summary_comment: Dr. Fus is highly regarded for his dedication and care towards his students, often going above and beyond to ensure their understanding and success. While his flipped classroom approach requires significant effort and preparation, it effectively reinforces concepts and leads to strong performance on exams. Students appreciate his extensive resources and genuine concern for their academic progress.

Ratings.comment: Flipped classroom but he makes you work really hard to actually understand concepts.

Dr Fus was probably the most caring Prof I've had at OSU. Always willing to answer questions and take extra time to make sure you are understanding the content. Reading and HW were well incorporated in the class (there's a lot but it prepares you well) and if you put effort into these assignments you should do very well on exams

Dr. Fus isn't a bad professor by any means. He teaches in a flipped classroom style which honestly isn't great for me. We had to do guided notes and pre lecture questions before class so there is constantly homework because the class is Monday, Wednesday, Friday. Overall, it really isn't bad but it's not great by any means.

Fus is incredibly caring and tries so hard to make sure that every student succeeds. As long as you use all of his resources (and there are SO MANY) you are guaranteed to pass and understand the material. He can ramble a bit in his lectures but I do appreciate how helpful that can be if you are struggling.

He is so kind and very understanding. He is a good professor and since I had a good background of chemistry from high school, that really helped. It is very easy to get an A if you study. I also appreciated that he called out the students who did all the extra work, it made it all worth doing in the end.

I loved Fus and was disappointed I couldn't get him for 1220 because he genuinely cares for each of his students. His flipped classroom style was very helpful for my understanding. Midterms and final were all relatively easy and Fus provides plenty of materials to help study for them. Only complaint is that LabRight was terrible at times.

Ez class. to succeed in exams just do key gnrl chem skills questions assigned before exam date along with practice exam. 4 midterms my lowest was 18.5/20 high 20/20 with this method. pay attention in lectures they're helpful and required for atndnce. Labs r useless easily gptable never helped, have gud lab prtner. Recis wr useless but good prctice.

Dr. Fus genuinely cares for you as a student and is very kind in lecture. There is a good amount of homework due to the reversed classroom style but helped so much with memory in the end. Engaging and not boring lecture.

Professor cares about his students, you can see how much he enjoys helping students and giving accurate explanations to your questions. Problems are given that you analyze in his lecture. Videos that he send to students explaining your homework and practice assignments are very helpful.

His class is set up like a flipped classroom style. Don't take his class if you don't know learn well in a flipped classroom. He expects you to learn everything before coming to class and does example problems in lectures and there is no fill in the blank slides for during the lecture only for the textbook.
Professor Fus is super engaging, but the class is a lot of work. The flipped format takes adjustment, but provides plenty of practice. Unstuck Study AI was a lifesaver for prepping for exams.

Fus shows you that even though he knows content is hard, that there is a way through! He genuinely wants his students to succeed. It is a flipped classroom model, but it was nice to try something new and get to know different learning styles. If you like practice for exams, he provides more than enough material. Will be looking for him for 1220!

DO NOT TAKE 1220 WITH HIM UNLESS YOU GOT AN A OR A- IN GEN CHEM 1. he is a nice guy. cares about his students. super hard to learn in here if you don't have experience with backwards learning or didn't retain info from 1210. thought i would take a chance and try something new. terrible idea

Year two of Fus and I have to say, not a fan. This is a very difficult class, but the way he teaches can get confusing and the class atmosphere is weird. OSU chemistry labs are really intense for some reason and he is entirely hands off with the labs which makes it feel like the two aren't even the same class sometimes.
He uses a flipped classroom and makes you read the textbook outside of class but he's a phenomenal professor and the GOAT.

Don't get me wrong Dr Fus is very kind and motivational but I didn't like having him as a professor. He does a flipped classroom which just doesn't work for me, I need to learn in lectures so I didn't like his teaching style. Also he has SOOO much hw, thankfully it's for completion but doesn't expect to have a social life when taking this class.

OSU's chem department is a living nightmare but Dr. Fus showed me that there's light at the end of the tunnel. A kind professor who genuinely wants his students to succeed and get A's. He does flipped classroom which some people like and others don't, but provides TONS of practice resources for exams. Absolutely take him if possible!
Dr. Fus is the GOAT, best professor at Ohio State.

Hard no from me. I had him for chem 1210 and 1220 my freshman year. He uses the reversed classroom teaching style, which in my opinion, is not suitable for most students. Lectures are for teaching, not practice problems. I shouldn't have to take the extra time out of my day to teach MYSELF the content and have it briefly reviewed during lecture.

This professor is a very good professor and cares. but he makes you do a massive amount of pre lecture 30+ page notes and 1 hour long pre lecture questions to answer twice a week. On top of the pre/post lab assignments it is very hard to have a social life. the pre lecture activities take around 3+ hours. If you're an athlete I suggest dropping.

Dr. Fus has a very different teaching style. It works amazing if you have already taken AP chem, like I did. He does a flipped class where you learn outside of class and practice in class. He explains everything well, and has a ton of practice available.
He's a great professor definitely recommend! Don't expect the class to be easy though, be ready to put in a lot of time into this class. Try your best and be confident in yourself, you got this!
Great professor, not a fun class

I had Dr. Fus for chem 1210 &1220. He is amazing, cares about your mental state & success, is inspirational, open to questions, & flexible. The class is difficult but he provides lots of resources and study material so you have what you need to succeed, it's up to you to do that work. I can't recommend him more as a chemistry prof & as a person!

Very, very difficult class, but Fus does his best to help all his students succeed. He's very inspirational and genuinely just loves his students and teaching chemistry. He provides infinite resources and is very flexible and understanding about due dates. Attendance not required, but strongly recommended
He's the goat.

Dr. Fus is AMAZING. He is very relaxed with all deadlines and he provides endless resources with super great video explanations. The material is very difficult but he always works his hardest to prepare you for exams. His classes feel very personal and he always has great stories. Definitely take him if you are able to. Nguyen is really good too.

Dr. Stoltzfus is an amazing lecturer! He is inspirational and you can tell he really cares about his students. He supplies students with SO MANY resources and different practice problems, which prepared me very well for exams. I also really enjoyed the flipped classroom, as it helped me get a better grasp of the material.
He genuinely is the best professor I ever had. I literally teared up multiple times on the last day of the semester. He really really cares and wants you to do well.

Dr. Fus is amazing and cares for you as a student. If you have to take a gen chem course take it with Fus because he will make your life so Much easier. You will still have to work hard and labs are annoying but Dr. Fus sets students up for succes and gives you a foolproof way to study for exams. I

The class is incredibly hard. But Dr.Fus gives everything you need to succeed. He's extremely accessible outside of class and gives plenty of practice problems and videos to help you succeed. Your grade will be dependent on the effort you put in.

Dr. Fus was an amazing lecturer and really cared about us learning the material we needed to know for tests. His teaching style is different than a typical lecturer, he has a flipped classroom setting where you have prelectures before class and do practice problems while in lecture. The material is hard but if you want to succeed you can.

Dr. Fus is absolutely amazing. He genuinely really cares about his students, even though the course work he teaches can be so grueling for many, and gives more resources than one could ask for to study with. He tries to motivate and inspire his students to achieve greater heights and is, in my opinion, an engaging lecturer. Great professor overall.
Super good lecturer

Dr. Fus is one of the good professors in the chem department here. His lectures are set up showing example problems which helps because the questions are similar to those on the exams. I enjoyed him despite my grade and would 100% take him again if I had to take gen chem again.

Dr. Fus is one of the best professors you will ever meet in you life. If you take Dr. Fus you are guaranteed a good grade and understanding of Chemistry. He actually cares about his students and is always there to help you. He has supplemental videos for every concept you need to review and endless practice problemsHe even wrote the Chemistry book.

As someone who had their hs chemistry class shortened due to covid, I was very nervous I would struggle. But Dr.Fus is a wonderful lecturer and kept us engaged during class. The only advice I would give is don't take his class if you don't like a flipped learning style, you will struggle if you can't commit to learning the material before class.

I used to hate chemistry, but after taking 1210 with Dr Fus, I love it. He does assign a decent amount of work, but if you do it all you will easily preform well on tests. If you can choose your chem teacher, choose Dr Fus 100%!

This is my second time taking the course and I went from receiving a D to receiving a B, all thanks to Dr. Fus! He was the most incredible professor I've ever had. He truly cares that his students succeed, and because of this, I was more motivated to do my best to make him proud! He really is the BEST professor for such a challenging course!

I'll admit that I didn't take this class seriously at first, which is why I didn't do very well. But Dr Fus cares a LOT about his students and makes it a lot easier to understand. This class is exceptionally difficult, but he made it a lot better. While I wouldn't want to take this class again, if I had to I would take Dr Fus' class again.

Dr. Fus is a very nice guy, but that doesn't make him the best lecturer. 90% of the information I had to go over and learn the material myself. The flipped classroom is not my favorite by any means. You need to read the textbook but be ready to do a lot of work outside class. Lots of HW. He's easy to talk to but sometimes hard to reach.

Before every lecture, there is a pre lecture and a Mastering Chem assigment. Expect to put in 1-2 hours of work before each lecture. Fantastic lecturer and cares for his students but tests are difficult and entire chem department at osu sucks. Take Dr. Fus over Zellmer but be willing to put in the extra work.

As a person who is about to fail his class... I can say that it is my fault. He does a great job of using assignments as a way to prepare you for exams/lectures. It seems like a lot but it is pretty nice. He lets you get 100% don't these assignments with retakes and revisions. I recommend keeping up with the course, as it is easy to fall behind.
probably the best professor you'll have at osu.

This class was tough, it would be with any professor, but Dr Fus gave so many materials that gave any student the chance to succeed. There is a lot of homework, it is taught by flipped classroom. I felt he set me up to succeed, though I had to hold myself accountable in order to get a good grade.
The class itself was a bit tough to get through, but Dr. Fus is a great professor that cares and gives plenty of practice work to help you! It may suck, but do the practice and it will pay off!

Class was somewhat difficult because it is chemistry but Dr Stolzfus makes it somewhat easier since he is a fantastic professor. While the class does come with lots of work it is all manageable and helpful for the exams. He also is very flexible with deadlines and all the work he assigns is because he wants you to succeed.

Dr. Fus was a great lecturer and really cared about his students and their success. Be prepared to receive many inspiration speeches from him in lecture. He records his lectures and offers a lot of outside resources. He also understands that his students are human and reflects that in his lectures and assignments.

Dr. Fus is absolutely wonderful. His class is very challenging, but he makes it as easy as he can for how hard the concepts are. He really wants you to know the information and pass. The exams are extremely hard, but he teaches very well and gets the main points across. Could not recommend him enough.

Dr. Fus is so awesome! He cares so much about his students and wants you to succeed. He gives so many resources and practice to do that it is very possible to succeed if you are willing to do the work. DO THE PRELECTURES, do the practice exams, put in the time, and you will get an A. I cannot say enough good things about Dr. Fus, such a nice dude.

I had Dr. Fus in the Spring of 2022 for CHEM 1210. There are a few things I wish I had known...

1. Do the reading guides but just skim the textbook for the answers
2. He is always available for help
3. The exams are brutal. They focus not on the big ideas but on the details (know the topics well/why)
4. Do the homework it helps to weigh out exams

Professor Stoltzfus cares about his students and genuinely wants to see them succeed. He will go out of his way to provide you with the resources and explanations you need to be successful. Cannot recommend highly enough!

Incredible teacher and incredible man. Dr. Fus utilizes a flipped classroom where you study material on your own before going into lectures discussing content together. Truly cares about the wellbeing and education of his students and frequently goes out of his way to discuss ways to better his classroom to best suit the needs of his students.
Overrated, good lecturer but flipped classroom. Wants you to put in a lot of work outside of class, given a chemistry course but expects a lot.

Easily the best professor at OSU. Dr. Fus is insanely inspired, driven, and caring towards his students and it is extremely evident that he wants us to be successful. The content is hard but he gaves you plenty of resources to take advantage of. Highly, highly recommended.
Great professor overall. Really seemed to care about his students. Material was tough but he provides a lot of practice.
Dr. Fus is an amazing professor!!!

Dr. Fus is a great professor. He does a great job covering the course content in a timely manner and uses a flipped classroom that I found very effective when teaching students about the Chemistry content. Beyond this, I thought Fus was excellent at prioritizing the well-being of students in a class as stressful as this one. He really does care.

Dr. Fus is literally the best person ever! I was lucky enough to have him for Chem 1210 & 1220, and highly recommend him. I have never had a proffesor care so much about his student's success and general well-being. He is a true inspiration and I'll never forget the life lessons he taught along the way.
Hated chem, loved Fus. Only way I'd take it again is if I got him as my professor. Definitely the one to get if you can.
Literally the best professor ever. Dr Fus genuinely wants his students to succeed and tried to make the topics as easy to understand as possible.
literally slayed

Dr. Stoltzfus is an amazing professor, he truly cares about his students and is very encouraging. He teaches you how to study correctly for his class and always gives amazing feedback. He puts so much time and effort into his classes, you can tell he loves what he does. I really appreciate him for making me love chemistry.

Dr. Fus was so obviously passionate about teaching and stayed long after class to talk to anyone with questions. He provides plenty of resources to succeed and was so supportive of students. You do have to read the book before class and review the info in lecture, and I know some people dont like this setup. Overall 100/10 professor

I loved the professor but hated how the class was set up. It was here do this homework. Good luck and then we would have a lecture about it. But since there was so many of us, we didnt go over all of the problems in lecture. So this course was a teach yourself thing and I just found it extremely difficult. Also had three exams and a final exam.

Best general chemistry professor at OSU. He includes a lot review resources that really help prepare for exams. He makes chemistry sound interesting in lecture and truly tries to help the students fully understand whats going on.

Dr. Fus is a great professor that I would highly recommend. He cares a lot about his students and is very motivating. Chemistry is a very challenging class in general, but Dr. Fus provides worked out solutions, practice exams, and hundreds of optional practice problems. He gives you the tools to do well, you have to use them.

I loved Dr Fus. You could tell he really enjoys teaching and cares that students grasp the material but also for our well-being. He provides endless resources for you to put in the work to get a good grade in the class. Chem 1210 definitely requires some effort.

Dr. Fus is a great professor and I would definitely recommend him. Do the practice problems and stay up to date on the readings. Labs are boring but a big part of the grade so stick through them. You need to do well on exams in order to get a good grade, but Fus prepares you well for them.

I'm writing this as someone who took CHEM 1210 with Fus and received a C+. That grade was on me. Fus is a great professor who cares about his students. I understand that there are students that are not a fan of the inverse classroom, but it really was not bad. Chemistry at Ohio State is no joke. It's hard, but Fus doesn't make it harder.

Dr. Fus was the best professor I had this semester. He wants you to not only succeed in Chem, but to build study strategies to carry into the future. Go to office hours and recitation. Take advantage of the mastering questions. Chem is hard, but practice is where learning happens. Dr. Fus is a leader and an amazing mentor.

Fus is the best gen chem professor here, but that doesnt mean that the class is a breeze. Theres quite a bit of outside work (pre-lectures, mastery questions, recitation quizzes), but these are all great prep for his exams. His exams are hard, but the material is straight from the textbook. Just be prepared to put in the work.
Great teacher overall, can ask questions before and after lectures. Easy to communicate outside of lectures

Dr. Fus is the best chemistry professor at OSU but you need to read the textbook and do the worksheets before each lecture because he only does practice problems during class. The Chem department runs the labs and tests so those all suck but that's really out of Fus' control. Taking him again for 1220 next semester.

Hardest class ive ever taken because you have to teach yourself everything. I stopped going to lectures because he doesnt teach, he just goes over random practice problems that you dont even see on the exams. The flipped classroom is awful. Hes an extremely caring and passionate professor in a horrible department. Not his fault at all.

Dr. Fus is AMAZING! Chem was hard, but he gives you all the tools you need to succeed. Its a lot of work because there is so much homework and complex info, but do every bit of it and you can get an A like I did. Do the reading guides before class so you don't fall behind and so you can better understand lecture. Lectures clarify a lot! U got this!
The class is set up where you teach yourself the material and then review in class. I can't learn like this, I needed him to teach us the material instead of trying to teach myself and failing.

Dr. Fus was one of the best teachers I have ever had. I never went to office hours or reached out for help just because I didnt feel I needed to. He prepares his students really well for exams, and he gives so many resources other chem professors do not. He truly cares about all of his students and wants success for every one of us!

Dr. Fus makes it clear that it is 100% in your hands to succeed. Courses like Chem 1210 are up to students with how much work they will put in to truly understand and not just recall. You will not find a better professor in the general chem department that will help you understand chem. He is so patient and truly wants the best for his students.
this class is hard, but not impossible if you stay on top of your reading and do the extra practice problems. Dr. Fus is definitely the gen chem professor you want at OSU.

Dr. Fus really cares about his students and their success. I personally am not a fan of his fill-in-the-blank style notes, but I do enjoy that we read the chapter before lecture and get our questions answered/problems worked through in class.

A tough course, but a very straightforward guy. Hes super helpful in the way the course is just set up. This course is basically just math, so the flipped classroom is beneficial for doing practice problems. Expect a lot of work, but thats for all chem 1210 classes.
Dr. Fus is a great professor! He explains everything very well and often has great demos in class to help understand. He also showed pictures of his cute baby.

I feel this professor or the department is lazy because we read most the time and not much of teaching. We are expected to know what the lecture is about beforehand which is fine, but he only goes over certain content instead of everything we read about/that's in the pre-lecture. TONS OF HOMEWORK!! Other than that he as a person is great and fun.
there's a reason his averages are higher than the other professors!

Dr. Fus is a great professor and person that cares about his students. He's really passionate about chemistry and teaching. The class is lots of work (expected for a 5CH course), but if you buckle down and study well for the 3rd MT and Final a good grade is definitely achievable.

Dr. Fus is the best chem prof you can get. He's nice and tries his best to motivate his students as much as he can, but the exams are VERY difficult/weighted and he moves through examples really quickly. It's kinda like, "ok so to solve this problem, you just do it," which can be frustrating if you're struggling with the concept being covered.

I really like Dr. Fus, he is a good professor and he really does care about his students. Chem1210 is hard, but he tries to make it easier. I took this class online, and I do not attend office hours, so I do not know him very personally, but he makes you feel like his friend even in a huge lecture! Would recommend!

I had Dr. Fus for Chem. 1210 in the fall, and now have a different prof. for 1220 since he wasn't teaching it in the spring. Having a new professor really made me realize how good Fus is to have a professor. The class is flipped so most work has to be done outside but he gives you plenty of resources to succeed, and grades very fairly on work done.

I took Dr. Fus's class my first semester at college during Covid. He really made the effort to adapt his class in a way that was both accessible and conducive to an online environment. You can really tell Dr. Fus cares deeply about his students and teaching. The content is hard, but he makes learning it bearable.

Dr. Fus is amazing and adjusted well to the online format. His explanation videos are so helpful. Exams aren't too bad and are very similar to practice exams. Organize your notes because the open note format helped a ton. Do the Grind problems! There are plenty of resources to help you succeed. Be proactive and ask questions to do well.

Amazing prof. Actually cares about his students, and he really gives you all the tools you need to succeed. It is a flipped classroom though, so you read the textbook and fill out his reading guides before lectures. Was easy to fall behind on readings, so must keep up. His students do way better on the standardized exams than the other profs.

He's the best no cap. Gen chem is a hard but he's the best professor to get you through it. He puts in so much effort into class, really cares about his student and is humble too. He always teaches with a smile and very willing to explain any questions you have. I don't miss gen chem but I miss being in his class. Hands down best professor I've had
It's a lot of work, and even if chemistry isn't your thing, just by doing all the work you'll have a pretty good understanding.

One of the most amazing teachers ever!! Lots of homework but he is so thorough and clear in the way that he teaches. A very tough class but it will be very rewarding if you take it with Dr. Fus! PS: Gives extra recognition at the last lecture to the students who complete the most practice problems on MasteringChemistry.

One of the best professors at OSU. He genuinely cares about his students and is extremely inspiring. He is very helpful and accessible outside of class if you dont understand something. The content and exams can be difficult but take advantage of your resources, put an effort, be determined and you will succeed.

This is a flipped class style. Dr. Fus is extremely nice, helpful, and motivating, explains things extremely well and provides tons of examples and videos each lecture, so there are many opportunities to learn things you don't understand. The only thing I don't like about this class is how fast it is and how difficult exams are.
Such a great guy!

The chem department at OSU isn't easy; HOWEVER, if you're going to take chem 1210 during COVID-take it with Dr. Fus. He knows what he is doing w/technology and also studies how to improve learning as a hobby. He cares extremely for his students and will probably answer a message at 2am. 3 midterms online 30-35 ?s, pre-lec hw 3x/wk, interactive zoom
Hes great.

Chem 1210 is definitely difficult, but having Dr. Fus really helps! I thought that I was going to hate the flipped classroom but it actually helps because he thoroughly re-explains everything in lecture. He makes some aspects of the class graded on completion which is different from other Chem 1210 professors, so this helps your grade.

AU 19. I LOVED Fus (taking him again right now for 1220!). "Flipped" class style, so not sure if you really need to show up for lecture. Lots of reading for the reading guides. Provides lots of resources for the exams, so use them and you'll do well. Nice guy, stays after lecture to talk to his students. 10/10 would recommend for CHEM 1210.

This class is definitely a struggle, but Dr. Fus is on your side! He does a flipped classroom, so you read the book, take guided notes, and do practice problems before class. Then, in lecture, he goes over things people are confused about and he does and explains practice problems. 10/10 Would recommend him, Im taking him for Chem1220.
He should be the head of the Lab branch of the Chemistry Dept. as well. Enough said.

Id HIGHLY recommend Dr. Fus for chem 1210. Hes passionate, caring, and extremely accessible and helpful outside of class. He responds to emails quickly and wants his students to do well in chem and in life. Chem 1210 is a hard class and theres homework every night but Fus makes it doable and inspires you to work hard. Im taking him for 1220.

Such an amazing, optimistic, caring professor. Each day before lecture, he assigns reading guides( REALLY HELP) that you fill along with your text book( he co-wrote the textbook too) and you do a few practice problems and during lecture he reviews the notes, answers your questions. He goes in depth and explains material in simple terms during lec.

This class was honestly one of the worst experiences of my life, and a lot of it was due to his teaching style. He does a flipped classroom, which is a form of teaching where you learn through videos at home and then you go over practice problems in class. THERE ARE NO GUIDED NOTES OR ANY NOTES WHATSOEVER!!!! He works with some people but not me

I love Dr. Fus, the way he sets up his class is very beneficial for the students. Before each lecture you get guided textbook notes and practice problems that actually give you a good understanding of the chapter. He does a great job of answering student questions in the lectures. If you pay attention and do your work it is pretty hard to do bad.

Dr. Fus is a really awesome guy; however, the structure of this class was not helpful. I got all my information from reading the textbook and would have not gone to class if attendance was not a part of the grade. Recitations were very poorly organized but the TAs were great. Labs ruined the course, but not Fus's fault. Prepare to teach yourself.
Overall, hes cool. Its the chemistry department, you know.

Fus is a great professor who truly cares and is invested in his student's success. However, it is a flipped classroom which means you must teach yourself before class. I personally can not learn this way, but some can. Reading the book is vital. Lots of homework assignments. He gives lots of practice exams to help students prepare an is very nice.

Super nice guy, really cares about his students & is easily approachable. The class itself is extremely hard, but he is for sure the best to take it with. Attendance not "mandatory" but you get points. He provides a lot of extra resources and practice for exams. Must read before class, and "review" material in class (which I liked a lot). 10/10! :)

THIS IS A FLIPPED CLASS! This means you MUST be able to learn the material on your own by utilizing the textbook and provided reading guides, and then Dr. Fus uses lecture time to review, cover difficult concepts, and provide example problems. Be prepared to learn the information before lecture, and come to lecture with your questions.

He is the most amazing prof in chem I have ever meet. Although he assigned lots of daily grinds, most of them are not graded. Doing those helps a lot in improving grade. Recitations are easy and interesting.

One time I asked a question in class, and Dr. Stoltzfus responded with an answer heavily laden with contempt. I think there is a more professional way to communicate to me that this is a better question left for the TA lab.

Out of all the chemistry professors, he is the one that will teach you the material and make it feasible to pass with a decent grade. He holds several after class help sessions which include office hours and peer study. You'll want to go to those if you want to pass or else it'll be much harder. He explains exactly what you need to do to pass.

His teaching style doesnt really work unless you have extremely good discipline. If you take this class with him don't expect to learn any new information in lecture. Taking his class without having very much previous chemistry experience was excruciating. Be prepared to literally teach yourself the entire class. He was really nice & accessible tho

Not gonna lie I was a little worried coming into to Chem 1210 because of its reputation of being a super hard class. However, Fus does a great job explaining concepts and he gives you all of the tools and resources that you need to succeed, so use them! Great teacher, great guy. Hoping i can transfer to his 1220 class this semester. Wish me luck!!

Dr. Fus is one of my favorite professors at tOSU! While his flipped learning style may not be for everyone, if you put the time and effort in before class, you are given the tools to succeed. Fus is also inspirational and likable as well! To succeed: read the book, watch the lecture videos, do the practice exams, and still go to class!

Dr. Fus is a great person who cares about his students, however in my opinion he is a terrible lecturer. He loves to give motivational speeches and many times you have no idea what he is talking about, content wise. He expects you to read, and provides many resources to excell in the course. He knows a lot about chem, but he does not explain well.

Dr. Fus makes you work for your grade, but that only because he has a reversed teaching style. In other words, you teach yourself and go to lecture to enhance the material you learned. Personally his teaching style gets students to remember concepts more once they learned them. He has amazing videos explaining concepts and he wrote the textbook.

Dr. Fus is a great professor. The tests were the same for every professor and his class always had the highest averages. He does a flipped classroom, so you're sort of forced to study outside of class. BUT you never have to go to lecture if you don't want to. I'd recommend it though, because he goes over tough examples.

Dr. Fus is without a doubt the best Chem 1210 professor. He is very engaging, lectures are amazing, clear grading criteria, lots of practice problems given, and the list goes on. He also cares a lot about his students, and he'll respond to a Carmen message really late at night (3am for me one time, not kidding). Do the work, and you'll succeed.

If you cannot stand flipped classroom beware. Fus is a nice guy but the teaching is not done in Lecture - examples are gone over in lecture and teaching is done through videos that usually cover all of the topic material... usually. If you like flipped classroom he is your guy. He also provides plenty of out of class practice to study on your own.

I understand he wants to do flip classroom but that isn't always possible with students that have a lot of coursework already. If you have time take class with Fus. He doesn't teach you, just tests you.

Great prof, readily available/good office hours. BUT he acts like his class is the only one you're taking. It's a flipped classroom so be ready to read the book before EVERY lecture. Tests are now committee-made (no longer an issue of his being harder.) Be ready to commit a lot of time/effort.

Dr. Fus made my experience with Chem 1220 much more manageable. He truly cares about his students success and made the textbook easier to understand in his lectures. You have to complete pre-lectures before each class which force you to read the book/ watch his flip lectures online and take notes. He has many helpful practice exams.

I chose to take Fus for my second chemistry course because of his high reviews on this site. DO NOT BE FOOLED! He does a flipped classroom so you teach yourself. His lectures are only examples. And he helped write the textbook so if you dont get something in the book chances are he wont help. Take Clark instead. (PS Fus's office hours are useless)

Dr. Fus really cares about his student's success. Gen Chem is not easy by any means, but he does his very best to set each student up for success. However, it is on the student to do all of the work. His expectations are clear, and if you follow them, although it is a lot of work, you should be able to do well in the class.

Dr. Fus is probably the best general chemistry professor that OSU offers. Listen to his advice at the beginning of the semester and work hard, and you will do well. He is pretty easy to meet with outside of class and offers so much practice material and review sessions. His high exam averages compared to other professors' classes don't lie.

Dr. Fus is such a great professor. He seriously cares about helping students succeed, even though everyone else in his department wants us to fail. He does use a flipped classroom, so if you are unable to handle that teaching style, avoid him. If you follow his advice he gives at the beginning of the semester, you can and will succeed in this class

Dr. Fus is probably the best teacher I have ever had. He is great at identifying and explaining the things that most students struggle with, and he genuinely cares about his students' success. His classes' averages on the standardized exams are consistently about 5-10% higher than other professors' averages.

Chemistry is hard no matter who teaches it. Dr. Fus acknowledges that and literally gives you a path to success that will work if you just put the time in. He's so inspirational and honestly adorable in how much he cares about us. One of the best profs I've had. Super willing to answer questions. I once got a response at 3am.

Fus is an incredible professor. He genuinely cares and will try to help you as much as possible. He has higher averages than most. The chemistry content is very tough, but he's pretty good about trying to get through it all. I like the flipped classroom, but some may not. READ THE MATERIAL. I took both 1210 and 1220 with him and it was worth it.

The best professor I have ever had. This man is so inspiring and changed my life. He is very willing to help you become successful not only in his classes, but other classes in general. He always has higher averages than usual. If you put in the work, do all the practice problems then you will end up with a great grade.

Fus Daddy is definitely the best chem professor I could have asked for. He does the flipped class(Pre-Lecture assignments where most of your notes are taken before class) so if that's not you, then don't take him. Certaintly would take again, tends to have higher than average test scores compared to other sections.

If you can handle flipped classrooms, I'd highly suggest this class(proceed with caution if you don't). Stoltzfus gives optional daily grind assignments - i attempted all of them and they really helped me prepare for the tests (I once did a question on the grinds 3 times and it ended up on the exam). He often explains the difficult stuff in class.

Flipped lecture is great for some students, but if you're considering taking 1210 with Fus I would strongly advise against it. He didn't seem to bother talking much about content in lecture. He would show us motivational videos (which gets old after about 3 weeks) and express how much we have to "grind" in his class. Practice exams helped a bunch.

Chemistry at OSU is tough. It requires a lot of reading and dedication. However, Dr. Fus is amazing. The flipped classroom is more work, but it is more effective and really helped me learn. Dr. Fus is funny and engaging. I highly recommend him.

Dr. Fus is a fantastic professor. He uses a flipped classroom which I found to be extremely helpful. He cares a lot about his students and their success. I highly recommend him as a professor. He has online homework that is graded and some that is not. Do it all, its helpful practice for the exams.

If you put in the effort you will do well, it is flipped so you teach yourself as best as you can and then he clears up any questions about the material, gives lots of practice exams which were super nice.

Fus sometimes gets a bad rap, but really I think he's a great guy. If you're willing to learn, you're sure going to learn. A LOT. It's a lot of work but if you are willing to put in the work you're certainly going to get the results.

This guy is a gem. He is really motivational and teaches with a lot of passion. He is really intelligent (co-author of the book) and he really cares about his students. The flipped classroom is something to get used to but in the end, I enjoyed it. Do your daily hw and you will be rewarded by actually learning the material.

Dr. Fus is well aware that he is teaching a tough course; chem is one of the first obstacles that college students must conquer. That being said, he understands what it takes for students to be successful. He structures his lectures in a way that is difficult to get used to at first but is very effective. I improved a lot and I'd so take him again.

I absolutely love Dr. Fus. He really wants his students to succeed and do well in a tough class. That being said, I worked super hard in this class. Chemistry at my high school was a JOKE (like all we learned were sig figs) I worked super hard, attended EVERY SINGLE ONE of his office hours. Hard, but definitely doable and great professor.

Best professor I have had so far. This man is brilliant. Operates on a very flipped classroom, but goes more in depth in class. He LITERALLY wrote the book we use. Genuinely cares about his students, and encourages every single one to succeed. All around good person, and is able to teach chemistry in a way that somewhat makes sense.
He genuinely cares about his students

Absolutely amazing professor, he actually cares about his students. Although he can seem a bit intimidating, he is always there to help and wants to get to know his students. He will do anything to help you as long as he sees you work hard. I didn't get an amazing grade, but I truly did learn and enjoyed the class. He is also daddy

Flipped classroom, don't have to attend lecture if you're lazy, but you probably should. Available at office hours. Very approachable. You'll do fine if you're willing to put the time and effort into this class. Words cannot describe the brilliance of this man. Don't think, just take his class. You won't regret it.

I loved Dr. Fus! He was amazingly helpful and his office hours made the class doable, he's a sweet guy and made a class that I thought I wasn't going to make it through bearable. If you ever ask for further explanation, he'll usually make what doesn't make sense, make sense.

This class is hard and requires a lot of time and effort. Dr. Fus offers a lot of help and his lectures do help me personally. I believe he is a good professor, he gives oppurtunities for practice and is accessible.

Fus cares a lot about his student's success and is passionate about chemistry. Be sure to take advantage of all the resources he gives, especially the practice tests. His class is an adjustment for many, but I have taken to chemistry more than I ever thought possible because of his emphasis on concepts instead of learning the answer patterns.

The epitome of a "flipped-classroom" meaning all big picture learning is done outside of lecture. For me this was good because lecture was not something I made a priority to go to, but definitely set aside the time to do the readings outside of class. Provides plenty of resources and study sessions. Use the resources and practice problems provided

I took his class both for 1210 and 1220 and honestly he was a terrible professor because he didn't teach at all. You had to learn everything by yourself and had him go over only things the majority suggested. There's a lot of work you have to do and his exams are very conceptual. I wouldn't recommend having him for gen Chem to anyone.
He is a great teacher, really cares about his students. If you attend lecture and do the homework he gives you, you will do well. Also study all the practice exams he gives you.

Dr. Fus is a really good prof. He cares so much about student success. If you put the time in and go to all his reviews you will do well. His problems are math based and he doesn't do as much conceptual work. This means a lot of repetition of the same type of problem which can be boring but also means you know what to expect with tests.

Fus is a great teacher. Tests are hard, but it's chem so what do you expect. He clearly cares so much about the success of his students, even in one of the biggest classes at OSU. SO much practice material for exams offered. Also there was a slight curve, which really saved me. There's a lot of homework, but you'll do well if you take it seriously.

Dr. Stoltzfus was one of the best professors I've had. His flipped classroom required more work, but it was worth it. I was actually learning the material, and I am not sure how much work I would have done for chemistry had I not had Dr. Stoltzfus. Definitely passionate toward chemistry and  I was excited to learn new chemistry topics in his class.

I loved Dr. Fus. Personally, I didn't think the flipped classroom was something to get used to; I really enjoyed it. There are lots of practice problems available to you. He is really inspirational and really wants students to succeed. I would totally take him again.
Overall great professor. Lectures are very engaging and he provides a lot of practice opportunities outside of class.

It took me a while to get used to Fus' flipped classroom, but the pre-lecture videos he embeds within every pre-lecture assignment REALLY help. Make sure to take advantage of his office hours/review sessions. This class covers a lot of different topics and it's easy to get lost, so I really recommend actively participating instead of just doing hw.

I personally did not enjoy this class or Dr. Fus's teaching style. He teaches with a flipped classroom, meaning you're basically doing the reading and teaching and he just goes over practice. However, you are encouraged to think a lot and you need to be intuitive throughout. I highly suggest you have a great study habit to start with before taking.

Fus is a great guy. He really cares about the success of his students. He uses what's called a flipped classroom for teaching his class, so if you're ok with teaching yourself then take his class. Isn't necessary to go to lecture if you're good at teaching yourself the material. Exams are less conceptual and more calculation based.

Basically a high school teacher that got lost and ended up teaching college. Makes you buy this paid version of a book that is easily available online as a pdf for free. Annotations are graded but real reason it exists is he's connected to the book and wants to profit.  Lecture isn't actually lecture. Expects way too much time/interest.
He really cares about the success of all of his students. He answers all questions, holds extra review sessions, and posts helpful review material. I highly recommend taking his class.

Dr. Fus is a really good professor. OSU gen chem is set up to be difficult no matter who you take but he really cares about his students. He likes the flipped classroom method, so I recommend doing a lot of practice problems in order to be successful in his class.

Wonderful professor! Dr. Fus really cares about his students and tries his absolute best to give you everything you need to be successful. Yes, it is a lot of work. But if you do it, you'll be good to go! Do NOT get behind on required and optional homework. Do your daily problems, and practice the ones you struggle on. Do this and you're golden!
Dr Fus changed my life, and he will always be my favorite prof.
If you take chemistry, take Dr. Fus. Hands down. Best prof in the chem department.

Don't get me wrong, Fus was a really difficult professor but he genuinely cares about his student learning. I learned so much from this class and I feel prepared for Chem 2. If you want to slack off and just get the class over with I wouldn't recommend this class, but if you want to learn then I definitely do!
Flipped classrom. Didnt teach.

Dr. Fus is a very inspirational professor. I do not regret taking him at all. He cares so much about his students and he cares about their success. Though there's a LOT of work that you need to put into the class, it definitely pays off. I did extremely well on the ACS final. I felt as if I did not even need to study for it because I was prepared.

Lets just say I retook Chem 1210... Then got a B+ with a different prof so fus is not the best. Explains the material like you already know what he's talking about. HOWEVER chem is already really hard no matter who you have so good luck.

I loved Dr. Fus. His classroom is flipped so a lot of learning is done outside lecture. He spends lectures doing practice problems much like those on exams. While attendance isn't mandatory for lecture I highly recommend going you will do so much better. Be sure to do Perusall and Learning Catalytics, (easy points.) Go to recitation.

Fus uses a flipped-classroom style.  Pre-lectures include reading a section, annotating it online, and doing MasteringChemistry problems.  This really worked well for my learning and incentivized being prepared for lecture.  More work than other CHEM1210 classes, but worth it in the end.  Our class scored so much higher on the standardized final.

Dr. Fus was absolutely incredible! I've never met a more dedicated professor. He truly loves teaching and provides countless opportunities and resources to help his students succeed. If you take advantage of his study sessions and follow his teaching method (which works with effort) an A is achievable. Wonderful person as well.

Dr. Fus is by far my favorite professor. He truly cares about your success and his lectures are clear and thorough (hard to get these days). He utilizes a flipped classroom technique and requires you to annotate an online version of the textbook as well as complete pre-lecture assignments. Yes, it is a bit work heavy, but it's totally worth it.

Fus is the best professor I have ever had, I am taking Chem 1220 with him next semester because I love his teaching style. The exams are very straight forward and plenty of practice exams are available for preparation. His class tends to have a higher average than all the other 1210 professors. Homework is fairly easy to complete.

Dr. Fus really cares about his students. There are endless resources for this class, some of which are mandatory like online assignments, but they helped my understanding. If you put in the work and make sure you understand the content as you go, you will do well. Fus is an awesome guy, go to his office hours for help and to get to know him.

Fus is a great guy and a really good professor. He teaches valuable skills and provides plenty of study session. But definitely don't take the class if you don't like hard work. He teaches the material pretty well, but it can be very difficult at times.

Definitely go to all the lectures even though they're optional. His motivational speeches slay me.  Compared to my friends who have other chem 1210 professors, he gives a lot more work, but he's nicer and easier to talk to.  Get ready for 3 hour labs and about 7 hours of torment via the lab report.

Dr. Fus, at first, seemed liked a great professor that cares about whether or not his students pass. Later in the semester, however, you can tell that is not the case. He is extremely arrogant, so much so as calling one of his students subpar based on an answer provided in front of the entire lecture hall of 350+ students. He is seriously in love with his "flipped classroom" system, almost to the point of obsession. If you do not take the time to literally yourself everything, you will fail. Expect to spend 25-30 hours a week on learning the material, and another 10 hours on the lab portion of the class. Would recommend taking 1210 with a lecturer that actually wants to teach and help. Oh and P.S., he will not help you unless you go to his office hours, which are 2 hours a week during what he calls a Group-Led Study Session. And if you can't make that due to class conflict, etc, you are out of luck.

I would recommend taking this class if you have some experience with Chemistry. He goes really fast in the first few chapters. He teaches in a flipped classroom meaning you will have pre-lecture assignments. Overall, he is a really great professor and he knows what he is talking about. Encourages learning. Sometimes a motivational speaker.
His way of explaining things.

I love this guy, he really knows how to get the material to stick. If you think a flipped classroom is a good way to learn, then this is the professor for you. You will have to read a lot, and showing up to lecture is really important. His office hours aren't actually office hours though, but he's the prof that will screw you over the least in 1210

It's really hard to rate him cause he's associated with the flipped classroom which not everyone likes. He's very friendly and helpful if you do meet him. But his office hours are really crowded. TAs are less crowded, though. Take his class if you're the sort who wouldn't read the textbook unless you were forced to. He makes sure you do read it.

Overall a really good professor. There is a ton of homework but without it I wouldn't have done well in the class. The class is pretty hard and so are the exams. He is always motivating his students and seems like he actually cares about how well everyone does.

I will never have a better professor than Dr. Fus. Ever. This guy changed my life. Sure, Chem 2 was a struggle, as it should be, but Fus's endless support through the material was incredible. I have never met a teacher/professor who cares more about his students. The flipped classroom might take some getting used to, but it REALLY works.

Great guy, really good teacher but in my opinion the lecture time was used very poorly. Lab was by far the worst part of this class.   Also the whole Chemistry department grades on a bell curve so beware of getting a grade LOWER because of the curve. Had an 88 and got curved down to a B.

The flipped classroom really works. Read, do recitation problems, do past tests, ask questions, and you're golden. Only issue: need to spend around 7 hours a week doing homework + practice problems, maybe more. But if you do, easy A. I ended up with a 98. Lab seriously sucks though. READ. Dr. fus is the best teacher I've ever had.

The class setup was flipped which was different from the traditional style we're used to. This class required a lot of effort on your end such as the prelecture assignments that composed of reading , annotations, and practice problems. For me it was quite helpful because I wouldn't read the book on my own so having the homework forced me to learn.

Definitely expect to have a lot of out of class work to do. Fus' flipped classroom style only works if you put in the time outside of class to be your own teacher. If you do everything he says and assigns with effort you'll be fine. But it's easy to get lazy and start slacking because of the sheer volume of work you're handed.
There is a ton of work in this class but if you do it as he tells you to, it will help immensely in the long run.

Fus is awful. He believes in his system more than being an actual teacher, and his flipped classroom approach doesn't work at all for chemistry, especially when higher level concepts are introduced. Try to avoid taking a class with him as the lecturer, try taking Clark instead.

Really great class structure and lecturer! His online videos are awesome, would recommend watching all of them, a lot of his exam questions are similar to the examples he gives in his videos and they are very informative and clear. He really likes inspiring his students and his genuine push for the success of his students is refreshing.

Amazing prof!! If ur a student who wants to learn everything from lecture, this isn't for you (chem isn't 4u). He teaches flipped classroom style, requiring the students to come to class having read the material. Lectures are devoted to solidifying info by practice problems and peer discussion. He's inspirational and devoted to guiding his students

Overall one of the best people I've ever met. Took him for 1220 and 1210, and his style really forces you to read and do loads of practice problems. His recitation set-up is also great. Wish he would cover more concepts in lecture, but overall loved him compared to what other students talked about in other chem classes. Thought tests were very fair

Dr. Fus is clearly very passionate about teaching, he is constantly trying to revise his teaching style to be more beneficial for his students. While the flipped classroom was an adjustment, once you are used to it, I found that the extra work really helped me to succeed in his class.
Obviously cares very much and wants his students to learn.

He has a flipped classroom where you basically have to teach yourself chem1220.  He has some youtube videos that help a lot, but do not count on him to actually teach.  There is a pre-lecture assignment due every class, plus an exam prep HW every weekend.  It is a lot of work, most of which won't help you learn.  Requires you to get the textbook

Lot of reading, good lecturer for those who dont have a really solid foundation in chem. Works extremely hard to tailor to the preferences of his students, continuously is trying to better his teaching style.

Dr. Fus goes over mostly problems that you will see on the exams in lectures, so it is helpful to go. I find his exams are generally easier than the other profs, especially if you are good at math and the conceptual side of chemistry is confusing to you. The homework isn't too rough, study for exams and don't fall behind and you will be fine.

Overall, a good professor. Extremely helpful. But a lot of homework. Readings and homework due by the beginning of every class. Flipped classroom, doesn't personally work for me. But overall, the class is easy as long as you commit to it. Tests are not too tough, but are not easy either. A lot of practice needed.

Took him for 1220 too. His classroom style using technology is interesting, it's alright. Not really sure if it helped me or not that much. He seemed very willing to help. Was always very rushed for time on the exams. Didn't use the textbook much-- but probably really should have haha. Probably why I didn't do too well in the classes.

The instructor was more of an inspirational speaker than a chemistry professor. His flipped classroom approach is worthless and he expects students to have a high knowledge of advanced chemistry prior to taking his course. In the final lecture before the final, instead of reviewing/taking questions, he gave a 55-minute motivational speech. Classic.

Good at explaining, flipped classroom, take that as you will. Class basically consists of how to do problems. This is good considering that's what tests are. Honestly he moved slow and explain material really slow for my taste, but this is infinitely better than moving too fast. Material isn't so hard you just have to study.
It's a tough class but what you put into it is what you get out of it. He is a very smart and respectable guy.

Dr. Fus is well aware of the fact that tons of work is needed to succeed in chem 1210. He assigns a lot of homework but the time put into that homework makes studying for finals much easier as you have been reviewing the material all semester.

He really cares about students and their success; always answers emails and questions after class--saved my grade. Do  past exams to practice; questions may repeat. He's extremely smart and helpful. Perusall was annoying. Very time consuming, but when I put in the time, I did well. Overall great teacher, just wish there wasn't so much self teaching

The Chemistry department at OSU is difficult all around, but Dr. Fus is a pretty good guy. He's tries to make things easy for the students and his flipped classroom is helpful because you can view the videos at anytime to help you study.
He requires students to comment on the readings for credit which is really hard to do if it all clicks without a lot of thought

Fus's flipped classroom really forces you to read the text and understand the material. He cares more about his students and their performance than a lot of other gen chem profs. Exams have curveballs, but his exam prep assignments are extremely helpful, especially for the final. He will always help if you're willing to work. Great prof overall.

His flipped classroom style isn't the way I like to learn, but he is a very good professor. He really cares about his students and will inspire you to do better all year long. It's a hard class but do the work outside of class and you should be fine.
He really cares about your success.  If you put forth the effort you can do well, and he wants you to do well.  It definitely isn't an easy class, though, one of the hardest I've taken.
He's a nice guy but his flipped classroom approach makes the class a lot of work, and if you don't do the work outside of class you won't do well in the class.
Overall he was a great teacher and is always available for questions. He responds to emails promptly and genuinely cares about how his students preform. He also provides many study session.

Matthew Stoltzfus is a condescending individual who does not respect the mental and emotional health of his students. I have learned absolutely nothing from his lectures and had to teach myself the entire course (while he got my tuition money). He gives tedious homework assignments that just take time away from your studies. Take anyone else!
His inverted classroom teaching method is dumb in my opinion. It has no place in a chemistry classroom. Pointless lectures barely teach anything. Too reliant on technology.

Fus is an amazing professor. He expects a lot out of his students and a lot of students aren't willing to put in the work for this class. He starts each lecture with an inspirational quote and sometimes addresses current events. He wants you to succeed, but won't push you, he leaves that part up to the students themselves.

His classes are boring but will help if you cannot teach yourself chem.  There is a lot of work outside class but his exams come straight from the problems he gives you. I f you understand and review the mastering chemistry problem before each exam you will do fine.  He is very math based over other professors that like conceptual problems.

The lecture he gives is nothing. you need to spend lots of time to teach yourself. He just teach like very students already know the knowledge. Also , the lecture is out-of-order but the exam is hard.

His flipped classroom style is completely ineffective and useless. Lectures are extremely boring and add nothing to the class. You are basically on your own to teach the material to yourself. Do NOT take him for 1210, especially if you have a poor background in chemistry.

The flipped classroom style was an absolutely nightmare. Fus gets by with old videos and then gives you a couple of questions during lecture to work through. He does not explain the answers and I left feeling more confused than when I went in. Would absolutely never recommend this class. READ THE BOOK

His "flipped classroom" technique may work for some, but it definitely didn't do anything for me. The work outside of class was ridiculous and lectures were pointless to attend. He rarely attempted to explain concepts during lecture. Oh, & forget trying to go to office hours, too. Always too crowded and you end up sitting there for an hour waiting.

If you don't do the reading and homework assigned prior to class then his in-class lectures are practically useless.  Exams are very similar to the practice exams but there are always one or two curveballs.  Plenty of office hours to help you out before exams, but dont ask stupidobvious questions, you can literally see his soul draining if you do
Very difficult professor.

Out of all Gen Chem professors at OSU, Dr. Fus definitely cares the most about his students and their success in his class. His exams were very fair and included many similar problems to ones in lecture. He definitely makes you work for it though. Prepare to spend up to 3 hours a day on chemistry. Overall awesome prof. especially for osu chem.

Worst professor ever. I really struggled. His flipped classroom style of teaching does not work well for a class with such hard material. He doesn't go over any material in class, so expect to watch hours of online lectures. You'll probably want to read the book. His tests were impossible and our averages were always really low. High curve though.

He wasn't a bad professor, but didn't clearly explain in lecture as I and many others would have liked him to. You need to see him in office hours if you have any struggles. The exams, in my class of 600+ had an average of a 61% (a D). There is a curve in the class though.

Best professor I have had at OSU. Loves football, Urban Meyer quotes, and other inspirational quotes. I looked forward to going to class. A lot of work, and background knowledge of chemistry helps a lot. He cares for his students though and explains things well. Highly recommended.

The flipped classroom setting didn't intimidate me too much because I already took AP Chemistry so there wasn't much to study. Even with that background, some of his test questions seemed out of nowhere even though I easily got 100% on the homework. He genuinely wants to help and is friendly when approached.
Some concepts he's good at teaching, others not so much, so you'd often find yourself teaching yourself. You reeeaaally have to practice a lot outside of class, since his tests are HARD.

Very, very difficult.  I received an A in 1210 but was lucky to get a C in this class.  His tests are insanely hard, but devote your time to this class and you will be completely fine.  I slacked off in the beginning of the semester and it really hurt me down the stretch.  Watch his videos, do the reading, do the assigned homework, AND THEN DO MORE

RIDICULOUS exams. I've heard people really liked him for 1210, but my experience with him for 1220 has not been good. You are almost better off to not go to lecture since you are teaching yourself the material anyways

Dr. fus is one of the worst professors I have had at OSU. He scans the textbook and expects you to teach yourself material that is confusing and difficult. His exams are much harder than any practice problems given in class. If you don't want to get a C in gen chem, don't take fus.

Pre med today has gotten much more stressful with factors such as minority, gpa, mcat,and also rigor of institution. It used to be much easier to get in with C's but nowdays even with OSU med school you cannot even falter. Ohio State is definetely not easy in terms of premed and Dr. Fus makes gen chem even more stressful choose a different. prof
Let's see. He's not there for you,  he's lazy, arrogant, and just around not a good person or teacher. DO NOT TAKE! You will not learn.

Worst class I've ever taken. His "flipped classroom" method of teaching does not work. There are no notes, and you basically have to teach yourself all of the material. The exams are nothing like the practice tests or homework problems, and they are extremely hard. Do not take his class if you don't have to.

Fus thinks he was placed on this earth to teach students gen chem. All he does is teach no research and so he lectures like he's a motivational speaker and usually comes across patronizing. He's incredibly arrogant. His tests are pretty fair. I barely went to lecture because I couldn't stand him howeverI still did fine. He does a lot of online hwk.

Expect to teach yourself. Office hours are so crowded and he doesn't even help. If you ask him a question, he'll just dance around it but not answer it. It seems like he has no idea what he's doing. He's just there to relive his college life. DO NOT TAKE

One of the worst professors i've ever had. Expects you to teach yourself the content and then does maybe three practice problems and rambles on for thirty minutes on each question. All the questions on the test are trick questions and nothing like the ones he teaches. Recitation is a quiz and the TA's get mad if you don't finish quickly.

Dr. Fus is an awesome guy who genuinely wants to help the student and see them succeed. He uses the reverse classroom which is a bit weird, and lectures aren't fantastic. He focuses mostly on mathematical aspects and sometimes doesn't clarify concepts to well. He is easy to talk to though and I encourage going to office hours, very helpful.

The flipped classroom approach works for classes, but not for this one. There's 2 hours of homework every night, plus lab. I have had to learn all the concepts myself, and in lecture all he does is 2-3 practice problems. None of the material covered in class, homework or recitation is nearly as hard as the tests. Would not recommend

Fus thinks he is changing lives with his inspirational quotes, very full of himself. Aside from that he is an overall nice guy, if you go to office hours they are somewhat helpful. OSU chem is very difficult and Fus's reverse lectures rely on technology heavily and this aspect just leads to more busy work throughout the semester. Do not recommend.

Pre-reading and pre-lecture assignments are required to pass this class. Take notes beforehand, because the lectures are more examples rather than explaining the concepts. Overall good teacher and easily accessible for help outside of class.

In many years of schooling, this was the worst professor I have ever had. Work is absurdly high, tests are stupid hard. Except the first one. His online lectures are slow and painful. If he didn't have an assignment due every day, it'd be a lot easier to keep up. 110. Would not recommend.

Besides the fact that this was a tough chemistry class, I really enjoyed Dr. Fus.  The flipped classroom worked for me because it forced me to really learn the material on my own.  My biggest issue was with the exams.  I felt the actual exams he gave were 10x harder than any practice problems we did.  Be ready to really work for your grade.

One of my favorite teachers! He truly loves what he teaches and understands students are their schedules. However, in lecture you are online the WHOLE time. Don't take his class if you can get distracted on a computer easy. His class is very technology based. Online homework, labs, lectures, everything! Good guy (and hot). SUPER hard class though
Really hard. A lot of work. You better do them or you're like 3 classes behind. Exams were super hard. Worst ever. DO NOT TAKE.

Awful. No curve at the end of semester. Average scores on all exams between 60%-65%. Everything was clear in lecture and assignments on Mastering Chemistry, but tests were UNREAL. Would definitely never take his class again!

Terrible professor. Flipped classroom does not work. His pre-lecture assignments you have to watch online do not help you do the homework at all. Do the practice midterms, but they won't be similar to the tests at all. I would never recommend Fus to another students. I'm going to end up with a D or C-. Can't explain concepts well.

He does something called a "flipped classroom" if you don't know what it is LOOK IT UP because if you hate the setup, you're better off with a different instructor. There is a lot of homework, but the "hints" on the (online) homework help immensely if you're struggling He will go out of his way to help you whenever possible He's a great instructor!

This class is very well put together. A pre-lecture assignment includes a video of notes, so you don't have to read the textbook. Lecture clarifies what you watched and presents example problems and how to do them. Almost every Sunday night a six-point homework assignment is due. Fus holds at least two review sessions before each exam. I reccommend

I thought Fus was a nice enough guy. His tests are a bit harder than what you cover in lecture. I hated his flipped classroom setup though: It was silly and I didn't feel like I was learning any better. It was kind of silly to see him show videos of himself when he could the problems in person. A bit full of himself. Oh well, I scraped by with a B.

Fuss's flipped style classroom surprisingly worked for me. Depending on how much time you're willing to put in the class will determine your grade. He gives you everything you need to succeed, but it heavily relies on the student to put in a ton of work. He helps with the math part if you can learn concepts on your own. Class is definitely doable.
Super helpful and a cool guy

The lectures are basically online questions that he somewhat reviews.  He hardly ever gives you notes and instead gives you videos to watch of reactions or sample problems for "pre-lecture assignments".  I personally cannot learn without taking notes.  He basically teaches you problem solving rather than chemistry.
He really goes out of his way to try and prepare you for the exams. Really wants you to do well.

This class and Dr. Fuss are awful. Expect to do more busy work than you could have ever imagined a rational person would require and multiply that by 10.Lecture is useless and now thanks to him the recitations are set up like his lectures i.e, you do online survey nonsense and then do an online quiz and that's it. Take this class elsewhere.

Not very good with how he had the class set up. The flipped class is terrible... You might as well not go to lecture periods and the workload is unbearable. You're better off taking this class with another professor who teaches "normally".

Dr. Fus was a good professor. His flipped classroom can be annoying sometime but is helpful when studying for midterms, and midterms were always fair. Chem is hard at ohio state with any professor, but Fus makes it bearable.

He does not actually teach anything. you have to read the book or watch his videos to learn the material. The lectures are just used for his flipped classroom stuff. Going to lecture is not actually helpful at all, watching the videos and reading the book is the only way that you even stand a chance at passing because the exams are brutal
Dr. Fus is very demanding but if you give him and the class the time he deserves you will get a decent grade. You just have to remember that this is college not high school.

Dr. Fus does not make chem easy for anybody, but he really does know his stuff and simply isn't that good at translating his knowledge to terms for students to understand. I was never a huge fan of his reverse lecture, but it is beneficial to some people. His exams are near impossible though.

Had for 1210 and hated him personally every second he makes it known he doesn't like to help during office hours. He is actually a very good professor though I left the class knowing a lot of the material even though my midterm grades didn't reflect it. Do his practice midterms over and over again and you will be fine. I would take hime again.
doesn't lecture for notes, goes over a few practice problems in lecture when I feel lecturing information would have been more beneficial

Great teacher, hard class. Take advantage of office hours, he loves to help out his students. I studied a little bit each day and made sure I asked questions as soon as I was even slightly confused. Chem 1210 is daunting and difficult, but Fus makes it bearable.
Worst class I've taken.

Fus is really good at explaining things in very simple terms and demonstrating concepts with experiments. He's very willing to answer questions - even the stupid ones. The only thing that was really frustrating about his class was the ability to excel on the exams. I got near perfect scores in everything else but got a C+ in the course b/c of exams

Dr. Fus seemed like a nice enough guy. But it's frustrating when you spend 20+ hours studying for an exam only to pull off a D. Being a biology major I've had many other professors who teach equally as challenging material but create exams that aren't designed to trick you. Loved my lab TA Shi Shu though. He'd dance during our instructional vids.

Very hard professor, would seriously not recommend him. I studied like crazy for these exams and kept up with homework as well as did practice exams and still did awful on every exam. Tried going to his office hours to review old exam and he was annoyed i didn't understand some questions. He doesn't teach in class you have to learn on your own.
Super helpful if go to his office hours. Tests are really hard though and screwed me over.

he was a super cool teacher. you have to read and know the material prior to coming to class to understand what is being talked about in class. everyone says his tests are the hardest, but they aren't bad. do the practice tests!

If you struggle with chemistry, I truly believe Dr. Fus can teach you chemistry and you will be successful. The key to doing well in his class is GETTING AHEAD. READ the book, do homework ahead of time, and for exams DO THE PRACTICE EXAMS and redo the mastering chemistry practice problems and homework and the exams will not be bad at all.

Although he was a good teacher and was obviously very passionate and knowledgeable about what he taught, his exams were extremely difficult.  Many of the exam questions were "trick questions", which was frustrating, considering it didn't test our actual knowledge of the subject.  I worked ridiculously hard in this class, but haven't done very well.

Dr. Fus is a great teacher and very helpful when you ask questions. Exams of course are VERY difficult but if you study you should do fine. I spend about 20 hours studying for each exam though. Textbook is useless. One complaint is sometimes Dr. Fus doesn't teach the exam questions and you have to figure out how to solve all of them yourself
He thinks he's the coolest teacher around, the class is very hard. Id avoid, also thinks hes funny when hes not really that funny. Exams are really hard.

I had to live in the tutor to pull out an A- in his class. I can tell you its gunna be a very hard class and all midterm avg will be around the 50-60's. HIs fliipped classroom method is way better than traditional lectures tho. Be sure to do his practice midterms and online quizzes. Lab grading was unfair, it all depends on how your TA grades.

Although Dr.Fus is a really cool guy and tried to make the lectures interesting, the class was SO hard and the exams were almost impossible. Even after studying a lot, it is still hard to succeed. Dr.Fus even told us at the end of the course that just because you work hard for something doesn't mean you'll succeed.

The flipped class was not for me but I got used to it. I enjoyed having graded HW instead of quizzes. Exams were meant to make you think, but not all material covered well. It's refreshing to see a prof so involved esp. for a difficult subject like Chem. This class made me less of a process memorizer and think about what is going on. Dr.Fus>average

Chemistry is difficult to the majority of students, esp at OSU. Dr Fus does use the flipped classroom approach and it isn't for everybody. Personally, I really enjoyed Dr Fus. I think he genuinely cares about the students. Post-1220, I think he did a good job of preparing me to move forward in chemistry, more important than an A in my opinion.

I would seriously avoid this class. He does this whole flipped classroom thing where you actually have to watch his lecture vids online, not in class (btw vids don't help w/ exams AT ALL). At the beginning of school year, he said himself he doesn't care if people fail in his class. But he makes a whole show saying that he does. AVOID HIM!!!

Dr. Fus cares about his students and wants them to succeed...just not on his exams.  They're incredibly difficult and the class average hovers around 50.
