Better to take another class and use his resources if you want an A, but if you want to enjoy the class and learn from a good guy then Fus is the man.

Don't even bother showing up to class and just read the book. The exams are impossible, and no matter how hard you study there will always be stuff that you didn't learn in class. His videos are super helpless as well, half of them is him talking about random stuff.

Class is worthless. Might as well skip and learn the material  on your own since Fus doesn't actually teach.  Tests are inconsistent with textbook material so don't bother learning from the book.  If you can read his mind, I'm sure you'll be fine in this class

He never actually teaches. He prepares about 1.5 hours of video for each lecture that you have to watch on your own, learn the material on your own, and he is not helpful during class. He changes recitation format every week, his exams are impossible. The one time I emailed him about help, he never responded and his office hours are useless. SKIP.

Very difficult unless you are self motivated. If you are motivated you could potential skip all lectures and recitation and pass the class. All of the in lecture questions can be done on MasteringChemistry and the actual lecture is on YouTube anyway. Quizzes are online as well.
Lots of busy work with no real pay off. Ensuring you "get your points" distracts from learning the material. His exams are complete bs.

I really like his class. I took him for 1210 and 1220. Yes, his exams are extremely hard but so is every chemistry exam. You can't change chemistry. The homework and lecture videos can be annoying but they are worth it. Definitely read the book and do all of the extra problems you can. It will save you in this class.

"Flipped classroom." You watch his lectures on youtube (good luck focusing, they're SUPER BORING) and then do practice problems in class (like 5 per 80 minute class period). If I had known he taught like this,  wouldn't have taken his class. Doesn't curve, tests are super hard, practice problems aren't helpful, short office hours.

His first class was a vanity show, demonstrating his alleged "good looks" and tailgating savvy, not his ability as a scholar/educator. Most classes he just writes notes on the board while simultaneously saying each word he writes in a different tone of voice.  Last class he shows previous students comments on how "hot" he is etc. Real ego problems.

I had Dr. Fus last semester but what makes him awesome is this semester he actually set up a Mastering Chemistry for students not in his class with their professor's problems sets because he genuinely wants students to succeed in chemistry.
Extremely nice guy who really wants to help. The material is not easy, but if you do all of his assignments you should be good to go.

Lectures are not helpful at all. What you only need is to do the exercises online - which cost much, and ask your TA questions. Exams are extremely difficult. And the exercises do not help enough about the exams!!

Class was very difficult but also rewarding. The homework is annoying and time consuming but also helpful. Exams were very, very, very difficult (significantly harder than other profs). Made class really interesting and worth going to, he's great at inspirational speeches. Be warned: exams are nothing like the practice ones he posts so don't bother
Personally He's nice guy, but too hard to understand his lecture and his test.  If you're really interesting learning chemistry not the right guy.

Would not recommend. He seems nice at first and he is. But his class is terrible. It is more work than every other section in 1210 Chem. The lectures are pointless because you have to learn it all online (Which is helpful, but not as much as an actual lecture). And the lecture videos are painfully slow.

Nice guy who cares a lot about his students, but your success depends on your learning style. Mostly everything is online, which can make it hard to concentrate. If you prefer traditional lecture, he's not for you.

His lectures are interactive and useful.  It is easy to pay attention, and the class isn't bad if you just do the homework and keep up with the mastering chemistry questions.  He is humorous, clear, and he cares more about his students than any other professor.  If you took AP chem, the class isn't bad, if not then it requires a lot of studying.

He's a good teacher.  But because of that, his averages are VERY high.  like in the 80s.  I got the highest percentage in his class that I've ever gotten in chemistry, but I received the lowest grade I've ever gotten in any class because of the curve.  I actually curved down...

His exams are ridiculous. You completely need to think outside the box to get an A in his exams. Studying through the book, practice exams, mastering chemistry, poll everywhere and lecture is not enough. Your better off taking a different professors class and using Fus's resources and the exams will be extremely easier.

This class requires intensive grueling hours of studying. Lectures were slightly helpful and they are mandatory. Professor knows his stuff, but doesn't explain too well. Exams have very little to do with the practice exams he gives out. Exams are pretty damn ridiculous. He responds to emails well. Have fun.

Hard! Lot's of studying outside of what is actually mentioned in class. However, he is always willing and available to help you out and answer any questions. He isn't too clear in class but he's young, so may not be as experienced.
pretty hard! his class is really challenging but if you seek his help he is very helpful.
If you have to take gen chem, take it with Fus. Extremely difficult but he does care very much about his students and he is simply the best.
Dr. Fus is a very good professor,but you have to go big or go home. Be ready to flip tables and get tossed.

Dr. Fus is the best chemistry professor I've had.He is very nice and always willing to help students outside of class. Exams are very tough, especially the final. But it is possible to do well on them. I didn't do too well on the first two midterms, but studied more than I ever had for the final and got an A on it,and an A- overall in the class.
Tough exams, but a good teacher.

BY FAR the best teacher I've ever had (or most likely will have). The most understanding teacher I've came across-- going so far as to send emails back and forth at 1AM. Everyone knows gen chem is a hard class, but he made it actually tolerable. If you have the chance to take his course, I HIGHLY ADVISE IT.
The class may be hard, but it is doable. He is probably the best teacher in OSU's chem department. Mastering Chemistry HW sucks though.
He is quite lovely. That is all.

BEST TEACHER EVER. HANDS DOWN!!! Dr. Fus related chemistry to the real world for once! He made it fun which sounds impossible but he did it. He does problems in class and you watch lectures at home. He is definitely the best teacher I have ever had for chem.

Dr. Fus is without a doubt the best teacher I've ever had. I gladly attended every lecture and lab. I also had a tremendous crush on him. I didn't pass the course, which puzzles me because I'm quite intelligent and actually tried very hard, but I'm not going to put any blame on him.

Dr. Fus is the greatest chemistry professor (and professor in general) that I've been taught by. He truly cares about your success and how well you learn the content, and is always available in office hours when you need help. As long as you put the effort in, you will learn a lot from Dr. Fus.

Without a doubt the best professor I have ever had. His style of teaching is something to will spread to more classrooms and he genuinely cares about every one of his students. He knows how to make people successful and motivated to do well. His tests can be difficult, but easily worth it in the end.

Great professor! His exams are on the harder end of the scale when it comes to the Chemistry department, but he is very clear. Utilize his office hours!! Your understanding will be at a whole other level.

Best best professor ever! He puts lectures and put pre-lecture, lecture, pre-lab and lab questions online.so that means you must to spend a lot of time do finish that work. But generally, chemistry is a subject that require you to dedicate a lot and Dr.Fus is really awesome!

BEST professor I have ever had! The class is extremely hard but if you put in the work its possible to get a good grade. Go to his office hours, the first half I struggled and once I went to his office hours my grade improved tremendously.

Really great professor. Puts a lot of time into his class and cares a lot about his students. Exams are tough but puts all notes and lectures online which is really helpful. Also has a lot of office hours, go to them! Best professor I've had so far.
BEST PROFESSOR! I definitely wish I could retake Chem 121 just to have him as my prof again.

Dr. Fus is probably the best teacher I've ever had. I think the reason people have anything bad to say about him is because his exams are difficult. He wants you to do well not just in college but in life. Not a lot professors care about their students like Dr. Fus does.

As a chemistry major, Dr. Fus is the best professor I have come across in the chem department.  Exams are fair but tough.  Show up to class, study and you will do fine in this class. Chemistry can be an intimidating subject, but Fus makes it fun and more interesting. I highly recommend Dr. Stoltzfus!

Don't come to class expecting to learn, Fus just goes over textbook problems the whole period. The exams are easier than some other profs as long as you're willing to spend a lot of time reading the textbook. He uses this horrific online program that generates exam-difficulty problems while you are suppose to be initially learning material.
Fus is awesome. Cares a lot. Good guy. The class sucks.

Oh Dr. Fus.... very cool guy tries to make lectures somewhat interesting. His lectures were often pretty vague and I found myself having to learn the material on my own. Overall good teacher. Exams are very tough but fair if you really know what your doing....
Awesome!

Had him for 121 fall '09 and 122 winter '11. He definitely cares about his students, but asks them to care about the class. Most OSU chem professors only care about research but Fus actually wants to teach  which is a nice change of pace. If you have the choice pick his class, easier exams, and he's much more willing to help than most profs.
Sure, he's decently good-looking, but that doesn't excuse the fact that his lectures are really basic and you have to teach yourself everything.
Not very helpful and when asking a question seems annoyed most of the time.

Very enthusiastic and accessible, and has a good grasp of material. Writes notes on the chalkboard, so sit close. Use his office hours. Uses problems from a program called Mastering Chemistry that are ridiculously hard, but sometimes do help you learn. Overall one of the better chem profs at Ohio State.

Fus is a great teacher. It was his first time teaching 122 this quarter, so he went a little more slowly than he could have, but he cares far more than most other chem professors. Be warned, though, that you're still expected to do a lot of work outside class to understand everything at the level you'll need to to do well.
He is grate teacher bit challenging class, took class lightly at begging and got suffer with B

Far too interested in making a good impression, and not enough in content he teaches.  He doesn't go much further than slowly writing the textbook on the board.  Students are expected to teach themselves the difficult material at home online in the mean time.  Going to lecture is no more useful than reading the book with a basic understanding.

I personally really liked Dr. Fus. This was my first chemistry class at OSU and I was honestly expecting to fail because everyone talks about how hard chem is but I personally felt like Dr. Fus' midterms/ quizzes/ final were really fair. I definitely recommend taking him!! He can go a bit slow at times but atleast he doesn't try to fail his student

Dr. Fus is probably one of the nicest professors in the entire chem department at OSU. He really seems to care about his students and is prepared to help and give study tips. Mastering Chemistry is annoying but helps with practicing. Since he's so young, he tends to not be as knowledgable but I would definitely recommend him!!!

Being in Dr. Stoltzfus's class felt like being in high school all over again. He is more interested in being "cool" than effectively teaching the class. He makes A LOT of mistakes. Quite simply it feels like he still has a lot to learn. Be prepared to hear about how good looking everyone thinks he is. Over and over again...

Dr. Fus is a great guy and a very good teacher that actually seems to care about his students, unlike much of the rest of the Chem department at Ohio State.  He definitely challenges you to learn the material, but overall he's a great teacher and person.
Super difficult test giver

GREAT GUY!! My favorite professor to date. He keeps class fun and exciting. Tough class though, be prepared to do ALL homework and ALL practice exams and you will do fine. Go to office hours and just talk to the guy, you wont be disappointed.

Matt was a good professor except for his distructing look. Guys , don't let your gfs take his class, period. His class was not that bad but you have to do tons of work to get an A. If you have other hard classes that you have to take, don't take him 'cuz u can't balance the load.

He is such a great professor. He writes on the board rather than make powerpoints or transparencies. He moves slowly and is very clear. You can tell he really cares about his students. If you have to take chem, definitely try to get Dr. Fus!

My class was graded on a DOWNWARD CURVE.  Don't take this class with him if you want an A.  Dr. Fus is a great professor--he certainly cares a lot about his subject matter and makes every effort to help his students--but do NOT expect a positive curve.  You have to be the best in your class to get an A, not just good enough.

First off to all the 123 kids who are complaining about low 50% averages: welcome to the physical sciences, and welcome to college. Don't be surprised by 30% averages; it's all about the curve. Lower averages help see who really knows the material. Fus is a great teacher and a great guy in general. He knows the material AND his students. Rare find.

I really enjoyed Fus's class. If you read the book, go to lecture, and do the problem sets an A is very attainable. Crazy huh? Also, he altered the labs so we could actually get something out of them which was really cool and helpful. Definitely the professor to take for Gen Chem since he really is passionate about both chemistry and teaching.

I think I got very lucky to have Dr. Fus, compared to what I heard from other people about other chem professors. He is a great teacher, funny, good looking ;), very helpful - make good use of office hours. His lecture was always really interesting too, he always played sweet music right before class started. One of the best classes ive taken @ OSU
Hes great and very helpful. Do your best to get him as your prof cuz chances are hes the best prof for the class

Stoltzfus is clearly VERY committed and dedicated to what he does. His enthusiasm helps to make this class more bearable. Having said that, it is gen chem and it's still going to be pretty miserable no matter who's teaching. Lectures were clear and helpful and he changed up the labs a bit, making them somewhat less stressful

Too tricky and difficult on tests and quizzes. Too much work required outside of the normal hw probs. Expect to do at least 10-15 hours of studying and lab work on top of reg hw probs if you want an "A" or are not a chem rocket scientist. Sure, he wants you to succeed....but you have to be willing to climb Mt Everest to do so in his class.

Best professor in the Chemistry department! He makes you actually want to learn the material. He can be tricky but he is 100% fair. You have to do all of the homework problems (and then some) in order to do well in the class. It's a tough class but Fus is 100% willing to help any student out if they seek the help themselves.

Dr. Fus' class is very hard, and that is coming from someone who scored a 790 on the SAT chemistry test. That being said, he is one of the nicest and most helpful teachers I have ever had, and he cares greatly about what he does.

Fus is really good at what he does. He expects greatness, but also rewards greatness in his class. He is a very active professor and actually teaches,so do not expect rehashed powerpoint lectures. But be prepared to work hard, his tests tend to be tricky and to do well on them you MUST do the problem sets.
Has crystal clear and slow teaching style. Makes extensive use of the blackboard. Feels passionately about everything he teaches and making people understand the subject matter.

Dr. Fus is the best professor ever! He truly cares about all of his students, and will help if you just ask! His exams are hard, but come on, it's chemistry, what do you expect? He is also very hot, which helps make it easier to come to lecture. If I was forced to take more chemistry, I would definitely take Fus again!

Dr. Fus is the best chem professor out there period.  his lectures are so clear, paced well, and easy to understand.  He is entertaining and plays a great variety of the hottest songs before class.  If you have questions he is more than happy to answer them.  Exams are not tough if you go to class, do the necessary work.  DONT MISS OUT ON HIM!!

Really good professor. Definitely cares about students. It's a tough class (it's chemistry, so it's pretty much unavoidable), but the quizzes aren't too bad and the exams and very similar to the practice exams he gives. Very attractive, too, which is sometimes distracting, but you'll be okay.
One of the best teachers i think i will ever have!  So passionate about his work.  He is hard though.  Read the book and do the homework!  Overall, he was awesome

This professor loves his job!  I completely recommend him to anybody taking Chem 121.  He is hard though.  You have to read the chapters and do the homework.  There is a lot of busy work in his class so be prepared to have late nights!  He is seriously one of the best teachers i will have at OSU!  I will never forget His Last Lecture.

Matt was fun, but he never really delivered in terms of teacher satisfaction. I would even go so far as to say that I  could have taught him a few things. The chemistry just wasn't there. I would have fallen asleep, if he hadn't done so first.

I thought that Dr. Fus was an awesome professor for one of the hardest classes coming into college as a freshmen.  I thought that all of his tests were challenging but fair.  All you have to do is be willing to do the work.  He had mandatory homework assignments and weekly quizes which actually keep you on track. I totally recommend him for 121.

Great Professor.  Truly loves his job.  Lectures were fun to go to because I actually understood everything he said.  He really has a passion for teaching and helping his students as best he can.  I would recommend him to anyone.  There were very few people in my huge lecture class that didn't absolutely love him and his style of teaching.
Great teacher.  He was very helpful and cared a lot about the students.  He really loves his job.

He was a great teacher- I would recommend him to anyone. His tests were rather difficult and there was a lot of work that went with the class, but he was really fair and explained everything well. I would definitely recommend going to lecture, even though attendance is never taken. Also, don't fall behind on the work- its hard to catch up!
Makes very simple concepts overcomplicated to the point where the only person who probably understands the material is himself

The lecture material was very clearly presented, but I was very disappointed with the budgeting of class time.  I felt that the review of basics took too long, leaving us crammed at the end. I also found the lecturer slightly grating with his "I want to be your friend" attitude. I expect my lecturers to be professional and efficient, not chatty.
Best professor I have ever met

AMAZING Professor! He is probably my favorite teacher so far at OSU. Thanks to him I finally understand chemistry. He writes out notes and makes it easy to understand. Quizzes are very straight forward, no tricks exams aren't too bad Have to study! Really Funny. Keeps my attention in a very boring subject. Highly recommend taking any class with him

AWESOME professor. He writes everything on the chalkboard during lecture, so it's easy to follow along and understand. No need to print out a million powerpoint slides that you're never going to look back at! If you go to lecture and keep up with the homework, you will ace the quizzes as well as the exams! Best teacher i've had so far.
He is my favorite lecturer so far.  He is very clear and is extremely helpful. He comes around during lab and ask you how its going.  Very friendly and cares about his students.

Let me start by saying Fus is one of the nicest teachers I've met.  He lectures very slowly and clearly and uses the chalk board.  However, his class is one of the hardest ones I've taken.  There was almost no curve.  I ended up with a 83% in the class and got a B-.  His exams are challenging and really test you.  Study his notes!!!

Fus is a GREAT guy. He's very dedicated to his job and very passionate about chemistry. He takes time to get to know his students and help them out a ton. The exams are rough, of course, but he prepares you well. The REEL labs are great research experience and actually fun. I would HIGHLY recommend Dr. Fus! Best teacher I've had by far!!

Fus is a decent lecturer, but extremely helpful. Make sure you take advantage of all the opportunities he gives you to learn the material, like office hours, practice problem sets, and supplemental readings on Carmen. The exams are challenging but they are pretty straightforward if you know your stuff and studied. Labs suck.
This class was hard and a lot of work. However even if you hate chem like me you're not on your own because Stoltzfus really is a huge nerd and wants you to learn this.
First off, Dr. Fus does not have any kids (lol). Secondly, he's a great professor. He quickly answers emails and is more than happy to help with any questions anyone may have.

Dr.Fus is really a cool and fun lecture who dedicates to his teaching. He gave quite a lot homework which really helped students to understand the material. I am actually a TA who worked for him for 123. It's not so easy for TAs since Dr. Fus added quite a bit for TAs to work on, but really good for students. I can see the students really understan
Very good at explaining things.
Dr. Fus is a great professor and a very willing teacher. He will help you with anything you don't know, just ask. Do the HW problems and go to class.
he is honestly the best professor, he wanted everyone to get a good grade. He explains everything so well! Take him! chemistry will be so much easier for you

Fus is an awesome professor!! I would highly recommend him to anyone. I would say make sure you go to class though because he hand-wrote all of his notes on the board and he explains so much in class that's better then reading the book. Exams are kinda tough (but manageable) in 121, but he was so good I'm taking him again for 123. very good overall
he writes on the chalk board. no notes on the internet

Ladies, chill out. The man has a BABY, for god's sake! Great teacher, extremely helpful but tough. The class is serious, though, don't take it if you aren't ready to be challenged. It's not worth failing chemistry if you're only interested in day dreaming!

He is very passionate about his job and actually wants to see his students do well. He relates well with the students.This is a tough class but Dr. Fus makes it enjoyable.I never missed lecture just because of him! He explains things very well and is always willing to help, not to mention he is EXTREMELY HOT! Highly Recommended!!Do the HW Problems!
Very impressive teaching skills...exams are close to impossible tho.  Congrats to the genius with a high 90% cumulative exam average.
Great
Super fun, hot professor who makes chemistry almost fun to learn!
Nice, passionate, cool, hard material
Good teacher, difficult class.
very very helpful. actually came to the library at 1am to help us with a problem.
Dr. Fus has a genuine interest in the student's learning. He brings concepts down to earth for you to understand them. Can't wait to take Chem 123 with him this spring!

Fus makes a very good impression on his students. His class is hard, and the way he teaches some chapters (8 and 9 especially) are confusing. But go get help out of class and you wont be disappointed with the effort put forth. And if all else fails, GO SEE DAVE TURNER! Both Dave and Fus make a formidable pair if you are in the weeds. DO THE HW!!!!!

Dr. Fus is very young and excited about teaching chemistry. Having said that he also feels the need to make chem 121 a weed out class. His tests are ten times harder than the other teachers. Almost to the point they are very unfair. The class average for the first test was below a 50%.

The quarter's not even over yet, but I can say with confidence, he is by far THE best prof I have EVER had! Quick to reply to emails, and always helpful. Lectures are clear and organized, exams/quizzes are difficult, but fair. Chem is hard, so you HAVE to study, but a great prof makes it so much easier. I wish he were teaching 122 next quarter!

Very good professor! Dr. Fus tried really hard to keep us all engaged and interested.  He was willing to help, and wanted to know everyone's name's by the end.  Very personal teacher for such a big class.

Great prof!  Really wish I would have taken him for 121 -- my grade would have been much better, I'm positive.  Makes everything clear and even makes it a little enjoyable!  Was always available for help and even stopped in in most labs.  REEL project isn't as scary as it seems.  Would definitely recommend to anyone!
The Best Chem professor in Ohio State University. Get him for any class (Chem 121 or 123)

So far my FAVORITE lecturer/professor ever!!!! He is there to help whenever you need him. He works hard to make sure you understand!  As long as you read the text, take notes in lecture, do all the homework problems, and utilize his office hours you should do well! Non the less he is good looking...dare I say sexy! Knows how to relate to students!!

GREAT Professor!  I would recommend him to anyone thinking of taking Chemistry and I also agree with the comments before this one, he is definitely a good looking one, especially compared the the normal chem professor stereotype which is a short, old, balding man that is extremely boring (which Fus is def none of these)
great professor... I would highly highly highly recommend him to anyone. he is very helpful and very accessible for help. GO TO OFFICE HOURS! :)
Such a great teacher! I would HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend him to ANYONE!

I had him for chem 121 and he was an amazing teacher and he was also definitely not bad looking either, i knew girls that went to his office hours just to see him, the exams were a little tough, but I would recommend him to any one taking chem

Excellent prof who knows his stuff and knows how to teach it clearly. Pretty tough exams, but he warns you at the beginning of the quarter about his exams. Go to lecture and office hours and you wont get below a B.

I had Dr. Stoltzfus (although he likes to be called Fus) for Chem 121 and will have him again for Chem 123. Dr. Fus is an extremely  nice guy Chem is his life. He will nearly anything to make sure you are comfortable with the material. Quizzes are extremely straightforward and his Exams are very fair. The key to success in his class is practice. A-

VERY easy to understand, definitely knows his stuff.  One word of advice: VERY HARD MIDTERMS/FINALS.  I learned way more about chem that I needed(only need 121).  If I would have had a different prof I would have gotten an A and not learned as much.  If you need chem down the road take him, if not, you might hurt your GPA.
Very good American professor with excellent knowledge of the material.  GO TO OFFICE HOURS!  I wished I had gone sooner.  Exams pretty difficult
Awesome professor: very helpful, and does his best to make lecture bearable.
really helpful and keen of teaching
amazing get yujie sun as your ta

If you have the opportunity, try all you can to get Dr. Fus!!  He is absolutely amazing...by far the best teacher I have ever had.  He is so good at explaining things and actually wants you to do well. He knows the course is hard so he tries to help you that much more and wants you to come to office hours.  Get Dr. Fus you won't regret it!!
Good professor.  Not that great of a test writer. Sometimes questions appear that cover topics not covered in class.

AMAZING. He explained things SO well, and was ALWAYS available outside of class to help with problems. He popped into every lab and went above and beyond all other profs that have large classes. He's enthusiastic about teaching and definitely makes an otherwise awful class tolerable. Don't get me wrong - the class sucks. But as a prof, he's great.

Chem 121 is a very challenging course, however, the reason that I did well is because I had Dr. Fus. Dr. Fus is the BEST professor I have ever had...he is able to clearly communicate material and he is enthusiastic about teaching and helping students. If you take 121 try your best to get his class.
Very straighforward
Appropriately written tests and quizzes; Comprehensive studying material; Cohesive Lectures
Dr.Fus is a good professor, try having him for your chem class...

Dr. Fus is not only the best Chem teacher I've ever had, but he is the best college teacher I've ever had.  He explains things SO well, takes his time, and is very helpful and understanding.  You definitely have to study for quizzes and tests, but they are easier than you're going to find with any other teacher. Take this class from him.Definitely.

Very challenging class. Not a cake course. Dr. Fus is easy to relate to, young, and straight-forward. His exams are average in difficulty and have no crazy surprises. He does an excellent job preparing you for the quizzes and exams. Lecture is as interesting as possible... lol He also plays music requests before class!

Dr. Stoltzfus is probably the most helpful professor I have ever had.  He even let me borrow his car one time because I was pouring after our lecture was over.  Turns out he drives a Jeep and had the top off though... oh the irony.

Fus is the BEST. He is the best TA that I have ever had. I still continue to keep in touch with him, and he helped me in 122 and 123, although Ochem is not for him lol but he is great and very helpful!
Very pleasant and helpful...very knowledgeable
matt is the most helpful guy ever. if u can get into his recitation i highly recommend it
Awesome TA, extremely helpful. Went out of his way to help students. Explained material very well and held very helpful review sessions. I would definately recommend him.

Matt was probably the best TA I've had so far.  He kept class interesting, related well to the students and was very friendly and helpful. He even held review sessions for chem 122 which he wasn't teaching at the time. I'd definitely recommend him.

I had Matt as my chem TA for my first quarter of Chemistry.  He was extremely good.  He was good at explaining things in recitation, scheduled various review sessions for exams, and went as far as to give some of us his aim SN so we could get help online.  Easily one of the best teachers I've had.

summary_comment: Dr. Baldwin is highly regarded for her thorough lecture notes and effective teaching methods, though her exams are challenging and require diligent study. Some students find her lectures too fast-paced and her tests exceptionally difficult, while others describe her as condescending and unapproachable. Overall, while many appreciate her rigorous approach to teaching organic chemistry, her demanding style and demeanor have led to significant frustration among students.

Ratings.comment: Absolutely amazing lecturer, one of the best I have had at OSU. She gets an absolutely absurd amount of hate simply because some people dont know how to study, fail exams, and need someone to blame. Her notes are extremely organized and she teaches very well. Exams are not at all impossible, very fair rather. All you need to do is study properly.

I don't agree with the reviews that Dr. B is a bad person, I think she cares and wants her students to succeed, she just makes it impossible. Her tests are ridiculously hard, and she goes through lectures so fast, its impossible to keep up. My class asked her to slow down and she laughed at us and told us she wasn't going to listen.

I like that she provides a lot of practice but the answer keys to check your work are not helpful at all (ie. If you mess up, you'll never know why, and if you ask her, she will be as condescending as possible). I tried my hardest in this class and it still wasn't enough. I took it with Jennifer Walters over the Summer and got an A. Incredibly rude

Dr. Baldwin's class is FAR from easy, and she will push you as a student, but she makes sure you actually know what you're being taught. If you're not ready to work really hard to learn organic chemistry she is not the teacher for you, but if you're willing to strap up your boots and get to work she'll be your favorite professor.

She runs a tight ship, she takes student feedback seriously (and simultaneously proves the folly of democracy), and she is relatively responsive to emails. Her demeanor can be off-putting to students who don't know what they don't know. Help her help you!

Side note: Dr. Baldwin, if you see this, please don't hurt my friend in 2510. I love her.

Genuinely the worst Ohio state school experience I have had since stepping foot on campus. She emphasizes how she can tell we aren't doing practice problems, her midterms are entirely impossible application and mixing concepts. Weekly quizzes, ALEKS that takes 7+ hour alone. Recitation worksheets for a grade. Unreachable and rude via email

I really enjoy O-Chem and loved the material, but Dr. Baldwin is the worst professor I have ever had. I am shocked that Ohio State continues to allow her to teach given how unpopular she is with her students. Incredibly rude, condescending, and thinks she is smarter than everyone else. Please take this difficult course with a different professor.
homework took so long. exams were impossible. lectures were extremely lengthy. do not take this class with her. and on top of everything, she is incredibly cold

Doc Baldwin is phenomenal. She truly does care about you, even though some people may disagree. She is very clear on the expectations and provides endless amounts of materials to prepare you for exams and quizzes. I can see why some people dislike her, but she tells you how it is, and I see how that may offend people, but she does look out for you.

I could not follow lecture, I felt like the professor went through examples so fast and repeatedly insinuated we should already know how to do things while we were actively covering that section. It was a really demoralizing experience. I did not enjoy the flipped class room set up as it felt more like an online lecture with a 200person recitation.

Dr. Baldwin was a great professor! If you actively are trying to be successful in this course, you can do it with Baldwin. Ochem is a hard class universally, and I believe I was successful because of her. Also, she gives a lot of additional practice in case you feel uncertain about a subject. All in all, love her and would highly recommend.

Good things: big curve (B -> A-), exam seemed to have gotten easier thru the years (still HARD tho, the final avg was 44%), & easy assignments/EC to help grade. She teaches great, you can understand everything but the exams are on level 100 for no reason. This the 1 class you should make friends in. She's better for 2510 esp for pre-health ppl.

I took her class in 2021, and it seems like she hasn't changed. She is a good teacher that, if you were a Chemistry major like me, you would appreciate greatly. You will have amazing understanding of the material, given that you use the materials she provides you. This class took up ~1-2 hrs a day studying. Have a study group for LC to get 100%!

Ochem is a hard class and you will need to be ready to put in the work, but baldwin teaches it in such a way that you will have a really great understanding of it. utilize all the resources she gives to you, it teaches you so much. i wish i had her again for ochem 2; her midterms have gotten easier over the years and she has a good curve

Dr. Baldwin's class is no walk in the park, but she gives you all the resources to succeed. Her lectures move quickly, so self-study is key. Utilize the practice materials and unstuckstudy ai - it really helped me prepare for exams. Tough, but rewarding if you put in the work.

Ochem is always going to be a hard class, but find another instructor. 
Poor lectures, rude and unwilling to help. She acts like someone asking for help is such an inconvenience and rolls her eyes. I wouldn't care so much about that if she was actually helpful, but she doesn't even answer or explain the concept.

She's very smart, and also a good teacher. She provides tons of resources and practice material. She is, however, by far the rudest, least considerate, and most unfriendly professor I've ever had. For that reason, I would highly recommend to not take her class.

She gives a lot of resources which are super helpful and a big reason why I succeeded in ochem. Her lectures move super fast and a lot of the learning is done on your own. The biggest problem i had with her was that she would make students feel so dumb for asking questions both in lecture and office hours

She gets a bad wrap. Her class takes a lot of work, which is expected out of a class like ochem. she is really nice and gives you every opportunity to succeed. People get upset that it requires a lot of work and overall knowledge, but after taking this class I feel very prepared for my next steps as this information was learned! Baldwin was great!

Dr. Baldwin has lots of practice material such as problem sets, practice quizzes, and practice exams, that correlate to the exams and hw, I did not attend lectures but watched her online recordings and completed every practice material available and did fine in the class. Make sure you utilize the practice material

She gets a bad rep, but it is obvious that she cares about her students and success in her class is not impossible. She gives more than enough resources and although her quizzes are tough, she gives enough drops and is always trying to get feedback and change her course. Only complaint was exams are really tought. Gets undeserved hate IMO.

I was initially scared to take Dr.Baldwin, but then I realized people don't want to or can't put in the amount of work it requires. Dr Baldwin does not baby you like some professors I have had you need to put in the work yourself and earn it. The best advice is to prepare before and after class, attend all lectures, and use her practice material.

Baldwin herself is rather blunt, but extremely organized; never felt like I didn't know what was going to be on the exams or quizzes. Practice exams are actual past exams from the course, which I liked. Amount of content can feel overwhelming, so stay on top of things. Would take her for 2520 if I could.

Everyone will tell you that OChem is a difficult class, but Dr Baldwin does her best to make it 10x as challenging just because she can. Condescending, ridiculous grading, and cannot seem to understand that she is the common denominator when everyone is getting a 30% on an exam.

She will teach a topic one way, then test for it completely differently on her quizzes. It makes the information from her lectures useless.
A hypocritical style of instruction is in no way beneficial to facilitating a healthy learning environment; it only makes certain that students learn to distrust their professor.

Dr. Baldwin seriously will set you up for success in organic chemistry. if you dedicate your time to this class, you will 100% succeed. She gives SO many resources to practice and a great amount of extra credit. Quiz drops help too! Great prof, would recommend. she always answers her emails quickly and with very detailed replies.

She provides more than enough resources to be successful such as previous exams, practice problems, and lecture videos. She answers emails very quickly and is really helpful. Weekly quizzes are hard but force you to keep up. Exams are difficult but fair. I feel like I learned the material very thoroughly and am glad that she was my professor.

Organic chemistry is inherently very difficult and this Dr. Baldwin's course is no exception. Although she feels hard to approach, Dr. Baldwin teaches quite well and provides lots of resources to help students succeed. I felt more adept in a lot of the concepts than peers in lab who had different professors. Expect the quizzes/exams to be brutal.

Baldwin's efforts to provide resources and explanations are unfortunately often mistaken for her "making the class harder" or adding unnecessary work. The fact is, ochem is a brutal course, and if you don't keep up with the class (like me), your grade will suffer. Baldwin's exams, while tough, are fair, and she goes above and beyond to prepare you.

I truly found her difficult in the beginning because  ochem is a new language and students are thrown into the deep end. She moves fast but relays the information really well and gives a ton of practice help. You'll have to go over things multiple times to get the grasp becuz of her speed. She can be rude I think when answer questions though.

Dr. Baldwin is a great professor and one of the best I have had. It seems like those who think she is "mean" don't understand her tough love. It is undeniable that she wants you to succeed and she gives you all the ins and outs of the content with lots of practice. The class is immensely difficult, but anything worth doing is!
Dr Baldwin gives you everything you need to succeed but has a very hard class. Exams were super hard but extra credit is often and the homework boosts grade.

Do not let other people's opinion influence your mindset heading into her class. Her tests and quizzes are Herculean tasks, difficult in amount and complexity. However, she does provide materials (Problem Sets, Previous Tests) that allow you to excel in the class. Those who don't put effort are not prepared for OCHEM 2, or any rigorous STEM course.
Her problem sets are super helpful and she even gives us all the lecture videos.
Terrible memory to think back.

Attend lecture! That is the most important key to success with this professor. There are occasional chances for extra credit by attending lecture every day that YOU WILL NEED at the end of the semester.

Baldwin tries her best but ultimately is not accessible outside of class and the tests are impossible. i tried to go to her office hours and there was always a line out the door and i had to wait like 45 minutes just to have one question answered. some of the tests had in the 30 percentage average (which indicates a teaching issue). good luck.

Her lectures are clear and well-summarized. She gives you a lot of resources to prepare you for the exams. She expects you to put in some work, and you should, because it's a hard class. If you figure out the way she grades things and the types of questions she asks, you can succeed. Her lecture checks are sometimes unnecessarily stressful though.

One thing you must remember before taking Ochem with ANY professor is that it is supposed to be complicated. This is a weed-out course because of its rigor, but Baldwin gives tons of resources to set you up for success. I believe I did well because
1. I had a tutor from day one
2. I completed the provided resources
3. I gave this class my time

Class average on our last midterm was ~34%, she then spent ten minutes belittling us over how it was our fault and that we all weren't trying hard enough. Suuurely it wasn't the one thing all 300 or so students had in common (her.) She is inefficient in the classroom, and the flipped approach just makes at worse. If you want to learn ochem, run.

She inefficiently utilizes the flipped classroom style. The tests are designed for you to get a C or below. To be honest, I'm not sure how anyone gets above that. I have disabilities and found this class quite inaccessible which was my downfall. Take it at CSCC.

Provides way to much material, had a flipped classroom for my year that did not help at all. She will explain something once and proceed to go into a very complex problem and expect you to know it right off the bat. Acts as if her class is the only class you are taking.

Not sure why she receives a bad rep when it comes to ochem professors. Explains material extremely better than anyone else in the entire chem department. She also gives an insane amount of extra credit throughout the semester to prep your average before a midterm. Midterms are obviously difficult, so you need to study. Grading is fair.
Exams are based on lectures. Put in the time for lectures and understand them, and you will do great. Quizzes and Lecture checks are straight out of lectures. Very organized and thoughtful!

Such an awesome professor, she replied to my email in literally 5 minutes and she actually cares. She extends deadlines all the time and is really easygoing with grading. It's a hard subject and she knows it so she emphasizes that we don't need to know everything.
So far this is the best class I've ever taken! Awesome professor I'm so glad I didn't listen to all the reviews!!

I will continue to defend Dr. Baldwin to anyone who has an issue with her. I'm currently in 2520 and miss her lectures and learning from her so much. Her class is fast-paced but I found her flipped classroom to be an amazing way to learn ochem. She cares a lot about us and is ALWAYS working to improve the class. Please don't listen to the hate.
Super fun class and professor and it's an extra bonus that she is really nice and friendly with everyone. I look forward to seeing her at office hours. Fantastic professor and great friend!
Dr.B once told us about her favorite animal and she welcome everyone to bring their cat to lecture for extra credit!

Dr. Baldwin is one of the best ochem professors at OSU. She sets her students up for success by providing practice exams, practice problems, and online lecture videos to watch before attending lecture. Ochem is a tough subject, ultimately it is up to the student to make use of her resources to succeed in the class. Dr. Baldwin is truly amazing!

She's great! Super easy class. Super friendly teacher and she is really lenient with grading exams too! Her class is always fun and relaxing, she makes sure you aren't overworked and have enough resources to always do great.

She's great! Super easy class. Super friendly teacher and she is really lenient with grading exams too! Her class is always fun and relaxing, she makes sure you aren't overworked and have enough resources to always do great!

I only did well bc I spent HOURS deciphering her 2x speed speech in lecture vids. Stay on pace the whole semester bc if you fall behind quizzes won't make sense. Don't take the practice exams, they will confuse you. Thoroughly watch the lectures and do every problem set and you will survive. Read the textbook if ur confused on something. Good luck

This is orgo so you naturally have to be intelligent to succeed in this class. With that in mind if you come to class ready to learn and put effort into teaching yourself the concepts you will do fine. Focus on studying for the quizzes and the exams will come easy. Baldwin does a fine job teaching some people just don't pick up on conceptsgetbehind

Dr. Baldwin truly doesn't deserve the hate she receives, as she provides so many resources for her students to do well. She responds to emails very quickly and provides awesome feedback. Yes, organic chemistry is difficult, but the best tip to succeed is to practice and really drill down the basics, which I believe Dr. Baldwin does very well.

She's really bad but I somehow did well enough in the class and it was amusing to see other people struggle and deal with her nonsense. If you're smart you'll be fine and you get the added bonus of seeing her belittle everyone else on a daily basis.

She will be the only one who is teaching this course and ochem 1 is required for any pre-health major. Giving her positive reviews hurts other students. OSU please give us another option, Baldwin put us under mental stress every single day and utilize any chance she could catch to wreck our GPA. She is the worst.

If you can manage a heavier workload in your schedule you should take Dr.Baldwin. She prepared me so well for ochem2. She provides many resources and is transparent with what will appear on exams which not a lot of professors will do. Nothing is more nightmarish than trying to study a poorly organized course, so avoid that with Dr.Baldwin.

I don't get where her "bad" reputation comes from. She provides so many resources for you to do well in the course. She also hands out extra credit like candy on Halloween. Is Ochem hard? yes. Is it easier using her resources and practice problems? Yes. Would 100% take her again.

I do not really get where all the bad reputation comes from. The flipped classroom works great for me. You don't even have to attend lectures to do well. All you have to do is understand the material. It's really not that hard. Force yourself to genuinely understand what you are doing; I guarantee you we do well.

Had to contact my high school chemistry teacher to help me through this class. Dr. Baldwin's office hours were useless and she never responded to my email in a timely fashion. Taking points off for no reason. Pretty sad that an average high school teacher gives more help and value than a high paid professor at a top class university.

Dr. Baldwin praises her abilities to find ways for us to soak up the information. Her rxn book is nonsense. You spend hours working on it and it helps with nothing. Her "practice" problems are nothing like the problems we actually get graded on! Lecture questions are undeniably a waste of my time. She does not like to give herself as a resource.

Dr. Baldwin uses the slew of practice problems she uploads online as a means to disguise the fact that the classwork does not adequately prepare students to try and excel at them. Yes, she has provided "tons of resources," but if the style of the class does not help students understand how to use them, then they may as well just be gibberish.

I had COVID, emailed her explaining how bad my symptoms were and that I would need more time. she told me still do the assignments or to take zeros as COVID is not an excuse, even after I sent her proof from the university that I tested positive.
She claims you'll do better on the MCAT by taking her class...but the averages for the other ochem professors are higher than her students' scores. The statistics are online.

It's a hard class. She does not care and is unwilling to improve the class. No extra credit, no tools to succeed, you'll fail even with a lot of time and effort. I got a 70 on midterm 1 and still have a C. She is unwilling to help or give practice questions. Reaction book does not help. Textbook helps more.

Its a hard class but she does care & is working hard to improve the class. Gives a lot of extra credit + the tools to succeed, it just takes a lot of time & effort! I got a 65 on MT1 but now have an A, don't give up! Reach out to her for help & do lots of practice Qs (especially PS) & rewrite key ideas & make a rxn book! I never used the textbook

There's no way an actual intellectual can go through this class and decide to give her a 5 star review. Luckily, the explanation is that she asked her TAs to write those reviews. They are not written by real students.
She is an average professor but has no redeeming qualities. It's difficult to think of anything that makes her stand out as better than her peers and colleagues teaching the same course.

I truly don't understand the hate Dr. Baldwin gets. She is the best professor I've had at OSU so far. You will learn a ton but you have to put the work in if you want to do well. Luckily, she gives more than enough resources to prepare you for exams and quizzes! Her teaching style is an adjustment but very effective if you try your best to adapt.
She has a reputation of being the worst professor at this university and it says a lot when most are terrible.
A good professor and a funny person! Happy thanksgiving :)
Organic chemistry is a hard subject, and she does not make it any easier. Her tests are hard, and the average are always lower than other professors.
Organic chemistry is a hard subject, and she does not make it any easier. Her tests are hard, and the average are
If you are considering taking this class with this specific professor I recommend seeking therapy.

Organic Chemistry is by no means an easy course and Dr. Baldwin is not an easier professor, however she provides the class with many resources and opportunities to do well. If you are willing to put in the work she is willing to help you! I have attended her office hours multiple times this semester and she is very helpful each time. Thanks Dr. B!!

Ochem is a difficult class with complex material where exams are supposed to be difficult and studying a lot is integral to doing well...It is essentially common sense to everyone who enrolls in the course. With this professor, you are forced through a much more difficult and rigorous version of a normal ochem class. Save yourself, avoid Baldwin.

She's a bad professor and a bad person with no redeeming qualities. Her lectures are not engaging or entertaining and she is not funny or caring. Someone was crying at office hours and she completely ignored it like it's normal and an integral part of being in this course.
I got diagnosed with hypertension because of her.

Wow. Throughout my education I have never had a worse professor. Andrea Baldwin is horrible at answering questions. She will just laugh at you or tell you to look on carmen. Now I understand Organic Chemistry is a hard subject, but she makes it near impossible. Good luck having a social life when you are in this class. Super inflated ego. Avoid her
Her questions are so hard. I studied for 30 hours for one exam and didn't study at all for the next and got the same grade. I'm open to suggestions for the next exam.
Even the high reviews written by TAs can't agree on whether she uses the textbook or not. She told me to use it one day and scolded me for going by it another day.

Let me help fix the fake high reviews. Ochem is not the right class for a flipped classroom and everyone fails because of this. She provides USELESS resources that do not help with her exams. It is unanimous with 200+ students that she is the worst and her teaching style is terrible.
The most recent top review was written by a TA. Do not fall for this propaganda, she does not deserve anything higher than a 0/5. Even a 1/5 is generous.

Dr. Baldwin is one of the most effective professors I have had at OSU. She definitely does not ask easy questions, but I found this helped me to truly understand the material. She utilizes a flipped classroom format, which works very well in my opinion. She was always clear about what we were expected to know and provided plenty of resources.

Her teaching style is disorganized and unhelpful. A good professor should motivate students and have excellent communication skills, she does both inversely. I've begun to avoid office hours because of how much of a waste of time they are. She laughs if you ask a bad "easy" question and forces you to do the work yourself for the hard ones.

I'm way too frustrated with her. I asked her for help and feedback on the exam and she told me I should have studied more...Sure, I'll study more than the 5hr/day one whole week before the exam, but I was asking for help not ridicule.

I knew she was really bad so I got familiar with the material over the summer with my brother's notes from a different professor. It didn't help because the other professor was not aggressively tough and made the material easier. Baldwin makes the material harder than it needs to be and will cut your grade at every opportunity. Save yourself.

The fact that from the last 30 reviews, the "Did this professor use textbooks?" question is split evenly between yes and no says A LOT about this class. It is disorganized and lost. Should you follow the textbook? She recommends it, but doesn't follow it and if you do follow it you'll fail because she is teaching a different ochem as far as I see.
If you've enrolled in the class with her as professor you've already failed. The people who "do well" in this class are no different than people who win the jackpot in the lottery.
There is nothing else to add to the other reviews. It's nothing but the truth that she is devastating.
I had extenuating circumstances for missing lecture (broken leg) and she won't allow me to make up for a missed lecture quiz.

I literally retook this course to get a better grade than my original B- with a different professor and I somehow did even worse. It does not matter if you know the material or not Baldwin is looking to fail as many people as possible. I dedicated more time than the other professor and still did worse in her class.
Takes her more than 24 hours to respond to email.
I'm counting down the days for when I can wake up knowing I don't have to deal with her anymore.

I like Professor Baldwin as a person because she is intelligent and makes me laugh sometime. But I don't like her as the professor because it is extremely difficult to understand how to do well in the course. I am studying too much and I fail the questions I study from her assignments.

Yes I agree she is not that bad and not deserve these many negative reviews on here. Her in class lecture is understandable if you invest your time understand the videos and ace her LCs, which is tricky. After all LC worth only 5 points, quizzes are basically practice problem and test are not tricky but require you to do it careful.

Words cannot genuinely express how grateful I am that Dr. Baldwin was my Chem 2510 professor. Her flipped classroom format helped me be prepared for lectures. More importantly, her lectures always answered my questions and covered the material at the perfect pace for me. I am most thankful for all of the extra opportunities that she had.

I really enjoy Dr. Baldwin! No, I am not one of her TAs. She gives you TONS of practice problems that are similar to the exams. Yes the class is a lot of work. It's O chem after all. If you put in the work to learn and study then you will do fine. She gives out tons of extra credit. I recommend taking her class!

Thanks to her I got to bond with my research tech lol. Told him I got her and he's telling me how he failed ochem with her and was able to persevere and she's what motivated him to prove her wrong. But really she's a garbage prof so far

I took Baldwin last semester. Just to make it clear the 5 star reviews are completely misleading. The highest possible letter grade in this class is an A due to the unique course curve, it is impossible to finish with an A+. There are no extra credit opportunities in this course either. Please beware of these reviews.

Dr. Baldwin is such a great professor! Even though she seems strict, she is very kind and welcoming to her students. She gives lots of opportunities for extra credit, and the midterms are not so bad if you put in the work. I wouldn't recommend anyone else for this class! Good luck!

Take all neg reviews with a grain of salt. This is a hard class--hard work is exp, but Dr. B provides with you all the resources needed to learn and understand the content. I haven't touched the textbook once cause her pre-lecture vids, lectures, and practice sets are more than enough. I wouldn't rec anyone else & Ik plenty of people would agree.
Worst

Dr. Baldwin is aware that she speeds through the material and creates overly difficult questions on exams that are unlike any practice material. While she claims that bonus points are built into the class, she makes them extremely difficult and sneaky. She claims to want questions during class but is often unfriendly and unhelpful. DO NOT TAKE

I had a couple similar answers to a classmate on the exam and she took extra points off even after we proved we did not cheat. The woman even went through my phone and laptop and found nothing and still is so stubborn. She took a lot of displeasure from our innocence and even greater pleasure when she still took off points. Evil.

I studied with a peer for an exam. We were the only ones to put a couple unique incorrect answers on the exam. Baldwin was suspicious and we proved we did not sit near each other. Baldwin still did a greater investigation through our phone providers, emails, etc. No evidence because there is none and we did not cheat. She still deducted points.

While she does teach all of the information, she does in such a fast way that 30 minute lecture videos take me at least an hour to understand and take thorough notes. Unrealistic with some exam questions; we didn't need a Lewis ABC question when it was barely talked about in lecture videos. Had to read whole chapters of stuff I didn't understand.

Dr. Baldwin is not a bad professor, she generally cares about your grade in this class. She does make the exam a bit more difficult. She gives a lot of helping problems for practice to make sure you understand. Make sure you pay attention and ask a lot of questions if you do not understand.

Please read. Last week I had an interview for medical school application. The discussion took a turn when my interviewer took notice of my C+ in this class. It cost me my admittance. Baldwin does not create success, she diminishes hope. I hope she reads this. You are ruining lives Dr. Baldwin.

The woman is not receptive to constructive criticism. She does not believe in group learning. She does not believe in educational second chances. She does not believe in fair points, incentives, or motivational study. *SHE DOES NOT BELIEVE IN SUCCESS*. She epitomizes everything wrong with education in the modern age.

I worked so hard for her class, I attended every lecture and office hours until I fully understood the concepts. But her exams are impossible. At the end of the semester, I approached her that she was being harsh grading my exams. No partial credit? She said I should have put more effort. 4 hours a day apparently was not enough for her. Disgusting.

When her past 30+ reviews have been 1's, that should tell you enough about her. She expects you to either A) learn the difficult concepts the moment she speaks it or B) spend 8 hours a day to learn them. 

LC's hard, quizzes easy, Exam...good luck

Flipped classroom is an excuse for twice as many lectures a week. Each week has 3 hour long class periods, 6 lecture videos which can take 5+ hours a week to watch and take notes on, 3 lecture checks (quizes) a week in addition to a recitation quiz. And expected to complete "problem sets" and practice quiz's every week. ALL 70 FUNCTIONAL GROUPS!

I emailed Dr. Baldwin about help for advice and clarification for an upcoming test. Here is her response: "[This question] pertains to last week's lecture. You would not ask [this] if you attended lecture. It is too late for me to help you. Good luck."

I attend every lecture and it's still one week before the test...
Here are some nice things to say about Baldwin:

Baldwin ruined my life. Baldwin ruined my life. Baldwin ruined my life. Baldwin ruined my life. Baldwin ruined my life. Baldwin ruined my life. Baldwin ruined my life. Baldwin ruined my life. Baldwin ruined my life. Baldwin ruined my life. Baldwin ruined my life. Baldwin ruined my life. Baldwin ruined my life. Baldwin ruined my life.

Dr. Baldwin goes extremely fast and you are expected to have a solid understanding of materials immediately after watching the lecture videos. Beware, she will claim organic chem isn't memorization based, but will expect you to memorize many functional groups, pKa values, etc. She expects you to devote 50 hours per week to her class.
Not worth taking at this school, get transfer credit from another
She could also forgets how to spell remember.

Instead of encouraging students, Dr. Baldwin created an unwelcoming learning environment. Her repeated warnings of "If you forget to do xyz, I won't give you points!" and false guiding to incorrect answers followed by statements like "If you thought xyz, you would be WRONG!" came across as patronizing.

I had Baldwin in SP19. She was awful. Her exams had below 50% averages. She would go through 200+ students' hws to sniff out cheating. I saw people wrongfully accused of cheating just because they got the right answer. My brother has her now, doesn't seem like she is heading in the right direction and OSU is ignoring her behavior. Awful.

Class has just started and I've never been more stressed out in my life by a class. Dr. Baldwin is unapproachable. If we go ahead in the material she claims we are not there yet but then she seems to expect us to know everything. It's not a pleasure to be in her class. I should not be paying tuition to get "educated" by her.

You attend lecture 3 days but the rest of the week you stay at home doing LC quiz. No matter how hard you work on the weekly Lecture check, point deducted for a single missing arrow on exam is double the point you earn after 3 hours listening to her video. Toughest grader ever. Beware
Worst proff I have had at OSU. Beware if you have her.

Her impact on this class was minimal, but she tried to meddle whenever possible. Boasts being accessible by email but gives extremely unhelpful responses and shuttles you to your TA. Refused to give points back on an all or nothing quiz for something that was a technology error even when evidence for correct work was given.
Dr Baldwin is an amazing professor and has very clear lectures. She gives more than enough resources to succeed. If u put work into the class you will be fine.

literally the worst professor. if you make even the tiniest mistake, it drops your grade by a full letter grade. I'm not kidding. any bad luck you have in lab, you're graded on it, even if it isn't your fault. literally if you make ANY tiny mistake, she will make you keep that grade, even though it drops you a full letter grade.

She was always on time for class and accessible during her office hour. The class is well organized and the homework questions are very detail and clear. Tests were easy compare to her homework and the content are all in the problem set. She could answer all my questions and even knew which of the 37 problem set the questions were from.

The content was heavy, she made it even harder by writing the quiz in her own words so student have no other choice but watch her video to understand the lesson. The recitation quiz is hard and you loose haft point for every gramma mistake. Tests looks easy but actually tricky and graders looks for your mistake as if they are diamonds among grass.

Dr. B is one of the best professors ive ever had. Yes, the class is hard. Yes, you have to work A LOT. But, she gives us plenty of resources to succeed and is always available to help. Guys, dont blame her if you dont put in enough work. Shes not going to make it easy, but its totally possible to do well in this class. Just ask questions!

Pros
Gives very good lectures
Provides lots of practice problems
Decent curve & easy exams

Cons
Extremely condescending
Actively tries to COAM students
Has an extremely lazy attitude

To truly succeed in this class, you need to already be genuinely smart, and you need to know how to teach yourself. You also need to be prepared to dedicate an incredible amount of time to working outside of class, so much so that you will notice yourself falling behind in other courses. Exams are noticeably more difficult than other professors'.

Everyone hates Dr. Baldwin, but I thought she was an amazing professor. Her classes are tough, but I thought she was a really great lecturer. Personally, I prefer the flipped classroom, so if you don't, you likely won't enjoy the class.

She is definitely not as bad as everyone makes her out to be. While quizzes and exams are really tough, Dr. Baldwin gave us multiple opportunities for extra credit points. Also, she has so many practice problems and other resources which tell you exactly what to expect on quizzes/tests. I enjoyed this class much more than gen chem.

There's not enough words for me to describe how angry CHEM2510 with Dr. Baldwin made me. She does offer lots of practice problems, the exams and quizzes were so much more difficult than any of the problem sets. Super tough grader, and makes you feel bad for asking to meet with her about grades. I would tell anyone to try for a different professor.
She is so bad. If you ask a question she will laugh at you. So now I don't ask questions. If you are nice, she will still treat you mean. She is on a mission to fail you.

Will you pass? Most likely. Passing is not the issue in this course. Doing well mentally is the issue. Learning and self-belief go down the drain as a result of Dr. Baldwin's teaching style. I'm going to pass and pass with a healthy margin, but I'm walking out of this course mentally drained and truly unwilling to continue.
BEWARE!! just don't take her it's not worth the pain and mental stress...

She will humiliate you during office hours and lectures for the questions that you bring if they were either covered over before or if she finds the answer easy. Quiz and test questions are those "it's right but wrong" without giving any sort of partial credit or whatsoever. I understand ochem is hard, but to degrade learners like this is horrible.

The reviews speak for themselves. People who get above a B do the right things to do well but are very much aware of the toxic learning environment Dr. Baldwin creates. I am on course to getting an A- and I think she is an awful professor. If you are unfortunate like me and have to take it with her, take a deep breath. Good luck.

I had Baldwin last semester. Barely passed. She made me think I was an idiot and I should change majors. I went into ochem2520 with a loser mindset, but I only thought this way because of Baldwin. Everyone else in the department understands the material is hard and cares about helping. Dr. Walters is an amazing professor and miles above Baldwin.

Dr. Baldwin encapsulates all that is wrong with education in this country. We are too focused on memorizing pathetic nonsense details that aren't even found on Google. Dr. Baldwin LOVES these kind of questions where you find no assistance at all online. Why? It's 2022, if I can't find any help to a question, how relevant is this to my education?

Things I have learned from Dr. Baldwin this semester:
-Professors don't have to answer your emails
-Professors can disrespect you if you don't know as much as them
-The right answers on exams are still wrong
-Ochem is not fun
-Professors only want tenure

50% average on a midterm exam. Okay, it's hard material. Dr. Baldwin says 50% is normal. Okay, she must understand the material is hard....but then proceeds to degrade us as learners. "You guys are not trying hard enough. Clearly you didn't study" What?? I don't ask for encouragement, but what is the use of discouragement? She has ruined my life.

Dr. Baldwin is one of the most insensitive professors I have ever spoken with. She actively discourages students from asking questions and humiliates anyone who attempts to ask something. Any test she makes is about only special case minor scenarios, never the main ideas and takeaways from units.

Horrible professor. Baldwin carries herself with an attitude and treats any question as if it was the dumbest thing she has ever heard. She understands the material but clearly can't teach it. Ochem is hard to learn, but she makes it impossible. Just look at the 50% exam averages.

Baldwin does not help students in any way whatsoever. If you go to her office hours she just flaunts her knowledge of o-chem and makes you feel stupid for asking a question. Her lectures did not help understand the material at all and she was horrible at teaching... which was reflected by the 52% average on an exam. Don't take her class.

Quite possibly the worst professor/teacher i've had through all my years of school. She expects everyone to know exactly what she is talking about immediately, and if you dont, she keeps moving on and gets angry/annoyed when asked for help. told us to treat this one class as a part time job, thinking that we don't have other classes. try to avoid.

My parents both have PhDs in OCHEM and they admit Baldwin's teaching style is all over the place. She teaches from a standpoint that assumes we students know and have mastered everything. There are better professors here. I'd only recommend Baldwin when there's a general exam not when she's the only one teaching (usually during Summer and Spring)

I'm taking very hard engineering classes as well as OCHEM and I have trouble balancing time. There's a large expectation to be able to do her long problem sets during the week but I can't. I do not attend lecture and learn purely from her problem sets, lecture videos and group study sessions and have been managing well. I would not recommend her

I leave this review on behalf of all my peers who also have Dr. Baldwin. It is unanimous that she is destroying our mental states, our overall well-beings, and our lives. None of us have learned anything in the class, even with countless hours spent attempting to study the material. Please take the class with someone else.

I heard how hard ochem is. I played my cards right and now I take 3 easy GEs and ochem. I should be able to do well in ochem given the amount of time I can spend on it, right? So I thought. 50 hours in one week spent studying the material for the upcoming exam, and I bomb. No help given, lectures are terrible. Oh, and she answered 0/3 of my emails!
Dr. Baldwin is no more an educator than my dog. I don't learn much from my dog but at least my dog makes me feel good and listens. Idk how she has above a 2.0 rating, I'm drowning in this class.

Dr. Baldwin clearly understands the material, but lacks respect for students in her class. Why someone would enter the teaching profession only to have such blatant contempt for students is beyond me. You can read these reviews and consider that "hard" does not necessarily mean "bad", however, Dr. Baldwin appears to be purposefully cruel.

We are currently on SB, a time meant for us students to relax and wind down and destress from professors like Baldwin. She tells us right before SB that we will all fail the next midterm, which is scheduled shortly after break ends. She expects us to study for her class and do extra work over break. Why? And she's too lazy to do simple things.

Avoid at all costs! Don't be fooled for the appealing time she has her lectures, it is not even close to a bargain. All other ochem professors record lectures or copy notes so missing class is not a big deal. Baldwin is the type of prof to make sure there are some students really struggling in the class. A B- is above the average in this class.

Dr. Baldwin is the type of person to promote herself and her teaching style, but all that's going on is us teaching ourselves. Ochem is not the course to do a flipped classroom strategy. I'm trying to pass the class and never deal with this material ever again thank you. Dr. Baldwin is not for you if you agree.

I saw her reviews here but took the class anyways. I refuse to judge without my own experience. I engaged in lecture appropriately, went to office hours with relevance, and emailed her respectfully. I was met with disrespect and disinterest. I received no help 80% of the time. She is not a proper professor.
I should have listened to these reviews. She's the worst.

Gets a really bad rep but I think it is because she teaches tough material at the level of difficulty needed. Of all my friends who had other professors, I was always the most prepared. Her tests are hard, but if you study and pay attention, you will be fine. She is really nice and cares for her students, gives the most resources. Best professor

Dr. Baldwin may teach the material fine, but appears to lack compassion and empathy for others. If you fall behind or otherwise need help, you will find yourself reluctant to ask for it. Her condescending and superior attitude makes for an environment that is not conducive to learning.

Didnt have an issue with her until I had to talk to her 1 on 1 to ask a question. Is so rude and doesnt help whatsoever and just makes you feel stupid for asking her a question in the first place. On the bright side she does give you a lot of resources to succeed but it can get very frustrating especially when you get stuck.

Avoid! Went into ochem expecting it to be tough. Obvi, it was. But what I didn't expect was the lack of compassion from a prof. She would often make plain rude comments to students whether in office hours or in class. She acted superior. I have never felt like a prof was so unapproachable. And I say this genuinely, not just b/c the class was tough.

Organic Chemistry is a tough subject overall, but Dr. Baldwin did a decent job of teaching it. Has an excellent grasp of the material and an understanding of how to succeed in the course. She gives lots of required and optional homework, all of which is necessary to grasp the material. Lecture attendance, while optional, is necessary to do well.

She isnt very understanding or willing to help. I attended office hours many times and she was rude and wouldn't help students actually understand the material. Also, there are an excessive amount of lecture checks and quizzes for this class. She makes this class way more difficult than it needs to be

How to get a B. Take notes, lots of them. Study a decent amount. Stress. Repeat. Her PS are intimidating but prep you for the exam very well. They make the exam look like a joke. I always struggled with the MC and found those problems to be the trickiest because she does not give a lot of practice for those. Everything is hard. Breathe. You'll live

Here's how to ace Baldy's class P2 (Exams): Do 10 day study plan, redo PSets, redo past quizzes from your semester pertaining to upcoming exam, make QA sheet so you do not have to keep asking the same Q's, if common exams: Baldwin past exams were not very helpful. If non-common: take them fs. Office hours for smart Q's, email for dumb Q's.
