Here's how you do well in Baldy's class: Complete problem sets correlating to the upcoming quiz at least 2 days in advance to quiz; Go to office hours the day of your quiz to get any questions answered (Never saw anyone there until the day of exams); Spam her (her responses were always informative and concise); Take SOLID notes on vid lecs.

Organic chemistry is extremely difficult, therefore it is important to have a good professor teaching you this material. Dr. B provided me with a great foundation during lecture and plenty of problem sets and homework to practice. Yes the tests and quizzes were hard, but if you put the work in you will be fine.

I struggled in this class. My mental health was awful this semester. I would take a different professor if I could. Lots of quizzes and homework. The lectures did not correlate with the hw. Exams were very difficult, usually the exam averages were low 60s. I had to put in a lot of time and effort just for a C.

While this class has been one of the most difficult classes I've taken; having to put many many hours into studying and understanding the material, Baldwin is not as bad as people make her out to be. Her problem sets are EXTREMELY helpful, and yes while some of the quizzes were difficult, if you put the work in, you will be prepared for the exams.

WHAT A HORRIBLE professor. Do you guys remember the time she got an answer wrong on the quiz, and then refused to give us all the point back because she was too lazy and her ego was too high to support her students? There arent enough characters to describe her as a professor. Go to Chang if you need someone who cares about your success!

Let me start off by saying this class gave me stress constipation (which I had never experienced before). The subject matter is tough but has the potential to be very cool and interesting. However, Baldwin gives unnecessary stress to her students by giving outrageously hard quizzes. Lectures are nice but not comparable to her quizzes.

Many take their frustration of the class out on the professor. I truly enjoyed Baldwins class and I feel like from what I heard about the other lecturers teaching the same course, I was much more prepared. Yes, the assignments and quizzes she gives are much harder than the common exams we took this semester but it made the exams that much easier.

While organic chemistry is a difficult course by nature, Dr. Baldwin was effective in teaching the subject. She has explicitly strict, high expectations, which she makes clear by her teaching style and interactions with students. The common exams were beneficial, but Im not sure that theyre returning in the future, so prepare for difficult exams.

Dr. Baldwin is disliked by many but only because she pushes students to excel. Most of the people caught complaining are the ones who are not willing to put in the work to succeed in one of the hardest classes in college. Excellent teacher that prepared us perfectly for the common exam.

Teaches very fast but the split classroom approach made it much more manageable. Dropped lots of your lowest grades, including 3 of 13 quizzes. If you keep up with the class and work hard you will have a great understanding of organic chemistry.

Ochem is hard. She teaches very fast, can be rude, and her lectures often go way more in depth than necessary. Prepares you well for exams- lots of practice-but seems to care more about averages and beating other sections. Course is taught as flipped classroom style too.

If you are passionate about science,take Baldwin.I always tell people that she is like the teacher in high school that favors the smart kids. Class will be geared more towards advanced critical thinkers & people like to use Dr. B as a scape goat. If you use the resources provided, then you will be over-prepared for exams and love class with Dr. B.

Professor Baldwin is the most knowledgeable you will have in your college career. The course is difficult and she will move class along at an uncomfortable pace. She wants you to be uncomfortable because she wants you to actually learn. Lots of resources. People who complain are people who are typically people who are not cut out for it.

If you want to learn ochem 1 well, take it with Baldwin and put in the work. It seems like she gives way more resources than the other professors. With common exams, Baldwins students were much more prepared. Baldwin can be strict and intimidating, but shes actually really nice! Answers emails quickly and is always willing to answer questions.

Provides more than enough information for exam. The main thing is to really understand the concepts rather than memorizing mechanism. If OChem does common exams again, shes the best professor to take for it.

Dr. Baldwin told us the first week of class that she includes an "impossible" question on every midterm. She would constantly say verbatim "this is why this class sucks" when prompted with difficult questions. To be fair, I think that was supposed to be encouraging, but given the class as a whole you can probably do better when it comes to OChem.

She marked an answer wrong on one of the weekly quizzes when it was actually right & refused to give us our point back saying "I've offered enough bonus points this semester" (not rlly) and "one point shouldn't affect your grade." I don't care that it was one point. It's just bad morals and unfair of her to not give us the point that we got right.

She is the worst prof I have ever had her lectures cover insane amount of material that won't show up on the exams. she is very condescending and doesn't care about her students mental health. Take it with anyone except her.

this is the worst professor i have ever had in my life. she is passive aggressive and genuinely does not want her students to succeed. she is truly the reason i am switching majors. if you have her, please switch out. she will make you lose your passion you have for science and ruin your social life too.

I saw her ratings before I took her class and I should have listened. Every person I told I had Baldwin told me to switch. The workload she expects you to put in to get a decent grade is absolutely bonkers and unrealistic. She is rude and if you ask a question for clarity, get ready for her to make you feel stupid and embarrassed.
Dr. Baldwin is a really difficult professor to have especially for an introductory course like organic chemistry. Would definitely recommend anyone but her if you want to save your GPA.

Rude/unfriendly at times. Expects you to grasp concepts right away even though it's an intro course. Many recent quiz averages are F's & only a couple are dropped from the whole semester. Watch lecture vids b4 class (which take 2+ hours to take notes on at times), do lecture checks, problem sets, rxn notebook, & come to in-person lectures to pass:/

Has been one of the worst professors I've had. She expects her students to understand so much information with little time. Another thing that I had to mention was that after our first exam she celebrated that the average out of all the 2510 professors was a 60%. Why celebrate that you failed half of your students and are a bad professor?

Dr. Baldwin is very sweet and definitely overprepares for exams. However, she can be kind of condescending and students often feel underprepared for quizzes and lecture. Also, it is reverse classroom so we have between 2-5 hours of videos to watch every week plus a recitation and 3 classes (which you basically need to go to if you want to pass).

Worst professor I have ever had. Having a professor like her at OSU makes me lose respect for both the Chemistry department and the University. How can a prestigious place like OSU keep a professor like her on the faculty when so many students hate her so much. Please, take O-chem/Lab from any other professor.

Dr Baldwin is the worse teacher or professor Ive ever had. I dropped after the second midterm, took it with another professor and got an A no problem. Save yourself the trouble and just get another teacher.
One of the worst profs Ive had. Do better osu

Solid teacher. Lots of example problems/quizzes/exams. Just have to really put the time into the class. She's crazy about potential cheating but she's approachable and willing to help unless she knows you are putting in the effort.

Took her online class. Lectures were easy to follow but her exams/quizzes just did not match. Exams/quizzes and assignments were extremely difficult. Went on maternal leave and had Dr. Callam take over and he actually cared. The only class I ever failed. Take him or someone else.

She gives extra credit which is cool, but that's assuming you even understand the topic to get the credit. I had to watch Youtube videos to comprehend what she was saying. I tried SO hard to understand this material and it just didn't always stick. It made me feel worthless and stupid. She omitted crucial explanations to the material which stunk

Dr. Baldwin is a great professor but not a nice person. Her teaching style is amazing and I learned so much in this class, but she does not care about her students. Even the ones who go to her office hours every day and try so hard (and do well) - she is cold to the point of unprofessional. Take the class but don't try to get to know her.

Worst professor I have ever had. I don't get why OSU even keeps her on staff knowing how much the students hate her. She makes you completely hate the material. Do yourself a favor and take literally any other professor.

By far the worst professor I have ever had. She is clearly intelligent and she definitely knows her o chem. However, she is condescending af and her tests are impossible and she threatens to COAM absolutely everyone, which is stressful and stupid. Her tests are insanely difficult, do not take. It will save you so much pain

Ugh...... I signed up on RMP today just to write this review! My goodness! You wont believe how relieved Im knowing she is on maternity leave from today on and Dr. Callam is taking over for the remainder of the class! My experience with Dr. B is like �� Im so stupid I cant even write a poem after having learned just ABCs

I have so many good things to say about Dr. Baldwin. I was TERRIFIED going into the semester, and she made ochem SO accessible for everyone to succeed in. I never felt afraid to ask questions. She gives extra credit and TONS (hundreds!!!) of practice problems. Practice midterms are identical style to exams. Really hoping I get her for 2520!!

I took her for chemistry 2510 (as a chemistry major) and got a C- after the curve. Wanted a redo so I retook it with Dr. Callam and got an A. All of the same exact material, just taught well. She actually got mad at our class because we didn't read or something and gave us 10 min quizzes at the end of every lecture. They were impossible. No good.

Do not take this class. I'm quite literally in the middle of my first midterm and i have never felt more stupid. She did not prepare us for the difficulty of this exam. I would like to cry right now but I am doing this instead. Do not put yourself through this pain, take anyone else. A sock with a smily face drawn on would be a better teacher.
Hide ya kids, hide ya wife before she COAMs them too. Awful, AWFUL prof. Just take it at C state and transfer it over, it's way easier there anyways.
The reason Im no longer pre-med. Tanked my GPA. Watch out.
I took this class last semester and I cried every night because of this woman. Do not take. My GPA dropped SO MUCH because of her. Avoid her at all cost.

Loved this class online. Lectures are short and so helpful. Im good at ochem to be fair, but even with hard tests I knew what to expect and what she would look for. She gave practice exams and quizzes and recitation & TA OH were so helpful. Quizzes werent bad at all. Highly recommend her online. Also homework was fine with OH help.

This is my third year in college and she is the worse professor I've ever had. She goes out of her way to ruin your college experience. She will COAM you for any and everything. Her lectures are useless on her obnoxiously hard exams. I'll pray for future Ochem students who take her.

A horrible teacher and an even worse human being. Shes too worried about sounding smart than actually teaching. Her exams are impossibly hard. I would advise taking anyone else so that you actually have a chance to learn and enjoy o chem.

Her lectures were informative, bus shes passive aggressive in office hours and grades hard. you can get coamed for copying and pasting a structure. I spent most of my time hoping I would pass the class instead of learning. If youre planning on applying to med school or grad school, avoid the stress and bad grade and pick someone else.

The worst professor I have ever had. Impossible exams. Obsessed with COAM. Absolutely unhelpful and super rude. Seemed to just want to brag about how good she was at o chem rather than help students. Continuously told us what we were bad at and then made every graded assignment about it without trying to help us get better. Also, no curve.

pros: good lecture videos cons: everything else. she is a horrible human being. i dont normally trust rate my professor ratings because i know students can be lazy. but jesus christ. dude. anyone deciding if they should take her or wait a semester. wait the semester. its not worth your mental health. she does not care about you.

I wish I could rate higher, but I honestly feel like she grades maliciously. I had to fight so hard for my grade, but so many kids I know ended up failing. She doesn't care about her students even during a pandemic. Do not take her, she does not care about your future and she grades maliciously.

She is the least understand professor I have ever had. Once the pandemic started, she began grading even harder while giving less lecture information. She will take off points for things that have nothing to do with the content of the assignment (using notability features to draw molecules, asking a question that you didnt see on the syllabus).
worst professor I have ever had my entire time at uni.
Takes any chance she can to screw over her students. A good teacher but not a good person.

Hello Dr. Baldwin I love organic chemistry, but you makes me understand how stupid I am on organic chemistry. I tell the truth, I used my all efforts on this class, but I still not make anything. I am very impressed and appreciated on your strictness, hardness, seriousness on teaching, and the respect on chemistry. I'll take your class again!

She does do anything with online classes, she just posts videos and expects you to learn ORGANIC chemistry by yourself. The average for tests are 50% and she curves her grades to make her average a C. Shes the worst.

Please do yourself a favor and do not take any classes with her. Her lectures are very simple and make the content feel easy however she ramps up the difficulty on assignments and expects a lot. I learned more from YouTube than her lectures. She is very hard to negotiate with. If you want to have a fair chance at passing, AVOID HER.

Her empathy seems low. other professors seemed to understand this was a tough time for students, not a vacation, but Baldwin really made things harder than necessary and raised our anxiety making us wonder if we were committing misconduct all the time. ochem is hard but tutors and other chem profs called her exams extreme when I showed them.
Awful professor

She has got to be one of the worst professors at OSU. She is OBSESSED with sending students to Academic misconduct meetings, probably to boost her huge ego. She will ridicule you for not understanding easy concepts (things that are easy to her, a Doctorate in Chemistry, are expected to be easy to undergrad students who have little experience)

Barely covers a concept and then exams and quizzes it on you harder than she teaches it. Calls students who are struggling immature and gives "reality checks" at office hours (in front of other students) instead of helping or admitting she isn't teaching well enough for the majority of her students to keep up. 50-60% exam averages, sometimes lower.

Dr. Baldwin is very intelligent and good at Organic Chemistry. That being said, I cannot say that she is good at teaching Organic Chemistry. She merely reads off of her powerpoints and goes ridiculously fast, not explaining concepts in depth or giving good explanations. During office hours, she can be kind of snippy when responding to questions.

had her for o chem 1 lab and she made her own final instead of using the standardized one and the average was legit a 40%. tests way harder than you get prepared for. also she says she does partial credit but by that she means like 1/20 if you mess up :/

Baldwin is a good lecturer but rude to her students and tests are very difficult. Had her when school switched to online,her online lectures were very organized and even better than her in person ones. However,she provided no flexibility to students regardless of work schedules or sickness (including COVID).Demeaning when questions are asked. Rude.

As an alumni I can say that this course was my worst class experience by far in my entire career. Organic chemistry is an inherently challenging subject, but she belittles students, speeds through lectures, and provides a lot of material however it's overwhelming and not streamlined for exam content. Save yourself a potential retake. <3

Probably the worst professor I've had at Ohio State. Belittled students during office hours when asking questions and acted like she enjoyed seeing her students fail. Exams and quizzes were unnecessarily difficult; sometimes testing us on material she said wouldn't be on there. OChem is a hard course. Don't make your life miserable by taking her.

Horrible professor. She has no clue how to teach and is super cocky. The exams and quizzes are full of things you have never seen before and she makes them overly difficult for no reason other than the enjoyment of failing students. She tries too hard to make herself seem smarter than everyone else. Please take a different professor.

Balwin has a scary reputation but she really is a very great professor in the way that she is passionate about teaching. Don't let the bad reviews on here scare you. I too was scared to take this class and I was able to earn an A by really putting the time in and attending TA office hours. I cannot stress it enough how helpful TA office hours are!

She is by far the worst professor at Ohio State. She gives off the vibe of actually wanting her students to fail. She is more concerned with submitting students to the Committee of Academic Misconduct than she is working on a lecture plan that will actually help students learn. Do not take her.

Probably the worst professor I've had. She gives you a ton of materials to aid with studying but none of it applies to what is actually asked on the exams and quizzes. She honestly doesn't care about her students at all. She loves how much harder she makes your life. Please take any other professor for o-chem.

Dr. B is a very tough professor. That said, she gives you all the materials you need to succeed in a very hard class. She is accessible outside of lecture and is willing to help with anything. She will make you work for your grade. Provided 3 semesters of quizzes and exams with answers and 34 problem sets for various topics. She is also very caring

Worst professor I've ever had. She is way too arrogant to be teaching such a hard, complex class. She makes the class impossibly hard with class averages in the D/E category for every exam/assignment. When the entire class fails, it's the professor's fault, not the students. There are plenty of great professors at OSU. Please take a different one.

Baldwin is by far the worst professor ever. Her class was impossible and expectations were unreachable. Material on assignments/tests was way more difficult than anything mentioned in lecture. Averages on tests were in the low 40's which she gloated about in snarky emails. Showed no consideration for any students, even during a full-scale pandemic.

Dr. Baldwin is the WORST professor I have ever had. She shows a tremendous lack of empathy towards her students and is incredibly arrogant. She is very unapproachable and she does a good job of making you feel stupid if you ask a question. She is such a hard grader and her exams gave me so much anxiety. Good luck if you have her!

Dr. Baldwin is the worst professor I've had at Ohio State. During my Spring 2020 semester, she made the course-load exponentially more challenging, magnifying her lack of empathy towards students undergoing trauma as a result of quarantine. While she may know her stuff, you will come out of this class having endured severe depression. DO NOT TAKE

Dr. B is very tough. She expects you to know the material in & out. You will not see an exact problem you've gotten in practices/hw's on the exam. Ok. listen to me. Stop memorizing every "rule". Every single rule in this class has an exception. If you look for cut and dry if a then b, and if b then d not c, you will not succeed. be a problem solver

This teacher I would not recommend to anyone planning on taking organic chemistry. Do not take her class. If you take her class during the off-season please wait for the next because she is not it. She again IS NOT IT!!!!!!! She is very inconsiderate, especially since the COVID-19 outbreak. She is very arrogant, she should not be a teacher.

She seems to really enjoy how low her class averages are, almost bragging about it. She goes through the material so fast and expects you to learn everything on your own. She doesn't really seem to care much about helping students and makes her exams unnecessarily hard. Do yourself and your GPA a favor and please take someone else.

Dr. Baldwin is a great professor. Do not take her if you are taking any other difficult classes because it will just make your life miserable. The exams are hard (and tbh kind of unfair). Weekly CHALLENGING problems, tons of (optional) problem sets, weekly quizzes. Get ready to work! :I

Rushes through content. Expects us to know the small details of every concept she talks about. Asks exam questions that include reagents weve never used before. Lots of study material but not enough time to go through all of it with 5 other classes. She gets mad at the fact the averages are 40%. Ive learned ochem1 through YouTube , not her.

Yeah dont take ochem with her if you can help it. She really sucks. And now, that Ive retaken the course with Dr. Turner (who is excellent btw) I can confirm that there are good Ochem profs out there. Really she just makes it harder than it needs to bethe crazy chalkboard notes she does, whats that about? Theres a better way- DONT TAKE HER

Do not take her for 2520 unless you had her for 2510 because a lot of the exam problems are from her ochem 1 material which I never learned in my class. Also her exams are extremely difficult with the averages being around 40%.

She is incredibly knowledgeable. It is clear that chemistry is her passion. That said, I can't recommend this professor to anyone. Dr. Baldwin will give you problem sets and most of the test problems will be nothing like them whatsoever. She might say the test is on Ch. 15-17, and then a third of it will be on Ch. 8 without telling you. Be careful

Best professor at OSU is an understatement. She provides practice materials from previous semesters, is super organized, and has frequent office hours. Its inherently a tough course but she makes you LEARN IT and you can tell she cares about your success. Put in the work and get out the rewards-- its really that simple. 110% would recommend!
she sucks at her job

Dr. Baldwin is an amazing organic chemistry professor at OSU. She can be a really tough grader, but she leaves excellent feedback so you learn from your mistakes. She's also extremely good at explaining mechanisms which is super important in understanding these new concepts.

Dr. Baldwin was my favorite professor I had at Ohio State. Even though ochem was hard, she didnt lower her expectations and forced you to know the material inside and out. Everything you need, she gives you, including practice quizzes and exams. Lectures are interactive and engaging. Prepared me so much for 2520
I loved having Dr. B for ochem. She is super knowledgeable and provides lots of helpful resources. Do the problem sets and attend office hours! Provides extra credit for attendance and a few quizes.

Dr. B is amazing. Take her and you will learn O chem well even though it is hard. She taught me way more than I thought I could learn in a semester and I always knew she had faith in me as a student. She sees all her students potential and truly is a gem. I wish she was teaching 2520. Go to her office hours!!

Dr. B is the most organized professor and she responds very quickly to students who reach out to her. She can be intimidating to approach, but she genuinely wants to help you. Shes funny, gives good notes, and offers lots of extra credit and practice materials. Its challenging and stressful most of the time, but overall its a rewarding course.

She was an amazing professor for a combined Ochem 1 & 2 class. She did a great job making concepts very clear and giving examples. She gives out a lot of handouts online and helpful practice problems. If you put in the time and effort, you should easily be able to at least get a B if not an A in her class.

Ochem is hard, and Baldwin has high expectations. The good thing is that her expectations don't really matter because the class is curved regardless, and she has a ton of practice material. She can be intimidating to approach but is very willing to help once you get over that. Her reputation is a little overblown so just study and you'll be fine.

Her exams are difficult and the averages are around 50%, but that's normal for any OChem 1 course. She may come off as unapproachable, but she's very nice and caring. She provides SOO many practice problems and clearly explains her expectations. She teaches you everything you need to know in her lectures, and OChem 2 will be easier if you had her.
A good teacher blames himself for being unclear. A bad teacher blames her students for not asking enough questions.

Dr. Baldwin is definitely amazing, and her class was my favorite at OSU! Highly recommend to take her if you are taking ochem 1. She provides everything you need to be successful in her class, including a ton of practice problems.

Dr. Baldwin is by far the best professor I have ever had at OSU. She truly gives her all to her students & makes lectures not only engaging but fun. Her no excuses attitude necessary for this course. Her class taught me the value of hard work & pushed me to do my best. She is such a caring woman & truly wants all her students to do well.

Beneath all the color-coded notes and additional resources is a somewhat disorderly presentation of information. Topics are introduced before the fundamentals are set, and examples are given before the concepts are fully understood. That being said, she gives you plenty of practice problems. Those are a must. Lectures are a maybe.

There was talk about how Baldwin was evil before I took her, but that was far from the case. She is very smart and well organized, and she actually cares about her students. However, the tests are very difficult, and it's necessary that you stay on top of the problem sets. It's a ton of work, but compared to my OChem 2 teacher, she was great.

Eh, Baldwin is a difficult professor and she doesn't always explain things in a way that is helpful to many students, her class is extremely dependent on her midterms that hare really really hard. Make sure you take your time on her quizzes and study for them so they can boost your grade. Do the problem sets they are helpful.

Do all of her problem sets. Pay attention in lecture and take clear notes to study from. She is extremely organized which is in. Pay attention, do problem sets, do the old quizzes and exams. Just stay on top of the work and you'll be fine Baldwin is a good professor.

I had to retake organic chemistry, due to getting a bad grade. Dr. Baldwin's course was about equal in difficulty, but it was much better taught. She's extremely organized, providing all the material you could possibly dream of. Doing her problem sets and attending lectures is crucial to your success. Follow her advice and you'll do well.

Attendance in lecture isn't required but you won't get information anywhere else, plus she gives extra credit for attendance a few times. Admittedly she is a difficult professor, but the class is super doable if you put in the work. Biggest advice, don't get lazy after midterm 1 and MAKE THE REACTION NOTEBOOK WHEN SHE SAYS! It saved me on the final

One of the best professor's in OSU! Her problem sets are extremely helpful and her lectures are clear and informative. She is also really funny too! She has us students engage in the lecture and has a lot of office hours. Her class is hard but she prepares you well for future chemistry courses. Study from previous years quizzes and exams too!

Important info: Exam 1 - 128/200 (avg 118), Exam 2- 100/200 (avg 79) Final 164/300 (avg 134), 10 total quizzes two lowest dropped, above average on 8/8 of those quizzes. STUDY 4 THESE LIKE THEY ARE A TEST. They will help keep you afloat. Ended the class with a 61.5% and ended with a B in the class. Insanely hard professor but you WILL learn a lot.

Dr. Baldwin is an amazing woman and professor. Her class was very, very fair. If you do not end up with the grade you wanted, trust me, that's on you. She provides lots of resources. You put in the time, you will do very well. Her exams are difficult, as are all ochem exams, but fair. She is very knowledgeable and helpful. Curve is a godsend

Dr. B was the best lecturer I've had at Ohio State. Organic is fundamentally a HARD class, and the averages show that--her exams are difficult, but also pretty fair. Take advantage of her availability in office hours (I wish I had), do the practice probs, GO TO LECTURE!! You can gauge how you're doing based on averages. The class is curved!

Dr. Baldwin has the best lectures that I have ever attended. She makes this class enjoyable and manageable. Are her tests hard? Oh, 100%. Are they fair? Yes. She will answer all of your questions (btw: HAVE QUESTIONS. Question why everything works. It helps.). Dr. Baldwin is incredible and made me love organic. TAKE HER. You will learn so much.

I absolutely loved Dr. B! Her lectures are incredibly clear and easy to follow, and she teaches you about concepts and rules, not just how to do practice problems, which is what really helped me understand and succeed. Her problem sets and practice quizzes are very helpful, and you'll do well in the class if you do them. Highly recommend her!!

Dr. B is a great lecturer, so the textbook is unnecessary if you go to class. She provides a lot of practice material, but it is up to you to put in the time and effort. Her exams are very difficult (our MT1 average was a 60% and our MT2 average was a 40%). If you're willing to work hard and ask questions, you'll be fine. The class is curved.

Dr. Baldwin is a gem. Her class is difficult but she is a great professor. She keeps the class entertained and her notes are very easy to follow. DO THE PROBLEM SETS AND PRACTICE QUIZZES/EXAMS as her exams and test questions are much often harder than the examples in class. You get out what you put in so go to office hours and you'll be prepared.

Andrea Baldwin tries to be hard but fair, yet ends up just hard. Her grading is nitpicky to absurdity, she will flat out refuse to answer questions, and is overly condescending. It's clear to me that she loves her work, but cannot accurately convey its meaning to her students. I would say avoid at all costs.

Dr. Baldwin is the youngest professor that I've ever had, and the *best* --which says something. She gives so much to her students, making the lectures positive and enjoyable while having a necessary "no excuses" attitude. I quite honestly learned how to learn from her, and I'll forever be grateful for how much energy she puts in for us.

Easily both the hardest and most caring teacher I have ever met. If you are willing to put in the work, she is really a fantastic teacher. Office hours are a must, but she has such flexible hours. Yes, she is a crazy hard teacher, but I suggest go talk to her. You may be as surprised as I was. :)

Baldwin's lecture is all chalkboard writing the entire time. Good lectures but exams and quizzes are MUCH harder than any other ochem lecturer. I ended with a 68.5% in the class and that was curved to a B, which shows how hard the exams were. She sometimes gives extra credit for showing up to lecture. It's evident she LOVES chem.

Dr. Baldwin is pretty condescending and her exams are very very hard. Doing the problem sets and past exams and quizzes helps, but there is no way to be fully prepared for her exams. Class is curved but if you are toward the top it's not curved that much. She doesn't directly answer questions when you ask them in office hours.

Regardless of the professor, ochem is a tough course. In order to do well, you have to work hard and spend hours studying no matter what. Dr. Baldwin does an amazing job with her lectures, explaining things and telling you what you need to know. Her office hours are also very helpful. I highly recommend her class if you truly want to learn ochem.

Lecture notes are well organized, but goes through info very quickly and comes off as not approachable. Gives a lot of practice problem sets, but they don't help that much with exams because her exams are a lot more challenging. Averages on exams and quizzes were pretty low, but the class is curved- just not sure by how much yet.

I think serious students will love Dr. B. and those who want an easy A in ORGANIC CHEM will hate her. Her class is extremely challenging. I probably would've gotten a better grade taking an easier professor. Having said that, her knowledge and passion for what she does is contagious. I believe I got a lot out her class and will be well prepared2520

Dr. B is the best lecturer I've had at OSU. You can learn SO much from her class and it really pays off if you're pre-health. It's pretty simple: if you're lazy, or have too heavy of a schedule, you probably won't have a great experience in ochem. She is extremely straightforward with material even though she expects you to "show it" on exams.
AVOID AVOID AVOID! Exams are impossible, quizzes don't cover what was discussed in lecture/on the problem sets, and she lectures way too quickly.
Do not take her if you have other options.

One of the hardest classes that you can take. She gives lots of practice questions (around 20 pages at least) for each chapter and you are expected to do all even though it does not get you any extra credit:(. Tests are heavy and if you miss a class you are going to be behind everything. No extra credit .

Take Dr. Baldwin if you want to learn, but you will have to put in A LOT of time to get a good grade. Do well on weekly quizzes to cushion your grade. Exam are extremely difficult, she expects you to apply your knowledge to very complicated problems. She's a pretty good lecturer, but ochem is a notoriously difficult class.
Difficult, but passionate. She may seem unapproachable but is actually very nice and willing to help.
Best teacher I've had at OSU, exams are tough but she's so good at lecturing and is very organized

Dr. Baldwin is extremely condescending. She isn't willing to help students who ask questions and automatically assumes that you have the same baseline organic chemistry knowledge as she does. Her tests are ridiculously hard and her problem sets do not adequately prepare you for them. The class is heavily curved since test averages are below 50%.

I loved Dr. Baldwin. She has office hours more than any other professor I know and is always willing to answer questions. She gives you so many pages of optional practice and doing them will really help you on the tests! O chem is a hard subject, but Dr. B teaches you well. Take her!

She's an awesome professor because of the way she teaches. However, get ready to study really hard since her quizzes and exams are extremely hard!! But there's always hope, I ended up the class with a 55% and that was curved to a B- (:

The positives first. She'd be a great teacher for a for-majors class. For students who really don't care, she makes exams and problems really complicated. I hated going to class and I studied on my own. The class is curved big time, my 58% got curved to a B. She expects you to think like an OChemist and can mess with your self confidence.

Everyone knows that ochem is a hard class, so I wasn't all that surprised when I took it. Dr. Baldwin is a great lecturer with really organized notes. Her tests are crazy hard but it's possible to do well if you study and do the problem sets. I also got a lot of my points from weekly quizzes. Keeping up with those makes studying for exams easier.

If don't want to take a difficult class, don't take o chem. However, if you are going to take o chem Dr. Baldwin is the one to take it with. She knows her stuff to a t and has GREAT teaching skills. Her exams are difficult, but she provides you the resources and methods you need to succeed. If you put the work in you will do well. Also great curve!

Be super super super and I can not stress enough super careful with choosing this professor. Her exams are downright unfair. I have not heard one person tell me they liked her exams. They were just downright difficult and didn't reflect what I knew. The curve is pretty big too but wasn't enough as I was always 15-20% above the average and got a B.

Dr. Baldwin is a great lecturer. Her exams are very challenging and you really need to understand the concepts to do well in the class. If you have class with her, do the problem sets multiple times and read the book. The grade you get is really based on how much effort you put into the class.

If you want to learn take her. The way she uses examples helps make organic chemistry more understandable. She understands this is a new concept for most and makes it a lot easier to understand. Moves fast at end of semester but thats because this class has a ton of chapters to cover. Tests are very difficult but the curve will make up for that.

Extremely rude to her class sometimes and questions people when they don't understand things, like ochem is easy? Messes up the answers on the problem sets and doesn't provide the students with correct answers so students waste time on trying to understand incorrect info.

This class is hard but Dr. Baldwin is always willing to help. Spent many hours working with her on this class, never got annoyed with questions. Gives much more practice than any other prof I've heard of. Knows a lot, very knowledgeable and approachable. Work hard and the class will be fine.  Averages always comparable to other profs.

She is definitely a hard professor. You have to work really hard to do well in this class. This is the hardest class I have taken so far. She knows her stuff very well but sometimes expects more than we can achieve. Averages are very low, but there is a nice curve. This class will definitely prepare you for the next o chem.

Wow. Just wow. Baldwin is a very organized lecturer which is helpful if you are a textbook kind of person. She also gives an abundance of practice problems. HER EXAMS.. a lot of the stuff on the exams would require the combining of like 10 different ideas, which is fine by me, but don't ask for an 80 average and act like its our fault when its a 38

Sped through material way too fast and it was so hard to read her handwriting on the board. The quizzes and exams were impossible and were nothing like the problem sets she provided. This professor was very unhelpful! Don't take ochem with her if you want to actually learn anything or do well.

Dr. Baldwin is truly interested in the success of her students. O Chem is a VERY challenging course. However, she only increases the challenge. She does this in in the interest of the students - but it sucks. Very organized with good notes. Very hard. Almost too smart to be a professor. If you're used to getting by with ease, this will be a change.

Dr. Baldwin is very organized and very good at explaining concepts for being new. HOWEVER, I do think that she needs to reevaluate her expectations for tests/quizzes. The average on the second exam was a 36%, and a quiz was given in order to artificially curve the test, however the average on that quiz was around a 68% so few got points added back.

Andrea was a great professor. O chem is a hard class regardless of who you take, but she explains very well and is always happy to help if you have further questions. The exams are really tough, but the average is usually very low, so the curve is much greater than other classes.

Do not take this professor! She is horrible. Her exams are ridiculously hard compared to other ochem sections. "Wow, she's showing off how much she knows. I wouldn't have taught my class some of the stuff she is testing you on." - Another ochem professor when I took my notes to him. Moves incredibly fast without really explaining material.

Dr. Baldwin clearly knows what she is talking about when it comes to o chem and her lectures are very detailed but really fast moving also. She really tries to help you understand WHY things happen. HOWEVER, she has ridiculous expectations and her exams are RIDICULOUSLY difficult. I believe she cares about her students, but it is just too much.

Dr. Baldwin does a great job teaching students to understand the "why" in all that is organic chemistry. Her lectures are easy to follow, but I also read the textbook. Loved her office hours- take advantage. Midterms are very challenging, but do the problem sets (all 25+ pages each) and you'll do well.

She is a great professor, but her exams are no joke. Just get ready to learn, she believes in her students and wants her students to speak the Ochem language. Well if you don't like learning new languages, you better find a different professor. She will definitely teach you this new language. She gives excellent notes unlike other professors.

It's organic chemistry, what do you expect! This is no doubt, a tough class but Dr. Baldwin is a wonderful professor. She definitely knows what she's talking about and presents the information in a way to make it pretty understandable to everyone. Your grade is dependent upon solely exams and quizzes. Make sure you're ready to study a lot!

Dr. Baldwin is a fantastic lecturer. She explains the concepts in a clear manner and is very available to help clarify. I find it baffling how many negative reviews there are. OChem is a hard class people! Maybe instead of crying about how hard tests are and writing about how "bad" your prof is, you could've studied and done better! Accountability!

Lectures are SO organized, her writing is very neat, she answers lots of questions, and is very nice and encouraging. The class is graded on a curve, so I don't know why people care about the average.  She definitely prepared me for the next course, probably more so than another professor would have. I am very disappointed she isn't teaching 2520.

I have no idea why everyone on here says she is such a bad teacher, in order to do well you have to, gasp, do her practice problems. If you understand those her tests and quizzes are not hard. I would recommend going to her office hours, I think she is better there than she is in lecture.

While she is a nice person one-on-one, her expectations are absolutely ridiculous. She has a hard time understanding that what she knows cannot be put into our heads by telling us that we "should know the material."  She loves what she does, but most students won't possess her skill, so she has to bring it down to a more approachable level.

I am in one of Dr. Baldwin's first lectures and I feel that she really cares about her students and wants to see them succeed. While her exams and quizzes are tougher than most of the other professor's exams, she makes sure you really know the material. She takes time to make specific problem sets for you to do if you would like to get better.

Dr. Baldwin is willing to help, if you don't mind being talked down upon. Her lectures are very fast paced and quizes are way harder and longer than a 15 minute quiz should be. The exams are absolutely brutal. The averages we anywhere from the 30s to 50s.

Don't take this professor she goes through topics really fast and doesn't explain them in depth yet expects you to know things in more than she explained on midterms and quizzes. She writes everything on the chalk board and it her handwriting is very hard to read. The average was so low on the second midterm they wouldn't post the grades.

she is the worst professor ever. do not take this class with her. she gives out problems that my tutors think are impossible. Callam at least gives practice exams & quizzes she gives nothing! dont know how u can give no practice quizzes/tests for an ochem class. Goes too fast & doesnt explain concepts at all or tell u what will b on the quiz

Baldwin explains everything in lecture well, and she writes everything on the board so you won't miss any info (compared to ppt). Her quizzes are fair, and her exams are application based (so more challenging).  You have to put in the work to get the grade you want, the bad reviewers were expecting an easy A in my opinion. Do her problem sets.

Dr. Baldwin has a lot of expectations. She teaches at a very fast rate but expects her students to know all the concepts in depth. She does not provide much study material besides her problem sets, which are copy&paste from another professor. She forgets that students do not know as much ochem as her and makes mistakes that she doesn't own up to.

Average on the second exam was so low she wouldn't tell anyone, because it reflected how poor of a teacher she is. Constantly talking down to students saying 'this isn't hard' after barely teaching things. You need to go to office hours to actually learn anything, her lectures are useless. She should be your very last choice for an ochem professor.

She is geniunely a very caring professor. She gives students enough materials to get a good grade, it's just a lot. Do all of the problems she assigns, understand them and you'll be fine. Yes, you actually have to work pretty hard in this class for a rewarding grade!

Worst professor I've ever had. She is rude to students when they ask questions and makes ridiculously hard exams that my PhD candidate tutor things are brutal. She flies through concepts and is very snippy when students ask questions. Ochem is a hard enough class without a professor who wants you to fail. Take somebody else who wants you to succeed
If you dare to choose this class, it will be better to study in group.
never try this , trust me
So hard and even have exam problems for things not taught. Please do not try her class. You know that there are many options instead of taking her class.
Amazing at explaining concepts, very helpful in office hours. Super hard class though, take advantage of professor outside of lecture.

Although I am one of the first lectures Dr. Baldwin has taught, she teaches like a pro. She is very good at explaining concepts and her lectures are extremely organized. This makes it easy to reference the material in the textbook for more information. There is no homework to do, but she does create problem sets for us to complete as practice.

summary_comment: Dr. Nguyen is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching skills, clear explanations, and genuine care for her students' success. She consistently receives praise for her engaging lectures, helpful review sessions, and supportive office hours. Students appreciate her clear teaching style, use of analogies, and provision of ample study materials, making her one of the top professors in the chemistry department.

Ratings.comment: Dr. N is legit a queen. Amazing lecturer, genuinely cares about her students, and is super funny. Her lectures are very engaging with lots of demos. She holds super helpful review sessions before every exam. The pre and post labs can get a little time consuming but other than that the workload isn't unbearable for a chemistry class.

Dr. Nguyen is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. Although concepts can be tough, she will set you up for success with all her extra practice exams and clear explanations in class. It is obvious that she genuinely cares for every student and is a very friendly person. Choose her if you want to be successful in Chemistry!!

I had Dr. Nguyen for both CHEM 1210 and currently have her in CHEM 1220. Her explanations in lecture are so clear and easy to understand. She has a genuine gift for teaching, her office hours are super chill and helpful, and she is clearly devoted to the success of her students. I can't recommend her enough. Take her class and you will be prepared.
Quit reading her reviews and go enroll in her class. She is the best. Enough said.

I loved Dr. Nguyen! She explained concepts easily and used great analogies to help students understand. She genuinely wants her students to succeed and ensures they grasp the material. She also provides plenty of review materials and practice exams that helped with studying. I'd do anything to have her again!

Honestly a really great teacher. Explains everything fairly well and records lectures incase you miss one! Good style of homework (1 hw assignment per chapter so abt 30-40 question hws) but it is not weekly. Very nice and helpful in office hours

Truly an awesome professor, I wish I could take all my chem classes with her! Super sweet and tells fun stories, great teacher and explains topics clearly. Seriously the best of the best of the chem department- I'm going to miss having her as a teacher. Lecture attendance isn't mandatory, but it is for recitation.

She is an amazing professor, my favorite of the semester. She gets straight to the point, never cancels class, and everything is always organized. Her notes are easy to follow and she makes class interesting. Also she posts all of her lectures on youtube and in canvas so you can watch them there.

Explains the concepts of all the chapters really well, and does many example problems during lecture with some demos. If you pay attention the course should make sense and it shouldn't be too difficult. Also breaks down harder concepts into easy to understand language like examples or analogies. Overall good experience.
Clear, friendly, and happy to help students
She is the reason I switched my major to something related more to chemistry
Great teacher, super caring and explains things very well. Lectures were recorded. Even just fun to chat with at labs
She is a good professor and cares about her students

She's an amazing professor! She always explains things very well. She also posts her lectures on Carmen, so it's easy to go back and watch them. Chemistry can be difficult for some, so I recommend taking her class if possible. It's apparent she loves her job; she always seems to have fun when she's teaching. Heard her office hours are helpful too.

Please take Dr. Nguyen if you have the chance because she is an amazing professor! Chemistry is a difficult subject but she makes it enjoyable. She explains hard concepts very well and makes it understandable. I am planning to take CHEM1220 with her again!
Dr. N was amazing. She was always ready to help her students with whatever they needed.

Awesome chem teacher!! She cared about students succeeding and very clearly loved chemistry. There is definitely work to put in for the class, but she made chemistry enjoyable and practical. I highly recommend her class.

Dr. N is in the top 3 of best instructors I have had at OSU. She has accommodations for missed exams, recitations, and labs. She explains concepts as simply as possible, often with analogies. She records every lecture. I have no complaints. Opt out of the textbook by the way. You'll never use it.
Dr. N is the goat.

My favorite professor at OSU, had her for 1210 and 1220. She cares so much about each student and provides so many resources and extra help. I think she is the best Chem professor for 1210/1220, I would do everything you can to have her as your professor. Gen Chem is a weed out, so you actually have to put time and effort into the class to do well.

Chem has always been hard for me so I was worried about 1220 but Dr. N just knows how to teach it. The way she explains things make so much sense. She singlehandedly keeps the OSU chem department running. She records all lectures and organizes her notes for the students perfectly. She keeps students engaged too. 100% recommend.

I don't know what to say about Dr N that has not been said one hundred times over. She is the absolute best the chemistry department has to offer and she truly carries the department on her back. She was so great of a professor that I would feel guilty if I slept through the class (It was an 8am). I would absolutely take another one of her classes.

She was an amazing professor that went above and beyond to make sure her students truly understood the content. Whenever I didn't understand a concept, I would frequent her office hours and there she would go more into depth and make sure to answer questions as effectively as possible! Also her review sessions were amazing! Would highly recommend!

I wouldn't have been doing well in the class without Dr. N, so I cannot recommend her enough. 1220 is a HARD class, but Dr. N makes it so much more manageable and provides so many resources. She tries to make lectures more interesting with demos and little stories. Because of her I now have a passion and appreciation for chemistry.
The best professor to ever exist. Dr. Nguyen is amazing at teaching chemistry and turns a hard subject into something that is easy to understand.
She is the best science teacher I have ever had! Took an 8am just to have her again for chem 1220.

This woman is a blessing from god to an undeserving OSU chem department. I took this class 2 years ago and didn't realize how unbelievably amazing she was, until experiencing the absolute dumpster fire that is the rest of the chem department for my later classes. I still rave about her to anyone who will listen years later. Take her!!!

Lived up to the hype as one of the best chemistry professors on campus. Lectures aren't mandatory but they're good to go to since they're not quite as sleep-inducing as many others. Many of my friends ditched their professor's lectures to come to Dr. Nguyen's so it was almost always a full house in McPherson 1000.

Dr. N is the best college prof I've ever had full stop. She explains chem at a level an 8th grader could understand. It does not get much better than Dr. N for college professors. Having her last year made me switch my major to chem. I would whole heartedly recommend her for any class she teaches!
Best Lecturer in the Department of Chemistry at OSU hands down. She is very sweet, funny, and knowledgeable. Very caring towards her students.

Dr. Nguyen is AMAZING!! She takes a notoriously difficult and hated topic and makes it interesting and not too difficult to understand. She prepares you extremely well for exams, so much so that my friends with other chem professors always ask me to send them her review packets and attend her exam reviews with me.

Dr. Nguyen is one of the most inspiring, caring, and enthusiastic professors here at OSU. She gives so many resources to her students and actually cares about them succeeding. From her review sessions and study guides you can tell she puts a lot of care and time into helping us become the best chemists we can be.

She is passionate about Chemistry. She takes a very hard class and makes it easy to understand. Provides a crap ton of exam review materials. Her exam review sessions are the bomb. She is a very good lecturer and when I had a hard time following/missed class, her lecture recordings would always be posted within 24 hrs of class. Get her if you can!

I CANNOT recommend her enough. Dr. Nguyen is probably the best prof I've ever had. She's so passionate about chemistry, understanding of students, and a brilliant lecturer. Most students in other sections end up watching her recorded lectures and hunting down Nguyen's students for the plentiful resources. She made me decide to do a chem minor.

Dr. N is a truly amazing professor and anyone should be considered lucky that gets to take her course. She clearly teaches all material and gives the least amount of homework compared to the other chemistry professors. She provides lots of practice material for each midterm which is very helpful. She truly wants all of her students to succeed.

Dr. N is the best professor I've had at OSU. She is kind, caring, and passionate about what she teaches, making it easy to learn from her. I did quite well in her class and improved greatly from Chem 1210 last semester. The course is difficult, but she makes it bearable. I would definitely take Dr. N again!

I found Dr. Nguyen set clear expectations and gave a lot of study material for each exam. Her restructured 1250 course was done very well. Labs were sometimes offset from lecture, but she attempted to make up for that in most cases. A decent bit of homework, but a very manageable class structure. Highly recommend Dr. Nguyen .

The absolute best chemistry professor. In order to succeed in any chem class, you need to do a ton of practice problems. Dr. Nguyen provides a ton of practice resources and questions that are similar to what you would see on the exam. She explains things very clearly and she gives the best advice. Best professor I've had in awhile :)

AMAZING PROFESSOR- she is super transparent, GREAT lecturer, and offers a plethora of resources to help you succeed. 
She sets high expectations for us- she even refers to us as "chemists"- but does everything possible to help us reach them.
5 stars.
Great professor. The home-works take awhile so get a head start. The tests are hard but there are many resources she gives you to be successful! I learned a lot.
Dr. Nguyen and Dr. Stoltzfus are the reason Ohio State gets to even have a chem department.
Amazing presenter/lecturer and uploaded quality recordings of every single lecture.
Professor Nguyen is awesome! You can tell she truly loves teaching chemistry and she cares about the success of her students. She gives lots of extra resources for practice before the exams too.

Dr. Nguyen's behavior is very 'I'm gonna teach you the content of the slides. Then I'll crack a joke or two. Then I'll give you office hours or online resources (self-made or external) and some practice exams.'
Basically, she'll give all the resources and you have to figure out which one works best EARLY. 
Office hours helped.
Loves her farm.

Professor Nguyen (Win) is a passionate and excellent professor. If you have the chance to take her I would. Chem 1210 has many annoying parts about it (mostly the lab), but Dr. Win has no control over these. She releases extra study material, posts the lectures online (which I found extremely helpful), and hosts helpful review sessions.

Dr. N is passionate and energetic. Her lectures were fun and engaging, but also useful tools in understanding the content. She provides "overview" pages for each chapter with extra practice problems, and these helped me make a B+ to A average on the midterms.

Dr. N is the BEST Chem 1210 teacher you can have- I promise. She is very kind and knowledgable and always makes the lectures fun. Chem 1210 is a hard subject, but having Dr. N is the best boost to success.

The class is tough but Lisa made it bearable. She was great at explaining concepts in lecture. Just show up and pay attention. Do the homework. You will pass the class, even by doing bare minimum. Curve was heavy.

Dr. Nguyen was such an amazing professor. She was the only 1210 professor I know to constantly do demos in class to help us understand the material better. Her notes are easy to follow and she tries to make the class interesting. I purposely scheduled an 8am next semester just to have her again.

Dr. N is a great professor and genuinely wants her students to succeed. Her class is traditionally lecture-based, and she posts guided notes to fill in. Not too much homework, on Mastering Chemistry. As long as you attend lecture or watch the lecture videos and use the extra resources she posts, the exams aren't too hard and you should do well.

One of the best 1210 professors. Actually cares about her students. Just got out of grad school so young and energetic compared to other energetic. She posts her lectures online; however, they are actually fun to go to as she likes to interact with the class from time to time. She is a great teacher and I highly recommend.

Dr. Nguyen is the goat, plain and simple. She does a great job of explaining topics. She gives lots of practice to prepare for midterms. Basically, she makes it so your grade is dependent on how much time you want to put in.
I loved Her
Genuinely Dr. N is the best chemistry professor I have ever had. Even if we were behind in lecture notes, she caught us up and made sure that we understood everything before the midterm.
Dr. N was an amazing professor teaching a hard course. Chem 1220 is a hard class, but Dr. N made it feel much easier. She is so willing to help and cares so much about her students success.

I recommend taking 1220 with Dr. Nguyen if she is teaching. All the practice she gives is very similar to the exams, so if you do the practice sheets she gives it's more likely than not that you will recognize most of the problems in the exam. She also provides good insight into office hours so it's recommended to attend those as well.

Dr. N is one of the rare professors out there who genuinely loves teaching and is passionate about her subject. She provides a ton of resources and is more than willing to help her students. She is very approachable and loves talking about her chickens. As long as you put in the work and practice, you can pass this class no problem.

Dr. N genuinely cares about teaching and the success of her students and provides a multitude of good resources to succeed in her class. She is engaging and explains things very thoroughly and clearly in lecture. The amount of homework was not unreasonable, and the exams were fair/comparable to practice exams.

Dr. Nguyen was super nice and inspirational. Knew how to keep her students engaged and found creative ways for students to remember concepts. Clearly cares about students and extremely motivated in ensuring that we understand the content. Highly recommend.

I was never a fan of chemistry until I had Dr. Nguyen for chem 1210. She made lectures so fun and I could easily follow along. Although the course itself is a bit of work, as long as you do the work it's not too difficult.

Dr.N is an extremely caring and passionate professor. She makes chemistry 1210 interesting and easy to understand, all while intellectually  challenging her students to think conceptually. She also has office hours in which she helps students with practice problems or just going over course material.

Cannot recommend enough for 1210. Always makes material as simple as possible to understand and gives a ton of extra review/practice. Office hours really make a difference. Her sections fill up quick but its worth it if you can get on the waitlist.
She genuinely cares about her students and wants us to succeed. Definitely recommend

Best chem professor for sure. She genuinely cares and takes the time to make sure you understand. There is only one graded homework assignment a week so its not overwhelming. Her class consistently gets higher averages on exams than other 1210 courses so I would say take her class if you need chem.

Pretty good. Not as good as Fus, but cares a lot and wants students to do well in her class. Lectures are late which is not advantageous, and homework is plentiful which can be unpleasant. Good at lecturing though, she keeps concepts relatively straightforward and easy to understand. Not bad overall, but OSU Chemistry Dept is horrible so shes good.

Dr. N definitely puts a lot of effort into catering to students' needs (provides a lot of resources, exam prep, review sessions, etc.) Her lectures were lively and she broke down tough concepts pretty well. Ultimately, your grade will come down to how much work you put in and how well you utilize her resources outside of the classroom.
Really sweet professor who tries to help her students. She also would take time outside of class to host online review sessions. She assigns more homework than the other 1210 professors though.
An overall fine teacher, nothing amazing, nothing terrible.

Fantastic lecturer, she makes the content easy to understand and practice problems in class are well-explained and relevant to exam material. As long as you put in a reasonable amount of work into the class, you should do very well.

Dr. Nguyen is absolutely amazing at teaching! I actually am able to understand the concepts she introduces, AND the reasoning behind them. She also makes sure to do lots of practice problems during math sections.

Dr. N is an amazing professor! She genuinely cares about you and wants you to succeed. Shes very good at explaining topics and goes into depth. Lectures arent boring and are super helpful. You have one hw assignment for each chapter ( 1 a week), its long but helps you learn. She gives you so many materials to study/learn!

Dr. N is an amazing instructor. There is a text book but whether you use it is up to you. In this class you learn about 1 chapter a week and you have a mastering chem homework due every Sunday. However, Dr. N makes it enjoyable and has a tendency to get side tracked on anecdotes making class all the more enjoyable along with in class experiments.
Very fun and engaging lectures. Youll be fine if you do your homework and pay attention in lectures.

Dr.N is so amazing. She genuinely cares about her students and makes me love chem. I ended up switching my major to chemistry because of how much of an impact she made on me. She helped so much and really made sure we understood topics thoroughly before she moved on. She always makes time to help students who need it or give them more resources.

Dr. Nguyen is actually the best professor I have ever had. She makes in depth pre-lecture videos and incredibly helpful overviews for every single chapter. Her office hours are super informative and overall a great time. If you ever have a chance to take Chem 1210 with her, please do!

I LOVED having professor Nguyen she is so funny and made the material easy to understand. The class in general sucks because the chem department at OSU is awful but Dr. Nguyen actually cared about us and helped out. The class is very hard and time consuming tho, def recommend getting a tutor. However, she is very caring and helps out when she can.

summary_comment: Professor Zhang's teaching approach is mixed; while some students appreciate his clear explanations, helpful online lectures, and positive attitude, others find his lectures overly focused on unimportant details and lacking in exam preparation. His high workload and lack of extra credit can make the course challenging, though some students attribute their success to his thorough coverage of material. Overall, his effectiveness as a teacher varies widely among students.

Ratings.comment: Wasn't a professor i would really remember or be fond of in the future. Just came into lecture to teach and left, not really passionate. I didn't have a bad time with him or the exams, I just took notes from the textbook and memorized that and was fine, I also recommend doing practice problems.

Take Kohler instead, or whatever section is NOT at 8am. Nothing wrong with this professor, exams aren't much harder than AP chem (although it is a LOT more content). Memorize everything and all shall be well. Beware the labs. I dare you to try and rizz up the lab TA, our class managed to rizz the lab TA for a fortnite 1v1.

DO NOT take this class with Professor Zhang. He's a good lecturer but skips exam topics, focuses on unrelated content, and provides no review materials for Midterms worth 40% of the grade. Exams don't align with lectures, and our class average was 10% lower than other sections. Take someone else for Honors

Zhang was a bad teacher in terms of teaching and the passion he had when teaching. Because he did not seem to be passionate about education, the class seemed very boring. He takes a lot of time explaining unimportant things outside the exam and takes so little time explaining the important things.
Professor Zhang explains concepts very well and provides a lot of examples during lecture. He also has a funny sense of humor and makes the class more fun.

Zhang is a super sweet guy and seems like he really enjoys chemistry. However, he often gives out 3-4+ homework assignments all due in one night usually a couple of times a week. EVERYTHING IS A GRADE, made practicing the material hard. no extra credit. I think the course is just poorly constructed because it's based only on the midterms and final.

By far the best chem 1210 lecturer. We always had the highest average out of the other sections and it was because of him. The chemistry department absolutely sucks at OSU, so the only reason I did well was from his lectures. He uploaded short lectures online too which really helped when reviewing! I didnt know anything about chemistry, got an A-

I loved Professor Zhang! He was always confident in the fact that all of his students had the potential to succeed and had a positive attitude. He was passionate about the subject and I found his lectures very helpful. That being said, this was a class that required a ton of work and reading to succeed in. If you put the effort in, you'll be fine!
I Went to his office hours once and he was strangely rude and condescending, not a very clear lecturer either. You can find better lecturers for 1210
had lots of hw, pretty decent lecturer

Honestly, this class is just hard, but he does a good job of explaining material and even makes a few jokes along the way. Could've been wayyyyyy worse. Giant lecture so definitely go to his (or TA) office hours.
He cares a lot, but often spent too much time on certain subjects and then skipped over others because we ran out of time.

Dr. Zhang was awesome! You could just tell how happy he was to teach. He was encouraging and positive around exam times (trust me, you need that!), and he has a good sense of humor that made me look forward to lectures. He often added extra information about his favorite scientists into his lectures, which made class more interesting.

I had him for my first semester of general chemistry and found that I really understood the material. Although sometimes boring or dry, his lectures were helpful. The online homework was a lot but that was to be expected. Exams were on the difficult side. I would suggest not only doing the homework and taking notes, but read the textbook also!

Clearly very passionate about chemistry, very knowledgeable and when he makes mistakes (which chem professors are notorious for), he always clarifies them in an email. Hes new to teaching I believe but he does a decent job explaining concepts, and he gives you opportunities to ask questions when going over problems. Makes funny comments.
Talks about things in class that will never be relevant for exams and spends very little time on the hard stuff you actually need to know.

summary_comment: Professor Ricciardo is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and genuine care for her students' success. Students appreciate her clear explanations, willingness to help during office hours, and the practical approach she takes in her lectures. However, some find her grading to be heavily dependent on effort and preparation, and there are mixed feelings about the relevance of certain assignments and practices.

Ratings.comment: Very good professor. She is very nice and good at teaching.

She was an amazing professor and she will set you up for success. There are many ways to prepare for the exams and if you are struggling go to office hours. She is always willing to help students out and genuinely wants students to succeed. Use practice problems and pay attention in lecture and you can get any grade you want!

Dr. Ricciardo makes General Chemistry simple and easy to understand. Her lectures involve doing many practice problems on the board and individually which helps me feel confident in my abilities before leaving class. Super understanding and always willing to help.

Here's a corrected version of your text: Professor Ricciardio is probably one of the better chemistry professors at OSU. Your grades in this class are indeed a direct reflection of the effort you put in. If you study efficiently, you should have no problem getting an A. I will say this, she never once responded to any of the emails I sent.

She truly cares about her students and tries to be as accessible and accommodating as possible. Your grade in her class directly reflects the amount of work you put in. I had ZERO background in chemistry yet felt very welcome. Would take again!

Personally, I am not taking her as a professor for 1208 as she wasn't very personable when I was dealing with personal problems outside the classroom and wasn't much help overall when it came to the class In my opinion, the learning portfolios are redundant. She takes attendance every lecture so try not to miss much.

She is so so kind and clearly cares about her students. I liked her lecture style and having an iPad with Goodnotes or something like that is VERY useful. The tests and homework load are manageable. She is also very accommodating when needed. Definitely recommend going to class though or you will feel a little behind.

Never can wrap my head around why we give practice tests when the exams are nothing like it. "The practice exam is similar to the real test". What is similar??? The Unit of the test. Kind of awkward when you ask her questions and overall just not very fair. Learning Portolios are a waste of time and nobody benefits from them. Do better.

Was a pretty good lecturer and could give good examples when you had questions. 4 midterms, 20 questions each, each worth 10% of grade. There are practice exams for them so if you do those multiple times you will just memorize the question structure and process. Chem is not an easy class but it is not super hard. Lab is annoying. HW super easy.
Attend her lectures 100%, passionate with how she teaches, provides good study materials for exams

Dr. Ricciardo is an amazing professor and person. She really cares about her students and wants them to succeed. I don't think this class is too challenging as long as you put in the work and go to her office hours if you have questions. Her lectures are very organized and easy to understand. Best professor I have had so far.

She is an amazing professor and really helps with the transition between high school and college, she is extremely understanding and helps making sure you understand the material as long as you ask for help 10/10.
Awesome professor. Puts lots of work into her classes. Explains it very well and gives you time to work and ask questions.
She was a good teacher and was very open about asking for help and encouraged studying before and after class.

She is the best chemistry professor I have ever had. Her notes are very organized and well structured. She writes the notes with the class which makes it very engaging. Her lectures are very easy to digest and understand. She gives lots of practice problems and is very caring and friendly!

She is an amazing chemistry professor, probably the best I've had so far. Her midterms are fair and I felt well prepared for them based off the homework, review, and lectures. However, her final for 1206 was relatively difficult and a bit less fair than most of the midterms. Nonetheless, a simple class with a great professor.

Professor Ricciardo was an amazing chemistry professor. She really cares about her students, and was always cheerful and willing to help with absolutely anything during office hours and in-lecture. She gives time in lecture for work session on tough concepts during which she walks around and gives 1 on 1 help. Super engaging lectures, made chem fun

I love Dr. Ricciardo so much and I cannot recommend her enough. She cares so much about her students and makes topics really easy to understand. She has work session days which are extremely helpful, she gives excellent feedback, and accepts late work for full credit which relieves a ton of deadline stress. Overall, she is an amazing professor.

Awesome professor. She genuinely cares for students and often gives advise on how to best learn the material. She also gives full credit for all the late assignments which is amazing. Lab is the only pain and the exams are not easy. Don't fall behind and read the book!!
Professor Ricciardo made gen Chem 1210 bearable. The lectures moved a bit slow but she is a very kind person and the class isn't very hard.

Absolutely loved this professor, she made it a top priority to value students time and energy. She creates lecture videos on each topic discussed to reference outside of class, and was always accessible through email. Great professor with great teaching strategies. This course was adjacent to Chem 1210 and gave me a great head start going in.

I really enjoyed this class! She made me able to understand chemistry and I actually enjoyed it! She is really caring and wants to help her students and is amazing in office hours and in class! She teaches based off of example problems and not conceptual which I was ok with. But she is an amazing professor and I would highly recommend her!!!!

Dr. Ricciardo is an extremely nice person. Very caring and truly wants her students to succeed. Does a great job lecturing math concepts. However, the conceptual based information is lacking in her lectures. Definitely have to use the book to fully understand them. Also, some topics are skipped. Overall, a good professor and and a great person.

Professor Ricciardo was amazing. The content wasn't easy, but she gave many resources to prepare for the exam. She starts classes by thanking students for being there which made the atmosphere so much more supportive. Material was clearly discussed, and she did great at answering questions. I could not imagine a better Chem professor.

Although Chemistry is a very challenging course Professor Ricciardo made it very easy to understand and was always working for the students best interest. There is countless examples of her putting aside her personal life to help students through the use of study sessions for midterms, finals, and general topics.

Dr. R is a bright light in the chemistry department! She uses the flipped classroom model very efficiently and I walked away learning a lot. She makes information accessible, easy to understand, and provides lots of relevant examples. She is very supportive and kind outside of class, too. If you have the chance to take her class, please do!
