Dr. Ricciardo makes great effort to connect with her students. She is a great lecturer and very approachable outside the classroom. Gen chem takes some practice for sure and she does a good job of providing her students with resources to set them up for success in the class as long as they utilize them. Would recommend her or Dr. Fus for chem 100%.

I really enjoyed learning from Professor Ricciardo. You do have a decent amount of homework and the quizzes are fairly long for just a quiz but her lectures are easy to understand. If you need to reach out be ready for a quick and extremely helpful response. Genuinely seems interested in the lives of her students. I would 100% take again.

Ricciardo was not even close to preparing any student for the midterms or tests that were given. She was inconsistent in content and lacked half of the textbook required material. Make sure you are reading on your own or you will be screwed. Midterm 3 is the easiest, followed by Midterm 1, and Midterm 2 is by far the worst.

Dr. R was the best chem teacher that I have ever had. She does a lot of example problems of everything covered in class and makes sure to get good use out of the time spent in lecture. You can also tell she truly cares about her students and is glad to be there. Chem is not a cake walk, but if you put in the work they tell you to, an A is possible.
Dr. R really does care about her students and goes out of her way to make sure they're comfortable with the coursework. Which is a godsend considering how most of us react to chemistry.

I feel like as a lecturer, Dr. Riccardio was often very vague and often over complicated many concepts, which was confusing. Additionally, I missed a lecture due to personal reasons and when I went back to rewatch the lecture, there was no sound to the recording. There were also multiple lectures that weren't posted at all.

Professor Ricciardo genuinely cares about her students and is very accessible outside of class. Chemistry isn't easy but she does a wonderful job helping you create a plan and mastering the first 4 chapters of chem 1210. I learned a great deal in this class and would highly recommend it.

Dr. R shows that she really cares about her students. She teaches the content in a manageable way and gauges her lectures off of student understanding. She is always grateful that students show up to her lectures and continued to be available for her students even when she had other things going on in her life. SHE IS GREAT!

Ricciardo really cares about teaching! Her lectures were really understandable, though problem focused, and she teaches you how to study. I havent taken Chemistry for 3 years and I understood it more than I did in high school. Pre-lecture videos are very helpful.

Dr. Ricciardo did an amazing job teaching in a very careful way. Any misunderstandings from lecture are easily clarified during her office hours and she tries to not overwhelm her students with content after exam days which I liked. Exams were difficult tho.
amazing! she really cares about her students and is a great teacher. she is really good at making people understand chem easily.

Dr. Ricciardo is the best teacher I've had. She is thorough in taking the time for students to understand the content. She is truly passionate about her work and she genuinely cares about her students. Her kindness makes attending class every day truly enjoyable. She makes pre-lecture videos every day which are a lot but really helpful for learning

If you are considering having Dr. Ricciardo for Chem 1210, do it. She is so nice, her lectures are useful and digestible. If you can't make it to class, she records her lectures and posts them. She will give heads up in lecture about what will likely be on the exam as well. Its much easier to get a higher grade in her classs compared to other profs

I love Dr. R, she was the sweetest person ever and really cares about all her students. Gen chem 2 was not my best subject matter, but she definitely goes through the content during lectures so that the material is more accessible to students, although sometimes not to the difficulty of the exams. Definitely a solid choice for Gen chem 2.

I had Dr. Ricciardo for Chem 1100: Chemistry and Society, and it was a very easy GE course. She cares so much for her students and is very thorough in her teaching. She gives great feedback on assignments and makes her goals for us clear.

Professor Riccardo was an amazing person, and a really great teacher. This class is flipped so you do all the content and reading before class and only do practice problems during class. However, the questions done in lecture are absolutely no match for the questions on the exam. Also you don't learn anything conceptually.

Dr.R is one of the best professors I've had. She really cares about her students and teaching. The OSU Chem Department isn't the best and the tests are really challenging but she is really dedicated to helping her students. Consistent Mastering Chemistry homework but not excessive.

Rebecca is a fantastic professor. She communicates material clearly and is always willing to help. This class was a breeze, with a few in depth assignments but no midterm -- biweekly quizzes. She is super nice and seems like a very down to earth person.
It's chem so it's hard, but she is the sweetest and most kind prof I have ever had. Super helpful and super caring. She does a good job of working through problems in class.

Amazing professor with a heart of goal and genuine passion for teaching chemistry. She is sweet and personal and her love for her students makes learning Chemistry fun. She walks you through problems and inspires her class through positive reinforcement. It's just obvious Dr. Ricciardo cares.

The BEST professor I've ever had. I look forward to lecture, she's willing to meet with you outside of class. She's one of the few chem profs who genuinely cares about your success. Makes a hard class fun and delivers content clearly

The best chem professor at OSU. Caring, accessible, very helpful. Genuinely wants to make chemistry accessible to all students. Does lots of practice in class. I cannot speak highly enough of her. A gem.

I liked her, but that was because her teaching style matched my learning style. You have notes before class that you discuss in class as well as guided practice. My only problem was that sometimes I felt the tests were graded too harshly, there wasn't enough time to complete them, and you didn't get to look back. Homework was fair, too.

Dr. Ricciardo has been my favorite professor by far. She sent out lecture videos before lecture as homework, and then go over practice problems in the actual lecture. This approach, although very different, has been by far the best for me. Very accesible, I reached out to her and heard back within a day. I genuinely loved learning in her class.

I had this professor for zoom lectures in chem and honestly she was so great! You'd watch short videos of the content before class, and then she would do a lot of step by step problems during class time. It felt like a flipped classroom, but it was super helpful for me. She was super sweet and I wish I could have her again for spring semester.

This semester we had a hybrid-style of learning in which lectures were done through zoom and some labs were done in person. To make lecture time more efficient, Ricciardo assigned us prelectures in which we learned the class content before class and then learned how to apply the concepts during lecture. It was asynchronous and very helpfu.

The Ohio States chem department is trash and we all know this, however Dr. Ricciardo is not. She makes good use of in class time and is always available outside of class for extra help. Chemistry is a hard subject for me so I cant really discuss the difficulty. But the exams are hard because you have to do one question at a time and cant go back.
Doesnt prepare for exams at all. Teaches basic concepts that cannot be applied to exams because theres such a contrast in the difficulties.

The class was easy enough, but there was a lot of busy work. I didnt really use the textbook but you have to buy it because it comes with Sapling Learning that is used for homework ($80). Also, it was annoying that she dropped grades after everything was finished for the semester bc grades were inputted into Carmen wrong.

this class was so stupid. It was pretty easy but just so much busy work that was so irrelevant to what we were doing. also the professor barely does any actual teaching. cant stress enough how stupid all the assignments were. really annoying for an online class.

Dr. R was a great professor who genuinely cared about all of her students and their success. She chooses main parts of units to go over in class, and expects you to have a general knowledge based on the reading and online homework. Her office hours were a great resource, although a lot of times they would be cut short due to meetings, so go early!

If you have the opportunity to take Dr. R, do it! She is very motivating and believes in all of her students! The class itself is very easy if you have a strong background in chemistry. I've never met such a caring woman, and she is very knowledgeable in chemistry. She has great teaching style as well.

She's a very nice professor who cares about her students, but her lectures don't make 1210 any easier. Be prepared to put in work throughout the semester and go to class, the lectures still do help. Hard class but if you try enough, you'll get through it.

She posts nice inspo quotes on each lecture that are very nice. She is always thoroughly explaining any questions that arise during class & is patient with students. However, she does not prepare you for the level of difficulty of the exams. She never recovers important or difficult concepts and is never available outside of class.

Ricciardo is a GEM of a woman. She is extremely passionate about chemistry but very good at bringing it down to a level that is understandable. She reminds me alot of a high school teacher and is very nice and understanding. Go to her office hours, unlike the rest of the OSU chem department she wants you to succeed.

Very good professor. However, she does not prepare her students for exam materials. There Will often be material on exams that she did not cover thoroughly in lecture. She is also not accessible outside of class. I scheduled several meetings with here and she did not show up. Read the book and work the problems in the back of the text to pass.

Rebecca was a good professor, however she did little teaching. There are many assignments, which is nice, but the weight of the assignments didn't seem fair. If you do poorly on one, it brings your grade down quite a bit, but doing well didn't seem to positively affect the grade at all. Overall, good professor but could be better.

Dr. Ricciardo is great! I took the online Chem and Society class and it was actually really interesting. Organized really well and you are able to do things on your own time. Each module usually has a few readings and questions to answer, a discussion post, and a 10 point quiz at the end. Very doable and the expectations were clear!

seriously the best professor at osu. I'm retaking chem 1220 and I'm so glad i switched my schedule around to take it with her. She is not only a great professor, but she genuinely cares about her students and wants to know whats going on in their lives. She'll even set up online office hours. Honestly the only professor worth taking 8 ams with

Dr. Ricciardo is an amazing professor. I really struggle with chem so I was super nervous coming into 1220 but her lectures are great and she gives actually useful studying tips and advice. She is even willing to spend time with you and develop a personal study plan. It is chem so you have to put the work in, but you're not alone.

Ricciardo is the BEST! As a student with a major pet peeve for unorganized professors, I was highly pleased with the way she laid everything out for us from the beginning. She makes it clear how to get an A and wants her students to succeed, but you will have to put in the work. But beware, her averages were high and there was no curve at the end

Dr. Ricciardo's lectures are clear and easy to understand. If you do not understand something, definitely go up to her after class and ask questions. She is very approachable and genuinely cares about her students. Do not skip lecture! She does sample problems that are very similar to the ones on the exams. One of the best chem profs at OSU.

Best lecturer I could have ever hoped for! She engages the huge lecture in in-class activities/calculations and really cares about her students. She lays things out simply, let's students know where to relearn things they've forgotten, and never goes too fast. No denying this is a very hard class, but she is truly a teacher, not just a chemist!

Dr. Ricciardo is just amazing! She is great as a person, and great as a lecturer. I took chem 1220 before and got a C. I retook it with Dr. Ricciardo, I got an A. She is very very helpful and make chemistry so much easier to understand. Her tests are fair. Do the homework and the recitation activities and you will get A-B range on the exam.

Not my favorite class for many reasons, none of which relate to Dr. Ricciardo's teaching.  She was very nice, clear, and helpful.  I appreciated that she would walk around and talk with students before class and kept lectures very interactive.

Very nice professor! I do not like chem but Dr. Ricciardo made it much more bearable! We had time to work through problems on our own during lecture which I liked & recitation  is easy attendance so go to them! The  only complaint I have is that her exams are a bit harder than her practice exams. Ask for help when you need it and you will be fine.
Nicest chem professor I have had. Her office hours are extremely helpful. Warning don't rely on a curve in her class.

Any chem class is going to be hell ,  but Ricciardo is definitely the way to go! Required course for my major and it's not my favorite to say the least, but I sat in the front row and she made lectures bearable and clear. Though her math-teaching was very watered down, she made sure you knew all the conceptual stuff. Willing to help you if you ask

Dr. R is amazing. She is very clear in lecture. I had to read the book for 1210 but with her it was straight forward as long as I went to lecture. Her demos and videos are entertaining as well. Her practice exams do not really reflect her exams. They are a little bit more easy than the actual tests. Do the homework and study everything.

She is a very good conceptual teacher that helps you better your knowledge of the subject. However, she does not go through math questions thoroughly in lecture. Also she goes super quick in lecture and is hard to understand at times. Overall, she was better than my 1210 prof and I would take her class again.

Dr. Ricciardo is the perfect teacher for an introductory CHEM class because she makes it enjoyable! While almost all of the topics in 1220 were covered in AP Chem (I watched Breaking Bad during class) she had lots of experiments, quotes, surveys, and examples that made the lectures engaging even for those who have seen the stuff before.

Dr Ricciardo was awesome.  She really cares about the students and making sure they understand everything clearly.  She is very much a people-person, unlike some of the other chem professors.  She also gives out candy for participating in class.

I was very disappointed when I took this class. It was basically just notes that she read that she seemed to not understand herself. Relied to heavily on Mastering Chemistry to teach sections of the class. Exams weren't like the homework. She puts up powerpoints to try at home but doesn't give answer so you never know if you're doing it correctly.

She is by far the worst chem prof I've had at OSU. She doesn't teach merely reads notes to you. She rarely gives the examples to math problems that would actually be beneficial and help the students on the exams. She relies on mastering chemistry too much. All in all, if I were you I'd spare myself and switch teachers.

Very good at simplifying often complex material by rephrasing concepts in the book to make them seem much less daunting. She is always willing to help if you ask--she seems to genuinely care and wants her students to do well. Best professor I have had so far in my 3 years at Ohio State! Definitely recommend her :)
Dr. Ricciardo is a great teacher. Really cool, laid back...exams were fair - if you studied hard. She's enthusiastic about learning too
Very helpful and nice, willing to help students during her office hours. Quizzes and tests follow her notes, so attendance is pretty mandatory.

She was a pretty good teacher, I liked her. She handed out candy and other goodies to students that bothered to come to lecture. While I vastly prefer Dr. Stoltzfus as a Chem 123 instructor, I did not pass his class... I'd say Ricciardo's version of the course is a bit easier. Well, easy as genchem at OSU can be...
Really disappointed in this professor solely based on comments from this site. I knew the class would be challenging but I felt the exams were more ridiculous than those I saw in 122.

Ricciardo is very nice and very helpful. Her notes make sense and she does practice problems for every variety of problem, including labs. Her exams and quizzes are based closely off her notes. The book is not needed to fully grasp the material. It wasn't easy, but it was much better than 122.
She's a really nice professor, really young. No use of the book - all practice problems are made by her. Lecture notes are incredibly important for quizzes and exams. Not too hard, but not too easy.
Very friendly, but her teaching skills are very sub par.

Dr. Ricciardo was the best prof. I've ever had in the sciences at Ohio State. She is ALWAYS willing to help, and as long as you actually do problem sets and study for each quiz/midterm, you'll be fine. She goes by the book pretty carefully, but makes it fun and interesting, too. Not an "easy" prof, but she's a good one. Very personal/enthusiastic.
Made a boring class fun and exciting.  Very good Prof.

Worst professor ever. She reads her notes to the class instead of actually teaching and explaining the material to us, she relied way too much on Dr. Fus's old stuff (she is new, and she used to be his t.a); half of our second midterm were questions from his (how is that fair, we are not in his class)!  Take someone else, you'll thank me later.

summary_comment: Dr. Ward is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching skills, making complex chemistry concepts accessible and engaging. Students appreciate her clear explanations, supportive attitude, and willingness to help, despite the challenging nature of general chemistry. Her lectures are well-organized, often recorded, and supplemented with useful study materials, contributing to a positive learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Ward was great! Her lectures were very easy to understand and attendance was not mandatory. The course is still difficult as it is gen chem, but having her made it so much better.
Best chemistry teacher at osu next to nguyen, her lectures are fun and she makes chemistry very digestible. Fantastic teacher.

I love Dr.Ward and her lectures! She always came to class with a great attitude and you can tell she cared a lot about chemistry and her students doing well. Exams are worth about 60% of the grade but they're very manageable if you prepare! Take chem with her for sure!

Dr. Ward is an amazing professor in a class that is very challenging. Attendance is not mandatory and the lectures are recorded which was really helpful to go back and rewatch. She is truly one of the best professors at Ohio State. She cares for her students and understands that you have a life outside of chemistry. She's truly the best!

Dr. Ward is one of the best lecturers I've had so far. She packs a lot of information into the lectures but explains confusing concepts in a very understandable way, in addition to plenty of practice problems. She doesn't write the exams, so sometimes the wording is confusing to the point that the coordinators need to give extra points back.

Dr. Ward is an extremely knowledgable teacher and is always there to help. She goes a bit fast in the lectures but you can tell she's actually passionate about what she teaches. She gives useful materials like annotated study guides and practice tests, and is thorough when explaining things even through email.
Probably the most interesting professor I have had this year. Is very lenient on absences and personal issues. Clear instructions and a good attitude on student learning.

Dr. Ward is a great professor who makes all the concepts super interesting. She really wants her students to succeed and makes chemistry accessible for everyone! I would recommend her to anyone taking gen chem, makes me want to take more chemistry courses
Amazing lecturer.

I really did love having Ward as a prof. I thought she was super easy to understand and tried to present things in multiple ways so that you could really grasp it. She assigned homework as a completion grade and allowed for unlimited tries. Overall I thought she was really good and I would definitely recommend her as a prof.

GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS, she explains stuff so well over there. A funny teacher that makes class interactive. You will enjoy her class like I did. Read the e-textbook and use the practice problems to help with succeeding in exams.

Dr. Ward is the best professor I've had at OSU so far. I switched my major to chemistry after taking her course. She cares deeply about her students and is very understanding. Her course is very interesting, 10/10 would reccomend.
Engaging lectures with many practice problems. Very accessible outside of class and always willing to help.

I genuinely love Dr. Ward. She is always so accessible outside of class and you can tell she loves what she does. She makes information easy to understand and gives us a lot of practice problems. Definitely take this class with her if you can!

Dr. Ward was a fantastic instructor! Her lectures were very engaging, and she often tried to relate chemistry topics to real world scenarios which made the content a lot more bearable. Her slides were also very well done, and she captured what was tested for on each midterm very well. Highly recommend taking 1220 with her or Dr. N!

Great professor that knows her stuff! Practice tests were super helpful and I found that her lectures matched every exam pretty well. Was also super accessible outside of class (via after class, emails or office hours) and genuinely cares for students. If you were to take Chem 1220 I would 100000% recommend taking Dr. Ward's class.
Took chem1220 as a freshman and Prof Ward was great and all her lectures were recorded and on canvas

She was amazing! Lectures were brutal at 8 am but she kept everything interesting and is honestly a great person! Chem 1220 is hard in itself but she made it tolerable. Even though she records lectures, I'd recommend going to class because she goes over a lot of practice problems and is always willing to answer questions!

First and foremost, she is a great, empathetic person, which has made her be an amazing lecturer. She is a relatable person and she shares about her life + sees you as a person. Her lectures are fun and she makes it easy to understand things. However, sometimes, she focuses a lot on calculations and not theory, when much of our exams are theory.

One of the best professors I've ever had. She genuinely cares about her students, and her lectures were very interesting. She provides so many resources and opportunities to get help outside of class! Take her for Chem 1220!!

She is new so is still working out what works and what doesnt but she is really kind and wants to help as much as she can, lectures are recroded and posted and she goes through a LOT of example problems which is great. Her mastering hw has as many attemps as you want which is great. Shes a really good teacher to have

Dr. Ward is one of the best professors I have ever had. she genuinely cared about every students success and was incredibly down to earth. 10/10 professor. Gen Chem 2 can obviously be a hard class, but she made the class easier and was very accessible outside of class. Wish she was teaching OChem next semester.

Honestly, she is the BEST professor you could possibly have for CHEM 2. She truly cares and goes above and beyond to help you out. She even makes annotated supplemental sheets to review before the exam with a lot of helpful notes on how and when to use supplamental exam info. She is also hilarious and I wish she taught Organic lol. Take her class!

Dr Ward walked into Ohio State with a BANG!! She is probably one of the best professors I have ever had. Her lectures are so easy to follow plus she makes them so much easier to understand the criteria. On top of that, her office hours helps out so much because she is so caring towards her students that are there. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
She is great, the semester isn't over yet but She has great lectures.

One of the best Gen-Chem professors at Ohio State. The only issue I have is that she often doesn't use sigfigs in her lectures which can lead to confusion when learning how logging H^+ molarities can affect decimal points, for example. But trust me, if that is the only negative thing, she is fantastic. It's a tough class but she makes it enjoyable!

I LOVE HER. 1 homework weekly and no actual due date for these assignments. Receive 100% for completing the homework. Just like any other Chem class but her lectures + recorded videos + resources make it go a little more smoothly. HIGHLY recommend.

summary_comment: Dr. Callam is highly regarded by many students as one of the best professors at Ohio State, particularly for Organic Chemistry, known for his accessibility, clear teaching, and genuine care for student success. However, some find his exams challenging and inconsistent with his lecture material, suggesting a steep learning curve despite his efforts to support students.

Ratings.comment: It's halfway through the semester and Dr. Callam has been wonderful! He responded to my email 2 minutes after I sent it to him on a night so he deserves a 5/5 no questions asked. One of the best professors I have had by far!

Hands down THE best professor at OSU! Ochem is a notoriously difficult class and he has cracked the code of teaching it. Dr. Callam is always ready to help and is incredibly knowledgeable. GO TO OFFICE HOURS (he has many throughout the week)! If your intentions are to actually learn ochem, you absolutely will.

Dr. Callam is literally the best professor ever - everyone should take him for ochem. He teaches with clarity, is easily accessible, and clearly cares about the success of his students and single-handedly made ochem my favorite class I have taken. Yes, ochem is a hard class, but if you put in the work, you will absolutely end up succeeding!!
Chris Callam is the Jack Sawyer of the Ohio State University chemistry department.

O Chem Lab was so hard mostly due to his unnecessarily difficult tests. He provides lots of material, but even when you feel like you understand the lectures, you still fail the tests. I would recommend going to the TA's office hours before your lab each week, that is truly the only thing that saved my grade.

Great office hours availability. Exams are all written response but there are inconsistencies in his partial credit and discouraged students from asking for a regrade due to it. Past exams and his old covid lecture videos are the greatest resource. Places a couple of extremely hard time waster questions on exams so good test taking strategy is key.

Dr. Callam is a cool guy. His lectures are very useful and he certainly gives you the tools to succeed. His exams are brutal, but the info he provides you is still enough to work through any problem. Certainly willing to help students out too. While this class undeniably is hard, he presents information in a way that makes it easier to break down.

Dr. Callum is hands down one of the worst professors I've ever had. His quizzes and tests are a complete joke, and he waits until the last possible second to enter grades, leaving you stressed out during finals week trying to figure out where you stand. Avoid taking organic chemistry lab with him unless you enjoy being miserable all semester.
Only person in the chem department who I feel isn't actively trying to weed students out
It is a super tough class BUT Callum is amazing. Go to his office hours, it will help so much. He understands it is a tough subject, but truly wants his students to succeed.

Organic chemistry is tough, but the professor does a great job explaining the material. Attend lectures, use the provided resources, and try unstuckstudy AI for study prep - it really helped me stay on top of the content.
GOAT

The TA's are told to grade very hard, but as a lecturer Callam is great. He will walk you through any homework assignment as long as you have already attempted it once and can explain what you tried. Despite having him basically give me answers for the hw, I almost never got 100% on the assignments bc the TAs grade so harsh.
Hes awesome, take his class.

dr. callam is the best professor you could have for ochem. he moves fast but his office hours are a gamechanger. he cares and he really knows his stuff. if you want to do well, you have to go to lecture. you will not learn ochem on your own

Even though I didn't get the grade I wanted in this class, Callam is a good professor. He has a good and interesting lecture that's engaging and high-energy for the material. Most important thing is to not get behind, it's hard to cram for a class like his. Would definitely take again.

Best professor for this class hands down. Ochem is hard & time consuming but go to all of his lectures, rewatch the posted lecture videos, do the problem sets, practice quizzes, and practice exams and you are set. He makes himself very available to students and you can tell he truly cares and pushes you to learn. Never get behind in this class

Dr. Callam was by far my favorite professor at OSU. Organic chemistry is hard, but he was always extremely encouraging and helpful in lecture and office hours. He's very down-to-earth and personable as well. His quizzes were basically copies of his sample quizzes, and practice exams were fairly representative of the real ones.

One of the toughest classes I've taken. Although the subject matter itself is difficult the exams were sadistic. It was already hard to understand the content being taught in class, so when the exams tested "outside of the box knowledge" it became pretty difficult. The grades based on only quizzes and exams, leaving little room for error.

I personally loved ochem lab! It was a very tedious and stressful at parts but at the end of the day this was actually enjoyable unlike lecture (*insert that one teacher that shouldn't be employed). It will be stressful and seem like a 4 crd hr. course but the points are broken down over a long period of time so it makes up for it. DLR's strict!!
He's in that Dr. Fus tier - if you can get him, do it. Still a hard class, but you have a good lectures and a LOT of practice to learn the material. As good as you can ask for.

He gives you weekly recitation worksheets that are graded for participation which is super nice. He is very good at making sure you get the big picture-- he ties in concepts from several weeks ago and is super encouraging. Fair grader, just make sure to study like hell for the second midterm-- I didn't.

Although organic chemistry is tough, Dr. Callam was a great lecturer. Finding professors in the chem department here who actually care about their students is difficult and Dr. Callam is one of those professors. His lectures are very well set up and he does a great job of teaching the information. His exams weren't the most difficult but still hard

Very easy to follow in his online lecture portion. The videos are quite long and sometimes hard to get through, but you need every bit of what he says; he gets straight to the point and can apply what he teaches easily if you pay attention. That's not to say you don't need to practice, you definitely do but there are plenty of resources.

his lecturing style is really difficult; he lectures as if everyone already has background knowledge in the class. When you ask him questions, he explains in a very complicated and rushed way. The exams DO NOT reflect what he teaches in class. quizzes and practice sets are way easier than exams. DO NOT TAKE HIM.

Ochem is always going to be a challenging course however, he really made it much easier with the amount of resources he provides. I felt that his office hours were not quite too helpful however, I had consistency meeting him weekly for my questions. He was great with explanation and helping you figure out how to learn the material, don't memorize.

Dr. Callam is great at explaining topics! He also provides lots of practice problems for students to do. His exams are tough, but office hours are super helpful when it's exam week! He also posts his lectures from when he taught the course online and those were very helpful.

I previously took chem 2510 with Baldwin who did flipped classroom which was zero help. I was able to retake chem 2510 with callam and get a B. His exams are hard but fair given how good his lectures are. This is the hardest class at OSU for most people but calm genuinely is your best chance for success.

I was so excited to have Callam, due to past reviews. However, I have been really disappointed with the class. His lectures go by way too fast, and he is very hands-off. The practice material and quizzes are NOWHERE near the level of difficulty of the exams. All but 50 points of your total grade are quizzes and exams, so zero room for error.

Callam is very hard to reach and too hands-off. He gives you practice problems but doesn't explain how he got the answer, and speeds through lectures so you're more worried about keeping up than listening to what he is saying. Zero partial credit and exams are ridiculously hard. If you don't want to end up teaching yourself, take someone else.

Callam is hands down the best prof I've ever had

actually teaches me the material thru lecture. No shortcuts with any "learn the content outside class" crap. 

 intuitively builds upon concepts you already understand 

 ALWAYS answers any questions. Even the dumb ones. 

Even tho we're all dying, he still makes the content feel fun and exciting.

Organic chemistry is a really hard class no matter who you have - but having Callam helps. Very clear lectures that translate well to exams. Provides lots useful study materials. Office hours are very helpful. Just a pleasant person. I messed up my entire schedule to get Callam, and I didn't regret it for a second.

Too hands-off. No lectures and constant work on reactions we have never encountered. Unempathetic. Overrated. The amount of work you have to put in for a 2 credit hour course is completely ridiculous. Instructions are vague and rubrics are unpredictable and way harsher than instructions.

Dr. Callam is the best at everything he does. Had him for 2510, 2540, and 2550 (wish I had him for 2520) and got an A in each class and actually enjoyed learning from him. Would not recommend anyone more highly to teach such difficult material. Man is a genius that explains at an understandable level.
Dr. Callam is really kind and responds to emails quickly when you have questions. He tries to keep the information fun and breaks it down into bite-size pieces so you understand better.

I tend to be very critical of professors, but this guy earned my respect. Crystal clear communication, legitimately cares about students, and his exams - albeit difficult - are not insane if you really know your stuff. Good choice for Ochem lab 2.

Dr. Callam is one of the best professors I have ever had. This class is really hard and takes a lot of time regardless of your professor. However, Dr. Callam is extremely clear about what he wants and expects from you on quizzes and exams. If you complete his practice problems/quizzes/exams you'll do great. Take him!!!!

Definitely take ochem 1 lab while taking ochem 2. Online the class was not bad at all. Labs were long but TA was so helpful. Lectures were decent callam is a good teacher. Ochem is a hard topic but hes the best at teaching it.
Dr. Callam was a great lecturer, but his exams were ridiculously difficult. They did not reflect the difficulty of quizzes or practice problems.

The class honestly wasn't that bad, I just didn't put in enough time. Lectures were very clear and helpful, but there's lots of them so be sure to stay on top of things. Callam was very kind and understanding when I had some lab issues, seriously nice guy. Quizzes and the final were extremely fair. Put in the work and you can definitely do well.
If you have to take Dr. Callam during the pandemic, he's a pretty solid choice. All of the lectures were asynchronous which was very helpful since all of my other classes were not.

Dr. Callam is the best teacher I've ever had, and he did so well at teaching online. It's not easy to do that. He makes such an impossible subject seem doable because he is that good at explaining things. Do all optional work, don't read the school textbook, and read Ochem For Dummies I. Also, go to his office hours even if you don't have any Q's.

Dr. Callam has been an amazing teacher, and I look forward to taking 2550 with him next semester. Dr. Callam cares about his students deeply, is willing to help you at any time, is very approachable, and definitely knows organic chemistry! Yes, o chem is freaking hard, but put in the work and use him as another resource and you will do fine.

Professor Callam made ochem quite enjoyable. His lectures were concise enough to make them easy to get through, and gave plenty of examples. He has tons of practice resources to prepare for quizzes and exams- take advantage!!

THIS MAN IS THE BEST PROFESSOR AT OHIO STATE. He is such a caring, charismatic teacher. Given you have to work extremely hard in his class, he makes it worth it. Smartest man I have ever met. Do all his practice exams and problem sets and understand them! And of course attend all lectures. He is an amazing teacher and an amazing person:)

Dr. Callam's portions of ochem lab lectures were usually very rushed (not his fault...). He did explain things very clearly, but I found that it was often a little too fast. That being said, he gives you plenty of resources to fill in the gaps. He is engaging, but the class is a lot. I would recommend. I took it in Spring 2020.

I usually never write reviews but Dr. Callam is the best teacher I have EVER had. His lectures are amazing and he conveys everything extremely well. He made chemistry my favorite subject and I would 1000% recommend him. He is so nice and more than willing to go out of his way to help his students. Plus his notes on the board are literal art
Very hard class, but he is a great professor who wants all to succeed.

Dr. Callam rocked this course in terms of concepts for lab. This course is more reaction heavy than ochem lab 1 in my opinion, so it was good to have a professor like Dr. Callam teaching who was amazing at breaking it down to understand in a relatively short period of time. He was also always willing to talk outside of class if I didn't understand.

Dr. Callam is amazing. He's so funny and charismatic when he gives his lectures. He's also extremely helpful when seen outside of class at office hours. This class is not "easy", but Dr. Callam tries his best to make sure you succeed if you're willing to show him that you will put in the work. He's really the best.

Gives decent lectures but will intentionally leave details out in an attempt to make going to office hours or seeking outside help mandatory. Assignments are often graded harshly and overall there is little room for error in the class. Just hope you land a decent TA.

I had Callam for both 2510 and 2540. He is an excellent professor for both courses and a very entertaining lecturer. He gave us many problems to practice and was very clear about the material we needed to know. Make sure you take advantage of all the practice given to you (I did not and that was my main downfall) as the exams are very tough.

Dr. Callam is one of the best lecturers and professor I have had during my time at tOSU. He clearly goes beyond teaching organic chemistry topics in a textbook like manner and includes various examples to make the class more interesting. However, the class is very difficult as he mentions several times. Go to office hours!

Love him!!! Lectures are really informative but takes a while to get used to the speed of his writing and talking, I appreciate that he writes everything. Exams are difficult but are doable if you work hard and do ALL the practice. He can come off as hard to approach but once you get to know him he really goes above and beyond to help you succeed.

Best prof I've ever had. Exams and content are challenging (as to be expected), but you will come out of this class with a new appreciation for chemistry that gen-chem stripped out of you. Dr. Callam clearly cares about his students and their success. I was dreading taking OChem since I was 15 but can honestly say I enjoyed this class w/ Dr. Callam

Best professor I have ever had. His lectures are amazing and he makes you love ochem (which is hard to do, trust me). He's so funny and incredibly smart. He provides a lot of resources for you to succeed. His test are SUPER hard but if you do the problem sets/practice exams, they're manageable. Would not recommend anyone else, he's the GOAT.

Dr. Callam's one of the best o-chem professors at Ohio State. However, he's also the stereotypical college professor. If you don't get something written down, he's moving on and he talks fast. He deals with different types of spectroscopy, which are then evaluated with quizzes in lab. Overall, it is evident that he knows what he's talking about.

Dr. Callam might be one of the most unprofessional and rude professors that I have had at my time at OSU. He made me feel as though I couldn't ask questions, and was very judgmental, even when I asked for clarification for certain problems. I recommend avoiding at all costs.

Amazing professor! Makes a really difficult topic interesting to learn about. His test are hard, but his class prepares you for that level of difficulty. Well worth it to take his class. He is by far the best professor I've had at OSU!

Callam is one of the best prof I have ever had, hands down. He teaches the content really really well but for that reason his tests are super hard but if you actually pay attention in lecture and do what you should be doing, the tests are totally doable. You have to work for it, but Dallam helps every step along the way!

Probably the best professor I've had at OSU so far. Callam is a genius and a great teacher, he really helps you understand the material with his very thorough lectures and practice problems. Exams were really tough, but the quizzes were fine so it kind of balances out. Definitely do the problem sets and practice exams.

Dr. Callam is one of the best professors I have had at OSU! Super knowledgable and willing to help, especially if you go to office hours. Organic 2 lab is generally a little bit more difficult than the first, but definitely still manageable.

Dr. Callam has been one of my favorite science professors so far. He explains concepts in great details and covers important material more than once. The quizzes were pretty fair if you actually attended lecture. He's also really accessible if you are unable to attend his office hours. I highly recommend taking him for O-Chem!

BEST PROFESSOR EVER! I LOVE DR. CALLAM. He is a real gem. His exams were hard but he is really cool and makes you love O chem (no joke). Take with him. I don't know what else to say. Definition AWESOME. such a beautiful human being

BEST teacher I've ever had. He's hilarious, lectures are fun, and he explains everything so well, he's perfect. Book is pointless but don't skip class, do all the problem sets, old exams/quizzes, and go to office hours. It's a lot of work but he will go above and beyond to help you. Callam is a genius, no doubt he will change the world one day.
A great professor. The best option for any o-chem class. He posts his notes on carmen and gives students plenty of resources to learn/study from.

Dr. Callam is great. The lectures are clear and informative, and interesting for the most part (as much as chemistry can be interesting). OChem Lab is a tough course, and honestly your TA can make or break your grade, but Callam himself is very helpful. The exam is tough, but he offers a lot of material to help you prepare.
Callam is a real gem. He's funny, draws perfect hexagons, and has never made a mistake on paper. Callam is very good at explaining things because he anticipates what students are thinking.

He is without a doubt the best professor I have ever had. He did an amazing job of explaining the material in an interesting way. Definitely recommend going to lecture because he lets you know everything that it important to know for the tests. Do the problem sets and old exams that he posts online because those are most like his exam questions.

Callams the best prof at OSU and he prepares you extremely well for exams and makes a hard subject super interesting. The material itself isnt hard and with practice, a good grade is definitely achievable.

Dr. Callam is really great. He cares about students. His lectures are clear and he gives great resources for studying. However, o chem is very hard and his exams are 2 hrs long & very difficult. He combines several concepts into 1 problem. I'm going to retake the class because I'm not happy with my grade. Requires lots of practice outside of class

I love Dr. Callam! His class is not easy by any means but he gives you tons of practice problems and old exams to study from. He is very helpful in office hours so go and ask questions. His exams are very challenging but if you prepare enough ahead of time, you will be fine. Curve was nice.

Very smart guy and a great professor. The course itself has an annoying amount of work for a 2 credit class, and it's very easy to miss a deadline for an assignment. But it's ochem, so what else would you expect. Regardless, him and Dr. Paul are great characters and are awesome to talk to. They make the notorious ochem much more bearable.

Was definitely a very difficult class but I would never take it with anyone else. A truly amazing teacher who cared about his students, and definitely my favorite professor I've had at OSU. Hilarious, well organized, overall great. It's a challenge, but I loved it and he made the course manageable.

He is the best. Can't wait for 2550 with him. He is a great lecturer and really breaks things down so they are easier to understand. The midterm is kinda tough but the final is a huge opportunity for bonus points. Definitely not a tough class if you pay attention and study.

Dr. Callam basically played bad cop and taught the spectroscopy part of the class which is a hard topic to teach. He did his best and used as many examples as possible. But he's not a very accessible lecturer.

Daddy Callam is such a gem and let it be known that this is the first time I have enjoyed and genuinely learned from a chemistry professor. His lectures are loaded with information so you def can't skip but he makes learning fun! He's funny, kind and really approachable. Also, he's always willing to meet one-on-one to make sure you're understanding
Dr. Callam is a great O Chem teacher. I definitely recommend him. Love him loads.

I struggled in gen chem, but Dr. Callam made ochem fun for me. He is really good at explaining what is going on and provides so many materials for you to practice. While its not an easy class and I study basically every day, Ive definitely learned from him. His midterms aren't impossible if you put in the work. I recommend

Callam is a great professor and very smart. His humor is one of his best attributes. If you go to lecture, take good notes and study, there is no reason you cannot do well in this class. The O-chem textbook is also extremely helpful. His tests are very hard if you skip class, but can be easy if you study your notes and do all the problem sets.

Dr. Callam is a good professor, but he teaches so many things that you don't need to know unless you plan on getting a PhD in chemistry. If you just want to do well, take another professor, who will have less tough exams.

The lectures are interesting and he is great at responding to emails. There's also a lot of resources provided by him so that you can practice outside of class. The quizzes and midterms are always harder than the practice, but that's the point. It's the only way to know if you truly understand the material.

As usual, Dr. Callam is the most brilliant. Personally, 2520 was a lot easier than 2510. Almost an easy A. Just make sure to pay attention in lecture, do the problem sets and the practice exams--and go to office hours so you can ask your questions. This class was amazing!

Callam is well-respected in whatever he teaches. With Dr. Paul, the two did a fantastic job of teaching the class. I learned a lot and surprisingly had fun along the way in what I expected to be a lot tougher of a course.

Dr. Callam is one of the best chem professors at OSU. Dr. Callam's tests are difficult but he goes over concepts and mechanisms well in class. Nothing on his exams are something he hasn't gone over and they are all completely fair. There's a lot of practice material he gives you and he really cares about his students!!

Dr. Callam was a great professor. He gives you plenty of practice problems including exams and quizzes from previous years. The current exams and quizzes were very similar to the practice. Take Dr. Callam, do the practice, and you will succeed. Don't fall into the trap of thinking Ochem is too difficult.
If you are taking OChem it's going to be hard, no matter what professor. You might as well take one of the best professor at OSU.
Dr. Callam is one of the best professors at Ohio State. You can tell he really cares about his students. Pro tip: try not to be too intimidated by him, hes really nice if you actually talk to him!
Almost no work, but pay attention in lecture or you will find yourself not knowing how to do the unknowns 2 days before the midterm/final.

Provides you with all the material you need to succeed in the course. I never knew the definition of hard work until this class. After putting 12-15 hours a week into the class (plus more during exam weeks), I finally figured out how to do well. Callam will help you in office hours (GO TO THEM) but come prepared to learn, not just get answers.

Dr. Callam is far and away the best instructor I've had the pleasure of learning from. He knows the material he teaches better than any other professor I've taken. Lectures move at a fast to sometimes feverish pace, but they are always very clear. Take good notes and, you will not need the book. If you have to take Ochem, you for sure want Callam.

Dr. Callam is an amazing professor. He is by far the best professor I have ever had, as well as one of the coolest people I've met. His exams are difficult, but he fully prepares you for them. You never need to read the book; he supplies you with all the practice that you need. He is  great to talk to during office hours, and is extremely helpful.

Dr. Callam is the best science professor at OSU. He makes a hard class really enjoyable. He is great at explaining all the material in a way that you will understand.  Definitely do ALL the practice problems, quizzes, and exams. He is genuinely nice and really cares about his students. Don't be afraid to ask questions and go to office hours.

Amazing professor. He's a really tough professor but you learn so much. He gives you a ton of materials to succeed in his class and I recommend you do ALL of them! Do all of the previous quizzes he posts and the weekly quizzes will be really easy. Do all of the practice exams and GO TO OFFICE HOURS! Curve was amazing - went from a C to a B.

OChem lab II midterm is harder than lab I but if worked hard, passing won't be a problem.  Spectroscopy quizzes will be there so master it. Both Dr. Callam and Paul are great help for passing this class.

Simply the best. Excellent lecturer- I barely touched the book. Very difficult exams; you have to do all the practice problems (he gives you a ton) and go to office hours regularly to ask questions. Dr. Callam is really funny, really caring and it feels like he knows everything. I love him and couldn't ask for anyone better.  Decent curve too.

Callam is absolutely the best professor I've ever had. His lectures are incredibly clear and he makes learning OChem as simple as it can possibly be. His exams are difficult for sure. You'll have to study a lot but he gives you TONS of practice for every topic. 100% recommend, he's a great guy in and out of class. TAKE CALLAM!

Dr Callam was one of the best teachers I ever had. He teaches o chem in a way that college students understand, and makes lectures as interesting as a chem lecture can be. He teaches you everything you will need to know, but tests are still very challenging. He really makes you work for your grade. Worth it though.

Arguably the greatest science professor at Ohio State. He's a genius and amazing at teaching you organic chemistry. The exams are extremely hard, so you cannot wing anything in this class. You'll have to work 5 days a week and it'll really make your hairs turn grey.

Dr. Callam was absolutely my favorite professor at OSU. Not only is he a genius, but he's able to explain it in a way that makes sense to struggling, stressed out pre-meds. He was always available to work out kinks in understanding. The exams are difficult, not going to play that down, but do the practice problems, they help a lot.
Best teacher I have ever had. He cares so much about his students, and even if he is super hard, he insures that you understand the material and will go out of his way to meet with you

By far best professor I have had in my life. He is very accessible, personable, funny, and inspirational. He goes above and beyond to help his students out. His tests can be difficult but he really prepares you. If you are premed, TAKE CALLAM. Great lecturer, great in office hours, and great in lab.

Dr. Callam is by far my favorite professor I have ever had. He is very willing to help his students and truly wants them to succeed. He is willing to meet outside of class and opens his office hours early. Do the problem sets, practice quizzes and go to class. If possible hit up office hours. Very personable. Very funny. Makes O chem enjoyable.

The best. I despised gen chem and was dreading O chem... but Dr. Callam is a fantastic professor and I actually look forward to his lectures. He is great at explaining the material and throws in comic relief... good at keeping students motivated, helpful in office hours. Exams are not easy but he gives plenty of practice material to prepare you.

I have Dr. Callam and Dr. Paul for the OChem 1 Lab and they is great. You can tell that they both are interested in what they are teaching and wants to see their students succeed. I don't think class is mandatory because they post their notes online, but Dr. Callam is a smoke so why not.

I found it tough to pay attention in class simply because we had no required tests or quizzes that I had to know the material for until the very end of the class. Basically your entire grade is based on the test at the end, no matter how well you do in lab.  That being said Dr. Callam is a great lecturer who explains the necessary concepts well.
Incredibly intelligent. Very friendly and approachable.

Dr.  Callam was by far the best professor I've had at OSU so far. For a subject everyone dreads he makes it so much more enjoyable. I loved going to lecture (and I don't love chemistry people)! He gives you so much practice and explains things very clearly so you can understand them. Hard subject, fantastic teacher!

I have taken Ochem twice and the first time I took it was with Callam. He is a great professor and is willing to help but I must warn you. If you are not a strong chem student or you know you struggle with harder classes, do NOT take him. I learned a lot from him but I struggled a lot b/c he expects students to know the information back to front.

Callam is a genius. I say that because he knows the material extremely well but he also teaches it extremely well. He is super clear. He gives you a TON of practice material (practice problems, quizzes, old exams) and if you have time, do it all because it is exactly what his exams will look like. O chem is tough, no doubt, but Callam is incredible

Dr. Callam is an amazing professor and person. He makes a dreaded class enjoyable. Definitely my favorite class at OSU so far. Tests are hard but doable if you use all of the resources he gives. Go to his office hours as often as you can. Get ready to work extremely hard, but if you do all of the problem sets and practice you will be successful.
He's an amazing professor, but his tests are extremely difficult.
two midterms, and a final. 6 quizzes. everything is doable if you practice all the old quizzes, old midterms and problems sets. With hard work and a willingness to ask for help you can do good.

Callam was by far the best professor I've had at OSU, especially in the Chem department. His lectures are very clear and he teaches O-chem in a very straightforward and understandable way.  Midterms and exams are tough, but you really learn something in this class

Dr. Callam was a great professor.  His lectures were great and he was crystal clear about everything he was trying to teach us.  He also gave us A TON of practice material, including many old midterms and final exams, which were very helpful for studying.   That said, his tests were tough and getting a good grade took a lot of effort.

Fantastic. He is the best professor for OCHEM. Very tough, has high expectations. However, teaches everything crystal clear, lectures are mentally stimulating. Pretty large curve in the end of the class.  Go to class, and practice everything you can get your hands on and you will be fine. He is a genius, teaching style is fantastic, cares a lot.
Makes OChem very easy to understand. Very clear in his mechanisms. Tests are very difficult, but he truly tests your understanding of the material. Study, work hard, and you'll do well

Great guy and great professor. Although exams are incredibly hard. I have put in so much time and effort into this class, but I'm not even sure if I am going to pass. Learned a lot, but obviously that doesn't get you too far. Good luck.

Dr. Callam is a great professor, but because of that he expects more of you on the exams. He gives you a lot to practice for quizzes and exams, though it never really helped me on the exams. Im pretty sure I failed this class. If I could go back, I wouldn't have taken his class. Great guy though, just teaching an extremely hard class.

Callam is the best teacher I've had so far. His lectures flow very well, he comes prepared. He explains things clearly while still using the important terms and concepts. He posts enough material online that even though I had the book, I only used it once. Will only succeed in this class if you attend lecture and practice problems every day.
Hands down the best professor I have ever had. Brilliant organic chemist, teacher, and mentor. Class is difficult, but extremely rewarding. 10/10 would recommend taking him.
This guy is the MAN. Toughest organic prof here but we're working with pure genius here.

His lectures are very engaging and easy to follow; you just have to show up and pay attention to get the jist of it. But the best part is the sheer multitude of resources he provides: example quizzes and exams from previous years, extra problem sets, reference videos, etc. Everything you need to study is available, and it's essential to study.
he is one of the best professor in OSU

Only 3 weeks in and I love this professor. First day he makes you feel invincible and then he spends the rest of the semester breaking things down and encouraging you to keep working for it. He rocks.   Do the problem sets and practice quizzes.

Dr. Callum was a good professor and was more than willing to help students. That being said, his lab quizzes were often quite difficult and I rarely felt prepared. The final was ridiculously hard! Print out the notes and study early. Go to the TAs as well. They were super helpful for lab report writing and IR Specs.
Simply the best

I had Callam for 2510, 2540, and 2550. He is phenomenal as a professor and as a person. He is exceptionally clear and explains things really well, always pushing you to try harder and challenge yourself. He always answers questions and is very on top of everything (more so than Dr. Paul). Do the work, go to office hours, and you'll be fine.

OChem 2540 is not impossible to pass. Do the labs sincerely following the guidelines. Don't miss the lectures. Overall, work hard and you won't regret taking this class with Dr. Callam. For exam, make sure you know all topics covered throughout the course. Review sheet also helps a lot.

Must take professor on campus. One of the only good and sensible professors left on campus. Enjoyed his class very much and learnt a ton. Also provides great one on help if needed and has regular office hours. Wonderful teacher!
most intelligent and helpful professor.  Clearly coveys complex ideas. understands how to effectively teach organic chemistry
Callam is bomb. TAKE HIS COURSE. You will have to put forth lots of effort, but you will learn a great deal because of it.

Got a B in ochem 1, and I'm lucky. I never went to a single office hr, and I didn't study anywhere as much as I should have. I regret not doing better in his class. Did amazing on the 1st midterm but got 50% (avg) on the 2nd and the final. It was rough. You can't fall behind, even when it's hard. you GOTTA push through. It's tedious, but worth it

He is very smart and does a very good job of passing that knowledge onto you. Tons of practice problems. Expect difficult exams with at least one or more challenge questions that make you apply what you learn. Although its sometimes better just to skip those and make sure you get all the realistically attainable points on the exam. YOU WILL LEARN.

Go to TA hours, and refresh yourself on lab techniques on YouTube if it's been awhile. I personally hated the course, but o. chem material is on graduate examinations, so I took it anyway.  His exams are the worst if you have test anxiety.

Dr. Callam is by far the best professor I've had at Ohio State. He provides so much extra practice to help you study, and his lectures are fantastic. He clearly wants his students to succeed, and if you go to class and study then a good grade is easily attainable. I would definitely recommend taking his class if you can.

Callam is a great professor. He presents the material clearly and concisely. If you show you care and want to succeed he will help you so much. He's super approachable and incredibly smart. You can gain a lot from him. He also provides a ton of extra practice. Utilize it and utilize him for questions and you should be fine.

Super great guy and professor.  Will help you if you put the time and effort into it.  He curved our class so much I don't understand how people can complain.  He cares so much about his students and cares that you understand the material.  Be aware that a lot of people come to office hours.  Definitely my favorite professor so far.

Literally the best professor for the subject. If your going to take an organic chemistry course yes hes probably the hardest but you will learn SOOOOOOO much and might even learn to enjoy it. He is by far the best teacher Ive had to date and I was that kid that sat in the back of the class.

Dr. Callam is by far the best professor at OSU. His lectures are simply amazing. I barely put in any effort outside of class and still got a very high grade in his class. My OChem 2 class makes me miss him already.

Callam was the best professor I've ever had at OSU. He always explained things clearly and made sure he taught in a way his students could understand. Tests were pretty tough, but if you put in the effort, it's not too hard to get an A in his class.
He explained concepts very well. We understood ideas that people in other classes didn't have a clue about.

Dr. Callam is my favorite professor at Ohio State so far. His lectures are so clear that they can give you a false sense of confidence so be careful. He gives out tons of example problems and tests and answers all questions during office hours, which I highly recommend. Another plus is the quizzes, if you prepare for them.

Not going to lie: I worked my butt off in this class. Without a doubt, his exams are some of the hardest I have taken. However, this is the most I've ever learned during any course at OSU or in general, for that matter. He's hard, but he's very fair. I would recommend him to anyone. Just be prepared to put forth your best, every day.

Dr Callam is a smart guy. I think he's the smartest person I've met at OSU yet. This class is usually only taught by Paul and him, so no other professor options are available. But, the midterm is not as hard as in the past. The average was high and unless you kill the other averages, you'll get a B+, like me. Destroy averages and you'll get an A.

Callam comes off as an arrogant guy, but is really down to Earth and willing to help you when in need. I used to email him at midnight at most of the time, would get a very clear response right away. His tests are hard so I would study weeks before. Quizzes are raw points, and he gives so much practice material that the book was useless. TAKE HIM!

Callam is seriously the best o chem professor we have at Ohio State. He should run the whole department. He gives you SO many practice materials for quizzes and exams that there is no way you could end up doing poorly if you focus and get them all done. PLEASE go to lecture, the book is useless and he really knows how to teach!!

Dr. Callam is the best professor I have had at Ohio State.  Great lecturer and gives you all the resources you need to succeed.  If you are willing to put in the time and take hard tests, I'd recommend him.

Callam is a super clear lecturer and is always willing to help his students. If you need help, he will make time for you. His exams are tough, but if you put in the effort a good grade is totally possible. I ended up really enjoying this class that is usually dreaded by many thanks to Dr. Callam!

Callam is perhaps the best professor I have had. He enjoys his job and his students. While he provides you with everything you need to pass, his tests are difficult and require a lot of study time. His office hours and practice exams are really helpful though. His ability to help any student that comes to him amazes me. Great Professor!

Really great professor, gives you all the resources needed to pass you just have to find the time to put it in. Midterms are hard, but he gives you all the resources you need to succeed on them. Very helpful in office hours because sometimes lectures have a lot of material. Really glad I took him.

Dr. Callam and Dr. Paul are nice guys and all, but be prepared to hate your life and have anxiety attacks all the time over a TWO CREDIT HOUR LAB! I do more for my lab course than any other class and severely affects how much time I get to study for the actual Ochem lecture! Might as well sign over your life and sanity when you take this

Easily one of the best professors at OSU; his lectures are crystal clear and he's very willing to help if you do need it. Exams are very difficult but certainly fair if you put in the effort. Just go in with a willingness to learn and managing an A is definitely possible. Don't underestimate how much he will push you to learn and you'll be fine.

Callam is one of the best professors I have ever had. His classes are hard but his lectures are very well structured and he is very knowledgeable. He is also pretty funny and lectures aren't too boring.

Dr. Callam was a really good professor for the o chem lab course. Compared to my CHEM 2510 course, this one was significantly easier. The quizzes each week are easy if you study the material, and the final exam is not as hard as it could be. It's very very fair, so I think anyone can get a good grade.

Dr. Callam is the best professor I've had at OSU. His class is very hard but you learn so much from him. Lectures are a must and his problem sets are also quite useful. If you want to get a proper Organic Chemistry experience, make sure you try to schedule him for 2510.

Callam & Paul are two of best professors at OSU. I am so glad that they teach the OChem labs rather than some other professors. I have learned so much from just listening to their lectures. They are both extremely accessible and friendly in office hours. Anyone that says Callam is "overrated" probably shouldn't have been taking Ochem to begin with

Omg it's so frustrating how overrated this guy is. I'm not saying I dislike him as a person but this class was one of the most frustrating and unfairly graded classes. I was so annoyed because sometimes you don't know what kinds of copious details these people want??? I spent hours everyweek on this class...

Callam is awesome.  He is by far the hardest organic professor, but makes up for it by preparing you the best.  Compared to my roommates in other sections, we had way more difficult exams but way more to prepare from.  I would definitely take him again.  He makes everything really easy, making concepts and mechanisms  much easier to understand.

I feel that Callam is extremely overrated. He is average at best, and not approachable at all. He gives looks of disdain when asked questions after class, and rushed though the material like you wouldn't believe. You could ask him to slow down but he would just give you a dirty look. He was more helpful through email. I had high hopes.

Dr. Callam is the best professor I've had at OSU. He is an excellent lecturer and provides ample resources. His exams are tough but he makes ochem bearable. Challenging, but I would definitely take him again if I had the chance.
Has very hard exams but he definitely gives the resources to do good on them. Best professor I've ever had

Dr. Callam is one of the best professors I have had. He teaches in a very straightforward manner. He takes you from point A to B to C in almost any case. With that being said, his exams are very difficult. You have to study a lot (probably for any professor though) to do good on the exams, but you surely can't blame him for a lack of preparation.
Class is definitely difficult, but Callam is fair and an excellent teacher.

Dr. Callam is by far the best professor I've ever had. His exams are certainly difficult but he gives you all that you need to succeed, it's up to you to step up to the plate. He expects you to learn how to problem solve so if you want to be spoon fed and do rote memorization take someone else :).

Dr. Callam is an amazing professor but his test are extremely difficult. The first midterm is fine but after that, things went downhill. He's really willing to help and he explains everything well but the final tests you on concepts that you haven't really seen. For me even after studying for the final for almost a week, I still did poorly on it.

Learned a crap ton. best teacher but hardest examiner. You have to start studying as soon as he teaches the material to get an A. that is, if youre not a genius person like me! he always helps if you go to him, just dont expect him to come to you, there are 400+ students in all of his classes.

Dr. Callam was a solid professor, but RIDICULOUSLY difficult. The weekly quizzes in lab are not bad, but seeing as you have to do a written report sheet, a narrative of every procedure done during the lab, and actually complete the lab all in 4 hours, the quizzes just add to the time crunch. Make sure to read the lab manual a LOT. Good luck.

Dr. Callam is the best professor OSU (or any university) has to offer. Organic Chemistry is a difficult subject, yet he manages to make it interesting and accessible for all students. Additionally, Dr. Callam is readily available to answer questions via email, at office hours, and before/during/after lectures. Rearrange your schedule to take Callam

Made a beginner's class too difficult to even continue to build interest. Had to drop his class and ended up with another prof that taught the same material in a much clearer and slower pace. Students are memorized by his confidence and intelligence as I was, but he isn't meant to teach

Callam is a decent professor.  He will push your brain to the limits, however.  His exams are very challenging, too.  Just make sure you study and review the lecture materials a lot.  The only really bad thing is that his voice is suuuuper monotonous and hard to listen to for long periods of time.  I fell asleep plenty of times in his class.

Callam is an amazing professor.  Take this class if you actually want to learn organic chemistry.  He's not the easiest, but he really knows his stuff.  The lectures are very organized and he posts a lot of resources on Carmen for you to use.  If you put in the effort, you can get a good grade.  He's very charismatic and my favorite prof by far.
Best Teacher I have ever had. Perfect tests! He makes the exams just one step harder then the examples and hw. If you understand the concepts well you can adapt them to any changes!
He is by far THE best professor I've had at osu...yes he is hard, but not unreasonable. Even though I didn't get the grade I wanted I loved the challenge

I really like him as a teacher, but the material can be quite difficult. The reports take forever and I really recommend going to office hours because you'll need it to understand some of the concept questions.

Callam's lectures for the lab class were much better than Paul's. You will have an endless amount of (pointless) powerpoint slides; save some paper and just bring your computer. 2540 had no quizzes/midterms. The class needs some restructuring. Work load was high for 2 credit hr course.
LOVE Dr. Callam!  He's always willing to help.  Maybe the class is hard, but if you go to the help room once or twice a week, you'll get an A.
I loved chemistry and breezed through every single class until I hit this. I'd say I studied a good 3 hours a day and I'm still in jeopardy of failing. Way too difficult of a professor.
The worst teacher I've had.The worksheets he gives at the beginning of the semester expect you to have prior knowledge in Ochem. I wish I had a different professor.

I am honestly interested in the material and put a lot of hard work into this class only to discover that it does not pay off. Dr. Callam makes an already difficult subject much more difficult than it needs to be. He does not give his students the benefit of the doubt and penalizes heavily for the most menial of mistakes. Avoid if at all possible
Best professor at Ohio state so far. He puts in a lot of time to help students do well, responds to emails quickly, and provides a lot of resources. Overall great teacher.

Avoid this professor.  I had to work hard for his class. He expects you to think "critically" (whatever that means) and actually do work for his class.  I had to study for hours to get a good grade.  He's a terrible professor because he has high expectations and expects you to give 100% for the class.  Avoid him unless you have time to study

BEST ORGANIC CHEMISTRY PROFESSOR EVER!I truly enjoyed his ability and want to help students. Tests and finals were hard but if you go to his office hours, study all the material and ask as many questions as possible, you will do well!

He is the best professor I've had at OSU. Dedicates all of his time to the success of his students. Read the lab manual and be as accurate as possible in lab experiments. Exams or "quizzes" are almost exactly like the practice problems.

Best prof ever. Lectures are crystal clear, mechanisms are written out in detail. The material is pretty easy and the exams are NOT HARD if you do all his practice problems. He's incredibly helpful in office hours, but don't expect any sympathy if you go to whine about how hard ochem is. My TA was a notorious grader, but he curved her section.

I didn't have any problems with Dr. Callam himself some of his TA's though are brutal while some are easy. That however will not break your grade it could only make it because he gives points to sections with low averages. My #1 tip is to be extremely thorough in your labs in every section except procedure and in the procedure follow his format.
Callam is a very good professor, his exams are hard though and you will struggle with them. The labs are way better than the gen chem series though and the TA's are awesome!

Callam is one of the best profs I have ever had. He is very dedicated to helping his students and provides all the necessary tools they need to excel in ochem. I recommend him to anyone wanting to take ochem lec or lab. Do all of the work assigned and you will do fine, and retain a lot of info. Recommend for pre-meds.

He is a great teacher. He is always in his office and more than willing to help. Just make sure to work really hard because his class is very hard. If you do all his practice problems tho you should be fine.

Callam will push you like you've never been pushed before, but in how many other classes can you finish the class with a 57% and get a C? He expects a lot of you, but is really good at being motivating, and you'll definitely learn a lot.
Women love the dude.  Great teacher.  Hard class.

Best teacher I have had at OSU so far. He gives you all the tools you need to succeed and challenges you to use them. He provides tons of practice midterms and problems that makes the class easy to understand. He will also always open his door for a student who is putting in the effort to learn. To get an A just do your work.

Seriously the nicest, most approachable chemistry teacher ever, yes i'm a girl, but there were plenty of boys that came to his office just as much as me, who he was just as nice to. His class isn't hard, it's just a lot of material. He is one of the only professors that actually push you to apply your knowledge instead of just regergitate it.

Had him for 251, 254, and 255.  That said, I think he is a great professor and lecturer, but not such a great person.  He came off very snobby and belittling whenever I would try to ever interact with him 1 on 1 and I would always walk away wondering why I even bothered to ask him or think he would care.  He expects a lot, but you will learn a ton.

Chem 255 was definitely easier than chem 254 although Callam's good lecturing was a constant. He is very good at explaining concepts and is enjoyable to listen to in class.
