If you show you care is does a lot to help you succeed. The only knock against him is he tends to be a bit arrogant (but he's still the best ochem has to offer).
You can call him Chris
Definitely has his favorites. He much harder and more work then it needs to be.  He is veryyyyyy arrogant and will not even look at you while you talk to him!!

Idk what these idiots are talking about. He ignored me every time i was in office hours. If you're not one of the his lovers he will not give you any attention. A TA told me that callam told his TAs not help students so that they will come to him and makes him looks better. He's extremely lazy when it comes to 254.
If you have him for lab I suggest going to office hours and having him check your formal reports.  Good clear lectures.

Without a doubt the best professor i've ever had. The class is difficult but he makes every effort to help you along. He really is approachable and welcoming anytime. He even helps me now in my chem lab classes. Seriously if you are going to take organic chemistry, get callam.

Callam was one of the best professor's I have had at the OSU campus. He is extremely helpful (especially if you go to his office hours) and really enjoys teaching his students. His tests are very hard so study the book, do the problem sets and the homework problems. There is a huge curve at the end so try your best because it will really pay off.

Good teacher who enjoys teaching this class. He gives a lot more of his time to students then most professors so he is extremely helpful. He can seem arrogant to some people but he just wants the points to be clear and not BS his students. I managed to get an A (so its possible) in the class but I did the problem sets and old exams many times.

Really excellent professor: encourages you to ask questions in office hours/lecture, really seems to care about students, gives chalk talks, is excited about teaching. Ochem is difficult and it can be easy to do poorly by making small, dumb mistakes, but the tests are fair and he had plenty of old exams on carmen to help you out :). Good luck!

I had to really bust my a** in this class! I was taking two other upper sciences (baaaad idea). Its almost impossible to get an A, but a B is doable with a whole lot of work. I was putting 40 hrs a week on this class alone. Exams are really tough so brace yourself. He's really arrogant but u get what you need from him and leave. Good luck to all!!!

Callam is not easy by any means. Talking with friends who had other profs, I deff feel more knowledgeable than any of them. Callam really teaches you what you need to know in depth. MUST TAKE if planning on taking MCAT, PCAT, OAT, or DAT. Curve was astronomical b/c tests were hard. He's fair and a great teacher! The ideal college science course

AWESOME PROF!! I learned so much in his class and he is very knowledgeable about Ochem. He could clearly answer any question that I had. I'm taking 254 instead of 245 just so that I can have him again! Take callam and you won't regret it!!!

I love Callam! I was terrified coming into Ochem that I was going to fail, it was going to be really hard, etc. Although it is extremely hard (Who are we kidding its ochem) Callam made it so much better! If you need to take this class make sure you have him as your prof! I love ochem now because of him!
Callam was meant to teach college ochem.  He really cares about his students and will do anything he can to help you succeed.

I had Dr. Callam for Chem 251, 254, 255, and 253H.  He managed to ignite my interest in chemistry and my love for organic.  I spent a lot of time studying, but it was worth it for how much it has helped me with the MCAT and biochem.  If you actually want to know and understand Organic Chemistry, Callam is a great professor.

Dr. Callam may be intimidating and scary to encounter at first, but after you get used to him, you will find out that his organic chemistry teaching skills are far beyond what anyone would have expected out of any professor. STUDY, STUDY, STUDY! He's no easy A at all, so do problem sets and work hard in his class! You will not regret it at the end.
Awesome teacher and great teaching style. Actually understood Chemistry.

I had Dr. Callam for 251/254 and 255 and he was an incredible teacher. 251 sorta blew me away because as much as I studied his exams were really difficult, but the curve in the class is huge. Overall, hes a great teacher and a great guy, I enjoyed just talking to him about random stuff. Hes always there to help students pretty much 24/7

I made sure to take as many OChem classes with Dr. Callam as I could because he is one of the most amazing teachers I've ever had. He has his flaws, but overall he is extremely intelligent and helpful. His exams will make you learn critical thinking skills; pure memorization is not enough. I grew to love OChem because of Dr. Callam's teaching.

I had Chris Callam as my Organic Chemistry teacher for 2 or 3 classes. It was his first year there, roughly 8 years ago. The fact that I remember his name, and would bother to write a review should tell you something. He was easily the most memorable of all my teachers, and I'm glad to see that he's still there. Awesome teacher, but not easy.
truly is a God..amazing proff

I've had callam for 251, 254, and 255. He is a very organized, fair teacher, but he can be arrogant. also, good luck getting a question in at office hours, where the same members of the callam worshippers ask about every minute detail.

Callam is pretty much a perfect professor. He's extremely enthusiastic and really seems to enjoy teaching. He is always there to offer help if you need it, and he has a way of making even boring parts of chemistry interesting.
This was was very challenging.  Callam's tests were extremely difficult, but I feel prepared to move on to the next class.  Don't take him if you're looking for an easy professor.

I was scared to take his Honors course because he is challenging, but I am glad I did. Hands down the best professor at OSU. He explains things so that you understand instantly and provides a great deal of practice problems so that you feel comfortable with the material. He is also very approachable and wants you to succeed, very helpful. Take him!

I had never taken an honors chem class before, but I decided to do it this quarter because Dr. Callam was teaching it.  He is not easy, but will explain the material far better than any other prof. He knows that his exams are tough and will reward your hard work at the end of the quarter. If you do all the problems he assigns, you will do well

This class was very easy. If you do the study guide at the back of the manual THROUGHOUT the quarter, you will get an A. Just don't do anything stupid in lab. Go to Dr. Callam for help if you need it He will be more than happy to give you additional problems, he also respects those that work hard and don't cram. Again, do the study guide, get an A.

Dr. Callam is definitely one of Ohio State's best. He is certainly not easy, but he is hands down the best at teaching the  material. He puts in a huge amount of effort into making plenty of resources available to his students. I would recommend Callam over ANY Ochem professor at OSU without hesitation. Take him if you have a chance.
Great guy, extremely interesting and dedicated to helping everybody learn the material. Exams are fair, and if you study what he tells you to study, they are not as bad as some will tell you.

chem 246 is a class that really depends on your TA but the professor does give the lecture exams and he did a decent job preparing us for it.  He also went over the lab material with us and shared interesting information that made class worth attending.  He is also very nice in giving all the lecture slides online so you can skip class.

This class was not nearly as bad as some people say.  Don't rush the labs! Take your time, it will pay off.  It's easy to get high points on the lab reports; quizzes are difficult but you'll be fine if you do the prep work in the lab manual.  Same goes for the exam.  Callam was crystal clear in lecture; fantastic professor!

Callam is an extremely good professor.  Everything he teaches, he explains clearly and it is understandable.  The quizzes are OK but the exams are hard.  You have do put in as much work as you can.  Any previous ratings that say his class is an easy A in Chem 251, should be ignored.

This class is very easy as long as you know what you're doing and keep up with the work. Doing well in this class has absolutely nothing to do with who is teaching the class. It all depends on how much work you put into your studies. Grab the study guide from the back of the lab manual and be answering the questions THROUGHOUT the quarter. A+

I had Callam for 251, 245, 246. He's definitely the best ochem professor at OSU. He's clear and concise in lecture, his tests/quizzes are fair, and there's always a big curve. If you work hard, you'll do well! The one negative is his unfriendliness when you ask him for help unless you're a cute girl or you want to talk football.

This class really wasn't that difficult. Go to Office Hours and have him make you additional, harder problems, as the ones in the Practice Problems are too easy and not like what you will see on the exam.

I will be finishing grad school soon, and Chris is the best prof I've ever had.  He's a nice guy too.  Take any class he teaches, and you can't go wrong.  I do agree with everyone else though: you obviously have to work hard to do well.  This is Chemistry... if you don't want to work hard, you can get the hell out.

Dr. Callam is the best professor I have ever had.  He is the most helpful, the clearest lecturer, and the nicest guy.  Also, in regards to the post under mine, he does tons of research actually.  Definitely the best organic chemistry professor by far.

He doesn't do research, so he has a lot of time to devote to teaching. The second exam was brutal but he kept encouraging us and I aced the final. It requires A LOT of time, but do all the practice problems and get help if you need it and you'll do fine. Really focus on the first exam because then it's easy to ride the curve. My fav prof by far!

AAAAMAZING professor, the best ive ever had. i would choose him as my professor for any class. exams are semi-difficult, but its o-chem so that is expected. he is extremely clear in his lectures and is very willing to help you understand.

this class was cake if you put in the time.  go to his office hours all the time if you want an A and talk about football if nothing else.  as for having "a lot of honors kids," it tends not to matter if you can get A's before the curve on the tests (and also if youre one of them too)

If you need ochem and you have the chance to take Dr. Callam's class, seriously, don't even think twice! He's a top-notch professor. His notes are very clear and understandable, he gives problem sets that are valuable for studying, and he posts all his old quizzes and tests on carmen. He will help you get an A if you're willing to put the work in!
good teacher hard exams

Don't get me wrong, Callam is a great teacher, but his class was hard. Taking it fall quarter there were quite a few honors students. Large curve, my grade went up a grade and a half (still got a d+), but the tests were murderous (and I don't usually say that). I would recommend him if you are smart and want in depth knowledge of the subject.
pretty good

I walked out of this class having learned more than I have in any other college course.  He cares so much about his students, and is the most patient person I have ever met in my life. I went to his office hours almost every day, and he welcomes that. If you take anyone else for Ochem you are insane.

Hottest teacher at OSU! He's incredibly intelligent, explains the material perfectly. I took Fraenkel in the beginning becuz I read of how easy he was by comparison but he is a terrible teacher, doesn't speak clearly and doesn't give you practice problems. Callam responds to emails ASAP and is always willing to help!

I have to say that I heard great things about Callam's class--"hard, but you'll def. get an A if you try!" I was pretty optimistic, but a little bummed with the B I got, considering how much I enjoy Ochem. He's a great guy, very helpful, and has great TAs. The class is just really tough! Definitely make sure you attend, and do the practice HW sets.
makes class fun, really difficult but its more the material than him, you learn so much and i found him to be really hot
He is the BEST teacher at OSU. He's very clear, helpfull, funny, HOT. He knows what he is talking about. If you take notes during the lecture, you'll get an easy A.

What is everyone going on about.  His exams are extremely easy if you prepare for them.  great teacher, very helpful in office hours, intelligent, personable, overall just a great guy/prof.  Can be slightly pompous to people who don't take the material seriously.  There is no excuse for doing poorly in his classes.  He will always help if you ask.

The BEST professor I have had at The Ohio State University.  The exams are difficult, but it's Ochem...they should be.  Do the book problems, do the problems sets, and most importantly...GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS! Seriously.  Not only is he very willing to help his students, he is really laid back and easy to talk to. He is a baller, fo sho ;)

i went to his office and sang the lyrics "don't cha" by the pussycat dolls to him. he got kind of annoyed and told me i should only come to his office if i had serious needs. later i brought him cookies and he was cool with me. he is a decent teacher and loves old rock and roll songs.

Extremely clear and fair with what he will be testing on.  I have experienced 5 ochem teachers and he communicates the best.  Extremely prepared, and has written the lab manual.  Knows his stuff, duh.
Extremely passionate about helping students.

slightly overrated, knows his stuff and is available almost all the time since he's in charge of all the ochem labs so he's pretty much always in celeste.  formal reports are graded harshly, mention too much, you lose points, don't mention enough, you lose points.  midterms are your typical callam midterms but are slightly easier.
Really cool guy, good teacher, very willing to help but tries to trick you on the exams. Final was BRUTAL. Make sure you do lots of book problems and know all the details.
excellent professor, exams are fair.  The most helpful professor i have seen in ohio state.  the lab manual is very well written.

Not sure what the fuss is all about...he was ok but not great. Definitely knows his material, but wouldn't one expect that of a prof? Test material is difficult & I agree with the "old boys network" comment. Wouldn't recommend him over others.

The BEST teacher I've ever had. He's pretty much a GOD. I hated gen chem with a passion and took ochem just to see if i would feel any different about it, and i did! The material was tough, but he made it seem easy and taught it in a way that you understood it. He was always willing to help. Definitely go to his office hours and do his problem sets
You really need to know the material and understand his midterms for the final. Class is very fast pace.. it honors level if not faster.

Didn't understand gen chem, hated it with a passion, didn't exactly have high hopes for ochem especially with its reputation.  callam is pretty much the best there is, you will have to work hard, but you learn so much.  I learned more from callam in one quarter than i did in all of gen chem.  do whatever you can to get this guy, he is the OCHEM GOD

One of the best professors I ve ever had! makes ochem simple and kinda fun.  I did not understand gen chem at all but he made ochem real clear.  I got an A in the class but you have to put in a lot of time into this class but trust me its worth it! I would definately try to get into his class.

Best Professor I've ever had. You have to be prepared to spend a lot of time on this class, but it's well organized, the exams are extremely hard but fair, and he is more than willing to meet and go over material with you. If you put in the time, and have constructive questions to ask, you will learn the material & do very well. Take this class!

he is a great instructor.  take the time to have organized questions when you go to his office hours instead of sitting in there and doing the problem sets.  he recognizes hard workers.  i don't see how anyone can not like him.

For those of you taking the MCAT, PCAT, or DAT, this is the class for you.  Yes he is hard and you will spend hours studying for mediocore grades, but you will be well prepared for the future.  Sacrificing your grade now will benefit you later.  Callam is brilliant and incredibly helpful.  Best chem professor I've had yet.

Rather overrated judging by the comments on here. Exams are very hard, lectures are very clear, attitude is very cocky, and yes, he is helpful, but not more so than any other prof I've encountered during 2 yrs at OSU. Would not recommend him over other teachers.
He is extremely helpful, wants you to understand the material thoroughly. His tests are reasonable. Keep up with the labs, do the problems sets and the study guide. Highly recommendable.
Tests are hard as hell but excellent professor. He seems to like hot chicks and smarties. If you're not in those category, it's harder to communicate with him.
He is an great teacher, as long as you keep up with the material and do his work.  I would recommend him,and he is always in his office to help!!

The hottest professor every in OChem.  At 6'2"  Callam stands talk amongst his fellow faculty.  I wouldn't be suprised if I saw him on the cover of GQ magazine for sexiest man of the year!  Just by going to his class u not only learn something however you become smarter and I think a study is underway about how much you IQ goes up by to.  Take him!

Dr. Callam is without question the best professor of any core science at the institution.  Effortlessly, he demonstrates the fundamentals of OChem, clearly and accurately unlike most of the other OChem professors I have encountered or heard of.  I would take ANY class with him you could.  Not only did I learn from him, he made me a better student.

Callam is the best ochem prof at OSU. His tests can destroy you at times, but 253 is different, it's more luck of the draw, but callam will always help you if you want it (anytime he's free), he explains everything very well, same goes for lab, either take callam, or take someone else and go to callam's lectures, beware though, no grade curve,

Extremely hard exams.  However, he is an awesome professor.  I learned a lot from him and would take him again in a heartbeat.  You just have to go to class, and talk with him if you have trouble.  One of the best professor I have ever had

Awesome professor!Could be cocky/intimidating but if you get to know him (hint:talk about sports) and work hard in his class he will know you by name and take consideration when making final grades.True that his tests are hard but if you do the problem sets and understand WHY, you will do well and get a lot from the class -> you will feel smart.

Callam was by far the worst professor I have ever had for Organic Chemistry.  His midterms and finals were of the "play skool" format, and they were simply write the three reactions I have taught you.  I have not learned any organic chemistry thanks to Callam.  For all future students who wish to take Callam: DON'T! You will be a robot.
Hard exams. Would rather research than teach so he just reads the procedures from the slides for lectures.  He needs to teach and show how to do problems that are related to the midterms.

Be ready to work for an A. Hard exams, but great lectures and plenty of practice. If you're chemical engineering like me, you soon find out that it is extremely hard to compete with all of the soph. bio/premed students who have all the time in the world to invest in this class since it is by far their hardest course. In any case, go with him anyway

OVERRATED...OVERRATED!!!!! don't take Callam!! he's way to hard and loves making u look like an idiot. TAKE Fraekel! you'll learn the material in Callam, but get a C or lower. in Fraekel you won't really learn it but get an A.  A's r much more important than actually learning stuff.

I absolutely love Dr. Callam.  He is clear, helpful and dedicated.  He can be kind of cocky and it's easy to tell that he takes pride in making difficult exams, but he does a lot to prepare students for the exams.

he is a good teacher, but can be very pompous.  He is one of those guys who thinks he knows everything about his field, but really owes his knowledge to the fact he doesnt actually have to do research like some of the tenured professors.  Thus he is able to be the dedicate his life to teaching, which is great for us.  Wish I had him in highschool.

If you really want to learn the material, he's your man. If you're just in it because you have to take it and want to get out with the highest grade possible, take someone else. If you take 251 with another professor you can get a better grade with less effort.
Really helpful and fun to talk to.  Great guy!

Dr. Callam teachs students to think for themselves.  He really reaches out to students and tries to help them in anyway he can.  If you get an A in his class ur a straight up balla'.  Even if u don't do as well as you like you will have still understood organic chemistry allot better, which is better for you in the long run.

People give mixed reviews on callam.  he's an excellent professor, very clear, but gives very hard exams.  B's and A's probably study 12-20 hours per exam depending on comprehension level with any o-chem prof.  callam is one of the best for clarity, his notes stand alone, i didn't use the book in his 251 class at all and got a B. just dont be lazy.

Chris Callam is by far the best Organic Chemistry Professor at Ohio State.  The other raters who did not like him, simply did not like OChem.  It is a hard class, but Callam teaches you everything you need to know in the easiest way possible.  His exams have some tricks on them, but if you work hard and study you will do well.  BEST PROF AT OSU!!

Dr. Callam is great!  He is really helpful and knows what he's doing.  But he does expect you to know some ochem, he's not just going to hand you everything when you ask him a question.  His tests are kind of hard, but do the problem sets in the manual and understand what you did in the labs and you should be fine.

I don't see what the big deal is about this professor.  He talks really loud, so I guess you can say the lectures are clear, but I basically taught the course to myself.  Lots of people go to his office hours, but I think they just want to have their hand held.  Also, he talks bad about other professors which is kind of unprofessional.
Dr. Callam is great.  O.chem is tough no matter what, but he will really go out of his way to help you.  IF you go to class and work hard you will do well.

I had him for 251 and 254. There are quite a lot of good ratings about him but i personally did not really like him. He had the tendency to look down on people. He taught well but his exams were beyond hard. I have never worked so hard for a chem class but I did so for chem 251. YOU MUST READ THE BOOK and try all the problem sets and the book probs

The class was very hard! Def. more friendly with the ladies than guys. I have read svrl of the posts here and reading the book is def. a must in to do well in the class. Don't expect tests to be sim. to practice tests or the probs. he hands out every week, however, they help in preparing. Many honor students fill this class (hard on curve)!

Callam is by far the best ochem professor for 251.  He writes what you need to know on the board and explains everything so clearly that I never read the book.  His tests are hard, but if you do the provided practice sets & testsyou will be fine.  Do the work and dont' get behind & you won't have a problem getting an A.  He curves fairly too.

Don't take him. His tests are impossible, you must study EVERYDAY, even Frankel would be a better choice. I learned nothing, failed every test, but still did average in the class. If you take him, make sure to put the suicide hotline on speed-dial and have a flask ready.

His class was harder than any other ochem 251 class. Take notes in lecture, understand the material, go to office hours, only do his problem sets, and book problems. HIS EXAMS ARE HARD! I studied the hardest in his class than I've ever studied in my life and I got a C-. There was NO CURVE because of all the honor & ambitious pre-med students.
he is a very good teacher. very helpful. loved his TA's also. they seemed to help alot when it came to problems. do th e problem sets and homework problems!

Extremely intelligent and young (looks pretty darn good) But honestly he is and awesome prof, probably the best at OSU. Has the best office hours in the world. He explains everything in lecture very clearly. His exams are difficult, which he does to see if you can apply everything you learned.If you have the chance to take a class with Callam do it

I had Callam for 251 and I can seriously say that he is the best professor at OSU.I've never met a professor dedicated to his students like Callam.He honestly wants all his students to succeed,has great office hours,is great at presenting the lecture material(easy on the eyes)awesome problem sets.His exams are difficult but still recom taking. him

WOW.  Prof callam is the best professor i have ever had, ever.  try to get into his class.  if it's already filled, go talk to him personally.  also, do the problem sets.  do them repeatedly.  and go to office hours, ask good questions, and he will love you. he'll take your hard work into consideration when he's doing grades at the end of the quart
great teacher

I didn't have him for lecture, like it says below, we attend him because he can lecture like none other quite clearly, i've seen his tests, a bit hard, i dunno, i'd still take bong or fraenkel, attend Callam's lecture, ride the curve and still get the knowledge, best of all worlds, let's see how he does as a lab prof, also, very personable!

A chemistry genius.  Incredibly nice guy and maybe the best prof. I've had yet at osu.  The class kicked my ass though.  His students made him a facebook group, he's that good.  People from other sections come to his lecture instead.  Be early to EVERY class or you will have to stand in the back (which people do every class, for the entire class).
great professor! very down to earth, funny, and helpful when you go to his office hours! kudos callam!
Great prof, hard midtrerms.

I hate spectro, hate it with a passion.  The only thing I like about 253 is annoying Callam, which is kinda fun 1/3 of the time.  I really dislike it when he deviated from the text.  Overall, O Chem is alright. I guess.  I just can't believe that the first mid term is only over ch 13!

Young and brilliant = good combo. He's very relatable since he can't be older than 30. He makes lectures pretty interesting with his great sense of humor while still clarifying the weeks labs. Tests can be tricky so study a lot for those if you want A's. Great!!
Callam is an excellent professor. He has probably been the best instructor i have had. If you need any kind of help, hes willing to give it to you.
Callam is a decent guy. If you screw up your solution he'll give you a hand and most likely save your experiment.

Fabulous clarification. Expects you to know things that you certainly should know. For example: how to cleave an ester or sythesize a peptide. Work harder and you will appreciate the complexity of the subject. Example:you walk in and look at an NMR, if you had a clue, perhaps you could have an intelligent conversation instead of asking what it mean
People sreamed F*** word when they leave the class right after Midterm, I guess he is overrated. Exam was beyond the lecture coverage, but clarity in lecture is great.
Wasn't very helpful.  Seems very****during his office hours.  He expected ones to know certain material that one has not mastered in the previous quarter.

time and effort are needed, and you'll get an A if you are interested in learning the material go get help when you need it, he'll help you in everyway possible....do his problem sets, understand why each answer is correct, and you'll be golden
He is the best teacher you will have in the chemistry department. He's helpful and nice. The class isn't easy, but if you put the time in, you will do well.
Very good teacher. He does an excelent job presenting ideas. He explains the reasoning well. He made a difficult subject a lot easier to understand

As a lab teacher, he is really easy. Do the practice problems and study for the exam! His chem 251 class was harder, but he also explained everything to a T. I understood the concepts really well. He is a sincere teacher and is also very helpful and FUN. Goes out of his way in office hours to help. He is the MAN and he puts a smile on your face!

Dr. Callam is an excellent professor. He is the most approachable professor I've encountered. His exams are straight-forward. Do the practice problems and put the time in on your lab reports to get an 'A'. I would take ANY class that Dr. Callam teaches.
Great prof. He is very helpful in office hours and in class. Also if you pay attention to the "practice problems" you can get a lot of help for both labs and exams. :)

Best professor i've had.  Exams are fair.  He grades you based upon how much you improve during the quarter. First two exams i got an average and got an A on the final so he gave me an A for the class.
He is really good.  The best I have had in my 3 years.  He goes out of his way to make things better for his students.  I heard all great things about him... He did not dissapoint at all.
Dr. Callam is amazing.  Not only is he a great professor, he is a nice person who cares about his students.  I would take an english class he taught.  Fantastic professor - take him!
Very helpful, extremely intelligent, and very very nice to look at. Take any class he teaches. Definately one of my favorite professors thus far.
Thank goodness for professors like Dr. Callam.  I only understood ochem after taking his class.

A great professor. His problem sets make this class not as hard as it is supposed to be. His exams are straight forward and i freak blew the**** out of the final. Aced it like none other. Even offers ex cr. on exams. He'll know your name, just keep in touch with him and he'll do whatever it takes to teach you the material. Great guy too by the way

One of the best professors at Ohio State. He's a genuine guy who can teach, is down to earth, and will help you whenever you have questions. That's why he has his own facebook group. Anyway, definitely take O-chem with him if you can cuz you'll like it and understand it a lot better.
Callam really cares about the students and deserves your attention and attendance! Rock on, Callam! You rule!

Great teaching style, do all your hw and then some for practice and to do well in the course.  He practically lives in his office so if you ever have any questions he is very helpful and easy to find.
best professor I've ever had. Genuinely interested in helping students. very clear.

By far the best chem professor I've had at Ohio State.  Practice sets are very helpful on quizzes and exams.  O-chem is a difficult subject, but he makes it a lot easier to understand because he actually explains the concepts instead of expecting you to magically know everything already.

Dr. Callam=great teacher. He makes o. chem seem clear and logical.  He teaches you to think, not memorize, and his exams are written to test how well you understand the concepts, not how much you've memorized.  Do ALL of the problem sets that he gives and make sure you understand every single bit of it--it really pays off on the exams!

Dr Callam is awesome! he was nothing but helpful and was really interested in getting to know everyone. hes a genuine nice guy that tells jokes in class. his classes are challenging but managable. TAke any class he teaches!!!
Let me tell ya-H.O.T. Besides his good looks and his ability to float on air as he whisps back in forth as he's teaching, he's an amazing teach.  Mad props to him.  one love yo.
No Comments

The man is a tool.  The experiments were respectable, but Callam somehow succeeded in turning the paperwork part of the class into the most painstaking-pointless-daunting busywork I have ever undertaken. People on here confuse 'niceness' with 'good teaching'.  By the way, I got A's in both 254 and 255 so it's not like i'm pissed about grades.

Callam is the reason I'm still premedicine.  He is an amazing prof and ochem with him wasn't nearly as painful. Take him for any and every class he teaches!  He knows how to teach, he knows the names of every one of his students, he's awesome!!!

Dr. Callam is an excellent teacher.  He is great at explaining concepts and working through problems with students.  He is always willing to go over questions with students and will often spend as much time as needed with individual studnets.  He is very approachable and interested in teaching students, not just doing research.
excellent professor.  good lectures. approachable. concise...and he keeps it stylish with ralph lauren shirts and pastel colors. what a guy!
He has his own facebook fanclub group..and i think that just about says it all. check it out..  the "Dr. Chris Callam Is the Only Ochem Professor Who Doesn't Make Me Want To Kill Myself Club"

Outstanding Teaching Award for ASC 2005!! The best ochem prof at the university. He is willing to answer any question you may have after class (including the ones on your hw) and he very clear an concise in class. He teaches you what you need to know well and he walks around during the labs and you get to know him. :) (kazu is the best lab ta!)

Dr. Callam was the best teacher I have ever had.  He was very thorough teacher and yet still challenged you.  I learned more in his class than in most other classes.  If you have the chance to learn from him, I would highly recommend it because that's exactly what you'll do.  He really cares about his students, enough so to learn all of our names.
By far the best teacher at OSU!!!!!

Chris is very knowledgeable and personable, and his class is mostly straightforward. He can be tricky occassionally, but he's always willing to help, and always around the labs. I had a much better experience with Callam than Tatz in the 121 series.
GREAT TEACHER!  So nice, and very helpful.  Makes o-chem understandable.  (cute too)

I love Dr. Callam. He is very helpful in lecture and walks the labs. He is hilarious and he pretty much knows every one of his students, which is crazy, since he teaches several large lectures at a time. Just doing all the homework problems (which is not much) will get you and A on the midterms.
Easy. Also, Yalong is the best Lab TA ever.

A well-rounded instructor who goes to great lengths to ensure that the material is comprehensible. His notes are by far more succinct than the textbook could ever hope to be, so study them well and the exams should be a breeze to go through.

Chris is by far the BEST professor at OSU. He explains things very clearly and makes them easy to understand. He is a tough teacher but he takes that into consideration when assigning grades at the end. If at all possible definitely take O-chem with Chris. You won't regret it.
I could follow his lectures better than any other chem lectures I've ever had.

Chris did an awesome job with this class. I think he might have tightened up the grading standards a little this quarter, but nonetheless I learned more in his lab course than I did in Chem 251 lecture. Explains everything very clearly and is always willing to help. All around good guy.
the only teacher that makes chemistry make sense.
he has a cute smile.

Chris is by far one of my best profs ever- and not just in OChem.  He makes difficult material understandable, is young and relates to his students, and has a real interest of getting to know everyone he teaches.  I can't wait to take 255 with him next quarter.  He's amazing- take one of his classes
He is very helpful and has great office hours, which you will need since he is requires you to understand what you are learning. He is funny, sincere and has a tattoo! (Ask him where!!)

He is a very helpful teacher and is very fair in his grading. Also willing to help out with questions on the lab and such. Not hard to get an A as long as you do the busywork (pre-labs, formal write-ups, etc.)
Definately one of the best instructures in the nation.  He makes a very difficult subject matter very understandable and is always willing to help.
Chris is a great teacher. he is interested in his students and is willing to go the extra mile to make sure they know what's going on. He is great!

AWESOME! Best professor ever. Young, smart, interested in helping and extremely fair tests. Whatever he's teaching, take it...Great guy!! I just loved him. I would love to see him teach the intro ochem series.
excellent prof, clear, nice, helpful

The class is really easy and Callam is very helpful.  He does seem motivated and genuinely cares about getting the material across.  He's a bit detached sometimes, I never know if he understands what I'm trying to say.

Chris is by far the best proressor I have ever had in my life.  I am a fith year chem major and I had him 2 years ago.  I am glad they ofered him a position here to teach, but needs to be made full time faculty.  If you ever have the chance of taking his class do it.
No Comments
No Comments

Excellent instructor.  He's at Pitsburgh now, and it's a cryin' shame OSU wouldn't pay him enough after 5 years of TAing :/  If he comes back, sign up for his class!  Young, intelligent, and motivated.
No Comments

Absolutely one of the best out there.  Knows his material and knows how to convey it clearly, motivates his students to succeed, and cares greatly for the well-being of everyone.  Did I mention great sense of humor?

summary_comment: Dr. Noel "Michael Addition" Paul is highly regarded as one of the best professors at Ohio State University, particularly for Organic Chemistry II. Students praise his engaging teaching style, detailed guidance, and genuine concern for their success, though they note that exams are challenging. His lectures are recorded, and he offers ample opportunities for extra credit, making him a popular choice among students.

Ratings.comment: Noel "Michael Addition" Paul wants you to think like an enzyme.

if you can take any course w dr paul, do it. he is so nice and funny and he really does care. he answers emails pretty quickly, and you can send him a screenshot of your work and he gives a really detailed guidance for solving the problem. exams are hard but that's to be expected with ochem. attend office hours if you can!!
NMP is the Jeremiah Smith of the Ohio State University chemistry department.

Dr. Paul is by far my fav professor out of ANY subject I've taken here at OSU. He is so organized, knowledgeable, and genuinely cares about his students' success. His exams are extremely fair (by no means easy though) and he gives lots of opportunities for EC. I could also reach him outside of class and lots of office hours. Take him if you can!

Dr. Paul is possibly the best professor I have had at OSU. The content is difficult but he makes it understandable and is always on your side as a student. The most understanding and easiest to work with professor I have met by far. I seriously cannot say enough good things about this dude. Take him over Baldwin any day of the week.

Objective takes: lecture is recorded; lots of extra credit; main graded items: 1-4 question pre-lecture HW (participation mostly), few quizzes over functional groups & nomenclature (multiple attempts), short recitation preparation (graded), exams. No recitation quizzes. Exams are doable if you study & practice. Opinion: best prof. for AU OCHEM 2.

While Dr. Paul can be entertaining, his disorganized teaching style made this Ochem 2 class challenging. The lectures often lacked clarity and he was frequently behind schedule. Thankfully, the textbook and unstuck study were helpful for staying on top of the material.

NMP is the best prof for ochem 2 FS. Lectures are recorded and posted the same day. He makes the content relatively bearable to learn. Recitation prep worksheets (graded for correctness) sometimes have content that he hasn't taught yet which is unfair. But he gives a lot of points back on exams if you just go up and talk to him he's such a sweetie

Paul is a great guy but he gives pre-lectures over content that you haven't covered nor is it online. He overcomplicates mechanisms. He takes 30 minutes to explain 1 mechanism when it should only take 5, he tries to make the lecture fun by trying to be fun but it just makes it impossible to understand. Take Baldwin if you can.

I highly recommend Dr. Paul for Ochem 2 lecture. He is by far the best option for this class. If you bring your graded exam to him during office hours, there's a good chance he will give you some points back as long as you seem to gen want to know what you did wrong, and/or if you can explain why you did something. He is also a great lecturer.

I have Noel Paul for O Chem II again this semester (I had him for O Chem I) and I swear I wouldn't have made it through that class if he wasn't teaching it. He's sooo funny and that makes watching the lecture videos bearable, if not sometimes entertaining! He also obviously loves chemistry and is very knowledgeable. Awful class, great professor.

dr. paul is a really good professor and cares a lot about student success. ochem lab is a pain to get through and lectures are asynchronous but dr. paul is extremely helpful if you reach out early in the semester

His jokes during lecture were distracting because it would cause him to rush at the end of class with 5 complex mechanisms that he would just post on canvas. He would always leave complex topics 1 week before exams. In office hours whenever there was a question asked, he would make it more complicated with examples that would confuse you more.

Him and Dr. Callam did a great job during the online lectures. I would just say that there were some portions that weren't straight to the point and I would occasionally question relevance. Overall, a good lecturer for this course.

Paul was a great professor! His exams were pretty straight forward, but the final was very difficult. The practice quizzes helped a lot with the weekly quizzes. Also go to office hours and he is always willing to help

He's fun to be in lecture with, as long as the stress of not really learning much doesn't get to you. Consistently late to his own class, and we always go over 5-10 minutes. He's always joking and gets distracted easily, which is not great for learning a hard subject.  As others said, he's very hard to reach and you can't see your grades.

Mixed feelings about Paul. He's a very caring and considerate professor but he is SO disorganized it's painful. I missed an assignment due to health reasons, he told me he would get back to me soon with a make-up assignment but never did. A month after the class ended he gave me a 0 for that assignment, lowering my grade from a B+ to a B-

Dr. Paul is a caring & accommodating professor but very disorganized. Grades came back late, midterm formats were not in syllabus and could be changed/announced days in advance. Online assessments & grade estimates did not go up as scheduled. Lectures made no sense & he's difficult to contact via email. Textbook + practice problems saved my grade.

Decent for chem 2540/2550, not so much for chem 2510/2520. Was incredibly disorganized the entire semester for chem 2520. He's easy to talk to- if you can get a hold of him. He often doesnt respond to emails and shows up to his own office hours late. His lectures were unclear, and was behind schedule consistently. Take someone else if you can.
Worst professor, very unorganized, doesnt respond to emails, doesnt let you know your grade

So far currently failing the class. Lectures are very convoluted as someone else previously said. OChem is super hard and having to teach yourself is harder. He tries to be funny and joke around which is fine but some days it takes up the already limited time. Other days he explains concepts at length and at the end says we wont be tested on it.

The most caring and hilarious professor I have ever had at OSU. Hard to explain how kind and caring he is. Both O-Chem 1/2 are very difficult classes, but he makes it enjoyable to learn and has no trouble putting time aside to help his students . He is a friend to anyone and everyone, no matter who you are or how little/well he knows you.
Dr. Paul is a great professor, a lot of fun, and keeps things interesting. I feel like I learned a lot and truly enjoyed the lab.
Decent professor. Explain things in manners that were easy to follow and understand.
Cool guy. He taught the NMR material for this class and Callam gave the lab-related lectures. Answers emails quickly and is very helpful if you need assistance with NMR. Take his class.

Dr. Paul was in charge of the spec stuff for this class and he did a really good job going into depth and explaining everything. The spec quizzes were pretty difficult but other than that there isn't much to complain about. The lectures were asynchronous which was helpful because none of my other classes were (during the panny).

chem 2550 was much harder for me than 2540, but dr. Paul is still such a good professor. the spec concepts are difficult and lots of practice is necessary. the class isn't great and is based a lot on spec quizzes (that the majority of people got a 0 on) and lab reports but dr. Paul tries to keep it fun!

Dr. Paul's portions of the ochem lab lecture weren't very helpful for me since I had retained my gen chem and had already taken ochem lecture. He also spent too much time trying to be funny and relatable and ate into Dr. Callam's time of actually teaching me new material. He did explain things clearly, cared a lot, and gave us lots of resources.
Notes are convoluted and chaotic. Exams are tough, but does give extremely difficult extra credit on them most times. Basically taught myself everything from a secondary book and did well.

Chem 2550 was harder than 2540, but it was still doable. Dr. Paul is always super willing to help when you're struggling, which makes the course a lot easier. He truly cares about his students and it's very evident. He also brings some pretty interesting jokes and memes to lectures that keep you entertained.

Dr. Paul was one of the most accommodating professors I have ever met and I am truly grateful that I got to know him so well while taking this class last semester. I came down with mono while in this course and was convinced I would fail as a result. Dr. Paul singlehandedly helped save me in this course by encouraging me that I could do it.

Disappointed is an understatement. For a professor who preaches so much about caring for his students and their circumstances, he certainly has a strange way of showing it through the impossible expectations he has for them (even in a pandemic). Notes/lectures are chaotic, all over the place, and hard to follow. As Nicki Minaj once said, YIKES...

Dr. Paul is by far my new favorite chemistry professor. His lectures can be all over the place at times but the mechanisms he does are always helpful. He almost always goes over his time period which can be stressful if you have another class right after. You only have 2 midterms then the final and 8 quizzes so you are graded on very little.

Dr. Paul definitely has good intentions, but his teaching is terrible. His lectures are unorganized and include way too many details that are unnecessary and waste time. His analogies in lecture would take up more time than the lecture content itself. His exams were manageable and he provided many resources. Just awful at relaying lecture material.

Dr. Paul seems like every organic chemistry students dream come true, but as the semester goes on his lectures become more and more erratic as the content becomes harder. Every lecture feels like its building to a big aha moment just for Dr. Paul to run out of time. He cares, he just uses that as an excuse to make the class impossible.

Dr. Paul really cares about what he does, but his lectures are not concise whatsoever. He sometimes seems more interested in joking around and being likable than covering the material. Too many metaphors about ochem and not enough teaching of the actual mechanisms. He likes to describe the wrong mechanism at length before giving the correct one.

Organic chemistry is one of the most difficult undergrad classes you'll take at OSU. The exams are brutal. However, if you need to take it Paul is a wonderful option. He's relatable, empathetic and tries his best to make the content understandable and memorable. He's a wonderful professor and person. Good luck!

Dr. Paul is easily the most entertaining professor I have ever had. He makes learning organic chemistry enjoyable. While Dr. Paul does not talk as quickly as Dr. Callam, he still moves through his slides fast and it can be hard to keep up with him at times. His section of the notes are extremely helpful for lab.

Dr. Paul is THE best professor Ive had at OSU. Organic is hard - hes the first to admit that - but Paul makes it as enjoyable as possible w/ his humor & quirky ways of remembering things. He provides tons of resources for learning/studying & truly cares about his students success! Very fair & offers a bunch of extra credit throughout the class

Dr. Paul is a hilarious and highly knowledgeable professor. He is super funny and cares a lot about his students. Class is definitely hard, but not horrendous. Curve was not great (84 curved to B+) but there was a lot of extra credit given through Top Hat and midterm redemption. Ochem sucks overall tho ngl

I hated ochem one and I actually ended up loving ochem after his class. His second exam kills you a bit, but the fairest prof I have ever had. He's hilarious and helps you remember reactions in the weirdest of ways. Do well on Tophat and use all the practice sets for the exam. I never used the book and I did great in his class.
A really good choice for organic chemistry. Lectures well and knows a lot. Tries his best to keep students attentive and engaged. One of the best O-chem professors at Ohio State.

I went to Dr. Paul's office hours every week because he is so helpful. He is very willing to help, and he can answers your questions well and with patience. He is also very funny. His lectures are clear and straightforward, and although OChem Lab is tough, he really did his best to help students learn and be successful.

I have had few professors as helpful and caring as Dr. Paul. He's truly invested in the success of all students and is willing to help anyone through ochem. Lectures are entertaining yet informative. Take any class with Dr. Paul and you're in good hands--all this said after taking three classes taught by him.

Alright this guy is fully insane and goes on bizarro rants every class period that seem to have no bearing on what we are talking about but theyre super funny so its just kind of amusing. Great teacher overall, really knows his material.

Dr. Paul is AWESOME. By far one of my favorite professors I have ever had. He genuinely cares about his students and wants them to be successful. Ochem 2 is hard, but he makes it enjoyable and interesting in lecture.

Dr. Paul is a very hilarious, caring, and great professor. He made ochem much more manageable, as he teaches it very well. He is also generous with extra credit chances. However, the class is still a rough ride, and it's up to you to find a study method that plays to your strengths. Also, don't be shy to reach out to him, as he is great for help.
I really liked Dr. Paul. He is always making jokes in his lectures and he is very relatable to students.

Dr. Paul basically got the good cop role and got to teach the lab chemistry. So he always had funny stories to tell us about chem/lab/movies/himself. He usually explains most of the chemistry within the allotted time but fails to cover all details cause he gets distracted.

Dr. Paul truly cares about the success of his students and would never do anything to make one feel stupid for not understanding content. He's excellent at explaining material and has great showmanship, keeping the class's attention with plenty of dad jokes and other various pop culture references. Nice change of pace for a chemistry professor

The Good: Entertaining lectures, explains ochem in a very real and relatable way, Willing to help and answer all the time The Bad: The exams literary hurt you brain when you are done. Exam averages are so low. The grind for this class is so real if you are looking to pull off an A.

Dr. Paul is a really nice guy and is pretty easy to understand. He is very helpful when you come to him with questions. My only complaint is that O Chem lab is the hardest 2 credit hour class you'll ever take, and you'll spend just as much time studying for it as a 5 credit hr class. But if it's required for your major, just buckle down.

Dr. Paul was a fantastic teacher. OChem is obviously not easy, but he made learning much easier. TONS of practice materials and office hours to help anyone. Really nice guy overall. Exams were hard, but quizzes were easily doable. Do well on the quizzes and take advantage of all extra credit opportunities and you'll be fine.

Do the isomer challenge for extra credit and then never have to work hard in the class again. OChem lab is fairly straightforward, especially if you have already taken OChem. Paul is really funny and a good guy to be around. He and Callam do a great job of teaching the class together.

Good professor. Makes you want to learn. To prepare for exams do the problem sets. Do well on top hat and you can rack up a lot of extra credit. Learn the functional groups. Only complaint is he jumps around so sometimes it is hard to follow along with the  book.
One of my favorite professors so far at OSU, keeps lectures entertaining and is very good at updating grades and providing everything you need to succeed. Great Guy
Best teacher ive ever had at OSU hands down. Super helpful but makes you work hard for the grade. Hilarious jokes every lecture that made my day !
He is so funny, makes lectures very entertaining. Overall, a good professor. His test are pretty difficult but gives you a lot of chances to make it up. I would recommend NMP great guy!

Explains the material well for the lab portion of the lecture. He was pretty funny as well. The class has additional practice problems which help a lot. With that said, the final was as hard as everybody warned me about. It's something you should start studying for weeks in advance.

Paul is a great lecturer but you just go through example by example. There are Lecture Prep questions before most lectures, some are simple while others can take some time. The tests can be very difficult, but he wants to challenge since this is the majors class. He offered a redemption midterm for the second midterm because he felt it was tough.

I found it tough to pay attention in class simply because we had no required tests or quizzes that I had to know the material for until the very end of the class. Basically your entire grade is based on the test at the end, no matter how well you do in lab.  That being said, Noel is a engaging and funny lecturer.
Dr. Paul is the best professor in the chemistry department, and possibly at OSU. A genuine guy and passionate about teaching! Highly recommend.

Hilarious and extremely easy to talk to about anything, great person and professor, go to him if you need help he is always willing to go above and beyond for his students and he is super smart and nerdy and its awesome. Extra practice is given, obviously ochem isnt easy but if you put in the time you will get an A there is a generous curve as well

If you ask for help he will totally be willing to help answer. one and half class can be long and put you to sleep but if you print out the part of lectures where you feel like you need to write the notes down. You should be fine if you care.

Come to lecture with the slides printed to take notes. He co-lectures with Christopher Callam. If you study, its an easy A. The labs are pretty clear cut. Just do what you are supposed to. Also gives you points towards final for participating in weekly "optional" pre/post lecture quizzes. Very nice guy. approachable. Lectures clear. Would Recommend

Dr. Paul is my favorite professor at OSU - he's funny, knowledgeable, and is a great teacher. However, 2620 is HARD. Quizzes and exams are tough and grading can be harsh but it's understandable. This class has really expanded my chemistry knowledge and made me understand the big picture. It's a hard class but taking it with Paul makes it worth it.
hilarious and adorable

Dr Paul is a cool dude. His lectures are corny but that's besides the point. This class took up more time than my 5 cr. hr. physics class. THE FINAL WAS NOT HARD, THEY IMPROVED IT SO THE AVG WOULD BE HIGHER THAN IN THE PAST SO PLEASE DO NOT EXPECT A LOW CLASS AVG. I was above avg on every assignment and expected at least an A- but ended with a B+.

Dr. Paul is a more interesting lecturer than Callam. He is funny and tries to keep the material interesting and pertinent. OChem lab, however, is more difficult than it needs to be. My best advice is to do the end of chapter problems and the problem sets online. And go see the TAs or professors for help with lab reports. May you get a good yield!
A lot of work for only two credit hours.  But, Dr. Paul is extremely helpful in office hours and very clear when lecturing.  Good professor to have.

Pretty terrible class. The material is hard and the lectures are just straight boring. They aren't helpful at all and you pretty much teach the class to yourself. Final exam is impossible too but it's curved or else everyone would fail. All in all it's wayyy too much work for a 2 credit hr class...

Dr. Paul knows this is a difficult class, so he does his best to make it interesting, be it jokes or stories. I found his office  hours very helpful. I felt that short of giving me the answers to the test, he gave me what I needed to study and do well.  I found his colleague less helpful though...

Dr. Paul is no doubt a very kind professor but I absolutely despised the labs. The work you will put into this class does not pay off. One of the more frustrating and annoying classes I have ever taken. I have heard students who come from other universities say how reasonable and fair their ochem lab is compared to this class.
Overall a great prof. Extremely helpful and more than willing to meet with you for ANYTHING you need. Easy to listen to in class and gives you all the resources you need to do well.

Dr. Paul is fantastic.  He's bright, cheery, and easily captures your attention by making pop culture references and cheesy jokes.  He's also incredibly kind, approachable, and helpful.  Definitely one of the best science professors I've had here at Ohio State.

Paul is a good professor, and he is helpful and nice. He can be quirky and cheesy, but once you get used to him he is pretty funny, and the lectures aren't horrendous. He lectures with Chris Cash Money Callam and they are a great team. Exam is tough, but this is ochem, so get your game face on and quit cryin'. Solid prof(s), solid class.
Great guy, very approachable. Very good at explaining things. Hard class, though.
O chem is not an easy subject but he gives you all the tools you need to understand it. Do all the practice problems and go to office hours. Very helpful and genuinely wants you to do well.

Paul tries much too hard to be funny. You may laugh once or twice, but he dances around many of his lecture topics with weak jokes before making any point. Work load was high for a 2 credit hour course. Callam was much better at lecturing. Final is VERY difficult.

Dr. Paul tries to be funny, but with little success.  I do appreciate the effort, though.  Labs were fun and I think he did a good job of explaining lab, but the final exam for lab was completely impossible.  I had an A- going into the exam, and now after the final, I'm just hoping to pass this class with a C.

NMP is great!I loved his class & his office hrs are VERY helpful-GO TO THEM! He sincerely wants you to do well. The practice exams are great,as are the prob sets. Lots of q's on them & toward the end they get difficult, but dont worry.they're tough "thinking" q's at that point. memorize functional groups for exams. TAKE DR. PAUL,you wont regret it!

Excellent professor! It's a hard couse and sometimes his lectures can be confusing. However he gives you a huge amount of resources and is more than happy to help. Great during office hours - really wants to ensure students get a real understanding of the subject. Read the book before/after lectures but stuck to the problem sets for homework.
Dr. Paul is great, prob the best chem professor I had. He is very helpful and gives a fair curve at the end of the class. His notes are very helpful for the final and for labs

Doctor Paul is great! It's a hard class (duh, it's O'Chem). But he is extremely helpful and funny. He uses ridiculous metaphors that are extremely helpful when trying to grasp or remember concepts, and he gave us extra credit for making chemistry memes! Awesome!
He seems to think he's a stand-up comedian, which is sometimes distracting from the material, which is hard enough without any distractions.

very straightforward quizzes every week, gives tons of practice problems that help especially with quizzes. hard exams. had the whole class crack up lots and lots of times. likes to make drug-chemistry jokes. uses a lot of metaphors, amazing how he does it really.not my easiest A but super fun class, played trendy music at the start of every class.
Enjoyed having him as a teacher he keeps class interesting. As of the grades though he is very tough and his exams are rough. You do learn a lot from him though
Dr. Paul is funny and very laid-back, he will help you a lot if you go to his office hours or schedule an appointment with him but you have to be willing to put in the extra hours to pass this class!

Very good teacher, probably the best I have had at OSU. Keeps the mood casual. His jokes are kinda dorky at times but its pretty hard not to laugh at most of them. Tests are extremely hard, but fair. Very Helpful and very easy to talk to. If you get the chance definitely take him.

Worst teach ever. We are extremely far behind. We're suppose to go through nine chapters, we have three weeks left and six chapters to go. You have to teach yourself a lot. There are constant typo's, and his exams are ridiculous. He also says we don't need to know something, then tests you on it.

PAULY D IS THE MAN. He is SO SO SO Helpful in office hours. I have a teacher crush on him. Hands down THE best prof. I've had at Ohio State. I hated o-chem until his class. Sign up with him, for sure!! He taught me how to study-- he changed me life <3  I've cried in front of him before and he gave me a motivational pep talk!! He's like my uncle!!

Dr Paul is one of the best professors I have had at OSU.  He genuinely cares about helping his students, and is always available for questions.  He is very approachable, easy to talk to, and doesn't make you feel stupid when you ask questions.  Great professor..take any classes you can with him!

He is very clear on what he expects you to know, is extremely helpful during office hours, and loves answering questions. The class is difficult, but as long as you keep up with the material and ask questions, it won't be as bad. You can tell that he loves teaching and he's pretty funny, too. I actually looked forward to lecture!

Dr. Paul is the best professor I've had at Ohio State! I had him for Chem 252, 253, and 255. He truly cares about his students and will go above and beyond to help you. Go to his office hours and get to know him. He's super nice, funny, and great at exaplaining difficult concepts. Exams are tough, but he always gives a fair curve.

I had Dr. Paul for 251,253,254, and 255. I can say he has been my favorite teacher in my 3 years at OSU. He explains everything and goes above and beyond what is expected of him. It's organic chemistry, so it's going to be hard no matter what. But having Dr.Paul as a teacher makes it a little less painful, and gives you a reason to make it class.

Great prof; helpful & enthusiastic about students and subject. First lecture he explained how he broke his clavical doing a shoulder roll in Aikido and showed a video of Charlie Sheen. Explains pretty well and keeps lecture interesting. Tough but curves fairly (final exam avg was 46%...), breaks down grades after each midterm. O chem prof to have!

Great prof, for lab and lecture. For lab lectures he would take a while on one topic and run out of time for the rest of the powerpoint, but posts them online. Always up for answering questions, made clear the requirements for pre-labs and lab, and always stopped into our labs. Entertaining guy, too.

Dr.Paul is a great prof. Makes lectures interesting, and makes you hate life a lot less when taking ochem. Glad I had him for 245 and 252 too. Sometimes his explanations can be confusing, but b/c it's usually a difficult concept. Problem sets very helpful! Harder than 252 b/c of the content. And it's funny when he curses. XD

Dr.Paul is great! I had him for 252, 253, and 255 and loved every course because it made sense and he made it interesting. He cracks jokes in class and keeps the mood light. He is genuinely interested in helping you succeed and always makes time to help if you ask. Definitely a prof worth getting to know!

one of the best teachers i've ever had. he geniuely cares about his students and is always willing to help. he is so enthuastic about chem and made me tolerate o chem. he is very funny and has interesting lectures. i wish there were more teachers like him.

Dr. Paul is probably the best prof Ohio State has to offer. His lectures are funny, and people will pay attention to the material just to see if he cracks a joke sometimes. He answers any questions, goes over whatever you have troubles with, and will keep you entertained.

Great teacher, lecturer, and person. Its O Chem, therefore its going to be hard, but he tries his best to make everything as clear as possible. He spent an entire lecture going over questions that arose in his office hours. Take Dr. Paul if you get the chance.

If you have the opportunity to take Doc Paul for any ochem classes, jump at the opportunity;especially for 251. He slowly and clearly covers the basic concepts that can be applied to a broad range of topics.His enthusiasm and funny examples make it easier for the material to stick. i also heard he revived an injured baby dove during class one time
Dr Paul was amazingly helpful. know your mechanisms and use his lecture notes and you will do well.

I had Dr. Paul for 253 as well and he is an all around awesome teacher! Go to his office hours and you will do great. Yes his averages are low, but he gives a very fair curve. You learn a lot more from this guy than other ochem teachers. Take him if you can!!

I LOVE Dr. PAUL!!!! He's so excited about chemistry and such a nice guy all around. You can tell he is really emotionally invested in his students. I had him for 253 and jumped at the chance to take him for 255.
Very funny.  He makes class fun to go to.  You will learn a lot, but it requires a lot of effort on your part.  Great teacher.

By and far the best professor I've ever had. O-chem is a really hard subject, so you can't expect it to be easy, but what you can expect with Dr. Paul is an extremely knowledgeable approachable and helpful professor who will go out of his way to help you and make sure you know your stuff. Would most definitely recommend him.

Having had Paul for 251, I was excited about lab.  Turns out-I think-he's better suited for lecture.  I felt under-prepared for most labs, and without comprehending the 5 min cram sessions at the end of lab lecture (some post-252 material) my lab grades suffered.  Great person, great one-on-one, very tough 254 guy when taking 252 simultaneously.

Far and away the best professor I have had at OSU.  He gives tons of practice problems which are a lot more helpful than the book problems.  Also go to office hours!  He answers everything you need to know.  It is a very hard class but he gives you all the tools you need to do well.  Also very friendly and extremely approachable.

This is the best teacher I have ever had at OSU. Notice the only people who had bad things to say about him are the ones who did bad.  He give practice problems and the tests are just like them.  The averages may be low but the curve is fair.  I got an A in ochem 251 and nothing but Bs in gen chem.  It obviously has a lot to do with the teacher.

Dr Paul is the best professor I have had at Ohio State. He truly cares about the students making sure the material is understandable and definitely keeps your attention during lecture. Although he crammed a bit at the end of the class, the exams were always fair and he made sure to let you know what would be on the exam. I would def take him again

The best teacher I have had at Ohio State. The class is hard but it is OCHEM. He is extremely helpful and gives a ton of practice questions. Read the book and do his practice problems and you can get an A.

Tricks you into thinking he's going to be a great teacher, then crams an important 3 weeks worth of information into the last three lectures. Final average was a 49%. How can you pride yourself in failing over half of your students? Worry less about being funny and more about teaching.
N/A
I strongly recommend to take his class. You may even end up thinking about changing your major to chemistry!!! He is extremely helpful and understanding.

I don't know what some of the previous people were talking about... Dr. Paul is GREAT! He's definitely the most caring prof I've had from this cold cold chemistry department. Definitely take him if you have the chance.  Exams are practically identical to problem sets.  If you can do those, you're golden.

Don't be swayed by the negative comments from people who are upset they didn't do well.  Yea he's hard, but if I could have taken every O-Chem class with Dr. Paul I would've.  He enjoys teaching and enjoys more giving extra help.  Go to lecture, study a lot and you'll enjoy the class and do well.

Dr. Paul is the man.  He takes this tough class and relates it to his students. At times, he does get a little lost, but this was his first 251 lecture. He starts of rather slow, and is cramming here at the end of the quarter, but I would definitely recommend him in the future. Once he has his plan for the class down, he'll be golden

Dr. Paul was a very good teacher. His class took a lot of studying but the exams and quizzes were fair. He is always willing to help students if they are confused. I would recommend him for chemistry.

Put hours into studying and it doesn't pay off. The only thing Dr. Paul can say is, you aren't trying hard enough. He does worry about being funny to the students more than actually teaching us during lecture. That can get pretty irritating. He seems like a nice guy, but really wants to hold onto that death grip Ochem prof's have on the students...

Organic Chem shouldn't be this complicated. He confuses himself while teaching, but later emails out his "corrections" from lecture where he screwed it all up! Good thing he has TA's who know what they are doing or we would all study from bad notes....hhhmmm wonder why your entire class average is a D???

I wouldn't take Chem 251 with this guy... unreasonable, doesn't lecture well...too interested in making a stupid joke while uninterested in the fact that he wastes valuable class time... A+++ Gen chem student... C- Chem 251...I STUDY! He just wants the average to be 60%...this guy is a joke.

Dr. Paul is the new gold standard for professors in the chem department. He knows how to TEACH.  He's smart, he's available, he's young, and he's entertaining. An overall great guy! If Dr. Paul is an option for you this quarter, take his class!

This man is AMAZING! Probably the best lecturer I've had at OSU. He always managed to throw in jokes to keep things interesting. He moved at a nice pace and it wasn't hard to keep up. Quizzes and exams were fair. TAKE THIS MAN FOR CHEMISTRY!

Probably the most helpful teacher I've ever had. He was so approachable and always willing to clear up a concept or help with a lab or something. You could tell that he really cared about his students and whether or not they were learning. And he was just a funny guy, and I somehow didn't even hate his class, even though it was organic chemistry

Great Professor. Extremely helpful during his office hours. Exams and quizzes are fair. Lab can be tough but that's impossible to avoid with chemistry. Dr. Paul is a pretty funny guy, sometimes bizarre but always entertaining. He loves what he teaches for sure.

summary_comment: Dr. Chang is highly regarded for his fairness and straightforward approach to teaching Organic Chemistry II, emphasizing the importance of daily study and preparation. While the class is challenging, particularly with difficult quizzes and exams, he offers generous extra credit opportunities and a fair grading curve when needed. Students find him approachable and kind, though his teaching style can be detailed without always providing context.

Ratings.comment: Stop scrolling and just take this professor already. As long as you put in the work you'll be fine.

If you're aiming to get the best possible grade out of all ochem lectures take this professor, but class is still very difficult. Your grade will consist of quiz and exam grades, with some extra credit. Very generous curve, so even if you don't do well on exams you'll probably pass. Focus on recitation worksheets and problem sets for exams
Kind but hard class.

Dr. Chang is extremely kind and funny, however his tests and quizzes were pretty difficult with the averages being in the 50s to 70s. His teaching style wasn't my favorite, and he does offer 5 extra credit points/week (better than nothing) but with exams being around 240 pts each it doesn't do much. My 83.5 got curved to a B+. Go to lecture!

No lecture recording, so go to class! Dr. Chang is an enthusiastic teacher. It is the way the course is set up that there are a lot of materials we need to memorize in a short period of time.  I don't like one thing about his teaching style that he goes into detail without explaining the big picture/context. Be ready to study on your own for a lot.

Does his best for students.Weekly recitation quizzes worth 40 points. He also allowed students to get 5 extra credit points for worksheets based on completion each week. Exams were difficult but he was very straightforward about content. Lots of problems came from practice resources given. This year the curve for a B was at 70.5% and 78% for a B+.

Dr. Chang is very fair, and very straightforward. Especially compared to other orgo 2 lecturers, he really outlines what you need to know for his quizzes and exams. Orgo 2 was absolutely doable with Dr. Chang. However, do not expect any sort of curve for his class, as his exams are fair enough where a curve is not necessary. Know the lecture notes!

Dr. Chang is a great professor. Just make sure that you study every day and you'll be fine. There are weekly quizzes so prepare for them. Extremely approachable if you have any questions. Exams are relatively straightforward if you prepare.

Best OChem prof especially if your goal is to get a good grade. Go to every class, take clear notes, and you'll pass. Grade is just based on exams and quizzes, with recitation packets for extra credit, which I liked (no time sink online HW). The exams weren't that difficult, and he prepared us well ;) Wish I had taken him for OChem 2. TAKE HIM.

Dr. Chang has an amazing curve. If you do all the recitation activities & problem sets multiple times, rewrite your notes, and practice daily, you WILL get an A. For future reference, a 73%-82% this semester was a B+, which is a pretty good curve! He Automatically makes the average a B-, and curves at least 25% of the class to an A. You got this!

Aside from how easy he makes understanding ochem and doing good in his class, this man is amazing! I have had several issues related to this class and have actually, embarrassingly, cried in front of him several times. He sat down and spoke with me about how to help myself. I don't know a single professor who would do that for a student. Take him!

Dr. Chang cares about his students and truly wants them to succeed. The only downside to his class was that he doesn't provide recorded lectures so you do have to go to class each day. Watch YouTube videos, take your own notes, do all the practice material Chang provides, and try to stay on top of the content. Ochem is very manageable with Chang!
The best prof you will ever have and will make you love ochem if you hated it from ochem 2510.

I got an A- in this class. Dr. Chang curves 25% of his students get an A/A-, which is a lot higher than other professors. My advice? Start studying early. The first day you get to class is when you start studying. Also, so every problem set and recitation worksheet. I promise that if you do & don't give up, you WILL get an A with Dr. Chang.

I got a B+ in this class. I was 2% away from an A-. Had I not thrown up during the 2nd midterm, I believe I would have gotten an A-. Dr. Chang is an amazing professor! He has an accent, but he is absolutely hilarious in class. Out of all the professors at OSU, Chang is the easiest, no questions asked. Curve is amazing!

Great professor who teaches the content in fun, memorable ways. 2 midterms and 1 cumulative final. No hw except for wkly recitation worksheet (only graded for extra credit). 8 recitation quizzes and 2 lowest are dropped. Very fast-paced so definitely have to put in the work outside of class to succeed. Vry accessible in office hrs and outside class
dr. chang is the best ochem professor at osu by far. all my homies love dr. chang
such a sweet man. Gives a lot of extra credit and tells you exactly what is on all of the exams before hand.

Dr. Chang is one of the best professors I had at OSU. Wish I had him for Ochem 1. Wants to see his students succeed and emphasizes he wants to see who really studies in the class. With the vast amount of practice he provides you, you will see much of what he wants you to learn beforehand and will feel better about going into quizzes and exams.

Dr. Chang has been my favorite professor at OSU! I had him for both OChem 1 + 2. I was very worried about OChem given its rep, but he made things fun + easier to understand. I enjoyed his lectures + he was always willing to make time for students in and out of class. His quizzes/exams were fair and he is quick to regrade + correct mistakes.
