I took his class last year and it wasn't easy. But this year is much more easier. If u come to his lecture, pay attention to what he says and finish more of the homework problems, the exam will not be that hard. To get a good grade is not easy, but u do learn things in his lecture. Also, he is a responsible professor and very helpful.

It is possible to receive a good grade in this class but several hours of out of class studying and dedication is necessary. He is a great resource and always has his door open for questions and extra help. Difficult class, amazing teacher.
Really tough. Work your schedule to avoid him. If you're ok with studying three to four hours a day then it should be ok, but if you're like me and learn mostly from lecture you'll have a hard time

Zellmer is the best teacher I have ever had.  He is willing to help and synthesizes material in the text very well during his lectures.  I still go to him today for any Chemistry questions.  His exams are tough, usually average of a D+/C-; but if you are reasonably smart and put in the necessary work, an A is not that far out of reason.
Zellmer's class is very difficult, especially his 1250 section. But if you study your  butt off you'll do fine. MAKE SURE YOU TAKE ALL PRACTICE EXAMS. They are VERY good representations of his exams.

Anybody on here that posts Zellmer isn't helpful is lying.  Sends tons of emails, help pages for all experiments, practice problems for rough chapters and will bend over backwards for you if you show you are working hard.  Exams are challenging but thats it.  Go to lecture, do the homework and its no problem.

Knows his stuff, probably a little too well. He likes to let you know that you're wrong  but only because he knows people don't do the HW... you will definitely learn a lot of things in this class... but only if you study... A LOT! the homework is not hard, just time consuming and if you do the homework then the quizzes and exams are pretty easy.

Great professor, very knowledgable. HOWEVER, if you want to pass with a good grade, you MUST spend several hours a day studying the material that he covers each day. Exams are VERY difficult if you do not do enough work outside of class. Very large curve normally, D+ my term.

Dr. Zellmer is a great professor and although it was very hard, it is possible to do well with a lot of hard work. I basically failed the first midterm, but then crunched down and studied and ended up with an A- in the class. Dr. Zellmer also spends a lot of time devoted to his students, he comes to all the labs and even the review sessions.
Curved our class to a D+.  Enough said.  Do not take if you wish to pass.

The best Chem teacher ever!!!!! you will learn so much from him. His passion is so contagious you 'll be want to come to his lectures. He is so nice and helpful in office hours, he is always available to help :-)

He's a superb lecturer.  Knows his stuff.  But he's trying to make you feel overwhelmed.  Don't let the pressure get to you, but use his website and read all his notes...they're really helpful.  Exams are miserable, so pray for a good curve.

Knows what he's talking about but does not respect confused students. His tests are very complicated if you do not understand all of the material, there is no way to give an average effort and expect to pass his course.

The best professor one could ask for, in every sense. Yes, he's intense and his exams, labs, and quizzes are incredibly hard. But you will never find a more dedicated, available, interested professor, or a better preparation for the MCAT. If you work hard in his class, you will destroy the MCAT and be 100 times the student you were when you entered
Soooo hard...He gives few As. He said that his class has an average of C, if this class turned out to get an average of B, he will curve it to C... What kind of prof he is?!

Finally a prof who speaks beautiful English and cares number one about helping the student learn the material.  He gives you so many resources to learn the material.  If you put half the effort he does into the course, you will get an A.  His attitude is off putting, scolds you the whole times.
hard class, with a lot of hard work an A is achievable. have to get over his attitude, he really does want you to do well in the class though

He doesn't care if you pass his class, but if YOU care he will do anything in his power to help you help yourself. I find him knowledgeable and enthusiastic, even if I hate chemistry. You don't have to do well in the class as long as others do worse, the curve is usually pretty generous.

LOVE THIS MAN. Despite what you may hear, he is the most helpful professor I have ever had and does everything humanly possible to help you succeed. Go to his office hours and live by the textbook. I completely failed the first midterm, went to him for advice and ended up getting a B+ on the final and the overall class. Take his class seriously.
hard class, but do the assigned prob you will be fine. Don't take any hard class with this one. You have to spend more than 10 hour every week to get good grade.
He is hard,  but go to his lecture and do the assigned problems, you will be fine. Don't take any hard class with it. You have to spend more than 10h every week.

Great professor. Probably the best professor in the chemistry department because he works very hard for his students to succeed. Very intimidating and I never went to his office hours because of that. Don't be a chicken like me! I actually did better in my other classes because of his study tips.
Great teacher. First exam is difficult and throws you off but after that you get the hang of it. Really easy if you put in the time on homework problems. Good experience overall.

Zellmer is a great professor! He teaches the material very well, so that you can understand it! He is challenging, but what chem professor isnt? Do all his practice hw problems, and you'll get an A. His practice exams are fairly similar to the real exams, but not exactly alike. He may appear to be mean, but he's a nice guy and wants you to succeed!

Hard, but good. Do what he asks of you and you'll be fine. Read the textbook and DO ALL THE SUGGESTED PROBLEMS, and you will understand the material. He is very active with his students. Help is available when needed. A good grade in his class is achievable, but you have to work.

Scary guy. He's incredibly intimidating the first time you meet him. HOWEVER, his notes are some of the best and most organized notes I have ever seen a teacher give to their class. I didn't go to his office hours because I was too scared, but I would suggest you go with well-prepared questions, not stupid ones.

HE IS EXTREMELY HELPFUL.  HE WANTS YOU TO COME TO HIS OFFICE HOURS FOR EXTRA LEARNING.  HELPS OUTSIDE OF CLASS.  EXAMS WERE OK WANTS YOU TO BE WITH HIM IN CLASS.  I WOULD DEFF RECOMM HIM FOR 122 OR 125.  SENIOR PROF IN DEPT.   CLASS CURVE GIVES AN APP C+ TO MOST STUDENTS.  A LITTLE WORK HARD CAN GET YOU A OR B.  DEFF RECOMM HIM.  I GOT B

Dr. Zellmer is by far the best professor I've had so far. He made material I thought was impossibly hard in high school easy to digest. He puts in a ton of work to help his students--he's worked out all the hw problems online, step by step. If you're willing to put in the effort and not screw around you'll be fine and really appreciate the material

Mr. Zellmer is MY FAVORITE professor.  He cares so much about his students.  Unlike my chem 122 prof, he was extremely clear and he gives us step-by-step what to do for lab reports.  He makes the hard material seem easy

Dr. Zellmer was a great professor! He's my favorite that I've had so far. He wants every student to succeed in his class and he works numerous hours outside of class to help with an questions you have! I would take this class if you can!

Zellmer is excellent. I believed his practice exams were a good representation of the actual tests. The lab quizzes were hard but they prepare you for the level you will be tested at on exams. I appreciate that he would make appearances to lab and see how  the students and TA's were doing.

Although he offered a ton of help (emails, lecture, etc) it was almost too much information. Unless you're willing to put A LOT of time into this class, you're going to do poorly. Dr. Zellmer's quizzes and exams were very comprehensive and difficult. I have to retake this course, I got 500/1000 points in the class. -_-

My highschool AP Chemistry was not that great and this was my first college chemistry class. I started out really terribly with the quizzes and 1st midterm, but after meeting with him, I'm bordering an A-/A! He told me exactly what I needed to do to improve. Definitely Take this class if you're willing do put in some effort.
He did not require that homework was turned in so it was hard to stay on track just on my own but he was a great lecturer and I recommend him highly.

Dr. Zellmer is my favorite teacher at OSU.  Teaching is his life.  He sends like 100 e-mails a day.  He really just wants you to succeed and learn.  Obviously it's a hard class it's chem 122, but he does literally everything he can to help you.  the grade you get is really up to your effort

Your dream, drive to achieve, and hearts desire were placed within you at the beginning of time.... do not let his statements, attitudes or perceptions deter you.  He has reached his professional ceiling and is jealous of your successful drive towards your destiny.  Blue and Green faced ratings are true depictions.  He does no mean well for you.

This teacher is prejudice, rude, and he feels as if he is always right.  He is really not a good teacher, at all. Take it at Columbus State... with the rest of us. The class average was an F for the first test and he does not post the solutions to the exam until 7 weeks after, so you cant even see what you did wrong and why you got things wrong.

Dr Z, while at first seems quite overpowering and intimidating, is a GREAT teacher and good guy. He has cool demos and tried to make class fun. He's helpful by sending out emails for exactly what is on each quiz and exam. He also gives you an exam review that is EXACTLY the same format as the real one! Best college professor I've ever had.
HE was always available for help and has been the best college professor I have had thus far.

Dr. Zellmer is an awesome teacher.  Everything he explains is crystal clear.  He gives difficult exams with all the tricks on them but if you do all assigned practice problems you will be more than prepared to handle the tricks.  I feel very well prepared for the next class.  Take him if you can.
The guy came in on Sundays and did test reviews with us. I have never had a teacher put in that much effort into a class. Exceptional teacher.

Well If your a Chem Major he will teach you what you need to know and it will stick. go to every lecture, do every thing he says to do and you will pass. Take this class with easy non science classes you will need the extra study time. He is hard but fair and he curves so dedicate your self and you will do fine.
One of the best professors I've had. His tests were hard, but he is eager to help students and he puts a lot of effort into helping students learn the material, especially with lab hints.
tough but good

The class was very well taught. He sells all of his notes but you have to fill them in so it is worth going to class. He teaches straight from the book so as long as you read you should have no trouble

Definitely a difficult class if the time is not put in.  But if you put in the effort you will do fine.  This class is not like any other and you actually have to study but if you do you WILL LEARN CHEMISTRY with this man.

I cannot believe all the good ratings this guy is getting. We just had our first midterm and the class avg was a 65%.. for an intro class how does that happen? I've taken 2 other brief chem courses in college and i still think this is tough... i would never recommend this guy
Very hard course, if he weren't as helpful as he is it would have been a disaster
Very hard teacher. has a very negative attitude and doesnt ever look happy. if you go to his office hours, he will talk down to you more than help
The amount of work one must put in to do well is a little ridiculous. But, he is knowledgable and willing to help. Weird dude.
Cool guy. Very easy to approach, seems intimidating at first but is very helpful.
well..the Dr. in front of his name is legit. He knows his stuff but to me the class was very difficult. Definitely do whatever he tells you to study.

Review the section before lecture, thoroughly read it afterward. Spend at least two hours a day on reading and working problems. This is the advice he gave me after i failed the first midterm. This class is very hard. He is helpful but only if you put in extensive amounts of work. Very intimidating but very knowledgeable. Good luck.

He takes teaching this class very seriously. He sends out numerous emails that you must check. You really have to stay on top of everything to do well in this class. Even doing so, you are not guranteed a good grade. He does want you to learn, but this class is very difficult. Not too fair of a grader either.

One of the best professors I have ever had. He is dedicated to his students and is always available to help. He responds to e-mails very quickly and usually really throughly. His tests are hard, but if you listen to his advice and do the homework and read the textbook, you will do fine.

Zellmer is an amazing teacher! I would say one of the best I'm going to have during my time at Ohio State. YOU HAVE TO GO TO CLASS TO SUCCEED! Alot of the examples he does in class end up on quizzes and exams. You have to stay on top of reading and homework or the class will be very difficult!
Class is very difficult if you don't enjoy chemistry. Most people in 125 don't. He teaches well but you have to be willing to learn.

He is very headstrong and likes the students that do well in his class. He is strict, but as long as you do the homework problems and go to lecture, you will do fine on his quizzes and exams. He is there to help the students, although he is intimidating and does not communicate that he wants his students to do well.

This is an extremely difficult class for me, but Dr. Zellmer really is there to make sure you learn.  He sends out a lot (and I mean a lot) of emails but they are usually helpful.  Sucky class, but very knowledgeable and helpful professor.
Great Professor!  He always had lots of ways to study for tests and if you did all the homework and practice tests/quizzes he provided, you will do well!!

YOU WILL LEARN CHEMISTRY IF YOU TAKE THIS CLASS.  Zellmer will be quite intimidating at first but he truly just wants you to learn! He has awesome demonstrations and is SO knowledgeable.  Definitely print off his notes and go to his office hours.

Very good professor. He is extremely willing to help students, and makes every effort for students to succeed. His class is pretty difficult, but you will learn a lot. I'm glad I took 122 from Dr. Zellmer.

Zellmer is an amazing teacher, he actually makes lecture interesting with his experiments and examples and cares very much about his students and does what he can to help them. If people are complaining about him its because they don't work hard enough in the class - its not an easy class but having Zellmer makes the material more comprehensible.
Great Professor.  Humorous.  Absolutely loved his class

Overall, he is a great professor and actually likes to teach chemistry. Only downside is that the class is VERY VERY hard. It is definitely difficult to keep up in this course while managing 2 or 3 three other, equally as important, classes. Especially come exam time...
Dr. Zellmer is an AWESOME professor.  Definitely take this class!!!

Dr. Zellmer is terrifying. He starts every lecture with an amusing anecdote about failing a student, and takes great joy in failing those who are about to graduate. I have been working on chem lab for six hours now and I am still not done. This class is god-awful, save yourself and your sanity and do NOT TAKE IT.

He can be very intimidating but once you approach him he is very kind and extremely willing to help. You have to work hard in his class but in the end your  grade will reflect the effort you have put forth. But you NEED to go to class or else you will be really lost and do the practice problems he assigns, they will help!

Dr. Zellmer seems scary at first, or hard to approach. I struggled at the beginning of class, and finally I started going to his office hours. He's very helpful!! Go to your TA's office hours for help on labs too. DON'T BE AFRAID OF HIM! You'll learn a lot in this class. Go to study sessions and do the practice exams --Very Important!***

Extremely hard, but he knows exactly what he's talking about and he conveys the information very well. He sounds scary and mean, but he's very kind if you attend his office hours. He's just naturally a brisk guy. The only thing that will hurt is that he only curves the average as much as he needs to, so anyone below will fail.

Zellmer is a really good prof, gives a lot of info and clear notes. Going to lectures and using his notes packet helps. Use his website and read his emails for help. He's full of himself, but will help if you ask! 122 material is a bit more interesting than 121. Difficult though! Study your ass off & you'll do avg.

Makes 101 seem like Chem 121. Exams are quite difficult and time is always short. Weekly quizzes are slightly easier. Loves giving trick questions. Lectures are boring and half the content discussed goes above the head. Avoid this professor at all costs!!

hard teacher but I learned  a lot. To pass be sure to review lecture slides daily and do a whole bunch of practice problems. Dont let his harsh tone and yelling in class stop you from going to get help during offie hours. Be sure to follow his guidelines for lab reports.

Honestly this man may be the best proffesor in OSU's chemistry department. He conveys his lecture with great clarity with little or almost no personal notes. Its quite simple actually because he gives you the outline on how to get an A. He has his own website that has all the resources you need, he pratically takes the course for you.

Here's the secret: go to lecture,  he tells you EXACTLY what you are expected to know.  For the midterms and final: study ALL the quizzes, he posts all their solutions online and are the exact kind of problems you will see on the final!  He couldn't make things easier for anyone who cares enough to do the work.

He knows what he's teaching. Although some people say he is a hard teacher, you have to realize that this is a hard class, and he had already tried his best to make this class as easy to understand as he could. I strongly recommend him if you actually plan to learn some chemistry
terribly, unnecessarily, overtly and intentionally way too hard. the worst part is taht since he worked us so hard and it was so painful that i don't remember it.

Best chemistry teacher I've had. This is a very tough subject, but he had a knack for breaking things apart for us to make things easier than expected. Tests and quizzes are EXTREMELY difficult, and do require a lot of studying. But it definitely pays off. I highly recommend Prof Z for future chem 122 students.

Zellmer expects a lot from his students however he is really willing to help them.  He makes chemistry actually sound fun and his lectures are always interesting.  Definitely buy his notes from uniprint and use them durng lecture.  Be prepared to work hard but you will learn a lot

He really knew his stuff - very smart guy. He does demand a lot from his students but the work he asks you to do is the best way to master the material, so if you sacrifice part of your life for 10 weeks then you are really gonna get it.

He scared me, and basically told me how I will fail his class and graduate school. But he knows what he is talking about, and is very organized. If you read the book and do all the homework, you'll live.
My brain still hurts.

I loved this cranky old guy.  Go to UniPrint and get his notes.  If you study his notes and do some of the homework, this class is very easy.  I didn't go to his office hours, but he always offered them so I guess that's good.  Labs suck because it's three hours of your life you'll never get back, but overall the guy is a good lecturer & very fair.
Toughest teacher i have ever encountered!!!

Awesome! By far, the best teacher I've had at OSU so far. He is extremely helpful and a very nice guy. Go see him in office hours at least once, he's very personable. Be prepared to work very hard, but learn a lot. I did not go to class too often, but read the book for the exams and got a B (68% overall). Zellmer is the best Chem 122 teacher.

dr. zellmer was very well organized and was an expert in the field. he was a good lecturer, too. from the very first day of class though, his whole "it's not my problem" speech made me assume that he was a jerk and didn't want his students to succeed, even if they do make a mistake.  tests were fair, his personality was just harsh.

Prof. Zellmer comes off pretty blunt at first, but towards the end of the quarter he begins to lighten up a little. Doing practice problems is a must if you want to do well. His tests aren't too bad but you need to study. His notes are provided but you have to buy them. Overall best teacher Ive had so far here at Ohio State. He's very helpful.

Wow...Just Wow this is by far one of the hardest chemistry professors I've ever encountered. But he is very helpful and as someone said earlier...he certianly does pride himself on the difficulty of his class. But he's there to teach if you want an easy chemistry class please DO NOT TAKE THIS INSTRUCTOR...if you still do...likeme you've been warned

This man is a fantastic lecturer. The material is difficult, but he explains it thoroughly and does his best to make himself available if you need extra help. Posts incomplete notes on Carmen and completes the examples in class. Also, he's a ton of fun. Have your cell phone camera ready when he takes out the LCD screen...

Zellmer is a decent teacher. he is extremely fair. he is straight forward, tells you what homework problems to do to prepare for quizes and exams. he is not an easy grader at all, my lab grades were well below what they were for 121. but if you dont mind putting in a little effort, the class is not too terrible. there is a fairly large curve also.

He is very rude and disrespectful i will recomand not to take his class. (hadii aad soomali tahay please never take his class, he is really bad guy adaneh waa dadka yaska kujiro oo majeclo dadka muslimka ah)

very hard teacher. if you are only taking 121/122 dont take him. However he is fair he tells you what is on stuff and is rediculous with emails. If you have 2-3 hours (litterally) a day to spend on chem then u will be fine

Humility is not one of his strong points but hes a good prof. Sometimes during class, like today, he will randomly got mad after hearing a girl laugh and i didnt feel like listening to him anymore. he does look pretty good after a hair cut though, watch out ladies

If you plan to take the MCAT or you plan to pursue a career or research involving an in depth knowledge of chemistry then this class will prepare you better than any general chemistry class out there. IF you simply need general chemistry(i.e. 121-122) consider another professor if you are looking for an easier time.

Great class, and great teacher. The TA's suck, so if you get behide or confused go to him and he'll help you. You have to keep up in the class, it's not an easy class. But if you work hard, practice and study you'll do fine. And there's a curve at the end. Bets thing, you learn a ton in a short amount of time.

Very difficult class for myself personally. A lot of material is covered in a short amount of time. Lectures were pretty much worthless, I usually ended up going on youtube and watched other professors teach specifics needed for quizzes. Zellmer is a nice guy, he tries to be helpful, but the quizzes/exams are ridiculously hard...

DONT DO IT! I know being in his class may mean Fridays off but dont! I went to every lecture, I did every problem, I met with him once a week and felt like i knew the material very well, but when it came time for tests it was like I never picked up a book they were so hard!

His class is really hard but he is an excellent teacher. Assigns lots of homework problems but has all of the answers FULLY worked out online. Exams questions come from these. He seems mean at first but he really is the best.

the material is basic, i never did the homework and thought the tests were pretty straight forward; heard he is helpful in office hours too but i wouldn't know... if you do poorly in this class switch majors

Dr. Zellmer is a great proffesor. He is clear and the quiz and exams are very relevant to his lectures. You can get an A+. It's all about how much you work, but as far as the pro goes, he is fair in his exam and in everything else. Learned alot in his class!
Going to lecture is a must as well as homework. This class is almost exactly like 121.

Zellmer is the most thorough Prof I have ever had. He holds students to high standards so, in order to do well, you have to work your butt off.  He advises that you do all homework problems, treat practice exams like real exams (time yourself, etc) & come to lecture/ask questions. I did what he said and did well. Helpful in office hours as well.

Excellent teacher. One of the best I have had at OSU. Yes he is difficult but the material is not easy either. Study, read, do the hw problems& go in for office hours oh AND go to class. Always willing to help and he is understanding (IF you are doing everything you can). Also, very funny. Crystal clear notes (if you go to class). 2 thumbs up

Better person than a teacher. Was willing to help any student ad nauseam. His exams weren't as bad as most people would have you believe however his quizzes were impossible. I would get 40% on quizzes and 85% on exams because of nit picky grading rubrics. Earned a B+ with about 10-12 hours of study all quarter.
boring with hard exams
i studied for a quiz for at least 3 hours and still got an F.  Still taking the class so im about to get a tutor and see how it goes after this point.
He's a decent professor at best

Wow, never before have I actually worked like I worked in this class. I studied so hard I can hardly believe it, and I did just fine in 121(got a B)with almost no studying at all. What do I have to show for it? A very bad grade and major concern about my future. Thinks good exams involve a ton of trick questions, prides self on overdifficulty.AVOID
If there is another option, take it.  Chem 122 should not be this hard.  Thank God I passed this class.  He actually failed 1/4 of the class.  This was 2 years ago, maybe he's changed.
Full of humor,good teacher

I had Prof. Zellmer as a sub for half a quarter - it was hard to adjust to his teaching style: ridgid and to the point.  He did try to give us adaquate review sessions for midterms and finals, but I felt he didn't really relay the info in a way that was easy for a student who had never taken chem before.

Very hard teacher. I would recommend doing the practice problems. He was always willing to adjust his schedule for his students. Expect a lot of e-mails from him every week! All in all, very good professor.. just a tough course.

Must go to lecture. Must do HW problems. Must study. Has a kind of "God" complex. Expects you to know everything by the time finals roll around. Helpful outside of class. Not intimidating but thinks he is. Probably the best out of all chem prof... Which doesn't say much. The whole undergrad chem. dept. is very demanding but he's probably the best.

Zellmer is an extremely helpful professor if you take advantage of your resources. He provides you with all the notes you need for the year, and very detailed solutions to ALL math problems for h/w, quizzes and past tests online. The class is VERY demanding but he does everything possible to help students. Warning- hes quite intimidating and strict

Zellmer is a great professor, possibly the best one I have had at OSU.  His notes are great and lecture can be interesting.  Quizzes and tests can be hard, but if you do the homework (which he provides detailed answers for) then you should do fine.

By far the best professor I've had. He really knows what he's talking about and conveys it so the students can actually understand. Make sure you listen to him when he tells you to do the homeword. Be sure to spend a decent amount of time on the class and you will do well. I highly reccommend this class to anyone!

Don't go in expecting an easy A like many people did in Chem 121.  Even in you're the type of person who doesn't have to work to get the good grades, you should still be ready to work.  He makes it easier by telling you EXACTLY what to do.  Best advice, go to class and listen to every word the man says and do all/most of the homework he assigns.

Overall, a great professor. He really knows his subject and is able to teach it well. applies subject matter to real life situations to make the class interesting. expect to work hard to earn your grade in the class because the subject matter is difficult. if you need help, he will always be available he has plenty of office hours and sends emails.

Don't listen to the ass below this post. For all of you that actually work hard for your grades, you need to put a lot of effort to get a good grade. Lectures are honestly never boring b/c he practically yells in the microphone, but it helps to skim the book beforehand. Exams are fair and quizzes are actually easy. Expect about 100 emails weekly.

Easy class, i don't understand whats so difficult; some of the questions on his tests are tricky but if you look at the notes it's pretty straight forward... i can't even say that i had to study much because he was good at teaching; he will try to intimidate you saying stuff about how you need to do the homeworks but i never had to
Don't do it!!! Even if it means Fridays off, don't do it!!!

He is an extremely demanding professor and he knows what he wants. Even the TAs seen intimidated by him, but he's definitely helpful during office hours. Spend at LEAST 15 hours studying per week and an A should be achievable. He actually prefers if you visit him during o.h. and/or emailing him, so do it. Overall, I think he's a great professor.

Zellmer separates the men from the boys. His motto: If I have educated a student who will be a future doctor operating on me, I will make sure he knows his stuff. He is a tough, but fantastic teacher.  I have studied 12-16 hours per quiz and have an A. If you want it badly enough, it can be earned. Don't listen to all of the other complainers.
He prepares his lecture extremly well. He like to help by all means.

Dr. Zellmer is a great professor.  His class is hard, but if you put enough time into it you can get a decent grade.  Also, Dr. Zellmer seems intimidating, but he will do anything to help his students, so if you get behind make sure to go to his office hours and he will sit down with you as long as you need.
Very demanding but willing to help students do well at all costs.

This class is difficult, but it is not because of Dr. Zellmer.  The material is hard, but he does a good job of explaining it.  His exams are hard and the average on the final is usually between 50 and 60 (mine was 55).  If you do the work, you can get a decent grade.
His lectures are just straight talking with no breaks.  He's very helpful though.
crystal clear explanation, very helpful-make sure you visit his office hours, exams questions can be tricky but curves can save your butt...I love Dr. Zellmer!!!

Dr. Zellmer is pretty intimidating at first, but when you go to his office hours, he is very nice and helpful.  His lectures are very informative and he personally holds review sessions for each midterm run by him, not the TAs.

If you go to his class, read his lecture notes, do the practice problems in the book, and attend lab sessions...you will be fine! He is a little intimidating, but he wants his students to do well and he is willing to answer any questions! There will be a curve at the end of the class-so no worries if your grades arent great at first!
very serious in class, moves extremely quickly

Unless you really like chemistry and understand it well, 122 with Dr. Zellmer will be difficult, not necessarily because of dr. Zellmer, although he could be a bit less strict,but because of the material.
AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!  Best prof ever!!!

Zellmer is hard. He expects alot out of his students. BUT, Zellmer also does everything he can to help you succeed. His notes and lectures are crystal clear if you want to learn the material. If you don't go to class or you sleep in class his tests and quizzes will be impossible. However, if you show up and attempt to learn, you will do fine.

ZEllMER ROCKS! I had him for winter quarter and loved him. The material is hard, and he is quite demanding but he prepared me, so it was worth it. USE OFFICE HOURS!!! He really helped me out, and i got to understand the way he teaches more. THUMBS WAY UP!!!

Worst teacher I have had in my life. I didn't believe all of the comments on ratemyprofessor but they're true. DO NOT TAKE CHEM 101 WITH ZELLMER. I cannot stress it enough. Even if you study 15+ hours a week it still doesn't pay off.  I had straight A's until I took this class. Zellmer makes this class WAY too difficult for an into level.DON'T TAKE

Zellmer is the best professor in the undergrad chem department. I retook chem 122 after the disaster that is Loza and Zellmer is clear, provides notes, and online help. He is strict and straightforward but hey its college and not high school. 122 is never going to be easy, but he does the best job BY FAR compared to whomever else you could get.

he is a great teacher!  however, i would not suggest him if you are not interested in chemistry or are just looking for an easy A.  He makes you work hard but really helps you understand the info.  always available to help you if you need it.

Zellmer's class is difficult. Exams and quizzes are very challenging, but not impossible. He expects alot, and if you do what he suggests you will get a good/decent grade. He's extremely stimulating; awesome lecturer. He's funny and lectures are organized and usually interesting or atleast bearable. He'll help you if you actually go to him. A+ prof
Not someone I'd write home about.  Class isn't impossible simple because a lot of the people in the class do so bad it helps you out.  Demos are cool, what he expects us to know isn't.

Dr. Zellmer is a horrible teacher. He expects everyone to be Chem majors and know everything there is to know about Chem in 101. He is not helpful, rude, arrogant and a jerk. If you don't have prior knowledge of Chem or a good TA you're out of luck. DO NOT LET THIS MAN TEACH YOU. YOU WON'T PASS.

Zellmer is rude and entirely too demanding for a 100 level class. He seems to think that everyone in 101 is a chem major and that his is the only class you're taking. His notes are unclear/undetailed and he will give you no help whatsoever. If you don't have a good TA, you're out of luck. Avoid this man!!

just because he says "do the homework" doesn't mean you need to bust your balls doing it... i find that by just going to his lectures and paying attention that it really isnt that hard; tests are straight forward as well

He was a very good professor. Get his notes at uniprint and use them. His tests are demanding but if you attend lecture and review his notes from uniprint you can do vey well. Very possible to get an A if you listen in class and really review the notes

Dr. Zellmer is a pretty nice guy who manages to be pretty funny during lecture. He does a lot of interesting demos and gives the best notes youll ever get if you buy them from Uniprint. It makes the class much easier if you study before each quiz a little bit, and just do some of the homework problems and read the notes and you'll be fine. easy A.

Basically Dr. Zellmer assumes that you are only taking his class. He expects you to do the HW which consist of almost every problem in the back on each chaper (like 100) and is useless in terms of help inless you do all the hw. His test where ridiculous, and the curve was lousy. Take this class at c-state. Ps. he also looks like a corpse.

Dr. Zellmer is a very hard teacher and has high expectations of his students. He is good at what he does and he is very straight forward. The first day of class he told us that this would be the hardest chem we would take but we would learn the most. Just follow his suggestions and you will make it through and learn a lot.
really good lecturer at least

I really liked the way that Zellmer taught. His lecture notes we're really detailed & we're the only things I studied for the course. He's definitely intimidating, but if you study & are confident when taking the tests, you'll do fine. I'd definitely not recommend him if you're not willing to put in any effort. Still one of favorite professors.

First test average, 58%! He likes to trick you on the test. Expects you to put about 40 hours a week to get an A! He gives you about 60 problems a week (I counted), read EVERYTHING between in the chapters, and do all the problems in between the section. My advice DON'T take his class. Worst teacher...take it from a previously straight A student.

Not the greatest teacher in the world, but by no means the worst.  He can be a jerk sometimes but so can most people.  He's presents the material in an organized way, is pretty straightforward, and he is easy to understand.  I got a B+, and I could have tried a little harder and I would have had an A.

I love this man! People who complain about him are just afraid of doing real work. Yes, at first he's intimidating, and yes, he expects a lot, but if you put in the effort, he goes above and beyond to help you understand the material. Definitely my favorite professor so far.
He was really rude for my chemistry class. He talks to you like you are in first grade again. The only good thing about him is that he has his notes online, other than that he is really rude.
Switch profs!! He's terrible. His class is impossible. He insults his class and expects an incoming freshman to have the same amount of knowledge about chemistry as he does. Worst professor.
Awesome. Zellmer made pretty boring stuff pretty intresting. Definitely recommend him.
No Comments

A lot of you guys are pretty stupid, if you expect a college class to be easy just because you don't want to work.  The class is hard and I hate it, but the instructor is easy to understand, and doesn't seem so bad.  I'll change this entry if my grade sucks, though.
BAD PROFESSOR, OVERLY DIFFICULT CLASS.

Avoid this guy at all costs. Seriously. There is about a 5% curve, but unless you're a REALLY gifted chemistry student  or have no other life outside of Chemistry, switch professors immediately. The homework load is HUGE, tests are impossible, and his lectures are too fast-paced to actually remember anything. Oh, and did I mention he's a prick?
Very nice teacher, eager to help. You really have to want it to get an A in this class, no matter how good the teacher is.

The absolute worst professor I've ever had.  He insults his students daily, and going to class will not help you at all.  Even the weekly quizzes are impossible.  He treats everyone without a PhD in chemistry like crap.  The only good thing about the class was the high curve.

ok...so this guys exams are very tough as well as the class in general, but i think he honestly wants people to do well, holds review sessions, and has a pretty useful home page. all i have to say is read his questions on the exams very in depth. they are very tricky. it's a difficult class yes, but if you study, you should do fine. hefty curve too

ok...so this guys exams are very tough as well as the class in general, but i think he honestly wants people to do well, holds review sessions, and has a pretty useful home page. all i have to say is read his questions on the exams very in depth. they are very tricky. it's a difficult class yes, but if you study, you should do fine. hefty curve too

seemed to care about students' grasp of the material although it was overall very difficult. I would credit my TA with my getting a decent grade as it is a difficult course, especially for a GEC. attend his exam reviews as they are very helpful and all the lectures if you can. he is willing to help if you ask for it

Dr. Zellmer is a very hard instructor.  Sometimes he can make class fun and he is very willing to help.  He is a nice guy but his class is ridiculously hard.  Be ready for a lot of work when you sign up for his class.

i worked my ass off in this class and it didn't even pay off. The averages for the exams are EXTREMELY low! He designs his exams especially to trick you. I hope you get a good TA or a private tutor because that's the only way I survived. He makes you HATE chemistry.
Very hard, unclear, alot of work and very time consumeing

ok ok i have to say zellmer is the hardest prof. i have ever had and the class is so hard and to be in class he seems to be an intollerable instuctor but.i went to him outside of class and he was more than willing to help and he wasnt as bad as he comes off in class..the quizes and exams suck ass and i hate timed test with not enough time to do it

As an engineering student I had to take his class, and I learned nothing. All he does is yell at you all lecture long, he's the Drill Sargent of chemistry. If you don't have to take his class, don't, if you do, be prepared to do poorly.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF..he is the hardest and meanest person you will ever meet.  He tells you everday that you are going to fail his class no matter what.  He makes you feel like you dont know anything when you go to his office hours and his test are impossible..DROP IT ASAP or you will regret it

GREAT teacher.  Always available for help outside of lecture.  There is no reason to complain about how hard this class is if you don't go to him for extra help.  He really wants to help students and he cares about us understanding the material.  Just don't be lazy and go get help!  He knows what he is doing :)
Zellmer is hard and makes you work for your grade, but he is excellent at getting the material across.  This guy really knows his stuff and is more than happy to help you understand the material.

Zellmer was the best teacher i have ever had at Ohio State.  His tests and quizzes are harder than other profs, but they are fair.  He is always available for help and you can buy his notes so you don't have to worry about copying everything down. If you don't mind a bit of work, go with Zellmer, he's by far the best.

I was going pre-med before I entered his class, then I CHANGED MY MIND.  All the possitive posts, IGNORE THEM.  Its probably zellmer trying to pull his ratings up. Exams are hell, lectures are fast and he is rude, quizzes are as hard as other prof's midterms.  An impossible class, if you see him as your teacher SWITCH IMMDEDIATELY.

One word to sum Zellmer up, hes a ****.  His exams are hell.  When you are taking his exams, its like you are passing through Dante's Inferno, and you're gona be raped by the flames.  Exams- Impossible.  His lectures are boring, and he yells and screams constantly.  He's rude to everyone, and doesn't care about your opinions or thoughts.  HORRID

The worst teacher I have ever had.  He makes you work like a dog, and his exams are comepltely bulled from his bung hole.  Shoot yourself in the head if you have him.  Save yourself the time and effort of living through 122...

Utterly horrid in all aspects.  He expects you to do 100 problems per week.  His lectures are taught at lightning speed. DONT TAKE DR. ZELLMER!!!
Jump of a cliff if you have this guy. -enough said-

The worst professor I have ever had. He's rude, sarcastic, mean and any other negative word that comes to mind. His exams do NOT reflect his lecture at all. He makes everything harder than it is. DO NOT TAKE ZELLMER. The positive reviews are bogus.

He expects a lot and moves pretty fast through the material.  He is a pretty good teacher, though, and makes himself more available than any professor I have ever had.  If you go to his office hours, he is actually really helpful and not as intimidating as in lectures.
He was much better than the first chemistry teacher I had.

I did really well in class (A)but that's because I took AP Chem. I had a good background prior coming to this class. I have to admit however, that he was one of the WORST professors I have ever had. Do not ge fooled by the good reviews as I am sure they were written by Zellmer, himself. He's rude and screams at the top of his lungs!! RETIRE ALREADY
good lecturer, but the exams are difficult.  averages are very low.

Nightmare!  He expects engineers to enjoy chemistry.  Actually thought students have the same affinity for chemistry has he does. Teaches at a light speed pace and thinks you will do all 100 homework problems he assigns each week.

I really liked him. He seems intimidating at first, but expects you take the class seriously. If you do that you'll be fine. The exams were challenging, but with the curve I always came out okay. Words of advice: Go to office hour and do the homework. It will help sooo much
Only if I knew ahead of time how he was-I would have never taken Chem with him.
Terrible professor, too sarcastic and rude.
Do the practice problems he gives you out of the book! Also the exams are a lot like the practice exams he gives. Go to office hours if you have the time and are having trouble.

Wow, finally a professor that treats you like a college student and not a high schooler. Zellmer is very professional. He gives you the notes, homework solutions, and practice exams online. Read the book/notes, study the practice exams--the real exams are the same. Lecture isn't necessary really. He assigns a lot of HW, but you don't have to do it.
He is the best, he lets you use any edition of the book. He provides practice midterm with answers and the solutions to the homework problems.

not recommended. Zellmer knows his stuff extremely well, but that bad part is he expects you to know it as good as him. His tests are impossible. I understand all the material and still did poorly. Unless you have ur PhD in chem already or area co-author of the textbook, you will do poorly. hes kind of a nazi

His Bark is worse than his bite.  If you go to his office hours he's really helpful.  The class is pretty difficult, and theres a lot of work, and he definitely expects you to do it.  If you fail this class, its your own fault cause he makes himself available like no professor I;ve ever had.

Best chemistry teacher you could get if you really want to know the stuff.  Great notes available for download.  Tests and quizzes are exactly from homework.  Requires lots a work, but he helps you any way he can.

Bobby Z thinks chem 122 is the only class most of us take.  If you take all EASY classes, and chem 122, you should be fine.  Otherwise, tests are very difficult, and the average score on our quizzes is a 45%. Maybe. Expects you to read, and do 5 million problems a night.  Chemistry just isn't that interesting, im sorry.

wow, hard ass teacher, study!!!!! 1 chapter a week, 50+ hw problems a week, chem pre and post labs weekly and quizzes that compare to other classes midterms.  To say the least he is hard as all hell, good luck.  ;-)

I don't think there is anything wrong with a prof expecting you to know your stuff.  If you keep up with the homework and read the book, the class is a cakewalk.  Very intelligent, organized, competent prof.  I enjoyed his class a lot.  Helpful with lab and at office hours.  Good prof.
very arrogant.

Worst Prof. I have ever had.  No prof should ever make you think you are stupid and Bobby Z took pride in making his students feel stupid.  He once called us all blind idiots.  Avoid him at all costs.

Absolutely one of the worst professors I have ever had. Talks so loud that he doesnt even need the microphone thing. Notes are a little sonfusing. Tests are very difficult. PLEASE have some mercy for yourself and DO NOT take his classes.

He sucks terribly.

I would suggest studying twice as much for this class then normal because his quizes and midterms are pretty tough but if you study and REALY know the stuff you will be fine....getting his notes really helps!

Dr. Zellmer is essentially my hero. Dr. Zellmer was perhaps my favorite professor here. Those who criticize him probably didn't attend lecture, or do well on the exams. Study your notes and do the homework, and you will succeed in this class. The midterms are not that difficult, and he did curve in the end.

Highly knowledgeable and competent professor.  Sometimes cynical b/c he thinks students don't care.  Give detailed answer if you ask him question.  Lecture notes very thorough and neat w/ various coloring.  Exams & quizzes hard but fair if you studied & put time into understanding material.  Course may require large time dedication to understanding

he's really nice and very approachable when you need help outside of lecture. he thinks he's really funny and tells a lot of cheesy jokes that lighten the mood. the only thing i didn't like is he expects a lot from his students and his exams are really difficult.

Probably the best lecturor I've had...Very interesting to listen to, it was worth going to the lectures. Tough quizzes and tests, but keep up with the material and it's not so bad. Expects students to know their stuff.  Pretty hefty curve (usually around 10%) at the end of class.  Quizzes are the hardest part and there are 7 of them.  Tough class overall, but it's chemistry, what did you expect

summary_comment: The professor's teaching quality is generally average, with lectures described as boring and often requiring additional resources like YouTube for deeper understanding. While he prepares students adequately for exams through homework and recitations, the lectures themselves are seen as unengaging and sometimes lacking in thoroughness. Office hours are noted to be helpful for clarification.

Ratings.comment: He was pretty okay. Lectures were very boring. If I could, I'd give him a 2.5, right in the middle, because there really wasn't anything special. He does zoom for his classes, but you might have better luck turning to YouTube to find similar lectures. I ended up taking more from lab. I don't think he did enough in-class preparation for exams.

This professor didn't seem to care about teaching his class past 5pm, so good luck if you take this class in the evening. I always left the class needing to look at YouTube videos to actually learn the material. All in all, I am unconvinced this professor actually likes teaching this class at all and I would say good luck for anyone taking it.

Boring lecturer, just reading off slides. He does every lecture on Zoom, which makes it more tolerable. Definitely the class I put the most effort into. To any mechanical engineers taking this class, good luck.

Professor Chaffin is ok. He's lectures are extremely boring and difficult to sit through. It also seems as if he doesn't really care to be there; essentially he just reads off of the slides. He does prepare you decently well for the exams, but a lot of that is because of homework and recitation and not from lecture.

A lot of people are complaining about the tests but, in reality the tests aren't up to him they're up to the chemistry department which is notorious for being awful. In my experience he prepares you for the exams in the lectures. He also records lectures and gives lots of practice and gives exam hints in lecture.

Good professor, but speaks extremely slowly. You could probably 2x speed his voice and still understand his voice perfectly. He misses some things in lecture and some concepts required outside resources.

Chaffin teaches well, the lectures can definitely get boring - but they're clear and succinct. He's very willing to take questions and takes time to prepare you well for the exams. The exams are definitely tricky, but the practice exams he posts are very similar to tests in the course.
Good instructor. He'd help a lot during office hours for extra explanations.

Exams were mildly difficult but very similar to practice exams. Maintaining an A in the class is easy until the final, BEWARE. First few exams were passable with one/two days of studying, final was on a whole other level. Lectures were boring but helpful in understanding the material if you don't like to read the book.

Chaffin was the only option I had based on my schedule, and I wish I switched out sooner if possible. Exams were so hard and averages were very low. Practice exams were nothing like actual exam, no curves, but the only good thing I have to say is homework is unlimited attempts. Even though I passed, I may retake just for a better prof and grade.

Professor Chaffin was great! Lectures could be a little slow at times, but he greatly ensured that we knew all of the content. During his office hours, he would help every person one at a time if they had questions, being sure to thoroughly explain the answers to each question step by step
He was okay, mostly read from the slides but overall did a good job walking through several examples and explained things well in my opinion.

Dr Chaffin is a good professor. Although not mandatory, his lectures are greatly important. He also solves questions step by step, making it easy to follow. His lectures are on the slower side but the slides and material are greatly informative and important, and help a lot while preparing for the exams.

He was such a chill guy! The class itself wasn't difficult, and his lectures were very clear and concise. I loved his explanations of the content and how to solve problems - he explained just enough to help us understand the steps without spending too much time explaining elementary concepts. I started watching his lectures online later in the sem.
Incredibly slow lectures very hard to stay engaged. Not too much work, tests were worth most of the grade.

He's pretty decent. He knows his stuff and his always willing to answer questions. Goes over example problems in class to help us understand the material. He just goes a little too slow in lecture, but overall he's solid.

summary_comment: Professor Sevov is highly regarded for his exceptional lecturing skills and ability to break down complex concepts, making Organic Chemistry accessible through detailed notes and practice problems. However, his classes are challenging, with grades primarily determined by exams and problem sets, and he offers little structured support like homework or quizzes. Students find his exams particularly difficult but appreciate his thorough explanations and willingness to help during office hours.

Ratings.comment: Very hard class, but he is a great teacher. No matter who you take Organic Chemistry will be difficult but his lectures are very helpful and he posts all his lecture notes on Canvas right after class so they are very easy to access. Focus on doing practice problems rather than simply memorizing everything. And go to office hours he is very helpful.

Sevov is an amazing professor. He is very clear and explains concepts much more clearly than using the textbook alone. As with any Orgo class, you need to actually read and do work. If you don't understand Orgo 1, for example, you won't succeed in Orgo 2; so use time outside of class to brush up on those fundamentals and you'll do just fine.

Professor Sevov is not a good professor if you need structure for organic chemistry. Organic chemistry is a VERY tough class and he gives no graded homework, quizzes, or any sort of extra credit to help your grade, while other sections have those. Your grade is solely based on recitation packets and exams. Prepare to teach yourself everything.

Sevov did an awesome job of breaking down the concepts. I read the textbook along but I think he does a much better job at explaining so the textbook was not entirely needed. Only graded by exams and the recitation sets (10 points practice sheets). Overall a great class!

Sevov is an amazing lecturer! However, his exams are VERY difficult. He no longer does the 50% drop policy. I would say his exams are the hardest out of all professors, however, he does give a lot of practice. The class is graded on exams and problem sets only. It is possible to pass the class considering that AU22 got a generous curve.
Dr. Sevov was the best lecturer I have ever had. He was absolutely brilliant and I learned so much. Do not shy away from him, everything is very manageable. Truly fantastic guy.
Christo was the light of my Ochem career and I love him as a teacher. He also curves which is super helpful. We need to stop slandering Christo

Dr. Sevov was a nice professor, but his lectures had no correlation with the textbook or other professor's lectures. I am taking this class again, with another professor, and I am finding that there is actual vocab and multiple coursework sections that Sevov's lecture completely left out, which were only full of complex examples that made no sense.

There was almost no correlation between Dr. Sevov's lectures and his exams. He made everything almost 100 times more difficult and even those who knew what was going on were left baffled by his insane exams. He is a good guy and willing to help but in the end when it comes down to it, his exams are too difficult.

Dr. Sevov was a really clear lecturer. His exams were fairly difficult, but if you go to class, read the book, and practice you'll be fine. His 1/2 drop system for exam 2 was really nice, it's pretty much extra credit if you get above a 50% on the exam (average was 36%). Overall, good guy

Dr. Sevov is a great professor. He is clear in his lectures, and office hours are basically like another lecture. I suggest going to them. He has a 50% midterm drop which ends up working out really nice. He has a very unique way of writing questions but doesn't provide a lot of practice problems in his style. Overall great professor though!

Professor Sevov is a great OChem instructor. He is funny and good at teaching the information. This is a hard class by nature but he makes it manageable. The grade is almost solely based on 4 exams but he curves it in a student friendly way. The book is only used for practice problems.

This man is incredible. Beautiful handwriting, handsome, caring, funny, smart. Wow. I stan Christo Sevov. His tests are fairly difficult but you have a chance to earn 500 points throughout the semester and then he makes the class out of 450. In addition to that he has a softer grading scale AND he curves the class. . <3 350 characters are not enoug

He's really a great guy and cares a lot about his students! He is great at teaching/ explaining things. His tests are hard, but he makes up for it with the 50% drop on one midterm and the adjusted grading scale. I learned a lot and actually really liked this class. I will miss Christo

Many said Callam was the hardest prof for ochem at OSU. I think Sevov officially has him beat. Regardless, Sevov is a great man who is caring (will hold extended office hours and be very accessible / kind). While I think his tests were VERY tough, I think he is a great professor who is exceptionally smart (try understanding what his research is in)

Christo is a very clear lecturer, and pretty adorable. Some people say he's a little boring, but I didn't have too much trouble staying focused during lecture. However- his exams are honest to God insanity. Don't be fooled by the easy first exam. We had a 70% average on it, which was followed up by a 36% average on MT2... also he doesn't curve so

He is a very smart man and good professor however his tests did not represent what we learned. Many questions were multiple parts and if you couldnt get the first part there was no way to get ANY points for the proceeding parts. He also didnt teach multiple topics that were on the ACS test for lab which is where the expect you to learn that.
Tough exams, but awesome teacher!
He's a good guy.

summary_comment: Dr. Walters is highly regarded for her clear explanations and consistent approach to teaching, making a challenging subject more accessible. Students appreciate her engaging lectures and supportive office hours, though some note issues with pacing and time management. Overall, she is praised for her dedication to student success and her ability to help students pass the course with good grades.

Ratings.comment: Very clear explanation of material. Also does not surprise you, very clear with class expectations.

Dr. Walters is amazing at keeping students engaged through long lectures. Struggles a bit with time management and tends to rush towards end of lecture. Office hours is super helpful and she explains topics in a way for you to personally understand. Homework is by accuracy but not too difficult while exams and lab take up most of the grade.

Ochem is a hard subject and a very hard class. No matter the professor you get it's going to be tough but I think everyone should go with Dr. Walters. Attend her office hours and give your full amount of attention during lectures and you will pass Ochem with a decent grade.

Although she is very passionate, she struggles a lot with pacing for the class. Her class was persistently 1-2 chapters behind the other classes, and recitations were ahead of lecture material so not a lot of time to work with the material. However, she provided really good practice exam material and the exams were not that bad.

Dr. Walters is the sole reason I passed ochem. She makes the content actually accessible and understandable and gives plenty of leniency on quizzes. Lecture and recitation attendance give extra credit and quizzes have five retakes so I never even had to take the final. GET HER IF YOU CAN!!
Very nice and caring professor, but her lectures often focused on what she was interested in instead of info on the exams. Her example problems in lecture were also way easier than the exam problems.

She is such a good professor. As a student, I felt supported, I felt like the course was manageable and because Chem 1210 is so hard and content dense, Dr. Walters did the best job as a professor. She is truly one of the best and if you just do the work and watch the lectures, you are guaranteed a good grade with her. 10/10

Chem 1210 is a hard course. However this is the best possible lecturer I could have had. She did me wonders, she makes the material understandable and made a ton of resources available for the students to support us for our midterms. She truly focused on the success of the students, I felt supported and she was a great proffesor.
So sweet and truly cares

Great professor with easy to understand and engaging lectures! There is a textbook, but everything can be learned from the annotated notes gone through during lecture. Only work was a 30-50 question homework each week due Sunday, but go to office hours with questions, and she is more than willing to help! Lectures would often get behind though.

Dr. Walters is an amazing chemistry professor. She cares about her students and makes lectures engaging and beneficial. She is very good at explaining and fights to make sure the tests are fair and recitations are helpful. TAKE HER!!!!!! The class itself can be difficult but she does everything in her power to help you do well.

She was a really nice teacher who cared about chemistry and us succeeding in the course. My only con was that she often fell behind in lectures and had to post long recordings to catch up. It was her first time teaching our section though, so I give her grace.

Ugh- quite easily the worst experience at OSU I have had. Almost impossible to study for. My one advice is to recheck your exams to see if they are graded accurately because every single one of mine were not!

Dr. Walters cares about all of her students, and makes herself available to help. Orgo 1 is gonna be a tough class regardless of instructor, but her grading scheme was fair, with a small curve at the end of the semester. She doesn't have super conventional methods of conceptualizing stuff, so her style may not be for everybody, but it worked.

Whatever OSU pays Dr. Walters isn't enough. I struggled HARD in gen chem and was honestly resolving myself to letting ochem be my weed out, but she just explains things so clearly and allows you to retry on quizzes. Theres also a few extra credit opportunities, and perfect attendance makes the final optional!

Her lectures are good and she really explains things in her own way. I'd read the e-textbook that goes along with the course before lectures so you can have an idea of what is going on before she begins teaching.
Best chemistry professor I've had.

Dr. Walters is a good chem professor. She really tries her best to give analogies and dumb down some hard topics for the students. She does have a tendency to teach slowly so she sometimes would post extra lectures that you have to watch for homework. Other than that, super nice, funny, and definitely one of the better gen chem professors.

Dr. Walters has been one of the best lecturers that I have ever had. She assigns quite a bit of homework, but it is always due Sunday at 11:59. She also provides a lot of study material for exams and continually had higher scores than other classes.

Dr. Walters was such a great professor to have. She's very helpful with questions after lecture and you can tell she truly cares about facilitating the best education and learning opportunities for her students. She is very personable. There were no exam surprises. If you do what is necessary to study the lectures, you can get the grade you desire.
Very good lecturer. She has recording videos for every lecture. Very care about students. But has to study to get a good grade.

An extremely judgmental person. Would always go over the allotted time for lectures. And would then proceed to go completely quiet and stare at students when they went to go to other classes. Despite going over the allotted time the class was always a lecture or two behind.

This was Dr. Walter's first time teaching gen chem, and she did a really good job in providing a lot of resources.  Dr. Walters is really nice, and her office hours were very helpful. The class itself is a lot of work, but if you study using the practice exams you should be fine.

Dr. Walters is extremely considerate of her students, and she wants them to do very well. Her lectures are easy to understand, and she tries her best to record them so they can be viewed outside of class. Dr. Walters is very engaging in the lectures. Highly recommend her!
Most engaging science class and makes class quite enjoyable

Dr. Walters is a great teacher. She loves what she teaches, and you can see the passion through her teaching. She's funny; she tries to relate the topic of chemistry to everyday things to help you better understand the concepts (which I find fascinating).  

I literally wrote more, but the word count limits what other good things I wished to say.
Super sweet. Genuinely means well, although lectures can be confusing at times. Ochem is hard regardless of who's teaching it.

Dr. Walters is 100% a great professor and she definitely cares about her students. The only issue is that her exams are extremely hard, and that's because you'll never see questions like it on homework or study sheets. She gives extra credit to make up for the difficulty, but the extra credit is so time consuming.
Exams are way too hard and she does jot prepare you well. The previous exams and homework questions are not representative at all.

Doesn't answer questions straightforwardly and makes ochem more complicated by never telling you what she expects. She expects us to "use what we learned and apply it to completely new situations", the situations being her exams. None of the materials given correlate with each other. Tries to be quirky and relatable rather than a good teacher.

This woman needs to be in charge of the whole chem department. She ensures all the content is accessible through providing captions, inclusive language/attitude, provided paper lecture notes and created an environment where anyone can learn ochem. She will change your perspective on chemistry. Thank you Dr. Walters for being the best professor!

A Venn diagram of lecture material, homework material, exams, and quiz material would be four almost entirely separate circles. Lectures make no sense and exams are bogus. It seems she wishes she only did research or was the lab coordinator. Worst chem professor I have ever taken.
tried so hard to set up a 1-on-1 meeting with her since i was struggling so much. she either did not email me back for weeks or forgot about our meeting time completely.

Dr. Walters is a great professor! The energy that she brings to lectures definitely helped me succeed in this class. As someone who doesn't understand chemistry at all, it's possible to do decent if you put in effort. To be brutally honest, I think people who are complaining about Dr. Walters did poorly due to lack of effort, not because of her.

Professor Walters is an amazing lecturer, she makes the lecture interesting and makes sure every student gets the help they need. The midterms are manageable as long as you study, but I thought the final exam was harder than the midterms.

Extremely nice, but her exams and quizzes were absolutely impossible. Averages were never higher than 50%, and her lecture notes were so hard to follow because she would draw random mechanisms on the side. She offered test corrections (up to 50% back) but only ended up returning a couple of points, despite her students spending hours on it.

Dr Walters is a great person and a great lecturer! However, her quizzes and exams were much much much more difficult than what we discussed. Quiz and exam averages were often around a 50% and the average on the final was a 44%. However, she does release the keys, offers extra credit, and the curve is pretty decent (I finished with a 68= B-).
False witnesses and cheats

Dr. Walters had the coolest class layout I have seen in my time at OSU. She valued that students mastered the material through learning outcome credits and allowed students to really immerse themselves in the content without being pressured by an exam. She really loves interacting with students and it shows!
She really does want to succeed and takes feedback well. Easy to approach and gives you plenty of study materials. Good TA's, labs, and resources to use on the exam.
Loved Walters. She does her best to make lectures both fun and interesting. Exams are super easy if you review the study guide and practice exams.
Hands down the best professor especially for O chem! Give extra credit, not a picky grades at all, and gives student literally free points for you to get a good grade. Take her asap no joke

BEST PROFESSOR AT OSU. Dr. Walters ensures those who study deservedly do well in the class and those who struggle still get help to succeed in understanding the material. Dr. Walters' class works for any learning style. You can be independent and succeed. She is always happy to communicate.

Dr. Walters is an amazing lecturer. The energy she would bring to class made me truly understand ochem. Yes, the curve sucked but it was summer and we were the only ochem 1 section, it was gonna be a sucky curve, that's not up to Dr. Walters so can't really blame her. She offers a lot of extra credit and is very lenient with partial credit.

dr walters is a very understanding and kind person. I'm taking summer orgo1 and after the days-long power outage before our first exam she's offering us more than one option for a no penalty make up exam. i'm working >40hr weeks so my only concern is passing this class and dr walters makes that very easy for a summer (accelerated) course.
I got nothing bad to say about Dr. Walters. Please take if you can and if you cant attend lecture please watch the recordings. She states that her exams come straight from

everyone complaining about no curve is clowning. walters gives u everything u need to get an A if you put effort into it. her lecture notes were organized enough for me to get a good grasp of the content for my own personal study. walters was the first chem prof i have had that seems like an actual person. she has 4 separate slots for office hours.

There's going to be some bad reviews due to no "curve." Ignore. Dr Walters is an amazing person and one of the most caring profs. My B was due to just blanking on the final. Her exams are fair, but due to that there was no "curve." Kind during office hours. In the future, I would hope the class is a bit harder so effort is better represented. =

Hands down the best professor within the osu chem department. While my grade in this course wasn't great, I knew Dr. Walters was willing to work with me to help me understand the information- and I actually felt confident! She's fair with grading, and goes over difficult topics in multiple ways as long as you ask! go to her office hours!!!
There was no curve, which is unfair considering that all other organic chemistry sections have a large one.

TAKE HER CLASS. At the start of the semester I thought ochem 2 would be as bad as ochem 1 but Dr. Walters saved me. It goes to show that the difficulty of the material does not dictate our grades. Good professors correlate with good grades. How can anyone have anything bad to say about a good professor like Dr. Walters?

Dr. Walters is a very nice professor but very disorganized. She would mess up on the content, not answer emails for week periods, and takes forever to grade. With this, her tests are extremely fair and easy compared to other professors and her standards are pretty clear.

Prof Walters is a very nice person but a very disorganized teacher. Her lecture notes were sometimes all over the place & while some of the exams were fair, some questions were completely out of left field. If i had to take ochem again, i would definitely sign up for another professor. Also the homework is a huge waste of time.
Gives partial credit and homework is for completion. Super nice compared to other ochem professors. Lecture was a little slow for my taste, but it could be worse!!! Go to office hours if you can.

Dr. Walters is an excellent professor. Her lecture style is very cheerful, and she explain the content of each chapter very carefully. Also, she gives you a lot of extra help and don't skip the class and assignment she will give you many opportunities to get the grade that you want.

Honestly, the best professor I have ever had in college. Went into this class hating orgo 1, and she made me love orgo 2. She is great at teaching/ explaining, and gives fair quizzes and exams. As long as you do the work, you will do well (but this is a hard class inherently).

Dr. Walters was such a kind professor and person. But, her grading system is very confusing if you do not familiarize yourself with it in the syllabus. Additionally, I feel that the practice problems we did in class were significantly easier compared to what she put on her quizzes, which did not seem like they were written by her.

I hate ochem but Dr. Walters made me love it the semester I took 2520 with her. I step into lecture with an excitement to learn because Dr. Walters has a passion and enthusiasm for what she is teaching. She is fair and gives lots of opportunities and chances. She's a rare find, especially in OSU's chem department.

BEST PROFESSOR! Dr. Walters may be a young professor but she acts more mature than any other professor in the department. She is approachable and she knows what we are going through and how tough the material is. Her class took NO TOLL ON MY MENTAL WELLBEING. She will make you love ochem. Lots of extra credit. Lots of outside help. Lots of points.

There is so much positive to say about Dr. Walters. Everything that is lacked in every other ochem professor at OSU and the general chemistry department is present with Dr. Walters: a true ambition for her students to succeed, lots of opportunities to pick up points, and a thoroughly engaging lecture. You make a huge mistake not taking her class.

Walters was by far the best professor I've had so far (I'm a junior). Extremely caring and considerate, gives multiple opportunities for credit, very lenient with homework, and teaches very well. OCHEM is a difficult class but she makes it a lot easier to prepare for. Definitely would take her again.

Dr. Walters is a must have for 2520. She explains the material super well. Apart from being able to actually teach, she is extremely understanding & caring of her students. If she thinks she made a quiz/test question too unfair, shell give partial credit. Lots of opportunities for extra credit and she offers optional exam reviews outside of class.

summary_comment: Dr. Kroner is an effective professor who simplifies complex material and provides ample support through clear expectations, flexible deadlines, and accessible office hours. While some students find his handwriting challenging, many appreciate his thorough lecture recordings and extensive study resources, which help them succeed in the course. Overall, he is highly regarded for his engagement and dedication to student understanding.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Kroner makes the difficult content of this lab easily digestible if you pay attention and participate. He sets clear expectations for assignments and is always available to help if needed. The due dates are also pretty lenient and he is very understanding of unforeseen circumstances. Fantastic professor overall.

Lectures were pretty boring, so it's hard to be engaged at 8am. Attendance not required. Posts lecture recordings. Highly recommend reading the textbook. Weekly homework: digital assignments after each lecture (9-11 questions). Provides lots of resources for studying. Always offered help outside of class. Do the practice exams to do well on exams!!

He's great. His writing can be hard to read at times, but him posting lectures is so so helpful. He's also great at helping you understand content in office hours, so go! If you go to lecture, pay attention, read the book, and do the problems, you should be fine.

THIS MAN'S HANDWRITING IS GODAWFUL. You can't even tell what variable we are talking about in the notes. CHEMISTRY IS ONE OF THISE CLASSES WHERE YOU HAVE TO UNDERSTAND THE PROF'S NOTES.  Sure there are other resources you can use but at that point I should've just self studied for the AP Chem exam and gotten the credit in high school. praying for u
Dr. Kroner is a great professor who makes the class engaging. Utilize the practice quizzes and textbook to prepare for exams. Unstuckstudy can also be a helpful study tool alongside other resources.
Amazing lectures. If you go to the lectures, you will be OK!
Difficult course, good guy!

His lecture notes get messy but if you're following along it makes sense. Homework is divided into three smaller sections (9-11 questions) a week and he gives us a lot of study resources like practice exams for midterms.
