His main piece of advice for studying is to read the textbook. He loves showing off his dog.
I really did not mind this professor. He is really nice but his handwriting for notes is messy. He gives a ton of resources to help you out.
Awesome guy who enjoys what he does. Make sure to utilize the practice quizzes as they prepare you for the exams.
Dr. Kroner is one of the best professors that I have ever come across because of his amazing lectures, accessibility, and friendliness.

Dr.Kroner made lectures laid back and fun.  He was very approachable and made it clear that he was available for any help we needed outside of class.  His lecture content is solid but what helped me the most was reading the textbook on my own.

Good lectures that covered everything on the midterms. Dr. Kroner was also happy to help answer questions after class. Apart from that, the chem department does a great job of giving practice exams that are very similar to the actual midterms.
Easy on homework assignments. Very caring and funny. I slacked off and the midterms got me.

he was great, the chem department as a whole is hard so the exams were difficult if you did not prepare but he gives you a ton of practice material, he also has a ton of grades that are purely participation or showing up to recitation so he tries to not make the class too unbearable

Dr. kroner was so sweet! He would always answer our questions during the lecture and encourage us as well! His handwriting was a little messy and hard to read, especially with an 8 AM class. Prepare to watch a lot of youtube vids online; you have to put work outside of class! The exams make or break your grade.

Dr. Kroner is an excellent lecturer for Chem 1210. I learned a lot from him, has a good sense of humor, and seems like a very nice guy. His handwriting can be hard to follow, but the slides are typed out. Very approachable and often does cool demonstrations in class. Would recommend him for Chem 1210!

His handwriting is awful, and his pace can be slow at times, but he always finished teaching the materials in time for the midterms with an extra lecture or two dedicated to review. Overall, he was a very nice person and a decent professor.
Great chem 1210 professor! Probably the best chem professor at osu. Super kind and always willing to help.

I did not like Kroner. He was a messy writer and it wad impossible to read his notes. He also didn’t finish the content for exams until the day of the exam. I had peers who took Prof Fus and had a whole week of studying. Kroner basically just read off of the slides. Kroner went slow and his explanations didn’t make the hard concepts easy.

The biggest advice I can give is to read the textbook before each lecture. Thankfully, Mr. Kroner made an assignment for each lecture that shows which sections he will be covering that day. The exams have a lot of trick questions that many people fall for. Exams took up 62.5% of your grade, so make sure you take them seriously. Go to recitation!!!

He seems like a great human being. He presents the material well. Best advice I can give is read the book alongside watching the lectures and attempt most of the 17 trillion or so provided practice problems.
Good lecturer very nice guy. Handwriting a bit messy but other than that he's a good professor
He's a good prof and cares about his students. Attend his office hours and be specific with your questions.

Dr. K is a nice guy and is always willing to help during office hours or by email. His handwriting is messy, but you should be able to copy what hes saying. We learn material really close to the midterm which can be annoying, but he does offer a lot of review. Chem is hard in general so be prepared to do a lot outside of class regardless of ur prof
So far he has been really good at explaining material. Luckily does not give a lot of homework compared to other chem teachers. Probably best professor for the chem 1210 course.
god himself could not decipher this guys handwriting. looking at notes or work absolutely useless because his handwriting is so atrocious.

Kroner is one of the worst chem lecturers. His handwriting is so messy and he talks in literally slow motion. We never get through all the material before the exam because he goes so slow. He does provide a lot of practice problems which are helpful, but the lectures are not worth going to at all - I can teach myself the content better.

I had Dr. Kroner this past year during the fall semester. His handwriting is pretty messy and he kinda scribbles when he writes since he goes pretty fast, but I was able to keep up with his pace. He always came to class with a good attitude and while he didn't have a lot of control over testing, he does care about his students.
Kroner is the best and is always willing to help.

Dr. Kroner is really great amongst a really hard class. He does not curve or bump or anything, so do not expect that. He cares about his students and wants you to do well. Make sure you go to lecture, reading the book is also extremely helpful.

Kroner is really caring and a great lecturer. He tries his best to get the material across and if you don't understand he'll continue to explain it to you many different ways in office hours. He provides optional pre- lecture and post-lecture videos on each topic which are super helpful for tricky material.
Chem sucks and he didn't make it any better. Take with another professor if u have the chance but he isn't horrible.

Some reviews here review the class itself and not the prof. Chem is organized at the dept. level, so profs aren't in control of exams. With that said, Dr. Kroner is a good professor. He provides many practice problems which are BEYOND helpful, but I often found myself a little confused during lectures. Read the book before lecture to avoid this.

Dr. Kroner is a great person and but a horrible teacher. He goes so fast and will sometimes skip over things that can be asked on tests. He teaches the content as if we already have a good understanding of it and leaves you confused. He gives good resources like daily quizzes which help, but is not able to teach the content. I would not pick him.

Dr Kroner is alright. Gen Chem is really hard and he explained the subjects as good as he could. The amount of homework was a lot though, basically one for every single lecture. There are review packages before every test which is helpful but if you dont attend the lectures they wont be of any good. The tests are very hard so prepare to study.

I found out fast that I do not enjoy chemistry and so I switched my major right off the bat, however Kroner is probably the only thing that got me through the class. His lectures were helpful, gave us outside resources to study/practice, and overall he just did a well job and if I had to take another chem class it would only be with him teaching.

He is so great, I can't use text to express my happiness CHEM 4410 is one of the most impressive classes I ever take. I can remember, How many times, I failed to burn the organic substance, How many times, I don't know how to use the instrument, but you patiently gave the instructions How many time, you remind me to wear the face mask.

All he is responsible for are the lectures (he has no clue what happens in lab), but he does a good job of going beyond that and providing extra resources. He is really chill, but you have to advocate for yourself in this class. His explanations make sense to me.

As everyone says, Gen Chem 1 is very difficult no matter what professor you have. Dr. Kroner really takes the topics in gen chem and helps you understand them. Top Hat is used but bonus points for correct answers allow for missed classes. Dynamic study modules in Mastering allow you to get 100% on the homework by being bonus which helps your grade.

Gen Chem 1 is hard in general, but Dr. Kroner is an amazing professor who truly cares about his students and desires for everyone to master the material. For each midterm and the final, he provides several very accessible resources that are useful when studying. Not an easy A, but definitely possible if you put in the time and effort.

Dr. Kroner was an amazing professor for General Chemistry I. He provided us with a lot of resources to practice and prepare for exams. There are 3 midterms and a final, which do mean that you need to put in a lot of work to get a good grade. Lab is a lot of work, but recitation is simply a participation grade.

Everyone knows OSU chem sucks, but Dr. Kroner has made learning as easy as possible. He posts lectures on youtube, does chapter overview videos, and creates short (optional) lesson quizzes to test your understanding. He is a kind prof with lots of office hours. Gets back to you very quickly via email. Very much a dad and brought candy to class once

Kroner was an awesome prof. I was not the best at chem so it was very difficult for me. He goes well into detail and doesn't really get off-topic which is nice. Kroner is a great guy, very forgiving with computer issues, etc. Lots of extra credit. Would take the class again if I actually liked chem

Professor Kroner is by far one of the best choices for a professor. Tough course, great professor. He is easy to understand. The lecture portion of the course is not worth much in your overall grade, but he does the most for what he can help with. Gives little homework & lots of optional extra credit.

Kroner is like a dad! If you have to take Chem1210 at osu I highly recommend him! He gives very little homework compared to the other professors. Its a hard class but he does his best to make sure everyone understands!

Hes a super nice guy and clearly cares a lot about his students. Lectures can get somewhat boring but definitely not the worst, hes pretty interesting and his voice isnt annoying or anything. He can go kind of fast but its necessary to get through the lectures and stay on track
Steve was a great teacher but the class is simply designed to be difficult. Good guy, rough class.

Dr. Kroner was a great professor when it came to lectures and he did his best to prepare the class for OSU's standardized chemistry exams. His lectures are fun to attend, but can get slow at times. The TopHat participation matters, so show up to class. He also takes into account what students don't understand and explains it very well.

Dr. Kroner was a great chemistry professor. He truly cares about his students success and had very accessible office hours- which my biggest regret is not attending them. Midterms and the final are difficult. Attendance is vital to be successful. Kroner is great and offers lots of extra credit and practice problems. Would defiantly recommend.

Dr. Kroner is a really nice and caring guy. The class is difficult because the chemistry department makes the exams hard for no reason. However, he is helpful if you ask questions and uses TopHat frequently to boost your grade.
Dr. Kroner is great!!!! I wish I could have him for 1220!!!! He is so caring and gives lots of extra credit homeworks

Dr. Kroner is really caring and such a dad. Even though he says its not a weed out class (it is) he really wants his students to succeed. He is helpful in office hours and willingly answers questions in lecture. He offers lots of extra credit so you can pretty much get 100% in homework. The exams are really challenging and require lots of studying.

If you get Kroner, you lucked out! He gives TONS of daily extra credit, both in lecture and as homework, and takes the time to give you pre and post lecture notes and videos to help review the material.
Dr. Kroner was very knowledgeable about chemistry in general and tried to help students understand the basics and foundations of chemistry.

Dr. Kroner followed the book pretty rigidly so his lectures weren't super interesting, but they were ideal for understanding for the exams. He had no control on the exams since they were standardized, but he prepared us well. For TopHat and homework, it was extremely easy to get 100% due to extra credit. Solid gen chem professor.

Kroner was the most forgiving of Chem teachers since he allowed us to make up points in TopHat and online hw. A lot of his in class and recitation problems came up again on exams so go to class anyway. YOU MUST READ THE BOOK AND TAKE NOTES AND GAIN AN UNDERSTANDING ON YOUR OWN. Most people who failed didn't keep up with the readings. Be proactive.

The class material was pretty easy. Reading the book was the best way to learn the material. The lectures were sometimes a little boring, and I often did not pay attention in lecture. But when I did listen, it was helpful. He gives extra credit on a lot of homework assignments, unlike most professors. He's a nice guy and wants students to succeed
Never showed up to lecture except for midterms. Didn't study as much as I should have but wound up with B. Not bad.

Dr. Kroner did not thrill me. His lectures were so dry -- I honestly don't even remember any clearly because I zone out about 95% of the time. He seems like a nice guys, but honestly can not teach. Anything I learned in this class I learned on my own by reading the textbook. Homework is easy, but that doesn't really help when exams are impossible.

Kroner was OK at best, his lectures are very easy and yet still don't make sense sometimes. He is not an effective teacher. His homeworks are relatively easy in comparison to other teachers but he does not prepare you for the standardized exams. If you're set on having his class, get ready to self-teach from the textbook and from your friends.
Reading the book and doing practice problems are more important than attending the lectures.

Dr. Kroner is interested in his students' success, but learning is self driven. Lectures are mainly sample practice problems, recitation is a worksheet of questions (based on attendance). Exams are straightforward. Find Dr. Fus' online chem videos and take notes from those. I have Fus now and his lecture videos with Kroner's exams would be great.

Kroner is a nice enough guy, and he obviously is smart, but he is truly a terrible teacher. He gets caught up in tangents that make no sense, and he makes simple material difficult to understand. He makes it easy to get a 100 on homework and recitation, but he makes the material way harder than it needs to be and it's confusing.

Dr. Kroner is nice, really cares about his students, and wants them to do well. He gives out 1 sapling homework assignment per week, and there are helpful recitation activities too. His midterms are straightforward and not super difficult. He holds a lot of review and Q & A sessions outside of class. I would definitely take him again

I thought I was going to love Dr. Kroner from the beginning of the year, but it went downhill. It is DEFINITELY possible to get an A in the class, but I don't recommend Dr. Kroner. When I would ask for any clarification in office hours, he would go off on a 10 minute tangent that explained nothing. Dr. Kroner is a smart man, but a terrible teacher.

Dr. Kroner is one of the best Chem 1210 professors at OSU. His exams are very fair but challenging enough that the class won't bomb the final. Overall he seems to care very much about his students and their success, and sets up his class to reflect that.

Dr. Kroner wants every student to succeed. He makes it easy to get 100 on homework and recitation, so it does not screw your grade. He tries to make everything you need to succeed very accessible. He puts up several practice tests which are a real life saver. I wish I could have him again.

Dr. Kroner is an excellent professor. I took his class using grade forgiveness after having my soul crushed by Dr. Fus. He was able to actually teach me the 1220 material and conceptualize what was going on beyond the math. He's the first professor I had who made it clear that he wanted everyone to succeed in the class and worked hard to achieve it

Everyone here raves about Dr. Kroner because he makes the class easy. He gives away the homework points so that every student ends up with 100%, his recitations are just extensions of the lecture; all you have to do is attend to receive the points. This leaves the class with higher averages and virtually no curve. The no curve is a substantial con.

Took Dr. Kroner for Chem 1210 and loved him so I ended up taking him again for 1220 as well. His lectures can be slightly confusing, but if you supplement them with the book you will be fine. Do all his practice tests and reach out to him if you need help because he is EXTREMELY willing to help. Tests are fair but only if you prepare/study well.

Kroner is a great professor. Extremely likable and relatable; he is very available, offers many valuable resources, gives clear lectures, gives no busywork, and gives very fair exams. He was an undergrad here at OSU, so he knows what it was like to be in your shoes. I didn't use him much since I think chem is easy, but he is as good as it gets.

The lectures are unorganized. I felt that my knowledge of the material deserved an A, but I didn't get that because the tests were almost too easy. I would study, but miss two or three questions and end up with a B  every time because the averages are so high. If you don't know chemistry that well, I suggest it for an easy B.
Don't really like his lectures personally but I think his exams are very fair. Just do all the practice problems. Taking him again for 1220 and so far so good.

Exams are super easy, gives a lot of supplemental material in order to study for the exams. Some people don't like how he lectures but its beneficially for me personally. Even though his class tends to be at night he is one of the better professors and a good grade in chem is worth the time trade off.

Kroner is definitely a good chemist, but in terms of teaching in lecture he seemed to go off the rails and explain the material in the most complicated way possible. I personally just watched YouTube videos over the material and it helped clear some things up. However, he is very willing to help you and gives you lots of things to study for exams.
Not bad, I would say best professor to have for chemistry. Very willing to help and overall just a cool dude

Dr. Kroner was very clear that his purpose was always to make sure we knew the material and he wasn't trying to trick us on tests. This meant that it was pretty clear if the answer you got after your calculations was right or wrong. He relates to his students a lot and doesn't make the class more challenging than it needs to be.
Exams are tough but he is really helpful. I took this during the summer so we moved quickly. Taking this during the summer was tough; an exam every week, 2 labs a week, and homework... it was a lot.

Lectures weren't too helpful so I never went; I taught myself the material by reading the textbook. He is however a very helpful guy and wants you to succeed. He extends office hours before midterms. UTILIZE the online practice exams he posts on Carmen.. the questions are very similar to the actual test. Little (1-3%) curve at end of semester.

He's a great professor and he really LOVES teaching. He gives TONS of practice problems and help, and if you do them, you will succeed. He tries really hard to befriend his students, and its difficult to motivate yourself for night classes, but he does a really good job. He gives LOADS more on exams than typical profs.
Too many midterms.
Passionate. Has some interesting chemical experiment in class. Good professor but not a good chemist. Not knowledgeable enough.

Kroner definitely knows what he is talking about. He is very smart and knowledgeable in chemistry but that is also his downfall. Although he is very nice and does not do it intentionally, he explains things at a very high level and it can sometimes be hard to understand what he is explaining because it is so simple to him.

He is a great professor. He really cares about his students. Even though his lectures were hard to follow, he tried to adjust his teaching methods. His office hours were helpful and you can tell that he is very passionate about chemistry! His exams were all right. PRACTICE PACKETS were the best! He has a ton compared to other professors.
Great professor! Very helpful during office hours and quickly responds to emails. Doesn't hurt that he's easy on the eyes too. :)

He is a pretty good professor and his exams are alright. He really cares about his students though! Lectures are sometimes hard to follow because he doesn't explain thoroughly, but overall, an okay professor!
Dr. Kroner is an excellent professor. You can tell that he really enjoys what he does. Do the homework and practice exams. You get out of the class what you put into it.
I stopped attending lectures simply because going caused more confusion over the topics than reading the material on my own due to Kroner's teaching style
He is a good professor. He is difficult but if you attend lecture, do the homework and practice problems, and go to him when you need help, you will pass. You need to put effort to do well.

Very good teacher. Need to go to lectures and take notes. Lots of examples on exams straight from class and little facts he mentions could be on an exam. Enjoyed the class enjoyed lectures and learned a lot. Class is difficult but manageable if you do the homework, practice exams and listen. Helps a lot outside of class and responds to emails well.

His tests are really hard compared to the other Chem professors at OSU, but if you read the book and do practice tests you should be fine. The class is graded on a bell curve so if you get at least the average you get a C+. Overall I learned a lot in this class and Dr. Kroner was a good professor who cared about teaching.

Kroner is not a bad teacher. You should attend his lectures and seek help should you not understand. He is very open and willing to help students, especially during office hours. His tests are difficult but if you use the practice tests given to you, do sample problems from the book, and read the book, you can succeed in the class without a doubt.
Professor did not help at all. I found that I was better off reading the text book to learn.

I loved Dr. Kroner, he was an incredible teacher and you can definitely tell that he loves what he does. Pay attention in lecture and make sure to print out and work on the practice exams that he posts online. This class will be a breeze as long as you put forth a little effort.

Great teacher. I never really studied for exams but have always gotten above average.  He is extremely willing to help with any problems you may have. As long as you take notes and actually pay attention during lecture you'll be fine. Read the textbook in addition, esp. before exams, it helps. I wish I could take him for 1220. I recommend his class

THIS CLASS WAS DA BOMBDIGGITY. but for realsies for real, pchem lab is a good class. It ties together the concepts of organic and pchem and does well to show you how all that stuff you learn in lecture works. The point of the class is to understand the chemistry not to become America's next great novelist. Lectures would probably be helpful, maybe.

I took Kroner and did horibly in  the class. No matter how much I studied I couldn't do well in his class. He knows the material himself, but does not know how to present it to students in a helpful and clear way. He does have office hours to help, and is willing ot meet with you, but trying to learn something the same way is not helpful at all.

Never gave enough time for quizzes and there was always material from the next chapter on them even though he specifically said there wouldn't be. Lectures are really boring and he goes really fast so it's hard to understand. Smart guy just bad teacher.
I thought he was not very helpful. He just printed out slides didn't write much on the board that was comprehensive and did nothing to interest those in lecture.

This professor is the worst I've ever had. He is obviously very smart, but doesn't know how to "teach". No one understands his lectures and his quizzes and tests are impossible. We get between 1-2 minutes per question that take 5+ minutes each to work out. Even if you knew all the answers you won't have enough time to write them down! Ridiculous.

In my opinion he was a great professor! really laid back and didnt assign hardly anything. Basically you manage how much you wanna study. Pretty diffcult tests, but if you read, do all he puts on carmen, and book problems you should be good to go!
Okay teacher
GREAT! Breaks everything down in amazing detail and is awesome at lecturing. CHEM IS HARD NO MATTER WHAT, so expect to work hard and seek help if you don't understand.

Terrible at explaining things, but the class isvery easy if you took Chemistry in high school. Print out of lecture slides, practice midterms, and daily group questions make for a very organized and easy to follow class.

Good professor, goes into great detail in lectures which is helpful to supplement book material.  Very helpful in office hours, and quiz and midterm reviews are offered.  Overall, the course is well laid out and if you go to class, complete the homework, read the book and pass labs, you will be successful.

Kroner was a very good teacher, and if you go to class and do the homework, this class shouldn't be too bad. Missing class will make things difficult for you, though, He held exam and quiz reviews as well as posting multiple example quizzes and tests on carmen, so you will always know exactly what to expect and practice.
Awesome professor!!!! He is nice even though the tests are tricky....

Great professor - class isn't too bad if you've had chemistry in high school.  Tests and quizzes are very fair, but labs are tough with your grade based on how accurate your data is.  I would recommend to anybody

The first several weeks of class I thought he'd be okay. Easy to understand, assigns homework out of the book, etc. Then exams hit. Class average was a 55% with many people doing worse. Hours of studying wont pay off. Explains that he intentionally makes his tests hard to prep us for MCAT's. Problem is, not everybody will be a doctor. DO NOT TAKE!!

Best chem teacher you can take.  He explains things so well! Class moves very fast however and there is a lot of work, especially in the labs.  He has practice exams that are extremely helpful, the real exams are made of the same type of questions.  Ace the practice exams and you'll ace the real ones.
Does a good job of covering material and providing study guides for exams. Exams are difficult; be prepared to study hard and to read each question carefully so units/sig figs/etc. don't mess you up.

Although I found the a material difficult to understand, I thought Dr. Kroner was a great teacher. He is genuinely interested in teaching and communicating the material. He is willing to help anyone with questions and he was involved with the lab and recitations. His exams are very hard but as long as you do decent the curve will boost you up.

Great teacher! Very enthusastic about chemistry! Extremely knowledgeable about subjects and very personable.  Midterms and finals were VERY hard. They are made to DEFEAT YOU! My class average was a 55%. Which was the lowest of all the Chem professors. Great guy, just really difficult! Practice exams were easy compared to actual exams.
Good professor. He moves really fast. Definitely do the homework he gives you and read the chapters. Reading the book was more useful than his notes, but going to class helps clear some things up.

Dr. Kroner was one of my favorite professors. He's enthusiastic about chemistry, and always made class interesting with at least one visual demonstration per chapter if not more. He explains things in such a way that they are very easy to understand so that I found myself grasping concepts after one lecture that I never fully understood in HS.

Kroner did very well in responding to emails and the discussion board. He does care about his students. However, he is very, very tricky. I would recommend knowing all the exceptions to every concept you learn in chemistry. 1st midterm and Final were killer
Read before his lectures and be sure to use all of the study materials he posts online.  Midterms are manageable but the final was very unfamiliar.  Study the book more than his notes.

Great guy, even better teacher. Actually cares about the students and their grades. Exams are somewhat difficult but the curve makes up for the difficulty. Lectures are good and entertaining. If you take Chem 121 i would strongly recommend getting Dr. Kroner as a teacher. It will make this class easier then it is.
Great professor really helpful and very enthusiastic about the subject , besides that , also a wonderful person you are lucky if you have him as a professor.

Great teacher, really knows his stuff and is enthusiastic about the material. He also provides TONS of resources online to help you, you just have to use them if you want a good grade. Overall, he is one of my favorite professors.

Not a fan of this professor. He made a ton of mistakes on exams (which was really unfair to students) and wasn't really good at explaining stuff. The only good thing was that the quizzes were in class and pretty straightforward as opposed to mastering chemistry quizzes. Overall I think he was an alright professor but he could have done better
Watch out for his "ice ice tables". He explains them very poorly and it's not really in the book. If you miss that concept you will fail the first midterm horribly. His writting is also horrible.

Definitely do not agree with his high rating on here. I received A's in both 121 and 122 but Kroner will change that. He gives unfair exams and quizzes which contain information that was not covered in the book. Simply put, he makes the class much harder than it needs to be.

I was fooled by the positive ratings he received. I had Loza for 121 & 122 and did perfectly fine. Kroner has very sloppy handwriting and he lacks personality which makes lecturers boring. He tests on stuff that isn't covered in the book so if yo don't understand how he teaches it you are kind of out of luck. Not horrible but there are better profs
Great teacher, class is not easy, but thats chem. Helped me a lot. Has good notes

class is not bad if you study each chapter. Kroner gives you chances to make up points through online quizzes- DO THEM if you dont get a perfect on the in class quizzes. He also gives you a lot of practice exams and problems so take advantage of them!
Professor Kroner was a good teacher who was excited about his subject.  I would recommended him.

He is a really great guy. I thought he was a really good professor. He talks fast but you just have to pay attention! I never went to his office hours but I have heard he is always willing to help! TAKE HIM! his tests are hard. the final was very hard but Chem is not EASY so expect it to be HARD!
GREAT GUY!! this does NOT mean that he is a good/easy teacher.
Best teacher I've had at OSU. Take him, you won't regret it.

Sup Kroner!  Since I know you read these, great job this quarter.  I really like how the course was revamped.  Only qualms: your hand writing is atrocious! Oh and don't get so frustrated by stupid questions(although it was pretty funny a few times).  Would certainly recommend!  Way to be a teacher and a bro.  You stay classy Kroner (and Fus too)!
Awesssssome!

Dr Kroner is my hero. Very cool guy, excellent lecturer, very helpful & willing to assist you if you need it.  His practice exams are just like the ones he gives out! I have always struggled in chem (I got a C- in 121 & C+ in 122), but got a B in 123 because Kroner is just that awesome. He's like a big teddy bear you just want to squeeze! <3

I love this professor. He does well in explaining the material and is always willing to help during office hours. Exams are hard and require studying. Do practice problems and study at least once a week. Reviewing daily is suggested. Best chem teacher.

He was a very helpful and clear-spoken person. His exams were hard just because it involved so much memorization. He uses the board a lot for definitions and calculations, so try to find a seat up front. Overall, he seemed amiable.

Kroner is a bit confusing at times in his clarity about what he is talking about, and his hand writing is hard to read! BUT, he is a good teacher and if you read the book everything it's an easy A. He is really understanding, and if you go to his office hours confused, he is genuine about helping you out. GOOD TEACHER!

Dr. Kroner is incredible. One of my favorite professors at Ohio State. Chem 121 is a HARD course... be prepared to spend hours upon hours looking over lecture notes, reading the textbook, etc. But it's worth it because if you work hard you'll do well. Plus Dr. K is more than willing to help you anytime out of class.
Excellent, fun teacher. Exams are made to be difficult; if you do all the homework and pay attention, you will do well.
a great professor - very enthusiastic and awesome. lectures were not boring. course is challenging, but after kroner presents the material, you understand. TAKE HIM!!! TAKE HIM!!!

This man is so amazing that if you took lebron james and wayne gretzky put them together they would no equal Steve's awesomeness. Basically if u had any oppurtunity to meet this man you would be blessed with knowledge that no human being should every be graced with. Some say he's not real but we believe in SMK...Do you?

Interesting teacher, enthusiastic, lectures are usually ok to follow, but he's a challenging. Exams are not easy. Don't be discouraged by low grades, if you study alot & attend lecutre you still learn alot.

Dr. Kroner is very helpful and is very quick to respond to your questions. His quiz's/midterms are to the point. However, you must work hard and study the material to do well. No trick questions. A lot of Chapters to cover in a short amount of time...so be sure to keep up. I would highly recommend him. Just sit close to the board. He can get sloppy
No Comments

As a fellow student of mine once stated..."Never before have i ever understood chemistry so clearly...yet failed so miserably on every exam..." Dr. K did a great job with the difficult material, but writes harder x10^200 exams then Dr. Zellmer and Dr. Lousa... I recommend him...Do every homework problem to get half the points on the exam...
explains material very well.  good prof.

summary_comment: Professor Bong is known for his challenging yet manageable approach to teaching organic chemistry, emphasizing clear explanations and practical application through textbook problems and practice sets. While some students find his exams demanding, particularly in areas like retrosynthesis, others appreciate his fairness, clarity, and helpfulness during office hours. Overall, his teaching style is effective but can be intense, especially for complex topics.

Ratings.comment: Bong's class is challenging but manageable. Staying on top of the weekly quizzes and using resources like the textbook and Unstuck ai for study prep can really help. Email responsiveness could be better, but overall, a solid professor.

Bong wasn't a super hard prof, the course itself is just very complicated. He was extremely straightforward with the concepts that he wanted you to focus on (the concepts in the weekly quizzes and take home quizzes). I never walked out of an exam and thought that I had never seen the material before. Everything is straight out of the book

Feels like Dr. Bong and the TAs gave up on us. Answered questions at the beginning of the semester but then stopped. Stopped providing quizzes because he just didn't want to make them. I think he cheats you out of content because he doesn't want to go over it. If you care about ochem, don't take it w/ Bong. Probably great in research though.

Dr. Bong is by far the worst professor for organic chemistry OSU has to offer. If I could give any advice to a STEM major here, I would advise avoiding him at all costs. He was rude, disrespectful, and unfair. His notes were disorganized, unclear, and often times more confusing than not. Overall, he is mean, disrespectful and an awful teacher.

Professor Bong is the most fair O Chem professor I have had so far. His exams are not too difficult and does not try to trick his students on them. He made the material very easy to understand. If you do the textbook problems you will be in great shape for the exams. He is also very helpful in office hours and after class for answering questions.

Expect all of the retrosynthesis, one of the harder concepts in organic chemistry. Tests are hard and taken in lecture, quizzes aren't too bad though. O-chem is just a hard class so you'll be shafted no matter what prof you have tbh

Dr. Bong is a fantastic teacher - he knows how to explain difficult concepts in a way for everyone to understand. His practice sets are exactly what to expect for the quizzes, and he does his best to hint at the exams. This is also where his downfall is - his exams are ridiculous. Retrosynthesis comprises a large portion of them!

Dr. Bong was very clear on what would be tested on. Tests were similar to the problems in the book and his notes were very helpful.  His lectures made tough topics understandable. As long as you worked at it and came to class , you will get the good grade you deserved.

If you pay attention, you can figure out what exactly (read: word for word) will be on the test.  Overall, while he was a little difficult to hear with the microphone, his class was reasonable.  I enjoyed this class, and based on previous reviews, it seems that he has made an effort to improve his teaching style.  If asked, he would always help.
Fair professor but don't expect a response if you send him an email. I sent 4-5 emails throughout the semester, received 0 responses.

Although OChem 2 is a difficult course, if you keep up with the readings and you do many practice problems, the weekly quizzes and the midterms will have no surprises.  The questions for his midterms are usually hidden within the practice exams he gives. "It's a tough class, but that's just the nature of the beast".
Super easy, might be on probation and forced to give easy exams

His class is very straightforward, and if you read the book and do some practice problems you will be fine. Exams were extremely easy compared to some other professors and there weren't any surprises. He seems easy to talk to and genuinely tries to help students out.

Not clear on lectures, you can hardly understand because he mumbles a lot. Useless office hours and test reviews too. Quizzes and tests always have errors. DON't TAKE him run away from him. His class is very hard, he and his team go very hard correcting quizzes and tests. at the end you won't learn anything from him, you have to study in your own.
not clear in lectures-does not explain concepts or terminology you are just expected to know.
Very clear in lecture. Exams are straight forward and very fair - practice exams are very similar to actual exams. Went the extra mile and set up study groups for our class. Overall great proff.

Teaches at a basic level and his tests are much harder. However, ONLY chem professor I've ever heard of or seen that his practice midterms are exactly like his midterms. Requires you to know things out of the book that he wont teach in class. Sometimes kind of sassy and funny.

Dr. Bong actually doesn't do research, for people who tried to argue that. His class is tough, but I went to his office hours a lot and it definitely helped. If you study like you should and read the book, you will do fine. His exams were very predictable (no tricks) and overall the class had high averages on the midterms. He's really not that bad.

Bong is the worst professor i have ever had. Only cares about his research, so teaching is only a chore for him. Skips through things, but you must know them for exams. Your exams are the ONLY grades in the class!! Leaves confused students behind with no understanding.Does not care about students! Final avg. was 26%. Switch if possible!!!

the worst teacher ever!! he doesn't care about his students and doesn't want to help them. i asked him a question and he just blew me off. he's a useless teacher and i'm bummed i had him for the foundation class for o chem.

I thought organic chemistry was bad enough, but after taking this class, I may never enjoy a chemistry class again.  Dr. Bong is the kind of professor that doesn't care about his students.  It might be because he doesn't like to teach or even that he hates undergraduates.  Either way, if you can avoid taking his class, do so.

Dr. Bong starts off well with slow break downs of the material But about halfway through he started rushing through everything and leaving confused students in the dust. He doesn't take requests well at all. I suggested some example problems and he said no. I don't know what everyone else is talking about but his book problems DID NOT for exams.
Dr. Bong knows what he's talking about when it comes to Ochem (The fact that he's hot is an added bonus) Ignore all the negative reviews, Dr. Bong rocks!!

Don't trust most of these ratings, Bong is a pretty good professor. His lecture material is clear and concise and tests are fair. As long as you do his practice quizzes, go to class, go to recitation, and do the homework you should be fine.

I was really nervous when I read the comments before I took his class. But Dr Bong is a rare professor in organic chem. He knows how to teach chemistry. He does not test u on anything he does not teach in class. Read the text before lecture, pay attention in class, read his notes after lecture, and get ur A.

He isn't a terrible teacher (also not the best one), it's just the subject matter is very in depth and part of being in college when taking upper level classes is self motivation. This is a weed out class for Pre-Med/Vet students and those classes are going to be much more difficult, so appreciate the challenge.

Professors like Dr. Bong are few and far between at Ohio State. He is extremely knowledgable and always willing to help. Organic chemistry is a difficult subject, and he does his best to make it simple. By far one of the best professors I've ever had. Also,Oscar Torres is an organic chemistry ninja, so try to get him for your recitation.

Bong is very unpredictable in terms of what he puts on exams. Our averages were low (like 40s), and if you want the A you have to go well above what is considered normal studying time. I got an A-, but that was mostly thanks to my TA. If you don't come to lecture, don't anticipate passing the class.

Bong was horrible. Didn't teach much of the chapter, but expected you to know it all. Including every table and picture. His favorite thing to say was "This is important, but I'm not going over it" Reading your book and doing the problems are the only way to help yourself. Go to another lecture too if possible. Bong is uninterested in your grade.

I was really nervous for this class after reading the ratings here, but bong isn't as bad as he sounds. He is sorta rude when you ask stupid questions though. Read the book thoroughly and do all the homework, his practice exams are pretty useless but the carmen quizzes help. and memorize every pka he mentions.

Bong is the WORST teacher I have ever had at OSU.  He lectures like he's talking to people who've been doing O. Chem for years, he talks down to students and makes people feel dumb for asking students.  You have to teach yourself hard material, which shouldn't have to happen.  You need to switch out of his class.  He should not be allowed to teach.
If you get bong, really read your book, because he'll expect you to have read it every time you come to lecture
If you get bong, really read your book, because he'll expect you to have read it every time you come to lecture

Bong is not a very good teacher. That said, he was not as bad as I thought he was going to be after reading the ratings on here. It was not so much his teaching that suffered, more that his exams were ridiculous. I just took the final and despite not thinking it was too bad, got a 51% on it (I got A's and B's in Gen Chem). Switch if you can.
Horrible.
Teacher is garbage.  He doesn't teach even though it's his job.  His tests are not not compatible with the material you learn in class or from the book.
The class is hard and he does not really care about his students. Seems annoyed when you ask him for help. Tests are kind of rediculous. Turned me off from the chemistry field.

Bong is clear and easy to understand, but his examples in class are super confusing. I studied a ton and if you want an A you have to expect to go above just doing homework problems, because his tests problems are far more difficult. He's not the worst teacher but he's not a good one either. A LOT of test questions were totally irrelevant to class.

This is a VERY tough class, but not impossible.  It requires a lot of studying outside of the classroom.  If you fall behind, you are doomed!  Dr. Bong is very intelligent and his lectures are very clear.  However, he has a tendency to be very sarcastic and sometimes just rude to students with questions.  Tests, quizzes are fair.  DO ALL HOMEWORK!

Plan on teaching yourself everything out of the book. I went to every class and paid attention, my notes did not help for the online quizzes, they were ridiculous. He made people feel stupid in the class, and embarrassed students. horrible professor

Dr. Bong delivers clear, organized lectures, and does a good job of explaining things in office hours.  I don't know why people say exams covered material not covered in lecture - it just isn't true.  Organic chemistry isn't easy, and you'll need to make sure you can do all of the assigned practice problems if you want to do well.

I've always been a good student, but this class was really discouraging for me.  He makes his exams very difficult and even open book quizzes were unfair, covering material that had not been discussed in class. The main adjectives to describe him would be condescending, uninterested and demanding. You might just fail.

Pros:  He uses clear terminology to explain chemical reactions, and sometimes impromptu hand motions .  He's created a classroom where students feel free to guess answers without feeling stupid, and seems interested in helping the students learn the material.  Cons: more than half of the practice exams don't connect to what he's testing

If you like to teach yourself half of the material, then you may like his lecture.  He covers the "highlights" from the book- what he thinks are important- then tests you on everything.  Exam averages in mid-low fifties. Would not recommend.

This is a very challenging class. I spent about 8 hours per week studying. My friends became accustomed to my living in the study room on the weekends. However, if you do the work, you will get a good grade. It is a lot of independent study. He tried very hard at the end of the quarter to be as helpful as possible; he had not been so before.

Dr Bong is the single most god-awful teacher on the face of this earth and he destroyed my life for a quarter. He has no teaching skills whatsoever. Don't bother doing homework because it remembles nothing that is on the quizzes and exams. I am currently writing a letter to the chem department about him so he can never step foot in a classroom agai

Professor Bong is probably the worst teacher I've ever had. Ever. And I say this because what he does (read off of pre-made slides) doesn't qualify as TEACHING.. If you HAVE to take his class, it is 100% up to you to teach yourself the material.. It's hard, but possible, I ended up with an A in the class (after a large curve mind you)..

Now, I LOVE chemistry...but this class was just terrible! I went to lecture every day, read the book, did the homework, and still ended up with C's and B's on the quizzes. It's ridiculous how hard he makes everything. The average on the midterm, after people dropped, was a 54%! i will say he explains things okay if you go to office hours.
terrible! He does not know how to teach!!!
Bad Teacher! I took this class over to get a better grade and ended up screwing myself. He speaks extremely too low:( Please get a microphone!

He is the worst O-chem teacher I have ever had. After Midterm one he told us he was going to curve the class to a C- and told us to drop if we were below average. Everything about the class sucks, whatever you do DO NOT take this class, wait a quarter from another teacher if you have to.

The worst professor I've ever encountered at OSU. Does not take an interest in having students learn; lectures and notes are useless. Exams are difficult and do not have much to do with the recommended practice problems.
Bong is to chemistry as Larry the Cable Guy is to comedy. He sucks, and always wears the same outfit.

Bong is pretty useless. The lectures consisted of him drawing giant structures while we fought to keep up. He sometimes told us things that would specifically be on the exams (though he rarely explained it well). The exams were pretty insane. Despite his incredibly good looks and soft Asian skin, don't take him!

Can't always hear him if you sit beyond the 4th row.  Exams are't representative of recommended practice problems & exams which makes them more difficult. Attending lectures don't really help or hurt. The only thing you might miss is when he occasionally tells you that something specifically needs to be memorized. I'd recommend taking someone else

Is indeed very attractive (picture doesn't do him justice) and has really great skin. :) Not a great teacher, however. Frankly, it seems he cares more about research than teaching (has great credentials). Lectures can be unclear, fairly difficult exams, but very helpful with questions! Just study a lot and ask questions.
He's so intensely attractive that I have trouble paying attention in class. Maybe opt for a less attractive teacher if you're attracted to Asian males and easily distracted from ochem lectures.
He is really helpful

He made the quizzes take home and let you go to the TA's office hours to get help on it.   Oscar Torres was an excellent TA for the class.  His exams were much easier than callam's. final was only 6 pages but class avg was 53%.  look over the homework solutions because some of the tricky HW problems end up as similar problems on the exams.
Horrible Professor! Do not take this professor under any circumstances; not difficult, just a flat-out BAD TEACHER.

Tests are hard.  Teaches the material well, and tests over both hard concepts and little details.  He helps everyone pass the class.  Good idea to attend all lectures as he gives details in lecture not found in book that will be on the test.

The class was pretty difficult, but I'm assuming any ochem class tends to be. His exams are real tough (class average 55ish, but curved in the end), but if you go to office hours, he helps out a LOT. He had no problems staying late to give us some assistance. His class started off a bit messy, but eventually he organized his lectures into sensible

Don't take him. He doesn't talk loud enough, writes too fast, have bad handwriting, his tests are impossible, doesn't offer enough practice, even Frankel would be a better choice. I learned nothing, failed every test, but still did average in the class. If you take him, make sure to put the suicide hotline on speed-dial and have a flask ready.

Dr. Bong started off easy, but things definitely got harder as the quarter went on.  For me, the first midterm was ok.  The second one, was terrible.  I left feeling very sick.  The final was again ok.  O-chem just involves alot of work, and I think it sucks no matter what.

Difficult, cares about his students but is not personable, test 1 was tough, test 2 was a breeze, final kinda hurt (too much on stuff we never learned), lectures are pretty clear, his teaching doesn't really inspire like the other rating says but it is possible to ace the course, i did, curve was nice, and you'll learn some ochem too, homework was

Cool guy, but tests are impossible. Averages around 55% and suggested for students to drop the class. Compared to other profs (Callam) give little to no practice problems, except a few suggested problems from the book, which are not nearly as difficult as his problems.
whatever you do, dont take his class.  I am a chemistry major so i am used to hard classes and profs that dont care but this guy takes the cake for not caring about his students!!

Take his class, but go to someone else's lectures. The honors kids will sign up for Callam because he's the best, but that would screw up the curve. Most likely he will have the most empty seats so the stupid people will end up taking it. I Heart the curve. Goes to fast in lectures. Helpful in office, but makes me sad inside my heart.
Prof. Bong actually suggested dropping the class after the 1st midterm. 'nuff said.

Exams were not as unfair as some claim, but were poor assessments of the material. Very unclear, gave poor explainations, took confusing shortcuts in mechanisms, easily frustrated by questions, and seemed rather unwilling to work with students. Didn't offer review sessions, no answer keys to practice exams, doesn't seem like he wants to teach.

Worst professor I have ever had at OSU and anywhere else.  Doesn't care about teaching.  Exams are impossible to prepare for, even if you had done all of the homework and practice sheets.  Wouldn't even stay during exams, told the TA she couldn't answer questions for the last 30 minutes of the exam. AVOID!

Bad. You had better remember every single mech youve learned because he will totally surprise you on exams, which are impossible to study for.   Gives vague study sheets and then puts hardly anything relevant on the exams.  Nice guy, bad teacher, unfair tester.

I think he was so bad so all the feedback would keep him from getting assigned to teach another class so he can focus his time on research.  There is no other explanation, seriously the worst professor i've ever had.

bad..... office hours are brief and he is always late to them, he complains when the class does poorly on his impossible exams. practice exams (when he has them) are not very much like the real exam. comes up with a list of very broad topics to know for the exams that MIGHT point you in the right direction. drop this class if at all possible

Its official the polls are in THE WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD!!!! It doesn't matter how hard you study it does no good, notes are terrible, exams are extremely difficult. The help given is little to none.

Worst f*in prof ever! I wrote the exact same thing from the notes on the exam for ans and it was marked wrong. Wtf? He probably doesn't know what he is teaching. His officehour are helpless b/c, 1st, he is unpatient to explain "stupid" questions. 2nd, there are just way too many people there cuz no one understand what's goin on. Stay the hell away!
really, no words would really describe him. He is just that

OMG, the worst teacher ever..not just at osu, but everywhere.  His lectures are not coherent and don't flow whatsoever and he asks the weirdest questions on his tests.  The tests are nothing like the homework, so basically no matter how hard/much you study, you will not ace his exams.  DO NOT TAKE!!!

Ridiculously a horrible teacher. If you are going to take o-chem , avoid this one at all course. One bad ass teacher. Unprepared and always late to class. Basically, he just doesn't care. This guy is ruining OSU chemistry department reputation.
Lectures were about as clear as an outhouse toilet.  Kind of stuck up, and cocky...Dude needs a new watch to get to class on time.  Avoid at all costs...look to Platz for real explanations!
Two things about Dr. Bong: He always comes prepared, and he's  never late. Classes with him fly by because everything he says has purpose and content. Great professor. No one better for this subject.

Prof. Bong...Hehehe!  I think he and the last reviewer were using a Bong.  Inspiring?  He couldn't inspire a man on fire to jump in a lake.  Dude was always 5-10 minutes late to lecture.  Basically, I learned how not to behave.

Professor Bong's teaching inspires. He makes the subject matter accessible. Reading notes from his class is pure learning pleasure. I highly recommend Dr. Bong for this course. You will learn, and if you listen to what he has to offer in class, taking his exams can even be enjoyable. Dr. Bong is the very best this Chem department has to offer.

He is a nice guy but a bad professor. His exams were really hard because he didnt teach at all. I got a B+ only because the curve was incredible. Im in Rojanbabu now and he is 100x better. Only take Bong if Frankel is your only other option

Bong's a good guy, i agree, and when i took the class i hated it - but i got a B- and knew the material - now i have Fraenkel and i hate it even more. Bong might not be the best at explaining the material but most ochem profs are even worse.

Alright...Bong is good guy, he tries his hardest to teach the material...He tries to give everyone he can an A...He makes an effort to help you if you make an effort to learn.  The material itself is hard...it's a hard class. If you study you can do well in his class..these poeople whine too much!!!

I dropped the class after the first exam, probably could have stayed and gotten an A with a 50% for the class.  I wouldn't have been prepared for 252 though, he doesn't explain anything.  Taking Platz is a much better option.

Those were the hardest exams I have EVER taken.  He is a very nice guy, very personable.  However, there was something missing, but I am not sure what.  Once you finish that exam, just thank god for a curve, because you know it will be a big one.

Well, I think he was a bad teacher too. I ended up going to a different lecture(Dr.Platz), even though I was in Bong's class. Bong did NOT present the information as clearly as possible, he was very confusing and I don't recommend taking him. I ended up with an A-(thanks to Platz) in this class.

Allright these other ratings only said that because they failed!! I got an A in this class.  All you have to do is study.  You study and you pass.  He presented the material as well as it could be presented.  It's simple, STUDY AND YOU PASS!!  He does everything he can to give out A's!! Great prof!!

He is, without a doubt, the worst professor that I've had the misfortune of studying under. This guy makes absolutely no effort to help his students and throws together tests that are both irrelevant and lacking (proofreading was not evident). He needs to be reprimanded.
Yikes. Uses plenty of examples but doesn't explain a single one. Take him only if there are absolutely NO other options.

summary_comment: Professor Wilburn is highly knowledgeable in physical biochemistry but struggles significantly with teaching methods, leading to a largely ineffective classroom experience. Students found his lectures confusing and unhelpful, with many opting to self-study or rely on recitations. Homework assignments were often irrelevant to the exams, and he failed to provide adequate practice or clarify exam material, despite clear student requests for additional support.

Ratings.comment: Professor Wilburn is an incredibly smart man, but I honestly believe he does not know how to teach at all. I have never had a worse experience than his class. His lectures make no sense, and the only time I learned was in recitation. His coding homework is stressful and completely irrelevant to the exams.

I enjoyed the way he set up the class - the coding projects and use of genAI opened my mind to a new way of problem solving and taught me the basics of Python. But... he's not great at lecturing, I eventually just stopped going and read the textbook. The material being tested (60% of grade) was not clear, and there were almost no practice problems.

Dr. Wilburn lacks any teaching ability. His lectures consist of him going through slides without explaining any of what is shown on each slide. He also gives complicated coding problems for homework that are not helpful at all. Dr. Wilburn also refused to do practice problems in class for exam review when multiple students asked him requested them.

You can tell that Dr. Wilburn loves physical biochemistry and really enjoys teaching it, but he struggles with communicating the information in a way that students can easily understand. There were several times while studying where I had to first understand what he was actually talking about in the lecture slides. Convoluted explanations.

summary_comment: Dr. Adu is highly regarded as the best professor at Ohio State, known for his exceptional lectures and organizational skills. He is described as kind, approachable, and humorous, making the class engaging. Despite low average scores, students find the class manageable with sufficient effort and highly recommend it.

Ratings.comment: Dr Adu is the best professor I have ever had at Ohio State. His lectures are fantastic and is extremely organized. Very kind, approachable, and has a great sense of humor. Averages in the class are low, I think an 84 was an A. However, if you put the time in it is very easy to be successful in his class. Highly recommend.

summary_comment: Dr. Karn is an effective teacher who emphasizes practice problems to prepare students for tests, though the content is challenging. Her lectures are helpful but can be dry at times, and attendance is crucial for understanding the material. While some students find her approachable and effortful, others consider her one of the weaker lecturers in the OSU chemistry department and advise against taking her class.

Ratings.comment: She does lots of practice problems in lecture to prepare you for the tests, but you will definitely have to study on your own. She teaches well, the content is just difficult to grasp. Attendance is not mandatory, but you will be very confused if you miss more than one or two lectures. She does several fun presentations throughout the semester.

Dr. Karn is a good professor. Most of the time I felt well prepared going into the exams. She spends plenty of time reviewing for the exams during lecture and there are plenty of practice exams available on Carmen. Sometimes lecture can be dry and boring, but she gets the key concepts across.
Warm and helpful personality, but not a very strong lecturer. Almost all of the class's subject material was review to me, but I found the way she explains things in lecture unnecessarily confusing.
One of the worst professors at OSU, makes me want to sleep in lecture. Feels like she doesn't want to teach but is being forced to. Don't take her
OSU chem department sucks and shes a victim to their BS.

She is very nice as a person. If you taking this class and looking for a high grade I don't recommend taking it with Dr. Karnvshe uses very short notes and you might find stuff in the midterm that she didn't go over. She does very simple practice problems whereas when you do practice problems you will get lost because it is so difficult.

Okay we all know OSU gen chem sucks but Dr. Karn tries her best to make course concepts digestible. Her lecture slides tend to be short and to the point, she works out many practice problems to make sure you understand the basics but reading the textbook is important to understand the more complicated steps. She uses mastering sparingly.
Do not take her class
Class wasn't terribly interesting but Dr. Karn did her best with what material she had. She was very good at answering questions during lecture. Overall pretty solid.
So much online homework made the class incredibly overwhelming. I enjoyed her as a teacher, its just a tough class in general.

Karn was a great teacher and the class in general was very easy. You write a technical paper over the course of a semester and that's about it. The faculty lectures are interesting too. Would recommend it to anyone in the chemistry major trying to branch out or brush up on their formal writing skills.
Had dr Karn for lab. Great professor really cares for her students

summary_comment: Professor Dalby is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and genuine desire to help students succeed. He offers extensive review sessions and resources, which significantly aid in exam preparation. While some students find his lectures somewhat disorganized and unstructured, the overall consensus is that his dedication and clear expectations lead to successful outcomes for those who engage actively with his materials.

Ratings.comment: Dalby's class was easy if you are an avid studier and student. If you take time outside of class to make your own quizlets and review the slide shows, you will do great. All the practice exams were basically the exact same layout as the actual exam. I received 100% on 2 of the four exams, and the worst I did was an 18/20 on the first exam.

Professor Dalbey is a great professor! He takes the time outside of class to do review sessions during zoom for each exam. He seems to genuinely want his students to succeed and has a lot of passion for the subject. He sometimes can be scatterbrained during his lectures but it wasn't a problem for me as long as you pay attention.

Dalbey is a kind and funny professor, he genuinely seems like he wants you to succeed and he takes the time out of his day to do extensive and multiple review videos before each exam. Sometimes he is scatterbrained during lectures but you can tell he has a lot of passion for what he teaches!

Dr. Dalbey was a sweet professor. I went to almost all his office hours and found them to be really helpful. Before exams, he hosts a zoom and goes over material for the upcoming test. I used the online textbook, to follow along but it definitely isn't necessary. Although lectures aren't mandatory you should definitely attend all of them.

It was a hard class overall, but as long as you attended lecture and watched the zoom reviews that he posted, you will succeed. He was a bit scatterbrained, and the teaching style was a bit unorganized, but I am also very particular. All assignments and expectations for his class were clear and resources were always available.

I seriously wish i could understand him, he gets very off topic and mumbles about random stuff. has 3 midterms and lots of homework due every sunday. im sure theres better professors to take if you want to do well. i recommend 1210/1220 for a better range of majors you can take.

Dr. Dalbey was the most amazing professor I have ever had. He donates to much of his time outside of class to help his students, and really wants them to succeed. Attending his review sessions helped studying so much, as he narrows all the class content down to what you need to know for the exam.

Dr. Dalbey is a really good dude. He can be a little disorganized sometimes but he overall really wants his students to do well. The first three midterms aren't extremely hard, but the final was very difficult. I suggest using his office hours and review sessions, and use his key topic sheet so that you feel confident about all test subjects.

The lectures were really boring, it was very easy to get off track during class. I loved his in-depth Sunday review session. They were more helpful than the class. 3 midterms then the final exam. BE PREPARED!!!!!
Decent professor, but the lectures are pretty boring. So long as you pay attention and show up to review sessions you should be fine.

I was HORRIBLE at chem in hs but Dr. Dalbey is an amazing professor. He has review sessions and office hours which are SO HELPFUL!!! He provides the resources you need to succeed and if you use them, YOU WILL DO GREAT!! work hard, put in the time and effort, and he will help you even more. the book is not required but it gives amazing explanations
exam's are very hard but homework will bring you up. He does sunday review sessions every weekend.... GO to them !!!! saved my grade. final is impossible.

Just focusing on lecture: the lectures are fine but do not go in depth as much as the material on quizzes do. Your textbook and Khan academy are your friend. Ross wants everyone to pass and cares deeply- but that doesnt mean he will go the extra mile. Put in the work and itll come back to you.

Dr. Dalbey is an amazing human and professor. He truly cares about his students and wants us to do well. He hosts review sessions weekly and is extremely helpful. He is willing to answer all of our questions. If you stay on top of your work, you will do well in his class. If you have to take Chem 1110 definitely choose him as your professor.

There are weekly homework assignments that help you to understand the lectures more. I recommend reading the chapters before or after the lecture. They are very helpful. Also Dr. Dalbey hosts review sessions which are super helpful, so I recommend going to those as well. As long as you put in the work, you will get the grade you want.

Prof Dalbey is one of the best professors Ive ever had. The lectures can be boring but he is always hosting review sessions where he makes the course material a lot easier to comprehend and gives a lot of exam insight. If you go to class and study the class isnt too bad

Dr. Dalbey is the sweetest human being alive, and he genuinely wants everyone in his class to do good which is why he offers review sessions on Sundays and occasionally Saturdays. Chemistry is hard but he makes it fun and easy to learn. I always struggled in chem and I'm actually doing good, the hardest part are the exams which there aren't many

Dr. Dalbey is just such a funny old guy. He loves to show animals on the lecture slides and he loves to talk about his cats. He is a really nice guy and he is always willing to meet with students during office hours on the weekend. The class in my eyes was really easy with any background chemistry knowledge from high school.

Dr. Dalbey cares about his students and gives lots of study materials and hosts many study sessions. Definitely attend the study sessions as he tells you about a lot of what is going to be on the exam. Sometimes his lectures were boring, but the demonstrations always made me laugh.

Dr. Dalbey is truly one of the kindest professors I've ever had. He held many review sessions on Saturdays/Sundays to make sure everyone could learn the material. His lectures are kinda boring, but he does a lot of demonstrations. His exams are only 25 questions, however, so they can be pretty difficult. Overall, a great professor!

Take dalbeys class if you want to pass! during COVID, he let us make a study guide for ourselves. and for the Final we got to use 5 pages worth of notes! he makes sure to give us information that will be on the exam. chemistry is hard but going to his office hours and asking question after class will help! and the TA are amazing

He is a nice professor. the problem is he wont directly answer your question. He goes around the question not knowing he isnt giving the answer. also, he doesnt really give good explanations during lecture. He is a caring guy and wants you to know what is on the exam and his office hours do help a little. He has saturday and sunday review sessions
Dalbey was a fun prof. but the class was a lot of work. The labs took up a lot of time and so did the homework. The first 3 midterms were not too bad but the Final....

Dr. Dalbey wants you to succeed in chemistry. He recognizes that even though it is an intro class, it is difficult. You do have to dedicate time to this class to pass. But, he has very engaging lectures and he has fair tests and provides a lot of resources to review and study with. Although it is a tough subject, he wants students to succeed.
Wonderful guy, but doesnt explain very well.

Doctor Dalbey was an overall pretty good professor. He held many review sessions before exams, helping to know what would be on the exams. Reading through the book is very helpful with the homework and studying for the exams. However, Dr. Dalbey was very unorganized with his exams. All three of my midterms had a problem with how they were graded.

Dr. Dalbey is a great professor and he greatly cares about his students. His demos during class are always entertaining and a nice break during long lectures. There are 3 midterms and a very difficult final at the end of the semester. Make sure to attend Dr. Dalbey's review sessions that he holds almost every weekend- they are extremely helpful.

Dr. Dalbey is a great professor. He is engaging in lecture and holds good review sessions when its time for a midterm or final. His review sessions really help, I do not recommend missing those. 2 of the 3 weekly lecture hw is for correctness so make sure you use your book so you get all the points. If you put in the work, you should do fine.

Focus on lab grades and exams because they made up a majority of your points and are weighted heavily. Dalbey is a fine lecturer, and I recommend going to his lectures, but it's not a huge deal if you skip a few. He holds review sessions nearly every Sunday, but I found the most effective way of studying was reading the book and taking notes.
Final was terrible. Study for it! Go to review sessions.

His demos are so funny and you can tell he loves them too. Do well in the lab and explain your thoughts. Attend all the Sunday review sessions and you will pass no problem. I made review guides out of his "topics" posted and they helped a ton.

Dr. Dalbey is the quintessential nice old man, he has reviews every week, and extra reviews before exams. There were three reviews before the finals, and at one of them he bought three sheets of pizza from adriatico's, and another he brought in cookies his wife made. The class is pretty similar to my high school chemistry, with some extra stuff.

One of the best Professors at OSU. He was so dedicated for everyone to pass. He held review sessions every Saturday and an additional one on Sundays before exams. Sometimes he would get a little confused by questions, but not too bad. One of my favorite professors here.

Dr. Dalbey is a nice guy, but for a non math person, this class is hard. Labs and recitations are mandatory and come with additional work. Homework is online and due Sunday night. I found the the lab department to be quite difficult when dealing with a personal situation (almost failed) but I passed thanks to a generous curve. Go to his reviews

Dr. Dalbey is the most caring, and helpful professor I've ever had. He understands chemistry is hard, and is available outside of class. He also holds review sessions, GO TO THOSE! Pay attention in lecture, and do review problems in the book. Also, be careful in lab and recitation; it's easy to lose points in those areas.

Dr Dalbey really cares about his students. He held help sessions and exam review almost every sunday of the semester and was always available for questions. Although the exams were quite hard, as long as you supplemented his lectures with the textbook you should be fine. Overall, a kind and knowledgable professor. Use the textbook and online hw!!!

Fair teacher for intro chemistry. A lot of times he is just reading off the slides or his notes, but it is good to go to lecture for all the practice problems. Has review sessions pretty much every Sunday. Posts two exams from previous semesters for exam review. Lab and recitation are easy, but you have to show up to every one for credit

Dr. D was one of the friendliest faces I encountered in my first semester of college. He hosts multiple review sessions before every exam and does what he can to help you succeed. He was always trying his best to keep everyone engaged during lecture because chemistry can be pretty boring. His office hours always proved to be helpful.
So much homework every week, along with pre laboratory, and a post laboratory. There are two lectures a week cramming content, along with a recitation and a lab. I would not take this class again.
Knows what he is talking about. Gives out key topics for midterms. Fair Chemistry Professor.

Dalbey is a great guy, but isn't the best at teaching. If you attend class AND read the textbook, you should be fine. The material is covered very quickly and he doesn't know how to answer questions sometimes. But he is caring and wants his students to do good. He gives important topics for exams, which are really helpful so you know what to study.

Dr. Dalbey is a great person who clearly has a deep passion for chemistry, but has a hard time explaining it to students. He gets confused at his own lectures sometimes, but he really does want his students to well and holds review sessions on sundays. Overall, I would recommend taking his class, but be prepared to teach yourself sometimes.

Dr. Dalbey is not the easiest to understand; he is almost too smart to teach. Typically if you read the book and make your own notes you'll be fine. Other than that he is the nicest and sweetest guy you'll ever meet. He's clueless when it comes to some things like an explosive demo in class, but it makes it all the more better. Take him if you can!

Dr. Dalbey is a great prof who goes out of his way to help his students do well in the class. He holds review sessions before exams, and will always answer any questions you have to the best of his ability. Lecture can be dry, but have you ever been to a fun chem lecture? Chemistry is a hard subject to teach and learn, give the man a break.

His lectures are dry. If you ask for help later after class, it ends up being waste of your breathe. Dalbey always tells you to talk to you TA if you have questions, not him. There are 25 questions for 3 exams worth a ton of points. The final is 40 questions and cumulative. I HATED THIS CLASS! Take Dr. S for this class!

Professor Dalbey is a really sweet and funny guy, but not the best professor. He frequently seems lost in his own lectures. I rely HEAVILY on the textbook. The exam averages are about 65% so he curves each up to a C. Lots of people complain the tests are too hard, but listen, if you work hard and read the textbook you should get an A.

Dr. Dalbey is the classic absent minded professor. He really loves chemistry and is very smart, but you may leave lecture confused a lot. Although he was always helpful if you needed it. Through the lab and doing the online homework I didnt have to read the book and was able to understand what he was talking about in lecture.

To give a quick run down, the lectures are extremely dry and very long. I found that I did better on the exams where I didn't even attend class or look at his notes. I did the best when I read and outlined the textbook, as did pretty much everyone else in the class. The tests are pretty tough, but if you put in the work, you should be fine.

Dr. Dalbey loves Chemistry but has very little idea on how to communicate it to students. I found myself better off just mindlessly taking notes, reading the book and teaching myself instead of trying to follow his thoughts. He is an adorable old man though and likes to make jokes.

The problem isn't the prof as much as it is the CHEM dept. Hard to find help a lot of times, HW ridiculously long each week, tests nearly impossible to pass even after a week of studying. Prof lectures are long and dry, but he seems nice. Again, just a bad dept at OSU.

Dr. Dalbey is my favorite professor, he is so goofy and entertaining in lecture.
