Dr. Loza is very enthusiastic and loves teaching. BUT her lectures covered a lot of material not needed, and was actually more helpful to read the book. Exams were extremely difficult and go beyond the level of difficulty of the book. Avoid if you are not a natural at chemistry

If you must take Chem 1220, don't take her. Lowest averages on all exams (in the 50's) because of questions that weren't in hw, lecture, recitation, etc. She expects a lot out of people who don't even want a career in Chem. Buy a book. It's the only way you'll learn anything. If you have the option, take Dr. Fus. His averages were in the 70's.
Extremely hard test. Lowest averages in the 1220 section. Also seemed to complain a lot. Very knowledgeable on the topic.

Very difficult. Will try to trick you on any question in the midterm, even if you know how to do a problem, you may still get it wrong. I found reading the book more helpful then lecture. Average on exams is always low.

If you find out that she is the professor that you have SWITCH CLASSES. Her midterms so difficult, and cover a lot of material that isn't covered in lecture or in the textbook. She also like to complain to the class about things like the technology she uses in the class. 0/10. Would not recommend.

She gives difficult exams. However this is typical for ANY osu chem class, so anyone who says any chem teacher has easy exams should probably be a chem teacher. She will tell you typical problems that are on the MCAT and other professional exams. Overall, she is difficult but in the end extremely beneficial for your future.

She's nice enough and funny but it's a weed out class and she makes sure to weed people out. Her averages on the midterms have been in the 50%'s so far and she blames this on "holes in students' knowledge". Tested on things that were not on the homework/book/practice midterm. She was unnecessarily hard. Buy a book. It's your only hope.

Quiz average was 60 or lower due to the time limit. There was a curve and i was happy with my grade. A huge weakness of her is that she doesn't understand fully the level of understanding of her students.
very hard test, but a nice enthusiastic teacher.REALLY hard mid term and final.
Good teacher, not the best at explaining things sometimes, but she is very good to talk to and ask questions. She is a great woman and lots of fun!

She is a wonderful professor but very difficult to follow. I recommend a tape recorder and hanging in office hours otherwise great difficulties for exam prep. Problem sets kill but she is always willing to help. She is always enthusiastic and can explain things brilliantly, though she does rush in lecture. Overall: better than other OSU chem profs.

Dr. Loza was very helpful during office hours. If you need extra help, please go! I did better in 163 than in 161/162 because I asked questions and got individualized lessons. She will go out of her way to help you and make you LEARN the material, not regurgitate. Take Loza if you can. Her tests are hard, but studying (LOTS) can net you an A to B+.

I didn't really like her very much. I did decently in her class (A-) and when I asked her a question about the curve of the class she told me that I always had the option of switching to a business major. She seems like a nice person but don't trust too much of what she says. Study everything and work consistently. I would recommend 2 hours a day.

You can tell she loves chemistry, but tests were unnecessarily hard. When I went to ask for help during office hrs, she was incredibly rude & assumed I wanted "special treatment" while I was just trying to get recommendations on how to study better. I didn't like her as a teacher, but I didn't like her even more as a person. Would not recommend.

Took Loza for the second time this year with this class. She goes out her way to talk to students. WARNING: she won't answer her email in a helpful manner. I had a question about a typo on the problem set and she didn't email back acknowledging it, causing the whole class to miss the question.

Very unhelpful and extremely unfair during finals. No equation sheet was given on the final, which wasn't told to the student until three days prior. This made the class very stressed, which she was unsympathetic towards. I would NOT recommend her to people interested.

Dr. Loza is honestly the best professor i've had yet at osu. She genuinely cares about her students and it's obvious that she loves her job. Yes, her exams were difficult, but still fair. I find her class to be enjoyable and also worth going to. She gives plenty of examples, and is entertaining to listen to. I can't wait to have her again next qtr!

Dr. Loza is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about what she teaches. She's very practical and understands the students' side of things better than any other professor I've had in college. The material is hard and she expects a lot out of students, but she keeps lectures interesting and understandable. Great professor

Her class can be somewhat difficult and I ended up with a C in the class, but even as she says, she also got a C in general chemistry. While her midterms and finals can be challenging, she is a very enthusiastic person who is more than willing to help you out if you ask for it. She's lots of fun and seems to love what she does. Highly recommended.

Instructors like her make classes awesome. She is very enthusiastic about her subject and tries to spice chemistry up even more by connecting it with the real world. She makes an effort to talk walk around the room and talk to students before and after class. One of the best teachers I've had yet.
Very clear and uses many examples in lecture. So friendly and eager to help. Class and exams are passable if the work is done.
She may not be the easiest teacher, but she is very very helpful and truly cares about the students. I recommend her and am actually taking her next quarter!

Dr. Loza was brillant. She always went out her way to talk with students and build a personal relationship. Tests are difficult, but they're not a problem if your chemistry background is strong. TAKE LOZA. Tests will prepare you well for the future.
Words cannot describe how worthless she was. Impossibly difficult midterm and final, worthless TA's. Worst class i have ever taken. Avoid at all costs.

Dr Loza is an amazing teacher.  The only disappointment with her is that I couldnt have her for chem 123.  She is fun and made chemistry even more interesting.  If you have half a brain you can get an A in the class.

Dr. Loza is extremely helpful to the students that come to her office hours. GO! She incorporates the work she did in BP in the class. She lets the students blow things up. She is fun and passionate. I took Zellmer winter quarter and i believe that she explained it better. She goes through the notes quickly but she makes sure you understand it.

Professor Loza is the best professor I've had so far at OSU, especially for chemistry. Anyone who argues otherwise is honestly just whining because they couldn't handle general chemistry. Her tests can be hard, but if you pay attention in lecture and go to office hours, you'll find the class very manageable, perhaps even easy.

She is intimidating, but the more time you spend with her, the more you will never want another professor. Her class is hard, but if you pay attention and do what she says (i.e. studying any info she gives you!). Go to her office hours! She's willing to help.

There is no denying that the Gen Chem series at OSU is incredibly difficult and takes a lot of work, but it is nice to have a teacher who loves what she does and cares about her students. She makes an effort to talk to students before class and repeatedly tells students to come to office hours. She is animated in class. I suggest taking her.

Dr.Loza is the greatest Gen Chem professor ever. She's so engaged in class and truly has an interest in the subject matter and in making sure you understand it. Her tests are HARD but doable if you study a lot. Work hard and enjoy having a teacher that cares!

Great professor! Wish I could have her for all my chems. She was understanding and taught the subject clearly. Her homework problems are not mandatory, but they're very helpful and they appear a lot on the exams so keep up with them.

Professor Loza is an amazing professor.  Her exams are hard, and she does make you work, but she also makes you think in new ways. She is always so upbeat and happy and she really does try to make the students understand. Chemistry is a hard course at Ohio State, and you WILL need to read, and you WILL need to do homework problems- but Loza helps!

Dr. Loza is extremely willing to help all her students and is understanding and compassionate if you're having issues.  Her tests are difficult. I recommend doing ALL suggested problems, as most questions on the test resemble homework.  She shows strategies, doesn't give away the answer and expects you to think for yourself.  Fantastic educator.

I absolutely love this teacher. She really broke everything down into terms we could understand. Her exams weren't super easy but I thought they were fair.I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend her. Shes personable, funny and entertaining. There was a lot of content but I believe she covered and set us up for 123 very well.Go out of your way to take her!

When she isn't complaining about the room or the other professor, she can be a good teacher.  Watch out for her quizzes though, instead of quizzing over the main points of a chapter, she picks one thing and goes extremely in depth on it.  She is very helpful in her office hours though

I think Dr. Loza was an excellent professor. She always came to class very well prepared for lecture and was almost always clear. She was also extremely helpful for students at office hours and always open for questions in lecture.

Incredible teacher and extremely helpful. Made class fun and innovative. I got an A in the class. All the questions from the quizzes come from homework. Midterms and Final are hard but not impossible.
Incredible teacher. Very clear and helpful. All questions from quizzes come from the   homework. Midterms and Finals are difficult, but not impossible

Overall, I consider myself to be a good student (straight As in high school) and this was the hardest class I've ever taken. The tests, especially, were difficult. If you had AP Chemistry in high school, you'll be fine, but if you didn't, good luck! You'll need it.

I just finished Chem 161 today and I thought that Loza was a very good teacher.  She will help you, but she is not just gonna spoon feed you. The Final is not as bad as people on here are saying.  I got an 86.

I see people on here saying she is terrible, but honestly she is not too bad. I find her helpful, she is nice on top of that and seems to enjoy talking to the students. She comes in labs, and is encouraging. Her tests and quizzes are challenging, but not impossible. I feel like she is preparing me well. Most the time she explains things clearly

SHE IS VERY HARD BUT IT'S WORTH IT!I had Dr. Loza for the 160 series which is the same as the 120 but only for chem and biochem majors.Her midterms and finals are TERRIBLE but she is a great lecturer.If you go to office hours and ask questions it's a lot of help.She is a very nice lady and will do her best to help you pass the class.

Not a bad professor, but her midterms were pretty tough.  They were alright if you did the homework and understood it.  Read the text, go to class.  Also, her final was the single hardest test I've ever seen in my entire life.  Avg. of final was around 49%. Prepare to be challenged.

Anyone who complains about Loza is a pansy and needs to learn that college is tough! Loza although I hated this class at times because it has difficult exams...is still a great teacher. Go to office hours, study, attend lecture, study more. Loza is tough but if you are a science major or pre-med she will prepare you for success.

I had Loza for 121 and 122. She is one of the toughest professors I ever had, but she is also the nicest. GO TO OFFICE HOURS and DO THE HW and you are going to be okay. She's entertaining during lecture, but she moves fast, so you have to keep up! Exams are almost evil but they come almost straight from the homework so don't just ignore them.

I had her for 121 and 122.  She is tough, but you will learn the material.  Even though she writes hard tests, doing the homework and going to office hours will allow for good performance on midterms and tests.  If you're looking for the easy A don't take this class, but if you want to learn the material and retain information taker her.

Worst teacher I've had at OSU!I took her Fall quarter of my freshman year. I went to her office hours and she told me if I couldn't handle simple nomenclature then I should transfer to another university.That's a pretty hateful thing to say to a freshman in their first quarter.Exams are hard and lectures are full of mistakes.Avoid her at all costs!

Dr. Loza is one of the more amazing individuals I have ever met. She's one of the most helpful and patient professors. Her office hours are the key to success, plus doing the homework. Her Mids and Final were rough, but fair. Just look for the hidden trick to use.

Chem 122 is a very difficult class. Attend every lecture and read the book. Her exams are hard and her final even harder.! In order to be successful, must spend time out of class working homework problems.

Loza was the bomb.  Sweetest lady ever.  If you get the opportunity to take her I recommend it.  She is extremely fair on midterms and quizzes.  Final was really hard.  Go to office hours.  She is very helpful at office hours.  She is by far the best teacher I've had at OSU.  Not sure why her rating is so low.  Take her!!

Loza is a good teacher and her tests weren't hard.  The reason the average is so low is because most of the students are freshmen who think they don't have to do the HW because it's not graded.  They think learning is sitting in a lecture taking notes and in general being spoon fed.  Read the book, do the HW, and ask for help.  You will do great.

I had this teacher for 161 and 162 which are the same as 121 and 122 but for chemistry and biochemistry majors. I have read through people's comments and they are negative, I managed to get an A in 161 which we had short answer tests, not just multiple choice. She likes to trick (challenge) you on midterms, but just think. She is a great teacher.

THE ABSOLUTE WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY ENTIRE LIFE OF EDUCATION! If you are registering for courses and have her, then drop it and run the other way...I would rather wait for another quarter to take a class taught by another prof. then take another class with her. She's useless in lectures and office hours and horrible exam/quiz writer.
I hate everything about this woman and everything she stands for. The bell curve is obsolete and the class average was a 62... she thinks that is normal....

Dr. Loza is a great professor// I didn't have much of a chemistry background, so her office hours were great, she's very approachable. DO THE HW (which isn't mandatory)-many of her Test & Quiz ?'s are straight from there...and those are often hard. Reading the Chapter before the lecture is good b/c she gears the lectures more towards the specifics

Very nice lady, and excited about chemistry. Attending lecture is sort of helpful, but in order to do well in this class reading the book and doing practice problems is a must.She writes very hard midterms and final. Study alot and ask questions and you can pass with a decent grade.
Knows the stuff;;Details are important for her
Everyone liked her but I did not. I thought her teaching style was really hard to follow and her handwriting is very scribbly. Really sweet lady but if possible take someone else.

Don't take Loza. Even though she says she is willing to help every single person in the class, she is not willing to own up to her mistakes in order to help every single person in the class. She wrote questions on the midterms/quizzes that were wrong, and then would not give points back to the students who actually picked the right answers.

Horrible professor. Quizzes/tests impossible. MT aves 55%. Final ave 43%. Learned more from reading the book. However, she didn't test on material from the book, but rather on extraneous, irrelevant, tid-bits of info that she threw out during class. She talked too fast, her notes were illegible and it was impossible to follow her during lectures.

Careless teacher who didn't proofread her exam questions. I dropped after I saw how terrible she was at her job and enrolled in Zellmer the following quarter and snagged a B+ pretty easily. Avoid her like the plague if at all possible.

She is ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE.  Not sure why she has a job.She throws the exams at you they are full of tricks and not straightforward at all.  Most of the important material we should know is passed over for things that pop up in 2 sentences in the book.  Take her if you feel like ruining your GPA.

Loza likes to think that Chemistry is so much fun that we should do it in our spare time. I would not advise taking her if you don't like to strain your eyes to see what she has written on the board (messy)or like to try to take notes she speaks literally a mile a minute!!!

She talks too fast and her hand writing is very illegible.  She goes through a whole page of notes in lecture in about 30 seconds, which is ridiculous.  Her actual exams are nothing like her practice exams.

WORST TEACHER EVER, a complete whack job. Don't expect to learn anything from her. She doesn't use PowerPoint and talks really fast. Her hand writing is horrendous. She openly admits to not knowing the material. She is currently being reviewed because her tests do not reflect what she teaches. Class averages never higher than 60%. You be the judge.

Her class is impossible. She rushes through her notes and isn't clear on what she explains. Anything you do to study is useless. Her finals are mentally impossible. Best advice is to go to class and follow the book. You must be completely prepared. Good luck.

Welcome to weed-out classes, dudes.  If you don't go to class, read the book, and make a general effort, you'll probably fail.  Chemistry isn't going to get easier anytime soon - take advantage of the resources you're provided (homework problems, office hours, etc) and you'll do just fine.  Don't bet on the final to salvage your grade - it sucks.

This class is so so so HARD!  Her quizzes are tricky and her MIDTERMS are absoloutely nothing like the practice one's she gives.  Avoid this professor if you want to keep a good GPA.  She tricks you all the time!

Dont take her class. I am a very smart person. I studied alot for this class and beat the average very well on the exams on top of being above average on all the labs and quizes. For all of the work I put in and even by regularly beating the average by 15 to 20 percent I still only got a B. Its not worth it. Take someone else.

ok so do not listen to the person beneath me, this class is like impossible to get an A in.. ok there is homework, but there is really no time to even do it considering the labs are ridiculous and unnecessary. Loza puts trick questions on exams. She is a decent teacher besides her exams. I got a C+ with a decent curve! Just stay about the average!

Here is the thing about Dr. Loza. One person way back when decided to say she was a bad teacher and made terribly hard exams and everyone decided to hop on that bandwagon. She GIVES you the HW problems to work on. If you can do them all without a hitch before he exam, you will get an A. Those who don't do well in the class don't do the HW problems.

She says a lot in her lecture, but because she mentions BP, Inudstry, and references irrelevant things from 121, 123, upper level courses and the MCAT, most of it is worthless. Her handwriting is illegible. Her TA's are incompetent. Her final is impossible.  She has no accountability for how terrible she is; EVERYTHING is "your fault".

DO NOT TAKE LOZA UNLESS YOU HAVE TO. Everyone says she is so easy and nice when really she is hard to approach, and just not a good professor. I did well in the class but only because of the time i put in. Take Zellmer if you can. Loza tries to trick everyone, she made mistakes on both exams and on the snswer keys so we studied the wrong material

Dont listen to anyone who says she's easy. I failed Loza, next quarter I took Zellmer who is much more helpful and got a 94 after the curve. She makes mistakes in class and on exams a lot. All her test have problems that are tricks or that you've never seen before. She says do the problems in the book but she never uses them on tests. Take Zellmer

Not an easy teacher at all. She is easy to understand in lecture and quizzes but her midterms and finals are full of screwballs. She also doesnt have much sympathy for students who just conceptually struggle

Her tests are extremely long, 30 questions in 78 min. with all of them being math. If it takes you a little longer than 2 min. to do each question you will be dominated, our average is a 60%.  Don't take her unless you are amazing at math.

Shes teaches a lot of material in a very short period of time. You must study all the time in order to to well in her class. The average grade for our first midterm was a 64%, and the material was fairly easy at face value. However, the questions on the quizzes and tests are so warped and twisted that if you didn't study, you will fail miserably.
She moved way too fast. The average on the first midterm was a 63%, there was no curve. Avoid her if at all possible

Dr. Loza had a very tough class. She spoke way too fast and her tests had plenty of trick questions and were unfair. Her practice exams were so easy, but her real exams were so hard and tricky. This is a tough class and she wasn't the best teacher at all.

Wost teacher I have ever had! Seems nice like a nice person but dont let it fool you. She is an awful teacher. How do they allow such lecturers!? Makes many mistakes in lecture and has high demands of her students. If you can get someone else do it, AVOID HER CLASS!
The trick to Loza is- go to office hours & do the homework.  Loza is a good professor & more importantly, a good person who actually knows students by name

I had Dr. Loza for 121 and 123.  I think she was pretty good.  Her tests are very hard yet doable if you study.  The final was crazy difficult...I think i ran out of time on my 123 final.  But since the averages were so low the curve was really nice.  If you study, do the homework problems, and go see her you should be fine in the class.
She is a very good professor, but her class is way too hard. If you want a good grade then don't take her! Her exams are way harder than her practice exams, and the final was impossible.
Goes quickly in lecture but very helpful outside of class.  She works hard to teach at the level of the majority of the class. I highly recommend her.

She was a horrible teacher, guaranteed at least a 10% curve, there was none. Her tests are ridiculous and not at all like her practice tests and I would study at least the week before each exam everyday.

The final is near impossible after studying two weeks straight but it's curved so that doesn't matter. she's very helpful in office hours.. and i never went to lecture because i never understood her so i taught myself out of the book and did fine...it's a lot more work than 121 esp the labs

She is a gem because she only teaches this class in the Fall. You must read your notes every day, read your book and do aleast the general homework problems because its the only way you will make it. I put in 2-3 hours a day and got an A- and was 15pts from an A. Warning there is no curve. Before the curve I was at a 88% and got bumped up a few pts

She is helpful, her office is often open.  In lecture she will move very fast, and her writing on the black board is illegible.  Make sure you her practice tests, but after that make sure to keep studying.  The real test is much different.  Tests are very hard, be prepared.
Extremely helpful, office was always open and willing to help you without making you feel dumb! fast paced, but straightforward.

Don't listen to the other comments. Loza is the best professor for Chem 121. Exams were not bad at all and quizzes were easy and predictable. Just keep up in the book reading and you will know what she is talking about with lecture. It takes work on your part...she's not going to do the learning for you

I've had her 3 times, twice for 122 and now for 123. She's not awful. Most of the people who thinks shes horrible are just awful at chemistry. She teaches a tough class but does go through the notes very quickly. She is very open to helping students at office hours but does make mistakes sometimes that will make students confused. Take her.

horrible, horrible professor, incomprehensible explanation, ignores students request such as posting the class notes (plus illegible handwriting), always comment on how stupid her chem 121 students are - personally I hate her doing this, it is not even funny, pretty useless office hours since all you do is discuss with other studets who are lost

Absolutely terrible. She goes crazy fast, covers one sheet of notes with the other sheet and neither can be read, and tests are ridiculous. While the midterms were hard, they were definitely doable. The final was NOT. Average was a 51%. I studied for a month for that exam and still failed. Worst professor EVER!! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!!!!!

Had her for chem 122 and 123 a bit crazy all over but shes good at explaining and go to her office hours she'll help you out a lot.  Exams were fair and if you do the problems she assigns and go to lecture you should be fine.

Moves fast, you have to, HAVE to do a lot of practice problems to know what is going on. Her lectures are not interesting, but chemistry isn't. I think she's helpful, but her exams are not easy at all. But seriously, do the problems, practice, and  you'll stand a chance.

I know my grade doesn't show it but this professor sucked. She flies around the lecture hall rambling about her days in the oil industry and what not. It has nothing to do with the class so move on lady! Also her final for sp.08 what the heck was that?She gave two cake walk exams then hit us with the hardest science test I'd ever seen.Absolute bull

I had her for spr-08 qtr, and ended up getting a D+ while trying. There is no way you can follow her. She is a psycho-erratic lecturer that flies, no online help, all handwritten notes.  Zellmer is the best professor in all of the chem department since he gives you notes to follow as YOU LEARN...what a novel idea. Zellmer also provides online help.

She's a tough teacher, but fair.  Doing all of the practice problems isn't as important as understanding the concepts so you can apply them to new situations.  Midterms have questions you've never seen before in your life where you have to apply the concepts to completely new types of problems.  The final will make you cry.

She is very enthusiastic and goes over everything very quickly, it is best to read the book to fully understand what is going on. Her tests are the hardest and most frustrating thing I have yet to encounter at OSU. She also has a voice that can be very headache-inducing at early hours.

Loza is one of those profs that is still around, but noone knows why.  Her lectures are unorganized and consist mostly of failed experiments.  Her exams are unfair. The worst professor I have had so far at OSU.

If you want a good grade in chem 122, good luck it just a hard class. Loza goes very quickly in lecture and most of the material is not online. Her tests are very hard. Quizes are grades very strictly. If you dont show ALL your work you get points off, even if you get the question right. If done right labs help the grade but will take tons of time.
MIDTERMS AND FINALS ARE IMPOSSIBLE!!  Just cut your losses and do well on quizzes homework and labs.  Her lectures are fast and cover a lot so go to them.  Better hope you get a good T.A.

this class will be painful no matter who you have. dr loza seemed genuinely interested in teaching and made lectures about as fun as they could be (which isnt much). the curve sucked though, i worked really hard and got an 81 which only rounded to a B, which didnt seem like that much since midterm and final averages were Fs Ds and Cs

She is a very nice lady outside of class/anything to do with her class or tests.  She hates it when people complain about her tests, it's kind of her "her-way-or-the-highway."  But other than that she really tries to make good lectures (which are helpful), homework help problems and reviews.  Overall, a good teacher.

Overall good professor. Her lectures moved quite fast, but she was wonderful at explaining things if you paid attention. Quizzes are fair; mideterms/final difficult but are what is expected of the class. She is eager to help students. I highly recommend her.

First of all. Inorganic Chemistry is strictly a weed out class. And from the reviews listed below, it couldn't be more apparent. The ratings are either extremlely good or extremeley poor. If you study and work hard in this class, you will do just fine. If you slack off and blame others for your faults, this class will get you nowhere.

I hated Dr. Loza!  She kept screwing poeple over with mastering chemistry.  she went really fast and her tests were hard.  Everthing in her class was, "when I worked at BP..." It was outrageoud and I am glad to be out of her class. P.S. curve? HA! nonexistant!
Our classes average grade on the final was a forty percent if that says anything about her teaching...

Dr. Loza is a great Chem professor. Yes, she can go little fast in lecture, but she needs to in order to teach all of the material. Midterms are fair. Quizzes are difficult. If you work, you will do fine.

Dr. Loza is an exceptional teacher. Word to the wise.. GET TO KNOW HER. She is a very kind lady and loves to meet ith students in office hours. If you do not meet with her, you a great disservice to yourself. I got an A in her class because I worked for an A. Every teacher makes errors in class. Overall great professor!

Her exams are ridiculous, avoid her class at all costs! She is not clear about technical things-mastering chemistry..she was making the students use it and she did not even know how. THe exam averages were set extremely low(set by her I might add) for the final it was set at a 50%!!!! Do not be fooled by her in the beginning!

She is an amazing professor. The examples she does in class are just like the questions on the quizzes and exams. The old exams that she has as reviews are almost identical to the exams she gives.  She is a great professor and i highly recommen her to anyone taking chemistry.

I don't know why she gets so many bad reviews. She's an excellent professor who is genuinely interested in teaching. She does her best to relate material to real life. The only downside is she talks very fast and overlaps the overhead sheets. Weekly quizzes are more than fair. Study HARD and you can easily get a B. Love this professor!
Offered a lot of at-home assignments to practice problems learned in class. Clear for the most part, but makes frequent errors and has poor handwriting on the chalkboard.

this class was awful.i took three years of chemistry in high school and her class was ridiculously hard.she flys through notes and makes mistakes constantly.im not a chem major and she was teaching the class as if we were all going to move on to higher chem and like we had no other classes.in or to maintain honors gpa i droped.DONT TAKE THIS CLASS!

horrible teacher...going to lecture is like listening to a tape on fast forward...impossible to learn in class but after class notes are a good source of review...her exams suck so take any other professor...overall worst professor at osu

Her handwriting is awful.  She should publish her notes because she flies through them so fast, you can either copy notes and not listen, or listen and not copy notes.  Tells you not to worry about the details, but worry about them. Do the practice problems.go to office hours if you are having problems, she's really helpful. not terrible as a prof.

If you watch Dr. Loza very carefully, you can see her take a deep breath at the beginning of class, and then exhale for an hour and a half as she launches into lecture.  I find it hard to understand a professor who moves slowly, let alone someone who's mouth could be clocked on a radar gun.

She was very good at explaining concepts and how what we were learning was related to chemistry out in the field!  She went on random tangents sometimes though.  But all in all she was a great professor!

GREAT Professor. So much easier than the other chem 122 profs. She is clear, but fast. You have to keep up-but she takes all her midterm questions from questions  you've seen somewhere else in lecture/book/quizzes. I really recommend her, her lectures are fun and she's really nice and helps as much as she can! Just a great person and prof.

Confusing sometimes. Talks fast and i could not read the writing on the board. Made references and examples that i did not understand at times because they were from chem 123 (i was in 121). She expects you to know everything... or mostly everything and if you dont then you will feel very behind. She is a nice lady however.

If you show that you put out a good effort and go to her office hours, you will do great.  She is extremely helpful if you go to her, but you can't expect her to go out of her way to help you if you don't ask for it.  I learned a lot - Great teacher!

Not a very helpful professor. Did not have a review for the finals/midterms, which all other teachers had and the Finals/Midterms were ridiculous, with things on them that she said would not be on them. Doesn't provide notes unlike most and is often unclear. Be ready to ask for a lot of extra help from your TA and the tutor room. Wouldn't recommend

I had her for the entire gen chem series and all if you want to get a good grade go to ALL the lectures because she gets a lot of questions off her notes and make sure you pay attention because sometimes it will be different from the book (aka limiting reagents). also was really hard good luck!

Loza was a very difficult prof, her handwrtiting was unbelievably bad and she would fly through the lectures.  When she would ask for questions (a rare occasion) she would do so with her eyes closed.  Her quizzes and midterms were difficult but not impossible.  I found the final to be easier than both though.  Overall I would reccomend Fuss!
She is a very fair and very cool teacher. She's often quite funny  and enjoys helping and answering questions. I did very little studying for this class. Easy class, I'd recommend her.

I loved taking this class, and I am not even doing that great in it. I missed a quiz and 2 labs and she was very helpful, letting me make them up when I could. She teaches for continuing in o-chem, the mcats, and for the job field. She keeps her lectures interesting with demos and practical applications. She is also very enthusiastic.

Bad.  She lectures too fast to retain any information.  Her tests are exremely difficult and do not follow her lectures at all.  Her writing is illegible and she makes numerous typoes on the board and exam.

Her teaching method is terrible- and everything that everyone else said about her on her that is negative IS TRUE!! She goes almost twice as fast as the other chem 121 teachers and makes mistakes constantly (the material is hard enough and she makes it even more confusing by messing up the problems!)I'm taking the NIGHT class over her chem122 class
Her class made me hate. It is impossible to do what is expected of you on the exams, so she grades with a curve which isn't a very big curve. I hope she stops teaching chemistry.
Her grading curve is her way of apologizing for smacking you in the face with impossible midterms. Her methods are a bad time.
Not a good time in her tests although I aced them, I didn't like the format of her test. She  had many questions that were not covered in depth within the coure content.

She has sloppy unreadable handwriting and speeds through lectures. She does cool lab experiments occasionally however if you need a good grade I don't recommend her, her tests sting.  Her TAs aren't that helpful either although they try to be.
Good teacher. Not great. Her exams were difficult. Quizzes were a little easier. I did well because of the 96% I earned in lab portion.
She tries to act sweet and helpful, but her exams are very hard. Don't be fooled! I would recommend her though, ANYTHING is better than Zellmer.
I didn't think she was that great of a teacher. She was hard  to follow and the exams were crazy hard.

Worst Professor Ever! Her notes are useless and her voice is obnoxious. She makes countless mistakes during lecture and seems very fake. Her exams are extremely difficult and have many typos on them. Avoid her if at all possible

I adamantly recommend not taking the 122C (computer-based quizzes)class with her. I did great in lab & fine on exams (usually 10-15% higher than average) & my total guiz score dropped me down a letter for my final grade. If the answer is not typed in a certain way its wrong. Personally, I would have done much better if I took written quizes.

She seemed ok at best. The main problem I had with her was that she said not to worry about the "details", but then on the exams the questions were on the most detailed things. She also went way too fast in the lectures. She is the better of the gen chem teachers i've had, but being better than C. Mathews (my 122 teacher) is not saying much.

Really nice teacher, will do anything possible to help you understand material. Pretty difficult class but alot is learned throughout the quarter, lectures are a bit fast and hard to follow but office hours are great and help you learn alot. Definately the best Gen Chem prof I've had.

Do not recommend. If you pay attention in lecture, she makes mistakes on the board ALOT (both math and conceptual - told us H20 was polar). Tells you not to  worry about certain things then SURPRISE it's on the midterm. Even has answer keys wrong for midterms. Often derails about industry or other classes, has hard time admitting mistakes.

Enjoys what she teaches, friendly, and approachable. Lectures are clear, but speaks too quickly to retain anything, you're too busy copying notes. Tends to make mistakes on everything. Office hours are extremely helpful but usually packed and inconvenient if during your lab time. Puts things on quizzes and tests that she says will not be on there.

She's a very good professor and she definetely knows her stuff. Her finals are extremely difficult and it will probably be one of the hardest test you'll ever take, so start studying now! And when she says those words "hint, hing!" make a big star on your notes because it will definetely be on her tests in some form. good luck!
Very helpful lady if you ever do need help and believe me, you definitely will. Her tests are very difficult. My lab score of 244/250 and doing good on the quizzes saved my life.

After reading all of these reviews I can see people being scared of having to take Loza - I know I was.  Guess what?  The class was EASY.  READ the book and DO the HW because TEST probs were straight from these.  In class, watch examples, don't take notes and above all don't be that person who scoffs at Loza because you failed the last midterm.

pretty good teacher.  spent lecture time counting how many times she says INDUSTRY or BP.  tests are a little challenging and you have to know the material.   final was absolutely ridiculous.  got a 217/300 and destroyed the average.

At first, seemed like she knew what she was talking about.  As time went on, she made stupid mistakes and it was just confusing to go to lecture.  Felt like we had to teach ourselves the material.  Too many people in office hours so sometimes you dont even get help.  Tests are decent...but puts ridiculous questions on them sometimes
Very energetic and good at giving lectures.
very easy class but hard to concentrate in lecture because you copy notes the whole time.  Very helpful in office hours, and will explain anything you don't understand

A decent class if you stay on top of your game.  Midterms and finals are tricky, so do lots of the practice problems. She is the best gen. chem professor i've ever had and so energetic! If you have any problems go see her during office hours and you'll never regret it!
She herself seems very nice, but she made tons of typos on the midterms, making already difficult tests a bit more so.

For this being a very difficult class, Dr. Loza spends an unbelievable amount of time with you if it is needed to try and help you understand. She is a very nice woman with a great sense of humor. If you need help GO AND SEE HER. She is more than willing to explain everything to you.

Class may seem easier because I'm taking it for the 2nd time around, but as a teacher she is far above and beyond others teaching the same course in terms of presenting the same material and keeping the students interested.
No Comments
Reading of book important.  Lectures were fast paced, but she understood it well and was well prepared to teach.  She held regular office hours and was willing to help.  Very nice lady.

She was a very nice person, who liked her students and wanted them to learn. But she misses industry way too much and has forgotten that things easy to her may be difficult on her students. She put a question on our final which covered something neither touched in lecture nor the homework. The best people in the class got low 60s on the final.

This class is awesome because of her. She is so good at making things seem very easy. I had no problem in any part of this class because of her. This is saying a lot because my roomate got a D with another professor who taught this class.

Amazing prof, she is extremely personable and related well with students.  If I had the chance to be in her class, i would do it in a hearbeat....her quizzes and exams are fair....do the homework and go to her office hours and you will do well in her class

She makes the class harder than it has to be, I took chem 122 twice and my second lecturer didn't make us learn a considerable amount of things that she required. She is a great person, very nice and knowledgeable but she jumps around to various things in lecture, making it a bit confusing. If your in her class do all of the homework problems.

She is a great person and really explains things well if you go to office hours. She has many connetions and is a great person to have as a reference. Understands where students are coming from and will take her time to make sure you understand things. Tests are very difficult and she puts tricky things and exceptions on them.

Dr. Loza was very helpful, engaging, and knowledgable when it came to the material.  I highly recommend taking her class.  Your grades might suffer -- she is difficult, but you with thoroughly learn the material.  She wrote an amazing recommendation.  I've been accepted to a top 20 graduate school.  She takes interest in her students.  Go to O hrs.
Best Chemistry lecturer that I've ever had.

Very down-to-earth person. Is willing to help you out if you just go to her office hours. Lectures are very clear and exams are written as you would expect them to be. She makes lectures interesting and is great for the 121, 122, 123 series (I had all 3). Much better than the other chem 121 teacher I had. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! =)
She's too loud and has her eyes closed when she looks up and asks if there are any questions, so it's pointless if your hand is raised.

Hard to recommend this prof. She is very interested in helping students, very well prepared, and I think she is a great teacher; however, you might be better off shooting yourself in the face than taking her exams. I'm a chemical engineer and I barely managed a B in this class, and only because my TA didn't speak enough English to mark off points.

Loza is a good teacher, the class is very difficult. The work YOU put into it really matters. Read in advance, go to lecture, do the HW problems, re-read, go to office hours, read again if you have to. It's not easy material, and it's often less interesting than it is easy to understand. Try to find something you like in the class or you might die.

THIS WAS BY FAR THE HARDEST CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN AT OSU!! She slaps the S**t out of you gradewise if you aren't prepared on the exams.  But that is really something us undergrads recognize that we are about to enter upper level chemistry. Her lectures are a little unclear someitmes, but go to OH and you really should be fine. Good overall.

I came in with a solid background in chem, but these classes were still challenging. she runs through the material during lecture, so it's very easy to get lost. Best advice: read the book BEFORE the lectures so you know what she's talking about-it helped me to grasp the material better. Also, do ALL of the assigned hw and go to her office hours!!!
No Comments

Not a very good teacher at all.  She speaks so fast you cannot understand her and when she writes things on the board, it is illegible.  You are best off not even going to the lectures they are that bad.

Dr. Loza has greatly progressed with what to cover and preparing you accordingly for tests and etc.  I had her in 122 and was blown away, but now in 123 I really enjoy her class, and feel she has become one of the better teachers I've had.  She has always been helpful, replies to emails, addresses problems if ppl. are having trouble, and etc.

She is such an enthusiastic teacher. Yeah, she talks fast and it's hard to take notes in her lecture w/ 350 other students, but she is just so much fun and so friendly and encouraging when you actually get to know her. Although the class may be hard, if you try your best and seek out for help, it's definitly do-able.

Probably the hardest class I've ever taken. She's very disorganized, flies through notes and expects you to understand them. The midterms and finals are on nothing covered she covers in class. Avoid at all costs.
Very nice, and very encouraging with office hours. Talks waaaaaay too fast. And she loses people a lot, including me. Gives a lot of "real life" examples and the demos are pretty cool.

Unless u are already a chem genius, try ur best not to take this class! She has the tendency to ramble and get off topic, and she talks very fast. For some reason she thinks because she says something at 600mph we actually grasp it and then she'll put it on the exams! She's very specific, so if u must take her memorize everything.
No Comments
She goes way too fast in class and loses people a lot.   Her voice is squeaky and high and gets annoying to listen to.  She is a nice person and helpful though if you seek it out.
Talked way too much and way too fast.  Online quizzes were garbage and weren't fair...wouldn't recommend at all

I was able to get a B in her class, but not before getting an 85 out of 175 on the first mid-term. Study EVERYTHING.  Just because she says that something isn't on a mid-term or final doesn't mean that isn't there. Find more of her examst than she gives you to practice with (minority office on the 10th floor of the tower next to Morril will help).
the final exam was the biggest joke of my college career. she is hard but there was a nice curve (spring qtr) at least.  i passed so anything is possible.

She seems nice but really is a ****.  She is very tricky on her exam and final, and i mean very tricky.  The final is a **** as you have heard.  And she doesnt post your final grades and she won't return your emails once the class is over.  I advise you not to take her class.  Also our class wasn't curved at all while chem 121 and 122 were curved

The class is very tough.  The exams are rough however but nothing compared to the final, which was a disaster.  She is willing to help and encourages office hours.  Go see her and you'll be happy you did grade wise.  All in all great teacher for a hard subject

By any objective standard, Dr. Loza is an excellent teacher.  However, something didn't sit well with me.  The best I can figure, the class was too focused on students of high ability, and especially students with high interest in the subject, for such a large, non-honors class.
Class was hard. But if you take the time to work with her. She will help you by all MEANS...Trust me. (that includes your grade!)
Not helpful, made everything harder than it needed to be, always had random hard questions... DO NOT RECOMMEND

Dr. Loza seems nice at first - shes very helpful  in office hours, but by the time the final roles around, she says shes too busy to help anyone, and throws a bunch of tricky questions on the exam. study as much as you can, but theres not much hope unless youre REALLY good at memorizing 100 random chemical equations!

Exams are a little crazy, but that's mostly due to the material in the class. Very tough subject matter, and she flies through it. Wouldn't recommend missing lectures. She's pretty helpful, but you have to do most of the work for yourself, good luck getting by without studying.
She is an awesome professor! This is a hard class, but if you work hard you'll be fine. She lectures fast and in-depth. Read before class.
Caring, but goes way too fast.
man wtf is wrong with this professor, she talks to much about her personal life in the lecture and not enough materials about the subject.

Tough class!  She is amazingly helpful but her material is still tough.  She makes you feel fine in office hrs then you realize you aren't later.  Lectures give you cramps in your wrists.  Wish she would post notes.  Finals are really hard.  Overall she is one of the most hands on professors i've ever had but the class does suck.

I deeply dislike her, she told us that certain material would be covered, then put everything else that she told us not to study on the final.  She also lies, she let people retake the final because they were stressed, but would not let others and told them that she had not let others when I knew people who had retaken it.  Not as good as she seems
She is a two faced liar, dont trust a word that she says

She told us some specific things that weren't going to be on the final, and then, of course they ended up being on the final.  Then, on webct, a day after grades were posted, the grades went down a half grade...she's definitely not as nice as she seems
Nicest woman ever, but the final was the hardest test I have ever taken.

she talks wayyy too fast, notes will give you carpal tunnels, gives too much information so you're not sure what you need to know for exams, exams are ridiculous, esp the final, and no curve... helpful in office hours, but tough on grading

Loza was a terrible teacher. She should be ashamed of herself...the whole chemistry department should be ashamed of itself...I've spoken to many students whose GPAs have been destroyed by this class. If u must take take chem 122, take it at a different college. Don't waste your money it here!

Beware of the final!  She over-simplifies everything in lecture, gives easy midterms, then slams you with a ridiculous final.  Nice, but talks too fast and doesn't post lecture notes/reviews sheets online.  Teaches a lot of stuff diff't from the textbook- if you don't go to lecture, you're screwed.

She was very helpful during office hours. Her midterms are fairly straight forward and similar to the practice midterms.Her final will kick you were the sun does not shine.  It is very hard.  For the final, take all the hard questions from the previous midterms and know them inside out and backwards

She knows how to teach well and keeps people awake during her class :) Gives great hints for the quizzes. Midterms are fair. The only bad thing is the final sucks. No matter how hard you study. You are screwed.
this lady rocks
I really disliked this class

It is aneasy class,awesome teacher and lecturer. As human makes mistakes on the board but they are not major mistakes. The thing is there is no friggin curve and WebCT work sucks real bad. And another con is that always reffers to people that go to office hours. which is not good for the class.

I studied most of the material myself so was able to get decent grade in her class. I had an 86% and got a B+ (sad) didnt curve the class at all. very fast lectures and terrible notes on the board. one thing I hated abt her..she makes a lot of mistakes in the exam and hold u responsible for it.
teaches at a fast pace, but keeps you interested throughout the lecture.
good
She has a way of making you HATE the subject you once loved...

She can't think on her feet.  She is disorganized.  She is very dedicated and will help you if you need it.  I don't like her pace in class... she'll give you info you'll never use and tell you that you don't need it.  As a result she doesn't seem to take a breathe from bell to bell. Very kind lady.
No Comments

outstanding professor!  yet, she may go fast..but hey..it's college..she takes her time to actually explain the stuff during office hours..TAKE ADVANTAGE of that..very helpful! i just wished she taught other classes other than chem. HIGHLY recommend Loza. it's your loss if you don't get her.
She messed up multiple questions on both midterms & problems on the board.She comments that she "hates the stuff" she teaches. She is frantic and disorganized! NOT a responsible teacher.
Best Teacher so far at OSU
She is very good, very understanding, and very helpful. Best Chem teacher around. I would defintely recommend her.
It's as simple as this.  Do the work get an A.  She is the best chem teacher I have had thus far.  Suggest to anyone.  Is interested in helping you and getting to know you.
Truly interested in your learning

I could imagine she would be good for higher level chem classes, but she does not remember a good amount of the core material for chem 121. she is a good professor, just not for material that she doesn't remember how to do.
nice

She is the best chem teacher I've had since HS.  She explains things very well and is very well organized.  If you have to take chemistry, i highly recommend her.  But make sure you do your work cuz the midterm and esp. the final are NOT easy.
Nice...keeps everyone on their seat...very energetic.

Dr. Loza is so nice! She is extremely helpful and understanding.  Although I did enjoy her class, I only got a B- and was way above average on ALL of the midterms.  The curve is barely existant.  That is my only complaint.
She's a fantastic teacher!  If you get an opportunity, take her for your course, you will learn a lot!

Midterms are hard.  She likes to make near-riddles of chemistry concepts as questions on MTs.  You will be too busy taking notes in lecture to listen to her rambling on.  She is very helpful when you speak with her though.
very nice woman who seems to really care about students. she likes to strike up conversations. she moves a little fast with the notes, though.

She's very enthusiastic and willing to help Her exams are tough, but if you go to class, study, do even just some of the homework, and take the practice exams, you can do well. She's tough, but wants everyone to do well; all you have to do is ask for help
Can't make tests without messing up on the problems. She also messes up when working out problems in class.
Super nice lady.  Very fair but tests were hard.  She really tells you what you need to do to get a good grade.
The Best professor I've had so far. Intense, but the best professor in the chem department (I'm a chem major by the way), and I'm a senior now and I still think she's the best:)
Take if possible

(she's also listed on this website as just loza)... dr. loza is amazing.  the final was pretty difficult but quizzes and midterms weren't so much.  get her for whatever courses you can, she's an awesome teacher.

She is a good professor. If you study the notes, read the book, and <b>do the homework</b>, you will pass the class. Her exams are hard but straight forward for the most part if you know the material.
A LOT of fun.  I always enjoyed going to her class.  She did move kind of fast, but it was easy to get used to after the first week.
Chemistry makes a lot more sense than it did last quarter. The other techer for 122 doesn't seem to be as clear or understanding of students.

dr. loza is the most down-to-earth professor i've had. she's caring and helpful and an excellent teacher. it's interesting how she always ties things back to real life and "when she worked in industry".
The best professor I've had so far.  Very enthusiastic, high energy... makes 8:30 lectures a pleasure.
Awesome prof....if you need to take a chemistry class and she is one of the profs teaching it. Then this is your PROF....VERY VERY helpful...inside and outside of class(office hours)
She is a very helpful prof....i had a broken wrist for most of the quarter and she gave me all the notes!
Makes lectures actually fun to go to!  She has an incredible knowledge of the subject, and really enjoys teaching the class.  Get her if you possibly can!
No Comments
by far my favorite prof
She is one of the best professors I've ever had.
Awesome professor!
Hard class, but she is interesting and she does try to help even though the tests and class are very hard.
Very good teacher.  Not too hard for a chemistry class.  Very nice lady too.
enthusiastic-wants kids to learn-always willing to help during her office hours- moves so fast during lecture there is no time to look at the clock
Amazing professor.  Very enthusiastic and willing to help students. Holds office hours everday and even sometimes 2 times a day.
What a great professor.  Chem 125 is a hard class, that's not her fault, they just want to weed the wrong people out of engineering early on.  Really, really nice and so willing to help.
She is one if not the best teacher Ive ever had, and I even got a C.  She is so smart, so cool, and can actually relate the material to your life.  A great teacher.
Awesome prof.  Best chem professor I've ever had!!  You will love her...
Excellent prof. If you actually want to learn chem.  Look no further. very hard exams, but no surprises on them.
yes
Speaks English which is always a good thing, but very clear and helpful.  The final was brutal for this course with a mean around 50%.
Went to office hours everyday. Gives great recommendations! Exams were hard but had a nice curve. She honestly wanted to help her students succeed.
She was absolutely awesome!! Very helpful and concerned, which is something you rarely find in a professor!
Great teacher!!  Really wanted students to learn.
Very helpful and enthusiastic professor. Midterms and finals are very difficult though. She is very willing to help students if they come to office hours.
No Comments
Definately one of the better chem teachers to take from.
Very enthusiastic, but runs quickly through lectures & exams are very difficult.
No Comments
Easy to understand but exams are hard
Extremely energetic and enthusiastic teacher. Highly rrecommended.

summary_comment: Antony Okumu's teaching style in chemistry labs varies widely among students. Some find his approach easy and straightforward, requiring only adherence to basic guidelines and following textbook questions, while others criticize his lack of knowledge and poor safety instructions. Conversely, his TAs are highly praised for their helpfulness and effectiveness.

Ratings.comment: Took him for my chem 121 lab. Easy as long as you listen to his guidelines, he isn't nearly as strict on the format of lab notebooks as other teachers are. Just follow the questions from the part of the textbook he requires and you'll be fine. Pretty easy quizzes and final.

I took a general chemistry lab taught by Antony Okumu and I honestly think he should be a middle school teacher. This guy didn't know anything. He came on the first day telling us the basic safety rules, which took over 30 minutes, and said to use "insulating material" to hold hot glassware. He used napkins as an example of holding a hot beaker...
Antony is the Best TA over. Really helpful and overall was a great pair with Dr. Chang. In all honesty should be teaching his own section. The man is G.

summary_comment: Dr. McCoy is generally praised for her enthusiasm and willingness to help students, though some find her classes challenging. Students appreciate her clear lectures, useful demonstrations, and fair exams, but note that the class requires significant effort and engagement. Feedback is mixed regarding the availability of examples and supplementary resources, with some finding the class overwhelming due to overlapping deadlines and discouragement from asking questions in class.

Ratings.comment: Overall an ok class but not enough examples and very few supplementary resources to help. Exams/homework deadlines often overlapped and became pretty overwhelming (but they were graded very quickly which was nice). Asking questions in class was a little unhelpful and kind of discouraged.
Do not take class with her. She's a terrible lecturer and her explanations don't make sense.

Really really cool professor. Not the easiest class, but she made herself overly available and wanted students to succeed. Lots of demos and proofs in class, but the tests were very similar to problems given as homework and on quizzes. I would highly recommend!

Great professor, a little intimidating at first but great enthusiasm in what she teaches. Loves demos, one can expect seeing the same demo up to 5 times. Derives everything in class. Class absolutely requires hard work. Go to lecture and recitation and study before and after class, then getting an A is very possible.

Dr. McCoy surpassed my expectations of a college professor. Lectures were clear, office hours were helpful, and the exams (and grading) were fair.  Be prepared to work hard, but if you put in the hours you'll do well in the course.

I loved Dr. McCoy! She kept the class interesting with demos and was overall very enthusiastic about the course. Yes, the course itself was difficult, but as a teacher I think she did a fantastic job explaining concepts in her lectures. Dr. McCoy is very fair in her exams and you will get what you put in this class.

Dr. McCoy is very helpful to those students who are engaged and want to learn.  She gives hard homework and tests, but overall she cares about her students and wants them to do well.  I learned a lot in this class.

Dr. McCoy is very helpful. She gets excited when people come to office hours looking for help.  Always willing to help and accept questions.  Lectures are useful and she does interesting demonstrations.  Quizzes are very manageable, and exams are very fair.  She really cares that students learn the material.
tries her best to help students understand material, i mean chemistry is a hard course. likes to let the ta tas hang loose but besides that good teacher :)
She will reject you from office hours if it "not a good time".
Will make exams with the intent to fail most of the class.  Thinks she is funny.

At first it seems like she's going to be great, but found myself wondering what was going on by the first midterm, which was pretty tricky. I know that she cares about Chemistry a lot, but when asked a question she just says way too much and confuses people more.  Always smiling in a really creepy way like she knows she's killing you slowly.

The material is difficult, and the book is a must. The tests are difficult and include a "gimme" point regarding attendence (one was tricky though). Her notes she posts don't match her lecture very well and require notetaking anyway. Curve and grade breakdown was pretty unclear. Averages on exams were in the 60s, and she seemed proud of it.

McCoy was a wonderful teacher. She is very enthusiastic about chemistry and teaching.  She also loved to do experiments, which made class less boring.  I definitely recommend her.  For personal reasons, I had to drop the class, but will enroll in her class without a doubt when I retake it.

Willing to help at all times and offers help sessions prior to midterms/final the Sunday before. Fair quizzes/exams, just read the book and go to lecture. LOVES to do explosive demos, so expect one during every lecture. She may make material harder than it is, but she's overall great. Compared to the other 121 professors, she's great!

Dr. McCoy is extremely enthusiastic about teaching and tries to get all of the students actively engaged in all lectures.  She welcomes questions.  Her tests are hard, but that is because she wishes to challenge students, NOT see them fail.She is a fair teacher and very clear about what is on each exam/quiz.

She is VERY enthusiastic about chemistry.  She is a great teacher.  She seems hard because she must get through WAY TOO MUCH material in 10 weeks. Study for this class and go to all the class and you should be fine.  I would reccomend to take McCoy.
Dr.McCoy is a great professor. She makes lectures as interesting as a chem lecture can be. She loves blowing things up in class whenever she can. She has a big curve for the tests.
she loves to teach chem
I advice not taking her class if you want to get a good grade.
wonderful prof that is often berated for some reason.  show up to class and open your book once and a while and an A is easy to attain

She was a good professor. Her notes were good. Quizzes and exams were pretty difficult. She can get kind of rude sometimes in class. She does a lot of cool demonstrations in class. I would suggest her to future students

She's a good Chem prof, I'm re-taking the class right now and she is a million times better than my last prof. She actually explains things, of course exams are tough, all chem exams are. Her notes are easy to follow.

I thought Mccoy was a very good prof.  She was very fair with her quizzes and exams-she lets you know exactly what material it will cover.  Her practice exams are a lot like the actual exams.  She loves doing experiments, especially ones that involve fire and explosions.  I liked her for 121.
very interested in chemistry! midterms were difficult but that can be expected in any chem class

I thought that she was a good teacher. She stuck to the book and was very clear about what was going to be on each quiz and the midterms/final. If she thought a question was unfair and you brought it to her attention, she would look over it and usually accept more than one answer. Lectures were easy to follow and she blew stuff up=) Take her class!
The Worst Professor ever! Do not take her.  The curve help only few people, but it did not help me at all.  So confusing at lecture.  Trust me avoid her

100% English speaking professor, since I know that's what you care about most.  She's pretty good. Keeps lectures interesting for the most part, however she does way too many examples. The course could probably have been over in 6-7 weeks if she didn't do so many of them.  I'd recommend her.

I thought Dr. McCoy was a very good professor, she was knowledgable and energetic.  Lectures can get a little confusing, but that would be the case regardless of professor.  I disagree with the student that keeps making entries claiming Dr. McCoy is annoyed when asked questions, in fact in my experience, she encouraged them.

Okay, she blew things up in class on a regular basis.  What's not to like about that?  Very enthusiastic about her subject.  Tried to explain everything very well in class, but I had to use the textbook a lot as well.
You just can't make chemistry that interesting; it's not her fault.  You have to read the book to supplement her lectures.
MY FAVORITE PROFESSOR TO DATE!  (Including undergrad, masters, and medical school!)
Great Teacher. Very willing to help students out during office hours. Very caring.

I thought she was a great prof.  She was really helpful in office hours and I always felt welcome when I went.  Her tests were fair which is more than I can say for some profs.  I would recommend her.

The worst professor I've ever had!! Even though I ended up with a good grade I felt that her expectations were out of line. She seemed to put too much emphasis on thermodynamics and focused on too much detail. Lectures were frustrating because she'd get clearly upset if anyone asked a question. Avoid taking her classes!
She was great.  But what's up with those shoes??
No Comments
Exams were much harder this quarter than last year's... not a very effective lecturer, and exams focus much more on manipulation of formulas than the science behind them.

Such a horrible teacher! Get's pissed if you ask questions and seems to hate teaching. If you go to her office hours she makes you feel stupid if you ask questions. Good luck with the class, the averages on the test were 60% and 50%.... not a good teacher...

McCoy is probably the worst teacher I've had at OSU. She seemed short tempered, and grew frustrated if you were confused and asked too many questions. In her office hours, she seemed uninterested in helping me. I relied alot on my TA for help because McCoy didn't offer me any.
Course design was pretty good, and the TAs were very helpful. The homework was definitely harder than the exams, which definitely helped. A MUCH better course than h201 in my opinion.

She didnt explain the concepts, she just gave equations.  The homework only helps you if you wanna go to office hours and get the answers from the TA's every week.  Final was very unbalanced, too much thermo.
all in all a pretty good class.  dr. mccoy was very helpful and willing to answer questions.  she gives points for homework, and there are no quizzes.  exams were easier than h201, but still tough.
A pretty good teacher, can be confusing because she uses chemical equations to prove concepts-and derives everything!
Anne B. McCoy may not be hot, but she is pretty. Just because she's an older woman, doesn't mean she can't be attractive.
Compared to H201, this honors class is a breeze. Here, the teacher is actually good! Its thermodynamics and QM. In depth, but not as bad on tests as 201.
Gives points for homework (good thing); exams are sane; reaches out to students
great teacher, very patient and kind
Okay, My friend's don't think she is sexy, but She is great teacher.

summary_comment: Professor Stegemiller is an effective yet challenging instructor who receives high praise for his willingness to help students and offer extra credit. While his lectures can be monotonous, he enlivens them with occasional jokes and hands-on experiments. Students find his tests demanding but manageable with proper preparation and utilization of office hours.

Ratings.comment: Doctor Steg seems scary at first, but he's a really good teacher! he answers questions in class and is fine with late work, and he's super helpful. just don't let him scare you. also sometimes he jokes about how u have a pop quiz, you probably don't! i had fun :DD

Stegemiller is a rough teacher but is always willing to give extra credit as long as you show you're willing to try. He just wants you to try your best. Try to swallow as much material as you can during office hours and you'll pass no problem
Idk why these college kids are buggin. Stegs class was gucci. Almost all the sophmores that had him love him

Although I dislike chemistry as much as the next guy, Stegemiller made the lectures fairly enjoyable by explaining the concepts well and cracking sarcastic jokes whenever possible. I really enjoyed having Stegemiller. It wasn't until I took Chemistry 1220 with another teacher when I realized how good of a teacher Stegemiller was.
Extremely monotone but his occasional jokes and experiments make it bearable. Make sure you do the reading and go to office hours.

Stegemiller will start the semester by reading off his rate my professors reviews, but believe what you read because it's all true. His exams were rough. If you skip a lecture you will get behind but his voice puts you to sleep anyways so make you you stay on top of the reading. He uses TopHat everyday for questions too so know your stuff.

Stegemiller is hard. Harder than I had originally thought. He comes at you pretty heavy and if you aren't ready, it can really hit you from behind. However, if you prepare and utilize resources (especially office hours, they're incredible), you'll end up on top.

Stegemiller tries to keep things interesting by doing quick experiments to convey the point. Tests are heavily math based! After the first test, you get used to it. Online homework and studying is really important. And, he doesn't curve.

Go to class and be sure to complete the homework assignments. At the end of the year there was no curve and my TA started taking off random points on all the labs to "fix the curve of the class." I found this unfair as it lowered my grade by 2%. Also, he made the last midterm unusually hard to again, "fix the curve." He is also hard to understand.

Chem1210 is difficult regardless of who you take. From what I understand, Dr. S is pretty average compared to the rest of the Chem department. Definitely not the worst but not the best. He's a pretty cool guy and made some pretty good jokes but I often found that I didn't know what I could do to get better. We did Sapling but that was the only HW.

This class was difficult. It took a ton of work to get a solid B. However, it is chemistry, and chemistry is not an easy subject to begin with. Truly putting in a lot of work will result in an acceptable grade, there really is no way around it. Lectures and assignments were pretty clear, and there are a lot of resources available to help.

This class took A LOT of work to get a B in. His tests are pretty hard, a lot of application and synthesis. However, he definitely prepared me for 1220. He's also a super nice guy and is always sarcastic in lecture so it's a little more bearable if you hate chemistry like me.

Stegemillers a funny guy. Comes off as cocky/rude at first but gets funnier over the semester. He'll remind you about 486 times you have an exam coming up (thanks. I get it.) This class is really hard but any chem class is. He gives a lot of homework and the tests are really hard especially if your not good at application problems
Very tough class, no matter which professor you have.

Dr. Stegemiller is a good choice for Chem 1210. The class isn't the easiest as chemistry usually isn't. He has a very monotonous voice, but if you can pay attention, the class isn't too difficult. He hints to future exam questions and likes to keep class interesting with experiments or jokes. Overall, a good choice for a teacher. Better than others

This was my second time taking Chem 1210. Midterms were significantly easier. As long as you're solid on all the important concepts, A's are reachable on all the midterms. Not a very good lecturer. I found myself constantly looking back at my previous lecturer's slides for clarification while he lectured. Overall, very good professor.

Dr. Stegemiller makes everything clear. Went to his office hours whenever I didn't understand something. He's always accessible. He is very monotonous so it's sometimes difficult to pay attention especially when you're really tired but if you're focused (he gives hints to quizzes/tests during lecture sometimes) you will get it. PUT IN THE WORK!
This class will require work, Stegemiller makes that very clear from the beginning but he also makes sure that you know which topics that work needs to go to.
keeps class interstesting.

He does a classic lecture style class, and posts his slides on Carmen.  I really liked how he ran the class.  Tests were exactly what he told you they would be.  Recitation was a completion grade so that was a really nice grade buffer.  He did a fair amount of demos and joked with the class to keep you awake.

Dr. Stegmiller tries to make the lecture as interesting as possible. He prepares his students for the exams and is very clear as to what will be on them. He gives you everything you need to succeed. It is clear that he genuinely wants everyone to do well.

In hindsight Dr. Stegemiller was one of the easier professors for 1210. He's very clear and concise in lecture. He can go fast at times but if you ask him to slow down, he will. Tests overall were very fair. If you study, you will do fine. Go to lecture, he will give you hints for the tests! Recommend him!

Dr. Stegemiller was actually a really good professor in my opinion. He was sarcastic and was pretty to the point in his lectures. For success in the class do the homework, read the book, do practice problems from the book, and study a week in advance of exams. Utilize practice exams from other professors to prepare and don't cram.

Dr. Stegemiller was an excellent professor.  His class was one where if you put in the work and studied, an A wouldn't be difficult.  His exams weren't hard if you did practice problems in the book and did the online homework.  He also made sure to give time talking about the exam before we had each of them, so there were no surprises for them.

Dr. Stegemiller is a fairly good professor. He honestly wants students to enjoy his class and although he doesn't have office hours, he will arrange a meeting if you ask him. He is kind of awkward and it shows in lecture. His tests are mostly math based, which I really enjoyed. He was not a bad professor, but I'm not sure if I would take him again.

Honestly, if you work hard in this class and start studying a week before the exams you will do fine.  The only nice thing he does is posting his rather unclear notes. Attendance is not mandatory because you can not even understand him during lectures. If not go to lecture make sure you dedicate time to teaching yourself the material.

Overall chemistry is a difficult subject, however Stegemiller throws in funny sarcastic comments to keep people on their feet. He was very good at explaining and frankly a great professor. My advice is to do every practice test you can find online because he doesn't post any on carmen and go to class (sometimes he gives away hints to exams).

Dr. Stegemiller actually cares about whether or not you succeed. If you pay attention in lecture and do the work outside of class, you should get a good grade. He doesn't have office hours but is willing to set up an appointment for you. His sarcasm is interesting, but you will get used to it.

Going off of the other reviews on here, I really wasn't expecting much from Dr Stegemiller's class. Well I was wrong! He is a FANTASTIC teacher! His sense of humor is wonderful (people don't understand his sarcasm) and he is always willing to clarify a topic or answer a question. If you do all your work and study hard for the tests you will succeed

He makes lecture interesting with cool demos and jokes with students. When you go to office hours he is kind of awkward but willing to help. Chem 1210 is just difficult if you have not taken some sort of AP Chem class before, so that is mainly why I struggled. Curve is set by the kids who have chemistry background.

Lectures can be long and confusing. Test are tough and he tries to trick students.  Very sarcastic and can be mean at times.  Class is stressful but curved.  Test averages will be around a D.
