However, he doesn't provide any study materials like the other professors do. Reading the book before lecture, and doing (& UNDERSTANDING) the homework is a must.

By far the worst lecturer I've ever had during my three years in college. He flies through material, doesn't answer questions thoroughly, writes chicken scratch notes on ungodly amounts of paper that he projects onto an overhead screen. He laughs when the class freaks out and decided a 60% (failing) class average was enough to not curve it. AVOID!

He goes very fast during the lectures. He isn't helpful since he doesn't answer questions during lecture. when he gives "study guides" during lecture for exams, they are not helpful. If you get him, switch classes.

Cool guy but confusing teacher. During lectures he  writes down notes that project onto a screen while he talks. I find that he goes fast through lectures and does not let us write everything down. For tests he does give a "study guide" but there are no other practice problems but for the book. Tests/quizzes are hard and I find my TA more helpful.

Rather than explaining new material, he teaches as if it is a review which makes it very difficult to understand what is going on. I didn't understand nearly any concept until my TA reviewed it. He also refuses to answer questions in class but complains about receiving too many questions in emails.

Speeds through lectures and does not teach. He simply writes out notes and does not explain anything. He does not answer student questions in class but encourages visiting the TAs and Office Hours. However, once visiting office hours he still does not EXPLAIN mechanisms and reactions. He is VERY impatient also.

summary_comment: This professor is perceived as having a poor teaching style, characterized by passive-aggressive interactions with students and an excessive emphasis on rote memorization of course material.

Ratings.comment: She's very passive aggressive with her students. She expects you to memorize too much material!

summary_comment: Mr. Lau is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, known for being extremely generous and helpful both during and outside of class, making him easily reachable and approachable for students.

Ratings.comment: Mr.Lau was very generous and helpful during class session and outside class was easy to reach him.

summary_comment: Dr. Schultz is highly regarded for his effective teaching and willingness to help students, though some find his lectures fast-paced. While a few students found his comments about other professors uncomfortable, many praise his clarity and thoroughness in lectures, as well as his availability and support outside of class. Overall, his teaching quality is consistently positive, with several students giving him high marks for his dedication to student success.

Ratings.comment: Nothing special lecture wise, but he gives me abysmal vibes...would not trust him with my drink

He was a fine lecturer, but consistently made some really uncomfortable comments about professors in the department (especially women professor and told us not to go to the only woman TA (two men TAs and one woman) because she "didn't know what she was talking about"...kind of creepy

I took 1920H (was not an option). Dr. Schultz is very helpful in and out of class. His lectures are very clear and accurately reflect exams (exams are often easier than the lecture material) and he gives plenty of helpful examples and practice problems in each lecture. He is a pleasure to talk to and tries his best to help all of his students.

Took 1920H with Dr. Schultz who is an amazing professor in this difficult course. This semester was drastically different from 1910H, so be prepared to put in extra work to succeed. Dr. Schultz is always willing to help you succeed.

I actually took 1920H with Dr. Schultz, but that wasn't an option. Dr. Schultz gives really good lectures. He heavily focuses on being able to solve problems. He is very helpful during office hours and definitely wants his students to succeed. Exams were difficult but reasonable as long as you prepared with practice problems.

Absolutely amazing. Although the general chemistry department can be a pain, Professor Schultz really makes it his goal to have every student truly succeed. I would highly recommend him for general chemistry. Despite the fact that he is really busy, he will take the time out of his day to meet up with you and help if you ask. 5/5 Professor.

Dr. Schultz is a fantastic professor. He makes sure you are aware of everything that's happening. However, he tends to be very speedy during lectures (usually at no fault of his own - there's seemingly always too much material to cover). With that, he can get antsy if students ask questions during class. He still is always willing to help.

Dr. Schultz is a gem in the OSU Chem department. His lectures were consistently well taught, he answered questions to ensure material was clear to everyone, and he was always accessible outside lecture hours. Chem 2 is a difficult course, but Dr. Schultz makes sure that his students are equipped to take on the content. 10/10 guy!

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his dedication and effectiveness as a teaching assistant, genuinely caring about his students' success and providing clear explanations that make complex concepts accessible. However, opinions vary significantly, with some students finding him unhelpful due to a lack of subject knowledge and a perceived pretentious attitude. Overall, the majority of positive feedback highlights his engaging personality, passion for chemistry, and commitment to student learning.

Ratings.comment: He is a very good lab TA and actually cares about his students. Will answer any questions you have and will basically give you the answers to the lab.
Knows absolutely nothing about chemistry, does not care about the students. Does not know the material and cannot teach. He is very pretentious and very passive aggressive.

Matt genuinely cares about the success of his students and is accessible outside of class. Go to office hours because they help a lot; he is really good at explaining difficult concepts and never makes you feel dumb for asking anything.

Hands down the best TA I've had yet! Really chill guy and has an adorable dog he brings to recitations. His recaps of lectures were better than the real thing. He made the material not daunting at all and provided an endless amount of practice. Truly felt that he cared for his students and his craft.
very engaging, great personality and very passionate about chemistry. concerned about the well-being of the students and that they succeed in the course. couldn't recommend a better TA

summary_comment: Dr. Oba is highly regarded as a knowledgeable and engaging professor, particularly known for his sense of humor and dedication to student success. However, his classes are challenging, moving quickly through content, and requiring significant study time, especially for exams. Despite the difficulty, many students appreciate his availability during office hours and his efforts to ensure student understanding and success.

Ratings.comment: Dr Oba was a great prof at Lakehead in Thunder Bay! His class was HARD though wow. He moves fast through content & has very limited office hours. He is very helpful for students registered with Student Accessibility though, which was much appreciated! Midterms were worth 27% each (x2), final 46%, but doing online assignments could drop that a bit.
what is this bs about "having to study all the time because its chemistry"... you could teach yourself this course in a few hours just looking through wikipedia

Easiest class I have ever. He tells you what's on the exam. He even quizzes on old material to give you a chance to raise your score. He even had Saturday review sessions. He really tried to give you the best grade possible.

Dr. Oba was a great teacher...it's chemistry so you will need to study ALOT   to get an A. Do all the practice problems and read the chapter and u will get an A or B.  Also go to office hours, Oba is very helpful and funny.

great teacher! he was so funny -- and explained everything really well. his lectures are really well organized -- but you have to go b/c he doesn't put the power points up until right before the exam. i think i learned a lot from him

Oba is amazing! He is the funniest prof I have had to date, and he actually cares how his students do. He is willing to help no matter what. Class is slightly challenging, but can be handled. I failed the first midterm but still managed to get an A. TAKE HIM!

Dr. Oba made my first chemistry experience awesome! I WANTED to go to his class because this guy cracked me up! He is really fun to listen to, and also willing to bend over backwards for your questions. He truly wants to see his students perform well on midterms. I wish he was teaching 122!

First off, I barely passed with a C-.  Worst grade ever in college!  I just love him though!  Lectures aren't mandatory, but I do advise going.  He's so amazing, and dresses so cute and professional.  Go to his office hours! Read the Chem. book! Do the homework! and you still might fail, the midterms weren't horrible, the final was hard. he's cool
The class isn't bad, you need to keep up with it, oba is a little hard to understand with his french accent, but overal a good teacher,
This was a really easy class, mainly because the lecture notes were exactly what was on the quizzes. Dr. Oba is funny and he has a good sense of style.  Take this class if you want an A!!!

Dr. Oba is by far one of my favorite teachers ever. You can go to his office hours and he will stay as long as it takes until you understand the material. Also, he is very funny and he dresses very well. Genuinely nice guy and his quizzes and tests are very fair. He is the man and he is going to give Gordon Gee a run for his money for OSU president
A great teacher and a fun guy! Go to office hours for help or for conversation.

i did not really try in this class, and got burned on the final. Overall pretty easy class the two midterms you can study a little 2 nights before, and then alot the night before,and do fine. The final ended up being pretty difficult,but in no way impossible.  Very nice guy and if you can't understand him your an idiot. OBA CONTROLS OSU

I found this professor to be slightly difficult to understand (heavy accent---sitting near the front helped me understand him).  The material on exams and quizzes was very fair and came directly from his lecture notes (which were conveniently uploaded to CARMEN). I never had to go to him for help, but he definitely seemed nice and helpful enough.

He was a new teacher when I had him.  His quizzes and midterms are EASY compared to other chem 121 professors.  TAKE THE CLASS WITH HIM AND YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT.  He dresses very well too and he is a really friendly guy  Go to him if you have any questions and he will answer it!

Bad. You cannot understand him and lectures are pointless- you can't understand him.  Download the powerpoints and practice alot of the problems. The practice exams are not worth your time....completely diff from the real thing. ok quizzes, but tough exams... class average was a 64%

Good chem teacher.. tests were fairly easy and so were quizzes and homework... you have to write your own notes but he posts them on carmen before the exams... i would take more cemistry from him if i could
I didnt think his accent was hard to understand.  Lectures were straight forward and followed the book.  Midterms wernt too bad.  If you read the book you'll do fine.
Oba is the man.

It was easier when I didn't go to lecture and try to understand him; basically taught myself the powerpoints (though I procrastinated and did it all at the last minute, so I probably should have done better than a B+).

His powerpoints were extremely straightforward and easy to understand. Quizzes are ridiciously easy. The first midterm was really hard, the second one easy, and the final challenging, but not too bad.
He just kind of goes over his powerpoints, but at least he puts them online so you don't have to go to lectures.

His quizes are really easy, but then we got to the exam and it was pretty hard.  Luckily though he made it multiple choice, so it helped a little.  He's not that bad at lecturing.  I just have him at 8:30am so i'm really not into hearing what he has to say.  All in all, i really don't have any major complaints.

He has a French accent that sometimes makes him hard to understand, but everything he says is on the powerpoint projector so it's not a problem. He is a great teacher and his class is not hard. He let me create an explosion in front of the class. I like him.

Dr. Oba is very helpful and glad to talk to students.  However, he can be hard to understand and he teaches very quickly.  Since this class's material was review for me I didn't really have a problem, but it might be too fast for people unfamiliar with Gen. Chem.

summary_comment: Dr. Nagib is a caring professor known for his passion in organic chemistry, but his teaching is inconsistent in terms of difficulty, making it challenging to prepare effectively. Students appreciate the heavy curve at the end, but many find the quizzes and exams demanding and unpredictable. While some enjoyed his lecture style and found the course manageable, others struggled with his pacing and clarity, recommending seeking additional resources or alternative instructors.

Ratings.comment: He is a nice guy, but he is very inconsistent with his difficulty levels. If the class did too well on a quiz or exam, he would make the next significantly harder. This made trying to study using past exams and quizzes difficult. Friday quizzes during lecture were hectic. There was a huge curve at the end which was a lifesaver.

Dr. Nagib was a kind man who genuinely wanted his students to succeed in his class. That being said, this class was very difficult as most organic chemistry classes are. There was a hefty curve at the end of the class which was nice but it was hard to feel like you could succeed no matter how much you practiced. Practice practice practice.

Dr. Nagib is very nice and definitely passionate about Ochem. His lectures are pretty fast-paced although quite boring due to his ASMR-like voice. There are quizzes every Friday at the end of lecture that are pretty difficult to prepare for sometimes. Exams are rather difficult as well but the class is graded on a hefty curve.
He's very vague and not straightforward. He jumps steps when he could be more elaborate with his explanations. Take a different professor if you can!

Nagib is a nice guy who's passionate about what he teaches. The course workload is also manageable relative to other professors. However, he is often inconsistent with quiz/exam content and difficulty level (our second exam average was 30% lower than our first). Do plenty of practice problems to avoid getting "ambushed" by a quiz or exam

Horrible professor! He didn't seem to care about his students at all. He made all or nothing quizzes over one mechanism that could make or break your grade. He also likes to include unecessary content in his lectures as well. Many times, his lectures don't make sense. Overall, would never take this class with him!

Nagib made ochem enjoyable with his lecture style. He uses paper and a projector, but it worked pretty well for the class. The exams are extremely fair and manageable if you study the mechanisms enough. The weekly quizzes can be tough and draining, but they keep you up on the material. Overall, I hoped for a slightly bigger curve, but he's awesome.

Dr. Nagib is a very caring professor. I started off not liking the class but ended up dedicating more time to it and actually enjoying it. There is no need to do the book problems, but definitely do the practice exams! The practice quizzes and exams were very reflective of actual assessments. And go to recitation!

I started off not doing well in the class and hated his style but, he really wants students to learn. The quizzes are graded strictly to help you remember your mistakes for the midterms. Attend office hours, I went to every single one and he will always be open to helping you. Also do every single book problem, you'll do just fine.
Very chill professor, has really hard exams so be wate of that and weekly quizzes so study for those as well. however, work was minimal and assignments were limited. Study and you should be fine

I like Nagib. He offers a lot of practice problems that line up almost exactly to midterms. Weekly quizzes force you to stay up on material. Quizzes are harder than midterms but I found midterms very easy. Made o chem 2 much easier than 1. Highly recommend. Nice guy too, wants students to do well.

The professor and TAs are kind and readily help in office hours, but the textbook is absolutely horrendous. Combines bond-line notation with condensed formula for some reason, so learning mechanisms with it is a chore, and always insists on using overly complex vocabulary to explain simple concepts. I'd recommend getting other resources.

Be prepared to read the textbook and go to lecture just for him to rewrite the textbook in front of you. Notes are unorganized. Some quizzes are always all or nothing. Mumbles. Each question on midterm worth significant amount of points. Only one class period (55 min) to do midterm. Barely any partial credit. Quizzes every Friday.

He mumbles, is often incorrect about small things during lecture, is unclear about many topics, moves too fast, and will occasionally refuse to answer a question. This dude sucks. Not to mention our entire grade is based off of weekly quizzes, 2 midterms, and a final. Good luck if you get him. Go for Walters or Callam.

Most understanding Prof ever. The topic itself is difficult, and osu has notoriously bad standards in chemistry, but Nagib does everything he can to make the workload manageable. He will only test you on things that he has personally gone over in his lectures, and he makes sure to pace the class to the students understanding of the material.
Completely renewed my love for chemistry back again after first semester organic destroyed it.
Hes one of the best that Ive had. Highly recommend.

He was great! Exams were tough but manageable if you do all the practice problems. Lectures were actually pretty interesting. Orgo trivia lol. Study sessions before exams were super helpful. Curves heavily so dont worry.

This class was really hard. But once I started going to office hours, I learned how to do better for his exams. He gives lots more exam style practice problems in those sessions, I highly recommend them to do well in this class.

I loved Dr. Nagib's class in spite of the fact that I did not perform my best. My complains would be that he posts little practice material or expectations of knowledge. Other than that, his exams are definitely tough, but manageable if you put time in with the book. Personally, he is hilarious and I went to office hours every single week.
Nagib is fantastic. His lectures are engaging and his office hours are super helpful. And exams are very fair and mostly from the book or notes.
This was one of my favorite classes in the chemistry department!
Really enjoyed his lectures - a healthy mix of mechanisms and what he calls orgo trivia
Super caring teacher. You can tell he works on coming up with different ways to teach the material in his lectures and office hours. I highly recommend.

Nagib was a decent professor and made ochem pretty understandable but i still mainly learned from videos online. the weekly quizzes were worth 20 points which was ridiculous and they were extremely hard which destroyed my grade. tells you to do book problems for practice and doesn't offer much other than that. my 58% got curved to a C+. avg was 65%

Nagib wasn't the best professor, but he was just okay. This was the first college course I've struggled with, even though I did every single exercise in the textbook like he suggested. His lectures were at least better than Forsyth's. Obviously, just put in as much work as you possibly can. I ended the class with an 88 and it curved to an A.
THE BEST.
Wow! Ignore the hater on here. Dr Nagib rocks and everyone knows it.
Dr. Nagib was AMAZING!!! Ignore all the previous bad comments. He REALLY cared about the students and was so easy to get close to him and get to know him. He is such a nice person! TAKE HIM!!!!

Honestly I didnt like him at first because his lectures were extremely unorganized but this man has a heart of gold. He clearly cares about his students and makes sure he is fair with everyone. His exams are not that bad if you read the book and do all the excercise problems ahead of time. Quizzes are straight from those problems.
His exams are tough (I know. Its orgo. Duh) but fair. Go to class, do book problems, and youll do fine.

He put out a practice final (honestly for him that's more effort than he's given this entire year) and it's riddled with errors, dropped carbons, and intermediates that he doesn't even use. Take someone else at any cost, even if it's at 8am.

The quizzes are absurdly hard and only cover one topic, so it doesn't give you a good idea of the material. Really quiet, disorganized, only erases half of the board and then just runs into what the's already written, so it's basically illegible. Didn't show up to our last day of class and pretended it was a review period for us. lol ok
Very caring teacher. I really appreciated his office hours. In a 300+ person class, this is the best way to get 1-on-1 time.

I repeatedly asked him for more practice problems because I was doing poorly on the quizzes and every time he sent me an essentially identical template email saying to do the textbook problems (the first line in my emails was basically "I'm doing all the textbook problems). Don't take him. He's only there to do research, should never teach.
Prof Nagib made tough orgo mechanisms much clearer. I really appreciate his teaching style. His office hours were also very helpful. The exams were fair (some questions are straight out of the book).
Didn't even show up to our last day of class so that really says it all. He's up for tenure and if he gets it I will truly explode with anger

Dr. Nagib is a smart guy, clearly. But he is not a professor, he's a researcher. He is the worst professor I've had at Ohio State by far with unorganized notes and constant mistakes in lecture which is very confusing when you're learning mechanisms. He makes the class so much harder than it needs to be. Take another prof, even if it's at 8am.
So boring and unhelpful. I'm pretty irritated by the entire class. Offered no extra problems outside of class or any practice material. Basically just read the textbook out loud during class.

I really loved ochem 2510 but he kind of ruined that for me. He has maybe the quietest, droning lectures I've ever heard of. It seems like he's so mad to be there. The only practice he really offered was textbook problems and then the quizzes/tests looked nothing like them. Don't take him.

Professor Nagib is a fantastic lecturer and managed to make an extremely tough subject understandable and enjoyable. His quizzes and tests are challenging, but he makes it pretty clear what he expects you to know. If you don't understand something, go ask your TA. At least when I was taking his course, his TAs were very helpful!

Dr. Nagib is an incredible professor. His exams and quizzes are straight out of the textbook. If you read the book and go to lecture, you will get an A. His office hours are incredibly helpful, and he always gives help when needed.

Honestly, Nagib is a great guy, clearly cares about his students. His exams for the most part are fair. However, the whole class is a disorganized mess, expectation is extremely unclear, not very accessible outside of class. Oh also, he consistently skips important steps when teaching mechanisms which raises my blood pressure.
A white noise machine would be a more engaging and competent professor and I want a full refund from The Ohio State University

Dude talks way too much about food chemistry. ItS not applicable to anyones interests but his own and its not even applicable to the quizzes or exams. Truly wastes everyones time in lecture and if he isnt talking about food chemistry hes drawing five bonds to carbon and actively tanking everyone in the rooms GPA.

Super nice guy. His exams suck. They're not necessarily difficult but they're worth 200 points and you're expected to take them in a 55-min lecture period. This means there will be 40 point mechanisms (partial credit is stingy at best) and 20 point predict-the-product questions. He provides no resources other than the textbook.

Good guy and super nice, but not the best lecturer. Makes many mistakes, is soft-spoken and unclear. Provides no extra practice problems and never lets you know what to focus on for quizzes and exams. Take another lecturer if possible

To be honest, he is a good guy. But if there are only Wysocky and Nagib to choose, chose the previous one. Nagib is not a good teacher, he doesn't give clear lectures, you can't hear him unless you are next to him. His notes are messy, and he skips steps, often makes mistakes. Tricky exams, useless quiz, no extra credit, no study guide.

Many of these ratings are much too harsh. Dr. Nagib may not have been completely prepared for such a large lecture but he very clearly cares about his students. He is kind and it is evident that he wants his students to do well. Many of these ratings are too harsh.

BAD lecturer, quiet and makes many many mistakes in lecture. He was not ready for a class this size and had no structure to lecture or recitation. He does not provide any sort of guidance through material or provide actually useful practice materials at any time during the year.

His lectures are decent but can sometimes be confusing or unorganized, though he does try to address this in the following lecture if he hears that a lot of students are confused. He's very hypocritical, claiming that he's not out to trick anyone but giving some very tricky quizzes. So far, it has been difficult to earn partial credit on problems.
Terrible lecturer!

Gives very unclear lectures and is a huge hypocrite. He frequently told us hed give us clear criteria on exam questions and then give none and takes credit away for not reason. Also provides zero structure for recitation and all quizzes and exams. Not even clear chapter layouts. Everything is absolutely scrambled -10472847284/10. Do not recommend.
Im astonished that hes able to be THIS bad a professor. Its a skill

He wasn't prepared for a large class like the one we had. The TAs, although wanting to help, end up as ambiguous as his lectures. A bit disorganized, and no practice but from the book. His lectures have improved a bit, but he is very inaccessable outside of class, which forces students to be self-reliant. If you have a question, he's nice in person
Don't believe the hype.

I took Dr. Nagib's Ochem 2 course because he got such amazing reviews on this site, and I have absolutely no idea what people are talking about. He is the worst professor I've ever had. I leave lecture every day feeling absolutely confused and angry because of how boring and disorganized his class is. DO NOT TAKE HIM. Save yourself

Dr. Najib is the best Ochem professor at OSU. He will make you love learning chemistry. I have taken Ochem 1 with other professor and I learned nothing but with Dr. Nagib I learned a lot! This class was LIT!

Dr. Nagib is incredible, if you can take him do it, you will not regret it. He is passionate about chemistry and crazy knowledgeable and it is eveident in his lectures. He explains things well, gives great notes, and really good examples. Exams and quizes are tough but fair. Likes to take problems from the textbook. Take him if you can... seriously

Great professor! Dr. Nagib loves chemistry and is fantastic at teaching it. His lectures are very clear as to what's going to be on his exams and he always uses the book for problems.  Definitely recommend for organic chemistry!

If you have a choice take Dr. Nagib for chem 2520 absolutely get him. He gives great lectures and very detailed notes. Quizes and exams are fair. After barely passing chem 2510 I was worried about this class, but Dr. Nagib made o chem very understandable.

If you have to take Ochem at OSU, take Dr. Nagib! He is very passionate about chemistry, and that comes through in his lectures. He explains the tough concepts clearly,  always answers students' questions, and provides plenty of examples. Best part of lecture is when he gives a real life example of ochem. Quizzes and exams are very reasonable. 5/5!

summary_comment: Dr. Wu is a knowledgeable professor who cares about his students and tries to engage them through demonstrations and office hours. However, his teaching style can be dry and his explanations may be unclear, leading some students to prefer independent study or additional resources. Despite these challenges, many find his thorough lectures and efforts to help students valuable.

Ratings.comment: Overall, great professor and I didn't really struggle in his class. I had to study less outside of his class because although boring, his lectures were phenomenal and thorough.

Very lecture heavy. Attendance not required. He cares very much about his students, but couldn't always answer questions. Not the best prof., but not the worst. Better off independently studying/reading the textbook.
Hard to understand and isn't very good at explaining things. He does care about his students though. Try to get a different prof. if you can.
Does not engage with students very well and often fails to explain mathematical topics well.

While this course is difficult, Dr. Wu was a pretty okay professor. He was always very nice and tried to engage with students, but doesn't do the best job teaching material and being thorough. His lectures are kind of vague, so I do recommend reading the textbook before lectures. Not the best chemistry professor, but certainly not the worst.

Dr. Wu is a great person, and brings his kind energy to the lectures. However, he is not the greatest teacher. I would not take his class again. He knows chemistry, but does not teach it to a group very well. I find that he does not show the simplest way to do a problem, and when someone has a question, he has a difficult time answering.

He is a great teacher. Although his class is boring, he tries to engage with students by providing demos and class participation questions. He is a very nice person, and he has office hours every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday at least for the fall semester. I am bad at Chemistry, so I go to his office hour every week. He is patient with students.

Dr. Wu does a great job at explaining and breaking down very tough subject matter. His lectures can be a bit dry and boring, but he makes jokes and tries to keep students engaged. He also posted practice tests and held review sessions before exams, which were very helpful.
Dr. Wu was an awesome professor and explained things in great detail and went over practice problems in class to further understand chemistry.

Not a great lecturer but allows lots of learning to be done with the homework which is made to give you high grades. Ended up learning a lot without the burden of heavy homework and weekly quizzes. Definitely puts in the effort to make sure his students succeed. Also skipped lectures a ton to sleep in which was worth it.

Pretty easy class. Didn't really show up after the second week and still got an a. The lectures that I went to were fairly interesting and helpful. Compared to other chem lecturers, he assigns minimal homework.

Dr. Wu himself is an awesome person, but I struggled in lectures and felt like I could have made better use of my time. I wasnt taught so much as told what I should go over by myself. The dynamic study modules saved me.

Professor Wu is a good person but not the best professor. I had to teach myself most of the material because the material covered in lectures is quite confusing and not explained thoroughly. Its like being told what your learning and not actually taught, leaving you to need to practice, read, and watch videos consistently to understand the course.

I enjoyed Dr. Wu as a person, not so much as a professor. Make sure that you seek extra help if you are not doing well, I should have done so sooner into the semester because this class was very difficult.

He is the sixth-ranked materials scientist in the world. He is a very great professor. It may also be the first opportunity for us to get close to celebrities. He is very famous in China and is equivalent to Jackie Chan in the education world. I hope that everyone in his class will take the opportunity to communicate with him!

Taking CHEM1220 this semester, there is not a day that goes by that I don't miss Wu. I would say that my experience with him was amazing. He was very caring to his students during the COVID-19 time and would frequently give us breaks from recitation work. Doesn't know a lot of info about midterms/finals but is a phenomenal teacher nonetheless!

He doesnt give as many practice tests as other teachers. He didnt know much when it came to the midterms and what was on them. The practice tests from the chemistry department help a little. I would say overall he is harder than other teacher because he gives less opportunities to succeed. I would chose Dr. Fuss instead

Dr. Wu truly cares about his students and has a great depth of understanding of chemistry. The lecture portion of this class was entirely online because of COVID and I think that Dr. Wu was a great professor to have during this time. If you are willing to put in the time to understand the material, you have all the resources that you need.

It's hard to put all of the blame for my hatred of chemistry on Dr. Wu, as it really isn't entirely his fault. The chem dept. at OSU aims to break students down and make them feel terrible to drop their majors. However, Dr. Wu is unapproachable and is not good at teaching a chem class to students who have likley never taken a college science class.

Avoid taking him if you can. Doesn't explain concepts in depth and asks hard questions. I have learned everything by myself. Lots of hw which is time consuming. Definitely read the book or you will hard time understanding things. Try to choose a good TA. Exams were similar to practice questions even though there were a few hard questions.
Dr. Wu is a great teacher and is very proficient when you assess his knowledge at office hours. He gives good notes however somethings are left out so you must read. Dont skip class!!
Yiying Wu is a fine professor. He communicates information how it ought to be. His lame jokes and mannerisms are quite adorable. Would take again
Hes very good at breaking things down. Highly recommend

Dr. Wu was a great lecturer and did a good job of explaining each concept in depth. However, he does assign a lot of homework (worth 7.5% of your grade) that takes up a significant amount of time. The material on his exams were very similar to the examples he explained during class. If I had to take another Chem course, I would take it with Dr. Wu

I am horrible at Chemistry and still managed to get an A- so if I can do it.. you can do it. Not saying it was easy because it took a lot of time to understand the material and do practice problems. His practice exams are kind of similar to his exams and sometimes the practice problems you do in class will appear in the exams (with different #'s)

First and foremost, the chem department at OSU is messed up. so no matter what don't expect too much. Dr. Wu is pretty much your average gen-chem-in-a-lecture-hall teacher. He's not incredible, but he's a smart guy. He's actually the easiest gen chem professor in terms of tests, but better teachers can get you better scores on harder tests.

He is a top guy. But whenever he comes to teach a gen chem class he talks about his battery research. Most of the time he brings couple of Duracell battery and he used to compare that with his one. He even told that the efficiency of his battery was 10  times better w.r.t  Duracell. He even claimed he can surpass the efficiency of Carnot cycle.

I really really love his teaching!!! Very good notes. It's better to attend every class because all those in class notes will help to get an A. Honestly, I do not read any chapter of book when I took his chem1210. Midterms are not tough but final is tricky. Be prepared of both lab and lecture notes when you take final.

He's very intelligent, but it was hard to get him to explain it in a way that I could understand. I asked for help and he basically explained it the same way again. Be prepared to work and ask for help often. The grading system isn't too bad in my opinion, the curve helped my grade. Also, labs can cushion your grade so pay attention and work hard.
Exams could be harder than expected but nothing impossible

Chem at OSU is really tough, but  I think Wu is the easiest chem professor you can get. Most of the exam averages were around the 70% range, and the final wasn't that bad. I suggest always reading the chapter before lecture, doing the problems in the book as you go along, and using the TA help room as often as possible. Get Wu if you can!!
Wu is great. I recommend him, and his tests are fair.
Kind of hard to understand at times but has no problem answering questions if you have one. Also cracks jokes occasionally to lighten the mood.

Unlike another calc prof I had, Dr. Wu was very good about not just covering the concepts, but also covering the math in detail. It can feel a bit tedious and slow if you already understand the math side of the class, but if you don't, you'll love him for the time he spends to teach you what the book may not cover in detail.

Tough tests, but awesome professor. You won't regret taking his class. Unfortunately, his class is pretty hard. I had to put in some major effort to keep up. The online homework helps and other online resources like clutch prep will do you good. Take his class, but don't expect an easy A.

Dr. Wu was by far one of the greatest professors I have ever had. I absolutely loved him. Phenomenal professor, and extremely helpful. His midterms were very fair, but to be honest, his final was extremely difficult. I would have gotten an A in the class if I hadn't bombed the final, but woulda coulda shoula. Great class, study for tests!

Dr. Wu was awesome! As long as you do your homework, attend lecture, and study hard for the exams, you'll get a good grade. Exams were based off of lecture notes. He's extremely helpful answering questions in-class and in office hours. Final was quite hard, but I think everyone survived. Highly recommend Wu over any 1210 professor.

Professor Wu is AWESOME. I went to lectures for the Demos but I also gained a lot more insight in the process. Loved the lectures and passed the class after 91 friggin hours on ALEKS...which I hate. But needless to say GREAT PROFESSOR.

Dr. Wu was an excellent professor, he wrote everything he said on the board (because he has an accent). Attend Class!!! He is pretty funny and entertaining. If you have a chance to get Dr. Wu, GET HIM!!!!!!!

Dr. Wu was one of the best professors I had my first quarter. He was very helpful, obviously cared about his students and would keep us awake by conducting interesting experiments throughout the lecture. His exams were very fair, if you don't mind multiple choice.

Dr. Wu is an EXCELLENT professor. His lectures tend to be boring, but attending them is important. Everything he gives in notes will appear on the exam. As long as you do the online homework and study your notes, the class is easy to get an A in. The curve is not huge, however; the course is fairly easy and a curve really isn't necessary.
The only thing good about him is his jokes. The course is awful. The chemistry department at OSU is terrible.
Can be very difficult to understand, making lectures pointless. I stopped going because I wasn't getting anything out of his notes. Keep up with practice homework in the book and you'll be fine.

Dr. Wu knows what he's talking about, but he makes his lectures uninteresting. We have no quizzes in his class, and as long as you do the online hw you'll understand most of what's going on. The midterm was challenging but fair, and he curved as needed. He can be hard to understand (he has a thick accent) but overall he is a good teacher.

Despite his accent he is quite clear, and also very funny. He makes lecture interesting with corny jokes and some fun experiments. His midterms can be tough, but he curves appropriately. If you have him, rejoice! His quizzes can very easily be 100%ed if you just do the hw a couple days before, giving you some nice breathing room.

Overall, great professor, who answers all your questions thoroughly and helps you work through any homework problems you have difficulty with. has funny/ corny jokes and is always interested in teaching the class. His exams and quizzes maybe tough sometimes, but the curve in the end actually helped me out a lot.
Funny guy. You'll like him

His lectures are amusing, but useless; your time would be better spent doing as many homework problems as possible. His tests are unnecessarily difficult,and he doesn't give much of a curve (if any?), in spite of the fact that averages are in the 60's. I knew this material and busted my ass studying for this class, but only walked away with a B+.
Great teaching had really good corny jokes!
Its hard to understand his speech but he writes everything out and takes it nice and slow for you. He ends up being one of the best chem teachers you can get. consider yourself lucky if you have him.
He is a very good professor. I love going to lecture because of all of the corny jokes and experiments. He's really easy to approach to ask a question.

Well really good with some fundamental concepts of chemistry. I had a little problem with understanding what he was saying.(Sometime) But Thats understandable I guess. Random homework trick worked well to keep me involved with assignments.
Really, really enjoyed this class.  Do the homework, go to lecture, and pay attention, and you'll be fine.

I have now had the opportunity to compare prof. wu to another chem professor. So,from what i have gathered, professor Wu, is a very, very good teacher. Also, he has corny jokes that will make you laugh just because they are that stupid. I went to maybe one out of every two lectures and did great... if you don't do well, you should switch majors (=
he's a cute little asian who wears sweater vests and gets very excited about the corny jokes he tells. I would go to lecture just to see him even though I couldn't understand a word he was saying!
has a thick accent, but explains very well, and makes the class interesting; is also very approachable

Was very hard to understand....Did not like him as a teacher atall. He just starts writing on the board and does not explain too well. Loza is harder but is a better teacher and will curve your grade much more in the end. Wu barely curves at all so do not expect any help at the end.

Where to start....let's just say this class consumed my life for this quarter.  I went to his office hours and he didn't help whatsoever.  I went to lecture and didnt understand a thing.  Basically...had to teach myself everything and go to tutoring.  He's a nice guy but not so good at teaching.  Just angered me cuz lectures were a waste
Easily one of the best teachers I've ever had. Requires some effort to understand at first but it gets easier. Explains things well. Tells jokes and does demonstrations to keep people entertained.

Chemistry isn't my subject, so the content was difficult for me, but Dr. Wu was really helpful and tried to make it interesting. He always had a joke or demonstration :) If you study and do the practice problems, you'll do fine
Can I say, "researcher"?  How about the chemistry department hires a mime to act this class out while Wu writes notes on the board?

Dr. Wu is very nice and willing to help and he tries really hard to keep lecture fun and interesting.  Unfortunately, it's chemistry, so there are dry bits, but he usually does a demonstration each class that's pretty cool.  He's can also be really funny, though he doesn't try to do it intentionally. Overall, good professor.

Very fun teacher. Extremely funny. uses his cute asian accent to make you laugh. tries to make class interesting but doesnt hide the fact that he knows some parts are boring. tests and quizzes are very easy and he is there to help you not trick you with exams. love the accent and love his Wuisms.

Wow.. after taking Zellmer, who is a psychopath, I look back to Wu's class and really, really miss it. I did reasonably well knowing the material reasonably well, unlike in Zellmer where I did horribly knowing the material reasonably well. I miss good old Yiying.

I was thinking back of my old chem 121 class today, and comparing Wu with Zellmer (chem 122 prof.) I would prefer Wu. He is a nice guy who uses the blackboard. He makes his letters big so everyone can see, not like Zellmer, which uses overhead. Wu has good humor, and if you study even a little, you will appreciate his teaching. Wu is the man!

It was amazing to come back from a class and actually understand what was going on, unfortunately this was after coming back from loza's 122. If anything i felt like i am behind in chemistry due to Wu's lack of teaching. His accent is hard to overcome in class and i found myself sleeping in almost every lecture. The book taught me everything.

Hated him!! His chinese accent is VERY thick.  Gave up on going to lectures because I couldn't understand him at all.  Didn't come across as caring for his students at all.  Attending Loza's 122 lectures and come away having learned was a great feeling after having a quarter of wu.  Got a C, and am a science major...thanks wu...

He's kinda hard to understand but definitely a likable guy. He's nice and will provide as much help as you need. I never personally went to him for help but I saw many people do so. His lectures get boring after a while and I fell asleep in 4-5 of them so bring food to stay awake. Take notes, read the book, attempt homework.
good teacher, had a corny sense of humor. He breaks up his lectures with demonstrations, which helps pass the time during lectures.

This class is a phenomener. Very nice, adorable guy, likeable. Hard to understand english, his voice does put you to sleep. Heavily recommend bringing coffee/food to lecture to stay awake. He does cool demonstrations every class too, many involving fire. Tells corny jokes he got off the internet, recommended, there are definately worse out there.
Not that interesting, but I loved the thermite demo :D

Is a really nice guy. He had about a demonstration a week to help comprehension and keep people awake in lecture. He's a little hard to understand at times, not the best at explaining things to those who haven't had the material prior to the class. Assigns homework and a quiz every week. Two 25 question multiple choice midterms and a final.

This was Dr. Wu's 1st time teaching H202, so there's room for improvement. His examples came from the book & he sometimes makes mistakes in lecture. He's willing to explain things in office hours. He assigns homework after every lecture and quizzes every week to help you learn the material. Do the hw. Tests are difficult.
he's really boring and his tests are really unfair. the average on the midterms are in the 60's. don't take this class if he's teaching!
Worst teacher I've ever had in my life.
easy to understand
Hard Tests.
good guy
Funny but hard to understand sometimes.

Very good at explaining to people who haven't taken high school chem, hard to understand accent if you don't listen really closely, lectures are ok but it is possible to just read book for first 4 chapters at least,
a little hard to understand but not bad at all

He doesn't speak english very well and he hasn't been teaching long.  Lectures are crazily boring, but if you took chem in HS, its all just a reapeat anyways, read the book and its not that bad. I never went to lecture, or when i did i slept.
If you have any HS chem at all, this class is a joke.  He made it so easy.

I'll give the guy a break since he did say it was his first quarter teaching.  Needs to work on the english just a bit, but he really wasn't that bad.  Overall, I think i learned the most by reading the book, but the lectures weren't entirely useless.  I never visited him during office hours, but i hear good things. He is nice and non-intimidating.
Just read from the notes and did not do very many example problems. This coupled with a bad TA proved to be a terrible combination. Find a different lecturer if you can
The lectures were quite clear if you pay attention. Very helpful during office hours. Fair exams and useful review sessions. At least tried to make sure the TAs to do good jobs.
If you have had any high school chemistry and pay attention in class, this class is not too bad.  Plus there is always a generous curve.  A lot depends on your TA, so dont always blame the prof.
Didn't teach well at all.  My TA was terrible, so I had another hard time.

Only covered 1 or 2 things from each chapter and rarely did problems. Did almost nothing we had on our exams in class. You have to teach yourself almost everything unless you have a great T.A. which I didn't:-/

summary_comment: Dr. Turner is generally seen as a supportive professor who genuinely cares about his students' success, offering office hours and valuable recitations. However, his lectures are often criticized for being overly conceptual and lacking practical problem-solving, leading many students to rely heavily on self-study and supplementary resources. Students recommend significant self-study, especially for math-heavy topics, and emphasize the importance of additional practice outside of class.

Ratings.comment: Very sweet man but incredibly boring. I don't think he ever actually went through a problem or calculation, he just talked through everything. There were also many errors in his answer keys. I mainly used the textbook and lecture videos from other professors to learn the material.

Unique in how he made the content engaging. The same chemistry content putting me to sleep in the textbook would suddenly become interesting when explained by this high-energy, passionate professor. He truly seems to care for the success of his students. One negative is that during review not enough time is spent on the more difficult sections.

Look fellas this is literally how you pass the entire course 

1. When you get a in class activity, run through the math 8 times
2. Take the quizzes and learn from the mistakes
3. Again GO THROUGH THE ACTIVITES 30 TIMES. 
4. skim the vocabulary quizllet the night before the midterms
5. Take the midterm

It was his first time teaching on main campus and he clearly didn't know how to teach to a large group of students. His answer keys/questions for recitations had tons of errors and I stopped going to lecture after a week and just self-studied the content. I had taken AP chem and was already familiar with the content but don't take if new to chem!

Be prepared to self study the entire semester if you take Turner after I got a C- on the first midterm I decided to self study because I could not handle his long, drawn out lectures and even if my grade suffered for it I don't care. I also hated his recitation format. Making kids sit in a room for an hour doing practice problems in silence is bad.

Prepare to self study the entire semester if you take Turner. He rarely assigns any practice outside of the homework, which is not comprehensive for the midterm. Do a lot of practice problems from the back of the book and read the textbook thoroughly and you should be fine. Don't depend on him to do well on the class.

It's OSU Chem, it's going to be hard. Turner was a good lecturer on concepts, you will have to do extra math practice problems outside of class. Nice guy. Had Zellmer for 1210 so Turner was a breath of fresh air. Skim the textbook before lecture. Homework can take a while to finish but they aren't too bad.

Overall Dr Turner wants you to succeed and will give you help if you go to his office hours. However, he is not a very good lecturer he is great at conceptual stuff but when it comes to math he barely goes over how to do the problem. Recitation is mandatory and the most helpful part of the whole class. Graded homework is 3 attempts and helps grade

Friendly. If you like to know interesting facts that are only somewhat useful he's your guy. With science classes it's important to know chapter lingo before lecture so you can maximize retention. 1220 was harder than 1210. Most of this material comes up in small bits in later classes so just come prepared to lecture. His lectures down to a science
He will answer questions and give you plenty of practive problems you just have to ask.
DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH TURNER! very very hard to understand. i was more confused on the topic after leaving class then before i went.

summary_comment: The professor is known for delivering challenging yet comprehensive lectures that require active engagement; however, the notes are not always posted, necessitating attendance. Despite the difficulty, students appreciate the abundance of supplementary materials and extra credit opportunities. Another student found the professor's style engaging but noted that the lectures could be hard to follow due to frequent jumps in topics and extensive use of analogies, leading to better performance on practice materials rather than actual assessments.

Ratings.comment: I actually had him for 2510, you must go to lecture as he does not post completed notes. Definitely a hard class and you have to pay attention to every small detail of what he says, but extra materials and a lot of practice are provided, and extra credit. Only graded by exams, quizzes, and extra credit worksheets. Finals was much easier than mdtrms

Mike is a very fun professor and seems like a cool guy. However his notes were a little all over the place and his lectures were hard to follow with him constantly jumping around. He also made a lot of analogies. I always did well on the practice material and poorly on the tests and quizzes. Halfway through switched to Turner who I enjoyed more

SEI.Subject: ARTSSCI
SEI.Class Name: Arts and Sciences Survey: Mathematical and Physical Sciences

SEI.Class Name: Arts and Sciences Survey: Mathematical and Physical Sciences

SEI.Subject: ARTSSCI
SEI.Class Name: Arts and Sciences Survey: Mathematical and Physical Sciences

summary_comment: Dr. Mohan is known for her caring nature and ability to make difficult subjects more approachable, though her teaching style can be intense and stressful, leading to high levels of anxiety among students. Some students find her grading strict and her lectures and labs tense, with many reporting feeling intimidated and needing to rely on external resources. Despite these challenges, others praise her dedication and support, noting her willingness to provide additional help and extra credit, making the class manageable despite its difficulty.

Ratings.comment: She made this hard class more enjoyable and she cares about her students.

This professor fails to create a proactive learning environment for her students, which is crucial for such a difficult subject as Organic chemistry. She openly yelled at students at lab for making any mistakes, and made us feel like we could not ask questions. She does not explain concepts thoroughly. I often relied on sources online for help.

I also heard about her psychologically destroying lives. My friend who I took this class with, was told this by counseling. Students were terrified she was going to ruin them getting into med/dental/ other hard grad school majors. She made me, who doesnt cry, cry every day for 2 months before I finally couldnt take it and dropped the class

Idk who liked her class, or if she was just nice in the past, but this prof is easily one of the lowest humans I have ever met. Yelling, name-calling, so many student cried. I was told by the counseling dept that half her class ends up seeing psych every semester because she has psychologically destroyed them. These people are in grad/med school

Professor Mohan is a nice person, but a harsh, unforgiving professor. If you dont understand a topic overnight, she will yell at you. Lab was always so tense because she would get angry over the smallest mistakes. Most points are off of tests/quizzes. Ochem isnt easy but Mohan does not make it any easier by getting angry at the students.

Vague lectures. Expected to be at her level of understanding. Tests make up about all the points and are difficult and made to trip you up. Atmosphere in lecture and lab is so tense students cry and are scared to even speak. Had to rely on outside sources to learn and study for 5-8 hours daily. Never met a student that enjoyed her class.

Dr. Mohan is a great professor. She cares about each student and if they are understanding the information. She gives good feedback and will always go over anything you need help with. She has a fair grading scale and gives plenty of extra credit. The class is lecture heavy and she takes the time to make sure the class is understanding the material

Dr. Mohan is the best professor I've had in college. Ochem is a difficult class, yet she makes it simple to understand with lots of in class examples, extra credit and homework. She is easily assessable both in and out of class and she cares more about her students than any professor I've had. Ochem is hard, study and Dr. Mohan makes it easy(ish).

She is hands down the best chemistry professor I have ever had. I have struggled with ochem in the past , but I have done well in her class and additionally have done well in ochem sections on Professional tests because of her. This class is a lot of work but If you put in the time and effort will be successful. Highly recommend

Class was heavily weighted towards tests and quizzes with obnoxiously high point values with the tests and quizzes being poorly dispersed through the semester. Professor was very open to answering questions but, like others have said, had vague responses. Does allow for extra credit.

Best professor I've had in college by far. Wants you to succeed if you put the work and time in. Especially for how difficult Ochem is, makes it very doable and gives very fair chance of getting a good grade if you pay attention and put in effort. Highly recommended.

Im really not sure why people have a problem with her. She's extremely clear on her expectations. Ochem is a hard subject in general so you will obviously have to study to pass. She grades very fair, is always willing to explain things, and gives a good amount of bonus points because SHE WANTS YOU TO DO WELL
Very unclear. Asking questions lead to vague explanations.
She doesn't know how to teach really.

summary_comment: Dr. Singer is highly regarded for his deep knowledge in chemistry and ability to engage students with demonstrations and occasional humor, though his teaching style can be challenging due to its intensity and speed. Students find his classes demanding, with low average exam scores, but appreciate the comprehensive coverage of material and generous grading curves. Some students recommend avoiding the class unless they have a strong passion for chemistry, while others warn of its difficulty and suggest it may not be suitable for those seeking a less rigorous course load.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Singer is a great teacher and this class was very interesting. The class had a large focus on intro physical chemistry and much of the foundational chemistry you might learn in Chem 1210 is assumed to be prior knowledge. The exams were difficult, but the curve was good because of that. Lectures are very material heavy and can leave you lost.

Dr. Singer is clearly very gifted in Chemistry.  He is a good teacher and even throws a few jokes into class.  However, this class was difficult.  The average on the final exam was a 50%.  I would not take this class if it is only for Pre-Med.  Only take honors if you love Chemistry.  I don't love Chemistry.

I thought it wouldn't be too bad since I have some experience in Chemistry, but was by far the hardest class I've ever taken. Lots of physics. If you want to take his class be sure you have a strong background in quantum mechanics.

Loved Dr. Singer! He was super caring and just wanted his students to learn. Lots of demos. He made jokes sometimes. Lectures covered material we needed to know but also extra details he thought were interesting (usually was also interesting to the students).

Sherwin's class is HARD. Right off the bat you're learning about quantum mechanics and questioning why you joined this class in the first place. That said, he's a brilliant guy and a great professor who gives a ton of partial credit. But, don't take this class if you can't handle having your ego smashed ~5 times/week.

Dr. Singer is a nice and very smart guy and I learned a lot from him. But his voice is very monotone and his lectures can be tough to follow and material intense. He goes pretty fast and very in-depth, but he is there for review if you need him. This was a pretty tough class, but if you work hard you will get the curve for a good grade.

He's a good person, but cannot teach at all. He cannot convey what needed to be learned in simple enough terms to be understood by the class. Class averages for midterms always lingered around 50% because none of us ever knew what exactly to do. Tried to help, but just can't teach the stuff he knows.

Sherwin Singer is a fossil in the OSU chem department that needs to be replaced. He does not know how to teach. He simply regurgitates useless information off slides and never gets to the point. Doesnt know how to do problems and doesnt do any practice in the class. Incredibly unhelpful and petty in emails. Too full of himself. Worst option-RUN!

Singer's class was challenging, but manageable. Attending office hours really helps, and he is always willing to answer questions. I really appreciated Dr. Singer's approach to teaching because he was always up front about grading and made students feel like he genuinely cared about their success. If you put in the effort you will do well.

Sherwin Singer is really a great guy. He is always willing to help in office hours, and he is super knowledgeable about chemistry. HOWEVER. Do not, I repeat, DO NOT take this class unless your life goal is to be a chemist. If you are Pre-Med, stick to 1210, this class is way to difficult and way to stressful. Take only if chemistry is your BFF.

Always willing to help during office hours, couple laughs during lecture, seems stressful but you will do fine  Side note: If you're looking up Singer for 1910H you better be an aspiring scientist of some sort. 1910H is unnecessary for anyone wanting to go to med school. If thats you, leave now. Stick to the 1210/1220 or 1610/1620 sequence. please
Dr Singer is very nice but he is not that great at explaining the material. Exams are hard but he curves the exams and the final grade quite a bit.

Professor Singer is a genius in regards to chemistry. This can make it very difficult to be taught general chemistry by him because his lectures are so in depth in high level chemistry. If you are interested in physical chemistry I recommend taking this class and going to his office hours because he is very interested in teaching beyond the basics.

Really smart and knowledgeable about chemistry. Super willing to help in his office hours but at times his lectures/explanations can be a little convoluted. Learned quite a lot from the class but had to study a lot for exams, which could be pretty hard.

Dr. Singer is a great guy. He really does want to help. The class is hard so make sure you are ready to dedicate time to it. Go to his office hours. He is always willing to go into further detail or explain things in a different way. Tests are hard but there is always a good curve. Pop quizzes in lecture aren't a big deal b/c you can work together.
Lectures are clear and amusing. He offers a lot of help from office hours if you take advantage of it. Tests are tough with some questions that make you think "where do I even start?"

Professor Singer is incredible! He makes going to lecture very worthwhile, and entertaining with his great sense of humor! He does give pop quizzes in lecture, but they are partner/group quizzes so there is really no worry. Just make sure you read the chapters and do the homework, and you will be fine.

One of two professors that teach pchem. If you want to understand the subject, you should take him. Doing the HW well is essential to understanding and doing well on quizzesexams. Having a good study group is essential to doing well in this class. Reread your notes for material that was not in the HW, bc there's a god chance it will be on an exam

Crazy difficult class.  Our grad student TAs stated that we were covering material they didn't learn until the fourth year of their undergrad.  Most dropped, I wasn't smart enough to.  He has little patience for those who can't keep up.
Really likeable guy, goes very in depth and expects you to keep up. If you can't move fast don't take this course. Expect to do a ton of outside work.

Dr. Singer is awesome. Really likeable guy who's very willing to help. Honestly his exams aren't hard; they are really very easy, you just need to study. The material isn't that exciting but he's a very interesting open-minded guy. Def fave chem professor so far, and I've had many good profs since I had class with Dr. Singer

Had the audacity to be utterly shocked when he found out a group of students had material from this class last year. Made a concious effort to make quizzes and exams as different as possible (the result was poorly designed quizzes and tests with 30-40%) averages. He gives pop quizzes so go to class. Just hack through it, the class is rough.
He's an interesting guy, just can't teach to a group of people.  Tries to keep lectures interesting but it just doesn't work...
He is a pretty funny guy but really monotonous. Class wasnt too bad if you read the book and did suggested problems. Exams and quizzes were definitely challenging but not impossible

Although I found him to be a very like-able professor, his teaching tactics were extremely poor, in my opinion. The notes, which can be printed off carmen, are read word for word in class. Seeing as I could do this myself, I stopped attending classes after the first midterm. Words of wisdom, READ YOUR BOOK! I did way better on my other exams!
smart guy, funny to listen to. cant teach at all

he was terrible. he literally likes to teach the history of the world and he has the hardest chem class. we have the lowest average which when it is curved with the rest of the department, helps EVERYONE except us. i cant wait to retake this w. a diff. perfessor
He really interests in talking material that goes beyond course content to students.
Sherwin is the man.
class avg is currently 68.5%. he laughs about it. >=(

Okay, okay. This guy really isn't that bad, the material is just dense (although more useful than quantum!) I beg to differ on his understanding of thermo. This is my second time around, and it makes much more sense coming from him than it did on the ChemE side.  He writes very challenging test and homeworks, but you will learn a lot!

He seems like a nice guy, but the class is miserable.  It may just be me, but the exams/hw/quizzes (he makes them all up) are all very difficult and not in the least bit interesting since its all derivation's/proofs.  Can't wait to be done with this.

This professor does not understand thermodynamics or partial differential equations.  For instance, he will take an integral over temperature as a way to solve for a change in volume when the problem states that temperature is constant.  This type of thing is a frequent occurrence, as in multiple times per assignment/quiz/midterm. Do not take him!
The best thing that Dr. Singer has done is bringing quantum mechanics to a level where everybody can understand.
He was a great professor.  Very clear and explained things well.  His tests were pretty easy until the final.  Best chemstry professor I have had
Ouch, that burned!  An excellent teacher and very helpful though.  I am still patching my wounds.

Dr. Singer is the most helpful prof I have ever had.  The quizes are really hard, but midterms are fair and relate to HW and notes.  Dr. Singer is the rockstar of thermodynamics.  Now all he needs to do is Kick Pitzer to the curb and teach Quantum Mechanics to undergrads.  Please teach chem 530 DR S

Dr. SInger is a very nice man, but as usual is not a good teacher.  His class is just a replica of the class notes you buy at calss A notes.  He tries to be funny, but only about 50% of the class shows up b/c it is worthless.  The lights are dimmed for the overhead at 8:30am so bring coffee (Boring)
Very enthusiastic teacher!  The class wasn't too bad, just make sure you study his notes and go to class and you'll be fine.
An excellent lecturer.  He is very helpful, entertaining, and intelligent.
Brilliant Lecturer.  Also very funny and sympathetic.  His is the course in introductory chemical thermodynamics to take.

He's very enthusiastic, which makes lecture a bit more entertaining.  His exams are somewhat difficult, but there is a large curve that helps a lot.  He's very sweet and offers his time to help anyone that is willing to ask for it.
Exams are pretty hard, but the curve helps out a lot.  He tries to be funny during lectures, which is sometimes entertaining.
No Comments
His exams are hard, but not impossible.  He is very welling to help or give explanations.  Overall not bad a bad class and very understandable.

summary_comment: The professor is known for curving test scores and offering assistance to help students pass, though her teaching style is often criticized for being lecture-heavy and repetitive, with little additional value added. Students find her lectures boring and her tests difficult, and many recommend preparing extensively beforehand due to the course's demanding nature. Overall, while she is considered reasonably knowledgeable, her approach to teaching is generally seen as ineffective and unengaging.

Ratings.comment: she curved our test scores and actually wanted to help her students pass

On my first day the teacher told us that this is the hardest course on the campus. Her lectures were very boring. She expects you to have a lot of knowledge of chemistry before the class. The lab reports take 6 hours to do. Her tests aren't curved and very difficult. Redid a lab and got a lower grade. I wouldn't recommend this prof to anyone.
Just reads out of the book. Lectures are useless.

She is fairly nice, and reasonably knowledgeable, but class basically consists of writing what is on a pre-prepared powerpoint as fast as you can. My hand literally hurt after some of her "lectures." She seemed like the chem department told her what to say, or like she was just repeating the book. She didn't bring much to the course.
she could make this class easier, but instead she forces you to scribble notes furiously, becuase she refuses to post notes online. tests are ill-formed and difficult.

summary_comment: Alex is highly regarded as an exceptional ochem recitation instructor, consistently praised for his ability to clarify complex concepts and genuinely support student success. Students describe him as a dedicated and kind TA who goes above and beyond to help them understand the material and achieve their goals.

Ratings.comment: Amazing ochem 1 recitation instructor! Would choose to have him again if I could. Explains things in a manor that fills gaps in the professors explanations.

Alex was one of the leading reasons why I passed ochem. He explains the material in an understandable way and truthfully wants you to succeed. If you need a tutor, he is truthfully unbeatable and I am so fortunate to have had him.
Absolutely wonderful TA. Both great at explaining things and also just a kind, approachable person who really wants you to succeed.

Alex was a great TA and will make for a great professor in the future. He had great tips for guiding the material and when I had needed my quizzes nearing the end of the course he was more than willing to copy them over email so that I would have them to study from.

Best TA Ive ever had by far !! Alex takes so much of his own time to make and send us practice materials, he always responds to questions and emails in a timely manner, and you can just tell that he wants his students to succeed! Ochem wouldve been a completely different (and much worse) experience had it not been for Alex.
Alex is the best recitation leader ever in the world

summary_comment: Dr. Turner is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and engaging lectures, which many students find helpful for understanding complex organic chemistry concepts. While some note that his pace can be fast and his notes may focus on less critical details, overall, students appreciate his thoroughness and organization, leading to better performance on exams. His enthusiasm and supportive approach contribute significantly to positive learning experiences.

Ratings.comment: He was a pretty good lecturer and could give good examples when you had questions. 4 midterms, 20 questions each, each worth 10% of grade. There are practice exams for them so if you do those multiple times you will just memorize the question structure and process. Chem is not an easy class but it is not super hard. Lab is annoying. HW super easy.
His lectures and explanations don't make much sense and he goes really fast. He doesn't write down the useful information, but writes down redundant stuff that doesn't matter as much.

Didn't always cover what was needed for the midterms & final exam. With the chem department, the professors aren't writing the exams, so he sometimes said things wouldn't be on the exam. They would then be on the exams. Explained concepts well. Read the textbook and basically memorize all of the midterm practice problems and solutions to do well.
Turner is enthusiastic about the material and really wants you to learn. His personality really resonated with me making him fun to learn from. He overall did a really good job
Very good chem 1210 professor!

Dr. Turner is THE BEST ochem professor at OSU in my opinion. I had him for ochem1 by chance, but his ochem 2 class was full and I started with Dr. Bong. After realizing that I needed Dr. Turner's teaching style to do well, I desperately emailed him to join his class, and he let me!! He is amazing at explaining difficult concepts and is so caring.

Turner is an AMAZING Ochem professor. His lectures were so thorough that I actually enjoyed the class (and I hated all my other chem classes) as did my friends that had him. The material was presented in a clear and understandable manner. I could not recommend him more, TAKE HIM IF YOU WANT A GOOD GRADE IN OCHEM.

Dr. Turner makes Organic Chemistry easier that it should be. There is so much valuable material he gives such as lectures, pre-lecture videos, problems after every lecture, pre and post lecture assignments, and the textbook of course. But he makes everything so organized its hard to get lost. His guided notes are also perfection.

I can not recommend Dr. Turner enough and would argue that he is the best professor at the entire university. He understands any question you give him, goes above and beyond to help outside the classroom, and always has a quick response. His lectures and notes were amazing, always telling you what you need to know and nothing more. Great guy!
Wayyyy better than Baldwin. Teaches what needs to be taught thoroughly and succinctly. Nice outside of class. Ochem is always a hard course but he taught the material well.

really helpful, good at explaining and simplifying concepts. his office hours and review sessions allow you to get some last minute questions answered before tests and quizzes. if you do the lecture practice youll be in good shape for quizzes and exams.
Probably the best chemistry lecturer at OSU, and his quizzes are easy/fair. He tends to make some of the least funny jokes you will ever hear however.

Dr. Turner was a great professor and alleviated some of my initial ochem fears. He gave us really organized & well-written lecture slides that we followed along with during class, and he gave us a TON of practice problems to give us tons of opportunities to apply the content.

Dr. Turner is my favorite professor at OSU so far. He's very organized and his lectures and notes were always super helpful. He definitely wants to see you succeed; I had issues uploading a few quizzes and exams and he helped me out and gave me full credit even though I submitted past the time limit. I'm sad I couldn't have him for ochem 2!

Great professor! I used the organic chem as a second language book instead of the main textbook. His lectures were very great! He recommends a lot of practice problems, and if you want to do well on tests and quizzes, you have to do a lot of practice questions

I have not enough good things to say about Dr. Turner. I took him SU21 (he taught the last 6 weeks) and was absolutely incredible. Taking ochem over the summer is harder but he made it easy and was accessible, organized, provided many materials and I was shocked that I did so well and my confidence for the material went up! highly recommend!
If you can, try to get callam or chang as your proffessor. This guy doesnt help anyone with anything.

I took the first organic chemistry with Dr. Turner and MADE SURE I requested him for ochem 2. He is easily the best professor Ive had so far. While the content is hard obviously, he gives a ton of extra practice and makes learning fairly easy. He loves to help as much as possible giving multiple office hour opportunities. He is great, I recommend!

Turner gets a lot of hype, but I was pretty let down coming into his class. He is super unorganized and it usually seemed like he didn't know how to do the problems he was giving us. I would rather take a traditionally "harder" prof so I knew I was learning and understanding the material better.

I had Dr. Turner for both CHEM 2510 and 2520. The content is difficult, don't fool yourself. I got away with not using the textbook, but I'm sure using the textbook would help. I don't know if it was because of COVID, but I feel that he was pretty overwhelmed and disorganized at times. However, he is a great guy and I think he really cares.

Dr. Turner is a busy guy which shows in how he runs the class. Quizzes and exams take forever to grade, and sometimes pre-lecture videos are posted the night before (he still expects you to watch them). I had Callam for 2510 and Callam is MUCH BETTER. Turner asks questions that are just worded so weird and he makes too many mistakes during lecture.

Dr. Turner is a nice man but an awful professor. His lectures and problem sets are confusing and he often admits he doesn't even know the answers.
