His exams have little to no partial credit and are on material not covered in lecture. He is awful at keeping a schedule. I felt like no matter how hard I worked I could not succeed in this class. Avoid!

I had Dr. Turner for 2510 and 2520, and he is the best professor I have had at OSU. Ochem is a difficult class but if you put in the work and don't give up on yourself, you can succeed! His lectures are helpful and he gives lots of exam-style practice problems. Meet with him outside of class, he's a great guy and truly wants you to succeed!

To all you poor students out there rebelling and didnt get an A. I truly sympathize with yall. He is kinda hypocrite. He said he likes to make ochem easy and approachable to everyone especially to the average student. But yet he claims, he designed the course and exam to differentiate between the A students from the B students. Yikes! Lawd mercy.

Be warned. Not an angel you think he is. His exam and lecture dont correlate. You know why. Well Ill tell you why. Cause his lecture are easy and boring. He expects you to read a disgusting new online textbook after making you buy expensive textbook for previous semester. Not the great ochem teacher but then agaIn, there aint any good ochem prof

I took Dr. Turner for both 2510 & 2520 and I highly recommend him. I got a B in 2510 and B- in 2520 and I definitely struggled with content, but he is very reachable and wants to see you succeed. His exams are difficult, but he provides lots of practice and records all his lectures so its easy to access them to review. Loved him overall!!

Do not take Organic Chemistry with anyone else! Dr. Turner has been my favorite professor at Ohio State and makes such a hard concept much easier to understand. Notes are very organized and he makes it clear what he wants you to know. You have to study and do all of the problems, but he doesn't try to trick you. Dr. Turner made me love ochem!

Dr. Turner is a great professor. He is one of the best general chemistry professors and currently manages the TA program. He is very organized and prepared for every lecture with great images and powerpoints. There is a certain level of participation required so it is important to put in the work and time.

Honestly the best chem professor Ive ever had. Notes are organized and easy to follow. He gives you plenty of resources to help you succeed and is super approachable as well has helpful. The material is hard but if you keep up with the resources he provides you with and take his advice, youll do well!

Dr. Turner was an amazing professor, especially for how difficult Organic Chemistry is. He was helpful, fair and really wanted every student to be successful. His exams were still very difficult, but they werent impossible and if you pay attention in lecture you most likely will do average or above. Overall I highly recommend him.

Of all of my chem profs so far, Dr. Turner has been the best. It's very evident that he loves teaching and he is very organized with his notes. He provides many resources for practice problems and holds "problem solving sessions" (office hours) 3 days a week. He's one of the only o-chem professors that has 3 midterms with a multiple choice section.

Dr. Turner knows his stuff. He's great at implementing technology into instruction and is very clear during lecture. Lab is a pain but what else is new? He organizes recitation to be relevant to what's in lecture and doesn't have quizzes. If you don't read the book you won't pass but especially for an intro chem course he makes it very doable.
Probably one of the best CHEM1210 professors. Very helpful and makes sure to answer specific questions people have.

Dr. Turner was pretty good. You knew what was expected of you, and the only real barrier to doing well in this class is how much work it is, but that's how just about every general chemistry class is. He's good at explaining some harder to understand topics, and is friendly when you ask questions inside or outside of class.

Dr Turner was the best choice for Gen Chem first semester. His lectures are pretty comprehensive but you need to do the pre-lecture assignments to be comfortable, otherwise it will be overwhelming. There is homework every night but it can be done. Chem is a hard class but Dr Turner definitely made it manageable.

Dr. Turner is a great professor. The class is fairly easy, and if you dont understand something, you may find it clear after he explained few questions. You can meet him during office hours. The exams are not difficult, especially for the final, it is not hard and just covered a lot of things. The key model hw are messy and goes faster than class

Helpful powerpoints for lecture. Highly recommend getting a hold of OChem as a 2nd language supplement. Practice problems are very helpful in preparing for exams- I would do them multiple times. Going to office hours is very helpful before midterms.. will hint on certain things to know for exams. Get ready for lots of puns in lecture.

He was definitely the best possible professor you could have had for the class. I think some of the homework was perhaps a little too much and should have been made optional, but they all are attempts to help students perform well. His student test scores were higher than other professors. Dont take Gen Chem unless you have to, curriculum is awful

Overall very friendly and easy to talk to outside of class. However, lecture slides were not very helpful and a lot of at-home work was needed to understand the material. In-class activities each class were helpful (used for attendance). Provides a lot of help during office hours and answering questions during class, but lectures were confusing.

Dr. Turner makes you know the material forward and backward, literally. This is good and bad, good in that I feel like I had a much deeper understanding of Organic Chemistry than in the past. However, this made the class very, very difficult. He is very caring and accessible, offering help to those who ask.

Dr. Turner was such an amazing lecturer, and he made chemistry much easier to understand. You could really tell he wanted all of his students to do well, giving extra credit for homework and answering student questions pretty quickly. There was a lot of homework, and I didn't like the grading criteria on Mastering, but the extra credit points help.

Dr. Turner is a great professor. Chemistry at OSU is hard no matter who your professor is, but Dr. Turner made the informations easy to understand. Tests are pretty difficult, but the final is standardized and super easy. Highly recommend.

Dr. Turner is a pretty decent professor. His lectures were fairly easy to understand, and he was available for office hours. His exams were difficult, but his daily Grind assignments did help students understand the material.

There was a lot of homework for this class including daily online assignments, weekly exam prep assignments, pre lecture assignments, and frequent key skills assignments in addition to all of the lab assignments. His lectures didn't really add anything that I couldn't have found online or in the textbook. But he was nice and always had office hours

Dr. Turner's general chemistry class is difficult, but that's true of any general chem. The amount of homework is widely over the top, and usually doesn't help you prepare for the tests. Dr. Turner is not particularly great at explaining chemistry concepts

Overall, Turner is a good professor. There is homework everyday, but not too much and it helps. He asks a question through Carmen every lecture that is graded and used for attendance. He does not do many practice problems during class and mainly just lectures about the concepts. Do the practice tests he uploads for the midterms and you will be fine
Highly recommend. Great explanations. Tough tests, but if you use the resources he provides, you will be well prepared.
Highly recommend, but is a hard teacher (but ochem isn't supposed to be easy anyway).

summary_comment: Dr. Hummon is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and ability to prepare students well for exams. Her engaging lectures, use of demonstrations, and willingness to explain complex concepts in simple terms contribute to a fun and informative learning experience. However, some students find her lectures occasionally veer off-topic and note that exams can be challenging despite the supportive environment she creates.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Hummon is an amazing professor who prepares you really well for each exam. As long as you put some effort into reading/reviewing the slides, you should be good on all exams. Her lectures are interesting, and you can see her enthusiasm for teaching.

She was average. I would take her again if I had to, but I would prefer not to. She spent a lot of time talking about muppets, rather than the actual chemistry. I would say you should be happy if you got her.

She's AMAZING!! She has very in-depth lectures and is willing to answer questions in a way that you'll understand. She also prepares you well for the exams with her lectures which have demos that are are very fun and interesting.
Dr. Hummon is GOATED. She is so nice and cares very much about her students. You also will get to learn about a couple muppets in each lecture which is always fun. The class is also pretty easy.
Great explanations of material with plenty of memory tricks and breaks so students don't doze off. Lovely personality and remembers students faces and names well.

She is one of the best lecturers for this course. She always prepared some demo experiments for almost every lecture, which made the lecture fun and interesting. She always uses simple language to explain complex chemistry concepts and makes them easy to understand. Homework is a lot, but it did help consolidate the concepts learned in the lecture.

She was an ok lecturer compared to some other options, especially those for 1210. Sometimes she would not explain things very well. She doesn't like to personify chemistry but without that it was sort of confusing. The material isn't hard, but the exams are killer. The homework itself is on a different website not linked to Carmen.

She's a pretty fun teacher to have and is good at explaining things. Definitely still read the book and attend her office hours because they are very helpful. I know that she is also good on giving extensions for online assignments. I'm not happy with my grade but I would take a class with her again because you can tell she likes what she does.
Good at explaining

summary_comment: The professor is generally clear and effective in explaining complex topics, with a focus on material covered in lectures, and provides a straightforward grading system. However, some students found his lectures disorganized and difficult to follow, while others appreciated his clear explanations and engaging teaching style. Overall, the course is challenging, with a significant emphasis on exams and quizzes, and varies in difficulty among students.

Ratings.comment: Very good professor. Some occasional mistakes in lecture but he explains things very clearly. He is very clear about what you need to know for exams. The material isn't too bad if you study, but the whole course is only graded on exams and quizzes- but there are no curveballs. They only encompass what he went over in lecture.
He looks serious but actually very nice. The course is difficult though.

Lectures were so disorganized and hard to follow, he just scribbles on the chalkboard. There was a heavy curve (My 60.22% became a C+), but the only pints in the class are from tests and quizzes. He seems like a nice enough guy, but his teaching style is not conducive to learning organic chemistry

For teaching a very hard topic, he did pretty good. Sometimes hard to understand but not awful. Used the chalkboard religiously. Recorded lectures. No posted notes/slides. Has practice exams and questions but personally didn't find them very helpful.

While he may seem like a Soviet operative infiltrating the OSU Chemistry department, he actually is not as scary as he looks. Compared to other Ochem classes, he has by far the least homework (none). He is a nice guy, but there are virtually zero practice problems beside of practice exams. He also did not tell us what the cutoffs were for grades.
The best ochem professor. Very clear explanations, only tests what is covered in lecture.

90% of the grade relies on midterms and final but he is very clear about the material on each. Only downside is he spent a little too much time going over the easier stuff instead of on mechanisms. He was a funny lecturer and I really enjoyed his teaching style (chalkboard). I would choose to take him for ochen 2 if he taught it.

Dr. Bajic was a good lecturer, he very much focuses on the basics of organic chemistry and doesn't expect you to know information that he doesn't cover in class. His problems sets were useful and tests weren't super difficult if you studied the material in depth. I highly recommend reading organic chemistry as a second language for this class.

He teaches the basics of organic chemistry and only tests the basics. Pretty funny guy. He does make mistakes here and there, but there will be that one guy in class to catch him. Simple to understand. Read the textbook. Again exams are straightforward, tests what is taught.

very good professor that explains all ideas needed for class so we can easily understand and for the exams. only one quiz per week and 3 finals where one gets dropped so make sure to study and u will do perfectly fine. made mistakes here and there on practices but overall great professor that i wish i could have for ochem2. very likable and funny.

The points were made up of 3 midterms (lowest gets dropped), quizzes each recitation, and a final so not a lot of wiggle room. In comparison to other sections, the tests were easier but his lectures I felt were not focused so the exams were still hard. Didn't show up to the final and overall I didn't feel like he cared. Made lots of mistakes.

Dr. Badjic is a decent guy who puts little effort into teaching his class. He makes frequent mistakes in lecture and on practice answer keys. He doesn't quite explain overviews of concepts (or mistakes) well enough. His tests are fair if you study well. He doesn't care what goes on in recitations, lab, or even show up for his own tests and final.

Dr. Badjic was an amazing professor. O chem is a hard subject and requires a lot of outside work. Attendance might not be required but it is extremely beneficial if you show up. He only teaches you what is important and doesn't focus on anything that would not be on the exams. Overall amazing professor and person in general

Plan on being at every lecture. If you fall behind, there is NO catching up. 90% of the grade is based off of 3 midterms (lowest gets dropped) and the final. Lectures are extremely information dense; however, he is genuinely a great lecturer. Would highly recommend using Organic Chemistry as a Second Language as supplemental textbook. 9.5/10 prof.

I would advise anyone who does not have Organic Chemistry already mastered against taking this class. Frequent mistakes during lecture and in the answer keys for the homework. Talked very briefly about topics that were on midterms and quizzes. Lecture was disorganized and taught with a piece of chalk. Professor does not care about students.

This man skimmed over important details of many concepts, and was so unclear about what would be on exams. Lectures were an absolute bore and he expected us to memorize every bit of the textbook. Recitations were just time to take quizzes, with very little time actually reviewing anything. The worst college class Ive ever taken in my life.

Really smart guy but found his lectures to be confusing. Personally just did not like his teaching style (very old-fashioned with chalkboard). Content gets really tough near the end. First two exams are easy, but the third exam sucked (get one drop tho). Final is 40%

Im currently in his class, man does it get hard fast. Starts out pretty easy with a review of Gen Chem and basic stuff, then it gets to the point where he is writing down reactions and moving on to the next one before you finished adding to your notes, let alone even understood the mechanism. Likable guy though.

Sweet guy, badd prof. Course was disorganized, exams were so hard that the class average was ALWAYS an F (a 49% one time!) and he never responded to emails. Neither did his TA. The quizzes and exams often had content that was not in the lectures and there wasn't enough time to finish them. Probably the worst course I've ever taken tbh.

I was really struggling, especially at the beginning of the semester, but the final grades are curved. To do well in the course, read the textbook section before or immediately after lectures to help fully understand. DONT FALL BEHIND. If you stay on top of reading, do the practice problems at the end of each chapter and on canvas youll do fine.

The hardest teacher ive ever had. His tests made me want to kill myself. Really study for the first 2 tests, they are easier than the last 2. The quizzes are difficult too, read the book before lecture and dont be afraid to ask questions. i had a 47% before the curve after the final. Do your best. Go to tutoring if youre really having trouble.

He is a really passionate guy who tries his best to make lecture interesting. O chem is hard in general but he has very fair exams that follow exactly what he teaches in class. O chem is hard but thats not his fault. No points outside of the exams and quizzes which is rough but doable.

Badjic gives extremely fair exams and covers all important material in lecture. There are no graded assignments (only 1 optional worksheet per chapter) so you have to put in a lot of effort yourself by reading the book and doing book problems. He is extremely accessible outside of class if you need help and does want you to succeed.
Overall a very interesting professor, he was clear about the material that would appear on exams and he was always available and helpful during office hours.

Dr. Badjics class wasnt the hardest ochem class at OSU. We got 3 exams and dropped our lowest one and our lowest quiz. But the averages dropped after each exam. His final was pretty tough so be prepared for that. As a person, he seemed distant and intimidating. Even though he was funny in lecture, it was sometimes confusing. Good luck!

Prof Badjic was an okay guy. He has a fun sense of humor but didn't seem to care about teaching. He came in at the last minute and left the second the class ended. The class is difficult enough. He showed example after example but very rarely went into more detail. Thank god for the curve in this class or I would have definitely failed.

Badjic's lecture helps but isn't always necessary to show up for. The class follows the book. To succeed, a student should read the book, do the problems in the back of the book, and MOST IMPORTANTLY do the practice tests and materials several times over. These give students a chance to understand how to take the exam which is very important.

Very knowledgable and good professor. He does not give out what to do in lecture directly, he always wants students to use the think for themselves and use the textbook as that's directly what he teaches out of. His tests can be difficult but they are fair to his material, would recommend for anyone who wants a very good but challenging professor.

Unbelievably difficult. If you do not understand chemistry and can't commit 40 hours a week to teach yourself then you will struggle with this professor. Every point in the class comes from quizzes and exams, no assigned homework, and his lectures are just him doing reactions with no explanation

Do not take this professor. I honestly would suggest putting this class off a semester if he is your only option. Badjic doesn't care about teaching at all, he walks in class 30 seconds before it starts and runs out the door when its over. Have had a sub 5 classes this semester already. badjic makes this already had class, next to impossible.

Make sure you go to class, there are no notes posted and he will not give them to you in office hours. Exams are super tough, you have to study at least a few days before. No homework but do the suggested problems. Badjic just doesn't care about teaching, he shows up to lecture and runs off, don't expect to ask questions after class.

Although I know he's probably not a bad guy, professor Badjic is not interested in teaching. He does not walk you through things. Just comes in a minute before lecture and starts scribbling on the board and when questions are asked he is almost demeaning. If you want to actually understand and learn ochem don't take this you just end up memorizing

Organization? Horrible, no real structure to course. Multiple lecturers, all had no idea where previous had left off! --Exams? Easy, basic-- Grading? Horid! Absolutely awful! Clear mistakes made on grading. Got 15 pts back on final after regrade.-- Beat average by at least 13%, got B- for class. Not Reccomended

He missed a ton of lectures. You get to drop one quiz and one exam which is nice, but that final will kill you. Averages were super low and sometimes partial credit isn't even given. A 60% is a C- but I might have to take the class again anyway.

Do not take this class. If it's required for your major, change majors. Badjic is super confusing so you teach yourself. He's gone for 50% of lectures and our subs never know what they're supposed to be teaching. I hated this class. The exam averages are ridiculously low. I seriously considered throwing myself off the McPh balcony after every exam.

I learned everything for this class from the book, lectures were useless and the grading of exams was terrible. The averages on exams were stupidly low. You're better off just attending a different lecture if you take this class.

This is the Ochem 2510 that you should take. He is very thorough. All his exam comes from the textbook end of chapter problems. Although they may become hard, they are doable. If you are a premed, you should take him. Great preparation for the MCAT

He's horrible. One of the worst professors I've had at OSU. His exams are easy, but his grading is horrid. He made some random undergrads grade our final exams, and they were graded so poorly, we had to go back and ask for points back. I got 15 points back... can you imagine?!

AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Easily the worst professor I've ever had. His lectures are jumbles of reactions that you have to go home and teach yourself. His exams are difficult and the averages were always at least 10 points lower than every other class. He just seems like he does not care at all

He is good for some of the material and not so good for other parts. After the first midterm the material was much tougher and he could be confusing at times. You get to work in a group for quizzes, but if your group members are stupid you won't do too well on them. You will need to read the book and do lots of practice problems to do well.

Avoid taking this professor if possible. The lectures are not clear and the Midterm exams are difficult and unlike homework and quiz problems. The averages in this class are much lower than other sections.

You get to see the quizzes before you take them, but that makes it sound easier than it is.  He is very bad at teaching material.  You have to go to class already understanding it, and only then will his lectures mean anything.  His midterms are very hard.  I do not recommend this professor if you can help it.  There are much better ones available.
you think he will be easy but he is useful, unclear and wastes time. good scientist... bad teacher. makes little sense... ever

He is an awful professor, averages consistently lower than other sections of ochem.  Dropping a midterm does not really help that much, just makes the final worth even more because there are only two midterms that count.  He is really disorganized and unclear.

Group quizzes started off easy. My group did not understand concepts very well late semester. Midterm 1 easiest/Midterm 2 hardest. Study hard for the first one. His lectures were terrible... He can go really fast on hard concepts but waste time on easier ones. Read book, do the problem sets, and end of chapters questions.

His notes on the board are very hard to follow and he doesn't explain how he gets any of his answers. The quizzes are easy because you get to take them in groups but the exams are super hard and wordy.
The MTs are freaking HARD!!the average of MT2 is 44.85/100. If you are really good at organic chemistry, just take this class because you have a chance to drop a MT.

If you want an A in ochem, TAKE THIS CLASS. Don't get me wrong, of course it is hard. But the grading format and the way that Badjic creates exams makes it the easiest OSU organic class. If you are somewhat smart put in lots of time, you will get an A. The same CANNOT be said about other OSU profs. Also, he is pretty odd/funny/ cool

Badjic is an awesome professor. His tests are very fair and consistent with what you learn in class. The quizzes can be taken in groups, and your lowest midterm grade is dropped. Doesn't get much better than that in the OSU chem department
An adequate professor who was hard to understand in lecture and we had to cover two chapter in a matter of 4 days!!! Disorganized but you will learn a great deal. Exams are fair

I loved having Badjic for 251 he is definitely easier than the other professors (Callum and Mattson) but he still explains the information well. He is very nice and laid back.  Go to lecture and do the problem sets because that's where the exams come from.  You also get to take group quizzes and you get to drop a midterm.

He is one of the best professors I have had in the Chemistry department.  He goes over the essentials that you need for OChem. Take notes and do problem sets and do some practice from book if you are not sure. Exams are fair.
The best chemistry teacher. He is so calm and laid-back. He knows how to teach and is definitely not full of himself like some other professors.

I'm in his 251 class right now and I love the way he teaches. If you do the book problems and go to class there is no reason you shouldn't get at least a B in his class. Tests are fair, if not on the easier side compared to other professors like Callam. Let's you pick when your exams are which is a plus. Way better than gen chem!

He is the worst Chem professor I have had so far. In his 251 class he is unclear on the topics and is often unable to answer questions. When he does answer a question, the answer is usually incomprehensible.
Great guy and really knows how to teach chemistry. Go to lecture, take notes, and the exams will be easy (as easy as Orgo can be)

Before the Paul cronies attack...Badjic doesn't goof around in class and try to make you understand concepts with cute analogies...he gets it done.  In conjunction with the book, there is no reason to struggle in his class.  The tests aren't easy, but fair, and if you struggle, he's more than willing to help. If you don't like BS, I recommend.

If you're premed, take this guy!  When studying for the MCAT, the organic chemistry portion is really easy. I got a 14 in Bio partly because of Badjic.  Plus, it's pretty easy to get an A if you do his practice problems he posts online.

Its OChem, so its supposed to be hard. But if you had a good 251 teacher, his class is pretty easy. He was hard to follow during spectroscopy, but the rest of 252 wasn't bad. His tests are very conceptual, the averages are usually low in his class. He's helpful during office hours.

He's kind of a goofy guy which makes lectures light hearted and easy to sit through. The tests were easier than Callam (who I had for 251). Averages were in the 50s so if you had anything in the 80s you got an A. Just study and know the theory behind the mechanisms. If you did well in callam for 251, be prepared for an easier quarter!

I really didn't like him as a teacher.  He was missing for half of the quarter because his visa expired so we were taught by random chem profs.  The first midterm was really easy but so was the material. The second midterm was extremely hard. The group quizzes were okay but most of my group members just mooched answers off of me. Callam is better!

i am not that smart with a 3.3 GPA i pulled out an A in this class. Exams are really straight forward. Read the textbook take notes and understand concept and dont even do the problems coz his exam problems are easier than the book no trick ?s and his class is already curved 85% u are guaranteed A- and on top of that u will haf another 5% curve

took both 251+252. this guy is awesome but i would not recommend if you just want to memorize rxns and mechanisms. his exams always ask to explain why something happens. LITTLE TO NO SYNTHESIS PROBLEMS!!! i expect why people do bad is b/c they just try to memorize instead of understand WHY something happens. prof is not for everybody.

Awful professor. Teaches fairly simple material, then hammers students on tests. First midterm is ok, and then waits several weeks before giving the second one, which contains a huge amount of difficult material. Class averages were in the 30's. NOT RECOMMENDED!!!

started SUPER slow then started blazing through stuff. First midterm was easy but so is the material. Second midterm had a lot of material on it but wasn't too hard if you studied the book. His lectures are ok but I got an A just by doing all the problems in the book and studying it. lectures are super boring (no questions, just rambling.)

Goes ridiculously fast. Starts INSTANTLY after the bell rings. By the time ONE MINUTE has passed, he has one whole reaction on the board and is already half way done explaining it. Test averages are very low (22% on the first midterm). As far as the "group " quizzes go, seriously consider the previous person's advice.

Lectures were very fast paced, and nearly impossible to understand, I just wrote everything down and tried to make sense of it later.  Group quizzes are great if you're in a good group, otherwise you may as well take it alone.  Test averages were around a 50%.  Taught myself from the book and did decent thanks to a laughable curve.
Clear lecturer. Quizzes/midterm/final were straightfoward, no tricks.

Great guy. Had Callam for 251 and and this guy was much easier , however i feel like I learned a great deal from him.  His exams are fairly straight forward and no curve balls.  Also if you have any ochem intuition what so ever, you'll end up with an A for sure.  I did it. you can too!
Great teacher. Very easy to understand, very helpful and fair tests. AMAZING HAIR, seriously.

Best ochem teacher EVER.  Some say Chris Callam is the best, but that's definitely not true.  Badjic is equally as clear, if not more and gives group quizzes.  His exams are what you would expect, without any surprises.  In my opinion, he kicks Callam's ass.

He's awesome. Teaches the fundamentals and doesn't worry about the useless details. If you want to learn the basic concepts and have easier exams than other profs take Badjic. He teaches by doing examples of the types of problems that will be on the exams. Dude rocks the house down.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making chemistry, a typically challenging subject, accessible and understandable for students. He is widely praised as an excellent instructor.

Ratings.comment: Chem is usually a tough subject but he made it easy. Hes a great professor.

summary_comment: Dr. Heather Allen is known for her thorough explanations during office hours and her willingness to help students, though her lectures are often described as dry and unengaging. Students generally agree that the class is challenging regardless of the professor, and success requires significant self-study. Reviews are mixed, with some finding her assistance valuable during office hours while others criticize her teaching methods and lack of clarity in lectures.

Ratings.comment: No matter which professor you have for chem 1220, it's going to be a hard class. Dr. Allen does a good job explaining the material, especially in office hours. She's very nice and willing to help students. If you want to do well in the class, read the textbook before lecture, and go to office hours after lecture.

I feel bad for giving her a bad review because she is genuinely a nice lady. I just think she could do a better job at lecturing. She is very dry and not engaging, but it could be worse. I skipped many classes and found it easy to catch up because she posted her slides online.

Lots of people hate on Allen, but shes not that bad. The class is meant to be difficult and she does her part in teaching the material. If you want to do well you have to read the book outside of class and study a lot. Not her fault that Chem 1220 is hard.

Professor Allen is one of the worst professors I've had. I can tell that she is passionate about chemistry, but she has limited knowledge about 1220 and often does not know how to answer or explain exam questions. Lectures are dry and unhelpful. If you have her, you're better off skipping lecture to study or going to Dr. Fus's lecture instead.

Dr. Heather Allen is probably one of the worst professors I have ever come into contact with. She goes over negligible material in class. I would recommend skipping lecture and using that time to study. She does not know what shes talking about and I honestly cannot fathom the University that presented her with her doctorate.
Just because you can, doesnt mean you should teach.

If you got AP Credit, don't take 1210, go to 1220. Dr. Allen has poorly organized lectures and she only does easy practice problems in class. I'd recommend a different prof if you really want to learn, but if you get stuck with her, its not the end b/c she is pretty nice during office hours. There was a 2 or 3 point curve at the end of the class
Her lectures were very dry. She does not always know how the answer is obtained on her own tests and sometimes struggles to answer students questions in a different way than it was already explained.

Prof. Allen is not a good teacher. She works out simple problems in class, taking up class time, but does not talk about anything remotely challenging. Lectures are boring and hard to sit through; she is not very approachable. While its true that the exams bare some resemblance to her practice material, it is not enough to make any difference.

Dr. Allen's teaching style did not click with me at all. Her lectures are painful to listen to, and she hardly ever works through sample problems in class. Chemistry courses should not be 90 minutes of pure lecturing. I prefer seeing problems worked out, step-by-step, on the blackboard. Her midterms are pretty difficult. Find another professor!!!

She is very clear and I understood everything she said. She is willing to help you if you come to her office hours or email her. Her practice midterms are super close to the actual midterm. However, she is very scatterbrained jumping from one topic to another at times. Also, she really stresses the easy stuff and does not go over the hard problems.

She was a TERRIBLE professor. She is SO scatterbrained and spends 20 minutes on simple things and briefly mentions hard topics. I taught myself everything by reading the textbook and doing practice problems. The homework doesn't help at all. She's rude when you meet with her. Her exams are just like her practice exams. Didn't curve the class alot.

One thing I do want to criticize her on is her usage of the blackboard. In a class of maybe 100-200 students who the vast majority sit too far from the blackboard is it that smart to use it? Her practice exams  the midterms so if you can ace the practice exams you can ace the midterms

Very disorganized. She will start lecturing on the board then try to use her lecture slides after. Her lecture slides are not organized at all. She will talk about something then come back to it later. She is passionate about her research, she will go off on a tangent a lot, but she is not a good lecturer. Can show up late and not miss a thing.

Pros: Streamlined useful information, was open to meeting with you to go over material if you emailed her, exams were not tricky/she let you know what you needed to study for the exams  Cons: She would frequently take a lot of time going over simple problems, demos were lackluster, lectures could be boring since they were the longer ones.

Basically taught myself. Stopped going to lectures toward the end of the semester because there was no point. The practice midterms are pretty much like the actual midterm so that was helpful but other than that, 10/10 don't recommend

Dr. Allen is very straight forward in describing what the exam will be like. Sometimes she doesn't explain topics well in lecture, but she's much more specific if you attend her office hours. Also, the visiting the chem tutors a couple times a week is helpful.

She's a pretty boring lecturer, but that's not too big of a deal. If you have a bent towards Chemistry, then her class will be no problem. Make sure to do the homework and practice midterms. I've only missed a total of 9 questions on all 3 midterms combined, a lot of that due to her practice midterms being almost identical to the actual midterms.

She literally just mumbles and scribbles stuff on the board. She assumes that you already know how to do everything so she doesn't really teach the material...I don't bother attending lecture because its useless. I spent a ridiculous amount of time with chemistry tutors.

I only showed up to 2 lectures before the first midterm and scored 20% above the average.  Never showed up to another lecture and the same happened each exam.  Just make sure you do the homework, practice problems and her practice midterms before the exam and then you will do well.  Her practice exams are almost exactly like the real exams.
She's a decent lecturer. You can tell she doesn't really like teaching, she likes research.  Exams are just like her practice exams and she does examples in lecture that are on exam.

I stopped going to her lectures because I learned nothing from her. Her "examples" usually consisted of working out half the problem, realizing she messed up, and said "but you guys get what I mean." If the practice problems we had were at a difficulty level of 4, then the midterms were at a 7, and the final a strong 10. Switch out of her class
She is awful!

This was by far the hardest class I have ever taken. DO NOT skip class. Even though her lectures are extremely confusing and poorly explained, attendance will help. Read the textbook because her notes come directly from it. She doesn't go over any math problems, so practice those! The average on the final was a 56%. Be prepared to study very hard.

Gave her class 0 curve for the fall semester when the average for the final was a 56. Awful teacher, not clear at all. The only compounds she knows how to manipulate are O2 and N2 since she's an environmental chemist. She has no idea how to explain the other topics in this class. SWITCH OUT IF YOU HAVE HER.

I write this for Asian international student only. This is a very easy course for Asian students to take, I stopped showing up in lectures since midterm 1. She is not helpful and it's better to study  by reading the book and the PPT that she posted. Lab's reports are kind of hard for international students to write. Anyway, easy to get A.

Dr. Allen was always available to help and really wanted her students to learn chemistry. She offered tons of incentive like coffee and food since lecture was at 8 am. If you don't read the textbook beforehand you're not going to understand her lectures very much. The midterms were like the practice ones but the final really tested your knowledge.

Dr. Allen tried to be helpful and encouraged students to come to class and office hours (coffee, doughnuts, reminders).  Although she tried to explain well, she is just too smart and a lot of what she said went over my head.  Her midterms were easy compared to other professors, but her final was ridiculously hard.

She is a good professor and lecturer. There were two things I hated about this class: home works were all over the week, she  would changed due dates and times 300 hundred times. Final was ridiculous, home works didn't help. The worst part is labs, where you will have to write reports like research papers. Yes chem classes are filtering at OSU.

Yea this class is brutal, but that's chemistry at THE Ohio State people! It's not meant to be easy, it's meant to be a filter class. With that being said, Dr. Allen was passionate about what she taught and very available for students with questions. She tried hard to connect with students and I appreciate that. Also she's a total babe.

If you read the textbook before class and come to class with any confusion she will be more than happy to help you after lecture or during her office hours. She is NOT confusing just listen and participate and you''ll be fine. Everyone giving her bad grades probably never went to class or prepared themselves. You can do it Be proactive.

I went to every lecture and she is unbelievably boring. She traveled before every midterm and the final so we could not ask her questions. If you can take Chem 1220 with another professor I would suggest it. At the beginning of the semester she said that she wanted to raise her score on this site. Well, in my opinion her score is accurate

If you are reading this, I am assuming that you are about to take Chem 1220 next semester. Most people forget that Chemistry at OSU is extremely difficult. Dr. Allen may not be the best professor, but she is definitely fair and equips students with the knowledge to do well. The students typing these reviews were probably asleep during lecture.

This professor is seriously horrible! Her lectures are VERY boring and she has very few practice problems in class that are actually related to the test problems. Her tests are extremely difficult and she doesn't really care at all! BEWARE!

Dr. Allen is a kind and friendly professor who is obviously very passionate about her work in environmental chemistry and research. With that being said, DO NOT take a class with her teaching. She is dry, doesn't know how to explain material and gives you an addition problem and then asks you to do calculus on her exam. She is a horrible teacher.

This professor asked us to fix her rating on here at the beginning of the semester, and while I wish I could do that, I can't. She did not teach more than basic concepts in lectures (and these concepts were covered completely and more clearly in the book), yet assigned homework and gave exams way above that basic level. Beware of this professor.

I would not advise this professor. While a nice person, she simply is not a good teacher. I went to every one of her lectures and learned scarcely anything. She only covered the basic concepts, yet a lot of the midterms/finals involved complicated mathematical problems. Plus even though the class final average was a 56% there was almost no curve.

Dr.Allen said her overall goal was to "redeem her rep. on rate my professor". However, with the limited time she put towards her students and the immense amount of time to her research-that was an impossible goal and she didn't succeed. i suggest a different teacher that doesn't do research & dedicates themselves to teaching.

Dr. Allen is a terrible professor. Her lectures were truly useless. I would suggest trying to find another professor ASAP. I, personally, just read the book and got a tutor because she doesn't teach anything. Her example problems are from the book and easy. Her exams are mostly all math. She is mostly interested in her research, not her students.

More interested in doing her research than actually helping students and making sure they understand. I advise taking a different professor if you actually want to do well in the class. Example problems she does in lecture are useless.

Dr. Allen is a terrible professor. Lecture is a waste of your time. She isn't good at explaining concepts, I learned more from reading the book and doing example problems myself. Only example problems she does are the easy ones that are already done in the book which at 20x easier than the ones on the exams. Take a different professor if you can
If you take a class with this professor, you will ruin your grades in other classes too. She gave too many time wasting materials that wouldn't help you in the exams.
Biggest waste of time. Absolutely ridiculous this class exists.
She's a nice person, but this class altogether is a horrible class! You really don't learn anything about chemistry in this class.

Take a different professor.The lectures are pointless. She does no example problems in class and if she does they are the easy ones that are already done out in the book.She didn't seem that interested in teaching;cared more about her research.

Dr. Allen is a far better lecturer than other ratings here may suggest. She said that her lectures are a supplement to reading the text, which seems accurate to me. Though dedicated to her research, she is still dedicated to students if you are willing to seek her out. The course isn't the best, but as far as professors go, she's reasonable.

We all know the Gen. Chem series at OSU is rough and is under review, and she helps out with that. She is a terrible professor. I knew when she asked on the first day to "avenge her reputation" on this site, that she was not going to be helpful. If you can, take another professor. You will not learn anything by going to lecture. Good luck.

She is more concerned about going to her conferences and her research than her students.  She is hard to contact since she is almost never available. Her lectures are pointless, she does not show you how to do the problems, her notes skim the information and do not help. You are better off reading the book and using the internet to help.

This professor seems very smart and into what she does but the lectures don't actually help me to learn the material. I have to read all the chapters in the book in order to feel prepared for the exams, which is hard to do while in other classes.
very easy to understand, and she knows her stuff. She is very helpful, and willing to help anytime! Fun answering questions through text  messages without need to buy Clickers!

Easily the worst class I've ever had. The Professor had no idea what she was talking about. All she did was write her notes on the board. This might've been fine if she'd be able to explain them , but someone else had clearly written said notes. Grading was easy but inconsistent.
crappy teacher, just interested in research, wasted all class time doing long drawn out examples on the board, then after taking an hour on one problem, she would realize she got the answer wrong
tests unfair

This was a terrible class.  It took up a lot of time and made it much harder for me to find time to work on my other classes.  As for the professor, she's really pretty good compared to the other two chemistry professors I had at this school.

Totally unclear lecturer;spends much of class going over sample problems only to realize that she left something out from the start, then goes back and redoes them all. Ends up spending about 80% of the class on such pointless examples. Exams often had no correct answer, justified by saying we should choose the closest one, or leave it blank. Avoid

Horrible notes, horrible teaching, impossible exams. My TA helped me out in the class an insane amount, giving 3 - 4 hour review sessions before exams. Labs are easier than 121. The only curve she gave was 60 - 80 C, 80 - 90 B, 90 - 100 A.. pretty lame.

Bad Class Bad teacher, doesn't help students in office hours, I would avoid her if i could do it again. Material is not to bad though, just don't count on her lectures to teach you what you need to know.
No Comments
No Comments
Tougher class but not because she was hard. If you payed attention in 121 and learned that stuff, this is much easier. If you didn't learn that, this class will just be that much harder.

This class will not be too difficult if you read the book. Just go to her class and read the chapter instead of paying attention to her. In the time wasted in 3 classes listening to her, you could have already read the chapter at hand 2 or 3 times and know more than what she presents in lecture. It works.
very tricky exams. her goal is to trap us in every questions she sets for the midterams and the finals.

Be prepared to teach yourself. This class was horrible. It was sad that we had people correcting our professor every single day in lecture. She even asked students on several occasions to look up the correct answers in the text and to get back to her with the answer...sad. At least her double scrunchy pony tail will keep you entertained.
horrible teacher; makes mistakes every lecture that throws many students off.  god help whoever takes this class with her

This class was very difficult.  You are expected to be responsible for all the material in the book and from the lectureds.  Lectures were helpful to some and not others.  However they were worth a few points.  Her exams were very difficult.  Expect to put alot of effort into this class-no slacking.

Lectures are a waste of time, as well as the clickers.  She spends most of the time going over useless problems that won't be on your exam anyway.  Her tests, for the most part, were extremely difficult.  And, if nothing else bothers you, then i'm sure her awful pony tail will keep you distracted just long enough to pass out from boredom.

Lectures were pretty worthless. Clicker was worthless except for the free points it got you. Her review tests were nothing like the real tests. She did examples wrong on a regular basis. Overall I would not recommend the class.

She will spend half of class going over a problem only to have a student tell her that she has done it completely wrong.  Her tests were random and she is very uncleaar and goes against the book a lot even though she claims she teaches from the book.  Maybe if she read it herself, she would be a better teacher.
Hard class, hard exams, ****y, does alot of problems wrong which throws you off and has stuff on the tests that she hasnt even covered.

She sucks. She does example problems in class wrong and only tells the kids who go to her office hours that she did it wrong.  On one of the midterms she did calculations wrong so that the exact answer wasn't a choice, and she didn't dicount that question either. She made the class so much more work because she sucked at teaching it

Very easy to understand, but she doesnt always seem to know everything she is talking about, and occasionally does enitre problems wrong. also, her exams are not straighforward at all, and include things not covered in lecture...the $50 clicker is also not my favorite. :/
She does entire 15 minute problems only to have a student tell her it's wrong and do it all over again.

As one of my classmates put it, "I wonder if she could pass her own exams." She does a problem on the board and doesn't realize it's WRONG until a student corrects her. She assumes you know things you don't. Test questions are really difficult. She doesn't seem to care about her students. Doesn't know the material. AVOID THIS CLASS IF POSSIBLE!!
No Comments
Lectures are actually helpful, but requires you to buy a $45 "clicker" for in lecture quizes. Her exams are pretty challenging, but she covers the material in class very thoroughly.
Very hard class, tried to be helpful, exams are impossible, good luck.
No Comments
I liked that class, it's one of the best that I had so far
One of the best teachers I have had.  She speaks very clearly and you get a lot out of the lectures.

One of the easiest classes ever.  If you don't know how to do dimensional analysis, maybe you should go back grade school because that is about all you need to know to pass this class.  That, and memorize some periodic trends.  Chem 121 is extremely easy, and she is not a bad teach at all.

Tests were not hard, she covered all the material that was needed, and I feel she did a pretty good job explaining it all.  Study the notes, do the homeworks, and you should be fine.  She's hot too.  Nice bonus.
shes hot

Her first time teaching 121, it was not really a good lecture.  She was used to teaching high level chemistry and simply assumed that we should all know certain things.  Nice woman, and helpful if you go to her, but if you aren't good with chemistry before her class...she'll lose you real quick.
It was the worst class i have ever taken!!!
Horrible
The flow of the material was horrible. The teacher doesn't teach well. Being self-taught is necessary to understand any material.
knows her stuff, willing to help or research anything she doesn't have an answer for on the spot. lots of  self-teaching from the book but she's always enthusiastic about the lecture.
terrible teacher, she can't answer simple questions for the life of her, i bet shes a smart woman, but teaching wise she's horrific, and theres not better word for it!
She tries really hard, but her lecture is dull and goes way too slowly. Her exams were easy, but you have to teach yourself or already know the material.
The students know more about chemistry then she does.  If you already are intested in chemistry I suggest taking this class since her exams and quizes are extremely easy

summary_comment: Dr. Cowan is knowledgeable and passionate about chemistry, which some students appreciate, though his teaching style is often criticized as monotonous and lecture-heavy, relying heavily on the textbook. Students find success through diligent self-study and memorization, with a helpful curve on exams. Overall, while some see value in his expertise, many struggle with his teaching methods.

Ratings.comment: Good professor, listen to him and do the book problems. The book problems will help a lot on the exams. The exam is reasonable but you have to be willing to put in the work. He was the better of the two 1920H professors in my opinion.

Yes, Dr. Cowan does use the traditional blackboard method of instruction, however he is unable to use it to the advantage of the students. Lectures are a boring regurgitation of notes, and a lot of time is wasted on erasing and adjusting the board. Topics were barely covered in class, and most work was left up to the students. Would not recommend.

He doesn't use powerpoints during lecture & just summarizes the text and important reactions on the blackboard. The material followed the textbook exactly so memorize that and you'll do fine. The midterm/final averages were around 40-60%, but there's a massive curve.
OSU is lucky to have Dr. Cowan. It is clear he know chemistry inside and out, and is clearly passionate for the subject. There is a good curve on exams and if you study you should be fine.
Pretty much teaches from the book, and not very well at that, so you'll have to do a lot of work on your own if you want to do well. Curve is nice, though, and I love the Scottish accent.
His lectures were directly out of the book and so were his exams. So, reading the book is very important and memorization is key on his half of the class.

Cowan can't teach. He teaches you the basic ideas in lecture but expects you teach yourself more deeply with the textbook (reverse of a normal, good prof). His lectures are boring, monotonous, and made me dread going to a class covering a subject I love. His portion wasn't too hard, but most of his content is hard to study for (chemical trivia).

Cowan is brilliant, but he is not the best at teaching the material. The textbook will become your best friend in this class. The tests will cover material not taught in class, but it is in the text. Cowan will teach the "basic" problems/concepts in class and expects you learn the more advanced things on your own via the text and the homework.

Professor Cowan was arguably the smartest person I have ever had at OSU. He knows his stuff. That being said though, he does not present the information in a way for people to understand. Makes assumptions that we knew something already when in reality some people have never even heard of what he is talking about. Notes are up and down

Not all materials are covered in class and the rest is hard to follow so exam questions seem very random. One of our exams asked us what a chemical he never mentioned looked like in solid form, even our TA got it wrong! Can be very intimidating when it comes to asking questions because he will laugh at you and give you a sarcastic answer.

Cowan's lectures consist of him talking and writing on the board the entire time and the class taking notes. He's a good lecturer but doesn't cover all the material. You definitely have to put in a lot of work outside of class, but then again that is expected in chemistry anyway. He gives a couple practice exams every midterm which is nice.

Dr. Cowan was an amazing professor. He was very knowledgeable on the topics. The book covered one aspect of a subject while he would go in depth and use examples to to help make students understand.  There wasn't much of a curve. I was close to an A- but ended up with a B+ sadly. Read the textbook, do practice midterms, study, and you'll do fine.

Lectures are fine, because he just copy things from his papers to the board. You can just read the text book and pass the exams. The grades of experiments depends on your TA. However, our final grads were curved.

Great guy and brilliant researcher, but you can definitely tell teaching is not his strong point. Read the book and do practice problems and you'll be fine. He only teaches the first two of eight sections in each chapter so you have to read the book.
Really cares about his students, always ready to help, great lectures, really funny guy

Dr. Cowan had good lectures, but because his portion of the class was all memorization based, it all seemed very random as to what would be on the test. On the final, his questions just seemed random. It didn't seem like there was a way to prepare for his test.

He knows how to communicate the material he teaches but he does the absolute bare minimum.  He shows up to lecture, writes his notes on a chalk board and you better hope you get it because his office hours are a waste of your time.  He doesn't care if you pass or fail and his tests are very hard.

My class had Dr. Cowan the first time he taught this specific class, and that was obvious. His tests were insanely difficult, and were over material that was not covered in the class nor in the text book.  He gives pop quizzes that are take home, but even with the entire internet as a resource, the tests are still impossible.

Dr. Cowan was always more than willing to help me when I came to his office hours. His lectures were pretty straightforward and the examples he did in class were really helpful when it came to his tests. I enjoyed his class a lot and would definitely take another class with him.
He is very nice and cares a lot about his students. However, he is a bit confusing. Read the textbook and attend class and you should be fine.
He is a terrible instructor. Never feel helpful. Lectures are boring. Notes are hard to read. No office hour. Don't choose him!!!
Best professor I've ever had
He's amazing...

Dr. Cowan's lectures were extremely thorough. He was helpful in office hours, but not very familiar with the practice problem sets because he just used those belonging to a previous professor. All grades were based off of exams (no quizzes or homeworks), so that was a little stressful. Exams were fair. Average around 50% curved to B-.

If you are looking to have the easiest chemistry 121 class, take him! his tests are simple. you have to study to do well in 121, but that being said, he is your best chance of doing well. his averages for tests are in the C range, compared to other chem classes with 40% average. his students simply do better!

This is my second time taking 121, and I couldn't be more thankful having Dr. Cowan as a professor!  He is a nice man that gives clear notes and EASY exams.  If you put in the effort to study, you're golden.

Dr. Cowan is a teriffic professor! I almost didn't take his course simply because of the reviews here, but they are very unfair! YOU MUST STUDY FOR CHEM 121, regardless of your professor. That being said, Cowan's lectures were clear and concise. His quizzes and exams were EXTREMELY fair. I definitely recommend him!

terrible. complete jerk. notes were a mess. sarcastic and rude, nearly impossible to get his help. he SHOULD NOT be teaching any class in any university. actually laughed at students when asked questions.

Wow, this guy is terrible.  Previous comments are generally accurate, but I will reiterate - he is unclear, his lecture notes are a chaotic mess, he does not give straight responses to questions, and he gives little to no extra resources to his students, despite the difficulty of his exams.  Don't take a class under him, whatever you do; I mean it.

This was the worst class I have taken and the worst decision I ever made was to take this class. His exams are impossible and provides no help. Notes are useless. The chemistry dept. is half to blame. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS FROM HIM!

Dr. James Cowan is worse than the professors they have at OSU Mansfield. I never quite can connect what's in my lecture notes with any of the material on the quizzes or test. Quizzes and tests are ridiculous and some of the material is on concepts that haven't been covered. Even though I spend money on a tutor (which I can't believe I need) and spe

He is by far the WORST professor I've had thus far at OSU. Not only is he unclear about what will be covered on midterms and quizzes, but he also has blatant disregard for any questions or concerns that students may have. He obviously has no passion for teaching, and it shows.
I hate him
No Comments
This may, without a doubt be a guy who could ruin your shot at grad school.  Avoid him at all costs.

The past 4 weeks this guy has been teaching something, what it is I don't know.  I really don't think he is teaching chemistry.  At the end of class, I look at my notes and there is essentially nothing there.  By far the worst prof ever, I hope he is good at something bc his teaching is horrendous!!

i didn't have a bad experience in this class.  his lectures are decent but he is kinda unclear about midterms: he doesn't even assign homework!  luckily i took this class my 2nd quarter at OSU when my enthusiasm for academics was still pretty high.
Very condescending.  Assumes if you don't understand it's because you are not trying.  Seems incapable of explaining things from multiple perspectives.
Difficult Exams and Quiz, lot of memorization in his class. Materials goes very fast.

simply the worst.  a lot of kids found the midterms tough because they attended lectures.  I stayed home and read the book and got an A.  That is my recommendation if you do get stuck with him.  He pulls the excitement out of a subject rich with potential
rambles on in lectures...all exams comprise of conversion equations.  Has hard exams, lectures provide for good time to sleep

A very knowledgeable individual who seems genuinely concerned that students learn in his class.  Speaks very clear with a hint of a Scottish accent.  Writes very challenging midterms and exams, but easy quizzes.

summary_comment: Professor Shafaat's teaching is widely regarded as subpar, with students citing unclear lectures and a heavy workload as significant issues. The course structure, including weekly quizzes on untaught material and extensive homework, has led to low exam scores and frustration among students. Overall, her approach to teaching general chemistry is considered ineffective, with many students feeling they must teach themselves the material outside of class.

Ratings.comment: We had weekly recitation quizzes that were based on material that had not been covered in lecture that were worth 10% of the overall grade. Lecture notes were unclear and confusing.

shafaat seems to mean the best for her students and is clearly knowledgeable. however, her lectures do no justice to preparing you for exams or learning content. her exam scores are consistently below the other profs by 10%. ive had to resort to entirely teaching myself the content in this course. this is the single worst course ive ever taken.

One of the worst lecturers. She seems like she does her best, but lectures are often held late in the evening which is troublesome. Mastering is set up with assignments for sections weeks out being due well before discussed in lecture. 1h20m lectures are long and hard to stay focused in. Definitely doable, but requires a lot of extra textbook work.

350 characters isnt enough to fill the pure rage I felt during this course. artificially difficult via an insane workload ,falling a week behind in material often. its a 4 credit hour class with 7 hours of in class time. If Shafaat managed a business like she runs this course she would be fired almost immediately. 0/10 OSU chem dep needs fixing.

Best way to sum her up is that when we got behind in content in lecture due to her taking too long showing us in class demonstrations when we have a lab portion, she decided to skip a whole section and told us to teach it to ourselves. While Ive had profs whove had a more hands-off approach, this was the first time I was expected to teach myself.

We had quizzes every week in recitation which would sometimes be on material that we hadn't learned in lecture yet and were graded all or nothing. We had an unnecessary amount of homework assignments and our class average on exams was very low. Lectures were also not much help, and you have to go to your TAs instead of her for assistance.
She is not a good gen chem professor. She does not explain concepts well at all, and her lectures are very unorganized.

Homework exceptions are unreasonable, unless you are fortunate enough to have a TA to explain how to do each problem every week. I escaped with a B by doing much better than average on exams (the first of which had an average below 30%). Expect to spend 20 hours/week on homework which rarely relates to lectures... good luck
She was probably the worst teacher I have seen in my student life. She even wasn't clear about the stuffs. I got an A because of myself. But in the end she was a nice person and I appreciate that.

The worst class at this university. Be prepared for 20+ hours/week in problem sets, impossible exams, and her sarcastic remarks a million times in class. Dr. Shafaat expects the world of you but is unwilling to do anything more than the bare minimum as a professor. But you can't get around her if you are a chem major.. sorry in advance.

Lectures are clear. Exams are straightforward and graded fairly. Shafaat expects you to think on your own and work out the problems on your own. Let's face it: thermodynamics isn't intuitive, and the only way to be good at it is to play with the equations.

Terrible professor on every level imaginable! She gives pop quizzes, her homework sets are impossible, she holds office hours are right after when the homework is due, and the exams are horrendously complicated and way too long. I'd avoid her if you can!

SEI.Subject: CHEM
SEI.Class Name: The Inorganic Chemistry of Bioinspired Energy Conversion

summary_comment: Dr. Howell is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and caring nature, making complex chemistry concepts accessible and engaging. Students appreciate his interactive approach, willingness to re-explain material, and genuine concern for their success. While the class can be challenging, particularly for beginners, his support and clear explanations help ensure student understanding and success.

Ratings.comment: The class was extra hard since I took it online during the pandemic, but he was a great, caring guy. Wish I could've taken it in person.

Best professor I have had so far. Classes were zooms, not webinars and he was incredibly interactive with the chat. Always willing to go back a slide for someone or re-explain when someone asked for it. He is super friendly and very good at re-explaining concepts. Also super fun, literally brought his wife to class one day so we could meet her lol

Dr. Howell was a great professor! He actually took the time to explain the material to students. Sometimes class would move a bit slow due to this but it was still helpful. Lectures arent mandatory and he also uploads lecture recordings after. Exams are somewhat difficult, but if you study youll do good.

Amazing, hilarious Professor that truly cares about his students succeeding. He was always available for office hours & if u email him, hed make time for u. This class is HARD tho, especially for someone whose never taken a Chem course EVER, like me. Dont slack off , get all the help u can, go to lectures, off-hrs, & GET a TUTOR if needed.

Dr. Howell was such an amazing professor. He broke all of the information down and made things very simple. He always encouraged questions and was very helpful. If you have to take chem 1110, definitely try to get dr. Howell.

Prof. Howell is one of the best professors I have had since coming to Ohio State. He genuinely cares and feels for his students given the circumstances. He makes chemistry interesting even if you despise it. If you complete the practice midterms and go over mastering problems before each test you will do fine.

Dr. Howell is an extremely caring and helpful professor who obviously loves what he teaches. As long as you show up to the lectures, study, and ask questions when needed you will pass. He explains things well and works through problems to make sure everyone understands each concept. Great professor and I recommend him if you have to take this chem.

Dr. Howell is soooo nice. 10/10 recommend. Its a intro chem class so its a lot I mean Chem is just hard but he tries to make sure you know what your doing and actually answers your questions during lectures. If you go to his office hours hes super helpful too and just is an overall genuine guy. Funny too. Would recommend.
Dr. Howell is a good professor. He is very kind and loves to help his students get a better grade.

Dr. Howell is such a caring teacher who will do everything in his power to make sure you understand the content. If you attend office hours he's extremely good at answering any questions you have. 120% recommend taking his course.

summary_comment: Dr. Magliery is highly regarded for his dedication to student success, offering extensive support and resources. Despite some challenges with lecture pacing and clarity, students appreciate his accessibility and willingness to help. While the course is challenging, many find his fairness and clear explanations beneficial, especially when combined with consistent effort and attendance.

Ratings.comment: Dr.Magliery cares immensely for his students. He WILL help you and WANTS you to succeed, just ask. I've had few professors who care about their students as much as Dr.M. Mid-semester, my dad got sick and suddenly passed away. I'm still in awe of the patience and support I was met with by Dr.Magliery. He helped me get through an impossible semester.

Lectures were so dry, went very fast, and his handwriting is barely legible. Textbook used in class had practice problems but the answers to said problems are in another textbook that costs ~$70. I recommend watching Dr. Callam's lectures I learned more listening to him lecture once than I did the entire semester with Magliery.

This is definitely a hard class, but the professor gives you all the tools you need to succeed. Lectures are very fast paced, and notes are somewhat illegible and not posted online. Your grade is all exams and quizzes and 2% participation so you have to go to class and do the homework. Curve was ~30% because it was one of the hardest classes ever.

No matter what professor you have, ochem is going to be hard. His exams are very fair and they are heavily based on the EXACT content he teaches in lecture. He does not post his slides, so definitely attend lecture. If you actually study and go to office hours when you need help, you should do well.

Dr.Magliery is FAIR. Ochem's just a hard class. Super accessible outside of class. Best advice is to read or watch youtube on topics BEFORE lecture for general idea, PAY ATTENTION during class , mark slides you don't understand, and go to office hours once a week and ask him to explain them. DON'T FALL BEHIND. No grade yet but on track to get an A.
He is always available outside of class, very kind and helpful to his students, and always will answer questions in a clear way to really help you understand.

Things started off fine and went downhill as soon as the deadline to drop the class passed. A lot of information crammed into a small amount of time. Points taken off for right answers with no explanation and if you try to get it fixed good luck reaching him. Typo? Half credit.

Dr. M was a solid, straight-forward prof and had well prepared office hours during this online semester. Didnt provide any problem sets like other teachers but doing the txtbook problems, recitation work, going over the weekly quizzes, and doing the practice exams should set u straight for the exams, which i thought fairly covered lecture material

Magliery has this weird little fan club of people but he is genuinely the worst teacher Ive ever had. Awful teaching style, poor at actually explaining things, and downright RUDE In his emails. He is an awful teacher. I suggest not watching the lectures and just teaching yourself the material. Once I did that, my grade increased

Dont let the bad reviews scare you. Dr. Magliery is one of the better professors you can have for Ochem 1. The exams are fairly straightforward if you watch lectures/attend office hours/read the book and do practice problems. If you dont do any practice besides what is given in lecture, you wont do well. Just do your part. Ochem is hard as is.

The way the class was taught was truly awful, I watched every lecture, I tried to learn as much as I could and put the most time into the class of any this semester and I still had a very hard time learning. Overly complicated and did not take into account the difficulty of learning online. I would never take it again.

Ive taken Ochem before and thank god I did because his teaching methods are AWFUL. Over complicated everything and teaches things specifically for the male mind. His lectures are really no help, if anything they make it worse. Very disrespectful in emails, if you even get a reply. Do yourself a favor and avoid at all costs.

This man happens to be the worst teacher of all time. He tests on incredibly difficult material that he has not taught. He does not give any baseline knowledge of o chem so if you are trying to master the basics for the MCAT steer clear of this man. Exams are difficult with barely any time given. The laziest teacher I have EVER had.

Genuinely one of the worst teachers Ive ever had. Overcomplicates every topic and test/quiz material is way out of the scope of what he teaches in lecture. Lectures have little to no examples, no problem sets, and his handwriting isnt legible. Magliery is extremely condescending to students at all times. Never take him.

If you're an adult learner, this professor is probably not for you. He has a tendency to talk down to student. When trying to discuss with him some technical difficulties, he stated he gave exceptions to anyone who told him they were having technical difficulties, however he didn't give the exceptions he said he would. Plenty of work & time req'd.

Dr. Magliery is one of the best organic professors you could take. Read the sections he assigns at the beginning of the semester before class, he will cover the material to a T and it will make much more sense. Extremely approachable, especially during office hours, and truly cares about you as a student. Teaches like he has a degree in education.
Tom is a great professor. Tom has a super sexy voice.

Dr. Magliery is amazing. He is organized and follows the textbook. He has office hours twice per week, which are super helpful. I recommend reading the textbook to add to your class notes when you get confused. Definitely do practice problems! You don't need to do every problem he assigns but do them until you understand the concept.

Dr. Magliery is the best professor I have had at OSU. He continually worked hard to make every topic as easy to understand as possible. He also makes everything extremely clear with his guidelines for what he is going to do in each class. Wish I could take him again and anyone can do well with hard work. He is awesome!

Excellent professor. He really cares about his students and is always willing to help. His quizzes and exams reflect his notes and practice problems he makes. Therefore, if you are willing to put in the time to learn, you will succeed.

Dr. Magliery did a wonderful job making lectures organized and clear, especially considering the complexity of the material he was teaching. Exams were very fair and straightforward, no questions ever seemed to come as a surprise. Very possible to get a good grade in his class.
He is awesome.
Dr.Magliery is a really nice professor. He integrated the content to make it more understandable.

Magliery is an awesome professor! I wished he would teach my 2520 class. Great, organized notes and he tells you how to succeed in his class. Exams are difficult, of course, but they are straight forward with no real surprises.

Dr. Magliery was a very nice professor. He wasn't too hard, yet he wasn't too easy. At the beginning of the semester, he handed out a list of reading assignments. The lectures were well organized and he would give out worksheets for recitation and practice tests before midterms. He also would hold midterm review sessions on Sundays. Very organized

Dr. Magliery was an amazing professor. He was a very clear lecturer, extremely kind-hearted man, and as fair as could be on exams. Read the book because he follows it almost exactly, and make sure to go over your notes, quizzes, and group work for the exams. Exams are very straight-forward and are based mostly on lecture material. YOU WILL DO FINE!

His lectures were extremely organized. He gives out practice exams before every exam and even holds Sunday night review sessions the weekend before a test. He does everything in his power to help students do well. He is quick to respond to emails. His exams are straight forward and reflect his in class lectures.

Lectures very fast and you will scramble to take notes. Very confusing, does not clearly explain anything. Don't bother attempting to understand the lecture, just get the notes down and practice with outside sources. Goodluck

This being the first of the o chem series, he should've done a better job transitioning to learning reactions. He wasn't always clear with explanations. Came off a bit snobbish when asked questions in office hrs (and when i knocked a mere few mins early). Good curve though.

Overall Dr. Magliery was a good professor.
