I was able to pull off an A in the class... really all you have to do is do all the homework problems in the back of the book, read through his notes, and read the textbook. If you understand it, you'll get a good grade! And he is willing to help in office hours too!
Tests were straightforward. It's Ochem, so its going to be hard. Like the posts before me, I too got Bs and B+s in GenChem, but pulled an A- in 251.

I thought he was pretty clear with explaining the lecture material, and only tests you off his notes, but you have to go to class to write them down.  His exams and quizzes are kind of tricky (class average was 60%) so you have to pay attention to the wording, but he gives a very generous curve (i.e. I should have a B- but recieved an A-).
Magliery lectured as if he were teaching other professors, not undergraduates.  He acted often explained things in ways that were more confusing than they needed to be.

LOVED HIM! DId poorly in Gen Chem and got an A- in his class.  Easy to understand, tests VERY fairly. Basically tells you exactly what will be on them.  Take him if you can and someone convince him to teach 252/253!!!!

He was a very clear lecturer. Some say that he hammers you on the second midterm.  Well if you look at the other professors, they had about the same amount of material on their exams.  He is very good at explaining mechanisms and gives a generous curve.  I should have roughly had a B/B- and I got an A-.

Sometimes goes fast in lecture, but is fairly understandable. Very helpful if you ask questions. Tests were very fair but the material requires a lot of time to understand it. Overall the best Chem teacher I have had so far.

Loved him! Taught us what we needed to know to do well in 252 and 253 but did not take joy in making students fail exams like Callam.  First midterm no curve (do to high average), second midterm 20% curve- didn't tell us the curve for the final but I ended up with an A when according to the points I should have gotten an A-... Very fair and clear.
overall good
The best chem professor I've had so far. Makes everything crystal clear. The textbook helps, and is not a difficult read. Exams and quizzes are very fair. Great professor.
Dr.Magliery is some how clear lecturer but his exam is extremly hard.if you take a class with him you should kiss goodbye ur made school dream.impossible to get A.
he is one of the hardest proffesor in ohio state.he grade harsh and his exam is very challenging.I donot advise to any one to take his class specially if you need A grade.
He grades ext
I don't know why everyone likes him. He's sarcastic and grades hard. His tests are hard and they try to trick you.

Very good lecturer, well spoken easy to listen too. Will help a lot during office hours. Worksheets in recitation are hard but they prepare you for the exams which are not difficult at all..Easy class to do good in if your spend time with it.
Friendly and helpful professor. Willing to take the time to explain something. Lectures are clear, quizzes are made to be easy points, and tests are straight forward. Highly recommended.

Dr. Magliery is a very clear lecturer.  He gives many practice problems, review sessions, and he is extremely approachable.  If you do all the problems in the book, go to class, and do his practice exams, you can easily get an A.  He also has a sexy voice.

Extremely approachable and flexible when it comes to meeting with students.  Offers reviews prior to exams in addition to sample midterms.  Very fair grader, but not afraid to challenge students.  Focuses on concepts more than individual reactions.  One of the better teachers I have had.
Dr. Magliery is a new professor at OSU.  He is a good lecturer and explains the material well.  I would take another class with him given the opportunity.

summary_comment: Dr. Babu is highly regarded as one of the best professors at OSU, known for challenging classes that promote deep learning in organic chemistry. Students consistently praise his accessibility, organization, and willingness to help outside of class, though some find his lectures can be dry. Overall, while the course demands significant effort, students feel well-prepared and rewarded with strong grades and a solid understanding of the subject.

Ratings.comment: One of the best professors at OSU. His class is very challenging and thus provides a great opportunity to learn chemistry.
Best prof I have had and he really did a great job of making me a better student and challenging me.

Dr. Babu is just not good at teaching the material. However, I would 1000% recommend taking his class over other professors. He curves the class way more so you're almost guaranteed a decent grade. There's a book I bought that teaches the material better than any of the professors and makes the class SOOO much easier (OChem as a second language).

Dr. Babu was a great professor. The class was challenging, but it was a good challenging and I felt like I learned a lot. He was very available, his lectures were well-paced and well-organized, and he adapted very well to the coronavirus and online teaching. I created a large poster of organic reactions which I found very helpful.

Dr. Babu was one of my favorite professors that I've had so far at OSU. He was always willing to help outside of class when I needed it, and he openly voiced this kind of support to the class continuously. He didn't coddle us, but that made us stronger students in my opinion. I definitely learned a lot and he was a superstar during the coronavirus.

Dr. Babu really cares about his students. He is very accessible outside of class and is always willing to help. The class is very difficult and requires a lot of work outside of class, but if you are willing to put in the extra effort, you will learn a lot from it.

The lectures can be boring, and the quizzes were tough, but overall Babu will reward you with a good grade as long as you put the effort in. Take the time to read the book, and I recommend making flash cards as the class goes on. Looking back, the hard work was worth it and I'm grateful I had babu as a prof!

Dr. Babu is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. O Chem 2 is a really tough class, but he will help you through it. Make sure you read the textbook, pay attention in lecture, take good notes, and actually do all the practice questions he suggests. He is extremely helpful with questions outside of class as well. 10/10 recommend this class.

Great dude who genuinely cares about each of his students. Very accessible outside of class through both office hours and email. Reached out to me personally when I was struggling with the material and made sure I got caught up. The class is very difficult, but he is aware of that and makes sure that you have everything you need to succeed.

I believe that Dr. Babu does want his students to do well. However, he doesn't provide any resources that students would need to be successful. His lectures were unclear, and his handwriting was small, which didn't help. Overall very difficult, the only way I learned way I passed was reading the textbook and watching youtube videos. Avoid.

Rajanbabu is definitely a nice guy, but not fit to each ochem whatsoever. The only resource he gives to students is the textbook. He give little indication as to what will be on his quizzes and exams. I was usually about 10% below the averages on the midterms and the final and got a C in the class. Huge curve but learned nothing.

Babu is a nice man, and I believe he genuinely wants his students to do well. Unfortunately, his lectures and provided resources do not promote this type of success. Lectures are unstructured and hard to follow. Be prepared to read the textbook thoroughly. I also recommend purchasing Organic Chemistry As a Second Language.

Avoid this professor at all costs. His lectures are just him writing random reactions on the chalkboard and there is no way to keep up. Does not give any study materials for tests and does not care about his students' success. He humiliates students for not understanding things. The only reason I got an A is because I taught myself from the book.

If Dr. Babu teaches another O Chem class, I would advise anyone to take another prof over him bc Babu's accent is so thick & his writing is so small, disorganized & illegible that it's hard to understand him. His teaching style is pretty sloppy & I attended all lectures. To be honest the book was more helpful in learning the material than from him.

I think Babu is a great professor, I know most of the opinions on here disagree but that probably because they did not work hard so they did not do well or learn but if you want a challenge and apply yourself you would do great in his class. His office hours are also really helpful.  I think if you are chemistry major you should take his class.

Although I ended the class with an A, to be quite honest I don't think I learned anything. The class is hugely curved, and yes you most likely will get a good grade from it, but does that mean you really learned anything?? The quality of Babu's teaching isn't the best and I don't think it really prepares you for future classes or MCAT/DAT tests.

I didn't do as well as I was hoping but if you have Dr. Babu be ready to study only o chem. To me it didn't seem like Dr. Babu realized that we, the students, have other classes to study for. My grades in my other classes really hurt my gpa because of how much time Dr. Babu expects you to study o chem.

I expected O Chem to be hard because it is a hard class, but Babu made it almost impossible. I went to Dr. Callam because a lot of my friends had him and Callam really helped me understand the basic concepts of everything, but still I was having trouble understanding Babu because of how complex and unnecessarily difficult he made things.

Dr. Babu isn't the best professor and there are clearly other profs that are worth taking over Dr. Babu. Yeah most people will probably get a decent/good grade in Babu's class but that's because it's hugely curved, but that doesn't mean I learned anything. Regardless I've been above average for everything, but I feel like I haven't learned anything

As a chemistry major, Chem 2610 & 2510 are supposed to be interchangeable as it doesn't matter which class you take. Take Callum for 2510, AVOID BABU AT ALL COSTS. Expects way too much at an undergrad level, often leaning towards teaching us grad level content. He in no way prepared me to take 2520 next semester or even prepare me for the DAT.

Dr. Babu really doesn't put the effort into making sure his students understand the content, clearly proven by the stats of ALL our exams. He consistently blames his students for not putting enough effort into studying. I've been to his office hours several times and stopped going because he put in little effort into trying to help me.

I enjoyed being in Dr. Babu's class very much. His office hours were very helpful and he cared a lot about his students. His test were what are to be expected in ochem, but if you put the time in and study, you will do well. Overall A+ professor and an A+ class.

Has very high expectations from his students, but the average student often scores below a 50-60% & everyday he reminds us of his disappointment in us. I don't find his lectures useful b/c of how disorganized & illegible his notes are, then quickly erases it. He said there will be a curve, but I still don't like how I haven't learned anything.

Yes, he is intimidating at first and does make you feel a little stupid if you ask questions that could be answered in his notes. His exams are easy to anticipate but somehow, the class was never prepared for them. All material that showed up on the exam had shown up in problem sets and in class. His lecture style is dry and fast paced.
Intimidating at first but extremely helpful and dedicated.

The most dedicated professor I had during my graduate course work. Dr. Babu genuinely cares about his students and even offered for me to come to his office Saturday if I felt I needed help. Expects respect and hard work but will give every bit back to you. He is a fantastic person and teaches with exceptional clarity.

Dr RajanBabu is an excellent organic chemistry professor. He connects organic chemistry with real-world applications in pharmacy and polymers. Rather than just go through reactions, he teaches you to apply organic chemistry through synthesis problems. I recommend his class if you want more than a pharm/MD/DDS prereq. course.

Being in Rajanbabu's class was a very negative experience. He demands respect from students, but doesn't return the favor- often treating students in a condescending manner. He made a lot of mistakes while lecturing and spent a lot of time talking about obvious things while quickly glossing over more important topics. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Ok so everyone says they don't like Babu, but he is a great guy. His tests are hard but trust me he will make up for it in the final curve. In fact the average for my class was a B-. But if you study hard you can easily get an A. I would recommend him for anyone who has to take ochem for some obscure reason because he will be your best bet for an A

He is an awful professor. Does not explain things very clearly and can hardly understand him during lecture. Learned more by asking help from others. Exams can be tricky some questions are  not worded very well. I would def recommend taking another professor.
horrible teacher. could not understand through his accent. doesn't teach what he tests over. should retire. has insane expectations for the average student. do not take his class.

If you are willing to work, he's an amazing professor.  His tests and quizzes are difficult but he's a lenient grader.  He only tests over lecture material which is great if you go to class, he really cares about his students and is willing to do anything to help.  If you hate him during NMR just wait and give him a shot with rxn chem-he's great!

Lecture isn't really worth going to. He shows you the same examples the book has and is much less clear when explaining. Best strategy would be to use the 48 min. lecture time to go to the library and read through the chapter and knock out some practice problems.

Really enjoyed having him for 252. Class is hard and fast pace but he explains the material as well as anybody and genuinely interested in students. Again the exams were difficult but still doable and there was a healthy curve as well...i would recommend him if you are ready to attend lectures...

The material sucks, he does not. If you do the problems he assigns in the books and pay attention in class, its passable. The TA and him and easily accessible and are there to help, of you need it, ASK IT! Plus he does group quizes so you don't feel completely useless

Horrible. Class is pointless as he teaches things he doesn't test over. He stresses things that aren't important in succeeding in the course. His accent is bad at times. His quizzes were terrible and contained unexpected information. He spent the first five weeks discussing (i.e. glazing over) spectroscopy. I withdrew.

Nice and willing to help the students if they look for it. As long as you do the problems he assigns on the book and attend class you'll do just fine. We did all bad on the last 2 tests and he ended up curving the class. Make an effort and he will too.

He lectures just as well as callam and his exams are much easier than callam.  I took it at night so the class was small and laid back.  He gave a 5 minute break in lecture, which is nice considering some other night profs I have had do not give breaks.
I took 252 with him 2 years ago and his class was probably the second hardest class I have taken at OSU. I studied so much for this class and got a C
oh...  man.....  it's so so so way too hard.....   don't take this class unless you are a chemical engineering major....   otherwise useless.....

Perhaps one of the best professors I've had here. He's very, VERY clear, and his tests were fair. Group quizzes were very nice. O-chem is hard, but he made the hardest of the series very bearable. We stuggled to finish the syllabus, but we did complete it, and I don't think he went too fast. Show up to class and take notes and you'll do fine. Final was comprehensive, but easy.

His teaching methods are decent, but he has a nasty habit of testing for mechanisms and reactions that he did not stress rather than the ones he spent 95% of the time on.  He teaches a lot of mechanism, only to never have you show that you have learned it.

ok... this dude...very rude... First of all, in front whole class, i mean that big ass chemistry lecture hall, he called several students "STUPID", he did one of those cynical laughing RIGHT IN YOUR FACE, most important facts, average is way too low. When i do took his class, average was 40%, when other class was 80%, and those number true!!

I enjoyed the Ochem series with the exception of this class. He was very hard, I studied everyday, went to office hours, had study groups and I still got a C in the class. He was by far the hardest prof that I have had here at OSU. He does seem unapproachable, but once you go talk to him hes really nice. He teaches 252 like H252 so becareful.
He was very good.  Tests are easier than Callams and teaches just as well.  If you go to OSU, you will have to deal with the language issue all the time and learn to get past it.

Great professor who enjoys teaching.  Never called our class pathetic (perhaps because we weren't), and knows a ton about organic chemistry (esp. organometallic chemistry).  If you want to learn ochem, you'll have no trouble with TVR.

Babu was the worst chemistry professor I've had so far at OSU, and NOT because of his accent -- it was because of his huge ego. Called the class pathetic numerous times. Not approachable. The average on the tests were 40%. And don't tell me that's because OChem is hard. Callam does much better.

Dr. Babu was the most dedicated Organic Professor that I have had. His clarity was excellent and his accent is not an issue at all. The exams were all very fair, that doesn’t mean you can just blow it off, but if you study and do the practice exams you’ll be fine.  I would really recommend this class to anyone scheduling for 252.

two words: ack sent. The near inaudable accent and unusually fast pace make the class a challenge. in addition, he refuses to slow or repeat things. I know Organic Chemistry is a fast paced class, but hes making a footrace into an Indy 500. My adivice, buy or barrow a recorder so you can at least have some idea of what hes saying. PS. ACCENT!

Babu presented the material clearly and was very knowledgable about organic chemistry. The quizzes were challenging, but the exams were pretty fair without any major surprises. His practice exams were very helpful and he often related the chemistry to real life situations. If you have a choice, take this class from Babu.
Better than some ochem profs, but you can find better. The two midterms were fair, final he threw some random unimportant things on. Wait and take Callam if possible
He was a pretty good professor.  He was clear and helpful.  OChem is just a really fast moving class.  Tests are like the practice ones.
I thought he was a great teacher. the practice exams really help out for preparation for the midterms. You just need to read the book and and do a lot of work at home but I thought he was great.

Duh people. It's ochem. No class is going to be easy. There's a ton of info, and it goes fast. But that's just how the class is. He's a pretty good professor. He tried to make it as painless as possible.
This class is tough.  I would recommend taking another prof if possible.  There was a nice curve for the final grade.

He's not that bad.  His tests are very similar to the practice tests and he tells you everything that you need to know.  He goes right along with the book and if you do the practice problems and understand them you will be fine.

He went way too fast! The quizzes and midterms were unfair because there was just too much info to memorize.  I took him because I didn't want to take Fraenkel...now I don't know if that was a good decision.  Overall, he's not that bad of a prof, just a little rude.  My TA for this class sucked though.

He dosn't really lecture, just stands by the board and writes down equations.  He also expects you to know every little thing (ie 64 chemical equations for the second exam).  He's kinda rude if you ask questions, and he goes really fast.  Don't take him.

summary_comment: Dr. Lindert is highly regarded for his genuine care and availability outside of class, though his lectures are sometimes seen as dry and move quickly. Students appreciate his thorough explanations and willingness to help, and he provides valuable advice for exam preparation. While some find the lectures less helpful than other resources, many commend him for making a challenging subject more manageable.

Ratings.comment: He's a really nice and great person, just not an amazing lecturer. He moves on pretty quickly and always says things like "we won't go over this, it hopefully won't be on the test, I'll let you know" and then tells us the day before the exam to study it. He is accessible outside of class and replies to emails and holds office hours though.
Enjoys teaching and helping students but lectures tend to drag on and gave by far the most homework of any professor.
I found that going to lecture was not as helpful as it could have been, as I felt like the slides were just read and not more fully explained than the book was doing.

Dr. Lindert really cares about his students and that shows in his lectures. One thing I really wish I did was go to office hours more, so take advantage of those! He does his best to help! Try sitting at the front if you can; it can help minimize distractions. Familiarize yourself with the content before class via the textbook and homework.

Dr. Lindert's lectures are slightly dry, but he seems to care about his students and does his best to make sure you are prepared for the exam. The material is slightly difficult and the chem department sucks, but Dr. Lindert made this class better. He gives great practice exams.

Dr. Lindert does a good job teaching this course. His lectures are specific and efficiently convey the information. Utilizing the textbook with his lectures is most optimal for success. He is always available outside of class if you need additional help and does a good job giving advice on what to study and know for exams.

Professor Lindert provides good advice before the test and is willing to answer any questions you have. Reading the chapter before lecture or watching the supplemental videos will definitely help you understand the lectures and material better.

Doctor Lindert is easily one of the best professors I've had. He genuinely loves answering questions, explains content thoroughly and in a way that can be understood, and really cares about the students. He would extend deadlines for the whole class if someone asked. He made a difficult subject a little easier.

Dr. Lindert is the most incredible professor I have ever had. Yes, this class is tough, but that's just the material. Dr. Lindert's lectures are very clear and he closely follows the textbook so it's easy to follow along. Dr. Lindert truly cares about his students, going above and beyond to patiently explain the material. Highly recommend!!

This class was the worst experience of my entire life. Lindert is not a good professor for general chemistry. His lectures are very brief, and he flies through them. Then youre expected to basically teach yourself college level chemistry. For the love of god, do not take him for general chemistry if you have the option.

He loves chemistry and is v. knowledgeable, but it is also clear that he does not want to be teaching introductory chemistry. His lectures are very bland, and after about 30 minutes it is hard to stay awake. He will skip things, and you won't know until youre taking a midterm and get a questions that is impossible to answer. Responds to emails ASAP

If you have the chance to switch, do it!!!! worst professor I have ever had. His lectures don't make sense and he goes so fast. Had to teach myself everything and read the textbook cover to cover in order to pass. Gen chem is a weed-out class for everyone regardless of professor, but literally do not choose Lindert if you have the choice.

This class is awful!! Not only is professor Lindert super confusing in lecture, but this class is structured horrifically by the chemistry department. The exams are extremely difficult and represent nothing at the same level of the recitation activities or homework. DO NOT TAKE IF YOU DONT HAVE TO!!
Would not answer questions, tests were way harder than any of the homeworks or practice exams, had 30+ assignments due ALL ON ONE DAY, not quick ones either. class average for tests was around 50-60%

He was average at best. When students were confused he would just rehearse the material he already stated and wouldn't go into more detail. Sometimes even got mad at students when people were asking lots of questions because they were confused. His lecture was decently organized but the class as a whole was disorganized. The class was interesting.

I would try to find a different prof for 1210. Does not describe any concepts in detail, and notes are lengthy but repetitive. Seems like a nice enough guy, but did not conduct a learning environment that was helpful to me.

This was a tough course. Quantum chemistry isn't intuitive, so you definitely have to go to lectures and spend time doing practice problems. Exams are challenging but manageable if you prepare well. Lectures and slides were pretty clear though. Office hours were helpful, and he'll work with you until you understand the concepts.

This class was kinda annoying. The material is not interesting. Also the tests were kinda stupid,  but he does curve like a champ. Side note, if you aren't a chem major, you'll dislike it even more because you'll be surrounded by chem majors, who are mostly arrogant melvins

It was an annoying class. The assigned textbook was totally different from the one he used for lectures.. ended up having to buy both. In tests, Lindert hits certain topics really hard and then ignore some altogether. Tests were poorly written and grading seemed overly harsh. He is a nice enough dude but I disliked this class a lot.

This was his first semester teaching so there were some bumps.  For example, it took him three midterms to figure out how to write a balanced test.  He focuses on derivations a bit heavily in class and in homework when they weren't really on any of the midterms or finals.  He may change this up next semester though.

This class is challenging but that's mainly due to the material. It's physical chemistry so it's not gonna be easy. You definitely have to go to lecture and recitation to understand and even office hours. Some exams were really tough and others weren't so bad. It was his first time teaching before and he did a pretty good job.

summary_comment: Dr. Spinney is known for making Organic Chemistry II challenging, with a focus on independent study and practice. Students find his lectures rushed and his handwriting difficult to read, but appreciate his responsiveness to emails and willingness to adjust the course based on feedback. However, the grading system and expectations are often unclear, leading to frustration and difficulty in tracking progress.

Ratings.comment: 2 weekly papers @3pgs each, charts etc don't count, 1.5 space. 2 projects @ 5pgs same rules and easier to use the ACS template to get a decent grade. guidelines for exam and projects are very unclear what is expected and what needs to be studied. Comments were very poor and very late. finished 1/2 graded material before receiving first grade back.

He had a few redeeming moments, but overall not the best. LOTS of quizzes, and a lot of it was over stuff not really covered. Problem sets had no answer key, and more reading than really necessary. Had moments of tantrums. He tried a new grading system, which is what I went on in Carmen for grades, and turns out that he didn't keep that up to speed

OChem is hard, but Dr. Spinney has made the class exceptionally easier to pass. The only downside is that there is a small quiz every lecture, and those determine what grade you get. You DO have to do a lot of reading, but it's better than having midterms. Spinney is also just very understanding, and he does a lot for his students. Loved him!

Ochem is a tough class but Spinney made it easy. Yes, his lectures are fast and his handwriting is terrible, but he draws his quizzes directly from his own website which is very understandable. He responds INCREDIBLY fast to email and is very nice outside of class. He listened to feedback and changed the course several times to meet student needs

You have to read the textbook, and he assigns things over content you haven't gone over in lecture. Hardly ever explains things, can't read his handwriting, goes very fast. Doesn't use the online grade book so figuring out what you have is nearly impossible. 85% of your grade is tests/quizzes. Occasionally curses at students. Avoid at all costs.

Lectures on slideshow, illegible handwriting, rushed, doesn't explain or work through any problems. Problem sets don't have answer keys. Exams and quizzes are difficult, but expected. Didn't curve very much at the end, so study hard and often or you'll have to repeat the class like me. Good luck with Richard...

Spinney expects you to do work; read ahead of time, do practice problems and stop by office hours at least once in the semester. His questions are straightforward without any tricks. Also if you didn't do well in OChemI(less than a B) don't take this class with anyone you'll fail no matter who you have. Go back and retake the first one.

No matter who you have for O-Chem II, it will be hard at Ohio State. Dr. Spinney, though, made it tougher. His lectures seemed rushed, and he didn't provide solutions to the problem sets. The averages for the three exams were between 36-55%. Be prepared to invest a lot of time into this class. Do the book problems and go to TA office hours.

Insists on using Smart Board to lecture however has illegible handwriting and doesn't understand that he needs to wait a few seconds after he's done drawing to let students catch up before going to the next slide. Lecture almost feels rushed compared to Callam's or Paul's class. Doesn't give practice exams or solutions to problem sets. Book>Spinney

Honestly surprised at the level of hate for Dr. Spinney on here. He is very helpful if you pay attention or ask questions. The level of work is certainly intense for a 3 credit hour class but it forces you to learn the programs and do the work. Follow the rubric and you will get very good grades.

So far I've only been in class a week. He is terrible. His class so far very easy, but he decided he was going to save us money at the very last second after everyone already had a textbook and decided that we all needed some program called Owl that we can only get from cengage and requires the purchase of a brand new textbook that is identical.

This guy really likes to use the "information from nowhere" teaching style.  I took his Organic chemistry class and pretty much everything was approached in the worst way possible. the book is useless, his lectures are useless, everything i learned i learned independently. he once gave us an assignment on the wrong chapter and made us do it anyway
This guy was a terrible lecturer. He spun his head more than he gave useful information... Irony

he's a decent lecturer, and his exams aren't too terrible. very helpful if you go to his office hours, ALEKS helps alot. read the book, do the practice problems. it's a lot of work, but if you do it, you will do well in the class. he actually cares about getting students to pass, not just about teaching the material.
His tests and quizzes are fair. ALEKS helps greatly! You have to work, but if you do, you will have no problem.
Always helpful when going to office hours. Aleks really helps with comprehension and lectures are interesting.

Labs are the only thing in this course that will help you alot. his quizzes are time consuming on recitation days so dont expect much out of recitation grade, but he lets you "replace" 2 quizs and then does drop lowest quiz, midterms- STUDY, Final- Study harder, if you do this you might hit B to B+, dont miss class at all... or you will fail :)
Great instructor but you must read the book. He has an online program that helps with everything covered in class. He doesn't waste time though so DO NOT fall behind.

It?s not worth it? In my opinion he should be sent back to Canada (Even Canada doesn?t deserve this monstrosity) or the darkest, deepest part of any ocean.   I?m yet to meet a student or even a professor in the chemistry department who has anything good to say about him.   Some day it will all catch up to him?.

I went into the class expecting to learn a lot from which a laboratory setting couldn?t achieve but found myself more confused and disappointed than ever. I learned more in Dr. Kroner?s 541 P-Chem class in a 2 week assignment that I ever did in Dr. Dicks awful 10 week Computational Chem class. Avoid this so called ?professor? at all costs.

Words don't explain my hatred for this d-bag.  I took his "advanced? Computational Chem class and it turned out to be the biggest mistake of my undergrad chem degree.  Not only was he the worst teacher I?ve ever had, but in my mind he?s the worst person I have ever met. Con't

Computational Chemistry. He's the only prof teaching this, and it is HARD!! Averagely 6-7 hrs on each weekly assignment, once he even told us to do 2 assginments at the same time. The amount of work is horribly big! But pretty helpful, and fine lectures as well. My suggestion is better not take 644.

Dr. Spinney is a great professor. His lectures are clear and the examples he does really help to make the concepts clear. The only thing is, he expects you to do some ACTUAL WORK! Chemistry is a hard subject and to do well you have to work hard. He is more than fair. Take him if you want to actually learn something.
Horrible teacher ever..he enjoyed making everything hard and difficult. never take any class with him.

Not a horrible guy, but he expected students to know the material every well, esspecially early in the class when it should all be review from highschool. His lectures are pretty clear and full of examples, but the multiple choice tests are challenging for alot of people. His Canadian accent drives me crazy in lectur

The only reason I gave him the "2" for Helpfulness was for the one time in class he said "eh" (he's Canadian).  That really helped me through my day.  As for Chemistry?  I wouldn't bank on too much from him.

This professor did not make things simple. He expected you to know everything as soon as the words came out his mouth. He seemed to think he was the smartest person out there. Did not seem concerned with actually helping students learn. The tests were extremely difficult, and then he would get mad when everyone failed. avoid him

Putting this much effort into a first level chem class is just plain crazy. On top of the standard work done for chemistry, he had us do MasteringChemistry, which was no help whatsoever and took three hours to complete each one.  He talks down to students and is extremely unclear when asked questions.

This dudes is the epitome of the devil. Listening to that stupid Canadian accent of his at 9 in the morning made me want to blow my brains all over the wall. I worked too hard in this class just to get a freaking C+. Avoid this guy at all costs unless you want to get a crappy grade. I went in loving chemistry and came out hating it with a passion.
Horrible lecturer, doesn't care about students and whether they pass or fail

Dr. Spinney is a fair instructor.  The work is not a burden if you stay caught up with the material and do everything within your ability to understand the material.  Dr. Spinney was responsive to my questions and his website is a very valuable free resource for learning the material in conjunction with the book.
Horrible lecturer. He slammed the door in my face when I went to ask him for help before the final. Doesn't seem too interested in helping and the class is quite difficult also.
Horrible lecturer. He slammed the door in my face when I went to ask him for help before the final. Doesn't seem too interested in helping and the class is quite difficult also
terrible!
His notes don't help at all.

i worked my ass off for this class, along with everyone else in here, and the current class avg. is a 35% out of all the possible points thus far, with one week left in the quarter. lectures are so useless. quizzes absolutely can't be completed in the 20 minutes youre given and the midterms are horrendous. he seems like a nice enough guy though.

very very good teacher.. midterms are not bad at all if you put the time into studying. it's a fast paced high school class with a lab. nothing to stress about- this is who you want for 121 NOT loza and esp not zellmer
Lectures are useless, he would put things that haven't been covered yet on quizzes.  Try to avoid him
Great professor. Clear lecture and very interested in helping students.

summary_comment: Dr. Sokolov is highly regarded for his excellent lecture delivery and comprehensive lecture notes, though his problem sets are challenging and time-consuming. Students find his approach to the subject matter clear and supportive, with fair assessments and helpful recitations. However, some students have noted issues with accommodation during absences and the lack of practice exams, which can make the workload feel overwhelming.

Ratings.comment: His lectures are amazing. Both the lecture notes and how he articulates them. He writes amazing, yet tedious, problem sets that take the concepts learned in class to the next level.

Dr. Sokolov is a fantastic professor. Physical chemistry is not easy, but all of his homework and exams are very fair. As long as you attend his lectures, the course is manageable, and he is more than happy to help with any questions you might have.

Pchem was incredibly hard. Dr. Sokolov made it much better. There is a super large curve and weekly homework. The recitations are very helpful as well. I found the exams much harder than the homework and the final was rough. Overall, I thought he was a good professor.

When I was out with COVID, sokolov did not accommodate me and told me to read the textbook because he did not have any video recordings and would not record his in person lectures. This left me in a hole that I had to dig myself out of all semester. He doesnt care how you do in his class, and you can tell by his lectures

Pchem as a whole was terrible but Sokolov made is okay-ish. Lectures were dry but the lecture notes were good resources for studying and completing homework. I wish there were practice exams so my studying could be more focused. My biggest problem with the class was that homework took so long and each assignment was only worth 1%.

Pchem was actually an enjoyable experience with him. It's still pchem, so you need to put forth a decent effort for a good grade, but this class was actually not impossible, surprisingly. Most exam questions were similar to homework/quiz/recitation problems. Final was hard, though. Decent curve at the end. TAs were very helpful. 10/10

summary_comment: Dr. Hadad is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and strong commitment to student success. Students praise his clear explanations, accessible approachability, and the use of pre-made PowerPoint slides that enhance understanding. He emphasizes the importance of studying past exams and problem sets, and is known for his willingness to meet with students outside of class. However, some students have found his exams challenging and have criticized his grading practices.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Hadad is one of the best chemistry professors I have had at OSU. He cares a lot about his students and is straightforward with his content. If you practice the problem sets and do the past exams you will ace the exams. Also, Dr. Hadad is great with making time to meet with students outside of class and office hours. Utilize this!

Dr. Hadad made chemistry much easier due to one unique thing: pre-made PowerPoint slides. This was such a relief since I was used to scrambling down notes. There was a solid curve, but attend class, ask questions, and most importantly STUDY PAST EXAMS AND PROBLEM SETS. I'd recommend Dr. Hadad to anyone!

Dr. Hadad was an amazing Professor. Although he lectures using PowerPoint slides, this allowed me to focus on the content rather than scrambling to scribble every last mechanism down. He is extremely approachable and makes you feel comfortable. Whenever I couldnt make it into office hours, he was always willing to schedule an outside time. Great!

OChem is a hard subject - be ready to put in a lot of work. He explains concepts clearly, is knowledgeable and friendly. Read the textbook and notes before class. The practice exams are very helpful. Stay after class to ask questions, he enjoys helping students and wants you to succeed. Textbook was confusing, materials by Klein were helpful.

Awful. Simply reads off of power points in lecture which helps no one. His exams are extremely difficult and he gives absolutely no partial credit. He also does not make it clear what he is looking for and makes an effort to trick you on exams. There is no curve - only a slight grade shift.

summary_comment: Dr. Herbert is an exceptionally knowledgeable and passionate professor, particularly in electronic structure theory, but his teaching style can be challenging for some students. His classes are demanding, with complex material and dense lectures, yet he is very supportive during office hours and genuinely cares about student understanding. Students find his exams tough but fair, with significant curve adjustments, and highly recommend the class to those willing to put in extensive effort.

Ratings.comment: Very interesting and dynamic guy. His exams are very challenging and really test your ability to apply concepts to new situations. He was always willing to help, and if you attend his office hours and ask questions it is very easy to be on top of the curve. I would not recommend trying to slide by without doing max effort

Dr. Herbert really knows his stuff and is very passionate, the only downside to this class (electronic structure theory) is that it is only half a semester. There was a LOT of material and dense slides, but too little time to really get into the meat of things. It wasn't an easy A, but Dr. Herbert really cares if you understand. Final was fair.

Impossible course! Herbert was difficult to understand in lecture and not much help in off hours. Even the TAs couldn't help with the long, impossible homeworks. Exam averages were in the 40% range (no equation sheet). Cumulative final w/ no direction. AVOID!
Prof. Herbert is excellent. He is super enthusiastic and funny. Most importantly, he loves chemistry, so he knows his stuff. I would highly recommend taking a class with Dr. Herbert.
Incredibly genius but really hard class.  Only take the class if you're willing to put in many hours every day.

Prof. Herbert is a physical chem GENIUS. He is not, however, the best lecturer out there. Actually, he's probably one of the worst.  He goes off on 30-min tangents, argues about politics in class, etc. You'd be better off doing things "in the comfort of your own homes."  Take this class at your own risk and go to your T.A.'s office hours!

He doesn't know how to teach. He explain things in a way that only students who have finished taking this class would understand. I personally find doing some outside reading is more helpful than attending his lecture. He's probably too smart to teach a general chem class.

Very enthusiastic and funny professor, if a little odd.  Does great demos. However, his class is the hardest I have taken so far. His tests were very difficult, but the grades were curved a fair amount and the TA office hours/recitations were incredibly helpful. Only take this class if you're prepared to work extra hard and be challenged.

Herbert's very passionate about what he does, and I love that, but he's one of those people who's so smart, it's hard to keep up. One tip I have is GO TO OFFICE HOURS, either his or the TAs. I went to see him and he sat down with me and went step by step through the process. It's the bane of everyone's existence, but it helps you learn to study.

This professor was awful. He made a gen chem class into a complicated theoretical chem class. Furthermore he spent class time ranting about random stuff we didn't need to know and then he would lie about the format of the midterms and make us derive equations. He made the simmplest things complicated. I don't recommend this professor

This class was the bane of my existence.  Prof. Herbert makes the subject impossibly difficult and treats lectures as time to ramble about chemistry instead of time to teach students.  Every day I wanted to quit, but I needed the class to count as a GEC so that I could get to take only three science classes in college.

He is a good professor but doesn't know how to teach. He goes on tangents and always says "I will let you look at that in the privacy of your homes." He has the most unfair exams. Avoid taking his class or switch to 121 if you can.

Professor Hebert is an intelligent man who is a very good researcher and physical chemist, but he isn't the best lecturer. He will often spend an inordinate amount of time on trivia, but is good at covering the math behind chemistry. He was ill-prepared in writing our second midterm, and does not explain very well what you should review.

Dr. Herbert is very entertaining in class and very passionate about what he does. He students to do well in the class but freshmen chemistry students could never live up to his high expectations. He teaches mostly chemistry theory and doesn't focus on the practical part of Chemistry. For those who want to challenge themselves, a good professor.

Very hard to understand, very technical in terms. Changed style of midterm last minute, and provided practice midterms that had absolutely nothing in common with the actual midterm. Funny and enthusiastic about the class however. REALLY LOVES PHYSICAL CHEMISTRY. has odd fitting pants, especially around "that" area =/

Horrible professor. Goes off on tangents about probability distributions and focuses all aspects of chemistry back to Physical Chemistry, which is just one branch. Tests were ridiculous and homework assigned did not reflect anything we talked about/had in the textbook.
Entertaing. Professional. Difficult but not impossible. Reccomended, highly reccomended if you are interested in physical chemistry, that is is slant on gen chem.

The most difficult class I'll ever take. Disregard the earliest comments for this course as he has obviously changed it a lot and made things MUCH HARDER!  Even as an honors student, I struggled just to survive!(ended up with a B). Class averages were ridiculous. I failed 5/7 quizzes, both midterms, and got a 70% on the final. Do not take this prof

The hardest general class professor on planet earth.  And perhaps any other planet that may be out there.  Way to smart to be teaching Gen Chem.  If at all possible take someone else, however, he is pretty funny and a works better one on one.
This class is crazy hard! Very difficult to understand, although if you study non stop you would end up with a C+. goodluck!
complete jerk... he makes class hard just because he could
He's too smart to teach a watered-down chem class so he is hard to understand and follow.
Very passionate about chemistry and always has a demo to make lectures fun. He's also pretty straight forward about what to expect for exams.
He is one of the best professors here at Ohio State.  He made chem 121 crystal clear.  Tests are very fair, not tricky.. Just work hard and you will do well

Dr. Herbert is a terrific lecturer and more than helpful outside of class.  My advice: Work your tail off to get good homework scores because his exams are unbelievably difficult.  If I got a B, you can too!

He's AWESOME!!The BEST chem professor ever!!I failed this class last quarter and HATED,seriously HATED chem. But when I retook it w/ Herbert,I actually started liking it!He keeps the class entertained all through lecture.He is great at explaining important chem concepts.Take good notes in his clas.Sit in one of the front rows and go to office hrs.

summary_comment: The professor is perceived as fair but not particularly effective in his role as a teaching assistant, often failing to provide explanations or answer questions during labs, and known for being very detailed and strict in grading.

Ratings.comment: Very fair TA. I liked how straightforward he was.

Had him as my Lab TA, wouldnt explain anything. It would be lucky if he had read our lab manual that day but you cant ask him questions because he doesnt know. Super picky but wont explain anything. Has said many times that he would take away more points on labs if he was allowed to.

summary_comment: Dr. King is highly regarded for her extensive knowledge and willingness to assist students outside of class, though her lectures can be challenging to follow. Students find her approachable and fair in her assessments, despite the demanding workload. While some find her classes overwhelming, many acknowledge her effectiveness in covering complex material and achieving fair evaluations.

Ratings.comment: I actually took a year of grad level Biochem from Dr. King (which was not a choice above). She is very knowledgeable, her classes require a great deal of work, but she is fair and readily available outside of class. One of my very top professors at OSU.
Difficult to follow in lecture. Just save yourself the trouble and teach yourself.

I can't believe this is being allowed by Ohio State, they should be ashamed that their are being represented this way.  You have to just short of genius to have a chance in this class. To all you who have her in the future.  You will need more than luck!

Dr. King really isn't as bad as past reviews have made her out to be. Chem 101 covers A TON of information and goes really quickly. She is approachable and wants to help. Going to lecture is the best way to keep up. Labs are not especially easy, but midterms, quizzes and the final are fair, not easy but fair.. got an A but definitely worked for it.
This class is rediculous, She has been teaching Chem so long that she has lost her ability to convey basic material to new students. Yes, she is intelligent, but she is a horrible teacher!!
it was a hard cours

I personally liked Dr. King.  She was a good teacher and I think that she did cover a lot of hard material.  The tests and labs can be difficult at times but if you keep up with the work load and attend class you should be fine.

This was way to difficult a course for an introductory 101 class. I would be completely lost in lectures to the point where i quit going and would teach myself the material. It took time, but worked a lot better than sitting through the lectures.  She covers a LOT of material very quickly, so don't let yourself get behind

GOOD TEACHER! i don't know what these other comments are talking about.  Pay attention and you will do fine. Keep up with the work, go to lectures and study for each quiz. She does care about her students and gives completely fair tests and quizzes with most questions coming from lecture.  recommended!

She is very nice and can be funny at times, however when I was in lecture I had no idea what she was talking about half the time.  I would be lost in lecture, but when I went home and read the book and taught myself it wasn't that bad.  Lectures are kind of pointless because she expected you to already know what she was talking about.

She was an awesome teacher! She was really interested in the material and made sure that students had visual aids to what was going on. If you go to lecture, get the study guide and practice, and put the effort in the class, you will get a good grade. Good teacher!

Dont understand all of the bad reviews. took this class 1st quarter fresh year and managed an a-...if you go to class, read the book, and study a little everynight you should be fine. She is very approachable but you must make the effort.
She is a horrible teacher! She is not very clear, and she just doesn't care about her students. Avoid if you can!
I thought she was interesting to hear, but ultimately I don't think she really cared. I wish her class were easier.
Ugh, not a good teacher, and the in class quizzes suck.

This teacher was horrible!!! Worst teacher ever. She doesn't care about anybody, teaches stuff you aren't even tested over. I went to lecture, and it was a waste of time. Just go over her practice midterms. She doesn't have a practice final, so you're screwed there. The only thing that will save you is the curve!

Lectures were pointless but because of lack of attendance she decided to give pop quizzes every week, if you were even one minute late to class you most likely already missed the quiz. I learned everything from my TA and from the book. Take online practice exams!!!
please do not take her she is honestly the worst professor ive ever had does not care about anyone or if anyone learns anything! Never have i failed a class until now, please avoid this TEACHER! ek!

King is horrible. the TA chem room is not open during examn week so if you need help go early in the quarter. you might as well teach the course to yourself. i went to lecture but never used the lecture notes. take anyone but king.

In my opinion, this class was ridiculously difficult for being an introductory course. I had never taken chemistry before in my life and I was constantly lost. Dr. King moves very quickly through topics and expects everyone to pick up on all the material covered very quickly. Thank goodness for the curve...
Unorganized! She jumps from topic to topic. Not bad once the curve is factored in....

Basically, you're expected to enjoy chemistry.  This class is a lot of work between labs, quizes and exams and it's taught as though we all love chemistry as much as her.  If you have to take chem 101, you might just have to deal with her, just read the book and don't bother with lecture.
i felt like charlie brown, moves way too fast but i think that goes for the whole department.  i passed but she docked my class cause we did too well on quizzes and labs.

I had 2 choices for this class, take the notes before and fall asleep during class or understand nothing she was talking about and just frantically copy notes. Absurd amount of notes, but the practice exams are almost identical to the real exams.

This class was very difficult if you did not keep up and spend a couple of hours each night going over what you learned. Got an A, but spent a lot of time in the tudor room, very helpful!! Lecutures were worthless as she just read her notes. she does not make herself available and looks down on her students. She expects chem.majors!Moves to FAST!

This class was rediculous. The lectureswere just irrelevant. Her accent and the fact that she moved to fast, made it difficult to follow lecture. TOO much info expected to learn for a 100 level INTRO class. TA was O'Renick. Spoke english but when asked why you structured a equations they way you did,  said, "I dont know, its just that way".

worst prof i have had. I taught myself better than she taught.  got an A- in the class when i should have had an A cuz she changed my 180/180 quiz points to 140/180 since everyone else did so bad. I guess the people who actually know what they are talking about get screwed
Yes, she is very boring. I never went to class because I found the book to be more helpful. Her tests are fair and almost exactly like the sample exams on her website.

Does lecture strictly from notes available online.  Moved through one chapter per week.  Frustrated with lack of attendance at lectures and lack of student preparedeness at time.  Frequently threatened a "pop" quiz in lecture, but never followed through.  Tests were fair, although you need to keep up with the recommended homework problems.

I took 101 to get refreshed in chem before moving on to the 121,122,123 sequence... big freaking mistake, my 121 class was actually easier than her 101.  Someone needs to explain to her the concept of a 100 level course.

Her class is very boring and I have fallen asleep everyday.  With the guided notes online it is pointless to attend class because nothing new is ever added.  I would rather get two extra hours of sleep in my own bed rather than in her lecture hall.

This class covers WAY too much for a 100-level class.  Her lectures were models of unclarity, and she didn't seem to want to help people at all.  There were several times that someone asked a legitimate question in the review and she just told them where to find it in the book.  Uh, your job is to TEACH, not tell us to go read the book.  Avoid!

Ohio state chemistry is not cool at all.  It's not easy, clear, fun or interesting.  If you do have to take 101 you should make sure you get a good TA, one that speaks english. (you will rely on recitation to pass).

The chemistry department prides themselves on screwing students over. i can understand a 500 level course being tough but not a 101 class in which 90% of the kids are not ever going to use chemistry. she is horrible.
She is a terrible instructor!!!!!!!!!!
No Comments
So not cool or caring!

This class isn't that bad, despite what everyone says about it.  I stopped going to lecture after the third week of the quarter (don't do that!) and I still managed to get a B+ before the curve.  Study for the quizzes and TAKE THE PRACTICE MIDTERMS!  They're almost identical to the real thing!

She should just keep sailing her boat around the ocean instead of making our lives hell. She outright yells at us when we don't answer her dumb questions. She thinks she is the best because she grew up with the metric system. There is no way around her because she is the only lecturer for Chem 101.
i feel bad for you folks. i made it out alive this past fall with a D in this class. it sure doesnt seem like an intro course to me. her accent drove me nuts!

she teaches based on the assumption that you have read the text when you come to lecture.  but when i read the text AFTER lecture, i understand it, and STILL HAVE NO IDEA WHAT SHE's TALKING ABOUT! keys to this class: SKIP LECTURE, READ THE TEXT, ASK THE TA QUESTIONS, DO THE SAMPLE EXAMS AND HOMEWORK
Was not an easy class, not sure if it was cuz of the professor or cuz it was chemistry. If your looking for an easy introductory class, this isn't it.

This is the type of class where either you get it or you don't.  If you get it, then the class isn't bad and you won't have a problem getting a good grade.  If you don't, well, the most common thing to do is blame the professor.

She is teaching a 500 level class to us! Its crazy. She tries to rush in so much stuff and talks way to fast. Her lectures are pointless, just as long as you do the homework,labs,and recitation youll be fine. Her tests are very difficult though and I recommend going to the TA's for help.
Dr. Kins knows her stuff, but she is teaching a 500 level class in a 100 level course.
lectures are a little pointless, she moves too fast for me. TA's are extremely helpful. know how to do all the homework problems and you'll do fine on the exams.

quite enjoyed the class thought the labs were hard but interesting tied back to stuff taught in class. Defiantly go to lecture and recitation, should be easier for those who took chemistry in highschool first half really easy second half need to study harder but hey thats college for ya

This class is definately harder than any I've taken before. Her website is a little helpful but thats about the extent of it. Read the book as much as possible!  Youre definately better off teaching yourself, but use all the resources available.  P.S. the labs suck!
SHE SUCKED!!!!  she refused to help me out with several questions i asked throughout the quarter...maybe she should go back to europe and leave us alone

This was easily one of the hardest classes I have ever taken.  Dr. King cannot teach to those of us who are not ****in chem majors.  I cant stand that lady.  your going to need more than a sample exam, your going to need jesus christ himself to pass this class. **** dr king
I thought her lectures were boring and she talked way to much about her personal life. My TA barely spoke english so I had a difficult time learning from him.

The most boring monotone and scrachy voice ever!  Likes to brink up her child hood in Germany and lover for Chemistry.  Painful to put up with.  She is an avid sailor, why she told us this I don't know?!?!?  No reason to attend lecture just get help from TAs the day before the exams.

this class was kinda difficult and then the 2nd midterm came and it was like a whole other class. it was nothing like the sample exam (the first midterm was exactly like its sample) and it was by far the hardest test i have ever taken.

She makes the class more boring than it already is. She is also rude at times. She yelled at me in front of the whole class on the microphone for not picking up a test she never told me she had! Maybe she teaches 101 better.

I really liked her as a chem prof. she definitly knows what she's talking about and her TA's are helpful. Do the homework that she assigns and do the practice exams, the exams are exactly like it. I would definitly recommend her for 101.

Her notes were horrible. She couldnt quite make it interesting. She has a hard time teaching to students who are average or below, she just cant seem to get on their level, but she does know what she is talking about, so you should prly go to class
she was pretty hard, try to go to her office hours bc she was helpful and definetly go to the computer lab it has a lot of practice problems like the ones seen on quizzes
Avg. test scores are a D- so be prepared! Her notes are ok, but a little old fashioned. I would read the book too because her notes aren't always good enough for the test. Overall, it's ok.
She was a decent teacher but her notes sometimes did not cover what was on tests. Go to her office hours and the computer lab for help.

this teacher is snippy when you ask questions (even at REVIEW SESSIONS), her voice is annoying, her notes are extremely bad (who writes on overheads anymore...) and do not cover material that we're tested on. i don't recommend her for organic chemistry.
This class was extremely boring.  Her voice is so monotone that people dont show up to class simply for that fact.  Not very hard to get a decent grade.
the first prof i have had that seems like they want you to learn the materail! very clear notes, very good lecturer! makes chem fun (which is a hard thing to do)
Lectures are clear, tests are fairly easy, and she cares if you understand the material.
Her lectures are very clear and she really seems to care about whether or not you understand the material. She makes chemistry fun!

summary_comment: Based on student comments, Professor Coe is widely regarded as a poor instructor, struggling to effectively communicate complex material and often relying on PowerPoint slides without adding significant value. Students found his lectures unhelpful and boring, and many expressed frustration with his technical incompetence and failure to address grading errors promptly. Overall, his teaching methods and content delivery were criticized, leading to low class averages and high dropout rates among STEM students.

Ratings.comment: He messed up everyone's homework grade and I emailed him twice about it to which he basically said it is what it is. It took everyone flooding his email to realize that he actually did make the grading mistake. Did not appreciate that he did not bother to check after either of my emails. Lectures were not helpful, use book and practice midterms.

Dr. Coe is extremely intelligent and knowledgeable. However, he struggles to teach what he knows. He's a better researcher than a teacher, even 1-on-1 in office hours; he is bad at understanding questions and answering directly. If you take Chem 4300 with him, you better hope you get a good GTA that can actually teach you. The textbook carried me.

I did not enjoy Dr. Coe as a professor. His lectures were very boring and he seemed to not know the material very well since he heavily relied on the lecture slides and often quoted the slides word-for-word for a majority of the lecture.

Not understanding. Not good at technology, but uses top hat in every lecture even though he struggles with it. Did not get through all the lecture material for the final, and admitted to never having looked at a test (he doesn't make the tests). Class average is almost 20% lower than other chem sections. :( made me quit stem

Coe is one of the worst professors for 1220, his averages are consistently lower than every other professor. He is technologically incompetent and regularly gets confused by the chem taught in the class. his lecture questions are graded for correctness and are part of your recitation grade.

Dr. Coe is the worst professor Ive had in my life. He reads directly off of slides and gets confused on every third or fourth slide. I am slightly concerned if he even knows that he is a teacher. Our exam averages were between 50-60% which is 10-15% lower than the overall average. The fact that he is a professor at Ohio State is embarrassing.

Class was taught completely from powerpoint slides, Dr. Coe released a book he wrote for the class specifically with a lot of MATLAB code. It was hard to understand a lot of the verbiage that comes with quantum and it wasn't well explained. Thank god for my TA and a generous curve.

Horrible professor, doesn't know how to teach general chemistry or he just doesn't care. Would start 5-10 minutes before the actual lecture start time. He just read off power point slides that read exactly what was in the text book. Class averages were significantly lower than the other Chem1220 classes. Lecture attendance is 5% of recitation grade

It is very obvious that Dr. Coe does not want to teach Chemistry 1220 so if you get him, I recommend switching sections. He often confuses himself on his own problems and has typos in his powerpoints and TopHat questions. He uses TopHat to take attendance every class so make sure you attend.

James is not a good professor. He took a subject that I genuinely enjoy and made it miserable every class. Most professors that are as bad as James, you can skip their lecture and go to another, but he takes attendance so that people will actually attend. Still only 2/3 of the class show up. 0/10 would not recommend

Dr. Coe is a nice guy, and cares about how you perform in the class, but he is terrible at teaching. He reads directly off of the powerpoint slides, never explains concepts, and gets annoyed if you ask him questions. He really tries his best to make class entertaining, he's just not very good at is. If you struggle with Chem, don't take it w/ him.

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!! It is nearly impossible to learn from him. He directly reads off of his slides, and never clearly answers any questions. You would probably be better off by just reading the book and doing every practice problem by yourself, but TopHat points are a thing.

Dont take this class. Ive never struggled so much during a course that so many people before me have enjoyed. Our class average is much lower than the other classes. My favorite quote of his was I dont really know how to teach this. Youre better off trying to teach yourself through the textbook because no one understands what hes saying.

I have never had a professor or high school teacher as incompetent as James Coe. He just reads over the slides and gives no resources that help me learn anything whatsoever. Our class averages were consistently lower than the overall average. Even if the class starts at 3 AM with a different lecturer, it would be worth it just to avoid him.

Extremely difficult to learn from. He seems very smart and is good at what he does, but he can't explain anything to students who are learning this for the first or maybe second time. Lectures are pointless to attend as you won't gain any info from them, but attendance is mandatory. All my learning was done outside of class.
worst teacher i have ever encountered. i gave him a chance and tried to just learn from him, but he is extremely bad.

Pchem is a really hard class. Coe does an okay job of laying out the material. Most of the class is learnt by googling for better explanations on wikipedia, youtube and other sources. Make sure to learn the math for the class before you take it cause he doesn't go over those much. His exams are relatively easy and the curve is generous.

Had Coe for 1220 and 4300. He was pretty alright for 1220 but tbh if you read the book and do the hw you should be fine. He is an excellent 4300 professor, probably because he is much more passionate about p chem since it's related to his research. His 4300 class I believe is significantly easier than others, where hw is 27% of the grade

First Chem class at OSU. Exactly what I expected. If you've taken the class before as AP Chem, (which sometimes will cover the topics in this course) or if you read the book, then the lectures are a good mix of explanation and helping you apply concepts. Likes making poor puns, and may not be 'super-cool', but teaches well and is very kind.
Great guy, outstanding teacher, easy class as long as you read the textbook.

Dr. Coe never completes lectures and never completes the example problems and does not post the answers online. He always messes up while doing the example problems. His lectures are terrible but you have to go to get attendance points. You have to teach yourself everything from the book. He is terrible.
He copies example problems onto the board from a notepad. The copied work is normally incorrect and questioned by somebody in the front row. Very unfortunate lecture to have.

Frequently doesn't complete lectures and thus you have to learn super difficult concepts as well as complicated math equations with no help. When asked to post the answers online he does not reply. I'm convinced he doesn't realize that he's even teaching a class half the time he just shows up. Solves example problems incorrectly more times than not

He was probably the worst teacher I have seen in my student life. Come on, he was giving Wikipedia reference in a grad class. This was probably the Nadir of teaching. No sense of humor, he doesn't know what to teach. He even wasn't clear about the stuffs. I got an A because of myself. But in the end he was a nice person and I appreciate that.

Terrible lecturer, very boring. He reads slides that came directly from the book. Better off reading the book yourself. Continuously trying to raise his test average but keeps decreasing the amount of questions on the exams. If we don't cover something/not explained well, you're on your own.

Tests always have problems and abysmal pass rates. Class averages are frequently failing on exams. Doesn't teach and just reads off of slides which are posted online. Refuses to acknowledge when a question is worded wrong and someone asks a question about it it is always "just a typo" even when it is just him not understanding the problem.

Very very rough class. I would say that the course itself is pretty difficult overall, regardless of the teacher. I would recommend taking it with some easier classes, as this is the kind of class that requires alot and I mean alottttt of time studying independently. If you're confused after the first week, I would definitely recommend just drop it

Very dry, boring lecture. Extremely low scores on tests but didn't seem to make many adjustments. Reads straight from the slideshow (which is taken directly from the book, i. e. none of his own teaching).

This class is a complete waste of my time.  He goes through his lecture slides so quickly, it's almost impossible to follow and take notes.  So be ready to read the textbook to teach yourself.  He does not work through any problems, they are just written on the slides.  He constantly confuses himself, stops, and then skips the topic completely.

Professor Coe is more concerned about advancing his career than he is about teaching students. His class is a waste of time as he reads off the slides and constantly gets confused mid-sentence and ends up completely ignoring what he is talking about and then moves on to another subject. The lectures are confusing and he is often rude and arrogant.

Be prepared to sit in lecture and stare blankly  as he flies through slides because he is 2 weeks behind on his syllabus. Recitation quizzes are on stuff that you haven't gone over. Test averages between a 50-60% because he doesn't do any practice problems in class, just gives you the answer. Have fun teaching yourself everything.

Doesn't realize that his students don't know chemistry as well as he does. Unwilling to explain problems and expects you to completely teach yourself with no guidance whatsoever. He flies through slides so it's not even worth going to lecture. He cares way more about his current research than teaching this course which he hasn't taught in 20 years.

Coe does not understand how to lecture in an efficient manner. He has you do homework on lessons you haven't even studied yet and is constantly behind schedule. 10/10 would say don't take. He is a joke.

Coe makes PChem relatively easy. While he may have a strange policy with homework covering concepts before lecture, the answers are all out there. He recycles a lot of problems from old exams so find an older friend to help you out. The class is intimidating at first but gets easier as the semester progresses.

first off, I'm a Chem-E, not a chem major.  had P-Chem with Dr Coe, absolutely horrible class.  homework is 8-10 hoursweek, with weekly quizzes in recitation.  3 midterms and a final; hopefully you have old exams because it's about all that will save you.  averages between 60-70%.  final is very difficult and cumulative.  use TMP chem videos

Has pretty easy tests and quizzes (problems from book), lecture PPTs directly from book examples, great TAs. Talks a lot about lab, which is pretty good. Was a bit harsh and egocentric about his research in office hours. The easiness of this prof. might be a detriment to your grade; our class average was higher than normal and is being curved down.
He's a good professor; his exams are VERY fair. No trick questions. Same for the quizzes. One annoying thing about him is that he would call people out if they left early -_-

Dr. Coe is very smart and knows what he is talking about, but he is a very dry lecturer. He reads straight off of his powerpoints (which get posted to Carmen). Quizzes and tests are very reasonable. Good teacher for someone who already has a good understanding of chemistry

Quizzes: book practice problems (or he'll tell you if from the PWRPNT) Exams: like practice midterm questions- straightforward- no "trick" questions. Coe is an enthusiastic teacher who helps explain labs before you go into them so you know what to expect. He has easy-to-read PWRPNTS & does demos in class. No FAILING class averages l
Does not teach.  Spends entire time talking about labs.

I read the previous reviews before the quarter started and everything said here is true.  His exams are not too difficult and as long as you study the practice problems in the book, the quizzes are a breeze.  He can be a bit arrogant when answering questions that he finds to be elementary, so it's better to just study the text for understanding.

Lectures are pretty much pointless to go to because he puts the powerpoints online and you can read them yourself on carmen. The quizzes are easy though if you do the practice problems in the book, and the labs are much easier than regular 122 classes.

It's pretty much pointless to go to his lectures. I would of done better if I had just stayed home and studied the powerpoints he puts online. He talks about his labs for half the class and when he does talk about the material he reads his powerpoints directly and takes all his examples from the book. However, the labs and quizzes are easy.
Lectures Pointless, but quizzes and labs simple, just study the book problems and you will do fine.

Coe isn't the greatest lecturer, but he isn't that bad. Study a little bit from time to time, beat the average on the homework and quizzes and be at the average for the exams and you got an A. Easy as that.

Oh boy, where do I start from here....Dr. Coe can't teach. At all. The material is all in the powerpoints, but Dr. Coe just speeds through them as if his students were in grad or prof school. You have to learn material on your own, especially for the difficult homework problems. Avoid him at all costs if you can, this is a nightmare for me. Period.

I went to half of the first lecture and decided to listen to people on here and not waste my time. I studied the book for a couple hours a day and made my own notes to study from and ended up with an A-. Lab was absolutely ridiculous.

The worst prof I've had at OSU Beyond the fact that his tests are unfair, labs stupid (and not stupid easy, just stupid), and grading really is random, his lectures are worthless and he is the most arrogant prof I've ever had (tells you how many papers he's published just to make himself feel good). If everyone wasn't failing i'd be even more pisse

Before I took this class, I stumbled on this page, and thought, well.. maybe it'll be ok. He has low ratings, but I can pull through. I am only doing decently, because everyone else is doing horribly also. I don't know what to study for his 1 midterm final;Basically, if you don't feel like heeding this warning, best of luck to you. I hate this man.

Lectures are basically useless, he rushes through reading his slides. Usually attempts to answer questions by simply re-reading the slide. Occasionally puts unfair questions on exams. I would advise studying the book hard and reading the lab material well in advance, but much of the lab grading seems luck-of-the-draw anyway.

Writes his own labs that have little to do with class material.  Do not bother going to lecture, as he only talks about the labs.  His exams do not reflect the material he teaches in lecture, so study the book.

He won't answer questions in class, expects too much from a general chemistry class and focuses way to much on his own work and doesn't teach the material for the CLASS. he reads off the projector, so don't stand infront of it on accident. and his labs are so demanding.this class is NOT for slow workers.

He's the most unfair, unhelpful, rude man.
