He won't answer questions in class, expects too much from a general chemistry class and focuses way to much on his own work and doesn't teach the material for the CLASS. he reads off the projector, so don't stand infront of it on accident. and his labs are so demanding.this class is NOT for slow workers.
Coe is so bad he makes me want to cry. His lab was us making green goo. He is terrible. I would rather drop out of school than take this class.
Smart man....terrible professor. Dont even bother going to lecture, just read the book

If there was a score below a 1, this guy should get it.  Such a terrible teacher.  Literally copies the textbook into PPT, and lectures on it.  It's pointless to attend the lectures.  Goes on and on about the labs for 30-45 minutes.

What everyone is saying on here is right. Its really pointless to go to the lectures. he posts the lecture notes but you dont even need them. I was lucky enough to have two wonderful TA's, I would suggest going to any review sessions offered.

Horrible professor. I went to lecture before the first midterm and got a D on the first midterm, didn't go to class at all for the second midterm or final and got an A on the second midterm and (crossing my fingers) will get an A on the final too. I'm either getting a B+ or and A- in the class. Just read the book and look for practice tests online.
Smart, but not a good teacher
He's obsessed with the experiments and by the time he actually starts the lecture, you're already falling asleep wanting to leave... but then he'll cal you out for leaving!

If I was required to take his class...i would just drop out of college.  That's how bad he is.  Ezah shut up...he's that bad.  All he does is talk about his stupid research and loves the lab experiments.  WHY?  In a nutshell, he's god awful.

Coe proved very early on that he has a superficial understanding of QM. To get an A just memorize everything he gives you. Also be aware that he displayed the entire class' grades in lecture three times and even sent out the final by accident twice. Also he dresses and looks like a turtle. Poor turtles.

Suffice it to say - he doesn't even know that he is a theoretical chemist.  He told the class he was an experimentalist.  If he doesn't know that - teaching us Quantum is hopeless.  He earned the nickname turtle in my class.  Suffice it to say - Turtles should not teach chemistry.
He basically reads the textbook to you and goes off on random tangents about his irrelevant research.

I'm not sure where to start. Prof. Coe definitely knows his chemistry, but he can't teach for jack. Lectures are copied straight from book, he blabs on about HyperChem and "the triumphs of molecular orbital theory." Don't ask questions outside the field of analytical chemistry, as he "is not an expert in these areas" and says he can't answer you

Boring and useless lecturer, asks questions on exams about topics that are not covered in class until 2 weeks after the exam, when asked a question in his "office hours," he will defer you to his GTA saying "Joe can probably explain this better" (not a one time thing), easy enough class if you read (ahead in) the book.

DO NOT GO TO LECTURE! PERIOD. read the book, it will serve you much better. i must agree with the earlier sentiments. i don't think he understands what this course is supposed to be about. also he does not like to help during office hours. try to survive. beat that average on EVERY exam because he gives VERY few A's (much less than in H201, H202)

Absolutely useless as a professor.  As stated by classmates, he has no idea what is going on...about anything.  Tests were blatently ripped from previous teacher. PPTs blatently ripped from book (exact quotes, images) and, of all things, wikipedia.  Tests had nothing to do with the class, the book, or the lecture.  In short, a joke of a prof.

By far the worst experience I have had in college so far.  The lectures are absolutely useless at best and his tests have completely unrelated questions (not in notes, lecture, or book).  Bumbling Idiot is a perfect description of him during lecture.  He doesn't know the material he is teaching and he tells you, but it still appears on the test.

Two words describe him: Bumbling Idiot. I concur with the previous statements. The tests cover things he tells us he doesn't understand, and isn't in the book. Class is useless. The lab portion is the only fair part of the class because it is run by TAs. Get a good TA, or drop the class.
USELESS for gen chem.  If you get him, you're better off skipping lecture and reading the book.  Likes to insert random stuff from his research into tests/lectures; relevant or not.

Worst teacher ever. I am not given enough characters to voice my utter disgust with this man's ability to teach but I would like to say that if you are going to have to take a gen-chem class from him, drop the course and get another teacher.  By far the least helpful teacher @ osu.  If you must take his course, get friendly with a TA and your book.

Do NOT take for Gen Chem. He  has less of a clue than most students and the TAs. His lectures consist of him copying slides from the book, so you might as well just read it, you'll learn more than listening to him. His tests cover anything thats not the norm from the book. If you like to watch HyperChem or ab initio calc., you will love him. :(

Survival guide: Do the homework-useless but graded easy Quizzes-easy, don't worry too much. Exams-1st:Easy. Just study the old one. 2nd: Deviates more from study exam, make sure you have several old MQ2 exams since he is lazy and doesn't change much. Final exam: Hardest of the three, no tip offs, just try to beat the average!

The labs take FOREVER to write up. They are also very vague, and the lab in general is pretty disorganized. Coe really isn't anything special, but he would disagree with that if you asked him. The best part about the class is the final quiz - it's easy.
No Comments

In general, he's pretty good.  He was the best teacher I had last quarter.  But that's not saying a whole lot I guess.  The worst part about the class was the homework.  It was WAY too long.  The tests were ok. Pay attention to stuff in the lecture, and the problems he makes up in the homework.

You can smell this guy's ego, he puts his thesis in his lectures. Lectures are nothing but slides of calculus derivations and provide little help in understanding some very difficult concepts. Homework is not only useless but be prepared to spend 10-15 hours on problems you'll never use. His saving grace is very easy exams.

The class was very hard and took lots of work, but everything to do with the lecture was easy.  The prof practically told you what would be on the quiz and all you really had to do was show up.  The lab reports take forever!!!

Very very very hard class. There is a lecture once a week for the data analysis, but for the experiments you are on your own(i.e. you don't know what the hell you are doing). Most experiments are very simple, but the write up for the lab report would want to make you to kill yourself.

Decent lecturer, very dry and usually quite boring (especially at 8:30). Homework was ridiculous and routinely took ten hours a week, which is doable if you don't have other classes that require a similar amount of work. Buy the solution manual for the text.

summary_comment: Jeremiah is widely regarded as an exceptional TA, known for his dedication to student success, willingness to go above and beyond to help, and high standards that ultimately benefit students. His teaching style is praised for making complex material accessible and for his personal commitment to ensuring students understand the content. Students consistently highlight his patience, knowledge, and genuine care for their success.

Ratings.comment: Jeremiah is hands down the best TA I've had at OSU. He made an incredibly intimidating class approachable and answered many stupid questions of mine. I haven't met any other TA's or even professors willing to bend over backwards to help you succeed quite like Jeremiah will. The only downside is his atrocious taste in music (country....barf).

Jeremiah is a GODSEND!!!!!! Literally the only reason I passed chem. He has high expectations but will go to any, and I mean ANY, means necessary to help you. If you have Jeremiah, you're pretty much set up for success in chem <3

Jeremiah literally met with me personally every single night for two weeks before my final exam to make sure I was up to speed on all the content covered in class. He is the most caring TA out there and even gave me some great life advice :) he is incredibly knowledgeable and bends over backwards to make sure his students succeed.

Jeremiah was my TA this semester and is a genius and a great teacher. I wish he had been actual professor because he made sense of lectures that were extremely difficult to follow and bent over backwards to make time for me when he didnt have the time to give. He genuinely cared about my success and did whatever necessary to help me achieve it.

Do whatever you can to maximize your time with Jeremiah. Compassionate, invested in students' learning, knowledgeable, personable, and quite frankly genius are all understatements when it comes to Jeremiah. All I can say is take advantage of your time with him and you'll learn immensely and make a great friend.

Jeremiah is the model of what all teachers should be. I felt that he sincerely cared about my success. He would explain things many times over until I understood. He was always willing to extend his office hours until everyone was helped. He is also very knowledgeable about the material and knew exactly how far to push us to present a challenge.

TAKE HIS LAB! He makes a miserable class so much better. He always answered every single one of my questions (...I had many) and was always willing to have a quick Zoom call at the drop of a hat. He uses hilarious analogies to help you remember things. He is very talented at explaining things at a gen chem level without oversimplifying the material

Okay, so if you have Jeremiah, be prepared because his expectations are higher than other TAs. It's frustrating at first, but then you realize that he's doing it because he genuinely cares and wants you to succeed. He sets his bar high, but he will bend over backwards to help you achieve it. He is great at explaining material in an accessible way.

Jeremiah is probably the best ta in the chem department. He explains with a lot of analogies and won't stop until you get it. He grades really tough so be prepared to work hard and ask questions. He's really approachable and doesn't slap you over the face with his intelligence and belittle you like the professors do. He is kind of loud, though.

summary_comment: Dr. Gopalan is widely regarded as an exceptional professor, known for his deep passion and expertise in biochemistry, which he effectively communicates through engaging and understandable lectures. Students appreciate his kindness and availability, though they note that his exams and quizzes are challenging. Overall, his teaching is highly praised for its quality and effectiveness, though students advise to expect rigorous assessments.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Gopalan is great and so passionate about biochem. His lectures are generally interesting and engaging because he wants you to understand the connections between things. Super kind and helpful if you have any questions. His exams and quizzes are tough though so be ready to study.
The midterm and the lecture were good. But the final is so hard.

I wish i was as passionate about anything as Dr. Gopalan and Dr Jackman are about RNA. Their passion for the material is contagious and my only regret is not having the ability to take more classes with them.

Easily the best professor I've had here at OSU. Unbelievably good grasp of the material, and does a fantastic job of breaking it down into concepts that are easy to understand. Some of the most challenging material and exams I've ever taken, but I've never learned more from any one class here. Would recommend 10 times out of 10

Dr. Gopalan is a great professor. He was very informative and really knows how to get his message across. That being said, his class was more difficult than I thought (which a lot of ppl didn't tell me smh). There are only 100 points in the class so if you fail something, you better hope you don't fail on another thing. Good luck!

Venkat is probably the best professor at OSU, no exaggeration. He is the most organized, fair, and helpful professor I have ever had and it's not even close. He is extremely smart. Lectures are very important, make sure you attend. His practice exams are also extremely similar to exams. Study your lecture notes and ask any Qs and you will do great.

Dr. Gopalan is by far one of THE best professors OSU has to offer. He gives fair exams and is VERY lenient with grading. He breaks down metabolism so a 1st grader could understand it! Go to his office hours if you're confused, and he will get you to understand the material. HE IS AMAZING! Do anything you can to get him as your professor, trust me!

BEST PROFESSOR EVER!!! I really enjoyed his lectures. I was so close to drop out my major, but my hopes were restored after his class. He made metabolism so easy. He breaks down every concept, and builds on them back up. I really enjoyed him.

Easily the best professor I have ever had. His lectures are very engaging, and he is incredibly passionate about teaching. Great sense of humor. He will remember your name forever after hearing it once. Midterms are tough (but fair); you will receive the grade you earn. Go to every class, chalkboard notes are super important and show up on tests.

The best professor I have had at OSU.  His exams are very fair, but not easy at all.  he expects you to both know the material, and be able to apply it.  His lectures are great spending time both on his ppt and on the chalkboard.  He grades everything himself and gets stuff back with in 2 lectures.  Take this class!

Gopalan was 1 of my favorite professors at OSU. His test do require extensive knowledge, he provides you exactly the information you need to pass in class. That being said DO NOT miss any classes. Although he uses slides, most of the exam topics come directly from his chalkboard notes. Also, the class offers very few points, so every point matters.

One of the best professors I've had thus far at OSU. It is obvious he cares about teaching and about his students. Very knowledgeable about the subject matter but is still able to break things down in a way that is easily digestible. Midterms have been straight-forward and straight from his notes, which also means skipping class isn't a good idea.

By far THE BEST PROFESSOR I've had at OSU. He breaks down every detail and builds them back up. His exams are very clear, and very very fair. Also calls enzymes the pac-mans. Study his notes,the concepts he highlights, as well as know all pathways forward and back, and this class will be a breeze. It is obvious he loves teaching.

Dr. Gopalan is BRILLIANT. Truly cares about teaching students and getting to know them.  His lectures are SO clear, and he always tells you exactly what to expect for exams/quizzes. No ambiguity. If your answer is not what he was looking for, but is plausible, he'll accept it. Taking detailed lecture notes is critical. Loved the class!

Amazing teacher with interesting and clear lectures. Attendance is crucial, and you'll definitely need to take notes. Tests are fair but difficult, and hope for a late final date because the amount of stuff you learn is ridiculous. All in all really great class - you'll learn all you ever needed/wanted to know about metabolism!
wow really great professor, actually used chemistry to explain biochem!  not judgemental at all and very helpful esp in office hours.
AMAZING PROFESSOR!! I learned more in his class than any other course I have taken at osu. This man could coherently explain cellular metabolism to a small child.

Alright professor! Not helpful at all. I was doing really well in the class till the final. The final which was comprehensive consisted of enormous amounts of information to learn, which is ridiculous! also the final was much more difficult than the midterm! He also managed to cram a lot of info at the end of the quarter, which i feel is isnt fair!

Gopalan was a good professor. He explained things very well and made class interesting. The format of the class is not conducive to learning, so I literally outlined all the chapters we covered in detail.  If you just attend lecture, and dont study anything else you will probably get a C unless you have a photographic memory.

He was a really good lecturer, but his exam questions were harder than scholls. they were harder for technical reasons.. every other question would have 3 choices and A+B, A+C, B+C, as the options... that got tricky and it sucked
He's interesting and easy to listen to, but his tests are ridiculous.

He's an excellent lecturer. He can keep the interest and cause more than 1/2 the class to show up. He's the king of analogy, which do help. However,his questions on the midterms are a lot of times over obscure details you'd most likely skip in the book or notes.Lecutre outlines were useful. I'd say take him, he's good and it's not a murder course.
He's pretty funny and clear on the notes, but the midterms and final are RIDICULOUS.  There is so much detail about all the notes, its impossible to keep it all straight.  Better than Scholl though.

hated this class. Pretty much the most boring thing ever. The Bio department is so unorganized, and having two prof makes this so  much worse. Gop's exam questions were the most obscure points ever from his notes. I hate it.
you will pay attention more and learn more by taking Gop over Scholl. hes just that more interesting and funny and u will at least feel awake in the class rather than falling asleep in the other guys

Gopalan has such a thick accent that its painful to listen to for a long period of time. I fell asleep every lecture because it was so boring, so I stopped going to lecture. Midterm and final were really hard. I ended up getting a C in the class.

He's a pretty good professor, a little louder than he should be sometimes (and has somewhat of an accent, though it doesn't affect his clarity at all). Definitely go to his review session before the midterm; it was really helpful. He's a LOT better than the other professor we had for the class (Dr. Randy Scholl, aka Mr. Rogers look-alike).

summary_comment: Dr. Bernice Opoku-Agyeman is known for her strict and unclear grading criteria, often taking off points for minor errors and being difficult to approach for clarification. Students find her lectures challenging to follow and her grading harsh, though some appreciate her care and desire for student success.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Bernice Opoku-Agyeman is what made me hate general chemistry. Her grading criteria is unclear and when approached with a problem she will have an attitude.

Rubrics and criteria are not specific. But bernice will choose to not pick every small detail of every report you submit. Even if the rubric doesn't mention something bernice will still mark you down for it. Also she is very hard to understand and very vague when try to contact her about important information.

Bernice is probably the hardest grading TA at Ohio State. Her grading criteria is non-existent and she will take off major points for every minor error she finds. As someone who is not an English professor, she certainly grades like one and will rip apart your lab reports. Lab is the hardest part of 1620. Not a fan of Bernice.
Dr Opoku is very caring, she wants her students to do well. She went very quickly through lecture and could be hard to follow at times.

summary_comment: Dr. Schilk is knowledgeable about chemistry but faces significant challenges in delivering effective online instruction, with students finding her labs disorganized and her online quizzes difficult to manage. While some appreciate her passion for the subject and find the class manageable with sufficient effort, others criticize her teaching methods, citing issues with organization, lack of support, and unhelpful demeanor.

Ratings.comment: I had Dr Schilk for Chem lab, and in person she is so nice and super helpful. She would go around and check on everyone multiple times. Her online labs though, are atrocious. VERY disorganized and complicated. She does not set clear guidelines or deadlines and refuses to reopen missed lab quizzes. Do not take online with her, you will want to die.

Dr. Schilk knows the content. However, she has become very lazy in her methods of teaching. She has no ownership over her homework, as she now outsources a company to create online homework for us. Labs are made last minute which creates stress on us as students to complete pre lab, post lab, sapling and study for quizzes/exams every week.
Very rude. Not very helpful at all. I wish I had a better advisor...
Fairly easy class. Dr. Schilk isn't the best professor, but you can tell she loves what she teaches. Exams aren't that bad as long as you take the time to study and keep up with the course work.

Dr. Schilk clearly knows her Chemistry, but is not helpful whatsoever in lecture. Constantly bragging about how "easy" chemistry is. Her power points only show the easy questions. It probably would have been more helpful to visit the TA's on a weekly basis.
She is a great professor! The people who give her bad ratings are most likely the ones that don't go to class or study hard enough. Chem isn't easy, but she does her best to make it easy as possible
Not helpful at all. Very selfish
This women is awful. Rude, inconsiderate, high on herself, terrible person and supervisor. Doesn't care about the students.
She's amazing!
I loved Dr. Schilk!  She was really friendly and passionate about chemistry.  She was always willing to help.  I'm not a science major, but even I didn't find the class too excruciating.
She is a energetic teacher and really helpful. However, the quizes of this class are really hard. I don't know why she gives us so difficult quizes.

She is great in lecture and does love Chemistry - very entertaining. But, her quizzes are very difficult compared with the easy practice problems she goes over in lecture. Labs were easy, and exams were not bad. Just the quizzes could be killer or out of left feild.
She's very helpfull, its usually a bigger class but if you talk to her during office hours she is very helpfull.
Terrible. You can tell she LOVES Chemistry but she constantly contradicts herself and present material in a very unorganized manner

Her teaching style was great.  I understood everything she said in lecture but quizzes were a different story.  In lecture she always showed the easiest problems and then the quiz would have a problem of much more difficulty.  It would have been nice if she had just shown us the more difficult problems in class.  I had no trouble with the labs.

This was a difficult class, but she was very, very helpful. She even stayed after class to help students with the labs. She truly loves to teach. She comes up with fun ways to remember material and tries her best to simplify the difficult stuff. She provides you with equations that other lecturers make you memorize. AWESOME TEACHER!

summary_comment: Dr. Wysocki is perceived as a knowledgeable researcher but an ineffective professor, often rushing through complex concepts and spending excessive time on simpler topics, which left students behind and with insufficient time for exam review. Students found her lectures slow and unhelpful, and she was criticized for changing requirements for online homework and failing to adequately address student questions. Despite some positive feedback regarding her care for students and availability during office hours, her teaching methods generally received negative reviews.

Ratings.comment: A talented researcher, but sub-par prof. Would fly past complicated/important concepts or not include them at all while spending ridiculous amounts of time on easy ones. We were behind every other section leaving no time for exam review. She also constantly changed what was/wasnt for credit on the online homework

Although she seemed caring about her students, she seemed to not completely know the material herself. She would often come to class and if people had questions about the material she sometimes could not answer them there. Also was extremely slow and always made the class behind leaving no room for review, especially on the simple things.

Besides holding regular office hours, Wysocki did nothing above average to help students succeed. We often got behind in lecture, and I did not find the lectures to be very helpful. Exams were difficult, but average for the chem department.

Dr. Wysocki wasn't my favorite professor, but I thought she cared a lot about her students. Her lectures were slow and we got behind but I would go to her office hours and she would work problems one on one with me. Chemistry is hard but I thought her exams were fair and she gave practice on Carmen as well as many special office hours on weekends.

Wysocki was a very lazy "teacher." She went through the material way too slowly, putting us behind in other classes, then frantically throwing material needed for the final at us. She didn't provide us with any resources to prepare for exams. She doesn't teach you how to do anything, she expects you to read the book then asks how to do a problem.

I know all chem courses are difficult, but Dr. Wysocki didn't make it any easier. All she did was give practice problems during lecture where we should have been learning the concepts. Practice problems can and should be done on your own time. She also went very slowly, making us skip many sections in lecture. Exams are extremely difficult.

summary_comment: Dr. Kohler is an effective and knowledgeable professor who excels at explaining complex chemistry concepts, making challenging material more accessible. While his lectures can be somewhat dry, he is highly approachable and willing to help students through office hours and detailed problem sets. Students consistently praise his dedication to ensuring their success, though they note the importance of thorough preparation and engagement with the material outside of class.

Ratings.comment: Such a sweet professor to have for a hard class; truly motivated me to get out of bed to go to his class :)

Professor Kohler can be a little awkward in his lectures but really does know what he is talking about and will definitely help you understand if you ask questions. Office hours are really helpful too. We relied a lot on the book in his class, but the exam content was all reasonable and from lecture. Overall, he is a great professor.

This class is really great for students who want to know a little more about Chemistry. The class is challenging but nothing is too hateful as long as you do the readings and problem sets. Dr. Kohler is a really great professor and does his best to make sure that you succeed.

Dr. Kohler is great at explaining concepts during lecture. Go to his office hours, especially if you have questions about a problem set. The exams are not too difficult, but definitely not easy either. As long as you read the textbook, do practice problems, and ask questions, you will do fine in this very challenging class!

A great professor. Excellent at conveying the material to you, and very helpful in office hours. Be ready to share his fascination with the "particle in the one-dimensional box," and if you know what's good for you, do the practice problems. Pay special attention to the examples he does in lectures, because very similar problems show up on exams.

Chemistry is hard, and taking honors gen chem doesn't make it any easier. Dr. Kohler's lectures are usually interesting, but not always super engaging. That said, he's GREAT at explaining the content. Lecture workload was minimal, but you need to put in the time (do the non-graded problem sets, go to office hours, etc) to do well on the exams.

Your grade in this class depends on your past. Did you read the prerequisite chapters recommended by the syllabus? Did you do the practice problems? Have you taken AP Chemistry? Professor Kohler speaks to a higher level. You need to know the material well before lecture to really get it. If you're not ready to do the prep, you'll drop or fail.
real nice guy

It was a hard class.  Usually freshman take this and it will open your eyes.  Study the lecture notes, read the book ahead of time, don't fall behind.  DO THE PRACTICE PROBLEMS.  They will help.  He's really funny and doesn't have any accent.  However, he goes VERY deep into the material so be wary.

Sometimes the material was way over our heads but Dr. Kohler tried to bring it down to our level again. He's a brilliant guy but never flaunts it too much. It's important to keep up with the homework and practice problems; they're essential to do well on the exams and final. Office hours are fairly helpful.
No Comments

I managed to get an A in the class thanks to Dr. Kohler's generous curve. As long as you make it a point to do the readings and go to the lectures you should be fine. I wouldn't really recommend this class for someone who hasn't taken AP in highschool. Overall, Dr. Kohler is a great guy and if you do what he says you should be fine

overall the class was pretty difficult. If you knew the lecture notes well you would do well on the tests and quizzes. I didnt really have to read the book all that much, only for the more complicated topics. As far as grades go he told us that 40% of the students would get some form of an A. I earned 883 out of 1000 points and received an A.

Managed to get a B+ with minimal work.  But when I did work, I did it well!  Lecture attendance is not necessary but you may want to attend class to keep up with notes.  That way you won't be up all night before an exam!  Dr.  Kohler definitely knew all he needed to know.  Interesting man.
A tough but not impossible class.  Kohler's sense of humor makes the class liveable, though he does have the tendency to skim through complex passages super-fast.

This class was very difficult and required a lot of work. Most people failed the exams, but the average was curved to about a B+. His office hours are very busy, but he does his best to be very helpful. Go to your TA's office hours, because nobody ever goes to theirs so you can have one-on-one help.
Bern was a good guy who knew a lot about chemistry.  He kept it real
Kohler's exams are pretty challenging, but he's very fair. Go to office hours to ask for help because he's willing to help you figure it out. I had to work  hard in this class but it was worth it.
very intellgen man, a good profssor
curve smaller than expected, tough class if u havent taken ap
Dr. Kohler's class was pretty cool... the huge curve helped too... very challenging, but well worth it.  He covered the material very well, and doesn't deserve a sad face on here :)
Very unclear...tests were over nothing that had to do with the book or lecture series. Very disappointing.
What hell!
Sell your soul before taking this class!

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his ability to simplify complex chemistry concepts, making the subject more accessible to students. While his classes are challenging, he is dedicated to his students' understanding, often staying after hours to answer questions and provide additional explanations. Students find his approach effective, despite the rigorous nature of his grading.

Ratings.comment: an amazing professor just make sure to go to class

I took 1220 and 2540 with him. Chemistry is hard but he made it easier to understand. He has a good sense of humor and definitely really cares about his students. He might grade hard, but he will always explain why. His class is difficult, but he is always willing to answer questions during lab and explain things at office hours.

summary_comment: Dr. Watkins is highly regarded by many students for her thorough planning and engaging lectures, which help students feel confident in the material. However, some find her exams challenging and potentially unfair due to unrealistic mechanisms. Despite these challenges, her supportive approach and extra credit opportunities are appreciated, and many students strongly recommend taking another class with her.

Ratings.comment: She was fine, but her exams were actually impossible. mechanisms were unreal. I would just take it with another professor.

I thought Dr. Watkins was an amazing professor. Extra credit was great, quizzes were good practice, and I felt the exams were difficult but overall fair. Her lectures are very well planned out and she is very likeable and good at helping students feel confident in the content. I would love to take another class with her. Her TA was great, too!

Dr. Watkins is truly amazing. I had her for my second semester of organic chemistry and she made me actually enjoy such a difficult course after orgo 1 left me feeling horribly about chemistry. She gives a ton of practice and advice before quizzes and exams as well. Her lectures do move quickly though, so pay attention! I would recommend her 100%.

summary_comment: Dr. Woodward is a knowledgeable professor who writes the textbook and cares about student success, often staying available during office hours. However, his lectures can be challenging to follow if missed, and the class pace is fast, making it difficult for students without prior chemistry experience. Despite these challenges, many students find him engaging and humorous, and some strongly recommend his classes.

Ratings.comment: Great lectures just make sure you go to them. It is very difficult to learn the content after you have missed lecture.

The lectures were boring and he frequently made errors on the slides. He knows a lot about chemistry but it was difficult to know what would be on the exam and some of the concepts were too complexly-explained  If I had not taken AP Chemistry, this class would have been very difficult. Hour-long homework after every lecture and on the weekends

If I did not take chemistry in high school, it would have been very difficult to succeed in this class. Errors on the slides he was presenting was common but he would change them during the lecture. He would give a practice problem or two on each section and would take questions which is helpful.

Dr. Woodward is an adorable guy. His lectures were not hard to pay attention to, and he wrote the textbook. He cares for student success and is very accessible during office hours. That said, his class is often rushed, to the point where my class was a unit ahead before our midterm. His hobbies are funny, and he cracks a bunch of jokes in class.

Woodward is the author of the textbook used but didn't know how to teach his work. My high school Chem teacher who was recovering from breast cancer did a better job and that's kinda sad for Woodward. There was no forgiveness for when the tech was deducting points on correct answers. It wasn't his fault but he bother to didn't fix it either.

The class is definitely fast paced, however Dr. Woodward is always willing to help if you need extra help. It's a lecture and test based course, but he keeps lectures as entertaining as possible. He is super kind and jokes as much as possible.

He was a good lecturer (and funny!) even when the material itself was tedious. He is very helpful in office hours and overall I think he is the best professor I have had this year. I would 100% recommend taking a class with him. Go to his office hours!

Dr. Woodward is a pretty good lecturer. He wrote the textbook, so he obviously knows what he's talking about. He can definitely be dry but does try to inject some humor and make the material relatable. Homework for me was an assignment after each lecture (2) and then a weekly homework. Took me about 3 hours a week on top of lab assignments.

Dr. Woodward has been one of my favorite professors I have had at Ohio State. The class as a whole is still very challenging, but Dr. Woodward is always accessible in his office hours to break down even the simplest question you have. I went to him countless times with questions of all different degrees, and he never made me feel dumb.

I personally loved dr. Woodward. I have him for Chem 1220 and he's a good lecturer and very knowledgeable. Not to mention, he helped write the book we use for this class. If you do the homework it's good prep for exams. I will say he does skip over some content at times that could pop up on tests or homework so be aware of that overall love him

I LOVED dr Woodward for chem 1220 (I took it with him during an off semester). He was so friendly, so accessible and wanted everyone to do well! He knows chemistry very well and even wrote the textbook. I worked really hard to earn a B+ after failing the first exam and he made the class so much more enjoyable. Highly recommend!

Dr. Woodward is very knowledgeable about his research/area of expertise, but not so much about the lecture material. He is better than the other professors available for the course, but not too great. His lectures aren't too informative either and tends to spend a lot of time on unimportant topics. Plan to study a lot outside of class.
Overall good professor. Go to office hours and he is GREAT at explaining things. Very personable. Lectures get kind of boring so stay focused. But other than that great.

He's a great guy, but he isn't a great lecturer. He skips over difficult questions and concepts, and missed a bunch of lectures. Apparently very smart, but Woodward doesn't seem to care enough to prepare his students for the extremely difficult exams that are not set by him.

Dr. Woodward was an well respected professor. His lectures were helpful but the most benefit a student can get from him are his office hours. Recitation was a breeze. Our  lab was based on perovskite research which he would willingly help with. I did poorly on one of the midterms and I still ended up with an A in the class. Read the book though!

Dr. Woodward takes a large class and makes it feel small. he does a great job of identifying what the class is struggling with and addressing it. He is often available and willing to help outside of class if needed.

Dr Woodward literally wrote the book we used. Lecture and homework lined up with it perfectly. He had an extremely good knowledge of what he was teaching but his tests are killer. All multiple choice which actually was horrible. Good luck

Dr. Woodward was awesome! He was very clear on what he taught, he had a lot of dry humor in his teaching as well. Exam averages are the norm (55-60%), but his class curved like 100 points when I took it. Highly recommend! He knows his stuff! (PS - He looks like Jeff Foxworthy)

Dr. Woodward is one of my favorite professors I've had at OSU. His lectures are clear and super helpful- he wrote the book so he definitely knows his stuff! You'll have to study to do well, but the tests are fair and he makes sure to include a lot of examples in class notes. I would definitely recommend taking his class if you can, great guy!

Generally cares about the subject matter and that the students are properly learning.  I found him to be very helpful whenever requested.  I also enjoyed how he would talk about how many of the concepts would be important for real life.

I hate chemistry.  I took it as a GEC.  With that being said, Dr. Woodward made it as not-bad as he possibly could.  He was crystal clear and was always willing to help.  He genuinely cares about students' understanding.  If I were forced to take another chemistry class, I would make sure that Dr. Woodward is the teacher.

He is a great teacher and lecturer in addition to be a really nice person. His lectures are easy to understand and office hours are very helpful. The exams are pretty straightforward. He covers pretty much everything in lecture so you probably don't have to read the book.

Do not take Honors Chemistry unless you know your****. People in the class are very talented and your averages are around 85%.  However, Woodward is a great lecturer, very clear, simple, easy to follow.  DO NOT READ YOUR BOOK, he is not familiar with it.  GO TO OFFICE HOURS.  Very helpful and nice guy.  I suggest taking 122 though.

He definitely knows his stuff and is particularly knowledgeable about the condensed states unit. He's a good teacher and explains things clearly. Only complaint is that he's not very timely with putting things up, (problem sets, quizzes, powerpoints) so get used to checking Carmen often.
Dr. Woodward is awesome! When I took his class, I genuinely loved going to lecture. He's that good.

Really nice guy, but not the best lecturer. Teaches the REEL section so beware. Is unwilling to help in email responses. A lot of the material covered in REEL is not in book so it is based off of his lectures which are not the best. Not as bad as Loza, but Pappas & Fus and WAY better. Really nice guy but not a great lecturer&tests were way 2 hard.

The most straightforward chem professor I have had. His exams don't cover things not gone over, unlike many chem professors. He was always willing to help during office hours and regularly attended lab.

Dr. Woodward is a great professor, and easily the best I had in my Gen Chem career.  He holds review sessions, puts out review guides, and gives plenty of old midterms to study off of.  You can email him and he'll actually respond, and he comes around during lab to offer help.  If you're deciding between him and anyone else, take Woodward!

123 with Woodward was one of my favorite classes. He's very knowledgeable as well as entertaining. His quizzes and exams were pretty straight-forward and he was always available for extra help outside of class.
Great guy, tough course.  He taught it well and was a delight in the classroom.  Exams were tough but fair.

Oh where to start... This class was a mess.  This was his first time teaching it, so it was waaay disorganized and confusing.  The labs were worse, some kind of research experience that DID NOT enhance my learning.  Very funny guy, super nice... but needs to prepare better for this class... be wary if you have him for 123
Dr. Woodward meant well, but this was his first time teaching the class. I was extremely disappointed. I think the phrase "Abandon all hope, all ye who enter" applies here.

Seconded. Very disorganized, uses lecture material from his 700 lv grad class and expects you to understand it all without any further supplements or help from a book. Extremely sporadic and unorganized when selecting lecture topics, posts homework solutions & handouts much later then promised, too late to be useful. Avoid for 123 at all costs.

DO NOT take 123 with this professor.  I'm sure for 121 he's fine but he is not suited for 123.  He didn't explain the material well and went way out on a limb into material that apparently you shouldn't see until the grad level, because it's stuff he researches.  Take 123 with Submeranian.
This guy is good at teaching.  Excellent prof. for a beginning chemistry course.
DOCTOR PATRICK WOODWARD IS A FREAKING GOD!!!! <3<3<3
The class was hard but Woodward was interesting and was helpful most of the times.  They could use better Tas in that department.
The hardest class ever but a really good professor.  He was always willing to help when you needed it.  The class was still REALLY hard.  Although I got a D, I partially enjoyed
Woodward was a great teacher, his lectures were interesting enough to keep you awake even when exhausted.  He was always willing to answer questions and even visited recitations to help.

woodward is the man. hes awesome at explaining things and his web page was really helpful for studying for exams. the take home quizes he gives are easy points. hes youre best bet for a good gen chem prof
He is one of themost interesting lecturers I have had, very clear and informative.  Labs are long, and tests are hard though.  He is probably the best gen-chem prof at OSU though.
didn't get a good grade, but that is bc i didn't study.  awesome guy, and i love how he played music as you came into class.

This class requires a lot of studying, but Woodward gives you plenty of old exams to practice with.  He is a very nice guy and always willing to help students.  His sense of humor is great.  Check out his website for his top 25 student evaluations, they are hilarious.
not good, ta's werent helpful.... they didn't know how to solve some problems on our homework
Very funny. Acts like a big kid who happens to be teaching. Tests are muliple choice.
Woodward rocks.
the class was hard and the letures boring

By far the best professor I've had at OSU... (and I'm a Spanish major) He is extremely willing to help, he even shows up in recitation and labs to answer questions. Chem 121 is a rough course, but if you have it take it: you want this guy! (plus-he's sexy!)
pretty good

Really good prof, and is always willing to help, especially during office hours. It's a MUST to go to class though, and his midterms are rough, but I won't say that the class is impossible, because it's def not. Great guy, and had a good taste in tunes.

I had Woodward my first quarter of college. Great guy, so nice, good lecturer as well. Nothing was going to get me to enjoy chem at the time but Dr. Woodward made a great impression on me. Helpful in office hours definately, and I loved how he played music as people were walking into class at 9 am.

His class is kind of hard, but he gives you old exams and that is very very helpful. And he is only professor who does that so I thank him for that. And even though his lectures are a little boring, he has cool demonstrations, like the hydrogen/oxygen balloons explosions.

fo sho! that boi be hollerin his chem all up in my grrrll. i be like "what be that ion thang" and he be like "holler it be a part of my atom" i was like OHHH SNAP. and btw his beats be so fresh he be playin before class. holla!
He is so hot and and awesome teacher.  He explains things very well, but his tests are kinda hard. (There's a curve)
great guy! go to office hours!

If you do the practice midterms, you will do well in the class because they are very similar.  Go to lecture b/c things that aren't in the book, can appear on the exam.  He can kind of babble a lot, but he tries to make it interesting.  He a good professo
Great professor, only one that makes an effort to know and remember you!  Great teacher and very helpful!!  I highly recommend him!
Comical teacher, neat experiments, tough midterms and final.  There are curves.
He did cool experiments and made class interesting. He is easy to understand but his tests are a little rough. Good teacher to have.
Great, funny prof.  Midterms and final are brutal, though.
Very good lecturer. Interesting and funny.

Chemistry is a biditch, but the key in his class was to actually read the book, which is easier than it seems. Doing practice exam with understanding helps tons. In addition with a good TA will get you an A, like me!
Awsome guy
A good professor. His tests are more than hard, but he gives a big curve overall. He knows what he is talking about and will really help you out if you are lost.
Great lecturer, funny, and nice to look at too.
Very helpful, good professor, knows what he's doing. Generous curve. Midterms are easy if you look at the midterms from previous years.
Doesn't teach well. Expects student to understand everything after just brushing over it. Teaches too fast. Midterms are nearly impossible. Will make you hate chemistry. Drop ASAP
Very easy to understand.  Makes class comical.  Do all the midterms from past years to do well on his tests.
awesome guy, easy to learn from, test are tricky be prepared
He was an amazing professor, the best I've had yet!  He taught very well, was very willing to help, and was truly concerned about students understanding material.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
more interesting lectures than expected.  be VERY prepared for the tests though.
Excellent chem lecturing, much less boring than most.  Hard tests, though.

summary_comment: Professor Forsyth is generally considered disorganized and difficult to follow during lectures, which can make the subject matter unclear. Despite this, he is described as caring and willing to help students succeed, particularly through office hours. Exams are noted to be relatively easy, but grading can be harsh, especially for minor details, and the class is challenging overall.

Ratings.comment: He is very disorganized. At the start of the semester I would recommend downloading all practice content and blanking out the answers, because there IS practice, but it is just hard to use unless you do this. Exam practice is almost identical to the exam, you will be ok :)
He is a very nice professor but is unable to focus during lectures and is very difficult to understand. The subject matter is very unclear.

He makes very little sense. Clearly knows what he's talking about, super scattered, offers no practice, and little creepy in class. Will call you out by name out of nowhere. Sends cryptic, aggressive carmen messages with little explanations. Exams are easy but grading is BRUTAL. Don't mess up small details. No credit for forgetting h20 arrow pushes

I took Baldwin for ochem 1 and I learned there is light under the tunnel. This class made me enjoy ochem as its only 3 tests and one participation assignment. Tests are so easy compared to baldwins and I only studied the night before and never got below a B on a test. The final was a bit harder cause its more information but loved his laid backness

Only exams and recitation attendance counted for grades. Upset that first exam avg. was too easy (67%) and made the next exam near impossible. Scattered and unclear information, doesn't tell us the names of reactions but expects us to know them. Lecture left me more confused than the book.

Professor Forsyth is a good professor. He teaches the material that will be on exams. If you attend lecture and read the corresponding book chapter before class you will do well on exams, take home quizzes and recitation quizzes. I was nervous when I read these reviews, but he is super fair. Yes the class is still fairly difficult bc its OChem.

If you want to pass, go to office hours. He cares greatly about his students and will help you succeed. Study the take home quizzes, they are so similar to the exams!! He is a good teacher, the class is just hard & for those students who hate him, probably didnt put in the effort.

Dr. Forsyth is a really nice guy and cares about his students, but is NOT a good teacher. His lectures were very confusing, there were no opportunities to practice problems or try things in class. basically, the lectures caused me more stress than good. The take-home quizzes were easy points, however, and I was very thankful for them.

Craig clearly knows his organic chemistry, but he teaches first level organic chemistry as if he's teaching a graduate level class. He works through practice problems extremely fast and doesn't actually explain how he got to his answers. He also has a problem emphasizing things that aren't actually important. I taught myself. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Has to be one of THE worst professors at OSU, teaching THE hardest class at OSU. Whatever you do avoid this guy. I've had countless TA's make alarming faces when I told them I have Forsyth. STAY. AWAY.

Craig is very intelligent but hes a terrible teacher. His lectures were confusing and the information he chose to focus on on the exams never made much sense. I definitely feel I couldve done better in this course with almost any other professor.

Professor Forsyth is clearly a genius, however, he is not a good lecturer and his entire class is very disorganized. Exams were very predict the product heavy. Learning how to prepare for his exams was key, I found much more success after I accomplished that. Avoid if possible, you'll teach yourself the entire semester.

Dr. Forsyth is a great guy, but horrible professor. I tried really hard to get something out of lecture for the first half of the class but eventually gave up and just used to textbook and khan academy videos. Do book problems & MEMORIZE EVERY REACTION. The final was basically all predict the product or fill in reagent. 52,70,48 on exams was a C+

This class was a lot of work and Dr. Forsyth did not make it any easier to learn the complex criteria. Honestly, I would avoid him as a professor. Nothing against him as a person, the guy just cannot teach. I received an A in both Chem 1210 and 1220 and this class was just far too complicated. Get a tutor!

Dr. Forsyth is a nice man and genuinely cares about his students. However, his lecturers were very hard to follow. He often uses abbreviations not previously discussed and draws arrows to different molecules all over the chalkboards. He should provide more practice problems that actually resemble test questions, maybe even some in class.

I really liked him. Yes, his lectures were all over the place but he is very knowledgeable on the subject. You get out what you put in in this class. For me, I had my roommate send me Callam's problem sets and did them 100 times. If you devote your time to this class, you will succeed.

I had an issue with one of my grades and he was very nice and helpful while resolving it. His lecturing on the other hand seemed unorganized and difficult to follow. I personally stopped going to lectures and started watching online videos to pass the class. I also had trouble trying to find practice problems because he did not provide any.

Forsyth is so disorganized and all over the place that your only chance to learn the material is through reading the book. You still have to go to class because he reuses similar reactions from lecture and quizzes on the exams. Emphasis is on reactions and it will be helpful to study the "New Reactions" at the end of each chapter. Use your book!
His lectures can be really, really confusing without reading ahead. Going to office hours helps a TON. Very enjoyable class if taken seriously and done right.
Dr. Forsyth is a highly intellectual professor and has a vast amount of knowledge of organic chemistry but his ability to share that knowledge with students is poor. Great guy, poor teacher.

Dr. Forsyth is all over the place. He isnt very available for any sort of of help, and our TA has warned us how confusing his lectures are. First day of recitation and our TA let us know that wed come out more confused from lecture than we were going in because of how all over the place the prof is.

Go to class and do the book problems. Use "new reactions page" in text book and do book problems over and over from every chapter. Focus mainly on reactions over concepts. Exams are heavy on predict the product, retrosynthesis, and questions about reactions. Gives about a 15-20% curve. Most averages on exams are  around 50%.

Forsyth was one of the worst lecturers I have ever experienced.  I always went to lecture but had to teach myself from the textbook which made the class 10x harder than it could have been.  He doesn't post notes until a couple days before the exams, doesn't suggest book problems or give problem sets. Only good thing is a generous curve at the end.

Professor Forsyth was nice and enthusiastic, but was a poor lecturer. He basically repeated everything from the textbook, often times rushing through it and not explaining very well. Also, his tests are extremely difficult, but he gives a VERY generous curve. I got a 76% and a 57% on the midterms, and a 55% on the final and ended up with a B+.

Forsyth is not a very good professor. He expects you to already know the material b4 coming to class. He does not teach well, goes through concepts very quick & then erases them, also he doesn't post notes on Carmen. Expect to have a quiz in recitation every week. & tests are VERY difficult and avgs are 50. Also he jumps around while teaching lool

Easily distracted is an understatement. He stops during class repeatedly to tell stories and jokes. Class averages on exams are pretty low, but they do drop a quiz or two and curve the heck out of your final grade. I wouldn't take him again, but if I had to, I know the curve would be worth it.

He was the worst professor i have ever had. He legitimately had WRONG ANSWERS on his exams, and he seemed very jumbled. He doesnt respond to emails, and overall isnt helpful. 0/10 would not recommend.

Absolutely loved Dr. Forsyth!! Do the book problems and you'll be fine in the class. Super generous curve(15%). The final was hard but the midterms were fair. Go to office hours and don't fall behind and you'll be fine! I got a 70, 84 and 55 on final and ended with an A-.

Dr. Forsyth is a nice, funny guy. When it came to lecture, it was sometimes confusing. I wasn't very used to the way he teaches. He would go very fast. I highly encourage to work on practice problems to do well in the class. HE IS A VERY GENEROUS CURVER. Try not to rely on it because you can do better than expected if you work hard in that class.

never went to lecture and always left studying to a week before for exams- don't do that, go to lecture. Do book problems, and keep up with class because there are quizzes every week. There's some extra cred on exams, and generous curves. I had a 20, 80, and 41 on final- ended w/ a B- somehow. Also, really grew to like him, really nice guy!!

His lectures are all laid out the excact same- intro, notes by section, recap. As soon as you see the trend it's easy and very clear, until then it may seem sporadic and confusing. He is very straightforward in what he expects, and the tests/quizzes are not hard if you pay attention and practice. I hardly used the book. He's hilarious!

I started doing better in the class when I stopped going. I just put all my focus into the book rather than trying to do both. Wish he gave problem sets, since the textbook questions are sometimes ambiguous and the answers aren't always fully explained. I ended up with a 73% in the class, and somehow that became an A, so he has a very nice curve

I did not like his teaching style at first, but it grew on me as the semester went on, and he became one of my favorite professors.  His sense of humor is weird, but he is pretty funny.  I would recommend him for this class for sure.
Genius professor. VERY generous curve. Exam questions are identical to the book problems and new reactions page. I recommend taking him for 2520!

I didn't care for him at the beginning of the semester, but he kind of grew on me. He is clearly a genius, but he is not a very good lecturer. Do the book problems, because he likes using exact questions from the book!

Forsyth was the worst chemistry teacher I have had to date.  He uses only slides that come straight from the publisher, so it is essentially like reading the book during his lectures.  Unfortunately for students, organic chemistry cannot be learned this way.  Avoid at all costs!!!

loved him. funny sense of humor! Easiest Ochem class I've taken at OSU. The book is pretty much your bible. Know everything in it before the exam and you will be fine... especially the "New reactions" page in the back. Know that and you will ace the exam. I say you should take him if you get the chance.

OUTSTANDING Professor. He teaches very well and uses slides, which I totally back because everyone should know the material before coming to class. His tests are hard but can be done. Strongly recommend if you like doing well

Forsyth is kind, approachable, and has a great sense of humor for a professor! Class isn't too bad. I am on track for an A in the class now. Just do above average on the exams! Don't understand what other students are saying about him being an awful teacher.. Unlike any other organic chemistry class at OSU, if you don't know the material forwards and backwards before the exam, you're pretty much screwed. I recommend taking him!

By far the worst professor I've ever had. Both him and his TAs are useless. Doesn't give out problem sets and barely has any old exams to help. He goes way too fast through lecture and his midterms are not well made. He should stick to research. He clearly fails at teaching.

Dr. Forsyth was an absolute joke of a lecturer. He would fly through lecture slides and half of the things he tested on were never mentioned in class at all anyway. His TA was useless as well. I think I knew more chemistry than he did. I got an A in the  class so it can be done, but I essentially had to teach myself.

I didn't attend class much, but Forsyth seemed like a decent guy. Read the book. In particular, memorize the new reactions section at the end of each chapter. Do that, and you will do well in the class.

He went way too fast when giving his notes, and I couldn't understand half of what he said. I had to read the book in my own time if I wanted the material to make any kind of sense. The quizzes are hit or miss and the exams are pretty difficult. To make matters worse, my TA ws NO HELP at all. He also didn't put grades up on Carmen.

Hard exams. Doesn't tell you what the curve really is until the end and literally has no grades put in Carmen. DO NOT TAKE. He doesn't respond to emails at all either, making contact very difficult. Barely passed with a lot of effort, and I'm even pre-med.

Very quirky character. Likes to tell jokes that make no sense during lecture. He's nice and incredibly approachable, but spacey at times. His exams don't really follow any consistent pattern, but he gives you a STUDY GUIDE. But like any ochem class, if you don't know the material forward & backward, you're pretty much screwed
Class was by far the easiest ochem I've had at OSU.  Read the book, do the problems and you'll be fine.
Favorite chemistry teacher so far. Very funny in a quirky way and very willing to help in office hours. It's a hard class, but the exams are fair. Study the book a lot.
Dr. Forsyth was a really solid teacher.  He always adds really quirky and odd stories into his lecture to lighten up dense material.  Tests aren't too difficult.

The best Organic Chemistry teacher that I've ever had at Ohio State. He is very knowledgeable about the material and recognizes that there is often more than one way to go about solving a problem. He is a laid back guy with a great sense of humor! Could be my favorite professor yet. I recommend taking him.

Really nice and funny, but not a very good professor at all.  He does poorly in explaining things, he hardly gives out any problem sets or old exams leaving students on their own.  If you can understand the book though, you can do well because he follows the chapters almost verbatim.  His exams are fair if you go to lecture and take notes.

This class was a joke. So easy if you do the homework, as most of the questions on the exam were identical to those on the test-- identical. If you had Frankel for 253, good luck, this is actually OChem taught by an Ochem professor. He is a little odd, but he is very helpful and pretty clear in class. Read the book before you come to class!
Couldn't teach at all! Just uses random reactions that aren't in the book, skips random slides, and gives IMPOSSIBLE quizzes. Don't waste your time!

Awkwardly hilarious.  Tells jokes without punchlines and makes random small talk.  Totally absent minded and makes little mistakes like writing something different from what he says.  And he jumps around with the material so it's weird...  kind of open ended about the tests, as to what you should expect.
Extremely boring lectures.  Very unclear and makes many mistakes.  Unpredictable tests...can be simple or impossible.  A horrible teacher...should stick to research.

Not bad. The lectures come from the book, so read the book alot and do the practice problems. Quizzes are easy, midterms arent easy but if you study the book, you can get a good grade on them. Sometimes writes notes on board so fast he does not even know what he is writing but if you follow along with the book while he lectures its understandable
If you understand everything in the book, there's no need to go to lecture. His exams & quizes resembled the practice problems in the book.
terrible
Best chem prof i've ever had. He is a little goofy sometimes but he tries to make his lectures entertaining and is very willing to help.

His lectures are a little spastic and he can get off subject fairly easy.  But the material comes straight out of the book, so if you read the chapter the class is easy.  I went from low B's in regular chemistry to an A- in Ochem, a huge difference.  May not learn as much as with Callam but your grade shouldn't suffer as much.

As for his teaching, it's mediocre. He jumps around in lecture a lot. Sometimes his portrayal of the material isn't very clear, and connections aren't made (randomness is a good word). Also, he didn't even come to our first exam. We all waited 45 minutes, and eventually just left. He didn't even plan on coming. Does he give a crap?? Doubt it.

summary_comment: Alexei is widely regarded as the best teaching assistant in the chemistry department at Ohio State, praised for his exceptional ability to explain difficult concepts, his availability, and his genuine care for students' understanding and success. Students consistently highlight his humor, accessibility, and positive impact on their grades and mental health.

Ratings.comment: One of the nicest TA's who will make sure you know what your doing. Also has the funniest stories!!
I am deeply in love with Alexei. Best TA.
The best TA in the chem department.

Who doesn't love Alexei? He is the best TA at Ohio State. Super funny and laid-back, but also willing and capable of answering any questions and helping every student understand the difficult concepts of this class. Alexei singlehandedly improved my grade and my mental health.

Easily the best TA in the Chem department, Id not Ohio State. Had him for recitation, sole reason I understood what was going on and was able to do well on exams. Wonderful person, teacher, and fun to be around.
Lovely TA and was always available for questions before big chem finals!
The most amazing person that you would ever get as an educator. Accessible outside of class to an incredible degree. Great at explaining difficult concepts to someone at any skill level.

If I didn't have Alexei as a TA, I probably would have gotten a B in gen chem. Alexei is so fun and really cares about teaching you what you need to know. Recitation was AMAZING and Alexei would go out of his way to help us. Seriously, 1 hour of him teaching me wouldn't even equate to 5 hours worth of studying by myself. Amazing.

Alexei is probably the greatest TA to come out of ohio state. Alexei is caring, funny and nice to his students, and relates to them in a way that few TA's could. He is not afraid to talk about his personal life and his own issues with his students and he does an amazing job at making the information easy to understand and fun to learn.

summary_comment: Dr. Nardo is highly regarded for her caring and supportive approach to teaching, though her lectures can be confusing and prone to errors. Students find her exams challenging and often more difficult than the class material, necessitating additional study outside of lectures. Despite these challenges, many appreciate her willingness to help and the usefulness of her office hours.

Ratings.comment: Dr.Nardo was a very caring and understanding professor. She occasionally made mathematical mistakes in lecture and had to be corrected by TAs or students making learning a little confusing. Studying sources outside of class is a must for good exam grades as the exams are way harder than class material and study guides/practice exams provided.

Chem 1210: Overall Dr. Nardo was a good professor. Many of the topics are extensions from high school chemistry. I could tell she put in effort to be welcoming, learn names, and engage with students. Sometimes a bit unclear or incorrect with explanations and calculations.

Dr. Nardo definitely cares for her students, however, she's not great at teaching. Her lectures were confusing and she made a lot of mistakes while teaching. She has great intentions but the tests make up a big part of your grade and she did not do a good job preparing you for the tests.

Dr. Nardo was a very caring teacher, and it was evident that she cared about her students. However, lectures were oftentimes confusing, and the exams were very difficult; Much more difficult than any exam I have taken in college. The final is cumulative, 20% of your final grade, and pretty hard.

I would say that this class is pretty easy, especially with Dr. Nardo. She is great at explaining topics and easy to walk up to and ask questions. I would say that her office hours are pretty helpful as well. If you have the option to have her as your professor, take it.

summary_comment: Dr. Wade is an effective but challenging professor known for his deep interest in the subject matter and engaging, though sometimes lengthy, lectures. He emphasizes thorough understanding and application of material, making his classes demanding yet rewarding. Students appreciate his willingness to help and the use of tools like Learning Catalytics, despite occasional pacing issues and the heavy weighting of exams.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Wade's class was the hardest class I have taken so far in undergrad. To me, organic, analytical, gen chem, and physical chemistry 1 were all easier. There is no way to do well without fully understanding the material and being able to apply it perfectly. He was a good professor and extremely interested in what he was teaching.

Dr. Wade is a good time- his lectures are engaging and funny while still being informational. However, there are few assignments and heavy weighted exams which makes it seem impossible to get your grade up if you do average on an exam. I would recommend him still because of his good lectures and willingness to answer questions.

Wade was new to OSU in the spring but he did well overall. You need to keep up on the pre/post lectures because they are graded for accuracy unlike some other professors but he goes slow in lecture and posts guided notes which is really nice to follow along with. His recitations have quizzes but they are only 10 pts and you get 4 for going.

yada yada you know chem is tough. Wade is a solid choice and isn't as tough as some of the others. Sometimes he says he doesn't understand something in lecture or doesn't explain something clearly enough but most of the problem with his lecture was with the structure of chemistry not really him. He was good.

Dr. Wade is a great prof! He goes at a slower pace to really hit on concepts but also does problems in class through Learning Catalytics. You have to go to lecture because Learning Catalytics is graded. He is really nice and his lectures may seem long, but he prepares you well for the midterms.

Casey Wade is a new prof at OSU and was very good. However lecture was sometime really boring and very long. All powerpoints were added before lecture. There was not much in class problems done and was mostly concepts. A very exam based class, however Prof. Wade was a decent teacher for his first semester.

summary_comment: Dr. Pei is highly regarded by students for his passion and dedication to teaching organic chemistry, though his classes are challenging. Students appreciate his thorough lecture notes and willingness to respond to emails, and many found the course manageable with a good curve. However, some students noted that his lectures move quickly and can be confusing without prior preparation, and he often does not provide sufficient resources or partial credit.

Ratings.comment: Organic chemistry is hard but Dr. Pei teaches well. Records lectures & offers one official review session before each exam. Normally 70% of exam is details from lecture slides. Not great at answering questions bc he doesn't seem to understand the question being asked. Responds to emails. All grades are from exams no EC. Good curve a 74% = A for me.

Dr. Pei runs his class poorly. Midterms/exams are the only grades given and the only resources provided for your learning are the textbook and lecture. They recommend practice problems from the textbook that have no provided solutions. He gives minimal partial credit on exam questions, which are very different from examples given in class.

Dehua is such a good guy and definitely wants you to succeed but there is no other grades to cushion, it is strictly graded on exams which are hardly ever given partial credit on questions. If you have the choice don't take the one for majors, take regular ochem they have easier exams, more grades to cushion your overall, and they go much slower.

Dr. Pei is a great professor! He is also very excited about chemistry, kind, and approachable! His lectures move very fast and there is a lot of material in them, however. Reading the textbook before class is highly advisable!

Dr. Pei is truly a great guy and is obviously VERY passionate about ochem. He really wants you to do well, but his class goes very fast and is confusing if you don't read before. There's not hw or worksheets so you have to take it upon yourself to be prepared for the exams. The curve will save your life and your GPA.
Probably one of the best professors I've ever had. Could really feel his passion for OChem and motivated me to try hard. Class was somewhat tricky but ended up with a good grade :)
A lot of extra credit! Tough class but ended with great grades!
He's a very intelligent man who really cares about teaching. Do the work and practice examples and you'll be fine in the class. One of the best professors I've ever had!
Would take again.

I am just so dissappointed at his way of grading. Unfair, unclear, and this is the first time I've ever get a grade lower than a B+ in my whole college life. You are going to suffer a lot, mark that in your head.

Pei's ratings are slightly terrifying, but he's one of the greatest teachers I've ever had. It was the first time he taught the honors ochem and he did a fab job. It wasn't easy, the average for the 2nd midterm was 58%, but he is beyond fair & I def learned a lot. If you really want to learn take from him, just be prepared to work for your grade!
He is very clear in his explanations and he is very helpful. His enthusiasm for OChem is contagious.

Pretty easy teacher.  Everyone wines about him but you can't expect to study for an OChem test for and hour and get an A.  Tests were straight forward with no tricks.  My best chem grade so far came in his class

I did end up getting a good grade in Dr. Pei's class, but that doesn't change the fact that he is an AWFUL professor. He cannot teach and it is very apparent that he has no desire to help his students. He gets frustrated with low averages and blames the poor performance on his students' lack of intelligence and hard work.

Pretty easy teacher.  Straight forward with everything he teaches and the tests are very fair, no tricks.  Some stuff is not covered in class so kinda have to read the book.  But overall, pretty easy A
cute!!!

Dr. Pei isn't THAT difficult! Make sure you go to lecture, recitation, and review sessions, do the HW problems, and thoroughly review the practice exams he provides and you'll do just fine...I got an A no problem and still drank 3-4 nights a week!
Exams are Too difficult. Not much relationship among class, homework, and exam. Cost too much time on the homework which is useless at all. I really should drop this course.

WORST PROFESSOR/CLASS EVER!!!  This is the first class I have ever received an incomplete in.  The class is not taught you are just expected to comprehend everything that is being dictated to you.  DO NOT SIGN UP FOR IT!!!!

His lectures are TERRIBLE and boring, he's not a great teacher either, he tries to explain but then it just gets confusing.  3 grades which really sucks 2 midterms and 1 final so you f' up on one not much you can do except do really well on the next ones.  Don't take him if you can get another professor.  His exams were HARD.

Pei seemed like a very nice teacher but was not open to divulge any information about the exams.  The synthesis problems that he gives are very hard.  Study material from 251 and 252 b/c you may need some of the reagents for a synthesis problem.  Study his old exams as much as you can.  Multiple choice problems on every test!

This professor is very hard and his exams are unfair.  Class is setup to have only 3 grades, midterm 1 and 2 and the final exam.  The exams themselves have either easy questions or questions you have never seen or been introduced to during lecture or from reading the book.  DO NOT SIGN UP FOR THIS PROFESSOR

To quote him: "My goal is to teach you chemistry, your goal is to get an A on the exam". O-chem is hard and he tried his best to teach, unfortunately he ignored the fact that students are not geniuses. Most parts of the exams are fair. There'll be at least 2 problems on the exams that you've never seen before in your life.

Well, his exams are not really fair. I did well in 251 and 252 because the material covered was on the exam. Pei puts stuff on there that you have not seen or heard of.  His lectures are clear, but at the same time, pointless, because the stuff he asks is in the book or you have never heard of it before.  Not a fair prof.
believe it when you hear that his exams are impossible
very mean and tough
I studied so much for the final and still did terrible. A bad teacher and hard test just don't mix!
No Comments
worst prof ever. always has this snickering smile on his face. very unclear and extremely boring.  had a's in my other ochem classes before i had him.  can't teach at all.
Test are impossible

this is the one of the worst professors at ohio state. he is very unclear during lectures and unhelpful outside of class. his exams are impossible and convoluted. sometimes he just writes nots on the board without explaining them. theres at least 10 mins of silenc during each lecture. Stay far far away.
The rumors are true. His exams are difficult even if you devote your entire life to chemistry.  My advice is to stay far, far, away from him.
Worst professor ever!

The WORST chemistry professor I have ever had.  Maybe the worst professor I have had period.  Exams are very unfair and unclear.  Not helpful when it comes to preparing you for his exams.  Practice exams useless as are his lectures.  Do not take his class.

This professor does not teach chemistry.  He writes things down and expects you to know what he's trying to say.  His tests are remarkably unclear and unfair and they test you on material you haven't been taught.

Dr. Pei is the worst teacher I have had in the O-Chem series.  His tests are very unpredictable.  On one of his midterms, he had a question from a chapter that wasn't even in the syllabus and then he said it was a fair question since we talked about it in class (for about 15 seconds...).  I would not recommend taking his class.
