The guy is a pretty good lecturer, not hard to understand but a little quiet at times. The exams don't match the content of the practice exams at all, which makes it impossible to prepare. You'll learn chemistry from him, but you might want to take your GPA elsewhere if possible.
worst, biased
Not so bad until he totally slams you on the final, often hard to understand, often doesn't understand class questions

summary_comment: Dr. Southerland is an organized and caring professor who emphasizes thorough understanding of chemistry concepts through detailed lectures and ample practice materials. Her classes are heavily exam-based, with multiple midterms and a final, but she provides extensive support through recorded lectures, practice exams, and review sessions, making it possible to succeed with dedicated study.

Ratings.comment: There were four midterms and a final worth 20%. Dr. Southerland is very kind and responds fast to her emails. She provides many practice problems, a practice exam, and a study guide for the midterm/final. The labs were fine, and mastering chemistry homework is due for each chapter. She explains the material well, and the lecture is recorded.

Dr. Southerland was a great professor, she cares about the wellbeing of her students, and knows how to actually teach the lecture material rather than just telling you. The class is midterm heavy, we had four midterms not including the final. Homework can be lengthy but you have time to do it. If you have to take chem 1110 take it with her.

Dr. Southerland's class was extremely organized. While her lectures were a bit boring, she went into great detail about all the topics, and her exam review days were essential in recovering the material she put on the exam. Exams were straightforward and a reflection of lecture material. Take her class, she was amazing!!

She's a great lecturer and makes it clear that she understands things happen and that we have other classes to keep up with. All of her lectures are recorded and posted on Carmen which is helpful. The only thing I disliked about her class was having to wait around 2 weeks to know how I did on each exam.

Extremely test-heavy (3 midterms and a cumulative final). The curriculum has recently changed (as of 2023-24), meaning new teaching continues after the last midterm. You must go to lectures and take good notes. Lectures were on the main topics but the exams were more niche and covered extraneous subjects so studying was essential.

Great Professor, just make sure you study for the exams. Lectures are recorded. There were 3 midterms and a final. Exams are a large portion of your grade, but she gives a lot of practice material and gives a paper of what should be known for the exams. Study and you'll be fine.

Dr. S was a good professor. She taught in a way that was different from my learning style but if you wanted to succeed in the class, she made it easy. She is quick to reply to emails, has in-class review sessions for exams, has established office hours 2 times weekly and posts recordings of her lectures on Canvas.

SEI.Subject: ARTSSCI
SEI.Class Name: Arts and Sciences Survey: Mathematical and Physical Sciences

summary_comment: Dr. Parquette is highly regarded for his engaging and passionate teaching style, which makes his lectures enjoyable and memorable. Despite the challenging exams, students appreciate his availability and willingness to help, and many find his office hours and extra practice materials invaluable. While the course demands significant time commitment, students consistently praise his kindness and supportive approach.

Ratings.comment: His lectures are fun and engaging. Him teaching feels more like someone gushing about what they are passionate about, which I think is an amazing quality in a professor. His exams are a bit difficult, but not impossible and he is available to help you on anything you struggle with. Make sure to ask questions in class because he gives great answers!
Absolute GOAT. Learned Honors O chem 1 and 2 from him and his classes were so enjoyable it unironically changed my career trajectory.

Dr. Parquette is everything you can ask for in a professor. He goes above and beyond in helping students succeed. That being said, this class isn't a walk in the park. Be prepared to dedicate lots of time. READ AND UNDERSTAND the text. Do the practice problems at the end of the chapters. You can't complain about the class if you don't read the book

The exams are stuff of nightmares and I'm not sure that the practice he posted for them was very representative. Dr. Parquette is one of the kindest and most understanding professors I have ever had. I genuinely enjoyed his office hours and class even though it was incredibly difficult and took up a lot of my time.

I loved having Dr. Parquette! He was a very kind and non-judgemental professor. Even when I was slow on some problems during office hours, he was patient and worked through the problem with me. The class setup is very teamwork-oriented and his teaching philosophy is excellent. Exams are tough but practice lots and lots!! Truly a gem of a professor.

I would argue 2910H might have been easier than 2510 because of Dr. Parquette. He explains concepts very well and willing to answer questions. Go to lecture as he provides 100+ bonus points, which can potentially replace/make up for a bad exam grade. His office hours are very helpful, and he provide lots of extra practice. My best professor yet!
Awesome. Lots of Extra Credit points to inflate your grade. You can ask the TA for help on recitation quizzes and work in groups on them and the lowest also gets dropped. An A- was also an 85.

Pros
100+ bonus points available
Huge noncompetitive curves
Group quizzes

Cons
Lecture moves fast
Difficult final

Dr. Parquette was one of my favorite professors, and I enjoy going to talk to him even after taking his class semesters ago. He is one of the most caring professors I have come across so far. He wants all of his students to succeed in his class and he adjusts grading to match that. I was afraid to take this class, but I am so glad that I did.

Dr. Parquette is an amazing professor! O Chem can be tough, but he makes lectures entertaining, gives A TON of extra credit, and is helpful in office hours. Grades are based on exams and quizzes (group, open note). As long as you actually read the book, pay attention in lecture, and take good notes, you will do just fine.

Excellent instructor. Gives extra credit every lecture. Exams and quizzes were fairly straightforward. Very generous curve even after the adjusted scale he gives in the syllabus. Very accessible outside of class.

Easier than regular Ochem 1. Took in Fall 2018. Homework isn't graded (nice but dangerous). "Quizzes" were graded group recitation activities w/ old exam problems. Decent amount of extra practice resources. Fair exams. "Extra credit challenges" given almost every lecture, so read the book ahead of class. He could use more examples in lecture.

Dr. Parquette is the best professor I've had at OSU. The course is challenging, but he goes over the material at a nice pace, has in class practice problems, and is very easy to talk to in office hours and in class. I would've had an A without the curve, and I think most people in our class had A/A- grades. I liked this better than honors gen chem.
Dr. Parquette was very nice all semester. His curve is fair, but his tests are incredibly hard.

Dr. Parquette is an amazing instructor and really knows how to simplify very abstract concepts! Of course an honors organic chemistry class is going to be difficult, so be prepared to read your textbook if you don't understand everything in class! The many bonus quizzes during lecture also help out your grade a lot! He's a great guy!

He is a nice guy and wants the class to succeed. Lectures were fairly straightforward, he offered bonus, and exams made you think (but any ochem exam makes you think)! Only gripe is that he doesn't put anything online, so you really have to rely on the book (which I didn't think was very good) to learn the stuff if you don't get it in lecture.

Easy Class gives a ton of extra credit. Do Book problems and rewrite notes and you will get an A. I had more than enough points that I could have not gone to the final and still gotten an A in the class because of the extra credit. Extra credit is almost like 20% of the grade.

Keep in mind this is ochem. He goes "fast" in lectures, but so do all other chem professors. He gives extra during EVERY lecture and they add up to more than 10% of your grade! If you have any questions, he does his best to explain them clearly. He spices up lectures with jokes and actually fun chem memories and references.

I came into the semester excited because the people here on rate my prof spoke highly of him. I honestly couldn't stand the guy. He would teach the material as fast as possible and after every few minutes he would quickly add "any questions?" And move on. Only practice given for his HARD exams were easy book problems. Don't take him, take Callam.
Great professor.

Lectures are alright notes are kinda scattered and  have nothing to do with the tests. IF you want organized notes on mechanisms go to the book. Group quizzes but don't bank on your partners to always know everything. You have to pull your weight. Tests are honestly horrendous compared to what he explains in lecture.

Had a very clear cut way of presenting the material and offered extra credit challenges of 5 extra points for each correct response. Roughly 2 challenges a week. The class was 685 points with 2 exams 9 quizzes and a final. By the end of the class I  had over 100 points in extra credit added post-bump upcurve.  Am taking again for 2520.
He is very knowledgable, can talk fast at sometimes. He makes you think and is very helpful. The carve is very nice in the end. Studying along the way helps a ton like always.
Parquette is a great professor. He is always willing to clarify anything he says and is always ready to help if you do not understand something. I highly recommend him!

Decent professor. Tends to explain things that matter little in the long run but you'll get what you need to know. I was a little irked after the first exam since I expected multiple IR questions and there was only one. That through me off, but you can reasonably manage a B.
Exams are straightforward, but challenging. They get harder as you go, so make sure you get as many points as possible on the first midterm. He's a really nice guy, though.

He has recently changed his grading scheme a bit and the exams are quite difficult. He is a very knowledgeable guy and REALLY wants students to ask questions during lecture. He doesn't mind repeating himself 2 or 3 times to help students understand. group quizzes are easy but exams are tough but its ochem, they're never going to be easy... I rec.
Exams were very fair, I mostly just studied the notes.  Definitely pay attention and take good notes during lecture!  Good professor.

He used power point at the first couple weeks of the lectures which were quite confusing, but it got better after he started to use the black board to teach the mechanisms and reactions. His class is extremely easy. I got an A without any curve. Go to his lecture. Everything he put on the exams came directly from the lecture.

I had Callam for 251 and fought for a B.  Parquette was much easier but I still felt that I understood the subject.  I ended up with an A in the class.  The notes are key, all the midterms come straight from his notes! The final was definitely harder but very doable.  Go to class, listen, take good notes, and you'll do fine!
either go with Callam or Parquette for ochem. Callam is definitely a little clearer but I found Parquette's class to be a little easier. definitely go with one of those if you have to take ochem

Jon is a great teacher and does well at teaching a difficult subject. The only problem I had with the class was that basically everything you to throughout the year is only worth half your grade. The other half is the final where you will get a single problem worth 1/3 of previous midterms total. Good teacher. Horrible grade system.

Exam/Final were very fair. He gets a little ahead of himself in lecture and messes up quite a bit, but he is very approachable and knowledgeable about the subject matter if you have questions. Very generous curve and wants students to do well. Take him if you have the opportunity.
Jon was a great teacher, especially if you are a visual learner.  His TA's are helpful, and the midterm and final were fair.  Parquette was one of the best organic chemistry teachers i've had.
good
I really like him until the final which was impossible and out of nowhere.  In general, he is a really nice guy and a pretty good teacher.  His first two exams were fair.  Not bad.

Not a great lecturer, confusing and makes simple concepts complicated. First two midterms were easy, final was hard. Group quizzes (make sure to get a somewhat intelligent group otherwise it will frustrate you to no end). All in all, still one of the better professors.

Really nice guy and interested in the students.  At times could be a bit confusing and explain stuff in a roundabout way.  Tests aren't easy, but are very fair.  Starts out with a generous built-in curve as well.
tests are much much much more difficult than quizzes and assignments. in fact they are just brutal. nice guy though.

Definatelt a decent Professor. Tried very hard to convey the material in multiple ways so students would understand. Very helpful in office hours, and all around just a nice guy. Final was a bit brutal, but if you studied his old stuff/book problems you should've been fine. Definately one of the better teachers, take him if you get a chance.

Good teacher, teaches material clearly, the midterms were easy but the final was somewhat off topic but nothing couldn't handle.  He reminds me a lot about Drew Carey though. Otherwise not a bad prof.
he uses a lot of equations in lecture which helps a lot to learn them.
uses a lot of examples which are really helpful. HOT. :)
excellent!!
Very good professor. I would recommend this prof to anyone. In fact, I aced this class with flying colors even though the material was difficult.

Great teacher, was able to make even O-Chem relatively clear. Used a lot of analogies to try and help the students to understand. By no means an easy class but relatively straight forward tests with group quizzes and extra credit to boost your grade. If you attend class and do the homework you should do well. Overall I highly recommend him for 251.

Great professor! First half of class easier than the second half. Extremely fair exams, though still tough. He offers extra credit, group quizzes, and starts the quarter with a generously adjusted grading scale!

Super nice guy with well planned and worthwhile lectures. Exams are difficult relative to most other 251 profs, take advantage of the resources offered. You will definitely benefit by studying early and often, don't be fooled into thinking its easy because it makes sense in lecture (my mistake).
Easy to understand, very friendly, knows what he's talking about
Best professor ever.
He was a great Ochem professor and willing to help you out. Do his problems, take good notes and keep up on material! I recommend taking him over any other professor for 251

I enjoyed him. You can tell that he loves to teach and tries his best. He loves to take time out to answer individual questions in lecture and there are no surprises on the midterms. Just watch out for Dr. Babu in 252.

Best chemistry teacher I've ever had!  Very approachable and helpful.  His exams are tricky, but fair.  Group quizzes and extra credit!  I definately recommend going to his office hours; they helped me out a ton!

very clear... tries to make practical examples to keep people interested... takes his time explaining everything in detail and answers everyones questions in class... cares more about learning than grades... has a nice built in curve so you always know where you stand in the class
A good professor, but his exam's are way too difficult.

You will work harder than you ever have in your life, and I say this as someone who used to work full-time while taking 20 credit hours.  You will also learn more and love chemistry more than you ever could have imagined.  Great teacher.
Great teacher! Probably one of the best science professors I have had at OSU.  Makes the class interesting and explains well. I would highly recommend taking him if you can.
I didn't like general chemistry.  He made it so I not only understood chemistry better, I actually enjoyed it.

My first great lecturer, currently my advisor.  The exams were excruciating indeed, but I learned alot, and I cant imagine a more helpful or understanding boss.  Overall a great professor, but not for candyasses.
After the first midterm I realized that one person indeed can instill pain into your soul.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his thoroughness and insightfulness in lectures, though some find his teaching style and tone monotonous. He is supportive during lab sessions and grades reports fairly, but exams are heavily focused on calculations and multiple-choice questions with limited margin for error. Overall, while effective in helping students understand course content, his teaching style varies widely among students, with some finding him engaging and others extremely boring.

Ratings.comment: Great teacher and answered any and all questions thoroughly. Lectures were insightful. I didn't like the homework platform, but that is out of his control

Jose Cabral is a good professor, and his lectures are pretty helpful in understanding course content. However, his lectures can get very boring. He is very helpful in lab experiments and grades reports fairly. Exams are very calculation heavy and multiple choice. Most exam questions are very similar to lecture practice problems.

Professor is extremely boring, his tone of voice doesn't help either. He was very hard to get a hold of and barely answered emails. 25 questions on exams giving you very little room to make mistakes. After the class 1st exam average was low, he decided to give us 2 attempts on the remaining exams which helped a little. Lots of practice problems/HW

summary_comment: This professor excels in maintaining high energy during lectures, keeping students engaged even with challenging material. He effectively simplifies complex concepts and encourages student participation. His homework assignments are well-designed to reinforce learning, and he is highly responsive to feedback, offering substantial support to students.

Ratings.comment: Extremely energetic lectures that keep you active even through dull materials. He is great and portraying difficult concepts and tries to get student participation. Homework is made well to help reinforce lecture and is not just busy work. Always open to feedback and able to help students.

SEI.Subject: BIOCHEM
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Biochemistry: Macromolecular Structure and Function

summary_comment: Dr. Goldberger is highly regarded as an effective chemistry instructor who provides clear notes and helpful in-class examples, making the material accessible. However, students find his lectures move quickly and wish they were more engaging, while some note that his use of ALEKS can be both beneficial and challenging. Despite these critiques, many students appreciate his fairness and dedication to student success.

Ratings.comment: He is very nice but goes through lecture material very fast. Tests are fair but you definitely need to study well for them. Overall, hard class but it's not his fault. Just wish lecture were a bit more exciting and slower
love this guy very nice very attractive dont know why he doesnt have a flaming red pepper by his name???

Goldberger is a GREAT chem professor. He lectures the material and then does in-class examples which is extremely helpful. He uses ALEKS which is a HUGE bummer but overall he is the best chem professor I had. If I would have tried in his class, I would have gotten a great grade thanks to him.

He uses ALEKS which is a blessing and a curse. The material is really easy but he does try and he really wants his students to succeed. He has fair recitations and is overall a good lecturer. Honestly, I feel like my performance didn't meet my standards due to outside factors, not him. Try and get him if you can.
Doesn't like to curve.

Take him for 1220! He's one of the instructors who uses ALEKS instead of mastering chem, which helped me learn the material really well. His notes were clear, and he held review sessions before every exam, which weren't terribly confusing or difficult. Without a doubt the best prof to get for 1220.

Dr. Goldberger is my favorite teacher at OSU so far. He is super helpful and makes everything really easy. His exams are not to bad and are extremely fair. I highly recommend you take him if you have the chance.
Much more interested in his own research and travel than teaching the class. I learned what I needed to but could have done without constant mistakes in midterms, practice problems, etc.

Josh is a beast. He is very knowledgeable, and his class is easier than those taught by other professors. Kinetics, solubility, and chemical thermodynamics may appear difficult, but his lectures cover what will be on any exam. Do the homework he assigns! They are excellent practice for the exams.

He went to teach at other schools more than he was there for his own class.  He does NOT write his own midterms.  My friend was in 1620 (I'm in 1220) and we took the exact same midterm.  TAKE SOMEONE ELSE!

Good lecturer but makes many mistakes when doing sample problems/his own midterms. Practice midterms are not like the real midterms, read the book to do well. Quizzes were fair for the most part but he did give quizzes the day after the midterm.Do homework problems assigned. Recitation was a joke, left after the quiz. Watch Fus's videos in addition
he's a newb and never responded to emails

He's a nice guy and a good teacher. He tries to keep class interesting with jokes and demos. His carmen page has a lot of resources so use it! Make sure to do all of the practice tests and quizzes before the real thing. The real ones are very similar but with different numbers and chemicals. He's also really helpful during office hours.

He is a very good teacher for 123. His midterms very really easy but his final was challenging. His quizzes are also hard. You really do not need to go to lecture( other than lectures just before the 2 midterms)! Just make sure to go over his lecture notes after it is posted online.

Such a great professor. So nice, great attitude and personality and very available to offer help outside of class. Class is challenging but totally manageable. Definitely recommend printing out powerpoints to take notes on during lecture. Read the book and do practice problems before midterms and final.
He is absolutely adorable. Clear and very easy to understand and he makes the most clever of jokes.
I didn't care for Goldberger. He thought he was funny even when he wasn't and made me lose all interest in chemistry.

So funny, very helpful and clear, super nice, and pretty cute. Loved his class, but its really hard because its chemistry. Hated lab, but looked forward to lecture because he was the teacher! Makes a bad class tolerable!
He is so bro... and cool.. and interactive for such a large lecture
Awesome professor! Doing awesome research, ask if interested.  Super helpful, will chat with you about anything, and you can even drop into his office and hell welcome you in. Definitely recommended

Great professor! He's new, so it'll take some time for his teaching skills to develop. His lectures are really interesting. His quizzes and exams are really difficult, but that's to be expected. He's really nice and incredibly brilliant. Take him if you can!

I thought Dr. Goldberger was wonderful - he was sweet, helpful, and funny. He's new, so he doesn't have the kind of easy teaching skills that established professors have, but he did a great job with his enthusiasm. I actually thought his lectures were interesting, as well, because he had such enthusiasm. I would recommend him!

Since he's new, his lectures were iffy. Still liked 123 better than previous chem classes, but tests were hard (it is chem after all). Tests & quizzes didn't always match up with lecture material. A nice guy though, but definitely ask a lot of questions if you are confused.

He is new at teaching but because he is young he can relate better. The quizzes don't always match what he says. The exams are a little hard but if you practice enough you will do fine. It's a General Chem course at OSU so expect it to be hard anyway. He does a good job for the toughness of the course.

He's new, so he isn't exactly the best at teaching. Very smart, but his quizzes were not always similar to lecture material. Exams were very hard, and he did not prepare us for them very well. Take someone else.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his engaging and entertaining lectures, which are complemented by his sense of humor and frequent smiles. He is deeply committed to his students' success, offering support and redirection when needed, and ensuring that tests are closely aligned with homework assignments. While his exams can be challenging, students find his classes rewarding and often end up performing better than expected.

Ratings.comment: I miss this class and I would take it again. He cares a lot about his students and material. If you have any concerns or you are under-performing he will redirect you to achieving in his class. His lectures are entertaining, he is a comedian, and he smiles a lot. The TA group is helpful and failing his class is difficult to do. The HWs are helpful.

Very helpful professor. Cares about his students and tests the understanding of the essential material. Go to class, take good notes and do the homework and you'll be okay. I was definitely skeptical entering this class because I thought it would be impossible, but I was pleasantly surprised.

For expecting to struggle to get a B in Physical chemistry I was pleasantly surprised. Taught so you could understand what was going on. Tests were heavily based off homework so you knew what was on them and didn't have to learn all the chemistry in the world for them. I would take him again.

I went into this class thinking it was going to be so difficult, but Dr. Jaroneic made it pretty simple. His hw sets are nothing like the exams, they are ten times more difficult. His exams text your basic understanding of the material. Average for first exam was 90%. Attendance is mandatory as he does not use textbook. GREAT HELPFUL PROFESSOR.

I had Dr. Jaroniec for 121. I thought he was great. The lectures generally went by quickly and the quizzes were fairly straight forward. The tests were a little bit harder than the practice tests. Truthfully, I could have studied more, but even so I ended up with a B+.  Very approachable prof.
Good teacher, funny. His tests though are a little on the hard side so expect to study for them in advance.
Funny, good demonstrations, usually informative and interesting

summary_comment: Professor M.F is generally regarded as a kind individual, but is widely criticized for poor teaching effectiveness, often confusing concepts and making errors in formulas. Students find the coursework demanding and the exams more challenging than practice tests, with the class curve set to a C average.

Ratings.comment: She is a great person, but a horrible teacher.  She is always getting confused and frequently gets concepts and formulas wrong.

If you're taking this for a GEC don't. The biology classes are easier. This class is a lot of work. Prof. M.F is nice, but not always clear. Tests are harder than practice tests. Curves the class average to a C.

SEI.Subject: BIOCHEM
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Biochemistry: Macromolecular Structure and Function

SEI.Subject: BIOCHEM
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Biochemistry: Macromolecular Structure and Function

summary_comment: Dr. Turro is an exceptionally clear and fair instructor who simplifies complex topics and provides extra credit for attending lectures. Students appreciate her straightforward teaching style and her fairness in grading, which aligns closely with homework and class materials. Overall, she is highly regarded for her approachable nature and effective teaching methods.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Turro is awesome! First off, she teaches material in a very clear manner. She even gives extra credit if you attend certain lectures, so if you can, GO TO CLASS. Inorg chemistry is difficult, but she grades very fairly, even with the lower than expected exam grades. If you score average on all your exams (plus EC), you will do well for sure.

Very clear.  Literally gave bonus points if you were there on days when many people skipped, so obviously go to lecture.  Simplified everything down to what is easy to understand.  Definitely dont be worried with her as your teacher.
A really nice professor, I liked her a lot
Turro is awesome! Extremely fair. Tests reflect HW and notes, no surprizes.  Very nice lady. Come to class, you get bonus points. This class really spoiled me. Once again Turro is awesome!
Tough love, but straightforward and clear.

summary_comment: Dr. Law is widely regarded as an excellent professor, known for his dedication and care towards student success. Students appreciate his comprehensive study guides and engaging clicker questions, though some note that his lectures can be challenging and move quickly. While a few have experienced negative interactions, the majority find him to be highly effective and supportive.

Ratings.comment: Overall was a great professor, the quizzes are hard, but he tries to prepare you for them. he does move very quickly though.
He wants you to pass and if you go to him and ask him how to improve he will definitely help you out. I would take him again in a heart beat for o chem.
One of the best professors ever. Very intelligent and cares about his students. Absolutely loves what he does and spends time perfecting his class for students.

Dr. Law truly cares about his students' success. His study guides are a HUGE help for exams, and his clicker questions really help him understand where students are coming from. You can tell he definitely wants to know how students are doing, and what he could do better to help them learn. Tough course, but so worth it.

Dr. Law is by far one of the best professors I've ever learned. He is a fantastic teacher who expects a lot, which drove me to excel in his class. His ability to convey chemistry material in an easy-to-understand way undoubtedly prepared me for organic & biochemistry. He's a one-of-a-kind kind of gent, so get ready for an enjoyable course.

Dr. Law is very rude to students. Material is rushed and lectures are a bit confusing. He stands over people as they try to work. If you ask a question he will literally ignore you and walk away. He screeches at students, stomps his feet and acts like a child. Worst professor I've ever had.

Dr. Law is now at IU East.  He is one of the best professors there.  He is very clear on whats expected, puts tons of work in for students, grades fairly (in students benefit), spends time in tutoring center, and is very precise on what you need to know for outcome of class.  Lectures are sometimes hard but he clarifies for you.

Awful. He is short with students and rarely helpful. He doesn't think he needs an SI and I'm not sure why considering how many dropped/failed the class. I took AP Chem in HS and I know what good teaching looks like. He doesn't understand how he is awful at explaining things. Pompous, poor teaching.

He now teaches at Indiana University East. He obviously puts a lot of work into the class outside of lecture, but usually gives 2-3  homework assignments a week. Lectures are usually understandable, but sometimes can make the subject muddy. He takes academics very seriously, but grades fairly, giving partial credit. Tests aren't terribly hard.

He is very short with students. He is not a generous grader at all, and does not show much interest in the students at all. His rhetorical questions that he asks every few minutes are helpful at the very least. Avoid if possible.

He's not a people person at all. He's brisk and seems exasperated when you ask him questions. He's a HARD grader and skimps on partial credit. He tends to call people out during class. I definitely recommend against his recitation.

He was an awful TA. went to him for help multiple times and he did nothing. (Except call me out in class for not knowing what to do.) He is really bad at teaching and not even close to being describable as friendly.  He's a jerk that is not helpful. DO NOT TAKE HIM.
Extremely hard, he goes way to fast  and the class is graded much harder then the other recitations.

Avoid him AT ALL COSTS! He actually argued for points off of a quiz where the average was a 14/25. Definately not there to the students benefit, not helpful, and very very intimidating during exams. Loves to do countdowns. Seriously, if I heard "5 minutes, you have 5 minutes" remaining one more time, I was going to scream! Avoid!
He was always hyper, and knew what he was talking about.  But he was not the nicest/friendliest TA.

He runs his recitations like a tyrant. Obviously knows his stuff when it comes to chemistry, but he is not very helpful or patient in explaining things. He's one of those people who thinks, "Maybe if I talk louder, they'll understand me," instead of trying to explain things in a different way. Request a change if you wind up in his section.

yu kay was very energetic and obviously interested in chemistry. i found him to be very helpful and he always included the class as much as possible in discussions. i recommend having yu kay as a TA if you can.

He was one of the WORST TA's I have ever had...He was hyper everyday in class and never really explained anything. He is one of those people who knows his stuff really well but can't explain it at all. I would highly recommend trying not to be in his class.
No Comments

He was very hard to understand, and I think he was on like 10 energy drinks a day because he was very excited and constantly shaking and moving.  He was the hardest of all the TAs, because he was head TA. So do not get him if you can help it.

summary_comment: Dr. Coleman's teaching quality is mixed; some students find his lectures unclear and his exams vague, while others appreciate his passion and ability to make the subject engaging. His exams are generally considered fair but challenging, and he expects students to be well-prepared. Students who struggle may find his approach less supportive, though many still recommend him due to his enthusiasm and knowledge.

Ratings.comment: Does not explain things clearly in lectures

Dr. Coleman's class is easy but it is just stupid.  Some of the material he teaches is pointless.  It is stupid stuff that he is obsessed with.  His exam questions are often vague and pointless.  He is not concerned about the students at all and tries to spend the least amount of time dealing with students
Dude is sassy.

Dr. Coleman was a very good teacher & his tests were very fair. Yes, ochem is hard, but he makes it a little more interesting & fun while he teaches. I went to his office hrs & he was a little overwhelming, but he's an overall great teacher. I highly recommend him. Book is supplement, you MUST go to lecture to get the info he's testing on.
Awesome professor by far my favorite professor thus far!!

One of the best professors in the Chem department. Clearly knowledgeable and passionate about O-Chem, and it shows in his lectures. Exams are fair - equal amount of easier and harder questions. True, you'll have to study O-Chem quite a lot in order to keep up (don't get behind!), but that's true of all O-Chem classes. Also has a sense of humor.

Dr. Coleman knows what he's talking about, but unfortunately expects you to pick it up easily.  For those of us that really struggled with o-chem, he didn't have much sympathy.  I went to him for help once and he made me feel like an idiot.  I can't see why everyone else likes him.  Exams are really hard and has little leeway for partial credit.

Coleman is so passionate about what he's teaching, and it really shows. Just make sure you understand EVERYTHING in the notes and what he goes over in class. If you don't think it's important, chances are, it is. Make sure to really understand concepts--he WILL test over them on future exams. Don't focus on the book-use it as a supplement

I really loved Ochem prior to Doctor Coleman's class... He was a decent lecturer and the tests were so-so in difficulty, but he works of a normal curve so HE BARELY CURVES THE CLASS!! I am pre-med, and I defintely would not recommend taking him unless you are prepared to study ochem all the time...

Dr. Coleman is a very knowledgeable and passionate instructor.  He presents the material in a comprehensible way.  Final was practically the two midterms put together and the quizzes are directly from the notes.  Def recommend him for anyone taking 253. He even throws in some biologically relevant material which is cool.
Best Chem teacher at OSU hands down.  Makes everything interesting and is extremely fair.  Exams are difficult but he grades extremely fairly.

Excellent professor. His exams were difficult, but graded fairly. The content of the first exam was difficult to predict, but the following ones were very similar. If I have the chance, I will definitely take Coleman again.

Great Professor! Dr. Coleman loves O-Chem and it is contagious.  The class is very hard, but if you put in the time, you will get a decent grade.  Test questions required a lot of thought, but if you know the material you will do OK.  Make sure you go to EVERY Lecture as he writes tests on lecture material. 50% of the class got some sort of A.

He is simply the worst professor I have ever encountered.  The questions on his tests do not cover what is talked about in class, don't even bother reading the book either because it doesn't have anything to do with the tests.  All of the questions on the tests are totally random, DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH THIS PROFESSOR!!!!

BEST PROF AT OSU!!  the class is no walk in the park, but he makes it so interesting.  if you study, your hard work actually pays off in your grade, unlike a lot of gen chem multiple choice tests.  he loves chemistry so much it rubs off on the students.  he's always willing to help at office hours and review sessions. take him; he'll inspire you!

Coleman is very easy to understand and helpful, you will probably need to go to lecture every day but they are very informative so it is worth it.  Final had problems word for word from midterms, so just study those real hard.  Put in the work and it isnt terribly difficult.

He is a great teacher. His is willing to help all his students with any questions they have. And of course its not an easy class but he makes it very easy to learn if you willing to put in the time! Great teacher, highly recommended!

Best chemistry teacher I've had at OSU.  His lectures are very organized and easy to follow.  I had to drop this class once before and Coleman actually made this class interesting.  Exams are exactly like the practice exams and the final has the same exact problems as the midterms.  Only one or two curve balls per test.  TAKE HIM!!!!

I had to drop 252 the first quarter I took it because I was going to get a D, but after retaking it with Coleman Im going to end up with a B. His test weren't any easier, but he made the material much easier to learn. I would definatly recommend him for those who struggle with O Chem

tests are the easiest out of any ochem professor. that is if you go to lecture and do the HW. His test are very straight forward and only has maybe one question to try to "trick" you, but other than that he tells you exactly whats on the test and even repeats test questions on the final. very intelligent and clear about what he his presenting
He's tough, but good. He's a very straight-forward guy. He won't baby you through ochem, but if he sees you're trying, he's very willing to help. I'd take him for any class in this dept.

He is by far the best prof i have ever had for chemistry and probably all together. He is very helpful and i actually enjoyed his lectures. I would recommend getting him for any class you have a chance.

Coleman was the best professor I've ever had at Ohio State, especially for a chemistry class!  Very straight forward, clear, tests are very similar to previous quarters.  He's fun to listen to in lecture, jokes around a lot, very personable.  Do whatever you can to take him!! He made organic chemistry interesting.
Great in lecture. Very clear and helpful. Tests are straightforward. I highly recommend this professor.

one of best chem teachers. Tests are straightforward, Doesnt test on crap you dont need to know. talks a little fast. looks like a mixture of dustin hoffman and edward norton. Sounds exactly like edward norton. one of the only chem classes in which notes in class are relevant to tests

He's kind of arrogant and messed up all the biochemistry examples he tried to give in our class, but he does have a sense of humor and an interesting lecture style.  I've had other teachers I learned better from.

I don't know why everyone else thinks he is so great. HE is VERY full of himself and unwilling to help students outside of the classroom. His lectures aren't organied very well and he made concepts much harder than they needed to be! Even though I did well in the class I wouldn't recomend taking him.

Yes, he does seem to have a healthy respect for himself, but I think he deserves it. He is very intelligent and well-spoken, one of the best lecturers I've had in my Chemistry series. His class is challenging, but not impossible if you study hard.

Sort of cocky, but definitely a good straightforward teacher.  Tests are pretty easy, but studying is a must.  He gives a big democrat curve at the end which screws the people with good grades and helps the slackers with horrible grades (A- doesnt get bumped up to A, but F's can be bumped up to a C)
clear and fair, straightforward testing of basic material- no tricks, he presents interesting biological importance of concepts, overall great class
Doesn't follow the book hardly at all, so if you learn better from a lecturer, maybe you'll do well.

Dr. Robert Coleman is an excellent lecturer and an outstanding organic chemist. His class was fast-paced, and his tests were very fair. I looked forward to going to his class every day. If you're taking o chem, Dr. Coleman is the man for the job!

The man LOVES himself - no, really.  Very arrogant.  All and all, the class was good and he's fairly decent about getting the point across.  He does relate the stuff to actual biological systems, which is pretty interesting.  Midterms and finals are very much like the practices.

Just do the work and you will pass the tests.  The tests come right from the practice tests that he posts online.  Very Straightforward.  Learn the material and pass the class.  Presents material well also.  No tricks on the test.
He is a decent teacher, but an absolute jerk. My grandmother passed away right before the exam and he refused to give me an extension on the exam. What a jerk.

Not too bad overall. He is definitely pretty cocky, but I guess that's what a PhD and 15 years of teaching the same stuff will do to you. Chris Callam is a better option if available, but given a choice between Coleman and Dr. Fraenkelstein I'd go Coleman any day.

he is an arrogant man, he prides himself on being the best, take it from me, he is not, take the class from Dr. Callam, he is a baller chemist, coleman is old outdated and does not relate to students in anyway that can be compared with callam, plus callam teaches on a higher intellectual level
He is smoking hot,  I loved the class.  He is even fair in grading even though he hated to grade my sloppy tests!!!

This class is very challenging, he tends to throw in problem every exam from his graduate 700 level classes.  But the other questions are completely fair.  Just alot of memorization.  Lectures are fast past, but notes are very organized and clear.  He's the best chem teacher i've had:)
As everyone above has mentioned, the class is very difficult and fast-paced. However, Dr. Coleman is a great lecturer and made the class challenging. Hard work, but well worth it!

His lectures were the stuff of legend.  His exams are a bit tricky (beware of very little partial credit on mechanisms).  But wow, those lectures...greatly paced, articulated, concise...the stuff of legend.

He is a great professor that knows exactly what he expects his students to know. His exams are challenging but very fair. He is pretty intuitive and knows when the class is just plain lost and he needs to re-explain.
The class is challenging, but he is a very good lecturer and is also very  helpful in office hours.  The tests are hard but fair, and if you put in the time you'll do well.  awesome prof!!!
his honors is ****... the regular ochem learned more complex mechanisms.

This course is VERY difficult.  Rob is a great lecturer.  He's very helpful with me.  His first test has screwed me over already, but I feel as though I'm learning more than in the regular 251 classes.  I'm taking his 252 class next quarter.
He is an excellent professor, knows his material and how to communicate it clearly and concisely.  Exams are generally challenging but fair, and right from the lecture.
Best Ochem Prof EVER
FABULOUS PROFESSOR! In the all-time ranking of all things great and small, Prof. Coleman is second only to Peter Cetera's hit song "The Glory of Love." If you have to take Chem, he's your man.
The best Chemistry teacher I have ever had.  Communicates material very well.  His tests are a little more difficult at times, but they come straight from class notes.  Awesome guy.

He definitely made the class less painful than i anticipated. Not only was he fair about tests, he was willing to give help without making you feel completely stupid in the process. He's great in office hours too; he might surprise you and know your name!
Great teacher! Always very helpful!
No Comments
No Comments

Very fair exams, straightforward, from lecture notes.  Lecture is kinda hard to keep up cause he moves quickly, but good about showing you the overall picture.  Very well prepared for 252 (which I also took w/ him).
Great professor.  I learned a lot from him and I was very prepared for 252.  His picture makes a great light switch plate :)

He's a great professor, and communicates the material very well.  His exams are easy as far as O-chem goes, and he won't test you on anything he hasn't lectured on.  Just don't ask him dumb questions, like when the final is.

summary_comment: Kelsey is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching assistance, demonstrating a strong commitment to student success. She goes above and beyond to help students, as evidenced by her efforts to secure alternative opportunities when faced with challenges, such as helping another student start over on a lab assignment to earn some points. Her dedication is evident in her sincere desire for her students to succeed.

Ratings.comment: Kelsey is a great TA. Helped students to the best of her ability. I could not manage to get any product for my last lab, and she took the time to reach out to Dr. Callam to see if we could start over to get at least some points. She sincerely wants her students to succeed.

summary_comment: Dr. Badu is described as a sweet and caring professor who makes an effort to help students succeed, particularly through effective exam preparation and excellent TAs. However, his lectures are often considered confusing and difficult to follow due to his rapid pace and messy handwriting, leading many students to rely more on textbooks and prerecorded videos.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Badu is a very sweet and caring professor, but I generally learn chemistry best through just reading the textbook and watching the prerecorded videos instead of attending his lectures. He moved too fast in lecture and wrote too messily for me to get anything good out of it, so I just stopped attending and kept reading the textbook and did fine.

A very kind and caring man but a very poor lecturer. His lecturers were nonsensical at best and would often times end with a normal presentation slide that ended covered in random scribbles of his illegible handwriting. Albeit chem is a hard class but Dr. Badu's lectures do not make it any easier and at times more confusing.

Dr. Badu is a sweet and caring man. His lectures can be confusing at times if you aren't consistently paying attention, but he makes it easy to be able to figure things out after class. He does a good job prepping you for exams, and his TAs this year were phenomenal. Everybody just wanted students to succeed

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for their effective teaching methods, significantly enhancing the learning experience in chemistry labs through excellent guidance and support from their teaching assistants.

Ratings.comment: Great TA for chemistry. Made lab more enjoyable.

summary_comment: Hunter is an effective and caring professor who, while known for being a tough grader, excels in making complex chemistry concepts accessible and engaging. His humor, relatability, and genuine concern for students' understanding contribute significantly to a positive learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Hunter is a little bit of a tough grader, but that is to be expected in the chemistry department. He is funny, caring, and always tries to help whenever necessary. He is also very relatable and kind.

summary_comment: Dan is highly regarded for his expertise and approachability as a lab TA, effectively explaining procedures and answering questions clearly. Students find him easygoing and pleasant to work with, though some note difficulty focusing due to his attractiveness. Overall, he is strongly recommended for his teaching quality.

Ratings.comment: Dan is the best. Awesome lab TA, really knows his stuff, easy going, and tells you whatever you need to know. He graded pretty tough on lab reports, but i think its mostly because of our lecturer. Awesome guy and a pleasure to deal with. Definitely recommended.
Dan was a very helpful lab TA. He explained the lab procedure very clearly and was able to answer any questions very well.  He's a pretty nice guy too.
I had a lot of trouble focusing in the class b/c he is so cute!.....definitely recommended ;-)

summary_comment: Dave Turner is highly regarded for his engaging and enjoyable teaching style, making lab sessions look forward to rather than a chore. Students find him both helpful and humorous, appreciating his leniency in grading and due dates. Overall, he is consistently praised for his positive impact on the learning experience.

Ratings.comment: dave is the man
Dave Turner rocks! I actually looked forward to doing lab with him! Very fun guy but will also help you out if you don't understand something or if you mess up a lab!
Helpfull, funny, and very lenient when it comes to grades and due dates
Dave Turner is the man

summary_comment: This professor is overwhelmingly criticized for poor communication, unfair grading, and ineffective teaching methods. Students report that she struggles to be heard, grades harshly, and is unapproachable, often yelling at students during labs. Her lectures are described as confusing and detrimental to learning.

Ratings.comment: Despise can't come close to how much I hated her. By far the WORST TA I have had so far at tOSU. She didn't try to talk loud enough so that anyone past the first row can hear her. Grades unfairly. Picked up my lab book before the class period had ended and marked me down for not being finished when I told her I wasn't finished. Avoid AT ALL COSTS.

She was my lab TA for Chemistry 121. She is horrible at giving lab instructions and grades harsh. Sometimes shows up late or right on time then yells at the class for taking "too long" to do the labs. She is not very approachable and not very willng to help. Only nice to a select few. Wouldn't recommend her.

I had Kitty for my TA and she was by far my least favorite and most useless TA I've had at OSU so far. Kitty has no idea how to grade quizzes and our class average on quizzes was abismal. She also mumbles incoherently and I learned nothing doing lecture. In fact, I felt stupider after I left the room.

summary_comment: Professor Fuz is highly regarded for their excellent teaching in Chem 123, but students warn that having the specific lab TA mentioned can significantly detract from the learning experience due to her unhelpfulness, incomprehensibility, short temper, and efforts to make the class more challenging. Students advise enrolling with a different TA if possible.

Ratings.comment: I took chem 123 from professor Fuz, who is awesome, but I got this monstrosity for a T.A. in Lab. She is not helpful, incomprehensible, short tempered, and does everything in her power to make this difficult class even harder. If you have her, drop the class as soon as you can, or enroll with a different T.A.

summary_comment: The professor is generally viewed as engaging and helpful, though some students find his explanations lacking and his reliance on TAs excessive. There are concerns about biased grading, with one student finding the grading system unfair and inconsistent. Overall, while some find him entertaining and attractive, others criticize his teaching effectiveness and fairness.

Ratings.comment: Great teacher. Interesting and fun.
No Comments
He was cool and helpful if you asked for help.
This professor is totally hot and such a sweetheart!
Eh
Class sucked but he is totally hot and has a fun french accent.

he relies on his TA's too much and does not explain clearly. he guesses and lot and does not always give the right answers to questions. i feel that he does not really know his field in the depth that he should to be teaching.

Points given for difficulty are based on biased grading. I found out after finals that no two people with the same amount of points were curved the same way. Get it? I can put up with copious crap, but biased grading is absolutely unforgivable.

I felt his accent was very annoying.  The labs are so boring and nothing is learned.  Exams and Quiz's are tough.  There is just too much grading (10-labs 8-quizs 3-exams) to maintain a solid grade.  It should be more general.

What ever happened to the concept  of  "101" being an "introduction" to a subject? This entire department has such a huge chip on their shoulder that it gets them off to fail everyone. Buron is only following Chem department orders

Notes are online, with blanks in them for you to fill in.  Lecture is made fun only by his French accent and the jokes he cracks! labs are easy, quizes are hard and the exmas are awful. This class is challenging, read the book and go to lecture
it may seem that he is a nice guy, but do not take his class.  the exams are amazingly hard for a basic chemistry class.  STAY AWAY!!!
He's a ok kind of guy I think. He cracks nice jokes but yet the course is a little confusing and I took Honors in H.S. Overall, this isn't that bad if you actually do the homework.
He makes easy things hard, and doesn't explain concepts well, I only got through it because I remembered a lot from high school.

prof buron seems to forget that 101 is Basic chemistry.  compared to the other 101 profs, this man is insanely hard.  its funny i do good on the labs, the one thing he doesnt make up, but the exams and quizzes are killer!  STAY AWAY!
No Comments
Prof buron is pretty good for the most part. Funny french guy but the class sucks
This professor enjoys to make simple concepts complex.  This course taught by him seems to be more difficult than the weed-out chem 121 offered at OSU.  This professor is awful!!!!  STEAR CLEAR!!
He makes class really fun, his french accent and expressions are so great! Although chemistry is so hard, at least he makes it as fun as it could possibly be.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, characterized by his kindness and readiness to assist students during lab sessions.

Ratings.comment: i liked him. he was very nice and helpful during your labs

summary_comment: Dr. Wang is an entertaining and enthusiastic lecturer who makes class enjoyable and straightforward, often emphasizing key exam material. However, some students find his teaching style confusing and lacking in depth, with him sometimes skipping important sections and telling students to read on their own. Despite this, many appreciate his clarity and humor, finding the exams to be fair and directly related to the material covered.

Ratings.comment: If you think a 55% is passing and will get you through to the next O-Chem take him.  He class is so curved it's ridiculous. Probably because he has no clue how to teach the material.

Dr. Wang is a pretty entertaining lecturer. His exams are pretty much straight forward and he tells you exactly what to study in order to do well. He describes certain reactions as "sexy" or calls a certain molecule "baby." He seems to care and want everyone to do well and will adjust material as necessary.

'Let's make a sexy reaction!' This man is by far the best professor I have ever had. The first few days he was shaky, but after that he really knew his material. He skipped over the crap in the book that is unnecessary, told you exactly what was on the exams, and is hysterical. Anyone who complains about this guy sucks at Ochem or takes crap notes.

Very enthusiastic and hilarious during lecture.Exams are straight from the book aka "exercises" and he sticks to his word when it comes to what is going to be on the exam.He may be confusing but if you're patient and attend class it's pretty entertaining and easy.I would recommend him!

Enthusiastic, nice, and funny.. but a pretty useless teacher. Skips teaching whole sections & says "just read this yourself its no big deal". Wow, thanks TEACHER. Also seemed very scattered and unorganized, examples in class were usually worked out wrong and just confused us more. Exams are straight forward but you have to teach yourself EVERYTHING

This teacher is useless.  He confuses himself giving examples during lecture...says "no big deal" to the practice we do in class...of course it is a big deal when it comes to your answer on the test.  Chemistry is my WORLD!  I love the subject matter and this is the first time I have ever dropped a Chemistry class.

one of the most enthusiastic professors i had. really made my first quarter at OSU enjoyable. pretty straight forward about what was to be covered, go to class, take notes, talk to your TA and you'll do fine.

Easy for Ochem but not easy.  The tests were, for once in my OChem existence, completely straight-forward which was fantastic.  Nothing learned in class that couldn't be found in the book (it was the book verbatim) BUT he did say what to know and what to disregard so showing up was worthwhile indeed.  A perk:  he's funny and enthusastic.
His tests are relatively easy, as far as o-chem goes. But you have to learn everything on your own or from the TAs.
He's funny and easy. He's not the greatest teacher but he throws out free points. The TA's do most of the teaching anyways.

He cannot teach. Uses generic slides that come with the text book. However, his tests are very easy, plus he does silly things like gives bonus midterms and randomly adds 10% to everybody's grade. Easy, but you won't learn a thing unless you do it on your own.
He is the easiest o-chem professor that I've had.

summary_comment: Kristen is highly regarded by some students for her helpfulness and kindness, often going out of her way to assist them and even baking treats. However, many others have criticized her as a poor teaching assistant, citing her frequent absences and lack of interest in helping students, which has led to negative feedback and warnings to avoid her if possible.

Ratings.comment: She is the worst TA i HAVE EVER HAD, she has not interest in helping her students and is missing from class 60% of the time. She complained numerous times about how she had no interest in being "here" and wanted us to hurry up so she could leave. If you value your sanity or your grades, DO NOT TAKE HER.
Kristen is awesome.  She's a 5th year micro major so she's screwing up the curve in my classes.  But I still like her because she is very helpful.  She's as sweet as the stuff she baked for us.
Such a wonderful person! She will definitely go out of her way to help you...plus she baked cookies and brownies all the time, amazing!

summary_comment: Dr. Leung is highly regarded as an effective and caring teacher who prepares students well for exams through clear and thorough explanations. His engaging and entertaining teaching style, coupled with accessible office hours and a willingness to help outside of class, fosters a supportive learning environment. However, some students find his tests challenging and his lectures difficult to follow due to a sharp foreign accent.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Leung is a very good teacher. He cares if you succeed. His lectures were entertaining and easy to understand. You really have to know the materials for Chem 122 and 123. His tests were very tough but fair. You can't just study the night before exam in his class, so you get what you deserve.

Professor Leung is a great teacher.  He was always prepared, very funny, and explained concepts very thoroughly.  He did not move too quickly in class, leaving the students lost and confused like most professors do.  Also, he made chemistry fun...he even showed a gummy bear get destoryed in a chemical reaction.  Office hours were very helpful!
Four words: useless, crap, lousy, waste...these sum up Leung.
Sharp foreign accent made it very hard to follow and understand this professor.

lectures were fun, awesome lecture note.  great teacher, come to lab to know you.  always being helpful.  i am taking 122 with a diff prof now, he still helps me.  chat on AIM even at midnight.  where did you get a prof like that?  his tests are similar to practice tests and homework.

He is such a great teacher. He is always very prepared and he knows what he is talking about. He also takes the time to make sure you understand what is going on. If I could have him teach all of my Chem classes I would.
Funny

Dr. Leung is the BOMB. If I could take him with me to Organic chem, I would. All profs should be this attentive - he really gives a damn if you pass. Also, although he tests hard, you learn that stuff. Takes time in lecture to explain/answer questions. Great teacher!

This guy doesn't care about you. I learned much more from reading the book and doing practice problems than from attending every lecture.  The average for the first two exams was an 'F'.  The average for the final was a 'D'.  At the end of the quarter he had to curve the grades by about 10 percentage points to keep half the class from failing.

He has accent but not too bad. He has a sense of humor, that helps. I am a senior, I'd rank him one of the best in OSU. He is very well prepared and he cares about students. It is important to download lecture note from Carmen and attend lecture. Tests are fair. You just need to do homework. It is not hard to pass.
Wonderful professor.  Very organized and helpful.
He sucks! His voice is not clear at all. It is very difficult to understand him in class. He is the worst teacher. Never take his class.

Terry is the best and nicest TA of all time! Chem is boring, but he made it fun.  He loves teaching and works so hard, it makes you feel embarrassed not to work. Our section was like 15 pts higher than course ave. in exams. Go figure! I saw him recently, he said he'll teach as a lecturer in summer. Take his course!!

summary_comment: Maxx is an effective professor known for his fairness and clarity, despite occasional difficulties in understanding. He is also highly regarded as a lab TA, noted for his patience and friendliness.

Ratings.comment: Maxx was pretty cool, and easy. A little difficult to understand, but he always made the effort to communicate well and clarify himself. A fair grader too.
A pretty good lab TA compared to others in Gen Chem. Very patient and friendly.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his willingness to help students, particularly during one-on-one sessions, and his genuine care for their learning. However, his lectures are often criticized for being either too fast-paced or overly simplistic, and many find them unengaging. Students note that the class requires significant independent study, making it challenging for those without a scientific background.

Ratings.comment: He was very sweet and nice, but his lectures were generally useless. I stopped going towards the end because he basically just read the power points, but he was great help if you talked one on one with him. This is a hard class but he genuinely cared about us learning.
Very enthusiastic and helpful professor. Went through lecture materials little fast sometime.
He is very enthusiastic, but is hard to understand sometime.

I am the kind of student who has to spend an adequate amount of time on school work. Afterwards, I general have the concepts down to a key. However, this class was a complete joke. I spent hours DAILY on this one class trying to understand the subject matter. The professor who taught was helpful but all around a terrible teacher. Do not recommend.
This class was very difficult, but the prof was very willing to help. He is not often very clear on explanations and the lecture is beyond boring, but he really tries is best to keep your attention.

Extremely helpful professor. He was always willing to do exam reviews and truly wanted students to understand material even with the CHEM dept. wanting to keep averages down. Difficult class for those who's major has nothing to do with science. Expect to spend multiple hours studying per day.

summary_comment: Geoff is highly regarded for his excellent teaching and supportive nature, described as a lenient grader who goes above and beyond to ensure students understand both lecture and lab materials. Students consistently praise his helpfulness and enthusiasm for assisting them.

Ratings.comment: Geoff is a very helpful, easy-going guy. Very lenient on grading and wants you to understand not only the lab material but also the lecture material. Helped me more than anyone in the Chem Department this year.
He is basically the greatest chemistry lab TA. He is so helpful, and really cared about his students. He is a lenient grader too. I can't express how great of a TA he was. I highly recommend him.
He's just a good guy, helps people when needed, and is an easy grader
Absolutely great TA. He really helps a lot! If you are able to schedule his lab, go get him. He's enthusiastic to help students and may give you some extra grace!

summary_comment: Rohit Menon is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, described as humorous, intelligent, and exceptionally effective at making complex material accessible and engaging. Students praise him as the best Teaching Assistant they have encountered, emphasizing his ability to enhance even challenging courses like OSU Chemistry.

Ratings.comment: Rohit Menon is the best TA I have ever had. I really can't say enough good things about this guy. I would take OSU Chemistry again just to have him as a TA and that's saying somethin bc osu chem is no walk in the park. He was funny, intelligent, and best of all he makes the material both accessible and interesting.

summary_comment: Dr. Cunningham is widely praised for her exceptional teaching skills and dedication to her students' success in organic chemistry. Students consistently highlight her clear explanations, willingness to help, and genuine care for their progress. Her classes are challenging but manageable with her support and resources, making her one of the top-rated professors at OSU.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Cunningham is an amazing professor. She understands that organic chemistry is a very tough subject, but she does everything she can to help you understand and do well in the class. I would take another one of her classes any day! If you can take her class, you will not regret it.

Where do I begin? First of all she's the best professor I've had for any chemistry course. She genuinely cares about her students and wants them to succeed. I never felt that her tests were unfair. However, this class is difficult and if you do all her problem sets, practice quizzes, read the textbook, and do textbook problems you can get an A.
The best professor I have ever had!!!! She loves to teach and she loves helping students understand. I would love to have her for more classes

Best chemistry teacher I've ever had. She loves the material, but still seems to understand why you hate it and does everything and anything possible to help. Class is hard but curved.  Always attend lecture and recitation and study. She gives loads of resources. Corny humor but I kind of love it.

2510 is a difficult class but Dr. Cunningham makes it possible to do well. Make sure you go to lecture, it is very detailed and concise. Good handwriting. Do the practice packets each week before your quiz and youll be fine. She really cares about students which is nice.

Dr. Cunningham is amazing. This was my 2nd time taking the course, so I was obviously very nervous. I went to her office hours the first week and I could immediately tell she cared about me as a student and wanted to see me improve. Her lectures were clear and  well organized. Her office hours were amazing and she is always willing answer questions

Dr. Cunningham is an amazing teacher. I had to retake OChem since I didn't pass the first time with the grade I wanted and she saw all the work I put in. Make sure she knows your face and your dedication to the class, it really helped my grade. One of the few professors in OSU who REALLY cares about her students. I highly recommend her.

If you are taking Ochem, i highly recommend Dr. Cunningham. She is extremely helpful and wants to see you succeed. She gives you all the tools and resources you need to succeed. This is a difficult class but if you put in the effort you will get the grade you want. Dr. Cunningham is there the whole time cheering you on.

She's a great teacher! It's so hard to find a compassionate teacher in the chemistry department at OSU but she's one of the best! Truly cares about the students and gives so many resources to help make scary OCHEM not too bad. Overall such a great lecturer!

Dr. C is great.  Don't skip lecture, not because attendance is mandatory, but you'll die if you fall behind in OChem. She is one of the professors who actually cares about not only her students understand the material, but their success and eventual grade. Material is hard but she sets you up for success.
Dr. Cunningham is one of the best teacher in OSU for sure. Her lecture is very clear and helpful. Strongly recommend to take her class for ochem!
Dr. Cunningham is my favorite professor at OSU. She is the most helpful teacher ever and she is super nice. If you are scared of ochem TAKE KRISTA CUNNINGHAM
One of my favorite professors yet. Very helpful when you go to ask questions! She takes it slow for everyone to understand.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for their exceptional teaching quality, making chemistry engaging and enjoyable, even for non-science majors. Students praise their helpfulness and creative approach, including memorable chemistry songs, which inspire continued interest in the subject.

Ratings.comment: Best TA I have ever had! Super helpful and beautiful! I am not even a science major, I took this class just to see her. Made chem fun and has amazing chemistry songs. Ill be taking more chemistry classes now!

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, known for being very helpful and engaging, often adding humor to her lectures.

Ratings.comment: She was a great TA. Very helpful! She was pretty funny during lab too

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality and willingness to assist students, often going above and beyond to provide help. She encourages students to ask questions and maintains a friendly, straightforward approach. Her strictness regarding punctuality and cleanliness, particularly during lab sessions, can be noted but does not detract from her overall effectiveness as an instructor.

Ratings.comment: Easily one of the best TAs I've had, especially in a chem lab. She is always willing to help, even if she has to go out of her way to do so. If you have any questions at all just ask. She's always nice about it and pretty straightforward. However, she does get a little spastic if the class gets behind schedule and is a stickler for clean drawers.

summary_comment: This professor is consistently described as one of the worst lab TAs, noted for favoring attractive students, being overly critical, and failing to assist with questions. Students found him unpredictable, often stern and dismissive, and more focused on interacting with certain students rather than providing support.

Ratings.comment: Just exactly like others said, he is LITERALLY THE WORST lab TA you could possibly meet in college. He favors cute girls, and only cute girls. He yells at you for not putting on the goggles. And he never helps you with any questions. So if you are not a hot girl, do not take his lab.

He was the worst TA I've ever had. He favored girls who sucked up and laughed at his lame jokes. I swear he was bipolar. One moment he'd be all strict and uptight. The next moment he'd pretend he was your friend. I loathe his face and rue the day he was born.

He was incredibly useless as a lab TA. He was much more interested in talking to the cute girls in the lab than answering questions.  The first thing he did was scream at us to put on our goggles before class even started.  He is a very angry asian.  While obviously Chinese, he had this strange canadian accent that was very distracting!

summary_comment: Professor Pappas is highly regarded for her passion and clarity in teaching, though students note her tendency towards scatterbrained delivery and rapid pacing, which can make following important information challenging. Despite these challenges, she is described as supportive and entertaining, with engaging lectures and useful online resources. Her exams are known to be rigorous, requiring significant independent study and preparation.

Ratings.comment: She was rather scatterbrained at times and would switch from joyful to serious in the blink of an eye. Kind of unnerving. To be fair though she always had faith that I would pass and I did.

Chem 1210 is a hard class, but Professor Pappas is a fantastic professor. She was very good at explaining things and went over a ton of problems in class. Asked and listened to our feedback about tests and our understanding of the material. If you study, go to class, and do the work, you can get a good grade

Personality is interesting enough, but sometimes gets confusing. She gets hard to follow, at times going quick and scatterbrained making it hard to pick out important information. A little time out of class going over material helps, esp example problems-j get them down bc she goes so fast in lecture u don't have to understand but go over later

Dr. Pappas is visibly passionate & excited about chem & that really helped my outlook on the course. gen chem is designed to REALLY push you to be an independent learner. She's funny & nice, but pretty scatterbrained, so you 100% CANNOT rely solely on lecture if you want a good grade. Read the chapter before lecture, and GO TO OFFICE HOURS!!

Dr. Pappas usually gaves pretty entertaining lectures and her practice exams online were really helpful. The only problem I had with her was that she would sometimes give incorrect information during lecture and it would be really confusing when she would try and correct it.
She puts notes online and those are helpful

Dr. Pappas is very nice, however, the tests were what killed me in this class. I've never had problems with chemistry before, but ended up having to withdraw from this class after failing the first two midterms. Try to take with a prof with easier exams

AMAZING! best chemistry professor; hilarious and smart. Very clear and energetic. Does a lot of experiments in class which are always fun. Definitely take her class but be prepared to put in the work, it's no easy A.
Very funny, Reasonable with material covered in amount of time. exams taken during class period which is a major plus! Make sure to do the homework or else you wont make it.

Dr. Pappas is like Ms. Frizzel from the magic school bus. She has a crazy personality that will make  you listen to the things she says. I never took ap chem but I did well in her class. TAKE HER. SHE IS GREAT

I had 1210 with Dr. Pappas and liked her so much I made sure to get into her 1220. I'm glad I did, many people now in 1220 say they wish they chosen her earlier for 1210. She's funny and her lectures make sense, exams are straightforward and her practice exams do prepare you. She is very easy to recommend. Got an A in her 1210, doing well in 1220

I would ABSOLUTELY 100% recommend taking chemistry with Dr. Pappas. The class is hard because the class is hard, but if you go to lecture and study the material, she never throws curve balls on the exam. I knew what to expect on every exam, and did well on all of them except the one I didn't study for (duh). TAKE HER CLASS!

TAKE DR. PAPPAS! Her tests are straight-forward, I missed a two questions on the exam because  I over-thought them. 11 people got a 100% on one exam. If you have taken AP Chemistry, 1210 will be a cake walk. 1220 is a little bit harder, but still super manageable.

This class is made to be hard, so whoever you have it's going to be hard. But she made it bearable and gave us all the resources to do well (multiple practice exams, online homework, specific EOC questions). I ended up with a C which I wasnt so happy about but I'm not a good test taker, which your grade is basically based upon (62.5% to be exact)

Dr. Pappas is a great professor. Lots of industry experience. She is hilarious and frequently cracks jokes to make lectures bearable. Tests aren't easy but also aren't the hardest I've seen for 1210. Go to lecture, pay attention and study your notes and you should be fine.

This class is hard.  She is confusing and her exams are very difficult. Practice problems will not help you on exams, neither will her office hours (which I went to frequently) I am amazed that I passed this class. Lab, online homework, and recitation are what saved me. I failed every midterm despite studying almost every day. The curve is a joke
