Dr. Pappas is very passionate about teaching and loves to have her students involved! Her exams are difficult but as long as you go to class and do extra practice problems that she provides you will be fine!

This class is known to be hard but Dr. Pappas is really entertaining in lecture. Obviously the tests are difficult but that is expected. Dr. Pappas is a cooky teacher and loves to do experiments in class.

Dr. Pappas is an overall good professor. She has a very lively, wacky personality which I feel is a must to be any kind of professor! She also has extensive experience in industry, so she brings plenty of real world examples to lecture. Pound for pound, I'd say she's the best gen chem professor at OSU
Pappas is seriously an amazing professor. She is super enthusiastic and always willing to help! Chem in general is terrible, however, she makes it interesting. Would definitely suggest her!
If you have to take a Chemistry class and you get the chance to decide between Dr. Pappas and another professor, CHOOSE Dr. Pappas. She is very helpful and always go to her office hours.

Dr. Pappas is probably one of the best Chem teachers at OSU. The class is hard, not hers specifically. But, if you go to her office hours she is a huge help & it will show her that you are committed. Make sure to do ALL homework and try your hardest on the labs!

I liked Dr. Pappas! OSU Chemistry is never fun, but Dr. Pappas made it bearable. She really wants her students to succeed. Go to lecture. DO THE HOMEWORK. Go to her office hours. If you do the work, you will be fine.

Pappas is such a sweet heart. Do not miss her classes; some of the answers to the exam come straight out of her mouth. Do the homework and ask her for assistance when you are in bind. She is hilarious, and is more than willing to help her students. Her practice midterms are fair and representative of her exams. Don't fall behind though. I got an A.

Chem 1210 is a hard class and luckily she doesn't make it harder than it needs to be. Unlike other professors, if you studied before the test, there are no surprises. She's very fair and hilarious and explodes something in every class. If you must take Chem, take her!
Loved Dr. Pappas. Quizes, and midterms were very fair. Final harder however, she is an amazing teacher. Always helpful!

I LOVED Dr. Pappas! I wish I could have her for all my chem classes! I really disliked chemistry prior to her class, now I really enjoy it. She is challenging, but her tests are VERY fair. I felt that what I got wrong was bc I didn't study, not bc she's a poor teacher. If you have the chance to take her, do so. She see her class as a team effort.

Dr. Pappas was awesome! I didn't realize how good of a professor was until I had other Chemistry professors. You actually learn a lot by going to Lecture. She is always willing to help and is very friendly and funny. Her exams are tough, but very fair, and the class is curved generously.

GREAT teacher. She is very entertaining and full of life. Her tests are very straight forward but her notes are a bit hard to follow. I found it easiest to read the book after her lectures. Try to go to her office hours often, she is extremely helpful.

Pappas is very entertaining, but she's difficult. Her practice exams were a lot easier than her actual exams, so studying and understanding EVERYTHING is a must! She moves quickly so be prepared before class as well.
I absolutely loved her & would highly recommend her! She's very enthusiastic about the material she teaches & she does experiments every lecture. Her exams aren't too bad aslong as you do the E.O.C.s
Great and somewhat crazy personality. Keeps me interested and motivated to do work

I had Dr. Pappas for chem 121 and 122.  Loved her! Very enthusiastic. Wants students to do well. Recommends end of chapter problems that WILL help with test. Went to every lecture. Really helped with challenging topics! <3
Great professor but how OSU teaches gen chem is terrible!

She's very... enthusiastic.  I liked her but I wouldn't say she was my favorite professor.  Her practice exams were ten times easier than the actual exam which made it harder to know what to study for.

I am so glad I had Pappas as my Chem 121 Professor. She kept things interesting, taught well, and was very helpful. It was a lecture that I never fell asleep in. Pay attention to lectures because she uses random information from them in quizzes sometimes, and make sure you do ALEKS! And go to office hours, she's really friendly!
Is a good prof but can be tough. If you're taking 121, she will make it as interesting as possible. Take her!

I had her my freshman year for CHEM 121 so I jumped at the chance to have her again for CHEM 122 the next quarter of that same year. She is very helpful if YOU go to her office hours. She is a little scattered during lectures with her notes and the demos but if you don't understand it go to her office hours. GO TO OFFICE HOURS.

Dr. Pappas was a great professor! I admit, that had I worked harder in the beginning of the course, I would have received a higher grade. That being said, she greatly increased my interest in chemistry, and her lectures were rarely boring. She's excited about chem, and a lecture was not complete without an experiment, or something being blown up.

Pappas is bubbly, hyper, and always happy. She hysterically laughs at her own jokes, which are usually pretty lame. Never touched the chemistry book that I paid 300 bucks for. Midterms are SUPER easy. Didn't get much out of her lectures. Very nice and approachable, and super excited about chemistry.
She's amazing, funny, and bubbly. I hated chemistry until I had her.

Really easy midterms but teaching can get kind of confusing and muddled.  Use your text book for grey areas but don't be too scared about tests.  Very fair and approachable.  Laughs at her own jokes alot

Pappas is an excellent teacher. I HIGHLY recommend her for Chemisrty. I had her for 121 and I specifically chose to have her again for 122. Shes very bubbly and funny and keeps class interesting. Her tests are a little hard but she is very straightforward.

During lecture she will say what you need to know and what you don't need to know. DON'T LISTEN TO ANY OF THIS (if anything study the opposite). Read the book, do the end of chapter questions and use the practice exams. Lectures are USELESS!
She is absolutely wonderful! I definitely recommend her for 121. She'll kick you in the pants, but it's totally worth it.

This class has many components and can be overwhelming at times. She hates when student walk out in the middle of lecture, so do so secretly.The exams are fair and follow the practice exams and end of chapter questions. Lectures are useless, and you should be able to get a decent grade by using the textbook and going to recitation.
Lecture is all over the place.  However going to lecture can help with random questions on the midterm.  Not very organized teaching style.  A lot material must be self-taught.

0MG, her laugh is completely horrid. you will not learn a single thing in class. makes too many mistakes while teaching. i decided to stop going to lecture because it was unbearable. teach yourself and you will do fine. didn't attend a single lecture and im doing perfectly fine as nobody learns anything. save yourself time and stay home and read
good professor, not very interested in chemistry but she made it relatively painless

Very outgoing teacher, she makes lecture go by really fast. Lecture attendance is not taken, but I highly suggest it because she tells you numerous things that will be on the mid-term and final. The book was pretty pointless, I only used it to do homework problems, which were pretty easy to begin with. Overall, very interesting class..
good

She was awful! Her class was very hard and midterms were not easy either.  Her laugh is worst than a witch's.  She goes on tirades and then says, "But you don't need to know that," after you took a page of notes.  She is hard to follow in class because she is always switching back in forth from chalk board and over head.

She was a really funny teacher and I enjoyed her lectures. Tests and quizzes were fair, study exams she gives you and any links from old exams from other teachers. 1st test was easy for me, 2nd was a bit challenging, final wasn't so bad,look at the midterms given and READ THE BOOK, lots of questions come from there sometimes.She's a nice teacher

this class was out of 1000 points, so it was difficult to get less than a b if you attended class and recitation. she was a little crazy at times, but kind of funny. even though attendence is not mandatory, i would recommend going to class because she sometimes says exactly what will be on the final/midterm. decent class for gec

Not an "easy A." Dr. Pappas pulls the most random facts she spits out during lecture for the exams, so you're expected to basically write and memorize everything she says;if you don't go to lecture, you're screwed. Her TA, Seth, is hilarious and awesome, but sadly this was his last quarter. Hopefully he's replaced by someone half as good
She was a pretty good teacher who made lectures fly by due to her fast pace and ridiculous jokes.  The course is pretty tough, but she gives equations and stuff like that.

This woman is the most psychotic person I've ever seen. When she is not giggling like a nutcase or mumbling to the chalkboard, she is giving sub-par lectures that don't make a whole lot of sense. It doesn't help that the subject matter is difficult, and her tests are too... entertaining, but expect to learn from the book if you take her.

I was worried that I would do poorly since its chem but she was pretty clear with lecture, but sometimes too many facts were spouted out.  But overall the cushion of quizzes and recitation assignment made this class an easy A.  This is a good physical science GEC.  I would recommend to anyone!

Very solid teacher. Lectures can sometimes be a little overcomplicated, but for the most part a very fun and accessible teacher. Exams are pretty easy as well, work hard and you should get a good grade.

VERY enthusiastic about chemistry! Goes quickly and has difficult exams but is glad to help in her office hours and posts slides online. Makes bad jokes which lighten the mood and blows stuff up. Heard good things but was kinda disapointed overall.
Dr. Pappas was insane. The class itself was not hard but her lectures were unbearable. she just read her slides and laughed to herself. Avoid her if you can

She's very nice but her tests are WAY too difficult. Her tests are meant to "stump the chump" and purposely "weed out" people from the pre-med fields. If you want to actually learn chemistry, don't take her. If you want to get a good grade in chemistry, don't take her.
She is crazy but fun. She want to help students, especially in office hours. Her exams are not too bad.
Eccentric and good-spirited, but can be hazy on the details. Still one of the more enthusiastic teachers I've seen~
Her lectures are long and boring.  She doesn't explain things well, and is completely crazy.  If you can teach yourself take her class.  If not AVOID TAKING HER CLASS.  Her test are also very hard.

I've found chemistry very hard to learn from her. She is hard to follow in lecture and she's a bit crazy. In addition, she makes a LOT of mistakes so that doesn't help either. Her exams are tough. If you need to go to lecture to learn then don't take her...you won't learn from her, you're better off teaching your self.
I realized that professors are crazy because of her! She is a great teacher though and loves what she does. Some of her experiments are scary. Sit between the middle and the back! This is an easy GEC

Barb is a crazy woman. She'll go off on tangents and do insane experiments during class so I stopped going to class. I taught myself chem from the book and ended up getting an A. Exams are easy. Take her if you don't want to go to class but still want an A (with some work involved).

She is truly there for the student. She will help you out, the information is hard but overall she makes it clear. I would encourage others to take her. She is a little crazy though, but then again it is the chemistry department.
there's no doubt that going to lecture helped me get my grade.  She's an amazing professor and I actually wanted to go to her class. She was extremely helpful too

She is very enthusiastic and crazy, which makes it easy to pay attention in lecture. However, I would recommend her more for 122 than 123. It was her first time teaching 123, and she rushed and was kind of all over the place. In general, Pappas exams I hear are more forgiving than the rest of the chem dept. I hear she's way better than Loza.

She was pretty easy and straightforward, however her lectures are awful. I learned everything from the book which is awesome by the way. If you want an A take her, if you want to actually learn chemistry i recommend someone else.

dr. pappas is very nice teacher, her exams are easy, actually to the point, i would say just go over her notes and you will be in a good shape, well sometimes she is not clear on her concepts but if u r the one who cares about getting A , take her!!!

Love her! She is so fun and loves what she does. Her demonstrations are halarious. She is a very fair teacher and she is always very willing to help. She gives you her lecture notes on carmen, but actually going to her lectures is very beneficial. Great teacher I learned a lot from her!
Very enthusiastic! Really fun and crazy(in a good way).  Her quizzes are easy and to the point.  Her midterms are also fairly easy.  Just do the practice midterms and you'll be fine.
She was entertaining and a good lecturer. Her tests were fair and she's very helpful during office hours. Truly recommended.
Very entertaining and informative professor. Looked forward to lecture every week due to her teaching method and fun atmosphere.
One of the nicest proffessors in a very evil chemistry department.  Taker her if you get a chance!

Dr. Pappas is the bomb.  Take her if you can.  She is one of the nicest chem professors around and she actually wants you to succeed in her class.  Go to class, she gives problems from the test during class.  Take Dr. Pappas for chem, its the right choice.

great professor, excited to be teaching, add real world examples, doesnt read from book, provides pre-made notes that she follows losely allowing you to add your own onto her printouts. best chem prof ever.
She's amazing. Take her. Take her. Take her.

This class will separate those who CAN from those who CAN NOT. Unfortunately, I was one of the latter. Dr. Pappas is very fair and nice. Her tests were pretty hard. Labs and quizzes were cake. Don't think for one moment that because you're acing the labs and quizzes that you'll do well in this class.

I LOVE Dr. Pappas! She's absolutely crazy but has the most fun personality. Actually makes chem interesting. The class is challenging but not impossible. Same goes for the tests. Pay attention in lecture and take good notes... and you should do fine on the exams. She is very fair.

Pappas is a great teacher. Her first midterm isnt too bad.  The review sessions are worthless because the TA's dont speak english very well.  Her second Midterm is a royal pain in the butt.  The final is like the second midterm. HARD!!!. All I have to say is good luck.
Dr. Pappas was a fairly easy teacher as far as her exams & quizzes. Chemistry is not an easy topic but she helped make it better. Go to her for help & do NOT fall behind.

I enjoyed Dr. Pappas's class.  In chemistry courses in general, reading the book is extremely helpful.  It was nice that Dr. Pappas did not simply read from the book, she actually taught.  If you went by her office hours, she was extremely helpful.  She likes to put questions on the test based solely on class info.  Tests were tough, but it's chem.
I only read the textbook and got an A since class and the text overlap so much.  She is a great prof for the few times I went.  Pretty big curve.  Had an 88, class avg. was 67 and got an A.

Dr. Pappas is a very good professor and does all she can to help students. I really enjoyed taking this class with her. The homework problems helped a lot. It is a lot of work but it's possible to do very well.

I took CHEM 121 a YEAR AGO.  and I had an A without a curve.  She gives powerpoints for notes and is extremely organized.  I didn't touch the book.  All you need to do is GO TO CLASS and then study the powerpoints she gives, and follow her problems.  The quizzes, midterms, and final were a breeze.  If you dont do well, try working harder...it helps
Dr. Pappas was overall an ok teacher.  She gives a ton of notes which i thought were too much. The tests aren't that bad but make sure to read the book and pay attention, if you can
Very very nice lady, but a terrible professor. Giggles from time to time and it is SO annoying. The book and the TA's taught me much more than she did. I should have taken Zellmer 's class instead.
Dr. Pappas is really organized and is always willing to help if you have a question. She explains everything well from the notes and always lets you know what parts of the notes are most important.
Easy class, even though chemistry is very boring. Work load is kinda big, but the material isn't too bad. She's tries to make class fun, and succeeds sometimes.

I thought Dr. Pappas was awesome!  I still go visit her sometimes.  She's funny and did cool demos.  A lot of times she told kids who came to class on Fridays (there were very few), exact questions that would be on an exam.  Read and do homework, you'll be fine.  Overall, one of the best profs i've had here.

Dr. Pappas was a little crazy, but I found the class to be very easy.  A lot of her exams came from class lecture rather than recitation and the homework, so it was important to attend class.  I thought she was really nice and a good teacher.  She even took our comments halfway through the quarter and changed her teaching style.

She is really nice & fun, but she's kinda scatter brained.  You need to go to every class and take notes because it A. is on the exam and homework, and B. if people stop going she starts taking random attendance w/ no warning.   She tries really hard to make the class fun and interesting, and I hated Chem. all my life, but this class wasn't too bad
kinda off the wall.....

shes kinda loopy... but manages to keep your attentionfor most of the time... her final was impossible and the average was a 52... ouch.  i would not recommend her but if you have to take her its not the end of the world... i dont its her.. its the material

she does not explain examples well. she will starts a problem on the board and rarely finishes it. the examples are somewhat helpful, if you can understand what the heck she is doing or can read the board for that matter. her exams are extremely difficult and the quizes are decent.

Dr. Pappas made this class interesting, she always had some kind of joke which made me want to pay attention to chemistry more. If you attend the lectures she gives you exact examples of the problems she likes to ask, and she generally will say "this is on the exam" or something else along those lines. Do the homework problems, it got me an A.

She is unorganized. She did examples of easy problems and just explained verbally the tougher ones. No wonder the class average for the final was a 52%. Nice and helpful person. But definetely among the worst as a professor.
She is hilarious.
No Comments
Hard class take 101

This class sucked!  If you can take 101 do that.  This professor showed no mercy when it came to grading.  I attended all lectures, reviews, and went to her office hours so much she knew my name (so did the tutor room TA's).  I still failed by 5 points and she wouldn't give me the extra points to pass.

A little crazy, but in an entertaining/amusing way. Her demos were really cool. The tests are very easy if you pay attention in class, do the homework, and look over the practice exams she posts online. Just don't piss her off. It's not pretty.

Best Chem Prof! She's very funny and nice. Makes eveything sound interesting. Awesome demos! Her midterms and final are so straight foward and never tries to trick anyone. Very easy. She likes class participation and wants people to really learn the material. She gave us candy for Halloween and overall, SHE'S GREAT!
I hated this class and her exams are really hard. If you have to take  121 take woodward.. he's the best
i don't like chem at all, but from what i've heard, we got probably the best chem professor there is so i'm not gonna complain...
i hate her and she sucks at teaching. you basically have to teach youself everything.

In this class, there is one equation: science = fire.  And explosions.  She does a lot of awesome demos in class, and the vast enthusiasm she has for her subject shines through in her lectures.  I don't particularly like chem, so when she goes thru slides its a bit boring, but you can get printouts of the notes.  Just study.  You'll be fine.
No Comments
UGH this class sucked... and the exams were a ****
Pappas made chemistry as good as it could be for me.
she was a little insane but it made the class interesting. she's a fun prof

Pappas is a crazy woman.  at first i thought she'd keep the class entertaining.. then again how entertaining can chem be right?? i stopped goin' to lecture after awhile because she got annoying.  her exams were pretty easy.. u really just can't tell with her..
I appreciated her enthusiasm, but she could be all over the place at times.
Like Dr. Pappas a lot.  Easy if you do all the work.  An added plus: she dressed up for Halloween.
you can't win with a chem class. she's loud so you won't fall asleep. other than that, you have to figure everything out on your own cuz she's too excited to explain in depth.
very crazy woman, but a great teacher and is very interested in teaching

I cannot stand Dr. Pappas... I do not understand how anyone can give her a good rating. This is ridiculous -- and the curve was boo boo too. I wish I could go back in time and have another teacher. Stay off the crack!
good teacher, really into chemistry. sometimes is hard to understand her meaning unless you are a chem wiz. other than that is ur basic chemistry weed out class. but she is a good prof.
Good professor, entertaining as far as professors go.  As long as you study the material, you should do fine with this prof.

Dr. Pappas is kinda crazy, but she keeps you awake and attentive during class with her cool experiments and lame yet funny jokes (her laugh gets annoying though). Explains material well and is always willing to help. Take home quizzes make the class even easier.

She may appear to be a good teacher however I dont think she cares about the students. She wouldnt let me take the quiz just bc i missed the recitation. It was my fault but i mean i pay the tuition just like everyone else and i am also tryin to do well in class.Good thing i had a good TA.
Yes, this professor is nuts, but she is still cool. She blew off her fingernails during one demo so just don't sit to close to the front.
very interesting. great demos
She's crazy in a way that makes you like going to class.

a very interesting lady, thank god for study sessions- go if you need help before a test or just if you want to know what's going to be on it! demonstrations in the class were cool, just a lot of note taking
Not bad, very understanding...  uses demonstrations and corny jokes to keep class a bit more interesting.

She was so sweet. I hate chemistry and I went to almost all of her office hours to get help. She really rewards students who go out of their way to participate and truly understand the material, recognizing that profiency in chem is not innate for all!

I felt like she went off topic in lecture a lot.  Her laugh we really annoying, and she laughs at her own jokes which aren't funny. Has to erase examples 35 times, which make your notes look like chicken scratch.
Thank God for a good TA
Great lecturer and great person. Very enthusiastic, which is a huge plus.
odd lady- annoyed me very much.. I sat front 'n' center alllll the darn time... and she seemed to look up (huge hall she lectured to) instead of at the people up close... seemed odd.
Nice lady
Wierd, class is easy if you attend most of the lectures
Dr. Pappas is the best! I learned so much from her...too bad Zellmer can't teach 122 this well....

I agree that she is very energetic, and understands that not everyone loves chemistry as much as she does.  Her grading is very fair, and I'm glad she can acknowledge that not just chemistry majors take this class.  I hate science, but she makes it fun!

She does a good job converying the material. Has a lot of energy during lectures. The exams aren't too bad if you do the homework. The labs get annoying, because they are soo picky. Good professor makes a crap subject a more tolerable.
Very good lecturer. very enthusiastic and always willing to help. her tests are always straightfoward. great class to take.

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as one of the worst at Ohio State University, known for unhelpful lectures, unclear notes, and dismissive attitudes towards students' knowledge levels. Exams are challenging and not closely aligned with practice materials, and students strongly advise against taking his class unless absolutely necessary.

Ratings.comment: Wonderful man

His notes aren't readable. You can't understand him when he talks and when you can he makes comments about how stupid you are for not knowing something. Soh ow are you supposed to learn?? Worst teacher I have ever had at OSU. DO NOT TAKE, DROP IF HE TEACHES IT!!!
During review sessions, he tells student that they should know that, and doesn't really answer good questions
Not the guy you want to take for coherent notes. Exams are dervived from the notes, but are pretty difficult. Beware the road map problem, there is one on every test.

He's the worst teacher I've had at OSU.  Despite what everyone else says, reading the book before lecture makes it much easier to understand him. Memorize all the reactions which are provided to you including the mechanisms and any byproducts.  Don't depend on his exams similarity to practice exams.

He was probably one of the worst teachers I have had. I highly recommend switching out of his class if you have him. He is very sloppy with his notes and does not follow the text book. If you have him find someone to study with.

It took a few classes to be able to understand him, and even then I learned nothing from him. However, even putting almost no effort into the class I got a B-. What made me mad was that originally they posted a B as my grade; three days later they changed it to a B- w/ no explanation. Who does that? So glad I'm done w/ OSU's chem department.

Plan to teach yourself. The quizzes are more difficult to figure out what he's asking than to figure out the actual chemistry.  He will spend a lot of the time lecturing on things "you won't need to know for this course."

If you want a professor who will really teach you the material, dont take him. But if you want an easy A go for it. His exams come straight from the notes and the quizzes are really easy. Really helpful guy. If you really want to learn ochem be prepared to learn it yourself.

I've taken him and have gotten to 255. If you study with an active and engaging attitude, you'll do just as fine as with any other professor. He does have an accent and his notes are kinda sloppy, but he teaches directly from his notes and they're all posted online. His quizzes are pretty easy, and his tests are a little bit harder.

Just terrible. Had him for 251, learned absolutely nothing and much to my dismay, got stuck with him again for 252. I'm finishing out the quarter but I'm retaking 252 next quarter. In fact coming in to 251, our TA even told our class "I hope none of you plan on taking 253 or you're screwed."
Nicest teacher I've ever had.  Do not take him if you are planning on taking Chem 254 and chem 255 with Callam, it will be a hard transition.  Just memorize his notes and go over practice exams.

Not as horrible if you know how to study on your own. Quizzes and exams come from his notes, which are all online, and he explains them in class. It's paying attention that is hard, and he likes to mumble. Amazing TAs, and quizzes in lectures on Friday I enjoyed because it meant recitation was all for questions. Don't take if need chem for major.

Everyone, hes not that bad. his notes are quite messy and he does have an accent. 1st lec i barely understood him, but ull get used to it. notes are all online and quizzes fairly easy. he's not that hard, im only 17 and im doing quite well in the class despite sleeping in every lec for the past 4 weeks. read the book and study the notes and ur good

most worthless teacher i've ever had. i'm in the fourth week of his class (getting ready to drop might i add) and all i've learned is that carbon has four bonds. notes don't go with the book at all and doing practice problems is a waste of your time. quizzes on overheads during lecture?? his notes are ridiculous and illegible. don't hurt your gpa.

Very nice guy.. Had him for 251 and 252. Hard to get used to but very predictable after taking a midterm or two.  Did well in both classes but struggling in 253 now because he skipped alot.  Notes are messy but coming to lecture helps.  All tests are from notes, so study those!!

Notes are posted online, but hard to read and follow. Coming to the lectures will save you the troubles. Don't bother reading the book or doing the suggested HW because nothing like those will be on tests. However, STUDY EVERYTHING from HIS NOTES and be able to "mess" around a bit is a must! 95% of the Q/MT are from the NOTES. So, study them!

Oh dear, very nice man who is prolly interested in research more than teaching. So hard to understand, especially as your first OChem class. Had no idea what to expect on exams, barely passed & didn't learn too much. I suggest trying to take other professors if possible.
Awful. Mumbles all throughout lectures, notes are not only completely incomprehensible, they frequently contain typos and his tests are impossible.

I hate when people say Fraenkel is a terrible teacher. He knows what he is talking about, and he does not try to trick you like alot of other professors. Just like any other prof., if you study you will get a good grade, he is no different. Personally I thought he was not bad.

EASIEST PROFESSOR EVER!!!!  no need to go to lecture/read the book/ ect...just memorize his notes and you will get an A without a doubt!!!  absolutely love him...and he's incredibly nice and helpful if you go to his officce hours!

that picture is at least 20 years old. Picture a frail, old British man with a hunched back and a limp and you've got him. Class is alright. Study the notes. If you take him, at least you'll be amused by his constant adjusting of the overhead and his favorite phrases, and the way he thinks the mic. is broken but it's just him all the time.

Fraenkel is very knowledgeable, and in person he much more helpful than in lecture. He is somewhat hard to understand sometimes. It is very important that you go to lecture, as everything is based on the notes. He puts them online, but he corrects and adds to them in class. His quizzes are sometimes tricky, but not too bad. Exams are pretty tough.

Fraenkel is the worst professor I have had in 4 years at OSU. Sure, he posts all his notes online, and you don't have to attend one class, but half the battle is interpreting his notes and discerning what he will test on. When he says he curves, he means it. Provided practice exams are useless to prepare for his exams. Unless you need 231, avoid!
lectures are boring but he has all the lectures online
Dr. Frankel's class was the hardest class that I have every taken, I ended up dropping it with a W after getting a 36 on the midterm.

Dr. Fraenkel is the Real McCoy.  I like his lectures because he slips in little jokes that make you do a double take.  His exams are straightforward.  He never test you on anything he doesn't mention in lecture.  He also posts his notes online so attending lectures is optional.  I don't like his penmanship though.
i really really liked him a lot...no tricks...everything he tests you on has been discussed in class...so you dont waste your time on useless info...you still learn the basics.

I'd actually recommend taking Fraenkel.  He doesnt teach the greatest, but if you read the book before lectures the mumbling he does actually makes sense.  Furthermore if you memorize his notes (dont study anything but them) you'll basically have the exams.
terrible professor.... even if he does have his tenure, osu should cut their losses and get rid of him! do not take fraenkel!!!!!!!!!!!!

His class is the easiest in ochem.  As far as a teacher, hes not real great, but his exams are straight from his notes, so you dont even need to go to class.  You have two options: Take Callam, much tougher, but you WILL know ochem. 2nd option is take Fraenkel, get a good grade, but be potentially screwed for lab and another professor.
Not near as bad as everyone claims.  Every question on the test comes directly from his notes.  He is very fair and very smart.

I really don't know why everyone         gets on his case.  He isn't the easiest to understand but he posts all his notes on line and his exams are word for word out of his notes.  Just work hard and you'll be fine.

so i haven't had this guy for long but he is so funny and smart and is a great professor!!  you just have to givehim a chance.  he is not bad at all like everyone says on here.  i am taking him again for 252...love him!!

EASIEST OCHEM PROFESSOR OUT THERE!! when compared to Callam, Fraenkel is a cake walk!!!! u guys don't know how easy u have it with Fraekel. take Fraekel and study the heck out of his notes and u are guaranteed a good grade. DON'T TAKE CALLAM, HE'S OVER-RATED!
I think that it was mixture of me hating chemistry and the fact that he seems to think that we are/should be chem majors.  He is just a crotchety old man who needs to retire.

Thank God his notes were posted online.His handwriting was terrible and made no sense in lecture.   He expects you to write out the by-products unlike Callam in 251, so I lost several points because of that on the first quiz.

The worst professor I've ever had.  Doesn't let you ask questions during class, scribles on the board, and has a hard to understand accent.  He also looks irritated if you bother him in his office during office hours.  I ended up paying for a private tutor so I could pass his class and have a clue for 252.

I took this guy's ochem class in 1999, and it still stands out as the worst class I ever took in my undergrad career.  The only reason I got an A was because I read the textbook- the guy's tests were based on his lectures, but you couldn't understand a thing he said (more like mumbled, actually), and his handwriting was completely illegible.
No Comments

Although he was not the best teacher, he was very fair.  There was nothing on his tests that were not in the notes.  If you went to class every day and took notes, your grade directly reflects how much you studied.  Curve was good.  I wouldnt rule him out if you are willing to study (which you have to a lot no matter what prof)
He wasn't really that bad, as long as you memorized the notes and the practice exams his tests were easy.  He is a stickler for details though and his handwriting stinks.
easy but he grades hard. Instead of beating curves you must beat percents like the ACT.

Terrible teacher, lectures were unbearably boring and nothing is taught clearly, but you must go because the tests are based solely on his lecture notes, that is the only reason anyone goes, but from what I've heard and seen, his tests are easier than other Ochem teachers' tests

didn't have him for lecture, went to increase ochem knowledge, heh, don't, he'll put you to sleep, VERY unclear, moreso than Bong, really needs to retire, he is personable but you can do better, also, exams look HARD from what i've seen,

Fraenkel is by far the worst professor that I have had since starting college.  He is hard to understand, as he mumbles all the time.  His notes are very hard to read and all over the place.  His tests are also difficult.  Anything I learned I picked up from my TA.  DO NOT TAKE CHEM 251 WITH FRAENKEL!!!!
atrocious, horrible, words cannot describe his complete hidebound myopia and utter incompetence
He's a nice guy, kind of senile.

the worst professor ever. I like chemistry, but this class really makes me so frustrated cause i can hardly understand anything. Notes are really hard to read, and his strong british accent makes it hard to understand him. regret staying in his class..
if you get fraenkel, switch out asap

Gideon is quite entertaining although not purposely..  His midterms are fair as they follow the practice test almost exactly but there is little else credit in the class if you do screw up...*memorize* notes if you can read them...
He is hard to understand because he mumbles

Lectures are basically mind-numbing. He's pretty monotonous, and the notes are hard to read. But he's suprisingly funny, and his tests are pretty easy if you do the work (read the book, go to class, etc.) My friends and I always played hangman or that dots game in class with one ear on Fraenkel.
This guy is brilliant.  Some people in my class couldn't get past his English accent.  Most of those people didn't pass the class I would imagine.

I enjoyed him writing everything out on the board...made him go slower so that I could stay with him. Writing can be hard to read at times. His practice exams didn't reflect the material on the actual exam. He kept telling our class that we should take at least 2 or 3 more chemistry classes. I did better in this class than gen chem.
Hard class, but not impossible.

Here's the deal.  Study his notes, and do the practice exams ahead of time, and your golden.  He's very funny, and more than happy to answer questions in office hours. Some people don't care for his style of teaching, but if you like to take notes from the chalk board/online notes, and follow them, then you'll enjoy him.

i really liked dr fraenkel. he is quite brilliant and his class really is not that difficult if you study. i got a B and worked less than i did in general chemistry. his notes are kindof unclear though, i often had to look hard to find the hidden mechanisms within.
Very poor notes and hard to understand
impossible to understand, chicken-scratch writing, do not take him if possible.  if you have him, study the practice exams over & over
He was an ok lecturer but I did learn a lot from him.

As a person, Gideon was the****.  He was like this cute old English guy who does OCHEM...well I guess thats exactly what he is.  Anyway his teaching skills are sub-par even tho he's been teaching for 80-some odd years (give or take)  But I got an A- and an A in his classes, so once u get used to him just cram the night b4 exams and u'll be fine.

although i hated the man, his class is actually kind of easy if you just study his notes and learn the mechanisms and practice tests...i got a the averages for the tests were sometimes like 50%...but his curve is amazing...wish i had him for 253

Had him back in 95. Got an A in the class, but his grading was tough.  He once kicked me out of his office during his office hours...he felt the need to finish his twinkie instead.  If you require the aid of a prof to learn material, i would drop his class

Unbearable lectures and relentless with grading and class policy.  Even his TAs hated the way he did things and gave us slack.  The class had a great curve though, it got me a B out of nowhere.  Avoid this prof like the plague.

This guy sucks! worst professor I have ever had, his handwriting is disgusting, his lectures suck, his notes make no sense, this guy needs to retire right now. i got yelled at by him when i went to his office hours, what kind of professor does that? his grading methods are ridiculous and even his own TA's talk him down.

Dr Fraenkel is not that bad a professor if you just skip class and jsut read his notes outside of class. Midterms and tests are from notes exactly. Lectures are horrible due to his constant bickering like an old man trying to send back soup at a deli.

i cant understand why people have a problem with this guy. hes actually funny, brilliant, easy to understand and can write a mechanism in all its glory for almost any reaction. dr. fraenkel is the real mccoy professor!

His lecture is one continuous ramble.  Constant bickering about his mic or chalkboard not working... His notes are hard to decipher, but if you read the book you can do decent in his class.  Occasionally he will throw you a curve ball on an exam, but he's not impossible.  Averages on tests are ~60%

O-chem is already hard enough and he makes it even more difficult than it really is.  He tests on weird things and not the basic stuff. Maybe he is a great researcher or theorist, but he sure sux at teaching.  All I can say is read  the book before hand and study his notes like crazy.
crazy old man. he knows things in his head and rambles it out expecting us to grasp it with ease.

Even the best students complain of his unclearity as he floats in and out of topics with examples that are not usually in the book.  He makes mistakes in class notes and sends a vague explanation in an E-mail. He doesn’t clarify to students in class. Then you are tested on it.

It's very easy to sleep in his lectures but if you can actually pay attention and take notes, he's not that bad. his exams are from notes (lecture and rec.) but some of the questions are not straight forward. He jumps around  in the book A LOT so study from notes. I crammed b4 midterms and got a B.

He is not the worst professor ever as some would like to have you believe, but he's not one of the all-time greats either. Tests often deviate a lot from the notes, and he gives very little (actually no) partial credit. Can be unclear in lectures and doesn't like giving keys to practice exams.

He really wasn't a bad professor, but his lectures were sometimes hard to pay attention to.  Just make sure you don't fall behind, and always study for quizzes, etc.  Flashcards are really helpful since he follows his notes on tests.
Ugh...full credit or no credit...all over punctuation?
He's not near as bad as everyone makes him out to be.  Pay attention in class and read your book before lecture and you'll follow along with everything he says.  Fraenkel's a good guy.
If you have to take this guy, pray that you have a really good TA.

Read the book before lectures! When you do you find that his lectures organize the material well. If you don't read the book chances are you'll get more lost during class. Tests of the lectures, of course, so go to class.

He is by far the worst professor at OSU.  He doesn't care about his students and could care less if anyone learned anything.  His notes are very messy and jumps from chapter to chapter in the book.  His grading is very unfair. I would not take the class if he is your only option.  Absolutely horrid!
he isnt as bad as everyone claims!

Its pretty wierd to see people hating Dr.Fraenkel. I for one think he is an awesome teacher, i do admit he is a little wierd at first but if you pay close attention to him everything you need to know is in your notes. He actually made me get relly interested in chemistry.

He's not really all that bad.  As long as you read the book and do the homework, you can understand him because you will know the concepts.  Must go to class and pay attention to do well, but most classes are like that.  Just do the work and you should be fine.
do not take him!!!
It was like learning Organic Chemistry from OZZY Osbourne.  He is by far the worst professor I have ever had.  He makes no sense at all just rambles and is not interested in teaching what-so ever.

He is the worst teacher I've ever had in my life.  He cares very little about his students and his teaching is all over the place.  His tests weren't too bad, but I wouldn't take him again if I had the choice.

He was by far one of the worst prof I have had at OSU (i've been there for 3 years).  For example, he gives us a practice final BUT does not give us the answer key and when a student asks him to give the answers he replies that they are in our notes!
Worst chem teacher ever, had him for 251, screwed me up in 252 b/c i didn't know anything, ahhh!! you ruined my liking for organic chemistry, thanks dr. frankel!

His lectures are hard to match to the material in the book, and he often lectures out of order to the material posted on the web.  I spend more time figuring out what he is talking about, than actually studying.  I would recommend not taking his class.

he is thw worst prof in the chem department.he will make his first midterm easy and from his notes,and the secand midterm will come from no where ... any ways drop himm immidiatly if u can  or it will take u 2 years to finish the organic series

Awful! Lectures are hard to understand, tests are totally random material. I went from an A in 251 to a barely getting a D in 252 and ended up having to retake the class altogether because I learned NOTHING from him. Change professors if you get him.

This guy sucks. When i got to 252 I had no idea what I was doing! My 252 prof kept saying, "and since you learned this in 251, we won't go over it". Only problem- I learned NOTHING in 251. Dr, Fraenkel was the worst prof ever. His handwriting is

In my 3 years here, he is by far the worst prof I have ever had.  Mumbles about nothing like the senile man he is.  Book has nothing to do with the exams.  You have to MEMORIZE his lectures to get anywhere.  And that is not fun. Please take another prof!
I never understood what he was talking about.
he is horrible!!! The worst time of my life! The final came out of nowhere.  Not a good professor.
No Comments

Fraenkel is VERY unclear when he goes over lectures in class.  His tests are pretty similar to the practice exams, but just be prepared for a few surprises and to be able to study hard.  It helps a lot to study in groups.
worst teacher I have ever had!!! everyone I know agrees with me. He jumps topics, changes subjects in the middle of sentences, and wonders why you don't understand.

Tea and crumpets anyone?English accents are hot unless you're trying to learn ochem from a fossil with an attitude.All the tests come straight from his notes so you have to suffer through the bloody lectures. Although his terets attacks are amusing.

Unclear, tests on subject matter mostly irrelevant to topics covered in lecture, used the most horribly written test for a final i have ever encountered.  Immense thanks to Dr. Fraenkel for cutting my consistent A to a lousy B-  Did I mention senile?
Best OCHEM teacher I ever had.  Sure he's old, but if you pay attention to the lectures and really study your notes, you don't even need the book, unlike other professors.
He is not very helpful to students.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
he's horrible at getting the point across, but tests are easiest out of all...
No Comments
No Comments
His lectures are confusing.  Skip them; read the book instead.
Don't take him if you can't.  If you must then make sure to read the book
must learn material outside of class
Worst teacher ever...must use pen for test, does not give partial credit.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his clarity and thoroughness, with crystal clear notes and effective office hours. However, his exams are known to be challenging and often cover material not explicitly covered in class or the textbook, making them difficult to prepare for. Overall, while students find him knowledgeable and helpful, the class demands significant effort and can be frustrating due to its difficulty.

Ratings.comment: Amazing professor, tells you from the get go that anything on the board is fair game for the exam & he kept his word. Does not try to trick you (still difficult midterms tho), midterms are 5 short but hard pages. His notes are crystal clear, & hes quite funny. Best ochem prof ive had at OSU, hes fair yet difficult, so you learn a lot in his class.

VE was an okay professor. His lectures were good and I feel like I learned a lot, but his exams were RIDICULOUS. I did okay in the end, but I had no idea how to study for his exams. He asked a lot of conceptual problems that never crossed my mind or were mentioned in the book. Helpful office hours, though, and a fairly nice guy.

Liked him as a professor and quizzes were very basic, but exams were killer and there is no way to come back from a bad score because that's the bulk of the class. Very hard to put into this class the time it needs to do well when I had other classes to worry about too

VE was clear in his notes and expects you to do the work to get what you want in the class. His problem sets are key to learning and so are his office hours. He is amazing at teaching and even better one on one. He cares for his students. His tests are hard but once you see the answer, you learn more and it clicks. Not many recitations or quizzes.

Taking VE's class was very frustrating.  This semester we had 4 quizzes, 2 midterms, and a final.  About 30% of exams was O chem problem solving, which was annoying because he gave us no skills to work through problems we have not seen before.  I went to Callam's office hours to get help since week 1 of this class.  DO NOT TAKE
Tests were tough, but he wanted students to do well.  He was very helpful in office hours.  I would recommend him
The class doesn't have many points to boost your grade and exams are more difficult then any problems you'll practice. Office hours can be helpful, but exam material is always a surprise.

Honestly the worst professor I've had at OSU. Jumps around and does not follow the book, doesn't use powerpoints or online notes. His tests are irrelevant to the book material because he stretches it to extreme application-type questions. Do not take if you have another option. Awful

The biggest complaints I have about this class is lack of practice material and the fact that the exams were so much harder than examples given in lecturerecitation. I worked hard in this class and did not receive the grade I wanted. He is definitely not willing to get a lot of partial credit or ways to boost your grade (3 exams, 4 quizzes)

Horrible professor. Good professor to take if you want to learn the material but can afford to sacrifice the grade. Do not take him if you need an A or any soft of good grade.  Extremely picky on quizzes and exams, barely awards any partial credit, and other professors teaching this subject are way more lenient. Impossible grader.

This class was taught terribly. I don't understand why power points were not used. If power points would have been used then the class would have been a lot better organized and we could have covered many more examples, which would have greatly helped me. I learned nothing from lecture even though i attended every single class.

Dr. VE knows what he's talking about when it which makes it sort of difficult for him to make the material understandable and accessible to students. There were three exams including the final and all of them had a lot of material jammed into them. The exams are LOOSELY based on lecture, and the exam problems are way harder than examples.

He is a good teacher, and I honestly feel like I have learned Ochem II well. However, his exams are completely unrelated to class.  Approximately half of his exams are extreme applications of what we learned.  I would recommend Anita Mattson over him simply because her exams are more straight forward.
He is not clear during lectures and his tests are not representational of course content. I truly believe that he does not know what he is doing.

His lectures are piecemeal and do not follow the book. It does not matter how much you study as his tests do not represent the content of the chapters. I studied just as much as 2510 (received an A) and took the tests and wasn't even sure what I was looking at. Take the other professors if you want to actually learn the content.

His lectures are easy enough to follow and he tells you exactly what section of the book the info is from so you can look it up for more clarification later. No surprises on quizzestests but you need to study A LOT to do well. For me, I had to go to every lecture and then read and take my own notes on the chapters before doing anything else.

He is a decent professor. He only explained things one time at a very slow pace and then reused it on the problem sets and then the exam. The thing I disliked the most was his use of a conceptual problem worth 10% of every exam, all or nothing points style. Those were confusing. Other than that, fair professor, decent(boring) guy.

He teaches you very well and everything is laid out at the beginning on how he grades, so there is no mystery to what you will receive. For example, an A is a 91 instead of a 93 and that goes all the way down to a C- at 56. His exams are fair and from his notes so he is not trying to trick you. Pay attention, study up, and you will do well.

Dr VE was much harder than Dr Badjic whom I had for 2510. The averages were all so high so there was tons of pressure and there was so much to study. He is a cool guy and all but I didn't really like his approach to teaching and felt overloaded and overwhelmed very often, something I'm not used to.

I loved having Dr. VE for Chem 2520! If you go to office hours regularly it is very easy to get to know him. I admit I learned more and was challenged more in class with Dr. Callam, but VE made OChem challenging but manageable. Very fair professor. Definitely recommend.

You cannot ask for a better organic chemistry professor. I had Dr. VE for both 2510 and 2520 and compared to the horror stories I have heard about other o-chem professors, I feel Dr. VE was outstanding. His exams are extremely fair (I rarely consulted the textbook and received A's in the class). Grading scale is fair and he will also curve a little

Excellent professor. Super helpful whenever you have questions, whether in office hours, via email, or before/after class. You can tell he's genuinely interested in helping you learn. Do the book problems and problem sets and you'll do fine in this class!

He is a difficult professor but is by far one of the best professors at OSU, at least in the chemistry department. You have to put in a lot of work but he is more than helpful if you ask. He lectures right from the book so you can follow everything very easily. He is clear and concise. Put in the work from the beginning and you'll do very well.

Dr. VE is alright at best. He for sure wasn't the worst professor I've had, but nothing special. His notes are oversimplified to the point where it feels like you aren't getting the full picture, and then he would slam you on some obscure topic on an exam. I definitely would have taken Callam over VE if Callam was teaching 2520 this semester.

Dr. VE is way overrated. I don't understand what all of the other reviews are talking about, but he does not understand any students problems at all. He says that he's not going to curve the class. His exams are made to trick you. He changed his complete exam format. I would recommend taking Callam instead. Don't waste your time with VE.
Very organized, very clear! Work hard and you will get an A in his class.

Dr. VE was an okay professor. He contradicted the boot a few times and would get angry with me when I showed him that what he was teaching was actually incorrect. He also scolded me for using another book as an aid when I didn't understand a concept in the assigned text. I received a good grade in this class mostly from reading the book.

Professor VE is by far one the best organic chemistry instructor. He is clear, concise, and practical. Furthermore, he was a TA for Organic Chemistry through his undergraduate and graduate and can teach like no other. Finally, he is an extremely relatable professor and is completely understanding of any situation and will help you no matter what.
Very thorough lectures, went through the labs with detail and explained all lab steps and mechanisms. There really were no surprises in this class. Super chill professor

I can't stress how good of a teacher he is to have - it makes for a pretty unstressful ochem experience. He is always prepared and is excellent at explaining concepts. He is very clear and consistent with what will be on quizzes/exams. Work hard and you will earn an A.

Great professor.  If you put in the time in his class you'll get a good grade.  Teaches right from the book and doesn't trick you.  I had both Callam and Vanden Eynden.  I would recommend Vanden Eynden.

Great professor I would say as good as Callam.  His notes are extremely organized, the problem sets are well designed, and he is young enough to be able to understand and sympathize with the students.

Seriously the best Chemistry professor I have ever had.  His tests are very straight forward and the problem sets give you a good idea of what to expect on them.  Notes are very well organized and he gives fun starters that relate chemistry to the real world. Would highly recommend for pre-meds

His notes are extremely organized and he outlines everything he will be talking about so you know what to expect.  Midterms are only on what he's covered in class, usually with a tough bonus question.  Highly highly highly recommend him if you can.

An absolutely amazing professor. Organized, down to earth, approachable, intelligent and interesting. His notes are easy to follow and he gives you plenty to practice. Exams and quizzes are fair to what he teachers. Probably the best professor you can get for organic.

He is SUPER organized with his notes and explains everything extremely clearly. Mechanisms were very easy to follow, and he was very fair with quizzes and exams. Hands down one of the best chemistry professors here, even though he's newer. I HIGHLY recommend him for organic!!
Hardest lab TA ever, good thing Callam made the midterms worth so much

summary_comment: Dr. Hart is a passionate and approachable professor who excels in office hours but struggles with lecture clarity and note organization. Students appreciate his fairness in testing, though some find his exams challenging and time-consuming. Overall, while opinions vary, many recommend his classes due to his dedication and fairness.

Ratings.comment: Lectures were sometimes confusing and the notes were unorganized, but he is good at explaining certain concepts. He is SUPER helpful when you go into his office hours . Nice guy who is passionate about chemistry and wants the class to do well. Work hard, if he sees your effort you'll be fine. Overall I would take his class again.
Dr. Hart explained things extremely well.  He organized his notes so that it followed along in the book which made things much easier.  I would recommend him to anyone!!
Hart was very easy to understand. His tests followed the notes and the book. While they weren't easy, they were definitely fair.
He is a great professor but his final is really heard.As long as you read and keep up with book problems you will be fine. Very friendly and approachable for office hours.

Dr. Hart is a very sweet guy but he needs to retire. He constantly rewrites equations because he can't remember how they really go and his exams are way too long for the 48 minutes you get to complete them! He's obviously brilliant but he just has a hard time communicating the material to his students.

Awesome professor and person in general. He is very fair with his tests except for his final was pretty tricky and off subject. I definitely recommend him. Best o chem prof at OSU, period. P.S.- He really likes mechanisms with H2SO4.

Uh... definitely not that great of a professor. How the hell do you get an A- in his class?! You have to teach yourself everything. He was a nice guy, and apparently retired, but you could definitely tell he was a bit out of touch with lecturing.
Fabulous teacher -- I'm awful at ochem and have a solid A-.  I recommend reading the book sections before going to the exams.  Definitely would recommend :)
unclear, hard
Dr. Hart is awesome. His tests aren't very fair and not too challenging. He makes things fairly interesting and definitely clear. Definitely recommend taking him!
the only people who like him are the hippies who one day hope to make their own personal meth lab, get a life and stop smoking joints, i did bad but because i didn't care
Horrible prof.  You would be better off skipping lectures and just studying the textbook and practice exams.
He's a pretty decent teacher. Plus, he's got a sweet pony nub.
I hated chem, but he was awesome. Best prof at OSU that I had (including undergrad and grad).

The other posts are old, this guy admitted he is burned out and retiring soon. He ridicules students and hates teaching, he is very lazy and often inacurate in teaching certain concepts. He blaims his mistakes on the students, one of the worst in the department, avoid and take with Callam if he teaches it.

I was a continuing ed student, and all I can say is that the bad reviews here come from lazy whiners who don't know how to use a table of contents or an index in a book.  I was embarassed to be in this class with such losers.  I aced the second midterm, and missed one question on the final.  If you can read a book, you can pass this class.

Thank god this professor is retiring!  His class was miserable.  I worked really hard to stay up but you couldn't understand him! He seems like a nice guy but he just isn't clear when he teaches and his homework problems ARE NOT helpful!  I loved 252 and was very interested in learning the material of 253...the class was just terrible!

I don't think he is as bad as everyone is making him out to be.  His classes were enjoyable and if you do the homework problems you will be okay.  Go to his office hours, he is very helpful with any questions that you have.  I didn't think he was using a different book.  His notes followed our text pretty well.  Make sure you read.

I felt he was very unclear about what was important to know for this course.  His tests were confusing, and he taught from another book.  I thought he was a nice guy, but he really couldn't explain or relate to us, making it difficult to learn from him.  He was always saying we could figure the rest of a problem on our own time.  Avoid if possible.
Decent class if you had the book the guy was teaching out of

Alright, so the tests were pretty challenging, but I don't think he is spiteful as a person. It is EXTREMELY annoying that he teaches out of a different book, but I think he is pretty good at explaining things. The curve definitely sucks though. The avg. on the 1st midterm was a 57%, and he said that would be a D I think.
Horrible professor. Seems like a decent guy but is really a spiteful old man underneath. He really needs to reformulate his teaching strategies.

first midterm avg. was an F the grading is hard, he is unclear and rambles on pointlessly he teaches out of a diff book avoid him the other posts are not recent this guy is a looser he admits it because he is getting older
Great chem prof.  Great advice.
Easily confused by chem and he made it very understandable
No Comments
very fair, great o-chem teacher
Passionate about Organic Chem.

summary_comment: Dr. Sullivan is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and dedication to student success. Students appreciate his helpfulness, extra review sessions, and mock exams, which contribute to their preparedness. His classes are challenging yet rewarding, with many noting his commitment to ensuring students excel.

Ratings.comment: He had simple quizzes to pad your grade if you did badly on an exam. He was also extremely helpful and even held mock exams to ensure his students did really well.
Excellent Teacher. Always willing to help. Quizzes are straight forward.

A great professor who is extremely interested in helping his students. You could tell he wanted to be there and made an extra effort to help his students. Take this professor, he's the best I've heard of in the department

Brandon is really helpful if you go to office hours. He holds a lot of reviews sessions that are really helpful for the midterms and the final. He also makes practice finals/midterms, but the tests are still really hard.

Haven't had a teacher at OSU that was more universally liked by the class.  Hard to imagine taking class without him.  Very tough, but learned a lot.  Hopefully enough to do well in 122.  If you read these Dr. Sullivan, Thanks!

Wish he was teaching 122.  Super helpful and actually made lecture fun.  Unfortunately, this was my second time taking 121.  If I had Dr. Sullivan the first time, I'd be completed 122 this quarter.  Tons of resources to do well.
excellent!

Sully is the best professor ive had at OSU, and one of the best teachers ive had overall. He is a tremendous teacher and explains things very well. He will do anything to help you out and always asks about what he can change to make things better. He holds mock midterms and final, which I have not heard of anyone else doing. He cares and is awesome

Sully is the best professor ive had at OSU  and one of the best teachers ive had overall. He will do anything to help you out. Always asks for suggestions to make things easier or more helpful. He is a tremendous teacher and very good at explaining things. He has mock midterms and final so you can practice it then goes over it.

I was terrified of chem coming into the course, but after the 2nd exam i changed my major to chemistry.  I wouldn't just recommend this professor, i would go so far to say ONLY take this course with Dr. Sullivan.  I have not had a teacher work harder to make sure his students do well and i don't expect i will again.  best prof EVER.

This is seriously one of the best professors I've ever had. He's super helpful and very interested in helping his students do their best. He held review sessions and mock midterms. I would definitely recommend him!

summary_comment: Dr. Miller's teaching style is often criticized for making lectures overly complex and difficult to follow, with some students finding his approach monotonous and unnecessarily complicated. While some students found the class challenging and recommend using the textbook extensively, others noted that his quizzes and labs were manageable if students put in the effort. Overall, his lectures can be hard to understand, but he is willing to help if approached politely.

Ratings.comment: He's okay, he make things harder or more complex in lecture. Also some of the equations he gives are not necessary. Definetly do examples from the textbook.
He makes chemistry very very tough! Try to avoid him unless you want to destroy your confidence and interests.

He is quite condescending with questions. The class was extremely boring but it wasn't his fault. Chem 122 is just the most boring material. I love chemistry but I fell asleep a few times. Overall he's not that bad, but not the best.

Dr. Miller isn't as bad of a teacher as everyone makes him sound.  Lectures were very boring and his lecture slides confusing, but if you read the book and do plenty of practice problems then you will survive.  The quizzes and exams were fair.

Alright Dr. Miller isn't that bad really don't drop his class because of his reviews. His lectures yes are nearly incomprehensibile but his quizes and labs are quite fine if u read the book and if u reach out to him and ur polite he will help you. Chem 122 at OSU is a poorly run for all teachers. Miller isn't a bad teacher he just has a bad class

This class was tough but not impossible.  Unless you are a genius or just good at chemistry it is absolutely required that you read and do the homework problems.  Multiple choice quizzes were pretty easy but midterms and finals were very tough.  Dr. Miller seems to over complicate things in lecture but is a very intelligent guy.  Good luck...

Poor prof. He will go on and on in lecture, but you will have difficulty understanding his mathmatics to finding the equations. He does lots of examples in lecture with chemicals. Lecture was pointless I used the book and homework problems to get a A in the class.

Extremely monotone lectures and unclear guided notes-he includes derivations of equations that are not used in any manner throughout the quarter, and attendance is unnecessary if you 're willing to teach yourself from the book. Recitation is much more helpful than lectures.

This is his first year back teaching in a while and he did pretty well. He is very monotone, but organized too. He is willing to answer any questions. The quizzes suck because they are multiple choice so you get either all or none of the points. His exams are challenging, but you will do well if you do the practice exams and homework problems.
Get as many points on the homework as possible because this man's tests will make you cry!  He is a terrific lecturer and extremely helpful outside class, though, and he wants you to succeed..

I skipped a majority of lectures and got an A-; he speaks in a monotone and introduces mountains of material in class that are not on the tests. And I destroyed the tests and quizzes and did fairly well on the labs, but couldn't get the solid A. Tough curve.

terry learned quantum mechanics from dirac - he knows what he is talking about.  difficult class, but great professor.  not a good professor to have if you are in school to party, but great if you want to learn a something

His lectures are dry and terrible. He uses very confusing language and is completely uninterested in students. His tests and quizzes were very very hard and the average was about a 60%. If he is teaching--DO NOT TAKE HIM IF YOU DONT HAVE TO. I'm retaking the class with Loza and i'm amazed at how much better it is.

His lectures just confuse people. Not very good at explaining anything or comprehending questions. Recently exclaimed that metals have no protons in lecture, then moved on. Dodges a lot of questions, I think it's because he doesn't really comprehend the questions that are asked. Tests are almost all math. Reccomendation: avoid

His lectures are boring-plain and simple.  If you go you'll get something out of it, but not entirely necessary.  Read the book and do and check practice problems.  The quizzes are multiple choice, and if you miss a question on a quiz it'll most likely be on the midterm.
Very hard Midterms and Final, and he curves very little. His lectures are extremely boring and unhelpful. Try to avoid him unless you are prepared to completely learn on your own.

Prof. Miller is a challanging, but fair teacher.  He is a very well- prepared lecturer.  His class is tough...nothing that you can just glide through.  If you study and prepare yourself, the midterms and final are not terrible.

honestly if you dont know how to do calc. or have a hard time understanding chem to begin with stay away from him. he is horrible about explaining information further. make sure you do the homework, because his exams are crazy, you never know what you will get with them. good luck to anyone who has him.

HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE! AVOID him if you would like to pass Chemistry 122. Makes IMPOSSIBLE midterms and final, and then BARELY curves. Lectures are horrible and reads off hiw notes. Worst techer I have ever had.

He has no soul!!! Avoid taking chem 122 with him by all means!!! Midterms and final were impossible. Very boring lecturer, reads off notes that he posts online. Hes a jerk, he doesnt care about the students at all.

awful teacher. i slept through all of his lectures (when i went). his midterms & final were hard as balls. avg. on the first was a 48%..it sucked. final was impossible. no personality, reads slides, over-explains things so you can't understand any of it. take it another quarter if he's the only one teaching, he is terrible. get another prof.
Terrible man let alone teacher, doesnt care about the class or the students.  Only reads off a powerpoint then gives impossible midterms and a **** of a final, my advice, find another prof.

WoW. His lectures are pretty boring, and I like chem! Also, he said on the first exam that equations would be provided HA! he lied. It is a nearly impossible class to study for. I studied more for the second midterm than the first and got a worse grade... I recommend avoiding him as a prof
Chem 122 is pretty interesting, but with Dr. Miller it's really a boring class. Avoid taking his class!!!

ok, i am sort of a smart person.  got a nice A at akron u form chem 121, i know akron u is easier than OSU, but still from a A to a complete F with this guy.  wow, it is rediculus, i am almost self teaching myself chemistry 122

He is SOOOOO FREAKING HARD!!! Everyone fails quizzes,(I got an 15/30 and read everything in the book).His exams are very hard (midterm average was 80/173).And he barely curves (so I hear).PLEASE never take him unless you want to fail or do extremely horrible.He reads directly off of slides online,and the experiments are boring.DONT TAKE THIS W/ HIM
No Comments
Worst teacher ever.  Don't take his class.
He does a good job at explaining things, but he doesn't seem to care whether or not anyone does well. We'll see how the midterm goes...

Dr. Miller doesn't like Engineers, and tells the class this on the first day.  He doesn't make an attempt to try and teach for engineers, but instead has resolved to let us all go without understanding the material so we fail the tests... but does curve.

Dr. Miller is terrible.  His lectures are 2 hours of reading off power points.  My 8 year old retarted brother could do that.  His tests are freakin hard.  Also, hes a mean person with no sign of a personality.  Good Luck

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and commitment to student understanding, despite the challenging nature of the course material. Students find his lectures engaging and appreciate his availability during office hours and review sessions. While the exams are demanding, students believe the effort is worthwhile due to the extensive knowledge gained.

Ratings.comment: I'm not going to lie, this class is hard- but you WILL walk away with a lot of knowledge. This class requires work, but it is manageable. The midterms and final are challenging, but fair. He keeps lectures interesting, and always pops in the lab to say hi. Very helpful. Funny guy, too!
Wonderful teacher! Chemistry is a very hard subject but he makes it understandable and manageable. Read the book, take notes, do practice problems and you'll be fine.

This man is an amazing teacher. Although the class was hard he would try as hard as he could to make sure we understood the material. One of the only professors who would hold practice review sessions before an exam. Take him!
great professor, class does require some hard work though. gives midterm and final reviews that help a lot.

Great professor, challenging, but helpful. Provides practice midterms and offers multiple review sessions, very approachable during office hours, and easy to get in contact with. You will most likely find yourself struggle at first, but hard work will pay off in this class. Uses some info. from book, but mostly his own lecture material.
This professor was not easy! The class was very hard, and many students did not like him this year. He changed the tests, and sometimes quizzed us on things that he said he wouldnt.

Great professor! I would definitely recommend him. He teaches very clearly and makes sure students understand everything. I would say the only down side to his class is that his exams are very difficult, however you will still learn a lot of material.

One of the best professors at OSU. He is a hard teacher but  that is because chem is hard. Even though the class is hard he does everything to help you understand the material with review sessions, emails, and even goes over questions in class. If I could recommend a teacher for chem it would definitely be him. Shame he won't teach semesters. :(

Dr. Ouellette is a great General Chem professor. If you go to class and follow the notes, and then do some of the problems on your own, you will succeed in his class. He is tough but fair by means of testing (he tests you on what he goes over). I would highly recommend him!

Very good professor. The exams were very difficult but he was always willing to answer questions and give extra help when needed. Very smart man who knew the material and was good at breaking it down and teaching it the right way. Pretty sure he's retired now but if not try to get him!

Dr. Ouellette is a great professor - he's kind, smart, and loves students. He relays information really well, and his exams were an absolute breeze. He's always willing to patiently explain things to students. I highly recommend him!

Dr. Ouellette knows his stuff.. almost TOO much! I feel like he taught so quickly because he knew the info, but didn't take into consideration that we didn't know it; I feel he just assumed that we did. His quizzes were reasonable, but his exams were ridiculously hard. I really did like his accent and the experiments he performed in class though!

Dr. Ouellette is very kind, and very helpful! He has a lot of experience and it shows when he teaches. His quizzes and exams are moderately easy, and he really breaks down the material for students. I highly recommend him!
Very interested in chemistry and wants students to learn the fundamentals the right way.  Offers an amazing amount of help but you have to be willing to go to him when you're struggling

Dr. Ouelette has been teaching at Ohio State since 1962 (or thereabout). That gives you some insight into his depth of experience. He's got A LOT. Tests and quizzes were difficult but he really went out of his way to help students understand the material. If you put forth the effort, you will learn a lot of useful chemistry from this professor.
Dr. Ouellette ROCKS! Not only did I get an A for his course this quarter, but he also helped me learn Organic Chem, which is hard in general. In short, he is the best!

Chem 252 is hard in general, but he is a good teacher who expects you to be an excellent student.   He explains well but tests are super hard. MUST keep up, he goes very fast. And he is pretty full of himself.
You don't want this guy for organic chemistry, i strongly do not advise taking anything with him.

summary_comment: Dr. Chan is known for his challenging quizzes and lectures, often advising students to withdraw after the first midterm. While some students find his class difficult and not well-suited for beginners, others appreciate his comprehensive lecture notes and review sessions, noting that doing homework and attending classes regularly can lead to success. Overall, his teaching style is divisive, with some finding his class overwhelming and others recognizing his efforts despite the difficulty.
