Ratings.comment: Dr. Chan confused me during lectures. His quizzes are super hard. He actually advised me to withdrawl from the class after the first midterm. Took chem with Dr. Chang the following quarter and I got an A.

Chan was very clear in lectures, posted lecture notes and three study tests per midterm online. Also held review sessions before each test.Do the homework, very similar problems show up on quizzes, then on tests. There were only a few questions I felt he didn't really cover. Definitely go to class and do at least some homework to get a good grade.

If you take this professor, make good friends with your TA and your text book. Going to lecture is pretty useless (he does some cool demonstrations sometimes... but is pretty clumsy. Don't sit close to the front). This is a "learn-it-yourself" class. Midterm 1 average of 62%.

He wastes weeks talking about symmetry, which isn't in the book, and he's very unfair about grading. You can answer everything correctly on an exam but still get 85% because you didn't mention a particular word he wanted. Just memorize the slides he provides and don't bother going to class; you'll be teaching yourself anyway.

It's a 700 level class so obviously it's a lot of work. His teaching isn't amazing but definitely not as bad as people make it sound. Always asks if there are any questions and stays after class to answer questions.

Probably the worst professor ever. He completely ignores the fact that most of the students know nothing about crystallography and teaches like we're already grad students in the field. However you can't avoid him since this class is required for biochem major, so best of luck.
unless there's no other options...  avoid him   he speaks perfect english, but he is not a good teacher  plus.. compare to other instructors' exams.. Chan's exams are much harder
This class is insanely hard.  He's a decent teacher, though, and he does a lot of cool experiments and examples.
really knowledgable. kinda boring, but he tries not to be. tests are same as others. overall i recommend him.
No curve unlike many other chemistry professors.
Does a lot of experiments to illustrate concepts in lecture.

Mediocre teacher, he speaks perfect English which is good and does experiments in front of the class to aid in teaching.  The only problem is that he uses an overhead projector which is very difficult to read instead of a powerpoint projector.

Impossible to follow.  Boring lectures.  The notes are all online, but they don't make any sense.  I e-mailed him to ask him what my final exam grade was and he never e-mailed it to me because he was on vacation.
Hard course, but Dr. Chan makes its a lot easier!  I don't think I'd live without his lecture slides.

summary_comment: Professor Olivia is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, making complex chemistry concepts accessible to all students. She significantly enhances learning through her dedicated recitation sessions and goes above and beyond by offering free review sessions for midterms.

Ratings.comment: I have never taken time to do a review but she deserves one.. Olivia is my recitation instructor and I honestly don't learn ANYTHING from lecture, everything I know about Chemistry I learned from her. She is fantastic and make s it understandable for everyone. She is doing a review session for our midterm on her own time. She goes above and beyond!

summary_comment: Arijit is an exceptional TA known for his effective and relevant problem-solving sessions, availability to help, and fairness in grading. Students consistently praise his ability to explain complex concepts clearly and his willingness to assist outside of scheduled hours. His teaching style is highly regarded, making challenging material more accessible.

Ratings.comment: Arijit was an awesome TA. He goes over chemistry problems that are relevant to class and does not waste time lecturing. He grades labs fairly but quizzes in his honors course were very difficult. Arijit was always helpful in lab and you should be happy if you get him as a TA.

My TA for Chem201H. Excellent teacher during recitation, he gave us summary study guides for exams and he made what we learned in recitation easier. Also helped ATON with the crazy difficult problem sets put forward by the lecturer. Highly recommend him.

Mr. Ghosh was the TA for my Fall 2010 Thermo class. He was readily available to convey quick, precise and easy to understand explanations. He was very approachable and helped you understand work well enough to re-explain it with confidence. He showed extreme competence in his work.

Very very helpful.  Take him if you can, he is wiling to meet whenever to help and understands this is a hard class for students.  He is very clear in presenting the material and understands it very well.
Two word: great teacher. You will not be disappointed. The work is tough, but he understands it better than anyone else, so he will be able to teach it best.

Excellent teacher. very fair. He loves to help which is refreshing in a university with so many teachers who don't care about their students.  Its chemistry so it is not easy but he presents the material in a easy to learn way. Even met with me outside of class and office hours a couple times to give me some extra help.

summary_comment: Kevin is highly regarded for his clear and comprehensible teaching style, making complex concepts accessible to all students. He is described as down-to-earth, helpful, and funny, though some note that he can come across as sarcastic or somewhat reserved outside of class. Overall, students find his approach effective and enjoyable.

Ratings.comment: Very easy to understand. Explains things in a way that makes sense to everyone. Very down to earth and really seems to know what he's taking about at all times.
Kevin is awesome! He's fun and really just tells you what you need to know instead of making things hard like other professors do.
Kevin is so helpful.  He's very sarcastic so just take that in to mind.  Ask good questions and he'll explain well.  A lot of people would have failed Chem 121 without him as a TA
Kevin's a great guy. He teaches at a level that's easily understandable, although he seems a little unwilling to help outside of class sometimes. He's pretty cute.
Explains things in a way students can understand. Always willing to help. Really funny during class, but makes sure you understand the material too. HOTTTT!

I disagree with what the below rater said. When I had him for lab he obviously had a 'don't care' attitude, but in reality he was always helpful and easy to work with (doesn't mean he was a very easy grader, but he wasn't a nitpicker). A friend had him for 121 at the same time as the below rater and thought he was awesome too. And, he is SO hot.

Uhh heck no, this kid is so not hot. I didn't like him. He swears a lot, came off as arrogant, and said "I don't care" at least 5 times every class. If you like a super laid back "teaching" style, you'll be ok, but I needed more help than average in Chem 121, from someone who actually who cares about teaching.
Very helpful, explained things in a way that was much more clear than the professor's lectures. Funny, laid-back, teaches you what you need to know.
How does he not have any hottness rating yet?! Blasphemy. Teaches his students what they need to know and doesn't complicate it by trying to sound smart. Great kid ;D

Knows what he's talking about, but really doesn't review the material from class, just teaches whats on the quiz so you can get a good grade on it, this is good in the short run, but it will make your midterm grades suffer. If you ask a question, he will make it sound like its the easiest thing ever and you're dumb for not knowing how to do it.
Funny guy, pretty blunt. Tells you what you need and don't need to know. Throws out the occasional jabs/insults which make the class pretty humorous.
No Comments

summary_comment: Dr. Luk is highly regarded as an excellent professor, particularly for organic chemistry, where he is seen as one of the best due to his clear explanations, extensive use of examples, and helpful practice materials. He maintains a slow pace to ensure understanding and provides ample resources, making the subject more approachable despite its inherent difficulty. Students appreciate his humor and willingness to assist, noting that while the course is challenging, his teaching methods significantly aid in mastering the material.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Luk was a phenomenal professor. Don't be scared by the fact that his easiness score isn't great, because it organic chemistry. It's hard. However, I couldn't think of a better way to teach it than he did. More examples than you'll ever need. Lectures were the best lectures I'd ever had. Curve is great. Probably the best o chem professor.

Dr. Luk is simply a good professor. Tons of problem sets, practice quizzes, practice exams and all with answer keys online. Very helpful in class. Very funny and goes slow enough that everyone can get it (or at least slightly understand) but not so slow as to lose anyone. Fair quizzes and midterms! (Avg will be ~50%,high for ochem, but curves nice)
Great Prof. Goes at a slow pace and understands that we're all beginners. Packets and notes are extremely helpful. Had to drop Callam's class, so glad I ended up with Luk

Goofy and spunky, which makes it fun, but tests are ROUGH. Go to class and learn all mechanisms. DO THE PROBLEM SETS he provides! Those are invaluably helpful. He is very nice and willing to help you if you just ask.
Really clear, just memorize the packets he gives you and youll do great. Makes Ochem the easiest it can be. Dont skip class though.
Dr. Luk's a great professor. If chemistry's your thing you should have no issues at all. Midterms are fair, and I managed to pull above a 90 on both exams.

GREAT professor! He is very helpful and clear on what he expects. He gives lots of practice material (ie old quizzes/exams) like the ones he gives. He has a great personality and often provides packets for notes in lectures. Ochem is a hard subject, so it does take work, but he is a prof worth taking. He speaks great English, no worries!

Dr Luk is AWESOME! Don't let the fact he's new and has a scary name steer you away from this guy. His practice quizzes and exams are just like the ones you'll do, and he is always very clear on his expectations, giving you tons of practice material. He's always willing to help you and he's a funny guy! You won't regret taking him.

I was nervous at first. No reviews were available so I took a shot in the dark. He is by far one of the best lecturers. I really recommend him. Yes, the material is hard (it's Ochem, duh). He tries his best so people can understand it. I pretty much never used the textbook. His problem sets were pretty good, as well as his old midterms.

He is a really helpful teacher. I can say he is perfectly. I didn't get good marks for the 1st mid term and after that i started clarifying material during his office hours. He helped out lot. At the end I got an A without even curving. He is so willing to help. His material is good and exams are reasonably hard. But if you follow problem sets and reviews you can get an A. He was one of my favorite professors. I'm so happy to be under a lecturer like him.
The material is difficult, but he does the best he can to teach you. He is always available for questions. Ignore the book, just do the lecture problems he gives in class.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for their exceptional teaching quality, with TAs noted for their ability to explain concepts in multiple ways, ensuring thorough understanding. They are described as extremely helpful and dedicated, going beyond expectations to assist students. Their classes are praised for being efficient and well-organized, effectively condensing material for easy comprehension.

Ratings.comment: Amazing TA! Has 5 different ways of explaining each concept. So if you don't understand one he switches to another. Extremely Helpful & will go above and beyond to help his students. He is very efficient in terms of time. Going to his class is like going to a review. He condenses all the material and organizes it for you. Best TA I've had!
Biswas is the best chem TA ever. He explains things really well and the guy is brilliant. Wouldn't have made it thru the class without him.

summary_comment: Dr. Mattson is a polarizing professor; while some students find her lectures clear and her exams challenging but fair, others criticize her for not providing adequate support to struggling students and for making exams excessively difficult without sufficient preparation time. Despite mixed reviews, many recommend her due to her thorough explanations and emphasis on understanding the material deeply.

Ratings.comment: she is horrible. does not help her students if they are struggling. she told me not to worry about failing cause everyone does it and you can just retake the class. this was so demeaning and an awful thing for a professor to say.

I've never done so poorly in a class. I know ochem, as a subject, is very hard but I did not get any help from Professor Mattson. She faces the board and starts writing and does not stop. Went to office hours and she made me feel even worse. Will be retaking ochem again with a different professor.

It's ochem, so expected to work hard for it. Dr. Mattson isn't the most friendly person ever but she is a good lecturer. She is very organized with her notes. I barely have to touch the textbook. Her exams are tough but doable. Know EVERYTHING from her notes!

Dr. Mattson was a good 2510 professor. She was clear and fair. Her exams were very heavy on predict the product, so make sure you practice that. Exam averages were low (67, 49, and 55 on final for my section) but the curve accounts for that and you can still get a decent grade. If you have the option, take her or Callam

If you're going to take ochem, make sure you get her! Her tests have a much higher average than the other professors, and she doesn't cover a lot of the information that other professors do! (cough cough Callam) Everyone complains about ochem! Ya it sucks! But if you do all the practice you can you will do better than everyone else.

She's a fantastic lecturer. She's down to earth, with very clear notes. She doesn't tolerate repetitive questions, so if you ask a question that has already been asked, expect her to be som what annoyed. Her exams are hard, but not unfair. All of the material is covered, but exams are significantly more difficult than quizzes. Curve is generous.

Exams are extremely difficult in this class. 8 pages in 55 mins with averages in the 40's. Her lectures are pretty clear, but then she expects you to pull information out of thin air for exams because she makes it 200x harder than anything she does in lecture. It's like there's no way to prepare. Just try your best to beat the avg is all I can say!

Dr. Mattson is my favorite chemistry professor at OSU. She was very clear and emphasizes exactly what you need to know. She makes you really understand the material, not just memorize which I actually enjoyed. O Chem is tough, but she helps. Definitely recommend.

Dr. Mattson was an okay professor. The class makes you work if you want to do well, but I still feel like there should be more grades than just quizzes and tests. Generous curve at the end. She just needs to be more clear of expectations and provide more practice problems. She recommends the book, but it doesn't represent the graded material well.

The exams are way harder than what is presented in class or the quizzes, but at the same time all the topics on there were expected. Grades are based entirely on quizzes and exams, so it's crucial to not fall behind even though there's no homework. Book problems aren't that helpful. Class is definitely better with a good TA. Generous curve though.

Mattson is an awesome professor! Her lectures give you just about everything you need to know for her exams. Exams were fair, and not that difficult if you studied hard. She made OChem totally doable, and in my opinion way easier than gen Chem at OSU. The only issue is she doesn't give out enough practice questions. 100% would take her again.

Dr. Mattson is a prepared teacher who goes straight from the book. I missed one of the mandatory recitations WITH A NOTE FROM THE HOSPITAL EXCUSING IT, and Dr. Mattson would not excuse the absence. She does not care about her students to the extent that you would think by just attending her lectures. Just don't have a medical problem and youll pass

Quizzes are easy and straight forward, but the exams are SO hard. Lecture notes and book problems aren't good preparation. Good luck if you take her. Love her as a person, she's super down to earth and relatable, she just writes her exams really hard. 8 pages in 55 minutes means you may not finish. Very generous curve though.

The worst class of my life!  Her lectures BARELY skim the surface of what you ought to know and what she tests on.  Be prepared to use tutoring, or some other source, because her lectures were NOT helpful.   Exam averages were in the 50's and final was in the 40's, if not for the curve I wouldn't have passed.  Take another professor!
Ochem is a tough class, but I found Mattson's lectures to be very helpful. If you study and keep up with the material, you should do fine. I'd definitely recommend her if you must take Ochem.

She is a teacher who likes going quick. Its always better to go to class as you will be able to get all the information you need to do well in her exams. Its important that you study after her class as it would help you immensely in remembering tough concepts that OCHEM has. Good Luck!! :D

Okay guys, this is Organic Chemistry. If you're looking for an easy way out, let me just tell you that there is no such thing. Dr. Mattson is an incredible lecturer and her chalk-talks make note taking a breeze. Do the practice problems as you go, otherwise you'll be stuck on the night before the exam. I will definitely be taking her again for 2520

She's just awesome. She has small jokes that are just hilarious. She explains and draws clearly. She's straightforward in how the exams are set up and what's on or not on them. She's super nice. I already scheduled class with her next semester again

Tough, but fair. She's a pretty good teacher and helps you if you need it. She knows her stuff and is pretty good at conveying the concepts. I still had trouble, it might just be the difficulty of Orgo, but I joined a study group and used clutch prep and I ended up with a decent grade. Take her if you can!

Lectures were very rushed and whenever someone asked a question her response was usually "convince yourselves at home". The exams were tough but fair; she made sure that you knew your stuff. The "assigned" book work was basically just a list of every problem in the book; repetitively doing practice problems is a great help.
Her exams were the hardest thing about this class. Quizzes weren't too bad. She assigns homework out of the book but it doesn't help. I'd recommend her if you must take Ochem.

Dr. Mattson is probably the best chem professor I've had at OSU. She's very easy to understand and does a lot of work on the board, so it's easy to keep up with her. Exams are tough but reasonable. Book is not necessary, but the practice questions are helpful. My TA is also a saint. Make sure you understand the reactions and you'll be just fine.

good professor, however little framework provided for success on tests. homework does not reflect exams  & exams cover concepts from previous organic classes that your expected to "know"  Needs to provide practice tests/probs and/or concepts you expect students to know so working hard will actually be seen in exam grade

Dr Mattson is super nice and fun and helpful. She lays a good foundation for organic chemistry and focuses on what is important. Her exams are really hard, but not unreasonable. I wish I had her for 251 also!!

Great professor for your first Ochem class.  Exams and quizzes can be tough but fair. Mattson is very good and answering questions making sure you understand the material. Read the book and do practice problems and you will be fine.
Hard class. She does a good job of going over the notes clearly. Tests are difficult but the class will be generously curved. If you study and do what is required it is not difficult.

She is a VERY hard tester. I did not like her lectures. You would spend a lot of time TRYING to copy the lecture notes(It is not easy to do if you are far from the board). I really did not learn a lot from her lectures but I think the main problem with this course is that the class size is TOO BIG so I suggest taking the honors version if you can.

Anita is a good first ochem professor.  She seems genuinely interested in helping students learn. Her exams are rediculously hard, but if you stay on track you should be fine. Beat the curve by 20% overall and you should get an A. My only gripe about her is she spends too much time reviewing gen chem stuff at the beginning of the quarter.

Taking this class right now. Mattson lectures fast and it can be frustrating to copy what's on the board only to move on without getting a chance to comprehend it first. I wish notes were offered on carmen so I could focus on comprehending during lecture rather than just copying notes.

GREAT professor for your first Ochem. Although she spent a little too much time on prereq material and not enough towards the end, she was very clear in lecture (not so much in office hours) and not too difficult. Only problem is with her grading; beat the final avg by 30%,8-15% above avg on midterms, and a B+. Be motivated and you'll do FINE.

Anita is pretty cool and also a good professor.  She is really nice and office hours are helpful if you need it.  Exams got progressively harder throughout the quarter.  The final was probably the most difficult exam I've ever taken.

By far the best Chemistry teacher I had at OSU.  You definately should read the book and do the practice problems she suggests, but when you're studying for an exam make sure you pay careful attention to the practice problems she gives you.  She's also very helpful in office hours, but best if you have a specific question.

Anita is a really good professor. Her lectures were well-organized and interesting and she was helpful during office hours. Highly recommend. Just make sure you keep up with the material! That is honestly the biggest help!
Makes lecture interesting with a sense of humor. If you study and keep up with lecture, o chem won't be so intimidating. go to her office hours- really helpful!

My favorite chem professor.  I feel like she did a great job in preparing me for future o-chem classes.  She is very friendly and approachable, clear in her notes, very helpful, and very fair when it comes to exams and grades.

The class was interesting and she is actually a pretty good teacher. My only problem was her grading. A very low percentage of people actually get A's (I was 20% above the average and didn't get it), but as far as a class and teaching goes, she is nice, informative, and at times kinda funny
I thought Anita was a proficient teacher. Her quizzes were quite similar to her exams in difficulty, but they were very hard. You have to read the book to succeed in this class.

Anita was a good teacher but her tests were ridiculously unfair.  They were a hundred times harder than the quiz's and I felt truly unprepared.  Most teachers use the quiz as an example of the style of questions to expect on the test but she made it unfairly hard.  She does a decent job explaining the mechanisms which are very important.
Anita was awesome. She comes off a little cocky at first but once you learn her sense of humor you will love her. Very good professor for your first ochem class.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, effectively clarifying complex concepts and providing valuable insights. Students consistently praise her ability to organize course materials succinctly and comprehensively.

Ratings.comment: sorted all my ODS out, lady is amazing!

summary_comment: Dr. Means' course is challenging and requires significant effort, with a focus on memorization and pop quizzes. While some students found him to be a decent lecturer and appreciated his kindness, many criticized his teaching style as disorganized and ineffective, citing issues with lack of visual aids and relevant content. Overall, the course structure and difficulty level are seen as overwhelming, with inconsistent exam coverage and strict grading.

Ratings.comment: Pretty tough course. 10 pop quizes (10%), 1 midterm (40%), and a final (50%). No structured notes, mainly stands and talks. My suggestion: bring the book to class and circle the pictures in the chapter he's trying to explain so you know what to study. Tests are hard, the amount you need to have memorized is simply insane. Decent curve though, A-.

Dr. Means was not a terrible lecturer. He was a very nice guy and you have to read the book before you come to lecture. GOD FORBID COLLEGE STUDENTS TAKE A CLASS THAT IS DIFFICULT AND THAT YOU HAVE TO DO EXTRA WORK TO GET A GOOD GRADE. I got a B+ and I think that was only because I didnt do too well on a few quizzes. ITS NOT THE PROF, ITS ALL OF YOU
Great teacher. If you study, pay attention in class and take good notes you should do well. Studying is a must in this class but overall he was a pretty good teacher.

Horrible, horrible, horrible! Bad in every aspect from the prof, TA, and graders. Unless this class is required, do not take it. Exam questions are chosen capriciously. There is no passion in lectures, mindless memorization, and exam coverage does not correlate well with text or lecture emphasis. It's clear that OSU does not care about this course.

First, I'll say he's a really nice guy and actually is not a bad lecturer for biochem. Second, this class is horrible and avoid taking it with him at all costs. The problem is that his exams are both hard and test you over a lot of ancillary stuff that he briefly discusses and does not emphasize. grading is strict as well... take it with cogan

I have around 300 credits at OSU, and he is the worst teacher I have ever had. I will repeat everything that everyone else has said. Very unorganized, lecture is turrets like, no powerpoint or Carmen. Waves his arms a lot, transparencies are useless because they are so old you can't really see anything on them. Buy the book and highlight as you go

You can study as much as you want to and still do bad in this class.  I wish Dr. Means would decide to use powerpoints and Carmen.  Only gives 2 tests, both very hard. 10 quizzes only worth 1% each.  Take the class with someone else.

Worst professor I've had yet! Lectures consist of irrelevant tangents and disjointed reactions with zero context. No use of Carmen, study guides, or practice problems. Tests are short answer or fill-in and graded harshly. Pop-quizzes make useless lecture mandatory. If you don't have time to teach yourself everything from the book, avoid this class!

He is the worst professor I've had at OSU. He doesn't "believe" in carmen, powerpoints or SEI evaluations. He doesn't actually teach anything, just rambles and scribbles on the board. He also will draw structures wrong on the board, so you  have to correct him, or just read the book and disregard class notes. I had to teach myself biochem :(.
changes topics quickly, goes off on tangents. doesn't right much down and expects you to remember it and can write it all down.

I took over 300 pages of notes including every single structure he put on the board, made over 500 notecards, memorized every structure, went to every class and still struggled greatly in the class. His tests are NOT easy at all and nothing like the "study guide" given out.  Just wait a quarter and take the class from someone else

He is extremely unclear and presents no big picture so class comes off as a bunch of random facts. He is also still using transparencies which are extremely technical, but since they are displayed briefly and not available, offer no help. I am aware that I must put in effort, but if I must teach myself all the material what did I pay tution for?

I don't know who posted about this guy at the beginning of March, but Gary Means is THE WORST professor I have ever had at Ohio State. Like others have said, no study guides were given at all, and there was really no indication given as to what would be on the test. He is retiring at the end of the year, but he should have been fired years ago.

Professor Means is a really good guy and a great professor.He is kind to students and answers any and all questions.  He knows his stuff. If you come to class, write what he writes on the board, and note the key points he emphasizes, you'll do fine.  People are just lazy and whiny and need everything spoon-fed to them, so they make him look bad.

Dr. Means is a terrible professor. He doesn't give you the big picture idea of what's going on, so lectures seem disconnected. He gives roundabout answers to questions. He never gave answers to any problems he gave out, inc. midterm. Midterm study guide was a joke and didn't give us one for final. Read the book because his notes are unhelpful.

was looking forward to this class but ended up being bored out of my mind, notes consisted of random structures drawn on the board that students sometimes had to correct. everyone said to know structures but then final and midterm were over things we never covered. some of the things we spent the most time on in class were never seen on a single exam.

Come to class. If you write down what he says and memorize the structures, you'll do okay just keep up with the material. The quizzes are easy if you have good attendance. I went to talk to him with a problem and he seemed to really care.

Dr. Means is unwilling to repeat confusing material when questions are asked.  He often draws structures in the air, lazily avoiding going to the chalkboard.  His quizzes and tests are drawn almost exclusively from the notes.  There is a tremendos amount of information to be memorized, and nightly studying is a necessity.  Tests are fair.

Mr. Means is not that bad. His materials are not difficult.  The materials come from texts. There were TA's and Free tutoring session that really helped a lot, I might add, 90% of the materials on the final were went over during the tutoring session.  For those who complained, did you took advantage of the free tutoring?

This professor is a TERRIBLE teacher! I had a 3.9 GPA until his class. His exams were ridiciously hard and unfair.  I have to retake the class and I have NEVER gotten lower than a B+ in all my science classes.  His notes are never clear and he's NOT helpful at all.  He really needs to retire!

He's really not that bad.  People kept saying how terrible he was, but he's not that bad. He helps you out enough on the curve as well as making the tests somewhat easy.  Just memorize the notes and you really dont need to use the book unless your lost on his lecture notes.  just PAY ATTENTION during lecture, write down what he says n u'll be fine
He's not so bad.  I learned alot and did fine  in the class.  If you learn the material, there's nothing to worry about.  His quizzes are relatively easy and his exams are fair.

class is pretty self-explanatory. memorize the structures (ATP), mechanisms, pathways and reactions dr means tells you to and you should be okay. no notes online so go to class every day and take notes.

This was the most unorganized class I have ever taken.  His has no notes, draws structures in the air as he lectures (dude, the board is right behind you), and seems utterly un-interested in the class.

Out of my first 150 some credits, he was the worst prof I have had.  A lot of memorization of mundane structures and enzyme names, little learning of biochemistry. If you are stuck with the guy, I suggest tallying how many times he says "in fact" during lectures.  He averages about 25 per 48 minute lecture.

he has to be the most disorganized and unclear professors at osu. if you ask him a question he will never directly answer it. his notes are all over the place, his review sheet was useless,  and his exams were not the fairest bc he put stuff on their i am positive was never mentioned in class.

He's a nice guy, but the class was just too unorganized. I got an A in every single one of my O-Chem classes and labs and Biology courses until this class. I worked my ass off and only got a C+. He writes the tests, but the TAs grade them; I got the sense that there was little commuication between them concerning how he wanted the tests graded.

Horrible organization of class. Pop quizzes and first test is after drop date, the material is not impossible but he just does a poor job presenting it. No notes online, uses the black board and makes mistakes.  Doesn't label anything or draw many structures, or draw them well.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, bringing energy and enthusiasm to her role despite being a Teaching Assistant. She effectively balances a relaxed teaching style with thorough support, making lab sessions engaging and worthwhile.

Ratings.comment: She is just a t.a, but super awesome. She was only a Junior when she taught my lab. She would bring in music and try to provide as much help as possible. Super laid back and very easy on the eyes. She made lab worth going to

summary_comment: Professor Pitzer is generally considered ineffective in delivering engaging lectures, with many students finding his teaching style dry, boring, and difficult to follow. Most feedback indicates that his tests are challenging and do not align well with the material covered in lectures or homework. While some students found him approachable and helpful outside of class, the overall consensus is that his teaching methods do not effectively support learning, leading to low average grades.

Ratings.comment: does not follow text book makes up questions on tests that do not follow homework or quizzes.

Horribly dry and boring, which not the type of teacher you need in a class this difficult. It's impossible to pay attention to him. I stopped going to his lectures and started going to another teacher's. Final average was 30%.
Slow, dry, and boring. Refuses to use technology in lectures. Mumbles a lot. The average for my final was about 35%. I actually stopped going to his lectures and started going to another professor.

great professor!  don't listen to any other ratings.  go to class, read your book, do your homework.  russ knows what he is talking about - not only is he ken pitzer's son, but he studied with slater at harvard

Dr. Pitzer is a brilliant man who attended Harvard and knows his Chemistry.  That said, he wasn't wonderful at getting it across to us (the avg grade on the final before the curve was below 50%).  With some hard work filling in the gaps created by lecture, it's not too bad.

He likes chemistry, no one asked questions in lecture so I think he was bored with teaching it. The tests were really difficult, but he was totally approachable.  I would suggest reading the book before the lecture so you kind of know what he is talking about

Dr. Pitzer is an average teacher.  He is not particularly engaging, but does get the material across.  Doing the homework helps quite a bit.  You'll see that the lectures are mostly about concepts, but the tests are mostly about calculations.

His class in REALLY boring. All he does for an hour and 18 minutes is mumble things to the board while constantly clearing his throat. In one class period he cleared his throat 252 times. Yes, I counted. His exams are extremely hard with the average being in the low 60's. I've heard that doing the homework helps a little. Do not take his class!
blehhh so boring...if you take him the lectures are as dry as reading the textbook.  recommend loza over him anyday

He is a nice guy and knows a ton about chemistry. Having said that, he is probably the most boring prof I've had here, and it was worse because I had him at 8:30. Exams are luck of the draw - might look exactly like the homework, might bear no resemblance to anything you've seen before.
No Comments

He's really old and boring, but I could stomach that if it weren't for the tests.  He tells you they will be "just like the homework", but don't believe him.  The questions came from nowhere.  The average was in the 50s on the 1st midterm.  Basically, he sucks.

Seems uninterested in teaching, having good TA's made up for it, but thats not always the case. I wouldnt recommend him. Midterms are not bad at all but the final is pretty rough. Just force yourself into lecture and follow along as best you can.
DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!
Very boring. The exam questions seemed like he pulled them out of nowhere. And the final was impossible. I heard Steigemeiller is better for 121.
Class not that hard, especially for engineering majors, probably harder for med majors. Midterms were cake but the final was pretty hard. Lectures not worth much.
The first two midterms weren't bad.  The final seemed almost impossible.  His lectures are very long and make you tired.  He is very monotone and clears his throat a lot which gets annoying.
I couldnt force myself to go to lecture because he is so boring, dull, and uninteresting... and monotone... thank god im done with his class

After taking Chemistry at UC, you realize just how good the profs are here at OSU.  Despite what some may say, Pitzer definitely is a good prof., plus gives tests that are reasonable.  I would recommend this dude for freshmen chem.

OMG!!!! warning warning!  i understand that pchem is required for some students, but if it's possible, DO NOT take his cla.  flash note writer, super old, i went to his office three times just to get some points back, and super hard exams.  yes pchem is hard, but also important,  i suggest you to le
very hard tests, lectures are worthless.  Only reason I am doing OK is because of very good TA's.

htt hmm. this guy realing should consider retiring.  He has no interest in teaching the class and his notes are absolutely worthless.  The first midterm he gave us was not similar to anything in the lecture, hw, or the book.  If you have to take this, consider changing your major or suicide. htt hmm
boring!! makes material totally uninteresting

summary_comment: Julia is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching and TA skills, known for her clear explanations, enthusiastic demeanor, and willingness to assist students. Her positive attitude and dedication make lab sessions engaging and effective.

Ratings.comment: Julia is an amazing TA! She's super sweet and has a great attitude. Always has a smile on her face and has an apparent love for chemistry and teaching. She's very very concise and clear with instructions and is more than willing to help, always! She's pretty, but more importantly, makes chem lab a bit more exciting with her enthusiasm.Loved her.
BESTTTT lab TA ever! enough said! she will repeat things as many times as needed and will do anything for you :) great with office hours

summary_comment: The professor's lectures are engaging, though the material is challenging, and he provides a generous curve along with significant support for students who seek help. However, midterms are noted for being extremely difficult and lengthy. In contrast, Dr. Harris, who oversees the labs, is supportive, accommodating regrade requests, extending deadlines, and generally making the lab component more manageable despite the class being considered tedious.

Ratings.comment: Previous rater has not had him in lecture, that easiness rating is FALSE. His lectures are interesting, but the material covered is somewhat difficult. Gives a huge curve, and is willing to help anyone who needs help. He's committed to helping students do well & cares about them. His midterms are ridiculously difficult and long though.

Dr. Harris doesn't actually teach for this class, he is just in charge of lab.  He will always accept regrades for lab reports.  He also is apt to extend deadlines for lab reports when lots of students are having problems or need more time.  He will help you if you ask him.  This class is tedious, but Dr. Harris will try to make it bearable.

summary_comment: James Autumn is known for his rigorous grading standards but is generally helpful and knowledgeable, though students note that following his detailed instructions precisely is crucial for success.

Ratings.comment: I had James Autumn 2010.  He is tough with grading, unless you follow his directions exactly.  He helps out most of the time and is knowledgable.
James is helpful and cool with grading

summary_comment: Dr. Beekman is an excellent yet challenging professor known for his clear explanations and genuine interest in the subject matter. Students find his lectures easy to follow and his office hours very helpful, but warn that his exams are tough and require significant effort, especially through practice homework. Overall, while his classes demand a lot of work, many students appreciate his teaching style and the clarity of his presentations.

Ratings.comment: Very good professor, but difficult! It is definitely important to do the homework problems and ask questions if you don't understand something!!! His quizzes and tests are rough, but he's good about giving partial credit. I hadn't had any chem in two years and got a B+ in his class, so a decent grade is possible, but alot of hard work!
His exams are pretty challenging but if you attend class you will do fine. He is a good professor and is very willing to help anyone.

AWESOME PROFESSOR!!! Dr Beekman is one of the best teacher's I have ever had! He is hard because he tries to make you THINK! But he is a wonderful lecturer, and is super helpful! If you go to class the material is so much clearer! Chemistry in general is hard, but Chemistry with Dr Beekman actually ended up being my favorite class!!!!

He is a great lecturer.  He puts everything as simplistically as possible.  But that doesn't help when the exams come around because even the homework problems aren't an accurate study method for exams.  Some problems on the exams were nothing like the homework problems abd even harder than quiz problems.  Good luck if you have him. .

Great Prof, he actually made Chemistry understandable. I really loved him as a teacher, and its always a bonus that he actually SPEAKS ENGLISH!!!! Very Helpful Professor, made Chemistry survivable, although, he does kill you on the quizzes.

Clear speaker, but has the hand writing of my 5 year old brother. If you do the homework problems, then you will be okay. Quizzes are easy but midterms and finals are hard. Stay about the curve and youll do okay. I hadn't taken ANY chem since soph. year of high school and got a B+. Effort in = result of grade. I wanted him for 122, but wasnt avail.
A good professor. Very easy to understand (native english) and you could tell he was genuinely interested in the subject. Tough tests, though.

One of the BEST professors. His slides are so easy to understand. His tests are extremely hard, but completely fair. DO THE PRACTICE HOMEWORK. It takes a while, but is so worth it. He is so  helpful. He stays after class for questions and helps so much at his office hours. TAKE HIS CLASS. Challenging, but totally do-able.
He's alright if you read the book and have a general understanding of chem before you start the class.  He doesnt do any homework though, so if you do poorly on the midterms, you are in trouble
Beekman is an alright lecturer but his handwriting is terrible! all of his notes are fill in the blank so going to lecture is a necessity.
His class is easy but boring as hell; bring something to do besides listen to him talk solely. The class hasn;t had review sessions unlike all other 121's at OSU and he doesn't go into much detail.

Dr. Beekman is VERY helpful in his office hours. He is definitely concerned about his students doing well. He makes class enjoyable, even though I don't necessarily care for chemistry. Quizzes/midterms/finals are tough, but study and you'll be ok. You will get the grade that reflects the time you put into the course.

Great professor....exams are very tough but as long as you get a high C or Low B you will be well above the average by about 25 points or so....an A is very attainable and he is a great teacher and loves to help students
He is an excellent professor always willing to help and a really cool guy would defiantly recommend taking his class.
Really easy to understand, makes chemistry *almost* interesting
Dr. Beekman appears genuinely concerned about his students and their comprehension of course material. As long as you go to lecture and read the text, the class is very manageable.

Class average was 54%.  Curved to give the majority of the class a C.  Expect to be at least 20% above class average to get a B or higher.  Gen Chem sucks in general, not necessarily his fault.  Very helpful in office hours.

summary_comment: The professor is consistently described as having poor teaching qualities, with students noting that the professor appears disengaged and rude, showing no interest in students' learning and being unhelpful and disrespectful in interactions.

Ratings.comment: Worst TA I've ever had.  She doesn't seem to care at all about what you're doing.
Rude, doesn't want to be there, disrespectful, unhelpful

summary_comment: Terry Caman is highly regarded for his exceptional support in labs, where students consistently praise his willingness to help and clarify difficult concepts. His availability and patience make him an invaluable resource, particularly for those who struggle during lab sessions.

Ratings.comment: YOU WANT TERRY CARMAN FOR LABS!  If you have the opportunity to get him, make sure you do!  He is very helpful and the labs suck but atleast you have Terry helping you if you need it!

This class has some difficult material to understand, but Terry will help you with anything you need help during lab, I probably asked him 10 questions a lab session, not kidding.  So definitely take him, especially if you get nervous during lab, because he will definitley have the answer crystal clear.  P.S.  get to know him
No Comments

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded as a good teacher who is very helpful and strongly encourages students to attend office hours for additional support.

Ratings.comment: good teacher, very helpful, go to office hours!!!
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: The professor is perceived as having low teaching quality, with one student describing her as rude and unhelpful, while another, though appreciative of a teaching assistant's support, does not extend that praise to the professor herself.

Ratings.comment: She was rude and most unhelpful.  I asked her to clarify a question and she said my report looked fine.  I get it back an I got like 40 points taken off.  Thanks for telling the truth.
Coming to you all the way from france, this TA is awesome, she can easily clarify anything you didn't get in lecture, very fair grader, very good TA

summary_comment: Professor Cetin is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, providing extensive extra help and offering extra credit homework to enhance students' quiz grades. Students also appreciate his engaging and humorous demeanor, finding him both supportive and entertaining in the classroom.

Ratings.comment: I had Cetin for my Chem 122 class and he is the only reason i survived. He gives you tons of extra help for the problems and gives out extra credit homework to improve your quiz grades. Plus he is fairly funny without realizing it
So cool!!!! He should teach our lecture class too!!!

summary_comment: Professor Jeff is highly regarded for his extensive knowledge and ability to engage students, despite occasional challenges. Students found him both helpful and inspiring, leading to increased enthusiasm for the subject matter. Overall, he receives a very high rating for his teaching quality.

Ratings.comment: Jeff was very difficult sometimes, but he was very knowledgeable, helpful and a very good TA (and cute).  He made me more excited to learn the material.  Overall I would give him a very high rating.

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as one of the best at Ohio State University, known for sparking interest in challenging subjects and making organic chemistry both enjoyable and engaging. Students praise his clarity, sense of humor, and dedication to helping students understand the material, though they note that exams can be demanding and require significant effort.

Ratings.comment: Seriously best professor at OSU. OSU is losing a huge asset. Sparked interest in a class I genuinely thought I would hate. He's hilarious and he actually cares that you understands. Fantastic professor, and I'm annoyed I can't take his 2520 class.

While Stambuli may be leaving OSU, I still find it appropriate to give him a good rating on here. Keep in mind, this is OChem, the downfall of many students. Yet somehow, this guy makes the class fun, exciting, and interesting, and he is always willing to help his students! Great guy with a large personality. Exams are difficult but fair.

Amazing professor, funny, knowledgeable, kind and interested in helping his students. LOVE THIS MAN, best professor at OSU by far. His tests were tough, but he definitely made this class very enjoyable. I would HIGHLY recommend him.

He was by far the most difficult professor  I have ever had. The average on the first exam was a 44%, Very, very difficult and it is almost impossible to do well and it was hours upon hours of work. Awful class and professor

Great prof. Completely clear. His notes make it very easy to keep up. He definitely knows chemistry. Exams are hard, but fair. He will remember if you sleep/text, so don't. It's not worth skipping his class; his notes are invaluable for studying. Notes = exam questions. His sarcasm is hilarious.
Best Ochem Prof ever. Just go to office hours and keep up. He's awesome. Massive curves, so dominate them and you're set.
One of my favorite professors. Pay attention, take good notes, do book problems, and you'll probably do well. Nice sense of humor.

Awesome prof. His exams are straight out of his notes. you have to go to class to get the notes or else you would be lost. had him for 251 as well and he simplifies the material so that anyone with a brain could understand it. His jokes are hilarious, unless you're the victim then it would suck.

Stambuli was a great professor.  He expected a lot out of us but the exams were really fair and he didn't try to trick us.  He has a great sense of humor and jokes and is sarcastic during class.  He's also extremely nice and helpful when approached after class.  Take him if he starts teaching ochem again, you wont regret it!

Stambuli is my favorite prof at OSU. He is professional, yet puts himself on the level of his students and its enjoyable to work with him. He doesn't really use the book, tests/quizzes are made directly from his notes, which are really straight forward and basic. Exams are tough, but the averages are always low and there is a curve.

stambuli is an awesome guy and a great lecturer, but this is a tough class (as all ochems are).  exams are very tough.  enjoyed going to class, but not taking his tests haha.  youre gonna wanna go to class (only way to know bonus on exams), but dont text!  he's always good for a laugh, too.

I do not understand these great reviews. Stambuli is sarcastic and funny, yet is totally unprofessional. When the avg was a 40 for one exam, he said he overestimated our intelligence and that his grad students took it in ten min & we should have done better. He was condescending and honestly, it was discouraging. His tests are too in depth as well
Such a great professor. He makes the lectures fun (with his sarcastic jokes), and the tests are fair. He's good on the eyes, too.

Dr. Stambuli made Ochem the best experience of my sophomore year. Going to lecture made my day MWF, I studied so much harder and cared so much more about the class because he cares so much about you (although sometimes he pretends like he hates teaching). Definitely recommend him. Take for both 251 and 252 if you can! He even wrote me a rec

Definitely go to class- he remembers faces and will call you out if you miss class. DON'T TEXT IN CLASS- he will call you out in front of everyone. Great lecturer, very funny and sarcastic, and exams and quizzes very fair. Challenging yet definitely doable.

Not only was he really good at explaining things during lectures, he also made sure everyone was on the same page as to what would be on the exams. He makes an effort to recognize people, so don't be late, sleep in class, or skip, because he will call you out. I definitely appreciated that as motivation to do well. Study and you'll do fine.

Excellent teacher. His lectures are very logical, and he makes class fun. He wants you to understand the material instead of just memorizing everything. Go to office hours; he's very approachable and does an incredible job figuring out another way to explain things if you're confused.

Great professor. He really makes coming to class enjoyable; he is a really funny guy! He is obviously smart and knows his stuff. Sometimes he explains things confusingly, but if you don't understand, ask and he will gladly clarify. Study a lot though because exams are hard! Recommend for premeds.

Funny man, never thought I would laugh so hard in O chem. Don't text or leave lecture early. He'll call you out. He also recognizes the students who attend class regularly. 252 is some NMR and a bunch of rxns. NMR just takes lots of practice and the rxns must be memorized, all of them. He presents the material clearly. Study from lecture notes.

Had him for 251 and 252 autumn and winter quarer....the guy knew my name and even wrote me a recommendation. He is a great teacher and great person. You will enjoy this class if you have him. He makes ochem bareable...you control your grade..and he gives you all the tools and help that you need to get that A

Love him. He's hilarious, so you never dread going to lectures, and you actually enjoy them. He's great at explaining things and he's very helpful and understanding. His tests are tricky, but he gives you the tools to do well. Just put in lots of hard work and you'll be fine.

He is probably one of the best professors I have had. Go to office hours and read over notes after class. He is most def. a smart ass..but makes class very entertaining. I wish I would have taken him for 251 too. great person!!!

stambuli does a great job teaching his students and prepares them well for the exams. i however thought he was a lot easier than the professor i had for 251...so i'm not sure if that's bad or good! i'm taking my 251 professor again for 253 so i'll feel more prepared for the MCAT.
Great teacher and oOoOoOooh baby hot damn ;] sexy as hell

Dr.Stambuli is the best chemistry teacher i have ever had. his questions could be tricky lol but as long as you go to his lectures and pay attention in class also do the assigned homework , you are guaranteed to get an A =] P.S he is a great looking

The man is part comedian, part superb organic chemistry professor. Has a sincere regard for his students, willing to sacrifice a lot so you understand the material (go to his office hours), get to know him (he's one of the nicest professors you'll ever have), has interesting stories to tell, and is very fair if he knows that you've put in the work
Honestly the best teacher i think that I have had.  It is a huge advantage to have a teacher like this that will challenge you before you continuing to OCHEM 253.
like-a-firecracker,-i-think-of-his-butt-as-an-onion-because-it-is-so-fine-it-brings-a-tear-to-my-eye-can--i-get-fries-with-that-shake.
Stambuli may be hard, but his lectures are entertaining and incredibly useful. His tests are very fair but you definitely need to know your material.

Funny teacher. He seems serious at first but you will understand. He is very helpful after class and during office hours. This was the most I studied for a class during my second year but it helped me with the other Chemistry classes. Recommended.

Stambuli is a pretty good professor. First, he's halarious. The people that are upset probably didn't get the A that they wanted. He teaches fairly clearly, I never had a problem understanding my notes when I looked back over them. His tests are challenging because you can't really predict the types of questions he will ask, but he is fair.

One of the better ochem profs. his exam questions are taken from notes, so go to lecture. i suggest skimming over the chapters before lecture because his notes can get pretty confusing. but in the end, he teaches you everything you need to know. i would personally take him over callam any day.

Honestly, the worst science teacher I've had at Ohio State, he could care less how you do in the class. His notes are sloppy and don't make sense and his tests are completely unfair. There was barely a curve. HORRIBLE.

Dr. Stambuli will always get mixed reviews depending on the type of person you are and how you study. I had to drop the class yet I thought he was a good teacher. He looks like an intimidating man but he's very friendly when you ask him for help. His tests are hard, but he gives you all the tools you need. The rest is up to you!

Stambuli was not that great; he gives notes straight out of the book but barely gives you any practice problems or any kind of prep for the exams, so his style on exams is extremely hard to predict. Def take Callam if you can (I had him last quarter and he was way better) but from what I hear, you'll be ok if you take stambuli for both 251 and 252.

Dr. Stambuli is terrible, I dont understand how he has such good reviews. I had callam for 251 and he was 100 times better. Stambuli says you just need to know his notes, yet he pulls out questions that are way out in left field. Take someone else

I've had Professor Stambuli twice now and I must say he is a very great asset to The Ohio State University. Be sure to go to Office Hours and do all of the assigned problems from the book. I guarantee that if you can go through each problem before the test without a hitch, you will get an A in this class. DO Not depend on a curve. Do YOUR best. A+

Dr. Callam is the best ochem professor at OSU.  If you can get him for any class, always take him. Dr. Stambuli is a good teacher and solid second choice for 251. In 252, he was not as effective in explaining the material. If you had him for 251, I would recommend him for 252. If you had Callam, consider someone else. Workhardandyou'llbefine!

Why does everybody like him so much?  He explained things alright, except for his weirdo preference for drawing out structures instead of using skeletal form.  His expectation is that you devote your life to his class (not good if you are chem eng).  Just wait for spring quarter to take Callam - he's a hundred times better.

Best professor I've had at the university.  O-chem is a difficult class, and it was certainly a challenge for me, but he really took the time to explain materials clearly instead of just skipping over the tough stuff that needed clarification.

Dr.Stambuli was a very good teacher. He was clear in his explanations and really wanted students to do well in the class.His quizzes are group quizzes and his tests are hard, but very fair. Watch out for his final exam though, that tripped plenty of people up including me.

Dr. Stamuli finds a way to make you laugh during the most miserable, exhausting days.  His tests are fair, but far from easy.  You must go to class, read the book, do MANY problems and want to learn Organic Chemistry because like everyone else said- Organic Chemistry is far from easy.  I reccomend him.

Dr. Stambuli (or stromboli) is chem genius.  this guy knows his reactions and mechanisms likes its his business (which it is :-p)  regradless of who the prof is, ochem is hard.  he expects you to come to class and you should. some test problems come from lecture and tests are based all off his notes.  TA's are awesome too
Dr. Stambuli is a great teacher.  No matter who you take OCHEM will still be a hard class.  I would recommend him to any students taking 251.
Stambuli is awesome.  Very fair.  Read the book, do the problems, and go to class! You can get an A if you want it.

stambuli is awesome. very clear lecturer who sincerely cares that you learn the material. very approachable too. he's also hilarious which makes lecture more bearable. go to class, study the notes, and occasionally read the book and you'll do fine.

Professor Stambuli is very wonderful professor. I would highly recommend taking him for Organic Chemistry. If you want to do well in this clas, be prepared to go to Office Hours a lot and to do the homework in its entirety.

Stambuli is a dog.  Definitly take him if you can get to him before the Honors kids.  He's a nice guy, answers emails, has helpful office hours, gives group quizzes, and posts his old exams.  There's a reason this guy has a facebook fan club... The class isn't going to be easy, but if you're willing to put in a lot of hours, you'll do fine.
easy to understand
He is good

Stambuli is hilarious. Very dry sense of humor, but I never dreaded going to class. And lets face it, unless you're a chem. major, OChem is gonna suck. At least with Stambuli the class is somewhat bearable. Extremely accomadating as well...don't be swayed by the Callam worshipers. Stambuli is bomb.
i had stambuli for 251N and 252N. he is the only professor i've ever felt compelled to "rate". he's an amazing teacher and made my ochem experience bearable. i'd take him again if had the chance.
Taught well but exams were a little tough.  Could be funny but has a different kind of humor.

he and his midterms are very straight forward and BELIEVE him when he says that his notes are KEY. helps you work out answers to your questions instead of spoon feeding them to you. researches, teaches on the side. good sense of humor, really cares about his students and is good at what he does. excellent prof
Excellent teacher, very helpful.  Tests are easy if you pay attention in lecture and do homework.  Quizzes are usually easy and helpful as well.
Great professor. Is easy to talk to and pretty fair with tests. Makes a hard subject (organic chemistry) a little easier to learn. Nice to look at too.

Dr. Stambuli is the best teacher I have ever encountered in my life. He is so helpful and for once in my life a chemistry professor didn't make me feel like a idiot. His sense of humor is to die for and he is hot too. His test may not be easy but he is easy to look at.
Wonderful Professor!

Dr. stambuli is one of the best "professors" Ive ever had at OSU.  He loves to teach and is very concerned about his students understanding the material.  In addition you wont ever mind going to class and looking at his hotness!
Funny guy who really does care about his class; easy to understand and if you don't understand a concept he will help you out
Excellent professor, very straight forward and extremely helpful.  Highly recommended.

Dr. Stambuli was a wonderful professor who was always willing to help students and for a first time prof at OSU he did a wonderful job of explaining complex concepts and staying organized in order to help students actually learn organic chem. His humor was very "east coast" at times, but overall he made ochem as enjoyable as it can possibly be :P

It's rare to find a professor at this University who cares about his/her class as much as Dr. Stambuli does. He really puts forth effort to try and help students; he even changed his office hours to better accommodate students. He's approachable and clear, and just a flat-out "nice guy." Though sometimes cynical, he's definitely worth taking.

summary_comment: Dr. McCreery is perceived as very knowledgeable but often unclear in his lectures. Students find his discussions engaging yet sometimes tangential, with frequent detours into topics like the Haber Process. Despite the potential boredom, he is recommended to seek help during office hours due to his extensive example-solving sessions.

Ratings.comment: Very helpful and smart in my opinion. But not always clear.

Dr. McCreery tended to go off talking about the Haber Process and other random chemistry-related stories.  Lecture was fairly boring but filled with him blazing through examples.  He doesn't really ask for questions during lecture so if you're feeling confused you should probably head to his office hours.
He tends to go off on tangents all of the time, and of course everyone wants to know why a refrigerator works.
Richard McCreery - Why do you torture me so - Oxidize my soul

summary_comment: Eric is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and supportive nature, particularly excelling as a lab TA. While his classroom teaching is described as merely "alright," students appreciate his genuine personality and significant assistance with lab reports.

Ratings.comment: UGH I love Eric he is the best lab TA I have had at Ohio State so far.
He's an alright teacher but a really great guy. I would love to go out with him. Really helped me on lab reports.

summary_comment: The professor is generally regarded as unhelpful and even rude when dealing with administrative details, according to some students. However, others describe the professor as very knowledgeable and helpful, noting his laid-back demeanor and sense of humor, though they also mention his occasional sarcasm. Some students found the professor effective as a lab TA, praising his patience and willingness to assist without penalty, while others felt he focused more on distributing quizzes than on teaching in a formal setting.

Ratings.comment: Had to contact him about administrative details regarding the course and was completely unhelpful at rude. Hope that he is better as a TA.
Very helpful and knowledgeable.  Laid back and easy going.  Can be very sarcastic but funny.  Overall a great TA
Jake was very helpful and patient as a lab TA.  He was very laid back and would even help you fix large mistakes without deducting technique points.
I had him as a TA for chem 121. He's pretty laid back and pretty cool overall. Didn't really teach though, just handed out quizzes during recitation.

summary_comment: Professor Wysocki is inconsistent in his teaching effectiveness, with some students finding him helpful and caring, especially during office hours, while others criticize his confusing lectures and lackluster teaching style. Students generally agree that the class requires significant self-study, with many recommending reading the textbook, doing practice problems, and attending office hours for support.

Ratings.comment: If you want tests that are fair take his class. His explanations arent the clearest so youll need to watch YouTube videos or read the textbook but if you show up to every lecture, take good notes, and study and memorize those notes youll get an a guaranteed.

Wysocki is the definition of a subpar professor. He is terrible at teaching lectures. He just takes the material straight from the book and doesn't ever put any effort in to make the material flow or make sense. He also just rushes through the material without any compassion for if we are able to follow along or keep up. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Office hours are a must, he is always in his office even if its not his official hours. He will explain things and tell you what you do/don't need to know for exams. This class is straight from the book, and he is awful at lecturing so if you can't self teach don't take ochem w wysocki.

Be prepared to teach yourself basically all the material from the class. His lectures are confusing and disorganized and he doesn't explain anything well in class. It seemed as if he was just reciting his notes from the book rather than breaking down the material. I recommend reading the book and doing lots of different practice problems.

Do as many practice problems as you can, focusing on old quizzes and exams, Sapling, recitation activities, lectures, and the worked-problems in textbook. He's straight textbook, gives a ton of practice resources, and emphasizes lecture material heavily, but his lecture style isn't the best and he isn't the most helpful person in person. Good luck!
Reading the book before lecture helps a lot. He likes to use test questions right out of recitations or notes so always review everything he posts online.

Overall not a great professor at all. Lectures are confusing and doesn't really help in office hours because he talks down to you which is annoying. Went in about 3 times this semester and stopped because he would always give me the "I'm annoyed with you vibe." Someone on OSUCrush admitted that he let them take the exam in his office early. yea no.

OChem is a class that requires work and Dr. Wysocki is a professor that wants you to learn and truly cares about his students. If you go to his office hours and ask for help he is consistently there and willing to help you. All around good guy and if you do the work and ask for help you will succeed in this class.

Ochem is hard. That's just the truth. Dr. Wysocki makes himself available almost constantly if you suck up your pride and go into his office for help. It doesn't matter if you're a girl, it just so happens that those are the ones who suck it up and go in since a lot of the guys have too much pride. He gladly helps anyone who is serious about it.

This class was very difficult. Lectures were sometimes confusing, and since the material is very difficult, I found myself losing focus sometimes. I got the most out of reading the book and taking notes from there/doing practice problems. Exams were difficult but fair. Graded by 3 exams and a few quizzes, which makes the exams weighted a lot.

OChem sucks from any professor. It sucked with Wysocki. However, Wysocki is all in all a good professor. Communicates clearly during lecture, friendly, and rides a motorcycle. He didn't go far out of the way to make the class better for the students, but his tests were fair. If I took OChem 2, I would take it with him.

Dr. Wysocki had fair tests, much better than what I've heard about other Ochem professors. I would have to agree with the past reviewers. Dr. Wysocki was always nice to me and answered questions. However, his office hours were always full of girls trying to squeeze a rec letter or extra credit out of him. It made trying to learn difficult.

Lectures are very messy and unorganized, suggest sitting in Callams lectures or try to teach things on your own. Wysocki's exams are much better than the other professors but the same time and effort needs to be put in. His problems come from the book problems, recitation problems, and old exams. DO ALL PRACTICE EXAMS! try not to fall behind.

I really liked Wysocki as a professor. His tests were fair as long as you put in work. Takes a TON of his problems from the book. Lecture wasn't that great, I did a lot of work outside of class, but it's O chem so I didn't expect anything different. The class is hard but not impossible and if you go to his office hours, he'll answer all questions

Dr. Wysocki is probably the most solid choice for O Chem at OSU, especially if you compare to the other professors available. He doesn't have the most organized notes in class, and he definitely won't answer your emails unless you're really lucky. However, if you go to his office for help, he'll be helpful. All around nice guy, O chem is just tough

His lecture is really confusing for me. It's worse than I read the book. I actually need to go to Dr callam classes to listen again to figure out the knowledge. However he is available outside the class, and willing to help you with your problems. Next Tueyis the first midterm, hope it won't be too bad.

There's not a lot of room for error since it's the only grades are quizzes and exams. He usually won't answer emails since it's hard for him to explain the concepts that way, but he's always willing to help outside of class. Make sure to use his online resources and book practice problems. Exams are tough, but fair.

Wysocki's chalkboard lectures are stressful, unorganized and confusing. once you go over his ppts everything comes together and you'll find you don't NEED to go to lecture (I popped in a few times) quizzes are hard after 2nd one. exam 1 is literally the practice, 2nd exam is HARD, final was ok. book problems + his ppt notes is all you really need.

Wysocki is one of, if not, my favorite professor I've had so far. He is extremely concerned about how well every student does in his class. I went to office hours as much as I could during scheduled times and unscheduled (he's always in his office). He works through problems with you and basically tells you what's on the exams/quizzes (all book)

never had a professor who cared so much about how I did. I was failing with a 40% week 5 bc I'd never had a class with no homework. I started going to his office 3 times a week for him to give me problems to practice bc I have zero study skills. Hard life style change. Ended up with a role model (who never answers emails). always in his office

Quizzes every week. Stay on top of these quizzes, will help your grade tremendously.  READ THE TEXTBOOK. Try your best on midterms/exams. As long as you're with the curve you will be fine. Try your best but don't sweat it if your have a few or many bad grades. DR. WYSOCKI is a good lecturer and his exams match what he teaches.
You have a fair shot at getting the grade you want.  Its a tough class no matter who you have so just be ready to read the book and do problems.  The curve will help you out at the end of the day.

Decent professor. Never responds to email so you must meet him in person to have any questions answered. Studied a lot for the second and third exams but final was super easy since it was the exact same questions taken from the midterm. Takes questions directly from textbook so use that to study along with his class notes on canvas.

Don't usually do these, but DO NOT take with him if you have a choice. Probably the most rude professor on campus and does not care about you. My TA was probably a better teacher than him. If you do take class with him get ready to learn from somewhere (someone) else. Good luck!

Just don't ... Maybe this semester he was going through a personal crisis but Callam basically taught me most things because Wysocki wouldn't. If your not motivated enough to teach yourself Just don't .

Poor teacher. Use the book only as a guide. Do yourself a favor and get a second Orgo book I recommend Pearson and an educator membership. Does not answer emails TAs try very hard to answer questions about procedures in class but obviously they can only be so much help. Felt disrespected as did many other students. Ended with an A never again

Wysocki is easier in 2520 than 2510. Study the previous semesters quizzes and exams he gives you, as he loves to reuse problems exactly; his whole final was previous problems given ONLY. Attend lecture, as he will literally do a problem, tell you it will be on a quiz/exam, and it will be, exactly as it was previously written.

Dr. Wysocki is one of my favorite teachers at OSU.  While his notes on the board can sometimes get jumbled he always posts them on Carmen.  Just like he says in class his quiz and exam questions come from the book problems, and his exams repeat quiz questions (definitely fair exams).  His office hours are really helpful if you ever have questions.

Wysocki was a great person and his class was pretty straightforward.  Most of his test/quiz questions came directly from the textbook, even mechanisms, so do as many textbook problems as you possibly can.  All three of his exams were pretty easy, including the final, if you did enough prep work from the book.

I had him for 2510 and he was super easy (except the Final was the hardest exam ever). But I was in for quite a surprise in 2520. Midterm 1 was difficult but fair, but midterm 2 was pure evil. The final will be more difficult than the midterms. He gives no partial credit on synthesis problems, and the multiple choices really test your knowledge. GL

I thought he was ok. I felt his notes on the board during lecture were a little unorganized. He's quite sassy in emails haha, not always in a good way. He is worth it though in that his tests are some of the easiest organic tests-- not to say they're easy, but much easier than some other prof's. Also get many quizzes to bump your grade.

I really liked Wysocki this semester. If you asked for help he was really nice about it, and he often gave good hints in class. Some of his quizzes/ tests were difficult but definitely fair. If you do all the problems in the book he uses some of those problems directly on the quizzes/ tests. BEST Ochem professor at OSU! I am taking him for 2520.

Wysocki is the BEST OChem professor at OSU. He teaches exactly what's on the quizzes and gives hints as to what to really study. His exams are extremely fair. Do every single recitation activity and study the notes after every class. It's not hard to do well, so don't fear this class. The degree to which you study directly reflects your grade.

Dr. Wysocki is one of the best professors the chemistry department has to offer.  His lectures are somewhat confusing at times but he always puts his handwritten notes on Carmen.  Quizzes and exams are heavily based on the book problems, exams repeat old questions as well from quizzes.  I would highly recommend for OChem over any other teacher.

definitely do recitation problems and you won't have a problem with the quizzes. definitely look at his practice midterms; yes they are easier than the actual midterm but it's the fundamentals for the midterm I was given. Just do the work and you'll get a good grade. practice does make the grade, in and out of class. he is very reasonable.
Great professor. Study hard, you will do well.

Dr. Wysocki is one of my favorite professors I've had at OSU. He truly cares about his students, offers countless opportunities to receive one on one help outside of class, and goes above and beyond to offer advice and assistance with other classes. Do what he says and DO ALL THE PRACTICE PROBLEMS. Also. I found re-writing the notes super helpful!

Tests are hard but if you do the assigned problems as he is teaching, you will do just fine. Most of the exam problems are exactly like the homework problems he assigns. Our final was a lot harder than the midterms.
very curt in email exchanges,  says he believes in partial credit but you have to beg for it or you're losing most of the points... like 30 points out of 200 for a mechanism on the midterm

Dr. Wysocki is the easiest organic chemistry teacher you can get. Do the homework problems, read your notes and textbook as a supplement. If you put in the effort you get the grade you deserve. Everything he gives is reasonable and he wants all his students to do well. If he could give everyone an A he would. Just read, listen, and do the homework!
