Some test questions are from the homework given on Carmen (book), and the lectures he gives are in written form on Carmen as well. As long as you do the homework problems and study before each quiz, you are guaranteed at least a B. He gave about roughly 30 points of extra credit Spring 2015 out of 900 total points. He is a reasonable professor.

So unclear and rude. DOESNT CURVE. You can only miss 90 points out of 2 200pt exams 1 300pt final and 200pts worth of quizzes to get an A. I hated coming to class because it didn't seem like he wanted us to do well, but just make sure the average was a C. Just a  terrible experience. Plus his monotone voice put me to sleep every class

He has been on of the worst teachers i have ever had at OSU so far and I am a junior. He always talks down to students and takes terrible lecture notes. I went to his office hours multiple times and he just talks down to you and tell you to "keep doing the book problems" ..... which he doesn't even provide the answers to. Just a terrible experience

His lectures were disorganized and confusing. His midterms are easy, but even if you end up in the ER the night before DONT take the make up midterm.  It was 10X harder than his midterms with no curve. He genuinly doesnt care about his students and will NOT help you even if you end up in the hospital.

Dr. Wysocki by far was one of my favorite professors I've had, and I NEVER thought I'd say that about anyone in the chemistry department. Do the homework, I repeat DO IT. Study hard, rewrite your lecture notes, and don't fall behind. Exam's are fair, you can get 100%. (I got over 100% on the final with hard work!) He really cares, so ask for help.

summary_comment: Dr. S is a dedicated professor who offers extensive support to students willing to put in the effort, though her teaching style can be challenging for those who do not. Lectures are long and often unorganized, and exams are known to be difficult, requiring significant self-study. Despite mixed reviews, many appreciate her availability during office hours and her genuine concern for student success.

Ratings.comment: The course material isn't the easiest, but you will need to study outside of class. She's willing to work with you, as long as you put some effort in she wants to help. Very good at explaining things multiple ways. If you don't come to class the material will be difficult because the textbook is hard to understand. The homework is tedious
Long lectures. Hard quizzes. Extremely hard exams. Unorganized.

Dr. S was great for CHEM 1110! She is so sweet and always makes sure you are understanding. She goes out of her way to make sure she is accessible outside of class and visiting her in office hours is extremely helpful. She also makes it a point to host a review before each exam. Exams are very hard, but she will help you through it. Great professor

People like to give her good reviews because she's funny. As soon as she actually starts talking about substantive material, she dramatically shifts into a monotone and unengaging class style. Countless hours of busy work. She is always behind the other classes. So much so, she had to skip a chapter and make us watch videos on more lectures online.

Unless you know the information going in or are naturally good at this subject, be ready to teach yourself the material because she definitely does not. She is more concerned about being funny and interesting than actually teaching. Never felt prepared for exams and I had to spend a full week before each exam teaching myself the entire chapters.

by far the worst professor I have ever had. She puts on a friendly facade during lecture but outside of lecture is rude and unhelpful. lectures cover 1-2 chapters at a time. Constantly behind other classes. Online homework is published 1-2 days from the due date. I had to teach myself from the textbook and by doing practice exercises online.

Nice enough in lecture, rude outside of it. Never bothers with time-management during lectures. Shoves entire chapters into one lecture and then tests you heavily on it. Section distribution during exams not even at all

I LOVE Dr. S! I did get a C+ in the class, but I enjoyed the class because of her. She has plenty of office hours and is very available--GO TO OFFICE HOURS! She cares SO much about her students. I highly recommend going to office hours to get help and know her. Usually, knowing her will be more beneficial than knowing your TA. Real book not needed.

Dr. S gets really behind the other classes, however she teaches content pretty well and she makes class not terrible. The tests are very difficult and tricky, READ CAREFULLY. I had an A in the class all semester and then my grade dropped after the final. If you have an 92 or a 89, there is a good chance that the curve will NOT affect you.

Dr. S is a great person, and she's very funny, but is not a great Chem professor. We were constantly behind the other classes, had a lot less practice than the other classes, and she never went over example problems. The midterms are extremely hard but are very important to your grade.
she's interesting in lecture but sometimes gets distracted and jokes around too much.

Dr. Santagata is very personable and tries to make class entertaining. She loved to talk about her research and to the class, so much that we were consistently behind the other professors. It was rare that she finished a chapter on time. She is funny and a great person, but not a great teacher.
Grading criteria is very clear. Follow what it says and pay attention during lectures, you will do great!

This class is hard enough as it is, but Dr. Santagata simply rereads the book in her lectures and does not provide additional information on how to solve similar problems that have more difficult steps and elements to them. Going to the lectures is rarely helpful. I strongly discourage anyone from taking her class.

Dr. Santagata does a good job of keeping lecture light and fun as much as she can for a class thats very difficult in general. If, god forbid, I ever had to take chemistry again, Id hope to have her again.

This class was pretty difficult (for me at least) but she cares a lot about her students and has plenty of outside resources. Take advantage of the free tutoring on campus. I also recommend going to office hours. Exams are pretty difficult but she is a fantastic professor and will try her best to help you succeed. Also, TAKE NOTES IN LECTURE.
Overall a nice person but did not enjoy her teaching style. Go to lecture, take notes, and reteach yourself the information with the book.

The material of this class isn't too difficult, if you take AP Chem in high school this is basically just a review. However, the tests have tricky questions that screw you up on purpose. The final is worth more than your entire lab grade. She made some parts of her lectures amusing. She really cared about her students even outside of chemistry.

I did very well in her class and I loved her as a professor. Make sure you listen in lecture, a lot of the things she says in lecture will be answers on the test word-for-word! Definitely cares about her students and their success. Great professor.

I loved Dr. S.  Her lectures were very clear, and she was always sure to do examples of the types of problems that would be on the tests.  Her final was longer than the midterms, but it was about the same difficulty.  Dr. S is extremely accessible outside of class, and she encourages her students to keep in touch.  Definitely get to know her.

In her lectures, she is very straight forward.  She works through the practice problems thoroughly and even though it's a big lecture hall, she is open to answering questions in the middle of class.  The class is difficult, but she knows what she's talking about.  I recommend going to her office hours, great way to talk to her and get help.
Her lectures were primarily straight from her powerpoint (which is posted to Carmen each week). Midterms had a couple trick questions. Never used the book in class but it was useful when studying.

Her lectures were often very dry. Sometimes she would attempt to make the material more interesting, but it would end of making me more confused and frustrated because she was wasting time not teaching. Her exams were pretty fair, but you do need to practice and read the book material.

Dr. Santagata was a pretty easy professor. I got B+'s on two exams. Unfortunately, I had to retake one and she made that exam dangerously hard. I would advise not missing an exam no matter the excuse. Also, she did not curve the class what so ever which was extremely irritating. All and all, she was a solid teacher.

Chemistry is hard, but Dr. Santagata is extremely passionate and tries her hardest to make lectures fun. She genuinely cares about her students and even puts in effort into learning people's names. Make sure you go to her office hours even if you don't have a specific question! She will help you with labs/homework/ anything at all.
she was great

Dr. S made her lectures very interesting and easy to pay attention to since she obviously loves the material herself. Go to office hours! She is nice and easy to ask forhelp. I do not think you can do too well without reading throughout the semester, even if you just skim the chapters, this helped me clarify things from lecture I didn't understand.

I went to almost every lecture. She is a very bubbly person. She tries to make chemistry entertaining, but really it just confuses you more. Online homework assignments can be long. Make sure to get a 100% on all homework assignments because it will help you in the end. I finished with a 490.5/1000, I only need 10 more points and I would've passed.

There's a lot of grades that factor into your final grade, so you can do badly on an exam and still not fail. She's very fair; there's no surprises on your tests. She's also hysterical and tries to make a difficult subject a little more interesting and friendly by starting every lecture off with pictures of cats or babies that the class submits.

Dr.S is not bad. However, sometimes when I asked her questions, I felt that she did not have too much passion to help. Another thing I would like to mention is that my grades on the exams were overall way beyond the averages, but she only gave a B for my final grade, which I don't really understand.

I had Dr. S.  for both chem. 1110 and 1210 and would take her again for 1220 if she taught it. She's known to be one of the easier professors when it comes to midterms and finals. While her lectures can get boring, she's really nice and will always help if you go to office hours. A lot of the questions on tests are just like the ones on homework.

Gen chem at osu is difficult period but Dr. Santagata didn't make it any easier. The lectures weren't boring she's really good about keeping you entertained but she doesn't really teach. I didn't learn much at all. The exams are like a riddle so confusing. The averages were in the 40's or 50's but there is a bell curve at the end.
Her tests were ridiculously hard- you'd go in knowing the information and leave feeling jipped

The lectures aren't dry and it doesn't pain you to go to class but the exams are just stupid. On the midterms she doesn't just test you on basic knowledge and throws in trick questions so you'll come out feeling confident then get a bad score. Final was straight forward though and there's a curve.

Very hard class. Test averages are in the 50's and 60's. She does a bell curve so if you are above the curve you won't get bumped up too much. She is funny in lectures but her midterms are ridiculously hard and you don't know what grade you are getting in the class until the end of the semester which is frustrating. Be ready to work hard.

She was great. One of the easier gen chem instructors at Ohio State. Her exams are challenging but not impossible. Chem 1210 is an OSU 'weed out' class, and I would rather take her class than anyone else's

Dr. Santagata is amazing! If you have to take Gen Chem, take it with her! Her lectures are very straight-forward, and she posts everything online so missing class isn't a problem. She is funny and makes class tolerable. There are 3 midterms and a final. Don't cram and you'll be fine!

Dr. S is awesome! Very friendly, wants to get to know you and more than willing to help with clarification! The course isn't too hard especially if you took chemistry in high school but the midterms can be a little tough. Just don't put off studying
She is an amazing professor. She cares about her students and genuinely wants you to understand the material. If you have to take gen chem which is a very difficult class, TAKE HER!

AMAZING PROFESSOR! Trust me right now; if you have to take Gen Chem, take it with her! Every other professor is ridiculously hard. Santagata is funny, makes going to class an enjoyable experience, and actually writes fair tests. READ THE TEXTBOOK and go to the study area on masteringchem for extra powerpoints and quizzes. Overall, she is wonderful!

Very helpful lady. Kinda funny. My TA was the biggest help overall cause professors are hard to get in touch with, but she made herself available which can be rare for a professor. Exams are from the book. Loves to test conceptual stuff.

Dr. Santagata is by far the easiest chem professor at OSU. Her lectures are straight from the book, and so are her tests! She also gets many of her exam questions from the study area of mastering chemistry, so study those and her class is a breeze.

By the far the best science teacher/professor that I have ever had in my whole entire academic career. Gen chem at OSU is hard tho and so is her class, but going to her lectures really helps and she tries her best to keep everyone entertained!
She is truly passionate about Chemisty and tries to keep students engaged by making class fun.
Amazing teacher! She really makes class loads of fun, and makes sure everyone understands the material. Plus she posts the notes online, which is amazingly helpful. Overall a great lecturer!

Really awesome professor. DOES NOT SPEAK in monotone haha. I really loved her and she is the only reason I actually went to class. I took AP Chem so everything came really easy and I didn't even have to go, but I did anyway. Taking 1220 w/ her because I loved her so much! Really fun demos in class, she's adds some humor to the class. Take the class

She is a very good teacher, clear in class. She posts the slides after class so there is no need to write everything down. A lot of the test questions come from the homework or the studyarea in mastering chemistry.

She is a very kind professor and has a great sense of humor. she does a lot of fun demonstrations with the class. Her tests can be very hard, and I spent ridiculous amounts of time studying through the entire semester only to get my first B (As a senior who already has two degrees). Tough class.

Santagata was a great lecturer! Her sense of humor is geared towards college kids which made it fun, & included a Halloween costume contest. The average on the final was a 61, but I learned a lot in this course. Sometimes Santagata could be monotonous, but there were only maybe 2 lectures where I was actually bored. I'm sad I'm not taking 1220!
She was totally awesome and really fun. She explained everything in an easy manner. I just wasn't motivated enough :P

Dr. Santagata is really a great professor. She really cares about her students and wants everyone to understand things. The class is definitely hard though (any 1210 class is), but it is doable and it's possible to do well. She teaches directly from the book, so read it! A lot of her test questions come from little details in the book.

Very good lecturer. Willing to help you out and even make special arrangements to meet with you if office hours don't work. Tests are straight forward if you learn the material. Dry sense of humor and loves talking about her cat. Overall, awesome professor

She's nice, helpful, dry humor, tries to not make the class horrible like other professors.  She does speak in monotone though, which you just have to do something to keep your attention, check the time and then refocus.
good

She's super nice and really helpful if you email her or ask questions in person. Her exams don't aim to crush you, they genuinely test your knowledge. All her notes come straight from the book so I definitely recommend reading that. And class isn't mandatory, but I'd recommend going because she does cool demos and explains things well!

Great lecturer; has plenty of demos to keep the class from growing boring. Always willing to help out students and is fair on tests. She doesn't feel like she wants to punish students like other professors seem to act. Would definitely recommend her for classes.

Often times a tad boring, attention is easily lost when she talks because most of the time she speaks in monotone. Her demos are very exciting, though, and she doesn't talk to students like she thinks she knows more than you or like she's better than you, which is nice!

Dr. Santagata is an amazing professor. She genuinely cares about her students--I'm not able to attend her office hours because I have class during that period, and I made this aware to her. She then offered to meet me at 6:30 that night to help me out! I HIGHLY recommend getting her for chem. Great person, great teacher, cares for students.

Dr. S is my favorite professor at OSU so far! Her quizzes are extremely easy if you read the book. VERY helpful and is always giving incentives for bonus/easy questions on the exam. Exams are tough but not impossible. WONDERFUL lecturer! TAKE her class! I learned a lot.
Good professor. Challenging course, but she does attempt to make it easier for you. Actually cares about the students which is also a plus.
This class is hard, but not more so than any of ohio states other chem teachers. Dr. Santagata is extremely nice and helpful, she really makes an effort to keep the class interesting.

Really Great Teacher! Works to make sure her students understand a very difficult course. She gets to know you personally, she is nice and funny. Her exams are tough but not impossible and she gives 3 similar practice exams. Work to have her, it's worth it! My favorite teacher yet

Dr. Santagata is awesome. Her office hours are extremey helpful and she works really hard to make sure students are understanding the material. Exams are not bad if you do the homework and take advantage of her office hours!
I love Santagata. She is extremely helpful. She wants to help you as much as possible. Also, she attempts to remember names. This makes the class seem more personal. Take her class!!

Dr. Santagata is really nice. Her class is fun most of the time with at least one demo a week. However, sometimes her lectures don't make sense and can be boring. She is slightly easier than the other 1210 instructors. Read the book for clarity and do the homework problems as they help prepare you for quizzes and exams.

She is fun and interactive. Most lenient teacher I know. She has demonstrations almost every week. I recommend doing the homework because she will sometimes base the quizzes and exams on them. Exam level is probably the easiest compared to the other teachers. I really like Santagata and highly encourage you to take her class!

Good teacher, spends a lot of time off topic during the beginning of lectures. Quizzes are relatively easy if you pay attention during lecture and do practice problems. Same goes for tests. Overall a good teacher.

I pretty much hate this class.  I like her as a person though.  I find that we waste about 15-20 minutes every lecture on random facts.  The exams are quite difficult to me, but then again, I don't do the homework.  Apparently Z gets As, but I have no idea why.  I suspect he has resources...

She is an awesome lecturer, she keeps everyone in line. Her midterms are very difficult if you do not study. Read the text book it, it will make your life a whole lot easier in her class. Very nice person and makes class interesting and fun.
Extremely helpful!

Dr. Santagata works really hard at trying to help her students understand Chemistry. If you go to her during office hours it is especially helpful. She's also really nerdy and tries to keep things fun. FUN TIME FRIDAY!

summary_comment: Based on student feedback, the professor was largely seen as inexperienced and ineffective, particularly in her first semester teaching organic chemistry. Students found her lectures inadequate and her handling of a class failure unprofessional, leading to significant dissatisfaction. Overall, her teaching quality was considered poor, with many students expressing reluctance to take her course again.

Ratings.comment: Had ochem 2 SP18. It was her first semester teaching, honestly she wasn't that bad. I her "fill in the blank" notes for us. We'd come in to lecture with our notes printed out and we'd fill in/ work on problems. Not bad, she was just inexperienced. Oh the best thing was the take home exam! tough, but work in huge groups and its a grade booster!

It was her first semester ever teaching, so I'll try not to be too harsh, but overall she was just not a good teacher. She did a poor job explaining the content often times. Furthermore, when the class failed the 2nd midterm, she got angry and entirely blamed the class, rather than taking any of the blame herself. Would not take again if I had to.

By far one of the worst teachers I've ever had. This was her first semester teaching and it was a disaster. She doesn't teach. She just speaks to us in lecture as if we're her colleges that already know this information. Then she blamed us when the whole class failed the second midterm. She doesn't have the experience to be this arrogant.

summary_comment: The professor for Chem 1210 employs a rigorous flipped classroom approach, requiring students to watch detailed prelecture videos (30-50 minutes each) to stay on track, with online homework making up a significant portion of the course load. Despite the demanding structure, the instructor offers extra credit opportunities and curves, but success hinges on consistent effort and engagement.

Ratings.comment: For chem 1210 its a flipped classroom. He posts prelecture videos approx. 30-50 min long shortly before each lecture. While these are optional, if you dont watch them you will be completely lost. There is a lot of online homework considering it is only 5% of your overall grade. There is extra credit and a curve, but you have to work hard.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, effectively explaining concepts and demonstrating genuine care for his students' success. His passion for the subject is evident and significantly enhances the learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Cool guy
He explains things super well and genuinely cares how everyone does in the class. You can tell he loves what he does and that shows in his teaching!

summary_comment: John is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, particularly in CHEM 1210, where he significantly enhanced students' understanding of the material, often clearer than the lectures. His approach is patient and supportive, making him a valuable resource for students finding the course challenging.

Ratings.comment: John was a great TA that really helped me in CHEM 1210. It was an especially hard course for me, and I found myself understanding him much better than I understood the lectures most time. He is very understanding, and seems non-judgmental at the least - haha. Overall, thanks John, definitely get into his recitation/lab if you can.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his engaging and knowledgeable teaching style, known for telling memorable stories and providing practical, real-world examples. Students appreciate his clarity and fairness in exams, though some find his teaching style and note-taking methods challenging initially. While some note his effectiveness diminishes with age, others consider him one of the best teachers, especially excelling in advanced courses like spectroscopy.

Ratings.comment: Enjoyed his demeanor and style. Told great stories. One story involved when tear gas was released during student demonstrations in the 1960s and how he had to Put egg on his face to keep the gas from affecting him. It was part of the lesson.
Great teacher.  Super organized and clear.  Very helpful.

Swenton is a smart man who knows his chemistry. He gives real world information. He'll tell you the EPA will bust you for using chromium so you need to find another way. Stuff like that. It was difficult to figure out what was FYI vs what was testable material. Gave lots of industrial synthesis examples that were useful but not relevant. He's tough

It takes some getting used to the way he does notes (gives you a handout), but he is very knowledgable and tries to relate chemistry to your life. His exams are very fair and very doable although not necessarily easy. Other than Callam this was my favorite Ochem prof

Department pulled this guy out of retirement to teach this quarter because they were apparently short. I can imagine he was a great teacher back in the day, but unfortunately he truly is senile now. Very scattered and all-over-the-place, has trouble understanding what you're saying to him, loses track of structures mid-reaction, etc. Long exams.

He is probably the best teacher I have known.  That's not surprised the Dept of Chem has a teaching award named after him.  Chem 652 is an upper level/graduate course, his approach on spectroscopy and explanations are extremely helpful for students who are doing research.
Great professor!! Might take time getting used to his teaching style, but he really is very good at communicating the material.  Really funny too

His tests aren't bad,half fill in and half mc.  I personally thought his way of explaining mechanisms and reactions was unorganized, but there is always the book as a back up.  I put a lot less time into this class than I had to to get an A in Callam's 251 class.

This guy loves to use the slides all the time, he does not write on the wall which is so confusing  since you the reaction mechanism does not make any sense. His test are brutal and his grading system is biased. This guy is ol'skool and will do anything to make ya life miserable (and then tell you there is nothing to write home to mom about)

Great ochem prof.  exams were very fair, as were quizzes.  tells great stories in lecture actually a really amusing old man.  expect to study 12-20 hours per exam depending on comprehension level.  don't study heavily out of the book, rely on his lecture notes, they can stand alone.  MAKE FLASHCARDS!  252 has 100+ rxns you MUST KNOW for the final.

Dr. Swenton is one of the best professors I have ever had.  He's kind of old school, but extremely helpful and knows what he's talking about.  He also has some pretty interesting stories that relate perfectly to the chemistry we're learning.  I learned a lot in this class and am glad that I took him for it.

Let's face it, its OChem.  He's a pretty good teacher, his tests are hard but pretty fair.  Definitely look at the old quizzes and exams.  He reuses problems, sometimes verbatim.  He is pretty old school, but he's funny and makes a boring subject more bearable.

Swenton is old school. If you like teacher who write on the board, dont' take him.  You have to reread all the text in the notes after class. You must read the text book to understand anything. His tests are part MC and fill in.  He doesn't hold office hours, but his TA's are helpful.  They say he's the best for 252, but I would sayhe's just averag

THis guy was one of the best professors I ever had at Ohio State.  I believe he retired several years ago, but I just wanted to comment on the excellent education I received in his class.  Hardest class I ever took and I worked my butt off for my A, but it was well worth it.
He's one of the best O-Chem professors at OSU!

Loved his class.  It was an hour and a half twice a week, but the time seemed to fly by!  Very well organized, well-spoken.  Loved that he used current scientific articles to illustrate the usefulness of OChem.
No Comments
Extremely well-organized, intelligent, and helpful. One of the best professors I've had.
One of the Best
Very organized notes.  He gives practice exams that are very similar to the actual exams.  He really stresses the things he thinks are important in class.
great teacher, great notes, makes o-chem not as bad.
He is a good prof. Sit up front and he will like you more. Tests and quizzes arent bad, the final is rough.  I'd take him again of I could.
Very well organized and seems to enjoy what he's doing.  Very hard, but that's the class, not him.  Great notes and very clear.
Difficult, but thats how o.chem goes.  He is WAY better then Fraenkel.

Very clear and extremely well organized.  No surprises throughout the course.  He is hard, but does not expect you to know anything he does not teach you.  I learned a lot from him.  Keep up or you will be lost.
****poor.
Very intelligent, very helpful.  I never went to office or sat in front, but still recognized me on the street.  Always willing to help.
No Comments
No Comments
Excellent prof.... hard exams :(
No Comments

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, consistently delivering clear and engaging lectures that enhance students' understanding of the subject matter. He is known as a "nice guy" among students, fostering a positive and supportive learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Nice guy

summary_comment: The professor is generally well-regarded for making classes more enjoyable due to his approachable and positive demeanor. He is effective in explaining concepts clearly. While he may lack strong opinions, students appreciate his consistency and friendliness. Additionally, Jordan, one of his TAs, is highly praised for leading effective discussions and being very helpful in recitations.

Ratings.comment: Doesnt have any strong opinions. Good Guy overall, I think he makes class more enjoyable.
Idk about him eating sushi at 10:20 but everything else is pretty cool. kinda reminiscent of a golden retriever. explains stuff good.
Jordon is the best TA in the chem department. Consistently says yall and is great to have in recitation. Leads a great discussion in recitation and is very helpful.

summary_comment: Ilia is highly regarded for his comprehensive knowledge of chemistry and his ability to make the subject engaging, particularly in lab settings where he consistently awarded high grades. Students consider him an invaluable resource, noting his extensive understanding of the material surpasses that of many other TAs. His guidance significantly enhances the learning experience, making him a standout TA for CHEM1610.

Ratings.comment: Ilia was my CHEM1610 TA last semester. Hes definitely a blessing for chem students. Lab with him was fun, and he often gave high lab report grades to students. He seems to know everything about the material (compared to other I dont know TAs, hes a know-it-all). I was quite fortunate to have him as chem TA to give my college life a good start.

summary_comment: The professor is challenging and moves quickly through lecture slides, making her difficult to follow without preparation. Students find her lectures unhelpful and her tests, while not extremely difficult, are harder than expected. Many advise attending classes regularly, doing homework thoroughly, and utilizing supplementary resources like SI sessions to succeed.

Ratings.comment: She moves super quick through the lecture slides and she is very hard to understand. There is every day attendance...I was counted absent even when I attended every lecture and she wouldn't look into the problem when I asked. Goodluck, she is a tough one. My advice: do the homework (don't just chegg it) if you want to pass and GO TO SI SESSIONS!

Purely reads off of a powerpoint. Is not helpful to students in any way. Homework is extensive and the format of it is a pain. Her tests are not extremely hard if you study and they are much harder than the departmental final, which is a plus. Overall, she is not a good teacher and I would try to take anyone else. Study everyday outside of class.

I am a bright student, but she is ruining my grade. Worst professor I have had so far. Pre-labs are fill in the blank and never specify anything, so you don't know what to put into the blank even though you could easily pick the answer if it were multiple choice. Put in the chemical formula instead of the name? wrong. Her whole system is awful.

Doesn't make sense! Her lectures are redundant so you think the tests would be easy, but she tests you over things she's never taught. Unreasonably difficult for a beginner chemistry class. She relies on technology a lot which wastes class time, and doesn't know what she's lecturing about unless its in her notes right in front of her.
Egregious pre-labs, incredibly unfair grading, and a broken system. They know everything about this class is awful but they won't fix it. I'm losing my 4.0 for this lab.
Ridiculous with the broken blackboard pre-labs.

I had her for 1301 at Texas Tech and she was awesome! She taught at a nice pace. I had a friend in another class and they were always way behind. Definitely go to class and at least listen. She knows what she is talking about. She also offers review sessions before the test... go to those.

I had Professor Telesford's chem1307 at 8am Tuesdays and Thursdays. I rarely went so I made a B; however, if I had gone to class more often I'm sure she would have explained concepts and I would have understood them more clearly. This class requires work, but it is not impossible.

Horrible professor. Not helpful at all I tried emailing her a few times and very rarely did I get a response. I basically taught this entire class to myself. Attendance counts for a grade but her lectures are very unclear, she reads off a a power point the entire time and never explained the few problems she worked out on the board.

Lectures are rushed and so it is hard to get a lot out of them. She just reads a powerpoint which she sends out which makes coming to class pointless. Only thing done in class other than powerpoints is working out problems no one can see on a small board. Hard to understand and is not helpful. Requires a lot of outside work, tests are not that hard

Probably the meanest lady I've ever encountered. The labs were unclear, she did not explain them well. The prelabs were impossible due to the idiotic wording of the assignment. And she will kick you out for things the incorrectly placing something on the scale.
The discussion posts are graded very harshly. No one I have talk to has ever made more than a B on them. There is no extra credit. The quizzes are short, so if you miss one you get an 80.

The tests are a bit hard, so study! All of the tests for 1307 are mostly the same though, so don't expect another teacher's test to be easier. She knows her stuff but she tends to rush a bit while some of the other classes are still behind. She assigns homeworks about a week or 2 apart from each other, but there are still quite a few.
I only had her for recitation but she was okay.  She was able to answer questions but in class she didn't really help.

summary_comment: Dr. Tiff is highly regarded as an exceptional professor, known for challenging students to excel while providing flexible and supportive teaching methods. She customizes her exams based on class performance and encourages engagement both in and out of the classroom. While effective, she also emphasizes the importance of completing online homework assignments, which significantly impact grades.

Ratings.comment: Best professor I have ever had. You will have to work hard for an A, but it is possible. She writes her own exams based on the level the class is performing at. Don't be afraid to ask her questions and take advantage of the STEM center. WE LOVE DR. TIFF!!
She is pretty good. Very sociable, will talk to a class like friends. Will change the class if something isn't going well. Don't forget the online homework, as it counts big.

summary_comment: Dr. G is a highly dedicated and caring professor known for his challenging yet fair approach. Students appreciate his genuine interest in their success and the supportive lab environment, but warn of difficult exams and intense coursework. Despite the rigor, the generous grading curve helps alleviate some stress.

Ratings.comment: There is a nice curve in the class, about 30%. His exams are very hard. There is a lot of homework. Be ready to put in the work. He does genuinely care about his students and puts in the effort to show up during the lab. Good guy, tough class, tough grades, nice curve

I may be biased because I love Dr. G, but this class was a lot of fun. It gets you connected to a lot of other chemistry majors who love chemistry just as much as you do. Dr. G also genuinely cares about every student in this class and makes it a memorable experience. I don't think I would be the same person if I hadn't taken this class.

Amazing instructor. Really genuinely cares about every single student and will do his best to help them succeed. Ridiculous exams but with a ridiculous curve to match. Would take him again in a heartbeat.

Took him Spring 2018. Lectures cover very basic concepts with few examples, but exams cover complicated, math-heavy applications. Forces you do things the analytical chem way, so the book is rendered useless, and he's the sole resource. Online homework wasn't helpful. Had a 4-hour midterm and a 2-hour final that had even more questions. Big curve.

Dr. G is probably the nicest professor in the Chemistry department, but he makes up for it with his nearly impossible exams. Dont worry too much about the exams though, they are curved well. Dr. G will make sure that you have fun while being grilled through this challenging course.

Dr. G. is awesome and truly cares about his students. Having said that, this class was extremely stress-inducing and featured a lot of cutthroat competition. Midterm/final averages were 30-60% before the curve. I wouldn't recommend taking this course. On a side note, the lab research project (on perovskites) was interesting.

Honors is really hard, but Terry does a pretty good job of helping you understand it. His exam questions are really mathy, and sometimes feel like you need a stroke of genius to answer some questions. However, he has said that if you show what you know, they'll take care of you. My final grade of 68 was curved to a B+.

Doing practice problems in the book are a must! However, nothing can compare to the questions on his exams. Just try your best and show as much work as you can (with sig figs)! For our class there was about a 20% curve, so don't be discouraged by your grade on Carmen. He truly is the nicest professor I have had at OSU, and will help with anything.

His tests were ridiculous, but the rest of the class wasn't bad. Once you figure out his style of questions, the tests were more manageable, but not easy whatsoever. Dr. G was really helpful during his office hours and such, but that didn't make his tests less awful.
Really hard course but Dr. G does a great job of teaching it. Always there to help you if you don't understand something and really wants you to succeed.

This class was in one word, relentless. The material that Dr. G covered was in no means difficult, but the tests were "notoriously difficult" as described by them. They were more of a test of how well we can do hard algebra problems in a time constraint than actual chemistry.  I overall feel like I learned nothing in this class.

His portion of the class was really easy material, but his tests turned it into a nightmare. They were more a measure of your alegbra skills than your ability to do chemistry, and even with the curve at the end, the class was far more work than any knowledge I gained. I really enjoy learning chemistry, but this class was not at all fun.

As an honors course, this class is definitely very difficult. I have been incredibly challenged by his part of the course, but it was worth it. He is such a sweet professor and makes an effort to get to know each of his students and individually help them be successful. I would take his class again any day and will always remember Dr. G.

Makes simple topics much harder than they have to be, and enjoys giving long tests with really low averages. Nice guy and the curve is generous, but I just don't think his class is worth it for the amount of time and stress.
Hardest class I've ever taken but he is super nice and willing to help if you ask. Exam questions seem to come out of nowhere.

Dr. G is a super nice guy and I definitely recommend going to his office hours if you can. That said, this class is not easy and required a large amount of studying. Luckily, the curve was huge and you can still do well.

Nice guy and all, really. took him for 1210 my freshman year, the way he graded homeworks on mastering chemistry was pretty unfair though. Exams were fair, I feel. He'd put up a problem on the board in class and wouldn't walk people through it at the end. that was my one knock on him. nice guy but you can definitely find better.

This was probably the worst class I ever had. Nothing he ever taught was actually on the exam and he didn't even teach us exactly how to do the math problems. He actually said he was happy no one got a 100 on the exams. We basically had to teach ourselves with the massive amount of homework he gave us. Have to retake it.

I literally cried everyday of the semester because of this class. Tears of complete frustration. You could attend every lecture and go to tutoring, and they still did not prepare you for his exams. Only passed because of a 100 point curve. Final exam avg was a 30%. Always hoped to get hit by the CABS bus before and after his exams. He is AWFUL!!!!!

HORRIBLE!!! He spends every lecture covering concepts; however, his exams are math intensive. He never teaches a single math problem in class, and expects you to know how to do them. Don't study the concepts because 97% of his exams are math related questions. His answers usually look like XX.3, 1X.X, X5.X, so you have no idea if it's right. AVOID!

This professor spent most of class time discussing concepts associated with the course. He gives excessive amounts of homework that can prove to be helpful if you have limitless amounts of time to do all of it accurately. And his exams are highly associated with applying equations. Be sure to get good at stoich, that shows up a ton.

Hands down the worst professor I've had to experience thus far. His class was disorganized, especially in relation to the online homework, and his exams were impossible to prepare for--as others have said. I would most definitely not take a class with Dr. Gustafson again.

Dr. Gustafson will not clearly tell you what is and isn't on the exams. He does not give you his own practice exams; instead, he will direct you to other instructors' practice exams. The one time I met with him regarding my grade, he was more than happy to let me know how I was doing with respect to the class averages. Final exam was RIDICULOUS!

This class was literally awful. His exams were impossible to prepare for and included way too much math for a gen chem course. His teaching style was terrible and his abundant jokes during lecture were even worse. He relied a lot on online hw which was hard when you aren't taught anything. He's very clearly used to teaching higher level courses.

I loved Dr. G.  He's very helpful and is a super nice guy.  Definitely go to his office hours and you might need to use the book to better understand the material. He does give a TON of online homework, but that is honestly what will help you the most on his exams; lots of math.

He's infatuated with himself and the fact that he's a professor. His method of teaching is walking around striking poses and telling jokes, but giving online assignments to learn. The exams were VERY EASY conceptually, but involved  long, drawn out, tedious arithmetic.

Nice guy, but a bad teacher.  He will make time for you to ask questions, but his examines are near impossible.  They are glorified math tests.  If you did not take AP Chem, I would not recommend him.  However, he is the nicest guy and makes time with office hours.  You can tell he really enjoys chem.  Would not recommend. Normally teaches honors.

This was his first 1210 class in like 10 years and it was clear that he was used to teaching higher level classes. He treated us like we should know the material before lecture. He gave an excessive amount of online homework and tutorials to do before each lecture. The average for the midterms combined was a 62%. Take someone else if possible.

Dr Terry Gustafson is an excellent chemistry professor. It seems that he teaches few classes now--his only undergrad class seems to be honors analytical chemistry Autumn quarter (will be semester starting 2012). Nonetheless, I would highly recommend him. His exams tend to be in the evenings.

great great great class and teacher. loved it how you really didn't have to look at the book much but instead could just go to lecture and get everything you need to know. has a bit of a temper if people ask the same questions repeatedly, but good teacher. best one in the honors gen chem series this year. go to class!

You really have to do the book problems outside of class and ask grad students in the chem help room in celeste if you want to do it because he skirts around actually answering questions. His exams definitely are math intensive, but there are a lot of practical applications on his exams related to food science and environmental science.

Umm he is not helpful at all. People ask him questions and he shoots them back at them. He also has the most annoying laugh...looks like the man is about to go into shock. Don't take his class...just drop Honors.

Attend lectures to understand concepts, but do the problems in the book (especially the integrated ones).  The tests are ridiculo-hard.  Here is an example of how the questions are:  "There is a boy in russia eating ravioli.  What is the fifth biggest moon of Jupiter?"  srsly.

SURVIVAL GUIDE: Do all the review problems you can in the back of the book. He doesn't care as much about how well you understand the theory of chemistry, which is what is covered in class, as he does about you trying to solve a problem given limited information. He's worthless in regards to preparing you for the exam. Just try to beat the average!

He refuses to do examples in class. Notes have no relation to what is actually expected of you to know. Test problems resemble nothing you will have ever seen before. He openly makes fun of students failures and mistakes in class (this is no joke). Hardest, most disorganized, and largest amount of outside class work than any other class.

Never does examples, never goes over the quizes or exams (just gives the answers). Don't expect much help... you better have one heck of a TA helping you. Nothing in lecture relates to the exams or quizes, and it's basically a math class in disguise. Good luck!
best chem profesor ever! extremly hard tests, so be prepared!
only tests on math.  lecture does not pertain AT ALL to exams.
one word: creepy! Dr g. is nothing short of a weirdo. His lectures are convuluted an misleading. He doesn't test from the notes. Stay away!
No Comments
Yes, very challenging, but your hard work will be rewarded.  I got a 50% on the final and got an A in the class.

this is probably the class i have worked the hardest for in all of college but learned the most.  dr. gustafson was very helpful and kind outside of class and was willing to do anything to help his students learn the material.  got understandably annoyed when students asked dumb questions.

Very tough class (let's just say I'm never taking chem again!) The guy was genuinely interesting in making sure the students understand while not killing GPA's (VERY generous curve.) I should have gone to more office hours.
This guy is awful!  There should be a warning label on this class.
Two words- horrible teacher.  DO NOT TAKE!!!!

This class is a piece of work.  All of the questions on hisexams are problem based and are VERY difficult.  however, if you take the time to do practice exams, the exam will resemble the patterns.  Fair lecturer, helpful in office hours.  sigh, so glad i'm done with that

Hmm...What does that little "H" stand for before the course number? Oh yeah, "honors."  Suck it up you bunch of babies! Dang, did you expect an easy HONORS chemistry class? Dr. Gustafson is a great professor-helping, caring, and committed-just be prepared to work.

This man is the worst teacher ever.  He makes the tests completely ridiculous.  I failed his first midterm, then went to chem 121 and got an A with no problem.  This man was my worst nightmare.  Don't take this class.  Unless you like tortue.
Sadistic.  I learned a lot, but it was very stressful.  He helped a lot outside of class, though.
I hate this guy.  The tests are out of control.  He couldn't teach the class if the book hit him in the face.  He's sarcastic, mean, and arrogant.  Unless you've had 2 years of AP chem, don't take.

This is the hardest class I've ever had. The lectures have very little to do with the material you are tested on.  It's full of pre-med students who took 1-2 years of AP chemistry in hs. Those who don't fit that description are way behind. Even with a tutor I couldn't pass this class.
I really liked the class, I didnt even take AP chem in high school and still got a B+.  HE is hard but if you try you will not get less than a B+.
Dr. G was a hard prof, but it was worth it in the end.  Go to his office hours and it'll pay off.  He's also a great guy and is worth getting to know outside of class.

This class is very hard-the exams are very hard and gustafson hates any and all questions raised during class. He pretty much scorns anyone who asks a question. I would definitely not recommend this course... take 121.
The class was really hard.  If you haven't had AP chemistry, don't bother.  Dr. G is a jerk and can't explain anything well.

Class is NOT that hard. It seems hard to freshman because they have never had college level material and still expect to be breezing through it. Dr. G, however, isn't that great at explaining things and if you're stuck with something, go to the TA.

Dr. Gustafson was always willing to help and go the extra mile for his students.  He was very personable, and while his tests were difficult, he took most questions straight from the homework and always curved fairly (avg grade was a B or B-).
the course was entirely too difficult, there was no need for the tests to be that crazy. the class moved too quickly- no amount of help, though it was avaliable, could suffice

i loved this class!  dr. gustafson was very helpful and was willing to do almost anything for the students.  challenging, i had to study a lot, but you definitely get a lot more help than i regular chem 121.

This class is very hard, so expect to spend most of your free time on it.  however, if you work you will leave understanding chemistry much better than you did before.  Dr. G is VERY helpful in office hours, and can be funny.  he's also a great guy!

Class really hard but worth the work. Don't enter unless ready to work, it will be your life till it's over. He goes a little too fast and isn't always clear. I personally found more help with the TAs. Trust his notes more than the book!

I can't stand this guy.  The class is absolutely absurd.  Dr. G is rude and not helpful at all.  He expects WAY WAY WAY to much.  It is not worth the effort AT ALL.  My advice: stick with the regular chem 121 series.
Very helpful and takes a great interest in teaching.

very, very tough class, even if you keep up with the work. tests are very hard and almost impossible to prepare for.  nice curve for grading, though.  knowledgeable. dr. g. is no-nonsense.  warning: class may make you HATE chemistry with a passion.

Can't teach.  Tests are absurd.  Rude.  Smartass. Flirts with girls.  Ridiculous amount of work.  The class is not worth the effort.  Only take it if you are masochistic.  I used to love chemistry, but this man made me absolutely despise it.
A great guy, makes a great mentor.  He is there for his students.  His tests are impossible, but it's Honors chem, it's not supposed to be easy, and everyone does bad on them.  Curve is awesome.
The exams are very hard, but if you are truly there to learn chemistry, the class is worth taking

He is a great teacher. You must be willing to put in a little bit of work. However he does offer a ton of help...all you have to do is ask. Also, the midterms can be intimidating, but for those who like chemistry you will find that they are actually fun.
Don't fall for it. Class is not worth the work - stick to General version. This guy is sadistic (and always wears all denim).
doesn't teach, he lectures and expects you to figure it out
I really liked the class even though it was hard, he offers a lot of extra help
He's not easy, but you learn a lot and if you're having problems, he will help.
tough class and hardest exams ever...don't take this class
His test are hard but you learn a lot and he is a really nice guy!
annoying voice, impossible exams, smartass; pretends to care though
He's great!
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!  Um.  Don't take his class.

summary_comment: Dr. Moga's oversight of Chem 1210 and 1220 labs is marked by unhelpful and condescending communication, and the lab software is criticized for being subpar, leading to confusing and overly strict formatting requirements that penalize students even when they grasp the material well.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Moga runs the Chem 1210 and 1220 labs. You will likely never see her but she sends messages that are unhelpful and condescending. The chem labs use awful software for prelabs. They give very aggressive instructions, but leave out pertinent information so even when you completely understand the material you lose points on formatting.

summary_comment: Dr. Dutta's teaching quality is mixed, with some students finding his lectures challenging to follow due to his handwriting and scattered delivery, while others appreciate his helpfulness during office hours and the usefulness of the course material. Some students find his exams difficult but fair, noting that he provides clear indications of exam content, and he is flexible and supportive outside of class. However, many students also report that his lecture notes are often unhelpful for homework and exams, and the material covered in lectures does

Ratings.comment: His lectures are scattered and very difficult to follow.  He handwrites all of his notes and they are confusing/hard to read because his handwriting is atrocious. He is helpful in office hours.

This is a very useful and challenging course. Dr. Dutta is a good instructor. He takes care of everyone (he can memorize almost everyone's name). His lectures are concise and his office hours are helpful. Exams are hard but he usually tells us what will be tested before each exam.
This guys is horrible. He will doc you points for attempting to answer questions on his exam if you don't know the answer. He will give you negative points for incorrect answers.

Utilize Dr. Dutta! He is flexible in meeting with students at all times, especially right before an exam. Print out the notes and take your own notes, paying attention in class is much more helpful than reading the book. If you understand everything (literally) in his notes and work out the numbers, you'll be ready for his exams. Think critically.

dutta's lecture notes were near useless for the homeworks and his exams. his lectures taught you material that was irrelavent from what he actually excpected from his students. and the textbook used did not help either it explain everything in either too much or not enough detail than what was needed

summary_comment: Professor Grandinetti's teaching quality is highly variable according to student feedback. Some students find him confusing and ineffective, with inconsistent course materials and unclear exam content, while others praise his thorough explanations, willingness to help, and ability to make complex topics accessible. Overall, his effectiveness seems to depend significantly on the student's prior knowledge and their ability to stay engaged with the material.

Ratings.comment: Absolutely HORRIBLE.  Instead of putting everything all in one place on Carmen, he puts half on his website, half on Carmen leading to endless confusion.  He is extremely bad at telling us what will be covered on the quizzes and exams (which are 100% of your grade).  I don't understand why he actively tries to make this class more impossible.

Dr. Grandinetti may be good at the research that he does, but he does not know how to teach physical chemistry. Half of the lectures are spent on derivations that never appear in the textbook and don't help in any way, and the quizzes are a guessing game of whether or not you will actually have learned what's on it before you take it.
Amazing teacher. Provides notes, practice problems, and previous years' exams on his website. The lectures are clear and he makes sure people understand

Grandinetti was a good teacher, very knowledgable about chemistry. He went very in-depth in class and reading the book was really helpful. With students' questions and his reviewing each class, we quickly fell behind and ended up learning two chapters in two lectures. If you have a good base in chemistry and work hard, you can still do well.
Great teacher. Tests weren't too bad and there was a good curve to the final grade.

Professor Grandinetti was great! He really wants his students to succeed & LEARN. He welcomes questions and explains everything very thoroughly. Notes are online. Quizzes are straightforward. Midterms/final were more difficult but the class is curved. Really good professor, makes class interesting and explains everything in a way you'll understand.

I actually also had this guy for 221 and 520, and he was phenomenal. I had no desire to take either class, but he really tries to make you love it like he does, and that helps. Also, he is incredibly approachable and very nice. I got destroyed in both classes because of the subject matter (not him), but I would have completely failed without him.

I had Dr. Grandinetti for both chem 520 and Analytical Chem 221.  Both subjects are not easy, however, Dr. Grandinetti does a great job of explaining difficult concepts.  I have gone to him outside of office hours and he was more than willing to help me understand what I had questions on.  If you do the homework problems you will do well on tests.
He was really hard. He was a very thorough lecturer and went over concepts well, but his tests were hard.
Very hard class. Nice teacher, interested in helping students but exams were VERY difficult!
He's a good teacher but his exams are so HARD they make a rock look soft and cushy.
Moves really fast and does not really explain what he is doing
Fairly hard class, examples in lecture were much easy than the questions on the exams, which were impossible. Seemed like a nice guy though.

He was definitely educated in his field, but his exams were really difficult. His quizzes were also pretty unfair. My TA was unable to do some of the exam problems. Unless you're really into chemistry, avoid him if possible.

summary_comment: The professor is highly variable in teaching quality, with some students finding her enthusiastic and helpful, while others describe her as an extremely demanding marker and lecturer who moves through material too quickly and fails to provide clear guidance for studying. Many students found the exams and quizzes challenging, though some appreciated her availability during office hours. Overall, the course is considered difficult and requires significant effort.

Ratings.comment: Extremely hard marker (especially for labs), Mid terms and finals are impossible to pass

Pretty enthusiastic about chemistry in class but goes over lecture really quickly. Posts PowerPoint up but you will need to attend lecture to be able to actually use the PowerPoints for studying as she fills the slides in with handwriting in class. Moderately tough exams and quizzes are reasonable. Expect to put a lot of work into this course.
Awesome prof!  Fun and easy to understand. Very helpful! One of OSU's best!

She is a very nice professor and genuinely cares...very willing to help and responds emails very quickly...Exams very difficult average 52. Quizzes not too difficult...reasonable. Overall not bad...learn most from reading the book

She goes over the material extremely fast and gives tons of useless information and notes during lecture mixed in with what she expects you to know. She never gave any specifics on what we should study. I never had any idea what to study and what might be on the exam or quizes.  Does very few examples that are rarely like the ones on exams.
Absolute nightmare. Goes fast in lecture and rarely answers questions outside of office hours. Exams are near-impossible.

She was a lot of fun to talk to, very helpful during office hours. Only problem during the lecture was people asking her Chem121 questions that she would spend too much time going over, and in office hours she would go over the same problem multiple times if someone new came in the room and asked. I learned a ton between her, my TA, and the book.

this class was impossible. her lectures were super boring and useless, but if you didn't go you felt like you were missing out on information. the midterms and final were impossible and i felt like i was never prepared for anything.
Kind of kooky during class. Gave hard midterms, but was really helpful during office hours when she goes over most of what will be on exams.

Her lecture notes are basically a bad summary of the book so you're just better off reading the text. She also sucks at example problems. She frequently makes errors and students are constantly correcting her during lecture. helpful in office hours but you wouldn't need to go if she taught it to you thoroughly  in lecture. Midterms were ridiculous.

Very helpful in her office hours. However, her midterms were crazy, she gives you pracice midterms on carmen, and you will see a lot of similar problems, but 10times harder. In class if you ask a question about something you have learned in a previous chem class (121/122) she basically ignores your question and moves on. I'd take a different prof.
She is very hard, and was not sure how to make fair exams probably because it was her first year, I would go with a more experienced teacher, but she is very helpful during office hours

This was her first Chem class at OSU, she's from canada. Her first exam was a bit rough (avg=58%) second was better (avg=68%). She posts her lecture notes on carmen. Our class participated in the REEL labs. All in all, she's funny, young, kind, and wants her students to really know the material.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and dedication to student success, often staying late to assist with exam preparation. Students praise his genuine interest and attention, as well as his friendly demeanor and sense of humor, making him a memorable and supportive figure both inside and outside the classroom.

Ratings.comment: Great guy who really wants to help his students succeed in a hard course like chemistry. He really enjoys helping his students, even going beyond his assigned office hours to help prepare students for exams.

Best TA I've had! He really does take an interest in his students. He is there to help and gives his students 100% of his attention. He's also really cool to talk to and is a quality human being lolz.
chill bro. the burns are hawt!

Best TA I've ever had, not to mention a rad sense of humor. Would put meme's in his weekly emails. Cool dude I who I would totally hang outside of class with. He really cares about his students, and works the sideburns and beard like no ones business.

summary_comment: This professor excels in teaching chemistry, making complex subjects accessible and enjoyable. Known for his patient and supportive approach, he goes above and beyond to ensure students understand the material and achieve their best grades. His genuine interest in teaching and willingness to help students grasp difficult concepts contribute significantly to his high regard among students.

Ratings.comment: This guy knows chemistry really well. He can clearly explain the complicated subject matter without any thinking.  He makes chemistry easy and fun. Students like him a lot. He really wants to help students to learn which is hard to find nowadays.

Great guy, real nice. He understands that chemistry is difficult and attempts to help students receive as high of a grade as possible without breaking any rules. Very easy grader and very understanding when it comes to trouble with an assignment; always willing to spend time to go in depth to answer students' questions until they understand.
Very good TA. Goes easy on the students and helps you out alot.
This man takes chemistry and actually makes it fun and interesting.  Very approachable and genuinely interested in teaching.

summary_comment: Dr. Tatz has received mixed reviews from students, with some finding him helpful and dedicated despite being strict, while others describe him as arrogant, mean, and demotivating. The recent personal challenges faced by Dr. Tatz, including the loss of his wife and mother-in-law, and his impending retirement, seem to have positively influenced some students' perceptions.

Ratings.comment: He must have totally changed because my interactions with him have been very pleasant. It could be because his wife passed away this year, as well as his mother-in-law. Also, he is retiring this year. I respect this man and what he was been through.

My interaction with Dr. Tatz began innocently with me having no preconceived notion about him whatsoever. Quickly, I learned, he is insolent and caustic…awful experience with him! Is OSU unaware of this man's interactions with students, or does the institution not care? His presence undoes all the great work of the chemistry professors & TAs.

Dr. Tatz is the most arrogant person I have ever met, not only that but he absolutely could careless about your chemistry issues. He will belittle you when you see him in office hours.... If the almighty king decides to even show up for them, which he didn't for me and he specifically gave me a time to come. Overall this man is a horrible person
Terrible, talks down to students, wants everyone to fail

Horrible......mean......looks down at you....this guy is there to make you miserable, and he enjoys doing it very much...i have made it through all the gen chems and ochems....but I will always remember this guy

Ignore the previous comments, I have taken 2 labs supervised by TATZ and he helpful, but strict.  Do the work, ask questions, turn labs in on time and you can pass.  Chem at OSU is tough... and if you can't handle the heat you should stay out of the kitchen.

I took this class as a freshman 4 years ago, posted the comment about the case of academic misconduct back in '07.  I am now a senior in Nursing and I would love to get a chance to tell Dr. Tatz what I think of him to his face. I have no respect for people that think they are better than someone else. GO BUCKS! SUGAR BOWL CHAMPS!!
He doesn't generally teach lecture - TAs and professors do. He's extremely happy to help explain problems and devote a lot of time to help out with Chem problems.

Tatz is not a good person. He is a prime example of a person that you do NOT  want to grow up and be like. Probably one of the most cruel and jerk-like people I have ever met. He does not care about you, he only cares about himself and his name on the lab books. Every one of the earlier comments are right on cue. He is as bad as they make him sound
Dr. Tatz is a great professor and you can learn alot from him if you invest the time in studying and wanting to do well.  Overall, one of the better professors in the Chemistry department.

No making up points for missed labs, even if you have a documented excuse such as medical emergency or court summons. Get less than 50% total in labs and you fail AUTOMATICALLY. By far worst class I've ever taken anywhere because of him. If you find yourself injured, and have to bleed in your test tube, then at least you might get partial credit.
Poor lab instructor

What a pompous and arrogant idiot, and I'm the type of person that has a high tolerance of such characteristics. Never said anything to me until the last lab where I had 2 lab/checkout to do. The words that he said just made me want to bust a beaker on his head. He enjoys his label as lab diretor and the TAs love to suck up to him. AVOID HIM.
I only ever spoke with Dr. Tatz once, but I will never do so again. He HATES freshman. Loves to talk down to students.
Dr. Tatz is pretty intimidating.
R.J. is one of the best.  He rocks chem lab like a geologist.
One of the best professors ever. Willing to help as long as you ask. If you try to get to know him you will find out that he is a great guy.

I would rather shove bamboo up my fingernail than spend another day in the same building as Dr. Tatz.  Truly, this man is by far the most prideful, cruel, heartless, selfish individual on the face of this planet.  If you are ever given the opportunity to make his life miserable, please let justice be served.  He makes the devil look like a puppy.

This man who people call Dr. Tatz would have been better off being an internal affairs interrogator.He has an obsession with his title as Chemistry Lab Coordinator and patrols the halls like a savage animal. He does not seem to have any social life outside of his cubicle and is not afraid to take out his anger on his students.God Save You from him!
He keeps us all safe and is a nice guy to talk to.  Is willing to help students out who ask.

great guy - don't listen to other ratings. he patrols the lab to make sure that you aren't going to kill yourself (this is chemistry people, not home-ec class!) no ego problems - he might mention that he wrote the manuals simply to enforce that he knows what he is talking about (freshmen are too mistrusting).  very nice guy!

He definitely makes things very difficult for lab students. He's full of himself and continuously  prides himself on being the co-writer of the lab manuals. He has no remorse, he's completely insensitive, and hates undergraduate students. He's not understanding and I'm pretty sure he thinks all athletes are stereotypically stupid.
I got an A in the class and come to find out that he files an academic misconduct case against me for talking in labs and he isnt even my lab instructor! REDICULOUS!!

He has a huge ego, and I think he gets pleasure out of seeing his name on the lab notebooks each day.  He thinks you're always cheating, and he patrols the labs like a baboon, constantly watching and eyeing you.  Creepy man to say the least.

Where do I start? I came to lab late one day. He was extremely upset over such a little thing. One day he was just walking around and noticed that my goggles were not the "right number." He took it as an insult on his authority.                                   Never put yourself in a situation where you have to talk to him.

His job is to keep us safe, and he does it well.  Its pretty amazing to think that he coordinates all of the general chemistry labs at OSU, he's got to keep thousands of students in line, I'm glad somebody does because I sure don't want to get stuck next to any idiots in lab.  He's actually pretty nice if you ever get the chance to talk to him.
I was talking to a girl in lab one day, and he automatically assumed we were cheating.
His job is to make your life miserable. And he does his job well.

summary_comment: Jeff is an exceptionally knowledgeable and approachable professor, highly regarded for his clear explanations and relaxed teaching style. Students consistently praise his expertise and his ability to make complex topics accessible. His dedication to creating a positive learning environment is evident in his interactions with students.

Ratings.comment: Jeff is dreamy. He is such a great teacher. He really knows what he is talking about and he is super chill. I wish Jeff could TA all of my classes, and I wish he could TA my life. He also really wants a chilli pepper so if you write a review please rate him as hot.

summary_comment: Emily Bitticker is an exceptional Organic Chemistry Lab Teaching Assistant known for her high expectations and clear communication. She is consistently available to provide assistance, both in person and via email, and goes above and beyond to ensure her students' understanding and success.

Ratings.comment: Emily Bitticker is an excellent Organic Chemistry Lab TA. She is very helpful during lab, and she is always available to answer questions via email. Emily's expectations are high, but she makes them very clear and well in advance of the due dates. Her main goal is for her students to succeed, and she is willing go the extra mile to make sure we do!

Emily was an outstanding TA for ochem lab. She made sure everyone was clear on procedures and wrote out mechanisms if anyone needed help. She went above and beyond to ensure everyone understood, she replied instantly and thoroughly to emails and offered to proofread write-ups before they were due. Truly excellent, choose her as a TA if you can.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, described as both approachable and effective, maintaining a balanced approach that is neither too lenient nor overly stressful, making him an ideal instructor according to students.

Ratings.comment: Awesome guy, super chill but helpful. Not too lax but not too stressful, perfect teacher

summary_comment: Dr. Ethiraj is generally considered helpful and approachable, with many students noting his efforts to assist through office hours and review sessions. However, his lectures are often described as confusing and non-engaging, with some students preferring a flipped classroom approach or additional examples. Despite this, his exams are seen as fair and straightforward, with some students managing to perform well despite the challenging lectures.

Ratings.comment: Puts forth effort to provide extra help. Lots of Chalk-Talk! Confusing + non-engaging lectures. Prefer flipped class + more examples. Taught myself using online resources. Key to passing: read the text, practice exams + online lectures. Tests and homework were lenient and straight-forward; hence my "would take again." Avoid if you can't self-teach.

This class was harder than it needed to be. He's smart, but clearly not good at instructing. He can't explain himself and glosses over important information. He's also hard to understand (speaking and writing.) Try to get a different professor.

Hahah a funny guy that tries his best. Has a nit of an accent but still teaches fine. His exams are easy if you know and like chemistry. I ended up with an A in his class with some effort. To be fair most of the people in the class just don't put the effort in and still expect good grades. If that's what you're expecting get  out of here.

He is obviously not the best professor. He struggles to communicate and sometimes doesn't know what he's saying. I feelf or him. I know he's trying but he is just not doing a good job. His tests aren't easy. That being said, I finished with a D without curve and with the curve, a C letter grade4376. Avoid him.
He is very helpful and one of the easier Chem professors at Ohio State. He was not always completely clear on certain concepts though.

There is a clear disconnect between Dr. Ethiraj and his students mostly because he is fairly new at teaching, but overall he was a decent professor. His exams are tough but fair and he lets students know what the quizzes will be over.

Dr. Ethiraj is super nice and really funny. He tries very hard to help students, but since he is new at teaching, he doesn't quite understand how to fully help them. He schedules review sessions for exams and he drops some hints if you go to lecture. Overall, once you get used to Ganesh you will enjoy him.

Dr. Ethiraj is genuinely smart and that is obvious. He has a problem clearly communicating his work to students. He tends to skip steps with problems and provides only easy probems for practice. He does have good office hours and provides review sessions and practice midterms and finals which is pretty helpful. Can use 11th or 12th book ed.

Dr. Ethiraj was a decent professor. I know people say he is not that great, but that isn't completely true. He genuinely wanted to teach, and he was clearly a very smart guy, but just did not know how to teach very well. I suggest that students who have this guy from now on READ THE TEXTBOOK. Exams were hard, homework was not required. Have fun!

Average at best. Wouldn't recommend taking it with him. He makes mistakes in his lecture notes and if someone doesn't clarify the mistake, he continues on with lecture. His exams are ridiculous. He gives easy practice midterms and very rough midterms. Don't take 1220 with him.

He's a decent professor. Attending class is slightly pointless but at least he told you what he would be quizzing on during lecture, but the quizzes were impossibly difficult. He uses Fus' material because he's a new prof. at Ohio State. The midterms and final were actually very fair. There was a generous curve at the end of the class.

Lectures from his powerpoints, which aren't too great except for cramming for a quiz. DEFINITELY READ BOOK (doesn't have to be THE book, I'd used another intro-level chem book, saved $60). Crunched during lecture, ask questions in OFFICE HOURS instead. Sometimes necessary to look for info & examples beyond just what he presents in class...

Avoid this man at all costs.  He does problems in lecture from the text and gets a different answer than the text book each time.  Then he says how his answer is right and the text book's answer is incorrect.  He has a thick accent and you can barely tell what he is saying.  He also did not provide us with a grading scale.  The class was torture.

Such a useless lecturer. Try to avoid taking him at all cost, Stoltzfus is better and more helpful. Ganesh seems clueless most of the time; Did not respond to emails and the book taught me everything. If you're stuck with him, Stoltzfus has online material that's in your favor.
Not a very good lecturer at all. He used a bunch of Stoltzfus's stuff. My best suggestion is to use Fus's website. Very helpful.

summary_comment: Matthew Brew is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and unique approach to organic chemistry. Students appreciate his engaging and supportive demeanor both inside and outside the classroom, noting his ability to make complex concepts accessible and relevant. His lectures are praised for clarity and wit, though some find his methods unconventional and memorable.

Ratings.comment: Matthew Brew.
