I know I could trust this man when he walked into class on the first day when these inspirational words came out of his beautiful mouth: "Chemistry that takes place in somebody else's hands is so much more powerful than chemistry that takes place in our own."  Magical

Matt. Where do I start? In class, he's the professor who stands up there stone cold. Doesn't say a word for fifteen, maybe twenty minutes, then asks, "How was the weekend?" and dismisses the class. Outside of class, he's the kind of guy who opens his nicest bottle of wine for you, slaps you around, kisses you, and leaves you alone in his own house.
I felt some real chemistry in his class
Matthew Brew is sort of like the Wayne Gretzky of organic chemistry.

WOW. I had failed every single chemistry class I had ever taken before this one. After my 100 in Matt's class, my confidence is back up and I can't wait to continue pursuing my degree He was exceptionally helpful, would take his time explaining things and would come over any hour of the night. He also helped me get over my ex boyfriend - xoxo
One of the up and coming chem students of our generation. He is like brad Pitt in that movie where he's really good at math
I never thought the cartel crisis in Brazil would be relevant to organic chemistry until I met Matthew Brew. The visionary of this generation

The Brewmeister definitely knows what he's talking about. During lecture, the practice problems we went over were clear and he interspersed them with witty banter. Speaking of which, I picked up on some subtle Illuminati codewords while he spoke. Not sure how I feel about that. Still, he gave me a chub every time I went to class so I can't complain
Absolutely the best professor I've ever had. I felt like he took one look at me and knew everything about me; like he was directing his words towards me. Solid.

Really good professor and good looking hunk. Can't understand him. Purposefully alternates lecturing between Indian and Russian accents even though he is from England. Really frustrating. But still a really nice guy. He will talk to you on the CABS bus if you sit next to him.
Big fan of his work, gonna have to keep an eye out for other stuff this young blud is up to. Mad respect and keep it up brew. Much love, respect. Chemistry

Loved the class, I thought he was a PHD level professor with years of experience due to the way he understood chemistry. The only complaint I have is I had a hard time not getting lost in his eyes and trying to stay focused on the content.

The brewster is the man. Tots gets the chem and that 'ccent slays me. All the gurls were str8 jockin' for the apostole brewtholomew. Had so many pretty women round he was looking like Brewce Jenner. But he hittem with a Lynch stiff-arm. Back to the voice: he's like Brewno Mars its so Brew-tiful. Had him early morning but nothing like some hot brew.

This dude was insane!! He would talk about chemistry like he was talking bout girls!! He loved his students and was passionate about the class! Something I looked up to was how he could laugh one minute and discipline a student the next! Dexterity! Looks good in a v-neck! I mean good!! Would always say he would come to my partys but never did! WTF!

summary_comment: The professor is known for his rigorous grading and emphasis on deep critical thinking, particularly during labs and lectures. Students find him helpful, especially during office hours, where he provides clear guidance on the type of analysis expected. His approach can be challenging but ultimately beneficial for learning.

Ratings.comment: Really helpful if you attend office hours, wants to see in depth critical thinking beyond what is provided in labs/lecture, will send out emails to make it clear what analysis he's looking for, refused to tell me his favorite color.
Grades labs VERY harshly and won't give you answers - good to make you think, frustrating if you genuinely have no idea.

He was my Lab TA. Doesn't just give you the answer to your question, but makes you think a bit first so that you process and understand the reasoning behind getting to the answer. Nice guy who doesn't appear to mind chatting and helping students out. Went to his office hours and he was very helpful when I had questions about a lab report.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his helpfulness and educational value, described as a great resource who keeps students engaged. Students find him approachable and memorable, though some comments include more personal observations that are less relevant to overall teaching quality. Overall, he is seen as an excellent instructor who effectively aids student learning.

Ratings.comment: Really helpful and nice
Pretty good. Goofy
Hot and English... keeps you going to class. Doesn't like to wear underwear under sweatpants... interesting.  Educationally, he is very helpful.
Great prof.
This guy is an awesome TA. He was very good at explaining stuff and helped you to remember stuff by teaching you little tricks.  I probably wouldn't have passed o.chem without him!

summary_comment: Dr. Hurley is highly regarded by students for her effective teaching methods and willingness to help, though her class is noted to be challenging and time-consuming. Students appreciate her thorough explanations, clear notes, and supportive approach during office hours. Belinda is also praised for her teaching style, making complex topics accessible and helping students perform well on exams.

Ratings.comment: I actually did not have Belinda for a professor but dr Fus. I was not learning with fus so I went to her lectures instead and I brought my exam grade up from 48% on the first before I started going to 90% on the second exam. I can't say anything on her exams but she really teaches the material well and thoroughly.

Honestly Dr. Hurley was one of the best professors I have ever had, and I still keep in contact with her. She loves students who genuinely try, and if you do you will do fine in her class. Be sure to take advantage of her office hours! If she's in her office don't be afraid to stop by, she is always willing to help.
awful class. Good luck.  I am a straight A student and I got a C in her class.  Very hard and time consuming.
Dr. Hurley was always willing to help her students. If you need help don't be shy to see if she is in her office. If she is she will try her best to help you even if it isn't during office hours.

Overall, Dr. Hurley is NOT a terrible professor. Her class performed better on exams than other Chem 1110 classes, so she must have taught us something. HOWEVER, her notes are not as clear as I would've preferred. Also, homework problems are mandatory - this definitely helps in the long run!
Great professor!!

Belinda is awesome! I hate Chemistry, but even I did well and it wasn't all that bad. She makes everything very clear and goes at a slow pace. Make sure you do the HW, it's easy points and very well prepares you for exams!

Hurley knows that the course is hard and unfair with a C average so she does the best she can to help everyone get through it. She also does her best to keep lectures interesting. Her notes are very good. Basically, she makes an unpleasant, difficult, course bearable and helps you through it. Take advantage of her office hours
She was very enthusiastic about her field of teaching.  The class was fairly tough.  I didn't use the study guide once.  She was very helpful with any questions I had.
Very enthusiastic and clear. Always willing to help students. The class notes are really helpful.  Lots of  demonstrations.

This class has a very unfair grading curve where 40% of the class is required to get a C, and getting an A is next to impossible. Dr. Hurley herself was very excited about the material, but still just not the best teacher overall. The notes are disorganized and hard to make sense of and are basically worthless. Too difficult for 101! Very stressful

She presented the material as simply as she could and was always willing to help and clarify any confusion.  She is very approachable and posts practice midterms so you have an idea of what to expect on the midterms.  The midterms were easier than i expected and you can tell that she genuinely cares about her students.

Excellent prof who is highly intelligent in her field. She is always willing to help students and very understanding that we were beginners and didn't want to be there. I dreaded taking this class but she was my favorite prof this quarter. Just don't buy the solutions manual because it's a waste of $50 and I never opened it.
She is the best prof I have ever had. Go to office hours if you need help. She will help you till you understand and doesn't make you feel stupid. I would take her classes every chance you can.
GREAT ta, go to office hours and she will help you until you get the right answer. made this class much easier, especially the labs
really energetic and incredibly helpful.  you can tell she loves chemistry and teaching.  definitely made the class not as bad as i thought it was going to be!

very energetic and enthusiastic about the class. likes to do explosive demos, always willing to help outside of lecture. you can tell she genuinely wants all students (who don't drop) to understand the material.
Good prof, hard class to teach. There were so many chapters and information to learn that it was difficult to remember it all. Look over any old exams you can get your hands on and read the book.
Very helpful and tries to make the class interesting.  Definitely go over old midterms because they are the same kind of questions.
Very nice lady.  Tries very hard to get everyone to understand the concepts.  Definitely take old practice midterms because they are almost always the exact same kind of questions.
No Comments
She  loves helping people but she is not the clearest teacher I had. She sometimes gives poor examples. BAsically in this class if you read the book you can pass the midterms, they are very easy.

Very helpful, tries very hard to make the class interesting with fun demos and such.  TAKE OLD MIDTERMS BEFORE YOU GO INTO HERS!  Rough midterms, only 25 questions for 175 points of the 1000 for the quarter.  Again, very helpful, always answering questions and popping into lab to see how you're doing.

summary_comment: The professor demonstrates a good grasp of the subject matter and is willing to answer questions, though her explanations can be lacking. She is clear about her grading criteria and is thorough in her feedback, which some students found nitpicky. However, some students found her less effective at concept explanation and recommended using the hard copy textbook for the course.

Ratings.comment: Decent teachers for a TA. Show knows the concepts and she relays them pretty well.  She is willing to answer any question (silly or serious) and she is nice about it. She is picky about her grading she makes that known going into the class. Her grading  critiea is in the syllabus.

She tried to be helpful but was awful at explaining the concepts.. so I honestly just followed the book instead. Also takes off unnecessary points and was nitpicky all the time when grading. I recommend buying the hard book (not the online version) for this class you will need it....

summary_comment: Marc P. is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and deep knowledge in chemistry, making complex concepts accessible even to struggling students. His intelligence and approachability have significantly helped many, though some have noted issues with unequal attention and perceived favoritism towards certain students.

Ratings.comment: Marc P. wears weird glasses, however, he grew his beard out this semester and it's awesome. I am basically terrible at science and he made sure I didn't feel like an idiot, and actually helped me. Marc is a badass chemist and is a Level 70 Wizard Ice Class.
i love this guy.  really helpful.  and extrememly intelligent.  i hope he knows he has helped a lot of students in his time as a TA!

It would beneficial for him to not announce to the class that he enjoys being an ****. Also, it would be better if he gave students equal attention, not more to those with appealing physical features.
I tried to ask him for help and he said he'd be right there but never came.  He walked over to a hot girl and helped her for the whole class.  This happened multiple times.  Unfair and Unhelpful.
marc coons is the master of all things chemistry
Marc is friendly and hot and smart.
No Comments

summary_comment: Gary is highly regarded for his excellent teaching and supportive approach, making lab sessions enjoyable and motivating students to succeed. His availability during office hours further enhances his effectiveness as a tutor. Students would recommend taking classes taught by Gary if given the opportunity.

Ratings.comment: Gary was a really great TA and made lab enjoyable. He was very helpful during office hours and motivated me to succeed! I would take him again if he taught CHEM 1220.

summary_comment: Ted is a passionate and approachable TA who encourages independent thinking and problem-solving, which some find beneficial in the long run. However, his teaching style can be challenging for those who prefer straightforward answers, leading to mixed reviews. Despite some criticisms, many appreciate his helpfulness and care for students' success.

Ratings.comment: Awful TA! Not very clear, grades lab reports impossible... pretty much expects way too much out of a 2 credit class! Besides his good looks, I have no other positives to say about him. May God be with you if you get him as your TA.

So thankful to have Ted as my TA for OCHEM 2540 this spring.  While some don't seem to like him because he doesn't give you the answers straight up, he always is willing to help and guide you.  I see Ted as more of an OCHEM coach and that really taught me to trust myself and work out problems on my own.  Great TA!
Hes a great guy, and will help you if you go to office hours.

Super approachable regarding questions. Most people dislike Ted because he doesn't flat out give you the answers, but I obviously found this was way more beneficial in the long run in understanding the material. Great guy that you can tell is passionate about the material

Was excited about this class in the beginning. But lost interest during the third week. I would hate asking Ted questions b/c all he would do is stare at you and make you feel stupid. That's probably why I didn't do that great on the labs. He thinks he's the best TA around, but I've had more helpful and nice TAs before. Don't recommend.

Some people didn't like Ted because he made us think for ourselves and he wouldn't answer questions that could be found in our lab manuals, but I think making students think is one characteristic of a good teacher. Good at explaining and very helpful with experiments. Encouraged us to study and I felt like he cared about our success. Good music.

Totally gorgeous! But anyway, I did not ask many questions because I didn't care a whole lot, but when I did or when I heard others ask, he wasn't too helpful. I think he wants us to think for ourselves, but some things are ambiguous and need an answer!

Ted is really helpful and always willing to answer questions. He sets time frames for each step in lab in order to finish in time. Grades hard, but just really follow the guidelines provided in the manual. Overall, a difficult course, but he made going to lab fun

Ted got more ambiguous as the semester went by. He would help save your experiment if it went up in smoke, and was helpful explaining the chemistry behind it. Often felt like he was withholding vital information from us. He kept music playing during lab, but he stressed us out during quizzes. A little arrogant, but handled an injured student well.

He's an alright TA. But one thing I don't understand is why he wears the same freaking tshirt in every single lab. I am guessing its probably because he only owns one shirt since he's shirtless in his Facebook profile picture.

Ted created a good environment in lab by playing music and setting us time "goals" so that we would not fall behind. However, he wasn't always very clear on explaining things and made me feel stupid when I asked questions. I didn't feel like he cared for my personal success in the class. Lab is a difficult course, and Ted didn't make it any easier.

Ted always made the environment in lab a good one and was always cheerful. Labs seemed less stressful with his good playlists in class. However, sometimes we has not too clear when he answered our questions and would take forever to reply emails and was a tough grader on the lab reports. He was very nice and honest to his students, though.

Ted is probably the greatest T.A. ever!  I love him more than life itself.  Despite being a little harder than the Asians, Ted cares more and makes sure his students are making it through Organic Chemistry.  He's awesome and also a smokeshow.
Extremely helpful. He knew what he was talking about, and I really appreciated how invested he was in the class. I would take his class again.

ted bross is the best TA for O-chem lab that i have ever had. best TA in college that i have had actually. He takes a profound interest in getting to know the students and helping out when someone asks. If you get Ted Bross you are very lucky

Ted's a lab TA, a really nice guy,and the best one for sure. He was extremely helpful both in and outside of class. His enthusiasm showed and he played music in lab, which kept the mood light and somewhat fun. He graded labs pretty fairly and was willing to give pointers before turning it in. He's also incredibly gorgeous and has a killer smile!

summary_comment: Nathan is an experienced teaching assistant with in-depth knowledge of the subject matter, delivering overall excellent instruction that is highly regarded by students. While he could improve in clarity, his teaching is nonetheless praised as both effective and enjoyable.

Ratings.comment: Nathan is an experienced TA and knows his stuff. Could be a little more clear, but overall excellent and a pleasure to have.

summary_comment: Mark is an excellent professor known for his deep understanding of the subject matter, which sets him apart from other teaching assistants. He challenges students with rigorous problems in recitation, preparing them for various applications of the concepts. His quick turnaround on quiz grading further enhances the learning experience.

Ratings.comment: He is a really good TA. When I receive help in CE160 from other TAs, I'm surprised by their lack of knowledge, but Mark really seems to know his stuff. In recitation, he sometimes gives problems that are way harder than you'll see on any test, but at least he shows you different ways the topic can be used. He is also fast at grading your quizzes.

summary_comment: Based on student comments, this professor has a consistently poor reputation, with a strong consensus indicating subpar teaching quality. Students find the lectures and course material difficult to follow and retain.

This professor is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and approachable demeanor, significantly enhancing students' understanding of the material through detailed worksheets and thorough recitations. His ability to clarify complex concepts makes him an invaluable resource for students.

Ratings.comment: Love his class n he's cool.
Great guy to have, made us work sheets for each recitation and worked through the main issues of each chapter with us. Helped clear up all the mess that professor wang taught us.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, consistently providing extensive support to students in his lab and maintaining a fair and understanding approach to grading. Students strongly recommend taking his lab section whenever possible.

Ratings.comment: He is a great TA I have ever had. He is willing to help students in his lab. He is not harsh on grading lab reports. Take his lab section if you can.

summary_comment: This professor at ASU is generally viewed as helpful during office hours, with students who put in effort performing well, achieving grades above a B. However, her lectures are often confusing due to her tendency to get mixed up and struggle with communication, affecting all students, including those who attend office hours. Despite these challenges, she shows mercy in grading.

Ratings.comment: (at ASU) I go to office hours and find her to be really helpful i find lecture more confusing bc of other students questions more than anything. among us who put in the effort don't have as many complaints that i know and are doing well in the course. over half of us have above a B in class, those who aren't doing as much effort maybe don't agree
Gets mixed up alot and confuses EVERYONE
She really has a lot of trouble communicating what shes trying to teach.  Shes no longer a TA, and seems to forget that sometimes.
She can be a tough TA, but she grades with mercy.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his clarity and thorough explanations, making complex chemistry concepts accessible. Students praise his detailed notes and slow, clear teaching style, noting significant learning gains. However, some students find his lectures lack supporting materials and his class pace challenging, leading to difficulties with studying and exam preparation.

Ratings.comment: He is literally the most clear professor I've had at this school for chemistry. His notes were very clear and easy to follow the mechanisms for the complicated chem problems. I took the class last summer and realized I learned more in his class in one quarter than I did in the last two levels (251 and 252). Great Professor!!!!

he is the best ochem professor I've had in this school. The reason why he cancelled the final review was due to his bad health. He always extends his office hour to help. And he is extremely clear about every mechanism and concept, indeed he teaches really slowly, but crystal clear about everything, i learned a lot from him. Great prof!

Bad lecturer in general. He doesn't give any thing to go off of and has a horrible lecture pace in class. He canceled the final review and didn't find anyone to replace him, leaving the class blind going into the final. Try everything you can to avoid this guy.

A very good lecture but a very tough class. No practice exams handed out and no advice given as to what exactly to study for the tests. Get ready to study several hundred pages of notes for each midterm. I worked very hard to get a "B" in the class. He teaches a "no-slacker" organic chem class, if your not ready for the big leagues, you won't pass.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for being relatable and engaging, often using bar jokes to make the material more interesting. However, students note that consistent effort is necessary to keep up, as the content can be challenging without it. Labs are also described as somewhat cumbersome.

Ratings.comment: Cool prof. Easily relatable and tries to make the class interesting with bar jokes. You have to put in time though otherwise you will not understand what is going on. The labs can be a pain.
Cool prof. Has no problem relating any normally boring topic to meeting people in bars. Awesome professor who knows what he is talking about.

summary_comment: The professor is generally considered fair and caring, with a strong desire to help students succeed. Students appreciate his extensive use of practice materials and willingness to assist during office hours. However, many find his lectures boring and often overly lengthy, which can be challenging for maintaining focus.

Ratings.comment: Lectures are boring but he really wants his students to do well. Quizzes and midterms are exactly like the ones he gives you for practice and he also gets a lot of problems from the solution manuel so I would advise getting that. If you have trouble go to office hours and he will help you a lot! Not as bad of a class as people say.
Best chem lecturer by far!!! Very nice, easy multiple choice quizzes, fair midterms.  He will go out of his way to help you.  Sign up immediately!!!

I could not stand the lectures; they were SO BORING! He seemed like he really wanted students to do well, but I found his explanations to be vague and confusing. I thought this class was very difficult for a 101 level.
Agree with the below.  Really wants to help, but frequently lost my attention in the very long lectures.
Nice old man but his lectures make you want to go to sleep! Provides numerous study resources that really help out.

Nice guy.  Not great teacher.  Boring and almost reads straight from the book.  However, very FAIR.  Seems to really care that students get it.  gives sample quizzes and tests, which not all chem profs do.  Read the book and do the hmwk, and you'll be fine.
Great teacher, really cares. Get the practice manual, it really helps with his quiz/test questions. very fair professor. i would take him again.

A very kind man, but not a great teacher. Very willing to help outside of class. Does try to help in office hours, but sometimes just confused me more. Take the 48 min class instead of the 78 if you can. 78 min of him lecturing gets very looooong. Exams are difficult.

He is a very helpful guy and he's kind hearted.  It is a difficult course, he doesn't curve very well, and the tests are hard, but he offers any help you could possibly need.  Also shoes concern for every one of his students.
Good guy...more than willing to spend his extra time to help  you out to learn the material.
This class was really hard for 101. He was very boring and the tests were difficult...yuck!
he does not curve his class much at all
Spoke clearly but incredibly boring. Never really went to get help but seemed helpful. Exams are hard but he will prepare you if you pay attention.
Excellent teacher,most helpful
eh
prof heyns is a good professor but is EXTREMELY BORING! i agree w/person below, he makes it VERY hard to go to class, although he does give you a good idea of what the midterms are going to be like
No Comments
He makes it really hard to go to class, hes really boring. He tell you whats going to be on the exam.
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: Chris is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods, encouraging students to discover answers through probing questions rather than direct instruction. While some note that he occasionally rambles before quizzes, most agree that he genuinely cares about his students' understanding and puts in significant effort to ensure they grasp the material.

Ratings.comment: Chris is the best TA I have ever had.  He will never directly tell you an answer, but he will ask you a million questions until you figure it out on your own.  He's a great TA!

Chris was a good TA in my opinion. He cared about his students and tried very hard to make sure everyone understood the material. Sometimes he rambles before administering a quiz, but overall he's a good guy.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her willingness to assist students and her effective quiz review sessions, which are particularly helpful for exam preparation. Despite some difficulty with her accent, students find her approachable and kind, adapting to her speech over time.

Ratings.comment: She is a little hard to understand, but she is very willing to help.  She also reviews what will be on the quiz right before you take it.  It is very helpful and a great way to remind yourself of what you need to know.  She is very nice, and you get used to her accent after a while.
